Reviews.Title: “Great for Deal, customer service, bed bugs?”
Reviews.Author: nycladygirl
Reviews.Content: Great hotel design, great attached restaurants. Great for the deal we got through cheapcarribean.com but the staff was a bit uninformed about the benefits we were to receive from the deal and gave us misinformation on where/what to redeem within the resort. We ended up paying an extra $50 on a dinner because we thought we could redeem a credit there, but couldn't because the staff told us we could go there. Other than that, the staff had great recommendations for great places to go locally in Old San Juan and Lucillo.The hotel is about 30 minutes from Old San Juan, so plan on renting a car if you want to sight see. I got a mass of bug bites while staying here. The others in my room got much less, but did have some bites. We had friends staying in another room that had none, which leaves me to believe it couldn't have been beach fleas, or something else from the environment, but from the room we stayed in. Unconfirmed if it was bed bugs or not.

Reviews.Title: “Just Plain Unhealthy!”
Reviews.Author: Columbia_MOShari
Reviews.Content: Looks like it was once a beautiful resort until time and the mold monster began eating it alive. My friend with COPD couldn't even visit our room. The little couch in the room was covered in black mold. Black mold covered the AC vent. Very strong odor. Was sick by the 3rd of 7 days. Was difficult to get moved even though the resort seemed fairly empty. Was told it was not possible to speak to a manager when I asked...unheard of. Although the resort, pool and grounds are gorgeous, it doesn't look like anything has been repaired since opening. If something becomes broken, ripped or frayed, it just stays that way and gets worse. Tiles missing throughout pool area, many jets in pool not working, frayed chair arms in fancy restaurants, bent up wall sconce (light) in room, fridge dented and rusty, ice machine in disrepair, and did I mention the mold and smell. Pool had mildew around edges and on lounges. They didn't tell us the casino was closed when we booked. We were just looking for a resort on the beach with a casino and a nice pool. They weren't willing to comp us anything for that; not even parking. Who would have thought we would have to pay $15/day to park the rental car when they were in the middle of nowhere with so much space. We were dissatisfied with the beach part also. We didn't swim there because of all the seaweed. Mostly dirt/rocks. Still, it was a nice place to sit and look out at the ocean. We didn't know in advance that we would have to park 1/4 mile from room. They had golf cart shuttles and they said all we had to do was call. They didn't say call and wait for a half hour. Totally sucks when it's raining. They also don't tell you that when you call for a shuttle, they would be rude. I bought first round of island drinks for our gang of 4 when we arrived. Because this cost $40 plus tip, it was the last round we had at their bar. Then we are given some grief by a cart driver about bringing a cooler to our room......afraid we might be bringing fairly priced drinks in. We were warned, "don't let the manager see you." If only we could have found a manager!!!! Friends were double charged on their credit card, but ours was fine. By the way, you don't know until arrival that they put a $500 hold per room on your credit card. The only thing we saw that was well maintained was the lobby and the landscaping except the weed filled planter boxes that lined our balconies. Restaurant service was poor, but it seemed due to inappropriate training by management. New management could possibly save this resort for the future. Right now it seems like it is going out of business fast. .......and did I mention the mold....it's just not a very healthy place. Beware, iguana swims in pool........hmmmm, I wonder about the chlorine level!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort Great Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Jillian B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from here. What can I say the resort is truly breathe taking, and the service was phenomenal. We stayed in one of the junior suites with a garden view, we wanted to upgrade but they were all booked. However I was more pleased with the garden view, there was a beautiful view of the rain forest and private. The Red level is the way to go, they are very accommodating. The grounds were beautifully landscaped, and the pools were spectacular. Unfortunately I got got burnt the second day we were there, the market was out of Aloe but like I said the staff was top notch. Tony our butler ran out after his shift to go get me some, not a lot of other staff at other resorts would do that. I can't say enough good things about him, he treated my husband and I like gold! Also anything we needed from towels to room service was treated quickly.The beach is beautiful and the food was amazing. Don't read other reviews and base your opinion on those, you will not be disappointed in this place!! I wish I took advantage of the spa, I did hear a lot of wonderful things about it. I can't wait to return to Puerto Rico, and we will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably wonderful experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: kat1730
Reviews.Content: I truly do not understand how anyone could complain about this resort and the service! We stayed one week in a Red Level Oceanfront Junior Suite, and found the room, location and service impeccable and outstanding! We travel the world, so maybe our expectations have been "molded" by other experiences, but our decision has been made to return. The RL category comes with butler service, and we had the BEST!! (Tony R, our butler assigned at checkin, was awesome and provided us with anything we mentioned, going so far as to bring a stepstool from his home for us to use for access to the room's jacuzzi and pool cabanas. Made reservations for us, researched and set up outside resort accessibility needs,anticipated our needs/wishes, followed up and followed thru on requests[even on his day off!]) Angel M, another butler who also managed the Red Level pool and cabanas, was also great! He made sure we had cabanas reserved for every day of our stay; and even got special permission to bring a cart to our door for pickup when it rained. Manny,bartender at Red Level pool, is also a "great find". He serviced our drink and snack needs, and provided help after his shift ended when he saw we needed it. Resort location is 30-40 min from OSJ, 30 min from airport, 15 min from Luquillo(beautiful sandy beach with great food kiosks[try #2]), 15/20 min from Fajardo, and 15 min from El Yunque rainforest..perfect location, but do need a car! Resort beach is beautiful to look at and walk(rugged beauty), not great for swimming or for those who like soft, white sand. Please go and make your own decision.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but be aware!”
Reviews.Author: ladielisa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful time. The property is gorgeous and the staff is friendly. If you're aware of a few things then your trip will be amazing. -$100/night charged to ur credit card but refunded in the end -pay for red level service and ask for Tony as a butler. He made a our trip that much more enjoyable! -rent a car if you want to see PR. It's very easy to drive around and the vacation concierge is helpful. -Food on the property is expensive. The fried cheesecake at Passion is super yum. -property seems large at first but after the first day it's fine. Overall, we would go back! Me encanta Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful place!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda D
Reviews.Content: First, remember when you go to the Carribean, you have to slow down and relax...The Gran Melia is a picturesque property that is spread out. The pool is expansive, with a great pool bar, the cabanas are awesome! The beach isn't very sandy, but still very nice. The food is standard resort fare... a little pricey, but okay. Would recommend a car rental from Avis, then parking is free. Casino is closed. My husband enjoyed the golf. The spa was nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, Average rooms, have car if you stay here!”
Reviews.Author: sicilianprincess1
Reviews.Content: First bit of advice: DO rent a car. My main complaint was we did not get into our room i=until 6:30 PM!!! We were anxious to !, unpack and begin our vacation and were forced to "loiter" in the lounge for about 5 hours. Literally the most ridiculous check in ever!!! On our last day at this resort before going to a hotel in San Juan, we asked for a late check out and the girl on the phone said "absolutely not When I explained we could not check in to our new hotel til 3 pm, she said "oh well, not my problem" and hung up. Then I found out with my MAS card I was allowed one anyway. So basically they can kill your first day and last day by checking you in late and checking you out early. It was a joke .Also, DO upgrade to the Red Level. It will entitle you to free breakfast buffet, the Red Level pool (ages 10 and up only), cocktails (wine and beer, soda & light snacks) early evenings in the Red Level Lounge, All nice perks. This resort is away from EVERYTHING other than the rainforest. Ok, so the grounds and the outdoors is very beautiful. The pools are a bit above average and clean. The Bali beds are awesome but you have to reserve them in advance. The room was disappointing. It wasn't horrible, but definitely less than I expected from this resort. A bit outdated, no fridge, no microwave. The A/C did work well, many resorts have crappy A/C, not this one though. Expect to do a lot of walking. There are golf carts but good luck getting a ride on one. We were downright ignored on many occasions when there was room for more riders. They didn't even bother to stop, sometimes they looked at us, and just kept going with no explanation. When we did manage to catch a ride, it seemed like they'd stop and just let others pile on when there was hardly room, but as I said, other times there would be on or 2 people on there and plenty of room for 6 more and they'd ignore us. So, basically don't count on a ride in the hot sun from the jerks driving the carts. The beach is ok, not much to it. The water is not clear enough to snorkel or anything. It is a bit rocky too. The breakfast buffet was not bad. It is a typical buffet of fruits, meats, cheeses, cereals, eggs, pastries, etc. GET THERE EARLY. The people are VULTURES. Buffet goers are rude, greedy and always running to get the food as if it is going to disappear. Stand your ground and be a jerk if you have to. They cut in front of you, reach over you and all kinds of stuff. This is no reflection on the resort, but rude people as a whole.Asian Bisto NAMI was AWFUL! Also get the MAS card, it entitles you to some discounts here and there I suppose.Service was pretty good, drinks were good, but the food was disgusting. There is no casino anymore. We found this out days after booking but just a few days before we were scheduled to depart. So we played down the road at another resort. Later into our trip we left Gran Melia and stayed in San Juan. Overall, not a bad place, but customer service is lacking. I will say that Angel who works in the RED LEVEL lounge was the best and has outstanding customer service. The others should learn from him.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely setting, mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: Daniela M
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days in this resort and we were quite happy, especially after the reviews we read.The hotel was not our first choice, but all the other hotels were booked out because it was easter and the price was ok ( 700 $ for 3 nights for 4). We had a garden room, about 500 meters away from pool and reception, but the walk was nice and the room was very spacious. The balcony was not in a good condition and the room was not very clean. A pitty! I got a glass splinter in my foot, which was painfull, walking around the room. The room it self was nicely decorated, just not clean and the second day, we did get one towel (for a family of 4?!) It was again 4 the next day. The pool was gigantic and we really enjoyed it. The park and the main building were nice too. It is a bit of a shame, that the management is not working well, because this place could be a gem, I think. Breakfast was ok- join the Melia Club for free(best to register online at home) bring your club number and get 50% off the price for breakfast. You can not sit outside, which I love and it was pretty cold inside, so a light jacket is a good idea. The hotel is close to many attractions. We did a day trip to Culebra, which was great, visited El Yunquee rainforest, Luquillo and Sevens Seas Beach. You definitly need a car unless you plan to spend all the time in the resort. At the pool, there was a party atmosphere with a DJ in the afternoon (not sure if this was only because of Easter) and very loud music, which was fun, but one could also find more quiet places. If you like large pool with a bar in the pool, great landscape and are not too much into cleanness and do not mind a service between mediocre and incurious- it is a nice hotel. By far not as bad in my opinion as some reviews said but with some hafty mistakes. Which could easily be changed, if the management would care more, I guess.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for golfers”
Reviews.Author: cfmitchellumd
Reviews.Content: this is a premium resort with nice rooms, beautiful pool(s), and fantastic golf courses. I was there on a company trip, and enjoyed my stay. That said the downsides include a lack of a beach, small selection of restaurants/bars, gruesome casino. Distance from the old town in Puerto Rico was also a downside, as Old town seemed great for the 1 night we went there. Wouldn't be great for families, but great for golfers.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome landscaping, absent service and management.”
Reviews.Author: AdiiMontreal
Reviews.Content: I would give the landscaping at this hotel an Oscar! But all reviews are true as far as service goes. It's deplorable to see that such a nice hotel gives a service of a 2 stars hotel. This hotel needs a new management team quick. Unless they're happy with their current status. I would personally never sell this hotel to my customers, except if they change their ridiculous food and spa prices as well as include an AYCE package.

Reviews.Title: “Much more than we expected!”
Reviews.Author: Zacdav
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews, we were a little concerned. We just returned home about 4 hours ago and are already planning our trip back! Our butler, Josh, was great! Always had my sangria ready for me when I got to the Red Level Lounge happy hour! The Red Level was so worth the extra money. Free buffet breakfast, access to a private pool, happy hour every night, and your own private butler! And we did not have any rude encounters with any employee on the entire grounds, everyone was so friendly and helpful. And the grounds, Stunning! For the life of me, I cannot figure out where all those negative reviews could have possibly come from! And ps. Manny, the bar tender at the Red Level pool bar makes the best frozen daiquiris!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort! Don't Listen to Negative Reviews!”
Reviews.Author: tripmama4
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Gran Melia in Puerto Rico for a family vacation over Spring Break. We had heard a lot of negative reviews and didn't know what we were getting into. Upon arrival, we were amazed at the beauty of the resort and the friendly front desk staff that took care of us! Our bungalows were absolutely beautiful and spacious! The pool and beach area were well kept and boasted gorgeous views during sunset! The rooms were always neat and cleaned on a daily basis. Please don't listen to the negative comments because you'll be missing out on a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price. We were pleased.”
Reviews.Author: kk1234Alexandria_VA
Reviews.Content: We and our two children spent Spring Break here. It was a lovely surprise. We did not pay that much (compared to the other's Carribean trips) so we didn't expect much. But we ended up enjoying every bit of it. First, the resort is huge and beautiful. The room was spacious and clean (we just got the Garden View Junior Suite. Could upgrade to Red Service but we didn't want to pay extra.) They have the biggest pool I've ever seen. And it was cleaned and beautiful too. The ocean was calm, but the beach was non existent. It was rocky and had a lot of shells which hurt my feet. However, my kids are more into the pool, so we did not care too much. (About 5 lights down on the main road, there is Luquillo beach, which is OK (much better than the one in front of the hotel). There arean't a lot of restaurants at the resorts, but the food was good and the prices were very reasonable. We spent a lot more at the other islands. Plus, we got $50 resort credit for food so in the end it wasn't that expensive. We tried to eat out one night, but the bill was the same as in the resort, and the food was bad. So we decided to eat at the resort for the rest of the trip. Services are genearlly nice. Except the services at the grill bar near the pool was extremely slow and the waters weren't very friendly. (I think it helps if you speak Spanish). Overall, we're very satisfied and we would consider going back if we can get the same deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property but read through for details - some things not quite right”
Reviews.Author: ShiftNC
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property about 40 minutes from old town San Juan. This property is truly beautiful with a great beach, great pool, and very well taken care of grounds. The snorkeling right from the beach is easy and there are lots of fish and a reef (which is a decent swim out). The concierge department is utterly fantastic and helped connect me to the information I needed to have a great trip. The front desk was not that great - just average. A car is an absolute must if you stay at this property. Here is where the details come in. It is a 5 minute drive just to leave the property to do anything at all. It is at least a 15 minute drive to get to a decent restaurant. The beaches are 20 minutes away (aside from the one on property), the rainforest 20 minutes, San Juan 40 minutes, Fajardo 35 minutes, etc. So read between the lines and understand you will be in a car if you stay here. The restaurants on site are mediocre at best and typically expensive as they have a captive audience. It is $23 a person for breakfast brunch and the food is average at best. The lines for the omelets are long and the rest of the food got boring by day 2. To leave the hotel property is a 5 minute car ride just to get to the main road. Taxi's will add up quickly as there are not any great eating options until you hit the 15 minute mark driving from the hotel. We were there a week where it was 100% occupied and couldn't believe that the only lunch option was the pool bar/restaurant. They advertise that they have 5 restaurants on property but only one is ever open for breakfast and nothing but that one is open for lunch except for weekends - even when they were 100% full! Also, the tours are very expensive and a bit of a rip off. They have a dedicated tour operator and they are very pricey. We took our rental car and drove 20 minutes to the rain forest. It was free to get in and we spent two half days playing in the waterfalls, hiking, enjoying the scenery, etc. This is a US National Forest so it was totally safe and easy to navigate. Total cost of the day $0. The tour was running in the $70 range per person. Same with snorkeling. There is snorkeling everywhere on this island. So drive to a beach and play around. Cost $0. Tours ranged upwards to $115. Now we did do tours. We just didn't book through hotel. We booked direct and drove to the tour places. We drove to San Juan twice and played around for the day there. Lots to do in the old town and the food was great. Parking was easy but lots and lots of traffic so be prepared. All in all, Puerto Rico was a great place to take the family. Not sure we will stay at the same place again as we saw the things we wanted to on the Northeast part of the island. I would recommend the hotel for folks that are okay with getting around on their own. I wouldn't want to be stuck there all week without a car unless you are a beach/pool person or family and are okay to just play and relax in a chair and in the water all day. If you are that family, be prepared to spend a fortune on so so food if you do stay on property all day long.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised by courtesy”
Reviews.Author: Juan A N
Reviews.Content: Is being a while since my last stay in this Resort, this is my third visit. Contrary to the previous I was amazed by the courtesy of all hotel personnel with encounter and their desire to help in all respects. The security was noticible all over and the rooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfast buffet excellent. My only recommendation is that the local food restaurant should improve the quality of food and service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in terrible area”
Reviews.Author: ejh462
Reviews.Content: The hotel and pool were as beautiful as the pics show. The beach wasn't huge but it was really nice. Although they advertise 3 restaurants and a casino there are only 2 restaurants open and the casino is closed. They suggested going to the Wyndham (15 minutes away) for the casino but theirs was closed too. We aren't big gamblers but we were looking for something to do at night. There is nothing at the hotel. Went on a bioluminescent kayak excursion one night and a catamaran snorkel trip on the Spread Eagle II the next day. Both were great but were about a 45 minute drive from the hotel. The area outside the hotel property is very depressed. We were upset to see dead dogs on the sides of the road and hungry, abandoned dogs wandering around looking for food and water. The staff at the hotel was very helpful we found that they did what they had to (maybe not as quickly as some people would like) but we really didn't wait for much. We found that even if you had been waiting in line for something and you finally were getting waited on, if their cell phones rang you waited while they took their personal calls. This is how it is all over, not as much at the resort. We ate at the italian restaurant Tempo our last night and it was as bad as the reviews said it would be. They didn't have the wine we ordered off of their menu (the wines on their wine list weren't the best and were pretty pricey for what they offered) and ordered just chicken parm thinking that would be ok but they served a frozen chicken patty with a slab of cheese and sauce on it. We had to ask for pasta. One night we went to the kiosks and liked Kiosk #2 and the Ceviche Hut. We ate at Pasta Y Pueblo one night too. A tiny restaurant (only 5 tables). They kept changing the time they were going to open, gave us a handwritten menu and then told us they didn't have the steak we ordered from their menu (who writes things on their menu that they don't have?). I had scallops which came a bit undercooked so I sent them back to cook just a bit more, they came back pretty burnt. The coconut rice was awesome though. We really didn't feel that we had good food anywhere during our stay in Puerto Rico. The hotel is beautiful and if you are going to just hang by the pool or on the small beach, don't mind not very good food and go to bed early from boredom this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Will be going back”
Reviews.Author: adeolamak
Reviews.Content: The resort is beautiful and very relaxing. The staff and service was great. Our room was a bit stuff for me since i have allergies and i was a bit concerned it would turn into the trip from hell. We went to concierge to see if they have an air purifier, and before we got back to the room house keeping had set it up and my lungs were happy. I'm looking forward to our trip back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Bendor
Reviews.Content: We only left the property once in a week! After reading the reviews, I was a little worried. From the moment we pulled up and said we were staying "red level" until the time we checked out, I felt like I was in pure heaven. For all the reviews about no beach-those of us that love the ocean, it is the perfect setting. Quiet, fine sand, and water. Chairs spread around the grounds, and hammocks perfect for a quiet nap. I do highly suggest the red level, free cocktails and appetizers nightly, private pool, and butler service. The only negative that we had was the Italian restaurant-VERY long service times, for not so great food, but for a week and that being the only complaint, I would positively return.

Reviews.Title: “Still a wonderful Property, but service has slipped”
Reviews.Author: jaybobhead
Reviews.Content: We visited back in May 2011 and it was awesome. Economic turn down must have lead to cutback in staff. Service is now very slow....staff was still very nice and property is great. Casino closed about a month ago...not sure of plans to reopen. Played golf at Trump International and it was in great shape. Easy drive from airport. They need to pick back up on their service and really need to offer later hours at the beach side bar and provide some sort of food service other than room service for later meals... especially if you have teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort needs serious improvement on service”
Reviews.Author: wupot
Reviews.Content: The hotel property is beautiful although the rooms are far away from the main building and the pool. There is a market near the main lobby which is quite convenient if you want to get coffee and bagel in the morning instead of the breakfast buffet. There is also another market on Club Melia side that sells beer for $2.50 but there is no room charge. This hotel needs serious improvement on hotel management and service. The hotel staffs are not friendly especially those who works at the front desk. The checkout process is manually intensive and can take up to 45 minutes. The casino has been closed although the hotel website still mentions about the "boutique casino" on site. When we inquire about this at the front desk, the staff did not offer any apology and suggested that we take a cab for $25 to go to nearby Wyndham hotel for the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Not totally the hotel's fault....but big improvement needed.”
Reviews.Author: zinniaqueen
Reviews.Content: Okay, Okay if it had not rained maybe it would have been a slightly different story. We arrived on a Friday for one night prior to a cruise the next day so we were not on an all inclusive plan and I paid a reasonably inexpensive rate for the one night excluding taxes and food etc, so maybe I shouldn't complain too much. The rain came down and it kept coming after we arrived - the resort was inundated with water, the public areas were flooding, the golf course was under 6 inches of water, the golf carts could barely get through the ankle deep water to take guests to their rooms, the pool area shut down and everyone was moving to any dry public area or back to their rooms. I asked one of the staff if it rained like this often and he said yes, and considering it's on the side of the island where the rain forest is located, then I would assume that this was not an isolated event. Check in took forever as there were only 2 clerks, occasionally three to help and there was an obnoxious group of 5 people ahead of me demanding that their room be ready at noon when they arrived and not at 3:00pm when guest rooms are typically ready. First, the rooms were large and very nice for the most part and the air conditioning worked great - we didn't have a view of anything but the tops of some trees as we were on the 2nd floor and the balcony railings are concrete so you can't see through them and if you're short, almost not over them either. Our sink was plugged and my lamp by my side of the bed was out but the room had a refrigerator or so we thought. It was the kind of refrigerator that if you moved anything in it, like the snacks or little bottles of alcohol, it would trigger a charge to the room. That information was clearly stated on the front of the refrigerator, so basically you couldn't put anything of your own in the fridge without triggering a charge. If you wanted ice, you had to troop over to the lobby which was a bit of a hike for most rooms. Since we were not on an all inclusive plan and the resort is miles from a reasonable restaurant, we were a captive audience and the only restaurant open at 1:00pm during the rainstorm was the buffet at $18.00 per person. It was the most expensive buffet for the mediocre quality of food I could have imagined. We did have a car so later that day we made a trip to KFC and Walmart for dinner about 6 miles from the resort. We figured we were going to be eating fairly well on the cruise, so dieting this evening was the thing to do. The rain stopped probably around 430pm and everyone headed for the pool and the beach but by this time, the hotel had foolishly let much of the bar staff go home assuming the rain would not stop, so there was no bar open by the pool and the only bar available was in the lobby. It was three deep trying to get a weak tasting rum punch plus it was noisy and definitely an older Spring Break crowd which is more obnoxious than the college kids. I can't believe I said that! The staff who manned the valet parking were great, the vacation concierge was helpful as was most of the staff who was on duty. I just can't say much about the front desk clerks who spent their time walking back and forth to the back office and talking incessantly to the disgruntled guests. It took me 30 minutes to even talk to a check in agent and I was the only person in line. The grounds of the hotel were beautiful with lots of tropical plants blooming and the beach was nice though not huge. And the pool would have been perfect if there had just been a place to get a drink without going to the lobby for it. I don't usually pan a hotel and I like the Melia chain in Spain but I would first consider staying closer to town in the Condado beach area if you have to have the beach or the Spring break experience. I personally thought Old San Juan was lovely especially if you are just there one night and the beach and pool are not a big factor and I like the historic atmosphere of the Old Town and the Fort. Lots of nice shops and load of restaurants have bloomed in this old area which is constantly under improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort right on the ocean”
Reviews.Author: CanukTripper
Reviews.Content: We came with friends to the Gran Melia at Coco Beach, and the whole atmosphere was wonderful. The rooms are beautiful, spacious and clean. Sure, there are the odd bumps in the works, but they are minor issues that really don't affect the overall experience (like an iron whose cord won't rewind!). The beach is lovely, and clean, as are the pools. It is close enough to San Juan to be accessible, but enough out the way that you can easily get to fun spots like El Yunque National Forest- and SHOPPING. Excellent spot to go with a family; we went with a four year old and had a great time. Spent about $350 over seven days on food, as we didn't go all inclusive. Breakfast buffet is a great deal (though we skipped the free breakfast for Vacation Club members, as it wasn't very substantial).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Property for Golfers”
Reviews.Author: Cubacana
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia Golf Resort is a large and very beautiful clean property. It's about a 15 minute drive to the main road so you can't really walk to a restaurant or store. There is practically no beach and the little beach they have is hard on the feet, lots of rocks and shells. The pool is lovely. The beds they show around the pool you have to rent, they are roped off. I was very surprised to see that. They show them in the brochure and you would think they would be included. The food was nothing spectacular and the prices outrageous. Not enough dining areas for that large of a property. One evening my dinner took over 1 hour to get and we had to inquire about it, I think she forgot. The cost $27.00 for 6 shrimp/a cup of rice...have a look. It tasted good and for me the portion was OK...but for my husband, this is an appetizer! One afternoon we ordered a family size pizza...(it wasn't really that big, my husband could have eaten all of it) and it was hard and didn't taste that great. One Hamburger and 2 fries, cost $25.00. All the guests we talked to were not impressed with the food at the resort and thought the prices were way to high as well. I would probably only recommend this hotel to golfers. I would also recommend renting a car so you can leave the property for dinner and the site seeing is easy to get to as well. The main road once you get out of the hotel has an outlet mall, Wal-Mart, McDonalds and several stores. This road also leads you to the Rain Forest and Old San Juan. Driving there was very easy...I didn't want to give up the car! :) Overall, Puerto Rico is a lovely destination and I would highly recommend it as a vacation destination. Old San Juan is so beautiful as well as the Rain Forest. There is lots to see and do in Puerto Rico and we always felt safe. I would love to go back and explore more of Puerto Rico. Really lovely place and friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “It was Ok the grounds are beautiful thats about all!”
Reviews.Author: ninad99
Reviews.Content: I have been to many resorts and this was just OK. The rooms really need an update and I am so surprised that a refridgerator did not come in the room. I have a baby and needed one for her food and formula. I honestly only stayed here one night because I had a reservation at the Wyndham Rio Mar for 4 nights and the Wyndham was much nicer. The pool was nice my kids had fun. There really is no beach so if you are looking for a beach this isnt your resort. The food is way overpriced. I was kinda shocked by that. And it is not very good and neither are the overpriced drinks which were about $12 each for a pina colada!!

Reviews.Title: “When Compared to other Melia's - I Was Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Alicia G
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia is a decent resort but there were some major things had I known I would have made a different selection with my stay in PR. I have stayed in several Melias and Paradisus and this one was the worse. Upon arrival the Melia's usually meet me with a fruit cocktail of some sort, fruity drink or sparkling wine. This one fooled me with the fruit in a clear liquid which turned out to be water only, alongside paper cups. Well thank goodness I was a red level, felt bad for those who were not. If you stay red level you can get wine. There was no club, no casino, no nighttime entertainment. It was dead at this place. There weren't even shuttles to take you off the resort, so I had to rent a car and leave the resort to find fun. This took away from my vacation because I had to drive myself and worry about involvement in accidents and getting it back on time, etc. (The rental on site was out of cars so I had to use one offsite.) The bar closed early and from all 5 days there I saw a dj one time. So I think I can say there wasn't really a dj. The hallway/common area to the rooms wasn't kept very well. The dishes, glasses, etc. weren't pick up daily so I started placing it outside thinking it would be removed. Those items sat there for days. The hightlight of my trip was a gentleman named Tony who is top notch, gave excellent service, attentive and did everything within his power to make my stay easier and comfortable. He was excellent. For anyone that stays red level please request Tony, he would be the one and only thing to make you return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Below Average Service”
Reviews.Author: Mama2Boyz
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I travel to various islands every year. Usually they are all inclusive but I was only needing a quick getaway for Spring Break and couldn't pass up the deal on cheapcaribbean.com The deal came with credits for their restaurants, spa and a room upgrade (which was non existent, but whatever). I went to the resort wanting pure relaxation and that's exactly what I got since there was nothing else to do. Thank goodness I enjoyed the pool b/c the beach was pretty much non existent. If you look at any of my other reviews you will see why I'm not impressed by this resort. 1. Resort Grounds- Gorgeous! Everywhere we went the grounds were very well kept! The pics on their website don't do enough justice. You will not be disappointed with how well everything looks. That includes the rooms and the restaurants as well. 2. Location- It's about 30mins away from the airport. Not a big deal. I've been to other places where the drive from the hotel is 1-2hrs away!!! 3. Rooms- Absolutely not worth it! It's barely a beach and there is so much seaweed that you don't even want to get in. Huge clusters of it attached to the beach floor so you can't even walk across in certain spots. I put my feet in just to say I got in the water but spent most of my time at the pool soaking up the sun. 4. Rooms- Very spaceous and very nice. Slight moldy smell in our room but in my friends' room next door it was nice and without smell. The smell wasn't over powering in our room so it didn't bother me much. The beds were very plush and nice but as soon as you got in it moved VERY easily, almost creaked as if it was going to all apart. Thank goodness I was only sleeping in it. Rooms were very clean but DO NOT leave any food anywhere! We left a few coke cans out one night and the next day I saw a baby roach. Thank goodness we were checking out that day. 5. Activities - Non existent for the most part. Aside from your daily workouts I didn't see anything being offered. Supposedly there were some activities on Thurs - Sat nights but we left on Thurs. And the karaoke and piano bar isn't exactly "night life". I didn't want to do much or be bothered so I was ok with the lack of things to do. Someone else may not appreciate it as much. You will definitely have to go on excursions for some fun. I also noticed the lack of water sports. Motorized or Non Motorized. There were a few kayaks you could snatch up if you wanted but again, not exciting. As four young ladies we had to find our own entertainment, set up our portable radio in the lounge and make our own party. Pretty sad huh? For the record, my friends said the gym and the spa were very nice! 6. Food - Pretty decent food. Comprable to most other resorts. I did not like how they didn't have many choices which I am used to. Other resorts give you at least 3 or more choices for each meal. (i.e. restaurants, beach bbq, bar/grill, buffet, etc.) Here you have ONE, maybe two choices! For breakfast their was a buffet. For lunch their was either the buffet or the wet bar. For dinner there was only ONE restaurant open. They alternated the few restaurants that they did have. Passion is not ran by the resort so even though it is on their resort it is deemed separate. Don't go hungry, you will be waiting FOREVER! It seems like everything is brought in 30min intervals. Sad. (p.s. the pizza you can order from Luigis is ok if you are starving or drunk) 7. Service - Staff was okay but could have been more available. I am used to having resort staff always being around to point you in the right direction, help, offer services, etc. There was a wait no matter what you were doing. Checking in, Checking out, waiting on a table, getting towels, at the bar to get a drink, room service, etc. I found it interesting that for someone who didn't have the all inclusive option that they wouldn't provide service for what I paid for. Case & Point, I had a drink spilled on me during dinner at Passion (which is not part of the resort) and b/c I didn't act nasty or act a donkey I didn't get ANY compensation. I had to ask for "something" and then Carlos the manager only gave a little 10% discount. Really? What if my outfit was satin or expensive? Thank god it was a black tube dress but it doesn't hurt to comp a $20 meal out of an $80 check. The manager didn't even come out to apologize until I asked for him. So in conclusion I liked my relaxing vacay but only b/c that is what I wanted from the beginning. If we were looking for more we would have been disappointed. I prob would not go back or recommend this resort to anyone who would like to travel with high expectations. If you go . . . . just be prepared.

Reviews.Title: “Check your bank account.....”
Reviews.Author: 60922Lbl
Reviews.Content: I will say that the people were very pleasent & it's was a beautiful resort. However, when I got home I saw that I was charged $600+ more than what was to be charged!!!!! When I called the front desk & talked to a manager they told me there was nothing they could do... It is NOT worth the money, we were on a company vacation & had the red level during this time, but if it was my dime I would NEVER stay here or get the red level. When standing at the front desk to check out the line took forever because so many other people had complaints. I talked with people while waiting & they all had a bad experience, one way or another. Good luck if you stay here & keep a close eye on your bank account... even days after you have left.

Reviews.Title: “So Far So Good”
Reviews.Author: Laura D
Reviews.Content: We just made reservations to stay at this hotel for two nights in late April. After making the reservations we read some of the reviews on here and got a bit scared but so far so good. We just called to see if they could put our rooms together (my parents and I are traveling together and we have separate rooms) and the people who we spoke to on the phone were very helpful in assisting us. We will have to call back to finalize everything once our reservations are processed but if that is the level of customer service I can expect (from Hector who then transferred me to Anabella in reservations), then it should be a great trip. I haven't been to Puerto Rico since 2007 so I am very much looking forward to the trip and to staying at the Gran Melia! Will update the review after the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, poor service”
Reviews.Author: msjesims
Reviews.Content: I have travel quite a bit in the Caribbean. I got this trip at a great price for a quick Spring break get away. It is a beautiful resort with spectacular views, a great room, and exceptional golf course. Unfortunately, this is the worst service I've had in the Carribean. When I arrived on Monday around 4:30 PM, I tried to upgrade my room with the included voucher and there were no upgrades for anyone. We were told that we had several restaurants to choose from only the Italian restaurant was closed, the Cafe was closed, one restaurant didn't take the meal vouchers, so we were left with the Asia restaurant. We were told that we didn't have a reservation so we were left with some random menu choices that included sushi and a noodle bar to name a few. Once we were seated, which seemed like an imposition since I didn't have a reservation, it took me 20 minutes to get a tea and soda, another 30 for the sushi, and another 45 for the meal to come. The food wasn't bad but for 90 bucks, I would have expected better sushi. Today, I was in the cafe at 5 PM (which doesn't close until 6) and I Wanted to order the Paella. I was told the kitchen was closed for Paella so I needed to choose other items on the menu. I was then told to come early tomorrow before my flight if I wanted to have it. Thanks but no. This resort is far outside of San Juan, around 40 minutes. Again, great place if you just want to relax by the water. Drinks in the rum capital are 10 bucks a pop...and you aren't allowed your own coolers or anything. For the price, beautiful place with exceedingly poor service. I am not typically a complainer and I speak fluent Spanish and have lived abroad. Won't come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Anywhere but here!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Slim J
Reviews.Content: At first glance, passing the well manicured golf course and arriving at the grand open lobby, very inviting...........i would enjoyed a picture more than we did this resort. For a 5 star rated resort our rooms were moldy, electrical outlet not working and whatever type of energy saving censor they had in the room emitted a constant high pitch noise that was very very very irritating!!!!, it was me, my girlfriend and daughter in a room and we constantly has to request towels and wash cloths because they would only bring enough for two people, and then they have the nerves to get frustrated with me and tell me there gonna charge me extra towels.......really This was a combination vacation.....my daughter birthday and me and my lady get away. There so called kids corner was non existing they give you an activity calendar that the staff obviously had no knowledge of, the bars were like the gingerbread man....(catch me if you can)!!! The open late and close early, the service sucked the restaurants were over priced and the food sucked and even holiday inn have free wifi, they want to charge 14.95 a day for a modem and data cable.....wtf ......we got tablets what the hell we gone with a modem and data cable, no microwave in the room a mini bar fridge that don't work.....room service was a waste food was cold and guess what ...........no microwave!!!!!!!!!!!! And this was just day 1 and they charge you to park .........re damn diculous!!!!!!!!!! Good thing we had a rental car It's a shame that as beautiful as this placed looked we tried to stay away from it, we would leave early in the morning and come back when it was time to sleep.. It's great for those who want to do nothing, but hell I can sit down and read a book at home I have to complain about but it's pointless.......don't go here!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “please read MY REVIEW!”
Reviews.Author: Yolanda M
Reviews.Content: The hotel gets a 0 in my book! I've stayed in a lots of resorts in my lifetime and nothing was this bad. I stay at resorts for the experience of entertainment, relaxing, and the fact that I can enjoy the resort. This was not that. There was NO entertainment for us or the kids, the staff wasn't helpful AT ALL! This hotel is beautiful but that's all it is. It's over priced, they charge you a arm,foot ,and toe for everything. They charge u for the parking .they charge u 20.00 a plate for food. Oh and no such thang as a kids menu! The worst ever! Please don't waste good hard earn money on this resort. It's motel status!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Daniela R
Reviews.Content: The service at this resort is beyond terrible. From the front desk staff to the food service people, bad, bad, bad. The resort facilities are nice and well-maintained but our room was sad. It was spacious but the furniture was in bad shape, the couches and chairs were stained, not good. And considering the price, the value at this place is dismal. They nickel and dime you for everything. Go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Take Reviews with a Grain of Salt”
Reviews.Author: paceyswife
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Gran Melia for both business and pleasure. His company hosted a conference that included spouses/guests. We decided to go a few days early and not by plan, won a great bid on Priceline for the Gran Melia. We were hoping to stay in San Juan but won Gran Melia for about $125 per night. After reading reviews here, we were both hesitant about our stay. Fortunately, we had no problems with our stay and enjoyed ourselves immensely. We did not upgrade to Red Level and did not feel that we missed out on anything (other than a bit odd that rooms had old-fashioned TV and no docking station for ipods, MP3 players..). I do highly recommend renting a car. We did so from Avis at the airport and for 5 days, paid less than $225 for rental and gas refill. There is no charge for parking if you rent from Avis (just don't rent from site at the hotel as it is a bit pricier). I would have been content at just the resort as I enjoy nothing but the sun and several good books while on vacation but my husband likes to see the sights as well. We went into San Juan for a day and that was enough. Traffic into and out of the city is horrible and we spent at least an hour getting into and out of San Juan. Definately drive to Farjado (less than 30 minute drive) and take the $4.50 R/T ferry to Culebra (just get there early enough to buy your ticket as we were the first to be told that ferry was sold out..very sad :( . No worries though as we bought tickets for next day!) Loquillo (about 10 minuete drive) is another great beach with good kiosk on the beach that serves beer, frozen drinks and food extremely cheap (empanadillas $1, beer was $1.50 and pina colada $3)! Right down the beach are the kioskos that are fantastic...they were so good that we went back the next night. I can't comment too much about the restaurants at Gran Melia. We did arrive late our first night (around 8 pm) and went to the Italian restaurant. We were seated right away without reservations - on a Saturday night. The food was good and I didn't think overpriced. Our meal included an appetizer each, a bottle of wine and our entrees and we didn't think $130 with tip was extreme at all. We pay much more at home for a meal like that and we don't live in a big city. The food during our conference stay was much like that of any banquet style setting. Staff at the resort was wonderful. We did not encounter any difficulty with anyone. I felt bad for the front desk people as they did not seem staffed accordingly and on a couple of occasions saw them getting abused by people with trivial complaints...like standing in line for 5 minutes to be taken care of...seriously? You stand in lines at McDonald's longer and don't complain. This is a resort. Realize that when you book! Of course you have to walk to get to places but if you can't stand the walk there are drivers constantly asking to take you someplace. Is it such a hardship on vacation to walk 5 minutes in a lush setting? We had no issues with our room or housekeeping. One day, they weren't there yet when we returned to our room. I called to request additional towels which were immediately delivered. I told them not to worry about cleaning our room that day. When we came back from dinner, our room was cleaned, turned down and our cooler had fresh ice in it! Pool service was fine as well as the outdoor restaurant. Again, this is a resort. Drink prices weren't outrageous (although my husband would say the beer prices were!). A frozen drink was about $8.50. We were in Miami Beach last year and paid $16!! We did buy beer and pop outside the resort and kept it in our room on ice. No one said anything to us as we walked through the resort with it. We were discreet about it but didn't have to hide it and our bags weren't searched as others have suggested. All in all, we had a great 8 days. I would definately recommend this resort. Rooms were clean, staff was friendly, and the grounds are absolutely beautiful. I would even have paid more than what we won on Priceline. I hope this helps quell anyone's fears who may start to regret their decision to stay at Gran Melia.

Reviews.Title: “STAY FAR AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: SQRT69
Reviews.Content: We had a terrible experience at this hotel. there were ants all over our room. the plumbing did not work in the bath tub or sink. the electric outlets were not functioning. the caulking in the bath tub was full of mold. electric lights were not functioning. the rooms are really out dated. and this hotel is supposedly 5 stars?also, over $200 cash was stolen from one of our friend's room during our stay (a police report was filed). the few nice things about this hotel were the following: the grounds are well maintained (I wish the rooms were). there is shuttle service from the room to anywhere in the hotel (that was nice). and the exercise classes (yoga & zumba) were nice. breakfast was pricey but good. dinner at Passion Restaurant was pricey and not so good. felt like waitress kept trying to up sell everything. would NOT stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “So very diss appointed! Wish we had gone somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Bakecz
Reviews.Content: -You are captive to their terrible restarants,hardly anything open, and for a golf resort there is not one brochure, flyer or any information about the course in the room. So sorry we booked here.. Even though it's not an all inclusive it's kind of insulting that they make you wear a wristband. Celebrating a 25 anniversary and asked for a special room and was told the place was booked... We get here and the place is empty. So disappointed. Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great place if you want to eat room service every meal!”
Reviews.Author: RoadieFoodie
Reviews.Content: I have to say I read all the reviews about the service here so I was prepared for the worst when I arrived. After spending 10 days on the resort I can report that everything you have read is true. I would recommend getting a room with a kitchen so you can fend for yourself as far as food and drink. They make it very difficult to spend money here sometimes. We walked around to every restaurant one day looking for lunch. Every place was closed. Went to the front desk and were told room service was our only option. A resort with no place to eat! You have to be kidding me! Gran Melia executives need to go undercover at this resort and see for themselves how pathetic the service is here. I hope they would be embarrassed with it, I surely would. I know one thing I will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: Jen B
Reviews.Content: We went to the Gran Melia for a business rewards trip, so didn't get to experience individual dining, but the large food presentations were good. The grounds are very nice. Lots of beach front and areas to seclude yourself if you so desire. Close to El Yunque, which was nice as is the onsite Trump Golf Course. I would definitely go back on my own dime! Also, I have back problems and the 3 nights we were there, I had no issues! I'm tempted to call and find out what matresses they use, because it was the best sleep and no pain when I woke up!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed with the Grand Melia”
Reviews.Author: Dtanis
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just got back today from the resort. The grounds are beautiful and well kept. The room was nice but did have a strange smell upon arrival. The service was the worst I ever experienced. The staff acted as of they didn't want to help. Pool bar staff was a joke. There are about 12 tables but still waited one hour for a burger. Waiters never asked if everything was ok or ask for refill. The tables were left dirty and the birds would fly in and take the food off the plates. Staff at the pool bar was the worst in he resort. Finally the restaurants were over priced and food was average at best. Passion had the best food however on our last night the we decided to eat there again. We arrived at 810 pm with no reservations. The young hostess told us we needed reservations even thou there were tables empty. We waited until 858 to be seated We sat there with every brain dead employee walking right pass us without saying a word. Finally we left at 920 without anyone even asking us if we wanted drinks along with another couple who was sitting behind us. The best staff member was a girl at the front desk named Isabella . She listened to your complaints and seemed to be the only person who cared. Thank you isabella . Overpriced , The Worst service EVER, and a huge disappointment .

Reviews.Title: “Happily Surprised”
Reviews.Author: feliztravelr
Reviews.Content: I went to the gran Melia and I had seen a couple of less than fantastic reviews and was a little scared. I must say that i was very surprised with the property. We got a Red Level suite that had a Jaccuzzi in the balcony overlooking the ocean. Simply amazing. The service at the restaurant was much better than we expected. The service at the pool grill was ok, could be a little better, but the dining restaurants were really good. Overall I give it an A+

Reviews.Title: “paradise”
Reviews.Author: jsxtasy
Reviews.Content: the gran melia rio grande p.r is absolutley the most beutiful hotel/resort weve been in not hard to find affordable for such a higher end looking resort the staff to the grounds keeper very proffesional and super friendly three pools i counted 1 being breathtaking with a wet bar i beleive 3 restaurants on site several attractions nearby cannot say enough but am returning this year with no worries because we know the quality. also have their own private beach other guest enjoyed puled so me and wife had priv beach to ourselves mostly.stunning beach.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as all the past reviews”
Reviews.Author: worldly2012
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 day trip with my husband's company. Honestly I was so concerned about all the bad reviews that I really didn't even want to go. Glad I did and honestly it was a nice place. It is about 30 minutes from the airport, a very large and spread out resort on the beach. The beach is ok for walking but the views are amazing. We had a bungalow on the second floor in 2024 and we had Red Level access. Our junior suite oceanfront room was very clean and the outdoor patio had a jetted tub which we used twice. The grounds are very nice and the bar areas inside and out are really beautiful. The spa and fitness center were good as well. Notice I said good, not great. Again my expectations were low based on the past reviews. I found the service to be good as well. The only knock I can give this place is their food quality- it is just ok. Other than that, I would recommend this resort as an above average place to take a trip. We stay at Four Seasons, Ritz and Mandarin Oriental and this place is nothing compared to those hotel chains. However, I was pleasantly surprised at how nice the Gran Melia is.

Reviews.Title: “Typical All Inclusive; out of way from everything, overpriced, bad food, bad service, old mattresses & TVs in rooms”
Reviews.Author: kenarv
Reviews.Content: Out of way from everything-$15 to $25/ nt to park car, same price for a taxi anywhere. Overpriced overall, bad food, bad service, old mattresses & TVs in rooms w/no views. Rio Mar or El Conquistador better choices

Reviews.Title: “The Good, The Bad, and the........Mouldy”
Reviews.Author: Nosunshine1234
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent a week in beautiful Puerto Rico. I must emphasize Puerto Rico as the Grand Melia resort was the RAIN on my parade. The Good: - His name was Angel M. He was the butler that looked after us in the Red Level upgrade.His personality and service was exceptional. It is too bad that others in the resort didn't share his passion of looking after customers. - Angel M. ( just had to emphasize that again ) - The Red Level Pool ( was very relaxing and not overcrowded ) The Bad: - lets just say that communication isn't their strongest point. - check in is very slow, inconsistent information - any issues brought to the attention of the staff was " in one ear, and out the other " - no Management in sight - a simple shrug of their shoulders was the extent of their concern - they redefined "falling on deaf ears" to the next level - PRICE, you have no idea how expensive it is going to be until you go for a Burger and a Beer! Coming from one of the most expensive cities in Canada we were stunned. I have read many of the trip advisory reviews and share many of the same concerns and complaints. Unfortunately there are way more cons than pros. Potential traveller's should read the reviews and take them into close consideration when choosing this resort. The Ugly = Mouldy rooms. My wife was also very sick with a hacking cough! By the end of our trip the majority of the guests seemed to be sneezing and coughing. We did enjoy the sights and beautiful old San Juan, a lovely place to see. Their culture is absolutely amazing! Too bad the resort fell well short!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PorscheDiva
Reviews.Content: This is a nice luxury hotel. Recommend a shuttle from airport and verify your price before you arrive to PR. I was quotes 2x the rate by a shuttle rep. My family checked into the hotel around 11pm the Red Level amenities rep was gone. The resort is beautiful. I recommend the Red Level due to the upgrades available. The room was clean however a few minor flaws with paint/repair. The beach was pretty and different it is very natural with the nature:) The Red Level pool was secluded -if you want a cabana you need to reserve ASAP. Passion was the best restaurant and this is the first place I would go. The Asian was not good, the food had no flavor. The breakfast was ok however I am not a fan of buffet style. My family ate at the pool bar, when it rains you are ordering from a full service menu???

Reviews.Title: “Depending on the cost, it will be great or just so-so”
Reviews.Author: pascal482
Reviews.Content: I was at this resort for three nights, four days. The experience was a bit spotty, but overall, I liked the place. Here are the positives and negatives: Positives: Nice pools. Both have swim up bars, which is fun I think. They also have the cabanas, which is a nice thing if you want some shade. Lovely grounds, and they are pretty well kept. Right near a great golf course (Trump). I didn't play, but I got the impression the greens are very nice. I think it's pricey... Friendly staff. Nice room, quite large, with sitting area. bring a snorkel and swim off the beach.. Lots of fish, marine life close to shore in shallow water. Negatives: Our room wasn't ready for a couple of hours. The food was not exceptional--really quite average. Most disappointing was the breakfasts. I can get bacon and eggs in the States. I would like exotic fruits and freshly baked bread/bagels/croissants, etc. Not at this resort... The resort is far from San Juan--about 40 mins. So if you want to go out in San Juan, it's too far for an evening. Many of the staff members don't speak english. I would say that this is a good bet if you want to relax, not go out at night. And good for golfers for sure. But if you want a high level of service and really good food, you may want to look around.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected....”
Reviews.Author: Istanbully
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Melia Golf Resort in Puerto Rico this past weekend (3/17-3/20) and there were pros and cons (unfortunately more cons) to our stay. First the pros: the resort itself was beautiful. The grounds were well kept, the waterfront and pools were great. Even though their beach was not a traditional, white sand beach, it was still very peaceful and beautiful to walk along. It is not, however, for swimming. The overall look of the place was very nice. The restaurant Passion was very good and worth the price. The Mofongo dishes, fish and steaks were all delicious and the service was excellent. We did not try the Italian or Asian restaurants, since we live in NYC and have plenty of those which are some of the best in world, we thought we would stick to the local fare. The bellman/women and bartenders (other then the pool bartenders) were great as well and were always eager to help and give great service. Israel, that's his name, at the "Ave Bar" off the lobby was awesome. The breakfast buffet itself was very good, servers were great and the food was just fine. Now, before I explain the issues with Gran Melia, it should be noted that they are repetitive and have come up in several other reviews. So the people running the resort are either ignoring them or refuse to address the issues plaguing these bad reviews. Here are the cons of this resort, and I will begin with the breakfast. There is only one place to eat breakfast from 7a-11a. This is an ongoing theme for the resort, because it happens for lunch as well. So when the breakfast place, Cafe Soleil, fills up, a line forms, as it does everywhere at this resort and it concludes with people not making it in to eat either because of the food running out or no more space and then they close the doors. The only place to eat lunch is the pool bar, Wet Bar, that says it opens at 11a-6p, but twice while we were there (three days total) they did not start serving food until 12:30p because the staff hadn't shown up yet. This "lunch" place gets extremely bogged down with food and drinks orders as it is the only place to eat during the day for the ENTIRE resort and the only pool bar. It was up to 2 hours to wait for a turkey club sandwich around 1p in the afternoon. This was a huge issue, with no resolve in sight. The bartenders were inexperienced to handle large volume and mainly ignored half of the guests attempting to order anything. Next problem, the rooms. As it was mentioned in so many previous reviews, there are rooms with mold and extremely musty odors. The solution, unfortunately for guests, is to ask to see the room first, before saying yes, as we did and they will give you a room eventually free of mold and smell. The rooms themselves are very nice and spacious and on our third go around, we finally had a suite that we were able to stay in. DO NOT order Luigi's pizza by the way. We are from NYC, where great pizza is everywhere, but this is not pizza. It is cardboard with burnt cheese and ketchup on it and it was very expensive. Another issue which people thankfully spoke of in their reviews, is the checkout policies of the resort. We read these reviews, and listened to the advice of NOT using debit cards for the "incidentals" at the resort. Upon check in, they charge your card (make sure it's a credit card) $100 per day for incidentals. The huge problem with this is that they do not accept cash anywhere on the resort and most of the things (food and drink included) must get charged to your room, so when you exceed the $100 per day, as most of you will, the resort automatically puts another $100 per day hold on your card, which in our case (3 nights) came out to $600, and that was half way thru our trip. So be advised, if you use a debit card, you will lose your money and getting it back will much more difficult if you don't live in Puerto Rico. We actually somehow had $700 held on our card when we checked out and the front desk woman, Angelica, had no idea why we had so much money held on our card. Speaking of the front desk, they make you wait a good amount of time to check in/out or speak to them about anything. And they do not inform you of their policies unless you ask. Be aware of the daily "charge" for UNICEF as well. All in all we would NOT stay there again. Puerto Rico is beautiful and there are far more many places to stay for much cheaper prices. The Gran Melia is overpriced for what it is and although it is very pretty, looks can be deceiving.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best ever...”
Reviews.Author: Trish95
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews prior to booking this resort and was not real sure we were going to the right resort for our stay. I was so right on. We LOVED this resort and everything about it. By ALL MEANS THOUGH....... GO RED LEVEL !!!!!!!!!!! I probably would NOT go here if I didn't go Red Level. The breakfast is wonderful and of course you can get it for about $15.00 per person without the red level but to pick up the phone and ask for a cart to come get you and they are there immediately to take you wherever you want to go in this huge resort property is a must. The rooms were large and very comfortable. The red level lounge every evening with wine bar was well... lets just say I got my monies worth..... The staff was all very delightful with the exception of the brkfst buffet but they were ok.... Just not as friendly as others. Just loved this area and the resort. We had NO PROBLEMS WHATSOEVER.... MAKE SURE YOU RENT A CAR. THRIFTY CAR RENTAL WAS VERY GOOD TO US ALSO...

Reviews.Title: “Paradise for Urbanites”
Reviews.Author: BSmiths
Reviews.Content: Along with many other reviewers, we didn't experience any of the negatives expressed about Gran Melia. Our family of four live in Manhattan and booked a five-night stay through Cheap Caribbean (terrific deal!). We rented two rooms â€“ both spacious, immaculate, tastefully decorated and lovely for early morning/late night hanging out. Our package included a $50 per room daily coupon for the various restaurant properties which we applied to the generous and varied buffet breakfast. We spent each day touring a different area (El Junque Rain Forest - 15 minutes; Pinones - 30 minutes; Old San Juan - 45 minutes; Ponce - 2 hours - each highly recommended) and then returned for relaxation at the enormous and gorgeous pool. The grounds like our rooms were immaculate and beautiful, and though the resort was 80% full, we never experienced crowds or offensive behavior. Honestly, it was everything and more than we'd been hoping for â€“ a relaxing, beautiful and culturally rich vacation, with great appeal for both adults and children.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Mjc12771
Reviews.Content: We arrived here for a one night stay after our cruise for a little rest. We arrived earlier at about 0830 and check-in wasn't to bad. Gerard was the staff member that did our check-in and he was awesome. He was the nicest staff member that we encountered. We got upgraded to red level which was very nice. Even got breakfast that first day free. One thing that was hard to get used to was how slow things move. Not bad service just slow but that was everywhere we went. Nice place to stay but be prepared for a slower pace.

Reviews.Title: “Check-in and out painfully slow!”
Reviews.Author: Sawwhetowls2
Reviews.Content: Vacation = tranquility, peaceful, adventurous not frustration, impatient, annoyed... A great place to stay...if you have an hour or so to waste at check-in and at check-out. We stayed at the vacation club property Sol Melia right next to the hotel Gran Melia. They botched our reservation which was for a king master suite. We ended up with two full beds. This was very disappointing. The room was very nice. We left for two nights to travel to the other side of the island and when we came back they have us out proper room upgrade but still made us pay the difference. The king master suite was AMAZING! The photos will show just how special a place it is. Although we didn't 't use any of the on-site amenities, we appreciated the manicured grounds, which were groomed each morning, and the incredible pool and whirlpool. The views were spectacular. Ocean views and perfect blue skies nearly all the time. We arrived during the Puerto Rico Open - a National PGA event. The Golf Channel was there and more people than we were expecting, so we got out of there and went to nearby Fajardo and El Yunque to enjoy our first two days. We went for birding mainly and we would suggest staying on the opposite(SW) part of the island for birding activities.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds...”
Reviews.Author: targatin
Reviews.Content: ... but don't expect to build sand castles on the beach or dive in the water. The beach is very tiny and rocky. You have to walk on seaweeds and rocks to get to a small swimming tunnel parallel to the beach. The pool is great. Food is a mix. There are 2 excellent restaurants: one Puerto Rican, the other Asian. The Italian restaurant is over priced and you have to wait a very long time to be served. The beach restaurant is mediocre. The rooms are spacious and pleasant, they're clean and the beds are comfy. During my stay, all the ice machines were broken, and it was impossible to get ice from room service unless you ordered food or drinks.

Reviews.Title: “There are pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: alley3898
Reviews.Content: Pros: Beautiful lobby, grounds, facilities, pool, pool bar, good buffet breakfast (50% off with a MAS card from mymasrewards.com), good lunch at pool bar, stunning rooms, gym. Cons: location (far from everything), rocky, shelly, seaweed beach, overpriced food and drinks, $100/nt credit card charge pre-paid at check-in, slow/poor customer service, dinner restaurants overpriced and mediocre. The Asian hibachi was terrible! Casino is small. Golf carts drive by constantly and never offered us a ride. I booked 2 rooms through Hotwire and upon check-in they tried to give me only 1 room. It was corrected but upon check-out, they gave me a $1000+ bill for the second room. It took 15 minutes to correct, but it was a pain to deal with twice. No apology from the front desk-nothing. The only hot tub is inside the spa and costs $30/day. You would think a "5 star resort" would provide a hot tub outside- the resort next door has 2 free of charge. I would not stay here again. The best beach I saw in PR was in the Isla Verde area, where I wouldn't need a rental car, as I could walk to all, and also have many food & entertainment options.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning!”
Reviews.Author: Danette31
Reviews.Content: We stayed Spring Break 2012 for 4 nights. This hotel exceeded my expectations in every way. We upgraded to the Red Level which gives you access to private pools, free cabana rentals, free daily breakfast, free happy hour with appetizers and a private butler. I highly recommend the upgrade! Tony was our private butler and he was amazing. He drove to the other side of the resort for us to buy goggles for my daughter! We stayed in a Garden View room and it was perfect. The bathroom was large and there was a large sitting area. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Everywhere we went, a staff member asked if they could do anything to make our stay better. We enjoyed the "lobby" of the hotel as well. Nice cabanas there and comfortable sitting areas that really bring the outside in. We will be visiting again!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful grounds...poor service”
Reviews.Author: Jen61C
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five days on an incentive trip with my friend's company. The rooms are very nice and spacious but I must say the service at most bar areas is horrible....my girlfriend and I sat at the bar for at least 15 minutes before the not busy bartender even looked our way...no greeting or "I will be with you in a minute", seriously the worst customer service I have encountered anywhere, and I have traveled a lot!! I don't expect to be treated like a v.i.p. but certainly expect to be acknowledged!!! We found this to be the case every time and at every bar we went to except for the nice gal in the casino. Also, this place is much too far from any where, so unless you rent a car, you are mostly trapped at the resort...no stores, restaurants, or little bars or other places to walk to...have to take a taxi and is quite expensive!! Can get a bit boring and pricey...overall, I don't think I would stay again...have stayed just down the road in Luquillo and would go back there in a heartbeat!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: 2NeedAVacation
Reviews.Content: I booked our room using the name-your-price feature of Priceline. I was extremely nervous after reading all of the negative reviews here and was bracing myself for a terrible stay. However, it was all fine in the end. Check in was very quick. We were not offered the option to upgrade to the Red Level, but this may have been because there was a golf tournament going on while we were there, so maybe all the rooms were taken. However, our garden view room was very large and clean. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. I did a bedbug check and found no evidence of any. The pool is gorgeous and the view from the beach is lovely. The parking fee was about $14 or $16 per day and is annoying, but I know almost all the hotels charge, so it's just something you have to put up with. In-room Internet would have been another $14 or so per day, but wi-fi is free from the common areas, so we just hiked to the lobby area and sat on one of the comfortable couches when we needed it. We stayed 3 nights. We booked this room just as a place to stay for our daily excursions and so we only ate one meal at the resort - a late afternoon meal at the poolside restaurant before it closed at 6pm. The pizza was good but the salad was disappointing. However, the view of the water from the restaurant was worth it. We had breakfast every day at the little bakery at the corner of PR-3 and the road to the resort on our way out for the day (Coco something) and that was a very good bargain which I recommend. I had one glass of the house cabernet at the hotel bar which cost $9. I can't comment much on the service because we didn't actually spend much time at the resort, but most employees we encountered seemed nice. A trolley stopped for us once to ask if we needed a ride. They tell you upon checking in that your credit card will be charged $100 per day for incidentals and then refunded. I carefully checked my bill upon check-out and it was accurate except for the $1 UNICEF donation which I had declined upon check-in. The desk clerk offered to redo the bill to remove it, but I said to leave it on after all. Other than that, I had no problems with the bill and my credit card was properly charged. The location of this resort is a bit out of the way, but overall it was clean and quiet and we were pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, Relaxing, Relaxing......”
Reviews.Author: wendysuegrant
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a trip here 6 years ago, also surprised me with a ring when we got out to the beach!! It was SO good to go back. They have since changed owners (was Paradisus) and it is not all-in-clusive anymore. If you are looking for a vacation full of cocktails, I would look elsewhere! :-) (pricey!) However, the peace and quiet and beautiful weather makes up for it. Great casino right in the resort, nice restaurants too BUT remember, meals are not included. Activities were kinda planned poorly but it is vacation so me and my husband played each other in the pool tournament, won a non-alchoholic drink. Be careful of daily charges on your card. $13.89 was charged daily and we still have NO idea why!!! Very romantic and great value for price!! Look out for the lizards running around! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: MagKatCar
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here for four nights in early March. We found an unbelievable deal right on the Gran Meila website - only $140/night for a garden suite. The many negative reviews on here caused us a little pre-trip anxiety, but boy were we surprised when we got there. Upon arrival, we were immediately upgraded to a deluxe suite, complete with a mini kitchen, at no extra cost. This was great, as we were able to save money by buying groceries in town to make breakfast and lunch ourselves. That way, we could splurge for dinner at night. Our room was gorgeous - TWO flat screen televisions, beautiful accents, and very clean (not sure why people are complaining of getting filthy rooms when ours was immaculate). Very comfy beds. The bathroom toiletries were also very nice. The pool area is beautiful. Very clean, plenty of chairs, and nicely landscaped. Lots of fresh beach towels, too.
