My mom and I enjoyed the daily water aerobics at noon. Though the beach isn't much of a beach - more grassy than sandy - it was quiet and relaxing. The only restaurant we visited on site was PasiÃ³n. It was delicious, but very overpriced. We traveled to Luquillo (about 15 minutes by car) for dinner the other nights - we highly recommend the Brass Cactus and Guava's. We did enjoy the little cafe on site in the Gran Melia's Market, which was VERY reasonably priced ($1 coffees and $2 cookies). The staff was VERY friendly - always asking us if there was anything we needed, were we enjoying our stay, etc. Some of the things we didn't like - it was annoying to walk around with the hospital-style Gran Meila bracelets, and the security guards were a little pushy when we walked back with groceries (apparently alcohol purchased off site is not allowed at the Gran Melia). The resort was remote, but we had a rental car and thus did not feel stranded. Bottom line, we got a great deal and were smart about saving money where we could (buying groceries instead of eating every meal out). For what we paid, we had a wonderful vacation at the Gran Meila and really can't complain. This isn't the St. Regis, so don't come expecting everything to be perfect. RELAX, you're on vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Lawdog8877
Reviews.Content: Gran melia is not worth the money. Beautiful setting, but dirty rooms with lousy service. Gran melia could be great but it is not. Too far from anything and overpriced

Reviews.Title: “How does $90 = $174.98”
Reviews.Author: MrXFL
Reviews.Content: How does $90 = $174.98? My wife and I were assigned to this hotel on a one night NYOP stay from PL, We bid $90. Check-in was the evening of March 4 and we were assigned room 1607. Room Cost $90.00 Taxes and fees to PL $18.34 Parking $16.05 Resort Fee $13.39 Food $37.17 The room itself was gorgeous. Very spacious and well kept. The assigned room, overlooked the tennis courts and the parking lot, This was not ideal for an extended stay, but it was certainly adequate for our one night post cruise visit en route to the rain forest. The only problem we had was a minor ant problem near the desk. We suspect that one of the previous guests had eaten at the desk and that it had not been cleaned it off after departure. We called the front desk to report the ants and we were told that an exterminator would be sent up immediately. Front desk said that was all that they could do. Since it was late at night and we didnâ€™t want to sleep in a freshly exterminated room, we successfully dealt with the problem by moving our stuff away from the infested area for the evening. The grounds were beautifulâ€¦immaculately kept. My wife noticed the coarse sand on the beach. It didnâ€™t bother me all that much. We didnâ€™t swim. The beaches themselves were beautiful. The swimming pools were beautiful. The hotel and restaurant employees, in general, could not do enough for us. There are no nearby outside dining facilities. We tried to order a pizza at 8:30 (appx) Sunday night from Luigiâ€™s, the room service provider. We were told that the wait would be an hour. Instead of waiting, we visited Tempo, the onsite Italian restaurant. We split a bowl of risotto. This was probably the best risotto either of us had ever tasted. Portion size was large enough so that a single bowl was enough to feed both of us. The following morning we each had a continental breakfast buffet. The food was of high quality and there was a generous selection of meats and cheeses available in addition to the more mundane cold items. Other posters have commented on the high price of dining. Free of charge membership in the Gran Melia Mas program provides a 10% discount at onsite restaurants and a 50% discount for breakfast. This helped a lot. So what is my complaint ? My wife did the check in with Monica (?), the front desk clerk on duty. Monica told us that our credit card would be charged $100 per night for incidentals. If we didnâ€™t spend $100, we would be issued a refund in the morning. This was not a hold..it was a credit card charge. Monica also told us that we would be charged an additional 11%. My wife told Monica that we had already paid our taxes through PL. Monica told my wife and I that the 11% represented a resort fee which PL had partially paid but that we would be responsible for the difference. In the end we were charged $13.31 which is not out of line but it amounted to 14.48% of our room cost. Non-removable hospital style ID bracelets were affixed to our wrists at check-in. We were told that it was required to wear this bracelet at all times when on property. My wife saw a reference to this in the fine print and asked Monica about it. Monica told us that we would be charged $50 if the bracelet was not present. The business about charging the credit card $100 per night for â€œpre-paidâ€� incidentals had me upset enough so that I placed a call to a PL CSR while instructing the clerk to wait until I could resolve the situation. While I placed the PL call, Monica disappeared in to a backroom with our credit card. The PL CSR asked us if we had already checked in to the property. We were told that we had already checked in. I thought that this was weird since I didnâ€™t remember checking in. I think that Monica ran our credit card when she disappeared into the back room. With the PL rep on the phone, we spoke with the front desk supervisor (whose name I did not copy down). The desk supervisor did a wonderful job. She explained to me that the $100 was indeed a hold and not a charge and that the resort fee usually amounted to 12-14% of room costs for most guests. She also told us that being caught without a bracelet would not result in a mandatory $50 charge. If someone were to ask us how we rate this facility, the breakdown would be as follows: Room qualityâ€¦..outstanding Hotel groundsâ€¦gorgeous Beachâ€¦gorgeous Restaurant quality and serviceâ€¦top notch Front desk staffâ€¦one bad apple Would we stay here again? My wife loved the room, the restaurant, and the grounds. She would go back in a heartbeat. As for myselfâ€¦Iâ€™m not so sure. There may also be a more benign explanation for our troubles. The front desk clerk was not a native English speaker. The local culture also dictates that workers in a position of authority should have â€œall the answers.â€� If you donâ€™t have an answer, you make it up as you go. It is also quite possible that the desk clerk who checked us in simply did not have adequate English skills.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Land4life216
Reviews.Content: The Grand Melia was wonderful I stayed 5 nights in February and the property was beautiful. The Golf Course host the Puerto Rico Open and is very well kept. You will need a car if you are planning on going to San Juan because taxi's are very expensive. The food is average and over priced but there are great restaurants very close to the resort. Most attractions on the island are very cheap so if you have a car don't waste money on tours. Example Casa Bacardi is free and two drinks are included but the tour companies want $75.00 per person. Me and my wife enjoyed every minute of our trip. I hope my review helps.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Resort in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Mike O
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to the Gran Melia Resort 2/15 - 2/18 2012. The resort is absolutely fantastic! The pictures on the resort's website do it zero justice. There are palm trees everywhere you turn. The beaches were a little shelly, but that won't stop you from pulling up a chair and staring into the perfect turquoise water. There are also chairs set up on a grassy ledge above the beach with an equal view. Big iguanas roam the resort and can be pretty entertaining. They must be used to the guests because people were going right up to them to take pictures and they didn't seem to be bothered at all. We were Red Level, and didn't utilize it much, though you do have access to a Red Level only pool (which we definitely accessed!), free internet access in the Red Level lounge, as well as free happy hour with Hors d'Å“uvre. You also get free breakfast at one of the restaurants. Your room will be farther from the main lodge part of the hotel, but you are closer to the Red Level pool and a more secluded section of the beach. Plus there are golf cart shuttles that will take you wherever you need to go. We think it is worth the upgrade. I have to say the one negative was seeing how rude people were to the wait staff. Granted, they are on "Island Time", but relax, have a drink and enjoy the sun. Go see Manuel and Gustavo at the Red Level pool bar. Ask for a "No Pressure" (strawberry daiquiri, pina colada, and blue curacao) and they'll take good care of you. Our room was extremely nice. It faced the garden, so more palm trees, marble tile floors throughout, high ceiling, and a comfy king size bed. Aside from it not being all-inclusive, we enjoyed the resort probably more than the Sandals La Toc in St Lucia where we had our honeymoon, which was simply amazing as well. We booked our trip through Mark T. at Tripguy.com. He did such a great job when we booked our honeymoon through him and we did not hesitate at all to go to him for our trip to PR. He does a fantastic job and we will continue to go to Mark anytime we travel. Highly, Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “February 28, 2012 Trip”
Reviews.Author: Sauterelle1
Reviews.Content: I was very apprehensive about this trip due to many of the negative reviews written over the past few years. I found none of them to be accurate and thoroughly enjoyed the stay. There were no bed bugs, mold, moldy odors or rooms in need of repair. As for comments about the distance of walking around the resort, they offer golf cart shuttles around so I don't know what more you could ask for. The service from the staff was excellent. There were over forty people in our party and all had very positive experiences at the resort. We each opted for the Red Level and I was very please with it features. I took breakfast daily at the resort and found the selection of food wide and very good. All of the other meals centered around catered events but the quality of the food was very good. Since the resort is located on the far eastern side of the island, a car is highly recommended if you choose to venture out. I brought my Garmin GPS and was able to navigate around flawlessly. The rainforest reserve is very close and can be navigated without tour guides. And, since we were not in a very touristy area, I was able to eat at several excellant restuarants in nearby Luquillo. And, the beaches on the far eastern side are nice. The hotel does not offer WiFi in the rooms, it is accessed via land line modem. However, WiFi is avaible at the pool and lobby areas. The public spaces are extremely nice. If having a Bali bed at the pool is important, reserve one before you leave. Should you rent a car, there is a daily parking fee and there is no where to park a car outside of the resort that is within walking distance. In summary, I have used TripAdvisor for all of my travels throughout the world and this is the first time that many of the reviews were either not helpful or inaccurate. In the future, I will spare myself pre-trip stress caused by these reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, but not much to do at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: joe_cast_g
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice, however it is almost 45 minutes drive to San Juan Airport. It is right in the same complex as a few Trump developments. Everything inside the hotel is very expensive - from breakfast buffet at $25 a person to $125 dinner for a couple. There is no beach which was very disapointment. The pool was nice. The best thing about this resort is the distance to a set of resturants about 5 miles east on highway PR-3. It looks like a set of 25 shacks, but each is a different type of resturant. We went every day for lunch and dinner. It is about 10 minute drive. It was very safe with lots of family, tourists, and locals eating there. It is right on the water - each meal was about $15 - $20 each with a drink. The best breakfast was a bakery right before you reach the highway intersection from the hotel. Breakfast was about $5 for eggs and coffee each. Overall this hotel is good bargain to stay in however eating/drinking at the hotel is way to expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds, Mediocre Service”
Reviews.Author: Greyhound661
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our honeymoon trip through Costco, we were at the hotel for 5 nights. Here are some notable items before I launch into the full description: Service: Mediocre, awful housekeeping (things moved/missing) Grounds: Beautiful but inconveniently large, 45 minutes from San Juan Beach: Not swimmable, ample seating available for sun bathing Pool: Gorgeous and enormous Food: Very tasty, great value Rooms: Large and nice, not modern or luxurious (except Red Level) Rent a Car - unless you are purposefully taking a "resort vacation" The hotel is very beautiful. It is on a very large lot that has several different types of hotels/properties on it. It takes about 10 minutes to get out of the hotel area and they do not have a shuttle (except for golf), so if you plan on leaving you'll need a car. They have golf carts that will come and pick you up from your room to take you where you need to go on the property (it's that big!). Our room was near the beach, about a third of a mile away from the lobby (they have signs that list distance away from main areas). The rooms were large and nice, however the ammenities are not luxurious or modern unless you upgrade to red level rooms. The service was mediocre, for a hotel with this star/user rating and price I expected better than average service, this is definitely below average in the service area. Be advised that when you check in you will be given wristbands to wear during your stay. I was pretty upset about that, but they said security is likely to stop persons who are on the hotel grounds without wristbands. Housekeeping is hit and miss. They often took our towels, but did not replace them. They will give you new glasses but not take the dirty ones. Our coffee was rarley refreshed. One day, when we returned to our room several things had been moved. I like to put my clothes in the closets and drawers and I place my products in the shower and counter when I arrive. I leave things out of the way, in a corner, so that housekeeping can easily clean around things and I always throw any trash in the trash can. There is no litter anywhere in the room, I do not leave things out of place (I'm a bit of a neat freak, even on vacation). One day when we returned, all of our things had been moved, and my expensive prescription conditioner (full bottle) was missing. I also brought a hand made Do Not Distrub sign with a fake pearl hanger and pearl accents, that was missing as well. They sent security up to take a report after I complained, which felt silly for conditioner (albeit irreplaceable conditioner) and an item with only sentimental value. During all of my hotel stays, I have never experienced my personal items being out of place, let alone missing. I was very distraught by it. The beach at the hotel is not swimmble, the sand is rough because there are tons of broken shells so you need shoes at the beach. There is a lot of kelp right at the shore. However, if you just like to lay out they do have a lot of lounge chairs, little tables, and hammocks. The pools are also very nice. The red level pool is small, but it did look very private. We used the gym, it had a good selection of cardio equipment, weight machines, and a large selection of low and high weight dumbbells. The hot tub is next to the gym. We did not visit the spa because, well resort spas are out of our budget. The casino at the hotel gets very packed on the weekends. Parking can be an issue, but the staff will give you a ride so you just have to flag someone down to give you a ride or pay for valet on busy nights. The casino is small but has a large variety of table games and slots (even penny slots). Beer, wine, and well drinks are complimentary while you play. The restaurants are very good and they are cheaper than the surrounding areas. If you sign up for the Melia club, which is free, you get half off of the breakfast buffet and 10% off at the restaurants when you show the card they give you. You don't get a discount at Pasion, which is not owned by the hotel, but eat there anyway because it's exceptionally great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: E S
Reviews.Content: Before leaving for our vacation, I was worried about all the negative reviews posted recently. We stayed at the Gran Melia for 5 days and 4 nights. Just got back tonight actually! We opted to not splurge on the red level service and still thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Upon arrival, we were about 2 hours early for check in and also requested a room closer to the lobby. We were told the room was not yet ready but we were free to leave our bags with the bellhop and they would call us when our room was ready. We wandered for all of 5 minutes when we received a call that our room was ready. We received a room in bungalow 15 which is right next to the main areas. However, when we got there - another guest was already checked into the room. A bit odd but we called reception and in a matter of minutes, we were picked up and shuttled off to another room in bungalow 16, also right next to the main areas. A little bit of a hiccup but the resort took care of the room change very quickly. Not a big deal. The room was very large, comfortable, and clean. The room did have a bit of a damp smell to it but not enough to really bother us at all - i think i only took note of it because it was mentioned in so many reviews. The dampness is a bit to be expected when you are in a humid area. We never had any issues with housekeeping, our room was refreshed every day. One day we asked the maid to come back at a later time since we still needed to be in our room and we still received our turndown service. Another day we put up the privacy sign and received two notices letting us know to call down to reception if we should need anything. After we left our room and took off the privacy sign, our room had been turned down when we returned - we didn't even need to call down for anything. The pool was great - never had a hard time finding a chair. We had lunch at the wet bar 3 times and never had an issue with slow service. our food took anywhere from 5-20 minutes to arrive. the one time it did take longer was when we ordered the paella (which was delicious btw). Also, the one time drink service was slow at the bar was on a friday when the resort became much more crowded. There was, however, not much of a wait on the pool bar side so there were other options of getting drinks quicker. since we were already in line at the restaurant side, we just decided to stay put. one great thing was that water was very readily accessible - it was available at the bar (self serve). as for the beach - it is rather rocky, we opted to spend most of our days sunning by the pool but we also did see a fair number of guests laying out by the beach. the gym was a decent size and very well maintained - machines are fairly new. there is also a pool at the gym which is part of the spa and is very peaceful and quiet. there are bali beds around this smaller pool that you can use for free. we had breakfast at cafe soleil every morning. the breakfast buffet offered a pretty decent spread - fresh fruits, yogurt, juices, breads, cold cuts, cheese, omelet station, and a buffet of hot foods. there was also another station where you could get pancakes and fried eggs. the waitstaff was great - quick and attentive. one day our coffee was poured a bit cold (colder than lukewarm) so we asked for fresh cups. the waitress brought back piping hot cups of coffee and also steamed our milk! we never waited to be seated and did not really have any issues with long lines in the restaurant. sometimes there was a wait to get pancakes/omelets but i wouldnt say longer than a few minutes. Pancakes were really good! we had dinner at nami twice. Compared to NYC sushi, it is just as expensive as a top sushi restaurant but lacking in the quality. The quality of the sushi was average, just a bit expensive for what it was. to be honest, i wasn't expecting amazing sushi in PR so it was OK with me - just a little bit sticker shocked for what i received. the nami roll was probably the best roll on the menu and we also tried the ribs that were pretty tasty. We tried to have dinner at Pasion one night and as another reviewer mentioned - we had a hard time receiving service. We sat down and were given menus. someone came by and filled our cups with water but did not offer to take a drink order. we waited about 15 minutes and finally flagged down someone running by to take our order. However, still no one came. we waited another 5 minutes with no one paying any attention to us so we just walked out. A bit disappointed as I read good reviews about the food there but after waiting so long just to get someone to take our order, the meal was already ruined before it began. What was strange was that a waitress had taken the orders of the two tables next to us but then skipped us and never came back. she didnt acknowledge our table at all. i would say that was the lowest point in the trip but it was only one incident with poor service. check out was a breeze - we had a 75$ room credit per day with expedia and it was applied at check out. we had one small charge on our bill that we did not recognize (< $5) and the hotel took it off, no problems. check out took all of 5 minutes. Overall, our stay was great - we went to relax and that is what we did. Everyone we encountered at the resort was extremely pleasant and helpful. Of course we did have a handful of isolated issues on the trip but nothing was so major to never want to return to the Gran Melia. Also - it helps to remind yourself that you are on vacation - things tend to move at a slower pace in the Caribbean. A few tips: - rent a car at the airport. Based on reviews, the cab ride to the resort from the airport can be close to $100. We rented from enterprise for $19/day! We had to pay a parking fee of $15/day at the gran melia but this was still cheaper than renting from the avis on site and also saved us a cab fare to and from the airport which would have been more than what we spent on our ENTIRE rental + parking. For 4 days, our rental was ~$90. Roads are not too difficult to navigate, especially with the help of iphones! PR drivers are a bit reckless but comparable to NYC drivers. they run a LOT of red lights and merge without using their signals. - there is a supermarket (amigo) right down the street once you get on to the main road from the hotel. you just take a left at PR3, and Amigo + Walgreens + Burger King are on the left at the next stop light. about a 3 minute drive. - if you are planning on visting el yunque, it's also very close. make sure to bring rain gear! we were unprepared and had to get ponchos at the visitor center (they ran out of adult sized ones and we had to get child sized ones which still fit OK). However by the time we made it to the parking lot of the trail we wanted to walk (big tree) it was pouring so hard you would barely see! we decided to abandon the trip and drove back to catch some sun at the resort. i read that if you go early, it tends to rain less in the AM. we were there around 1PM. bad idea! we didnt get a chance to go back. - we took a day trip to Old San Juan, about 40 minutes by car (also making the rental very worthwhile!). If you plan on taking highway 66 (and not PR3) MAKE SURE TO HAVE SMALL BILLS in CASH. they dont give any change (coins or bills) at the toll booths. Highway 66 is a bit faster than PR3 since there are no lights. Old San Juan is definitely worth the trip! amazing views from the two forts. - there is a restroom with a shower that is right by reception (and fully stocked with amenities). You can definitely opt for a later flight out of PR if you want one last full day of sun. i wish i had known this! You can leave your bags with the bellhop (or in your car if you have a rental), soak up the rays for a few hours, wash up in the lobby shower and then head on home. how convenient! - lines to check in at the airport looked long. we checked in using the computers in THE MARKET at the Gran Melia and printed our boarding passes there. saved us the wait at the airport! make sure you get your bags checked at the dept of agriculture stations in the airport before getting on the line to go through security! there really were no obvious signs in the airport letting us know this had to be done. - if you want to visit the biobay, book with Cpt Jeff and Cpt Charlie at bio island PR. they were awesome. this is the electric boat version of the tour instead of the kayak tour. much more relaxing and so much more informative since they are able to talk to you during the entire length of the tour. also much less strenuous.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible horrible HORRIBLE service and management”
Reviews.Author: adriNorthport
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by stating that I too wished that I had listened to previous reviews regarding poor service and absentee management. Although the resort is STUNNINGLY BEAUTIFUL the love affair ends there. The Red Level service is essentially non existent. You are receiving a room closer to the resort (.17 miles was our walk) and a private pool but FORGET about white glove butler service. The "butlers" are in the Red Level Lounge in the lobby and can only be found during certain hours. We tipped one $100 on day one and never saw him again. We had to handle all of our problems ourselves. The "butlers" do nothing for you and are all hype. The photo of the Red Level rooms on line is also false. The rooms are the same as the non-red level rooms. Ours was purple and yellow. The housekeeping staff is unbelievably inept. Do not expect a bath mat and towels and soap and toiletries on every day. You will get ONE of those things daily but never all at once.???????? I had to call EVERY day for towels. Where the heck was that butler????? lol ...The Red pool was lovely but do not expect it to be ready early. most days we had to wait until eleven for our bali bed and noon for bar service. Personally, I like my vacation to start around nine am but I'm funny that way!!!! Expect to wait 20 minutes for drinks and an hour for food despite the fact they bbq right there. Don't ask just be prepared to waste your time. EVERY day by the pool people were screaming and complaining. And i mean screaming. Breakfast was a joke. ONE woman making eggs for the whole resort. One day the only place open for lunch for the whole fully booked resort was the beach restaurant with about 12 tables. The wait was two hours.There was alot of screaming that day. We had to bribe an employee with $50 to get us food that day. There is a serious lack of management here. You NEVER see a manager. You do see many worker bees, mostly cleaning which is surprising. I should think the resort would rather provide service to the guest rather than sparkling bannisters. But all of this pales in comparison to what happened to my son one night. As we entered the lobby which is a maze I dropped my key and in a second he was lost. We kept circling each other both getting increasingly upset. I approached a security agent who took a description but wasn't too concerned. My son, who is 10, recalled that his grandparents were at the casino and ran there , outside of the hotel,crying. As he was taught he ran to an adult employee-the guard at the door -and told him he was lost and his grandparents were inside. The guard told him " GET LOST" and told him to get away from the casino. YES YOU READ THAT CORRECTLY. He then ran to the Red Level lounge where an employee recognized him and told him to calm down and stay put. They then found me. When I spoke with the manager on duty, who oddly enough was in charge of security, he basically yesed me to death.I explained I am a former prosecutor and that about a thousand horrible things could have happened to my son outside the hotel on the street his employee sent him to but he really did not care. I watched from a distance as another manager spoke to the casino employee for one minute and 21 seconds and sent him back to work. When I brought this situation up with management this week they said that my son was not lost, he was trying to get into the casino to play. SURE. Crying hysterically he wanted to play a little roulette. DISGUSTING. My son was upset all night and wanted to leave PR right away. I felt very unsafe there after this too. Perhaps its cultural, in PR they may not value and protect children as we do. But I dont know a person who would see a lost child and not help.Except at the Gran Melia. I would never return here. I've even cancelled a trip to their resort in the Dominican Republic in November. Do not trust your vacation to them. Go to the Ritz Carlton- they never disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation”
Reviews.Author: 2026Sam
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the resort and my time in Puerto Rico. My mother isn't a traveler and was very nervous about the trip but she enjoyed herself immensely (which is saying a lot). Like other reviewers, we too got the Red Level package (sort of by accident on our part) and loved that option. Aside from seeing the rain forest we never left the resort but had a fantastic time. I would definitely go back and recommend the restaurant Passions (get the red snapper and garlic butter sauce). Do yourself a favor and give every courtesy and respect to any one servicing you. If you get to know these staff members you will discover they are the most hospitable and lovely people in the world. Some of my friends were Angel and Joshua from the Red Level pool. People will come to know you by name and are genuine in every encounter. Joshua puts in extra touches to help you enjoy the luxuries that red level offers. Also, be sure to show some love to the bartender Gustavo, and you'll discover he is an amazing person. Pagan, our friend, is the most humble and friendly security person; he'll make sure you enjoy yourself. I even met people on my last day, like Felix, who made me regret ever having to leave. Finally, be sure to meet Israel at the Avenue Bar. I mean it most sincerely when I say ask for "the best drink" and that man will make the best you'll ever have. In summary, it was a lovely experience and I would most definitely go back. The staff makes you forget your worries and provides luxuries to ensure you have a nice time. The entire staff's meticulous detail to service, ground upkeep, and hospitality will make you saddened to leave. I can't wait to go back and live in that ocean breeze once more. Sam

Reviews.Title: “"Beautiful Resort"”
Reviews.Author: DenAnt0216
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I celebrated our 27th anniversary from Feb. 14th to Feb. 19th at Gran Melia, Puerto Rico, Red Level. We had a wonderful, relaxing vacation. The grounds are lovely and the personal very professional. We ate at Pasion and the food was great. My one and only issue was that we were seated at a table that I do not believe had a server assigned so we asked a passing server to take our order 30 minutes after being seated. I cannot remember her name but she immediately apologized and took our order . Our food arrived and was worth the wait. We did not really use the butler service however we appreciate that it was available. The Jr. Suite Garden view was very nice and looked like pictured on the website. Jesus at the concierge desk is a Gem. He took the time to help my husband plan activities for us, like El yunque Rain Forest and Biobay excursion in Fajardo. He also made reservations for us on the night of our anniversary at a restaurant with great food and ambiance. Jesus printed out maps and directions to the coffee festival at Maricau where went and had a wonderful time. Another resort was recommended by friends, El Conquistadore, so we visited it and there is no comparison. Gran Melia captures the flavor of Puerto Rico and we are so glad it was our choice. We are looking forward to returning again. 6 days, not enough. I still have the bracelet on that was placed on us at Red Level lounge when we arrived. I am not ready to let go of wonderful memories just yet. Thank you Gran Melia for making my 27th anniversary the best one yet - Ron and Denise Antonio

Reviews.Title: “Beyond fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Stoneyoga
Reviews.Content: We spent five days in mid-February at the Gran MeliÃ  in Puerto Rico, Red Level, and had the most wonderful vacation; our only regret was having to leave! The resort is beautiful and meticulously maintained. Our room (on the ground floor) faced the lovely garden and was spacious and comfortable. The expansive beach area was almost empty, and we loved having a pool that was for the exclusive use of Red Level guests. Bali beds in abundance around the pool and in the hotel lobby areas, a bar at the pool, and top-notch, attentive service are all highlights of this fabulous resort; the concierge not only accommodated our every need, but called to check whether everything was to our satisfaction. Angel is truly an angel - seek him out and let him suggest tips for enjoying the resort, the rain forest (a brief 10-15 minute's drive from the resort) The small gym is nice and has its own small, private pool. Not having internet access in our room was not a problem (my i-Phone worked in a pinch); it gave us time away from computers and e-mails, and we were always able to use the WiFi in and around the Red Level lounge and lobby areas when needed. The daily evening snack in the Red Level lounge -- with wine and beer at no additional fee -- was a delightful surprise. A note about costs: don't rent a car at the resort; it's three times the price of rentals from other providers who will pick you up to get your rental car. The Gran MeliÃ  is a fabulous resort -- we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at Melia”
Reviews.Author: morocres_00662
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that i booked a 3day/2nights package through Gustazos. It included one Dinner for two at either of the 2 restaurants in the hotel and the breakfast buffet for the days we were there. I actually bought the package before going on TripAdvisor and checking what the reviews were for this hotel. When I finally got around to verifying the reviews i must admit i was worried about the quality of our stay there. But after a beautiful weekend, I can say with confidence that i really don't understand the negative reviews some guests have given the hotel. First, let me address the check in... I read various reviews where guests complained about long waits to check in. We were attended to within 5 minutes of arriving there. The front desk attendant told us our room was not ready and it would take about 20 min. She advised us to take the time to take a look around the property, which we started to do, and less then 10 min. later we got a call that our room was ready and we could go and pick up our cards to the room. An assistant came and took our luggage and gave us a ride to the bungalow where we would be staying. Second, the surroundings were beautiful and well kept. I read some negative reviews on this and again I can't say the same. They have an enourmous pool, big enough that it doesn't feel crowded and you can find your own little nook to relax in. I read a revie about someone complaining about the water being cold.... Seriously???? I mean it's Puerto Rico, were the weather is warm all year around, nonscense! Third, the room. Ok, so it doesn't have a flat screen TV, so what??? The reception on the channels was good. And really who stays in they're room just to watch tv when you're on vacation? The room was really well kept and CLEAN! If anything that is something I as a guest I'm NOT willing to compromise on. The bed was absolutely comfortable and I had no problem sleeping. There was no NOISE to be bothered by. Now about the musty smell, I did notice a bit of the smell when we walked in the room but PR has a very warm and humid climate. I would advise that you open the glass doors that lead out into the "balcon" to let some fresh air in the room and you should be fine. Now as far as the restaurants go, there are 3 in the Hotel, one for italian food called Tempo, one for asian food called Nami, and one for latin cuisine called Passion. We had our complementary dinner at Tempo and enjoyed it thoroughly. Our waiter was super courteous and attentive to our needs and the food was good. Like i mentioned before our dinner came included in the package we brought, but just so you have an idea, 2 appetizers, 2 entrees, and 2 desserts came out to a total of about $93 (that's if we had had to pay for it :) The breafast buffet was also included in our package, but it runs for $22 per person. I thought the buffet was wonderful. No complaints here, they had a very ample selection to choose from. There were omlet stations where they would prepare your omelet righ there on the spot, they had a pancake station and so many endless things to choose from. Definately worth the money if you have to pay. There was a small line when we went on the first day... showed up around 10:00am but needless to say it moved really quickly, i would say it was around a 5 min. wait. On our second day we went a lot earlier..around 8am and found that if you want to avoid the crowds, this is the time to go. The Breakfast Buffet is available until 11 am so if you're not an early bird and don't mind it being a little crowded then there's no need to wake up early. We went to the casino on 2 ocassions, during the day there is less staff but it makes sense because there is also less traffic at that time but there was at least one attendant per game table. I mention this becuase I read a review where someone mentioned the casino was a joke. Again Seriously??? I mean it's not Las Vegas but it's perfectly fine for a hotel caino. And finally drinks, my boyfriend bought a 12oz Heineken at the market located off the side in the main lobby and it cost him $4.75.... he later asked for one at one of the bars located in the lobby and ended up paying $7.50 for an 8 oz. Heineken (Aluminum Can). He felt ripped off..jajajaja. So if you like to drink I would recommend that you buy one of the packages the hotel offers where they give you 4 beers Heinekens/ or some other brand, your choice of 4 sodas, 2 bottles of water and a bag of chips for around $27 - $28 bucks (can't remember if that included tax) so you shold ask. You can buy more than one package and if you buy 2 they give you the 3rd one free but keep in mind that even if you buy the 2 packages they will only give you one package PER DAY of your stay. What to do for fun outside the Hotel - If you want to have some fun then i recommend Haciendo Carabali, it's about a 10 min. drive from the Hotel and it's really easy to get there. You can do a 2hr. tour on ATV's through the woods, half way through the excursion they stop at a river where you can take a dip. If ATV's isn't the thing for you then you can do horse back riding.. they have 2 hr and 1 hr. tours the same goes for the ATV's if 2 hrs. is too much for you than you can do a 1 hr. tour. If you have small kids they will love the Go-Carts they have available there. There's also a restaurant on the premises if you work up an apetite after having gone on one of the excursions. Another place i would recommend you visit is Richie's Cafe, also a short ride from the Hotel. It's a restaurant that offers local cuisine as well as seafood. The View is BREATHTAKING.... so even if you don't make the trip to have dinner... go and buy some drinks and take in the view... absolutely amazing. So that's it, hope my review has been helpful in making your decision. I would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Know what to expect, and you wonâ€™t be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: dianaf12
Reviews.Content: After having read all the reviews and done plenty of research on this resort, I felt pretty informed upon arrival. It turned out I already knew of the downsides, which made it abundantly easy to fully appreciate all the upsides. Truly, if you go into this already knowing certain things, you can really have a wonderful stay at this hotel. What to expect: The mail pool area is large and beautiful, with something for mostly everyone (sports, music, swim up bar, whirl-pools, kid pools, bali beds, quieter areas, etc.). The Red Level pool is calmer and very relaxing. It claims to be adult only, but I always saw one or 2 kids there and the staff didnâ€™t say anything. One thing I really liked is you can always find chairs at the pool or beach, unlike other resorts where theyâ€™re all reserved with towels by 9am. The grounds are stunning and very well maintained. I loved just strolling admiring the attraction, listening to the birds, sharing the space with all the various lizards. The beach is â€œehâ€�. I heard one guest describe it as lame, which might be a fair depiction for what one might falsely expect should be a beautiful Caribbean beach. Its lovely to look at (I could stare at any ocean for hours) and you can take some long, quiet, pretty walks down it; but, you canâ€™t swim in it. There is a TON of seawead, little to no movement in the water (since the waves break much farther out), and itâ€™s just not the kind of water you want to swim in. Naturally Gran Melia canâ€™t control this, and I feel they did a great job of creating such a tropical oasis out of the grounds that you donâ€™t care much about the so-so beach. Location wise, the resort is not near anything. If you want to be able to walk to places or take a quick cab out, simply donâ€™t stay here â€“ this isnâ€™t the place for you. My boyfriend and I had reserved 3 nights here then stayed elsewhere closer to San Juan so we could shop and go out, so we had anticipated and enjoyed the solitude of this resort during our stay. I thought the food and drinks were fabulous. There are plenty of options for breakfast, but it gets busier the later you go, so expect some serious lines at the omelet station if youâ€™re a late riser. There are three restaurants for dinner (Asian, Italian, Puerto Rican) and we tried each and were happy with them all. The Hibachi at the Asian restaurant definitely stood out as one of our favorite meals of the trip. The main bar area (near the lobby) offers many yummy rum cocktails â€“ I wish I could have tried them all. All the drinks I had were good though â€“ especially margaritas. The service was about average to me. We felt very well treated the whole time, no complaints, but it also didnâ€™t stand out as being exceptional (not saying that in a bad way â€“ we just didnâ€™t experience any above and beyond type of treatment). Rooms - we did the Red Level, so we had a gorgeous oceanfront bungalow â€“ I loved it. Slept with the balcony door open every night to feel the breeze. Lots of bathroom amenities and the room was very spacious. I would advise anyone to do the Red Level. You pay a little more but get a better room, free breakfast, a 3 hour open bar (wine, beer, and champagne only) plus one hour of appetizers nightly, and access to the Red Level pool. To sum it up â€“ if youâ€™re looking for a party, for a perfect beach, for an immense amount of activities, or for lots of nearby attractions â€“ you might want to look elsewhere. But, this resort is wonderful if you want to stay somewhere beautiful, secluded and peaceful. The food is good. The drinks are good. The music is perfect and the sights are stunning. I would definitely recommend it. PS â€“ if you want to see a perfect beach, go to Flamenco. We booked an excursion through the hotel that included snorkeling then a few hours at Flamenco Beach on Culebra, plus boat transportation. Definitely, definitely, definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Pathetic service rude staff”
Reviews.Author: roopam k
Reviews.Content: SO to start with I was visiting Puerto Rico to celebrate my first wedding annivesary with my wife. And I am sorry to say this but I had the worst experience of my life with the resort. The service was extremely horrible, the food was even worse (but I do not blame the resort for the bad food because it was the restaurants which had the bad food and service). I did not have any room service for first 2 days I was there. Me and my wife received a pitiful room service after making multiple requests at 11 om in the night on the second day to the manager and the house keeping staff. But they seem to care less about their customer's issues. Manager Tanya was on the duty at that time. She didnt really care about our problems and was laughing the whole time while we were trying to explain my problem with housekeeping to them. We somehow got a room service that night finally. The room was is a pathetic shape. The roof in the bathroom was falling apart, the bed sheets on my bed were not changed for 4 days and were torn. If that is the kind of service you guys give after calling yourself a 4 star resort then I am sorry, to say but I have had better experience with Best Western and at much cheaper rates. Last day when we were checking out , we had about $ 100 extra charges on our account. WE disputed those charges that very moment with the receptionist on duty at the resort and was resolved. She printed out a new statement and gave it to us. Our account should have been charged for about $240 but was charged $ 343. Now, that I have come back from that horror treatment, my credit card was still charged for $ 343. I have made multiple attempts to talk to the Gran Melia reservations, reception, and account services but they always just disconnect my phone call.

Reviews.Title: “Shame”
Reviews.Author: Vivi225
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the gran melia in feb of 2012. The service is just awful, awful awful. It's a shame because the grounds are beautiful. When we first arrived I told my husband we'd return with our children, well my feelings changed the next day. Lunch took some guests 2 hours some days. Can you imagine 2 little children waiting that long??? My room had a dirty coffee cup, turned upside down next to the machine, I never had coffee in the room by the way. There was a plastic cup of burnt out cigarettes next to the outdoor jacuzzi tub. Our comforter had a burn mark. Pool bar- regular pool absolutely no service, two of our friends waited 45 minutes for cocktails. We had upgraded to red level, which also had its own pool and bar. Service was much better and the bartenders were great, especially Gustavo. We drank a ton of mojitos, which were good, but apparently we drank all the mint, because by the end of the evening no one could order mojitos. The following day we switched to margaritas, guess what they ran out of tequila. Oh well I'm not usually a complainer but this was very upsetting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but remote, condo style, average service.”
Reviews.Author: adriantm
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed for several days. The best things about it are the sprawling layout with 4-unit bungalows in a condo style. Big nice rooms. Beautiful pool complex,. Negatives, no real beach. Way out from town, cannot walk to anything, mediocre service. Only three restaurants on site, and none really very good. And all three are expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately, the Reviews Don't Lie!”
Reviews.Author: TJohnson1409
Reviews.Content: Having read about 50 or more of these reviews before booking at the Gran Melia, I tried to convince myself that many of the individuals writing these reviews were probably unreasonable and just didn't understand how to enjoy paradise. Well, I was wrong. I really should have valued the opinions of my fellow travelers more. Truly, as some of the more recent reviews indicate, Red Level Service is more hype than reality, the stay is marginal at best if you have high expectations, and I was embarrassed to admit to my husband that I, the wife with impeccable taste and all the answers, had led our family down the rocky road of travel disappointment, and paid good money to do it. At this point you have probably read it all before, but if my comments can make even one traveler more aware of what they might expect, then the time spent on typing this review is worth it. So, here goes: We made our reservation through American Express Travel. We received what I considered at the time of booking an excellent rate on a Red Level Ocean Front room with a jacuzzi on the terrace. Red Level check-in went pretty smoothly, with very little wait. (We arrived just after noon and told that the room was not ready, but they would put a rush on it. Fortunately, the room was ready shortly after we completed registration.) As noted, almost everything is a brief walk from the rooms, so we waited for the golf cart to transport us (and our luggage). While I did think the grounds and the exterior of the buildings were quite attractive, the first thing that greeted me when we opened the door was the smell of mold/mildew and the dampness of the room. Thank goodness for Febreze and Clorox Wipes. (I shouldn't have to say this about a resort.) I can't say that the interior of the bungalow looked worse than the pictures online, but it had somewhat of a tired feel, and nothing spoke of "Red Level" luxury. (Even one of the "upgraded" bath amenities had mildew on it. I admit that I hid it from my husband as the thought that someone would put it out for a Red Level guest was simply too much to bear.) The lunch on day one was a disaster. It took us a while to discover that there is only one option for lunch at the resort, which is the poolside Wet Bar & Grill. We waited two hours (no exaggeration) for fish and chips, buffalo wings and a quesadilla. The first two items came after a 75 minute wait, and my husband's item followed after another 30 minutes, and the guests around us were not faring much better. So, service here was beyond horrible. We finally left lunch to check out the beach and the pool. The reviews are correct when they tell you this is not a swimming beach. It made for a nice walk and cool pictures, but we knew we would have to find another beach to satisfy the tastes of our beach bum 11-year old. Breakfast was OK. Go early or prepare to wait in long lines with poorly stocked food stations. (The only reason I was able to tolerate the poor food quality and service at the breakfast buffet is because it was complimentary with Red Level booking.) The remainder of the trip was also tolerable, with long walks back and forth to the main building, most of the time without benefit of the golf cart or having golf carts pass right by you without picking you up or even the driver looking your way. Brights spots were the Asian Bistro and Tempo Italian Restaurant. The food was delicious and beautifully plated but would have been considered expensive, even at a resort, for the quality. As for the excursions, book as soon as possible. The ATV tour that we booked through Dragonfly was awesome and well worth the money. It was the highlight of our trip, along with our drive to Old San Juan. (We had a great lunch at Cafe Berlin.) Thank goodness we rented a car at the airport as we had to drive to the ATV site instead of taking transportation from the hotel. (FYI, we were able to park at the resort free because we rented from Avis. I'm not usually an Avis renter, but I picked up this tip from someone online. The resort does not charge parking for Avis renters, even if you get the car at the airport instead of renting at the Avis onsite.) So, all in all, I would say that Puerto Rico was a great place to visit, but we would not stay at the Gran Melia if we were to return. Perhaps the experience would be OK for honeymooners or new loves who are blind to anything but the person that they are with. It's a very romantic place for long walks and beautiful scenery. Unfortunately, I didn't have the benefit of being blinded to the flaws of this resort on this family vacation, which would have helped tremendously. As a Red Level guest, I'm sorry to be the bearer of this less than positive review. I can only imagine what horrors and disappointments others without this "distinction of luxury" experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: A W
Reviews.Content: We should have listened to the reviews. We just returned last night from this resort. The check-in wait for RED LEVEL was over two hours. Room smelled of mold. Calls to managers were NEVER returned. Food was horrible. Take-out trays from neighboring rooms sat outside their door for 1.5 days after numerous calls to the front desk. Someone used the phone in our room to make calls and the chages were on our tab. The charges were taken off. We will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Red level service overated”
Reviews.Author: Eli E
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that I had a great vacation and absolutely loved Puerto Rico and recommend that you vacation there. As far as this resort is concerned you will basically get what you pay for. The prices are cheap but so is the service. One day they housekeeping completely skipped my room. The chairs on the porch had dirty arm rests and the balcony wass full of bird droppings. My main complaint: we booked our trip thru Expedia and received a $75 a night credit. I contacted the hotel and was told I can use that credit towards upgrading my room so i upgraded to the Oceanfront red level service for an extra $121 a night (after %25 discount for using my mas card) and lo and behold when it came to check out they did not let me use this credit. Additionally I definitely do not recommend the red level service. The main benefit you get would be the red level pool however the main pool is huge and you can find plenty of quiet spots. All the hype about these amazing butlers is a joke. I was never introduced to a butler. They never came over to us to offer us any services. We used the concierge from the hotel for our day trips and it was just fine(their directions are terrible use a gps). I called for the butler twice, the first time it was about 6pm and I was told that they were all on break and no one was available??? Haven't they heard of shifts? The next time I called was to have them pick me up from our room to help us check out. He was late in showing up and another bellhop that was passing by picked us up. I couldn't even tell you the butlers name because they never showed up. Red level also gives you access to free drinks (wine, beer,soda) big deal, not worth the extra $ in my opinion. Definetly need to rent a car if you are coming here (enterprise was very reasonably priced, onsite parking is $16 a day) As far as day trips I have 2 recommendations, you must spend at least a day in Culebra. This is the nicest beach I have ever seen. Also Haciendo Carabeli has great ATVâ€™ing. All in all Puerto Rico is awesome and Grand Melia is eh I would not recommend that you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “trip review”
Reviews.Author: phand31755
Reviews.Content: we just got home and this was a great place to stay. we were red level . resort was clean and well kept. eating there was not the best experience. slow service portion size small prices expensive. the best food we had was at the red level pool side where it was grilled right there but that is not an everyday happening. the staff was WONDERFUL. if the did not have an answer they found someone who could answer your question. the were the to please and help. there is ALOT of walking there . over all i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Appears tired and in need of some love.”
Reviews.Author: digital_dilemma
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four days here and my general impressions are: Entry to the resort: lots of industrial equipment and parking lots. Not a pretty entry. Immediately see into the delivery area. Not a good first impression.. Staff: most are very friendly and helpful and know enough English to make themselves useful. The grounds: overgrown weeds in many areas (including room balconies). Grass is sparce as weeds have taken over. The trees and plants have thinned and appear to be underfed and in need of a professional horticulturist to come in and insure that the trees and plants are receiving the right nutrients at the right time. It just looks.... ignored with just enough care to keep things from dying. Rooms: well kept. The phone did blink. I ignored it. No big deal. Plenty of towns. Clean, etc.. However, in this day and age, it's time to get rid of the old style, analog televisions and move to HD flat screens. The buildings, however, need to be painted. They are, as everything else is, looking ignored. Food: well... the buffets for corporate stuff? Really, really really not that good. Really. I would love to spend two weeks teaching the staff how to prepare and season meals. They do not understand American taste and standards and everyone I spoke to agreed. The restaurants seems to dp much better, although a bit overseasoned and salty. Otherwise, the staff seemed to be friendly and attentive. Lots to be desired, but lots to appreciate, too. All in all, I've been to and stayed in resorts that put this one to shame, but there was just enough good about this that my trip wasn't ruined by anything and in some ways, my trip was pleasurable. I can't recommend it, but I wouldn't advise anyone to run in the other direction, either. I guess your mileage may vary by your own personal expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Red Level a Must!”
Reviews.Author: Thomas M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at Gran Melia Puerto Rico at the Presidential Suite. We had a blast our own private pool and cabana bed. The room was very nice, we even had a guest room that we did'nt use but was nice to know we had access to it. Our Butlers were on the ball with us, Joshua was always taking care of us bringing us ice and other requests we made. Edgar also took care of us when Joshua was off, he was very puntual took us to the lobby area at the time we specified and took extra care with all our needs in the room. These guys are great, I hope you get to meet them if you plan on staying at Red Level. The food at Passion was very good, we enjoyed it very much. My wife enjoyed the Hammock that was placed in between two palm trees next to our villa. Overall we had a good time, very romantic time I had with my wife T.Meyer

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: mnp19148
Reviews.Content: The negative reviews about Gran Melia truly amaze me...I cannot find anything to complain about. But, as a response to some of the complaints, here's what I would say...if you are a person who wants everything to happen immediately, Puerto Rico (most of the caribbean actually) is probably not the best destination for you. If you want to be in the middle of hustle and bustle, this is not the resort for you. Gran Melia by design is a quiet, beautiful resort. It sits off by itself on a peninsula so yes, it's definitely best to have a car. There is an Avis on site and the parking is very reasonable ($16 per day). In fact, ALL the prices are reasonable for a resort: rooms, food, and drinks. The grounds are absolutely beautiful and the service is top notch. The rooms are clean and very well appointed but they do get a bit humid (it's a tropical climate 10 minutes from a rain forrest - we're not talking rocket science here), just keep the air conditioner running and it's not a problem. The red level upgrade is definitely worth it, and when you add up the ammenties that red level affords (breakfast, evening hors d'oeurves and cocktails) the cost is very close to the standard room. The service that you get from the Red Level staff (especially Nilda in the lounge, Angel the butler, and Gus and Manny at the Red Level pool) is so great! They clearly take pride in their work and treat you like guests in their home. I really can't say enough about this resort, I would recommend it to anyone without hesitation. I will go back many times I'm sure. My advice to the complainers: relax! You're on vacation!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: ButchChicago
Reviews.Content: Stayed here several times, had great times and been very frustrated ( own a time share next door). If you stay here, lower your expectations. Pay extra for royal service. And tip extra up front, for better service.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous”
Reviews.Author: joanne c
Reviews.Content: We just retd after spending 5 days at this resort. What a wonderful and relaxing time. We were treated to kindness,courtesy and a real willingness to be helpful. Another couple went with us, they truly enjoyed their stay also. Clean,wonderful food and great music. We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beauty only skin deep.”
Reviews.Author: ajwkmills
Reviews.Content: My family and I ended up at the grand Melia due to a board meeting we were conducting on site. We all ended up in the red level ocean front suites, supposedly the best... Check In - slow took over 15 minutes at 9 in the evening. Room - (Red Level, Ocean front, 18-16). The room smelt damp and over the next couple of days we realized it was v damp. Paper would curl and gel tablets stuck together. The air con was incredibly noisy but ineffective. Bed was frankly horrible, it has as thick rubber bed bug sheet, just aweful to sleep on. After the first night we began to dread the night of getting into a damp, rubber sheeted bed. Our daughter was on the pull out bed which had the cheapest nastiest mattress. The room was dirty, our feet were filthy when walking in the room. The light fixtures were bent and worn out. The bathroom was tired be on the final night a white cockroach crawled out of the floor. Food - get a car so you can get away from the appalling food, if you can get it. For some bizarre reason thy alternate which of the three restaurants is open each night. Food is average at best but really just poor. Oh and for breakfast it feels like camp or being on a cruise ship buffett. Conference facilities - Tired, old uncomfortable seats, cold then hot. Catering, appalling. Grounds - amazing, beautiful. Spotless, lovely with lots of cool lizards running around. Staff - overall very helpful, very nice. They are let down by a substandard property. Location. Middle of no where. Unless you like the feeling of being in prison get a car. Our group was supposed to stay 7 nights. Once our meeting was done we all checked out to get away for couple of nights at a proper hotel. This is not a 4 star hotel, it is barely 3, closer to a 2. The worst thing by far are the damp musty rooms. Just avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: moopr
Reviews.Content: After reading reivews of Gran Melia I was nervous to go. It greatly exceeded my expectations. The staff was very friendly. We loved the Red Level pool -Manny was a great bartender. The Bali beds with views of the ocean were heaven. The drinks at the pool were good, breakfast was good, we tried the Italian & Puerto Rican for dinner & were disappointed with both - below average food for high prices and so so service. If I were to return to this resort I'd stop at Ralphs on the way in and stock up on my own food. The beach was beautiful as were the pools. You felt as though you were on your own private beach. So peaceful and relaxing. The lobby and bar areas were large and beautiful. Definitely a great place for a romantic getaway, wouldn't bring my child, as it is tailored more for adults.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO HERE...THEY LIE!”
Reviews.Author: envs
Reviews.Content: We checked into this beautiful hotel for our honeymoon, thinking it was going to be wonderful! Upon check-in they asked us what credit card we'd like to put a hold on for incidentals, seeing as they don't let you pay with cash ANYWHERE in the hotel except the casino and gift shop, we asked what type of hold would be done and how much, as most of our spending $ was in cash. The front desk clerk told us they'd hold $100 / day and we could settle up with the other charges in cash at the end of the trip. NOT THE CASE! Our card was hit 3x before we even checked out! When we actually did go to check out, we were first met by the supervisor who told us we should have been told if we exceeded the $100 / day , whatever we went over would be added to our account, and held on our card with the other charges until the end of our trip...except that was a lie also! We put down a debit card...so it AUTOMATICALLY took out any overages immediately. Luckily my husband likes to check our bank account periodically, and noticed the charges, otherwise we'd have paid twice before leaving today (and yes I'm so mad I'm writing this the same day)! When the supervisor had nothing helpful to say, I asked to speak to the General Manager of the hotel. My husband and I work in the service industry as managers (I'm a shift manager, and he's a General Manager) and when someone asks for a GM...you find one...Immediately! Unfortunately, that didn't happen. Next we were met by the Front Desk Manager who re-itterated the SAME thing the supervisor said. Our problem isn't paying...its being lied to by an employee who should know his job before telling people incorrect information that screws with their money! Especially on vacation...and even more so on someones HONEYMOON! I then asked for a General Manager again...so someone else comes out... I feel its important to mention now, that another employee has now confirmed to me that the "blonde guy in the suit" I saw walking around, is in fact on the property AND the GM...the person who greets me is not blonde or in a black suit...he's the ROOMS Manager. Before I even begin the conversation, the smarmy look on his face infuriates me, so I ask for the GM again...and am told a 3rd time, he's not available or on the property. We are then informed that they don't really care how we feel bc they've already been paid. GREAT HOSPITALITY. On top of all that, they tax on top of making you pay for parking, and charge a daily resort fee (normal these days, but no one told to us/reminded us at arrival). The pool is unheated and you have to battle the birds for clean lounge chairs and any food you have near you. The restaurants alternate nights, so you have to plan accordingly, and make sure you have a reservation, you'll wait 15minutes anyway, but if you don't have one at all, you won't eat...the food is sub-par...sushi was the only thing worth eating, don't bother with room service or the pool bar...its also annoying they only have one place to eat for bkfst and lunch, no options... The one shining star at that resort...Richard the bartender! If you're unfortunate to have already booked your vacation, go hang with him and give him all your money! He's a fantastic bartender and host! HE should be the GM! At least he understands customer service! Much more than I can say for ANYONE else at that hotel! Thanks for ruining our honeymoon! We'll never be back!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO”
Reviews.Author: LAWOFFICESOFGK
Reviews.Content: Do not go if you are looking for a clean room free of toxic mold. Several rooms stunk with mold and one can see black mold spores on the ceiling. They had transfered my family to several rooms before there was no musty odor. The tennis courts were in a state of disrepair and coud have been in a ghetto. The manager offered two free nights for a future stay which was rejected for obvious reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Twoboys610
Reviews.Content: Red level oceanfront room a must. Beautiful views and the most comfortable bed I have slept in. The adult only pool with Bali beds great, Joshua and Angel were great butlers..... The resort was breathtaking BUT the food was blah and VERY slow service!! I would definitely go back but not longer than four days. ( there are only three restaurants)

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip - January 2012”
Reviews.Author: restondrums
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at Gran Melia and since we got a great price we decided to upgrade to Red Level service. Oh my, what a fabulous decision that was. Combine a full breakfast every morning, a three hour "happy" hour every night, an oceanfront suite with a jetted tub on the balcony, and finally the use of a made up bed, poolside: incredible. if that was all we would have been happy but since the Gran Melia is located in a remote spot and we elected to forgo a car rental we were "forced" to use the onsite restaurants. Well, we needn't worry, each of them was fabulous, well prepared food (and we can be picky), great drink selections and signature desserts that were wonderful. The prices were not unreasonable (we're from Washington, D.C., so unreasonable is relative). All in all we will be back. Travel Hint: rent a bike and travel along the golf course and around the property - good exercise and lots of fun!

Reviews.Title: “All encompassing resort near rain forest”
Reviews.Author: cliffview12
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this resort.We flew into San Juan and didn't want to drive too far since it was in the evening. This was about one hour from the airport. One of the places we wanted to see was the rain forest and it is about a 20 minute drive to El Yunque Rainforest (which was wonderful). The resort had a number of restaurants. We ate at the Italian one (food so so, ambiance great) and had breakfast each morning at the cafe buffet. The grounds are beautiful and had nice lounge chairs by the beach. The pool was nice. We spent more for the Red Level category which has it's own pool and it's own check in area. I don't know if it was worth it--my advice would be to go for it if it's not a lot more. They have a separate room to check in and out. They have an evening happy hour with wine/beer/ soft drinks and appetizers and you can eat breakfast (continental) there in the morning. We chose to go to the full breakfast buffet instead. We had a room on the second floor with an ocean view (not ocean front, but still saw the ocean and really enjoyed it). Just a note: when you turn off on the road to get to the hotel you pass a couple of big places first. We thought we had arrived a couple of times, but the gran melia was further down the road!

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever This is the anti-Club Med: watch for your $$$!”
Reviews.Author: globesurfer11
Reviews.Content: I didn't actually choose this resort as I got my accommodation there through the "name your own price" feature with priceline but I wish I hadn't used that feature! I have never been so bored in my life as there is nothing to do in this resort in the middle of nowhere and no access to any town unless you have a car and pay the hefty parking fees. On top of that everything is charged and is extremely expensive, even a bed near the swimming-pool. It is the contrary of the Club Med: nothing is included and you have to pay for every single thing!!!They also charge resort fees of $15 per night on top of the already expensive room price. The swimming-pool water is cold and even in the jaccuzzi area! Worse than that, the staff couldn't care less and can't tell you about what activities are going on and at what time. They don't seem to be aware that there are other languages in the world than spanish and english but their english is poor and their spanish is different from the spanish spoken in Spain. Besides, there is no authenticity whatsoever in this place. Everything is artificial and flashy and it's not even clean outside the lobby area! The food at the restaurants is bland and stodgy, although very pricy. No wonder they can't find enough clients and have to get them through this feature. Hopefully I only stayed there a weekend but that was a weekend too much... Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, but.....”
Reviews.Author: Shakazee
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, they couldn't find our reservation. We spent at least 1 hour trying to get this worked out. We had to call our travel agent to assist. We paid extra for "Red Service", but it wasn't worth it. The room temperature was not right, too cold or too hot, could never get the room comfortable. The toilet was making a very loud noise, had to have someone come & fix it. One day the water was off, couldnt shower/brush teeth until later in the day. The beds were not comfortable, we had backaches upon waking every morning. The food was okay, but very expensive, not what you'd expect from this type of resort. When you spend this kind of money on a vacation, we expect everything to be perfect. The grounds, pools & beachers were beautiful. We also loved seeing the Iguanas walking around the resort. We will visit Puerto Rico again, but will choose a different resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but...”
Reviews.Author: DaniC849
Reviews.Content: This resort was beautiful, picturesque, but was expensive. This is a great hotel for R&R but the location makes enjoying the culture of Puerto Rico difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: americanvagabond
Reviews.Content: The beach, grounds, and room were nice, but the service was poor. First, it took 10-15 minutes for front desk agent to get me a room key and then it did not work after walking a long way. Waited another 10 minutes for security come. Every 24 hours, they have to bring a wifi code to room. Not given over the phone. How inefficient! Failed to give free rewards club card info upon check-in, denying me the 10% off at restaurants I would have gotten. One phone in room did not work. Food service at overpriced restaurants was slow. Unauthorized credit card pre-charges every day that were not disclosed. No one ever asked whether I was satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: ORTHON
Reviews.Content: Wonderful luxury in a beautiful setting. This resort had everything I required, particularly because we went with the red level. The latter meant that we had an adult only pool (not many people using it either). Great pool, suitable for real swimming, with free bali beds beside it. The complimentary wine and appetizers in the evening was a nice touch. The first couple of mornings we ate breakfast in the cafe, but on our last morning realized that it was much better to have a continental breakfast in the Red Level lounge because the coffee was better. Both breakfast venues also complimentary. I thought this place was very good value. There are a lot of negative comments on this site regarding the service and staff. I agree there is room for improvement because a lot of times the ball got dropped. We never were offered a welcome cocktail while checking in (as advertised), and when we asked our "butler" how to reserve a bali bed, he said he would call our room right away with the number. That didn't happen either. In the bar the first night, I ordered some gumbo. It took a long time, but I wasn't concerned. A guest next to me started complaining loudly about the lateness of his meal. The next night, the bartender explained, when I ordered the same thing again, that this was room service so it would take a while. I said, no problem, but I would still like to order it. 45 minutes later I asked him how the gumbo was doing. At that point he jumped on the phone (which he hadn't done before) presumably to order it. I do think, though, that overall the complaints come from rude, spoiled people. If my peace at the pool was ruined, it was by tourists barking into their cell phones. Even though the literature clearly states that the evening appetizer hour consists of wine, there was still a woman acting disgusted that she couldn't get a gin and tonic. Coming out of our room one evening, I heard a guest upstairs shouting (presumably into the phone) that his ice was an hour late arriving. Why didn't he just get his own? Also, at the pool, a guest complained that his meal (which had to be trekked to him from the bar down the beach) was cold. On a positive note about the staff: It was wonderful to be strolling back to our room and to have a golf cart pull up beside us, offering us a ride. The staff at the entrance were so helpful and friendly. I hope to be able to visit this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: ashleyyf
Reviews.Content: Honestly, the facilities and grounds are so so nice. Minus the beach, the beach is a 4 on a scale of 1 to 10. It is okay for strolling but not your typical beautiful Caribbean Beach. You can't walk very far, and much of it is rocky and shaded (man made.) The restaurants were not great either. The Italian one was just bad. My boyfriend said everything tasted like Chef Boyardee. The asian one was about 3 stars. Not bad but my fish was cooked with tons of butter. Yuck. The service of the hotel overall was awful. We waited hours for our room to be ready, until 8PM when they say check in is 3PM. We did get upgraded to nicer accommodations but I would have had better service. Every time we needed something whether it was checking into the room, ordering food/drinks at the red-level pool or asking for a hair dryer it took an hour. Everything took an hour. Granted we were there over New Years but they seemed understaffed. I had a nice talk with the manager upon leaving and they said they understood our frustrations and appreciated the feedback which was refreshing. Also, be warned that a cab to and from Old San Juan is $80 each way. I wish I had know this when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service EVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: glamspa
Reviews.Content: It is a shame that such beautiful facilities had the worst personel EVER!!! Service is so bad in this Hotel, not worthy of even 3 stars!!! Cleanlines??? well... in the lobby area everything looks perfect, but in the farthest area of the hotel, were we had to stay, not clean at all. Mice were crossing by the stairs of our room, and a piece of garbage hat was on one of the steps stayed there during our whole weekend stay...Transportation to the lobby area took forver or never came at all. And let's add this was a make-up stay for a previous bad experience before. So for me, not even as a Gift I'll stay there!!!! no way!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lower your expectations”
Reviews.Author: MargiePargie1962
Reviews.Content: I took my mom on my last business trip to PR, so I wanted to kick it up a notch since we had not taken any mother/daughter trips in nearly 10 years. The website makes this place look like heaven. And it probably was when it was first built and maintained. I know Americans are picky and over-the-top especially when it comes to cleanliness, but the stairs and landings going up to our room were absoutely grungy with dirt. The room was nothing to rave about - we chose Red Level Jr. Suite with Oceanview. Granted if the the wind blew the palms just right, we could see a glimpse of ocean. We were lucky, we had the Red Level pool in front of us - most "OceanView" rooms had views of the "OceanFront" units in front of them. If you are toying with upgrading to Red Level - do the math to see if you will get your money out of it. You will recieve a free full breakfast (beware the omelet Nazi's - apparently white Americans are their least favorite tourist and the do NOTHING to disguise their dislike).
