There is a happy hour in the Red Level Lounge every night from 5-8p. Coors LIght, Miller Light, Wine, Champagne (no one was drinking it), sodas. The h'orsdeuvers are available from 5:30-6:30. They are minimal in quantity and appeal. You are also allowed to stop by at any time and request soda, water, etc. We grabbed sodas for the walk on the beach. The bulter sevice is not worth it at all. There's only just so much i can think of to call them to do for me. Getting a bucket of ice? Not really.... Picking up my luggage - bell service does that anyway. Coming to get me for breakfast? They run shuttles thru the resort about every 15-20 minutes for everyone. Plan to do LOTS of walking once you arrive. Our room was 1/4 mile (+) to the breakfast area, the shuttles run, but can be very sporadic. Your car is useless on the resort as it is all winding sidewalks. Night time lighting is abysmally inadequate - walkways are poorly lit - on the 'bright side' - it made the resort look cleaner.... Parking is $20 per day for self park. They charge $100/day on your credit card as soon as you arrive for incidentals. It will be credited back when you check out and settle your bill. The resort is expensive, the casino is full of OLD machines, the "happening" night club is not happening, the concierge team and check in staff are friendly, everyone else pretty much wishes you would go away. If you plan to stay on the resort and don't mind paying lots'o cash for mediocre food, you will be fine. We fell under the spell of the amazing promises and pictures on their website and we were so disappointed when we got there. We talked to several other guests who felt the same way we did. Lots of hype, not much heft. I usually stay at the Caribe Hilton and will be going back to them on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort with some great amenities, but the beach could use an upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: loganst
Reviews.Content: If you look for a good blend of relaxing, fitness, and drinking, then this is not a bad option for you. Not the fanciest or the best beaches but everything is relatively nice and overall it delivers a very surprising vacation for the cost. The good: The beach's water is beautiful and fairly private due to the geography - but limited actual "beach" with sand. Free water sports, tennis, basketball and fitness classes Nice fitness room and its free albeit crowded. Food at the restaurants is good and reasonable for a resort Great local restaurants and the concierge is happy to give recommendations nearby. The rooms are really nice for the cost. There is an acceptable onsite casino Poolside bar and bar in the center of the resort were surprisingly fun. The not so good: large spread out resort, we live in NYC and walk a lot so not a problem for us but beware. Get a car, the resort is fairly isolated and there is plenty to do if you leave. There is a parking fee (As stated above) There is an acceptable onsite casino Go to a foodstore and stock up on some snacks and beers for your room. It will save you $$$

Reviews.Title: “Top place for a New Year's vacation.”
Reviews.Author: mayin
Reviews.Content: Great party celebration. Not too loud. People nicely dressed. Food at Passion excellent and hotel room and amenities good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is great, but could be better, Red Level is the best”
Reviews.Author: Sweeneyfa
Reviews.Content: The hotel needs more night life, especially at the Red Level Lounge. The lounge looks old, and the carpet needs work, but overall the staff at the lounge are excellent. Starting with the two butlers that are always taking care of the lounge and guests, Edgar and Angel C., they are the best! The desk person Nilda is very proffesional. The Red Level pool is ok, even though its supposed to be an adults only pool. Me And my family had a good time, we would definetly come back next year. The Sweeney Family.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFULLLL Resort, Far from the City”
Reviews.Author: HsJBeachLove
Reviews.Content: This resort is absolutely gorgeous! It is extremely clean and actually just as breath-taken as the pictures. We stayed here for 5 Days for our 25th bday celebrations. Definitely not the type of lively resort we were expecting. It is about 30-40 mins from San Juan where basically everything happens so I would recommend renting a car for sure if you are an adventurer looking to see the real Puerto Rico. The hotel grounds, pool, lobby restaurant etc have the most relaxing and romantic vibe at night and the feeling of an oasis in the day. The staff is amazing and pleasant however slow. At first i thought this was just slow service of the hotel, however we soon realized that no one in Puerto Rico has any sense of urgency... meaning anywhere you go (even burger king) you will be waiting, thats just the culture. The resort is about 10-15 mins away from the Rainforest and a beautiful beach-town named Luquillo where you can meet the locals, have some drinks at a few of the bars, enjoy the beach and watch the surfers or go surfing. Again, we went to a restaurant in Luquillo and were waiting over 1 hr for our food. In comparison, the Gran Melia staff was great. Anything extra we needed in the rooms (towels, pillows, etc) where eventually delivered followed up by a pleasant call from the front desk ensuring we received what we asked for and were satisfied. Even after we checked-in and made it to our rooms we received a call asking if we were ok with the room! Check-In was easy, took just about 15-20 mins at most followed by being driven to our room via golf cart. The resort is that BIG, so you can get dropped off and picked up anywhere, or simply enjoy the walk exploring the grounds. You can call and ask for pick up or just walk out of your room and within 5 mins you will see a golf cart go by and they ALWAYS stop to ask if you need a ride anywhere. The hotel backs on to the ocean however its not much of a beach, hard sand, but still beautiful with an endless amount of beach beds and chairs to lay out. We stayed by the pool. The main pool is huuggggeee and in view of the beach so u get best of both worlds. There is an awesome pool bar that plays music all day and adds to the amazing atmosphere. There is also a Red-level pool strictly for adults along with a casino (small but funn). Wasn't a big fan of the italian restaurant, esthetically its gorgeous but the food is just ok and expensive. A side of potatoes meant 4 pieces of dry potatoes, and extra shrimp meant 3 pieces of shrimp for about $12. All in all its a great hotel if you want to be secluded and getaway from the world. If not, its still worth the stay just rent a car. Beware, its NOT all-inclusive and charging everything to the room will add up quickly.

Reviews.Title: “peaceful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: pnswamy
Reviews.Content: Nice resort, with clean rooms and enjoyed the pool side. Food was not very satisfactory. The Basmati was under cooked and very little considerations for vegetarians. Too far away from city and travel options were very lean. overdependent on the resort's ability to provide transport. But enjoyed the tranquil surroundings especially the coqui singing through the night.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: travelmum415
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the resort for three nights over the holiday weekend. I was worried about our resort choice given the mixed reviews. The Gran Melia exceeded our expectations in several areas and was exactly as expected based on the poor reviews. The grounds are beautiful, the pools inviting, the beach clean. The beach does have boulders that define it, but they are easy to climb over and then we could walk along the water's edge. The common areas are relaxing, with cabanas, chaise lounges, comfortable couches. We had red level status, which does make a difference. Our room was spacious, very clean, had beautiful views of the ocean, and a comfortable bed. Red level guests also have access to a private pool and a happy hour lounge with good snacks. The red level lounge was closed when we arrived, and check-in took nearly 40 minutes, despite very few people in line. This pretty much defined the entire service experience at the resort ----- too few people to serve their guests. We ate at Nami, which was pretty good, especially the Nami roll. It was three times as expensive as sushi back home, but that's expected at a resort. The free breakfast is also good, with fruit, omlettes, pancakes, etc. We attempted a meal at Pasion, but we sat at a table for 40 minutes without drinks or an order being taken, so we just left. Our best meals were at the Loquillo Beach kiosks, so they are well worth the trip. As mentioned in other reviews, the room smelled musty and air conditioning units are very old. If you are sensitive to this because of allergies, you may want to consider another resort. Overall, this is a decent place to stay if you can afford the upgrade to red level. If you want a beautiful property and pools, Gran Melia delivers. If you want outstanding service, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience but do your homework”
Reviews.Author: Chris E
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort. Rooms are adequetly maintained and comfortable. They need some work on internet access and television reception. When I stay at an all inclusive, I expect a reasonalble defination of "all". Do your homework here. Drinks are free with your meals, but when you are not having a meal, they are quite expensive. I think vodka and tonics were $9 each plus tax. Bellman tips and maid tips are added to your bill. I didn't expect this and tipped the bellmen as services were rendered. I also was charged a maid tip for a day when my room was skipped. Food at the poolside restaurant was very slow. Allow plenty of time there. Restaurants filled up fast for dinners, so plan ahead. The best part was the sun. Got to relax several hours in the sun. Just what I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Incentive Trip”
Reviews.Author: Jules W
Reviews.Content: I am an event coordinator for my company and we just got back from a 5 day stay at this resort. We had 50 people in our group and everyone was very impressed with this resort! From my guests point of view the resort grounds were supurb! They were all talking about how beautiful everything was, even the bathrooms! The staff for the most part were very helpful to my guests. The ones that i am referring to are the wait-staff at the resort - NOT the managers. The managers were AMAZINGLY helpful. I have done many events, and it is only as good as the onsite hotel staff. Well, the managers at the Gran Melia have out done themselves! Extrememly friendly and helpful. Always smiling and being the first to say hi to me and all my guests. The only negatives about this resort is the fact that they only have 2 place to eat dinner. If you are stayin gthere for 4-5 days it can get pretty old fast! Their lunch options are limited as well. No snacks. It is also very far from downtown, but i knew that going into this trip. Overall this is a wonderful resort and i would love to bring my family here.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: MissJetNyc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon in December 2011. We were RedLevel guests and enjoyed the complimentary offerings. I give the hotel mostly a high rating for several reasons: - Cleanliness - Beautiful common areas and grounds - Good food - specifically the Asian fusion restaurant and the pool grill - Friendly staff On the other hand, there were other features about the hotel I didn't like as much. - I felt there was too much LCD screen advertising throughout the hotel lobby and grounds. Of course these were all featuring the hotel itself or it's other locations, but as someone who was vacationing I found it to be an eye sore. Also, I live and work near Times Square in NYC, so flashy advertisements while on vacation doesn't appeal to me very much. It took away from feeling fully relaxed in my opinion. - NO BEACH. I was VERY disappointed in the beach (or lack thereof). As others have posted, it is mostly rocky and very shallow in distance at many points. When we arrived for check-in, it was already very dark by the time we got to our ocean front room. Excited to see the beach the next morning, before breakfast we went down to explore it. We were SO disappointed! With the ocean on 3 quarters of the resort, is it too much to ask for a REAL beach?? If this is a must-have at your hotel choice, do not come to this hotel! -The hotel is pretty far away. We rented a car from the airport just for the needs of our itinerary. Little did we know, if you ever want to leave the Gran Melia, a car is a must! While it is close to the rain forest, we found it very far from the other points on the island we visited. Having a car, we tried not to let this bother us, but it's quite a drive even to the nearest highway. On late nights in other parts of the island, we found it cumbersome to make the drive back to Gran Melia. We made several visits to Old San Juan which averaged 40-45min. In the end, we enjoyed our stay and the hotel was very nice. I think however I would only return with my parents, not as just a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Solid resort”
Reviews.Author: FPiers
Reviews.Content: This is not an all inclusive in Jamaica or Cancun. Manage your expectations accordingly. If you are expecting an all inclusive you will be disappointed. Rent a car. The Concierge, Jesus, was extremely helpful and they had printed directions and maps to everywhere we wanted to go. You will be able to take trips to El Yunque, or the Bio Bay, or Old San Juan safely and at your leisure. Call the Bio Bay tours and make your own reservations. This is a solid resort with very nice amenities. We stayed for four nights. Service was on island time outside at the pool lunch area, but very responsive in the restaurants. The casino could've used an extra dealer - but I wasn't expecting Vegas. The pool was wonderful and I never had trouble finding a lounge chair on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “red glove service? - more like boxing glove service”
Reviews.Author: rich r
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived and faced a 50 minute wait in a line just to check in - we experienced horrible service. It was like the staff was unmanaged. After waiting 50 minutes to check in only to find out that our room was not ready at 5:30 in the evening - the front desk promised to call us when the room was ready. After eating dinner and checking back with the front desk at 7:30 - they told us the room was now ready - but no one had called us. The one place to eat breakfast the next day had a huge line so we had to each snacks at the gift shop. The restaurant service was horrible and included them bringing us our entres one at a time - but not bringing the side dishes until we complained. The concierage desk gave us phone numbers and told us to call if we wanted to arrange something. The pool service was non-existent and your couldn't walk up to order lunch or drinks unless you swam up to the bar in the pool. In order to get a volleyball for the pool (there was only one) they activities desk told us to go find someone wearing a red shirt - which apparently made them invisible because they were nowhere to be found. Our family has been all over the world and had never run into a more miss-labeled hotel. Do yourself a favor and stay away. Unless you like rooms that smell like mold - then this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Winter Getaway”
Reviews.Author: latinag67
Reviews.Content: We visit the Gran Melia every year for the past 3 years and enjoy it more and more each year. Enjoyed time in the sun on the beach and pool area. Resort is beautiful and relaxing. We enjoy stopping in the VIP Lounge staff is helpful and pleasant. Most of our stay we dine off the resort especially for breakfast because the Soleil Cafe is outrageously over priced. The bakery exiting resort serves great coffee and breakfast sandwiches. Richies Cafe is great for dinner. The Kioskos in Luquillo Beach are also great places to eat try " Markitos and Diegitos clean,bilingual,reasonable prices. We will be visiting again this year.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Linda S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Melia for our second anniversary & it was AMAZING!! beautiful grounds, lots to do! I couldnt have asked for a better staff or a better time! I would come back anytime! :)

Reviews.Title: “I'd Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: SpacePastry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Melia over New Year's. It was our second honeymoon. The resort is a very nice place to stay. Beautiful grounds, inviting pools, nice view of the ocean, and very friendly staff. We had the Red Level accommodations, which meant free breakfast and happy hour, both of which we enjoyed. We also enjoyed the Red Level pool and, by pure luck, got to spend the day in one of the cabanas. A couple of issues: The check-in process was unusually long. We waited about 2 hours before we got our room. We were told (after asking 3 times) that the delay was because they offered late check-out to the people in the room before us. I was also told the hotel had a full house. What hotel allows late check-out when all of the rooms are booked? Fortunately we were able to wait in the lounge and enjoy the free drinks. We were not too thrilled with leaving our luggage at the entrance, but in the end they were fine. Also, it seemed the resort was understaffed. It took 15-20 minutes to get drinks at the pool bar and the martini bar, and at breakfast on our last morning at the resort we were never offered water or coffee and we had to chase someone down to close out properly (breakfast was free but we did not want to just leave). When we did interact with the staff they were friendly and helpful, and they were working hard, but there wasn't enough of them. As others have said, there isn't much of a beach and there are lots of rocks, but that was the least of our concerns. We still strolled through the water and enjoyed it. Despite the issues we had a nice time at the Gran Melia. The bed was comfortable. There was a flat screen TV in the room, but we were not there to watch TV. The bathroom was a nice size. We enjoyed walking the grounds to and from the main building. We got to do some star gazing one night. We rented a car from Avis so we could do touristy stuff and travel to other parts of the country. I'd stay there again. A special shout out to Manny, the concierge. He was very helpful when we had questions about San Juan and how to get to and from the Bacardi Rum factory. He also gave us names of great local restaurants to go to.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort in paradise”
Reviews.Author: Skinmakeuppro
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Puerto Rico and I could not have been happier with our accommodations. We were there for a week and didn't want to leave. Everything from the arrival at the lobby (gorgeous and grand!) to the pleasant, helpful staff made our stay excellent. The drive from the airport on the first night of arrival was a little long, but after we got to know our way around, it was not an issue. (We live in Southern California, so driving 30 minutes is nothing.) Once you arrive at the resort grounds, the property is beautifully landscaped, lush and feels very private. The rooms were a very nice size and the beds were comfortable. I read many reviews prior to our trip, and the thing that most concerned me was the often mentioned odor of mildew. I did notice it in our room, but it wasn't bad enough for us to request a change. Plus, I would expect it in that kind of climate. There are ocean views from nearly every point of the resort. Unfortunately, you can not enjoy the beaches here, but there are plenty of others nearby to visit. The pools were decent, however the main pool could have used a cleaning. After about two days into our stay, I was pleased to find out that we were in a red-level service building (which would have been nice to know in the beginning, but was a nice surprice nontheless!) Free breakfast in the morning and free water bottles are a great perk since dining in Puerto Rico can be quite pricey. We loved seeing the iguanas roaming around the property! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Gran Melia”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer D
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia is a nice place to stay if you're looking for beautifully kept grounds, large rooms, and multiple pools. My boyfriend and I stayed there for 2 days/nights while traveling around Puerto Rico. We requested and were granted an upgrade to a red level room. While this required a longer check-in process at the red level lounge, we were offered champagne while we waited. Our limited experience with the staff was very pleasant. Everyone was polite and attentive. As noted by others, while there is really no beach to speak of, we did enjoy walking as far as we could along the rocky shoreline. My only "complaint" would be the taxi service you are forced to use to leave the resort. This service is contracted out to a vendor who quoted us one price for a ride to Luquillo beach but we were then charged a higher price by the driver. If you visit Rio Grande, you should definitely visit Luquillo Beach and the kiosks for lunch. We had a delicious lunch at #20 and then spent a great day at the beach. Not sure that I would return to Rio Grande but if I did, I would stay at the Gran Melia again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Tajani F
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia is a beautiful resort with two drawbacks. The beach is unusable, really. It is right off the reef which makes the beach grassy, rocky and filled with algae. The other is the pool. The pool is frigid. I was told by management that they are considering heating the pool, which would make the resort much more enjoyable. Other than those items, the service was impeccable. The restaurants were great and the breakfast buffet was plentiful. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “First timers but not the last”
Reviews.Author: 476kate
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Melia for six nights during the recent holidays and arrived with apprehension after reading all of the reviews. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will consider going back. The service is outstanding, especially the conceirge desk. Sign up for the red level service because there is no waiting at the check in or check out desk and you get the free breakfast and evening happy hour, which we enjoyed. We ate at three of the restaurants and they all served good food. The full breakfast had everything you could want from fruits, cereals, yogurt, to bacon, sausage and all sorts of eggs/omelettes. Prices for dinners in the restaurants were reasonable for a resort. Drinks are expensive throughout, but that was expected. This resort is about an hour from San Juan, so we rented a car because we wanted to see the island. We did day trips to the rain forest (20 minutes away), snorkeling out of Fajardo to Culebra (40 minutes) and bio bay trip (40 minutes--Kayak Puerto Rico). We also spent a day in Old San Juan (one hour). With day trips we were usually back to the resort by 4pm and enjoyed the last daylight on the beach and then hit the red level lounge. Grounds are beautiful and our red level room was outstanding. The open air lobby is great for drinks before and after dinner. We were 100 yards from the red level pool and 200 yards from the red level lounge/lobby. We enjoyed the walks to each location. Living in Chicago, it's pretty nice to walk on a beach to other destinations in the resort, especially this time of the year. Here are some detracting comments. If you want a beach to swim in, this is not the place. Friday night, until 1am, got loud with music from the lobby. Security is personable and helpful but we were stopped by one security officer for bringing food to our room. Finally, be prepared for "island time" when you get here because people move at a much slower pace than we are used to. As an aside, other reviewers suggested breakfast at Coco Sweet, which is down the street. Don't bother!! Terrible service.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: family k
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a trip to Puerto Rico. We decided to stay at the Gran Melia because it was rated well by Fodors. It advertised tennis and beaches as well as pool, spa etc. There were three unusable tennis courts (one was turned into a basketball court!) and the beach is not a usable beach. Grass and rocks lead you to the waters edge where you can pull up a chair and admire the ocean from afar. When it rained we wanted to use the hot tub and we were told that that would cost $30 per person! The grounds are nice but that's not enough to justify staying here. Small annoyance: when you check in you have to wait for someone to take you in a golf cart to your room. We had to wait (too long) until other guests were taken to their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Facility with Horrible Service, Showing It's Age”
Reviews.Author: Joseph W
Reviews.Content: This place is a sprawling resort with lots to do. However, the service was poor in several areas. The front desk was understaffed and disorganized. The staff seemed poorly trained and poorly equiped with the materials and information they needed. Every transaction took many steps and a trip to the back room. Expect LONG lines in the lobby and fighting among the among the guests front desk attention. The restaurants were expensive and overrun. The servers ran the range in quality from wonderful, to inefficient and inflexible, to downright rude. Lastly, the facility was failing. Ice machines didn't work, the golf carts required to get around the facility were noisy and smelly, the room was moldy smelling. I would not recommend nor would I return to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel not a nice beach”
Reviews.Author: ZapMol
Reviews.Content: Nice comfortable property with good restaurant, lush vegitation and decent service. We spent 4 nights in February and enjoyed it as the weather was superb. But don't count on a Carribean type beach - beach isn't sandy and there are seaweeds galore. Get mosquito spray in advance as well.

Reviews.Title: “Way overpriced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Alex L
Reviews.Content: Don't be expecting a luxury resort with top notch service, even if you think that's what you are paying for. Do NOT stay here unless you get a really great package. Unfortunately we booked a non-refundable stay therefore even though we checked out a day early we couldn't get the last night back (and of course why would they go out of their way to accomodate us). A friend and I went for New Year's...Where should I begin? First of all, there is not much near the resort at all unless you have a rental car. Taxi to the hotel was about $70 without tip each way and around 45 minutes from the airport. There are only a few restaurants at the hotel and you are pretty much at their mercy. Every time we went to dinner we were rudely asked if we had reservations (which we did not) or we showed up at a restaurant only for it to be closed...I'm pretty sure no one walks off the street to this isolated place so why can't they seem to accomodate their own hotel guests? After waiting for a while to be seated service still did not improve. While the food was ok, the service was so slow. I ordered a martini and I had to keep asking the waittress to bring it and when she finally did it was undrinkable (and I'm not too picky in that regard). I wasn't asked what was wrong with it nor would I like something else and the drink I took two sips of showed up on the bill for around $14. The casino is SOOO SMALL. We gambled there every night and one night when it was a tiny bit more crowded they only had three or four tables open even though they had more tables, we were told they didn't have any more staff. Wouldn't they want to make as much money as they can? Also, you have to keep asking for the complimentary drinks that are supposed to come when you gamble...also note that they only give you wine or beer. Overall the staff doesn't care if you are enjoying your stay or not. I called the front desk for a wine opener and still had not received one the next day. I called several more times and finally an hour or so later after I had already shoved the cork down into the bottle did the corkscrew come. There is hardly any beach...those of you looking for a beach destination go somewhere else. We drove up to Bahia Resort which is the St. Regis and it looked beautiful. I would recommend renting a car unless you want to pay a lot for cabs. Loquillo beach is nothing to write home about, the kiosks are interesting but we didn't even stay on the beach five minutes. The rainforest was something to do so we hiked to the waterfall.....big let down if you've ever been to Hawaii. Also, we had a junior suite and even though the room was spacious and had marble it had an old box tv and smelled of mildew. This is not a luxury hotel, not much to do, food is ok at best, isolated location, spend your money elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you know everything you are getting into...”
Reviews.Author: onthego619
Reviews.Content: I had mixed feeling about booking this resort. Some of the previous reviews were not all that clear so here is my attempt to help anyone else planning to stay here: 1.The property is beautiful! The rooms were big with a balcony for reading or taking in the sounds. The plants are nicely kept and the pool was amazing. 2.The resort is in a remote location so if you are planning not to eat there for 3 meals a day be prepared to drive 10-15 mins for food. Fortunately there is a great selection and the distance really isnâ€™t that big of a deal as long as you are aware of it. 3.We opted for the buffet breakfast and passed on lunch and dinner plans. Breakfast was generic, nothing special and the quality of food was a grade B at best. Nothing to rave about but good enough to get the day started. Since we did not lounge at the resort and ventured to El Yunque, Luquillo, and Fajardo, we knew we could grab food on the way back to the hotel. 4.Staff was all very friendly and helping. 5.There is a parking fee on top of a resort fee. We got a better deal calling the Resort directly versus any website! 6.The resort is located on a beach but we didnâ€™t go in for two reasons. The Spanish name is has references â€œto itchâ€� and the sands and rocks didnâ€™t make it all that appealing to jump in. The pool on the other hand called your name and made up for it and it was open 24hrs a day. 7.The gym is great filled with basic weights and lots of cardio options. They even do group yoga classes in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good Food...and that's it!”
Reviews.Author: Maria N
Reviews.Content: I was also at the Gran Melia Puerto Rico during the holidays and I have to agree with my fellow traveler. Although the grounds are nicely kept there are no activities for the guests to partake in. The RECEPTION SERVICE was HORRIBLE! The wait for check-in in the evening with only two guests on the line in front of me was 35 minutes. My bill was incorrect and I was charged twice when I changed my credit card at check-out. The overall service was JUST AS BAD. We had a meal plan that NO waiter or host was familiar with and we spent every meal proving what our meal plan was. The poolside bar/restaurant was disgusting with birds everywhere and the waiters running around barely getting anything done. They really need to service the guests and walk around the poolside taking drink orders rather than asking a guest to wait on a 15-20 minute line just for a drink of water. The New Years Day buffet was uneventful. The salads and cheeses were not on ice and where wilted and melting by the time we ate at 2pm. The room service took over 25 minutes to make the order since they did not know what our meal plan covered and we still got charged for it with a room service charge and the tip included without anyone explaining that to us...we tippoed twice for cold food. The meal took over 1hr 20 minutes to reach the room. Although one or two of the waiters were personable - none were at the status of what is expected in a Gran Melia resort. At every meal we either had to request an item a second or third time or did not receive it at all. "I'm sorry" was a very common phrase. It seems as if turn-around is an issue with the hotel and is noticeable with the lack of service. Housekeeping was a MESS!! Literally, they never brought back a floor mat and I called every evening for a wash cloth. They never swept the floor and the bungalow entryway was extremely dirty. There was a smoker in the building who left ashes and cigarette buds every night and only the buds were picked-up and the floors never cleaned to take away the ash. The bed end cover and the decorative pillows were stained and yet they continued to place them on the beds. The seating areas in the lobby were just as bad with stains and I REFUSED to sit on them. The parking fee did not bother me, as all hotels except for motels charge you a fee, but I was charged twice for the self-parking. As well as charged for drinks during meals that were covered by our meal plan. I SUGGEST all guests CHECK THEIR BILLS before check-out. I would NOT recommend this resort to anyone. SUGGESTION TO MANAGEMENT: spend more time walking the property and watching the employees interaction with the guests. It won't take long to figure out where adjustments need to be made.

Reviews.Title: “Service not hot”
Reviews.Author: Byron L
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days and nights during the Christmas holidays. Porters and valet people were great, but the front desk ignored me during checkin for 30 minutes and laughed at me when I complained. (I was the only one in the lobby at 3:30). The room smelled, had no safe, and the maids took away the shower mat after the first day. The hotel and beach are beautiful! Pool was cold but it looked great and was nice on a hot day. No activities for any ages. Options are to sit around on the free wifi in the public areas, or go to the beach, gamble, or play golf. Beach wasn't super, but it was beautiful. The Puerto Rican restaurant was wonderful, and the Italian one was really good too. The breakfast was ok. The poolside restaurant was horrible. It was way to expensive, and had only one decent item on the menu. They had no fruit on a tropica island, and when I ordered a Margarita pizza, they brought a cheese pizza that was cold and tasted like cardboard. Everything was overpriced, except the Puerto Rican restaurant, and they charge $16 a day for parking. Service sucked over all at the front desk and the restaurants. You would wait an hour for the food, and they wouldn't fill up your drinks while you waited. Also, the bed felt broken.

Reviews.Title: “A little good, but mostly eeeh”
Reviews.Author: happytrails247365
Reviews.Content: We just got back from an 8-day trip to the Gran Melia Resort. Let me say we will go back to Puerto Rico, but would not stay at this resort again. There are certainly some good elements of this resort (the red level benefits of a full breakfast every day, the free bali beds at the red level pool (must reserve them ahead of time though), fairly decent food at the restaurants (although very expensive), and just being in a warm climate gets a pro in my review. However, the buildings (and some rooms) have visible mold, the pull out sofa that our daughters slept on was horrible (and after seeing cots sitting in the hallway for days we didn't dare ask for one...we were afraid they would be covered in bugs). We also spoke to 2 people who had to switch rooms due to bed bugs (!!), the toilet in our room was running non-stop (even after it had been "serviced" by maintenance, the tv in our room barely worked (not that you are sitting around watching tv, but with kids it's nice to have a tv for some down time.) In addition, the location is far from San Juan so either plan on renting a car or be prepared to spend $$ on taxis. Also, there really isn't that much to do for kids, especially if you have tweens... Bottom line is we were not impressed with the resort. We are really not complainers so take this as some friendly advice. You may not have a horrible experience staying here, but if you are going to spend $$$ and your limited time on a family vacation, I would look around for a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “First Impressions”
Reviews.Author: PieroG
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Gran Melia with great expectations since I love this chain and their properties in Spain are excellent. Well it's 3:35pm and no room available yet and no timeline for it to be ready either. Check in is at 3pm. and it's an oceanfront suite Red Level. The property is ok, beach is passable, pool not impressed. Stayed at this property since wanted to be in a different resort from usual (in the Condado area), big mistake. Takes 45 minutes by car from the San Juan area, probably 1 hour from Old San Juan. First impressions are extremely important, so far they've made a very poor one.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location”
Reviews.Author: mihockeymom15
Reviews.Content: We visited here with my husband's company. The room was wonderful, the breakfast restaurant was great, and the food served at our events was great. The only thing that I would complain about would be that everyone in our group was charged for the whole minibar - even when we didn't even touch it! We all had to dispute our bills as we were checking out. It was very disorganized. We had the red level accommodations which is what I recommend. The other downfall was that it was quite a drive to get to San Juan - around an hour. I would have preferred to stay in town. I can't comment on the value since we didn't pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Mold in many rooms, no real beach waves, great lobby and hang out spots”
Reviews.Author: goniles
Reviews.Content: Our first room had lots of mold, when you walked in it smelled bad. During the night I coughed and coughed. We requested a room change and they accomodated the request. After they tried to spritz the room with fabreze and change the air conditioner filter(Not sure if this was ever completed) The second room was much better. The floors were really dirty, you would walk across them with you bare feet and they would turn them black. The lobby and grounds were very well maintained and beautiful. They seemed to have a very low standard of quality control. The staff was mostly very friendly and very slow. There was always a line for breakfast and the help staff moved very slow and apathetic. I'm happy I got the room on priceline or I would have been devastated paying regular rates.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: BlueDevilDiver
Reviews.Content: This is supposed to be a fancy resort, but our interactions with the staff were poor. Multiple staff were quite rude to us, even on their initial greeting of us. Not one person greeted us warmly or with a smile. The rooms are really far from the main hotel area. The rooms are nice, though. Just realize that you will be walking or waiting for a golf cart to pick you up. The pool area is nice, but there's no hot tub! What kind of resort doesn't have a hot tub?? The view is nice, but the beach is small and rocky and not good for swimming. The breakfast buffet is a nightmare. The food was terrible and the lines were out of control, and we were there in the off season when it wasn't very crowded. They just don't manage the flow of people very well. And again, the restaurant staff were very rude. Also, they have no functional Wi-Fi and no business center. We must have asked 5 or more hotel employees where the business center was so that we could check into our flight and they all pointed us in varied wrong directions. It turns out that the "business center" is 2 computers that are located in the convenience store. You get a wristband and are basically treated like cattle in a herd. There's no personalized attention and no friendliness. I can't recommend this unless you get a really good room rate. It does not stand up to the other nice resorts we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facility, wonderful people, great location...but...”
Reviews.Author: dittoheadadt
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 days, 2 nights. Here's my impressions: PROs 1. The people. Every person affiliated with the resort met me with a ready smile and a helping hand. And I mean EVERY. Fantastic, terrific people working at this resort, and really, working for you. 2. The facility. Beautiful, spacious, comfortable, swanky, private. From the lobby to the lounge areas to the pools to the beach, and everything in-between the facility is top-notch. 3. The bungalows. Attractive, comfortable, very upscale looking. Terrific showers, plush comfortable beds. What more could you ask for? IMHO, here's what: CONs 1. No complimentary wifi in the bungalows. C'mon already. I can get complimentary wifi at just about any McDonald's and Motel 6 on earth. But I can't get it at an upscale, world-class resort? Instead I have to pay $16+ per day for it? And there's not even wired Ethernet in the bungalows? Sorry, but no complimentary wifi and not even Ethernet is unacceptable in this day and age. 2. Self-parking is $16+/day. Really? C'mon, man. Do you really need this as a profit center? Yes, I know you can charge this, because we have no choice. But I'd prefer that you show a little more regard for your guests. 3. On-site prices are pretty extreme. Just because I can afford to pay $21 for a 'roni pizza or $16 for a tube of sunscreen doesn't mean I appreciate doing so. Again, show a bit more regard for your guests. Many airport vendors are now realizing the folly of gouging air travelers and have instituted "same as retail" pricing, as have many car rental companies. They, too, have captive audiences but they don't exploit them like they used to. It would be nice if this resort took the same approach. 4. Most people have iPods. This is because people's music tastes are varied. So then why do you blast music at your pools? When you this, everyone has to listen to whatever music you choose to play. Sometimes silence, or the ambient sounds of the world around, is nice. So don't think the entire world wants to listen to music 24/7. Walk around the pool and notice how many people have earbuds in their ears. That says something, if you're paying attention. 5. Ditto in the lobby/lounge areas. It's 6 days before Christmas and the music system is playing loud music (and not even Christmas music)...in the lounge areas! Again, we don't need to be bombarded and inundated with music or sounds during every waking hour. If we're in the lounge area we're probably reading, socializing, interacting with other people. Maybe soft background music would be ok, but loud pop music? Again, it's the lounge, not a nightclub. Treat it accordingly. 6. Not sure if this is the case in every bungalow, but ours had an old-fashioned picture-tube TV. Would be nice (though not essential, since we're not there to watch TV) to have more modern flat-screen TVs in the bungalows. 7. The tennis courts and basketball court are playable, but in need of some repairs. I realize the Cons are twice the number of the Pros, but that doesn't mean the resort was twice as negative as positive. Not at all. I will surely return, because the place and the people (especially the people!) are extraordinary. But I will put more advance thought and planning into my meal options, because the resort's prices are just not justifiable. And I will bring noise-canceling headphones.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Sarah R
Reviews.Content: We visited Gran Melia in November. It is a beautiful property. Rooms and pools were nice. We were a little miffed that we were not allowed to go in the pool closest to our building or buy drinks from the pool bar because it was only for upgraded members. Unfortunately no upgrades were available during our visit. The ocean is not crystal clear water but it's definitely swim worthy. This is more of a pool resort than a beach resort. We didn't see anyone swimming in the ocean during our stay. No jacuzzi on property that we know of in the pool area. Breakfast was buffet style and I would highly recommend getting a MAS reward card online prior to arriving at the property and bringing it with you to breakfast if you want a discount on it. No card, no discount. Some of the room packages come with breakfast. Mas reward card also gives discounts at the stores and other restaurants on the property so worth taking the time to get that. Plan to have a car or rent one with Avis (on property) This resort is out there and you do need a car to see the area - easily rented at about $40.00 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort with a friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: expedition17
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to PR and had no idea what to expect for accommodation. The staff was very welcoming and gladly agreed to an early check-in given that it was the thanksgiving day. The hotel property is a beautiful and has a decent casino on premises. We were looking for a place to relax after a long flight and it felt like we had found what we were looking for... As noted by some of the other reviewers, rooms do have a tint of mildew, but compared to other tropical destination that we have been to, this was comparably mild and nothing to complain about. Restaurants in the hotel are decently priced and serve some of the best food I had in PR. Koi fish feeding, wild Iguana's, and beautiful flowers were some of the highlights of our stay. I would say this is definitely great place to stay and relax near San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic trip!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa D
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my trip in Puerto Rico and it is beautiful. This hotel was clean and also beautifulllllll I did not want to leave, and I am definitely coming back. I also enjoyed the food and drinks as well. The staff is also very friendly!! It is far from the airport and if u don't rent a car traveling can be pricey back and forth.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY. Worst resort in PR”
Reviews.Author: unclebuck9
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last aug for our wedding anniversary. The night of our anniversary we decide to check out the casino. After 15minutes 4 armed banditos bust through the door heavily armed and demand everyone to the floor in spanish. We don't speak spanish so we had no idea what they were saying and it wasn't til I looked around til I realized to get down. There is zero security at this resort. There is no manager at this resort apparently. They never found the guys and they left the car at the front door. We decided to get the hell out of there 3 days early and stayed at the ritz in san juan. Much cleaner and they have heavily armed police patrolling the beach and front door at all times. We were assured a full refund. Of course we got nothing and everytime I called or emailed nobody responded. On top of this we had to change our room 3 times as soon as we arrived because of the moldy scent. The "royal service" that we upgraded to was a joke. Free beer from 5-8. An old computer that was down. A small pool with bird crap everywhere. And a bar that had no radio or food. Just overpriced $10 mojitos. If you go to puerto rico. Stay in san juan. Its much safer. This place was also robbed in sept 2011 for 85k. Obviously they have no regard for their guest. I spent 5k on this trip and it was a nightmare. You can't even swim in the ocean at the resort. Its all rocks

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: YumYum71
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a week with our infant. The room was very clean. I was not worried about the baby crawling all over the floor. I can also say that the restaurant staff was the most helpful of anywhere I have ever been. I have a food allergy. The staff could not have been more friendly or more accommodating! If you have a food allergy, I highly recommend this resort! I thought the room was beautiful and the grounds and pool area were great. The beach isn't anything special, but overall, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “incredible experience”
Reviews.Author: martinmatta
Reviews.Content: with sun or rain the employee make our stay special , we were in red level the check in fast and nice and angel our butler was profesional and helpfull all the time , also ely at the check out time was special.... very nice tratment and costumer service we were also at nani rest at the tepanyaki and the chef cathy was excellent ...the hotel has Join the Party with grupo Mania ufff incredible evenning we looking foward to return ... possible the 31December to recieve the new year with our family in the hotel also we fell save there ,,,,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent until the last day”
Reviews.Author: BarbieDahl_ATX
Reviews.Content: I was about to recommend this resort to all my friends who visit Puerto Rico until the last night when I started itching. I called room service to ask for a 6am wakeup call because we had an early flight. Not only did they forget to call us at 6am, they lied and said they did call us when we woke up an hour later and complained. If that wasnt bad enough, we were covered in red bumps, BED BUGS!! I am still itching and scratching as I type this review. The food was average but cost way above average prices, the service was not good and the valet parking was 50 dollars!! I was about to give this place an excellent review because the lobby and main swim area were beautiful, almost breath taking, the room was above average the view from the balcony, spectacular but BED BUGS!! Omigod, I am covered in little red bumps and I have called the hotel 3 times to complain to the manager and left a message, so far, no one has called me back. I cannot recommend this hotel!! Very disappointed and I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Phenomenal”
Reviews.Author: jonbellemore
Reviews.Content: This was the vacation upon which I base all vacations. It was a great trip. We went to Luquillo beach, ate with the locals, visited old san juan, shopped, hung out, had adventures. It was simply amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort , nice room good service..”
Reviews.Author: CynthiaCav
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. We did the whole red level thing , which is not just a lounge area near the reception, they give you free coffee and drinks but close at 9pm.. they have open bar for a couple of hours btw 5-8 pm, but it's just cheap wine nothing crazy and they give you free full breakfast which is really nice. The rooms are really nice, alway clean !! the pool is really huge and beautiful , we didn't use the beach area, it wasn't very inviting very little or no sand area..the raspberry mojito was delicious from the wet bar and food there is good too. but the restaurant food was not that good.. the service was good.. overall it was okay.. the location wasn't so bad , we rented a car because it's like a 30 minute drive to san juan , about 30 minutes to el Yunque , and 30 minutes to ceiba airport..

Reviews.Title: “Needs some updating.”
Reviews.Author: Turkey19
Reviews.Content: Second visit to Gran Melia. Great place due to location. Close to El Yunque, Luquillo, Farjado and San Juan. First time I stayed at the Red Level rooms and must say it's really not worth it now that I have stayed in a regular room. red Level gives you a small adults only pool, a bathtub on you patio and a free happy hour. You will want to spend most of your time at the main pool, it's big and nice! The room could use use a little upgrading, clean the sofas, fix the curtains and how about moving up to flat screen TVs? Service was great. If you visit here rent a car and make sure you stop by Coco Sweet for coffee, bread and lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service! Don't let bad reviews fool you!”
Reviews.Author: carobustillo
Reviews.Content: We were a little scared because of some bad reviews, but don't let them fool you. Stayed at Red Level. Worth the Upgrade! Private pool for grown ups! We went for our honeymoon and the hotel gave us a free Upgrade to a oceanfront room. Servive was great! Very Friendly and helpful. Our butler was called Angel and helped us find everything we needed. The red level staff also helped us with all the questions that we had (specially Pedro). We were sorry to bother them with all the questions but was very friendly to answer. The pool bar staff wasn't as friendly, but treated us well. :) The hotel has activities during the whole week. We did Salsa lessons and star gazing (saw the moon up close and the planents!). We also saw Yoga and Zumba lessons. The breakfast is amazing (be sure to have the MAS Card it gets you 50% off). Ate at the Asian restaurant, SUSHI was very good and the Tepanyaki tables looked very good and a fun time! Passion Restaurant was AMAZING! Fresh fish and great taste. We were told the hotel was full because of a wedding and a convention, but didn't notice it, the hotel is very big and has a lot of open spaces so you don't feel it crowded. Loved it!!! Cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Suprised”
Reviews.Author: TheMacks11
Reviews.Content: I was terrified that this resort was going to be horrible based on the reviews here on Trip Advisor. But, the hotel was very nice. The hotel concierge was very helpful in getting us to our excursions and activites. The room did smell moldy, however the whole place was always wet the whole time we were there. I immagine that smell might be impossible to avoid. Our towels did smell funny on the day we arrived but then the next day they refreshed them and they were fine. The food is most certainly over priced, but there are restaraunt options which are 15-20 min away. The pool was amazing, huge and clean. The beach was decent. Many people complained about how horrible it was but i enjoyed it. Tons of shells and a few places of sand, I thought it was pretty. The whole resort is so big that there was plenty of room to relax away from the brats at the pool with plenty of areas that were private. The bar is incredibly over priced and a little dirty for my taste....Over all I really liked my stay, the grounds are pertty and well maintained. The staff was very helpful and came to my room to replace a light bulb with in the 10 min I called to complain about it. Not sure why this place has so many terrible reviews. My stay was rather enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel experience ever! Dishonest Advertising!”
Reviews.Author: G0lfplayer
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a refined and luxurious hotel, I hardly recommend DO NOT GO TO GRAN MELIA PUERTO RICO! Their advertising is more than dishonest! The service can be classified as a 3 stars hotel, at most. Waiting line and undressed tables at the breakfast lounge; tennis courts are unplayable; rooms with musty smell; noisy air conditioning; no mini-bar service; few restaurant options; sauna closes at 6 PM.. Even the maintenance of the golf course is below the expectations; the golf bar is poor, dirty restroom, totally incompatible with an International Golf Course. Red Level, is just a lounge near to the reception - that closes at 9 PM-, with complimentary coffee, fruits,â€¦ two old computers. The only worthy thing is the exclusive swimming pool. It seems the staff has no standards to follow and there is no general manager.

Reviews.Title: “The refinement and luxury is a lie!”
Reviews.Author: Ana S
Reviews.Content: The rooms have musty smell. Noisy air conditioner. Dirty stairs. Nothing inside the frigobar. No opened restaraurant for lunch. Waiting lines for the breakfast and no towels over the tables. Swimming pool bar with loud music, dirty tables and birds. The SPA closes at 6 PM. Tennis courts are in horrible conditions. No wireless internet in the rooms. When we asked for the cable for the paid internet it took 45 minutes until somebody showed up. Golf bar: Nothing to eat. Dirty restroom. Although some of the employees are nice, clearly, they are not very well treined, they have no standards and a very bad manager. No sign of refinement and luxury!

Reviews.Title: “"Horriable"”
Reviews.Author: ladypearl776
Reviews.Content: im gonna make this short and sweet i stayed at this resort with my two other girlfriends from 11/25/11 to 11/29/11 and it was terrible service ,swampy beach old moldy rooms and killer bedbugs the tours are rip offs need i say more this resort offers nothing this is a warning>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>TRAVEL THERE AT YOUR OWN RISK!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: aspen89
Reviews.Content: You can get rooms here for way less than other resorts in the area. Our junior suite was large, a nice balcony, beautiful bathroom, very comfortable bed. Request the second floor unless you don't like stairs. I was happy to find a coffee pot - I really don't expect a fancy resort to have microwaves or refrigerators. Food is very pricey in the restuarants. Sign up for the free MAS loyalty program and get breakfast at 50% off, making the buffet $11. Reasonable coffee and pastries can be found in the general store. If you have a car, good food can be found nearby at good prices (Martin's BBQ, right at the entrance to the main road, has great chicken and typical Puerto Rican food). Parking is $16/day - standard for nice hotels. Free internet in the pool/lobby areas, hefty charge for wifi in your room. I would expect an LCD TV at this price level. Staff were very friendly and helpful, though check-in was slow and we had to wait til 4 PM for our room. I had to go get my wife to sign their check-in form - not used to having to do that. There is a hospitality room where you can change to go use the pool while you wait for your room. Pool area is beautiful with lots of shady options if you want to avoid the sun. There's a daily exercise time in the pool at noon. Don't plan on going in the ocean, though the views are beautiful. Be aware this is near the Yunque rain forest, so it's in an area of Puerto Rico that tends to get a lot of rain. The walkways were not engineered for drainage, so they can easily flood after a heavy rain. If you don't want to walk, get a hotel where everything is in one building. We enjoyed the walks, and agree with other reviewers that the frequent carts, which they've provided to address complaints about long walks, can become annoying. A large outlet shopping center is located a couple miles up the road. The beautiful Luquillo public beach is nearby, and Fajardo, with many options for boat trips, is close.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort especially when you get great rates!”
Reviews.Author: PinkyB69
Reviews.Content: My gal friend and I stayed at the Gran Melia Golf Resort and it was like paradise in Puerto Rico! The grounds are plush and the resort has several restaurants. Do the sales pitch timeshare tour and get a few extra dollars to spend at the resort. I recommend you rent a car and get away from the resort for a few meals and save a lot of money. There's a private beach and several pools. The bar pool is perfect. We had a great time! When you check in they will ask you for a hotel for incidentals be careful they charge your room for everything. If you can rent a car you should.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissatified with accommodations”
Reviews.Author: BlufftonJojo1952
Reviews.Content: We went to Gran Melia and the first room we were given on the first floor smell like mood really bad. We complaint and were moved to another first floor room which still smell like mood. Again we were moved to another room on the second floor which the mood was not as strong but still smell. The reception area is very nice but if you are planing on staying there make sure you do not get a first floor room. Also, there is no refrig or microwave in the room. There were not wash cloth in the bathroom. All AC vent in the rooms we were in look like it was full of mood. They need to keep these a little bit cleaner. Food at the Gran Melia is expensive so if you want to save some money rent a car at the airport and go out for breakfast, lunch and Dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: coconuttraveler180
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Living Social deal and was worried after reading the reviews that I would regret it. Our room was very clean and quite large. The outdoor tub needed to be wiped out upon arrival but the sent someone immediately to take care of it. The Red Level service is certainly worth the upgrade. Private check in with cocktails on arrival was a great way to start the vactaion. The grounds were clean and beautiful. No moldy smells. The walk was not long. Some rooms were a little further down but there were always carts driving by to give people a ride. The Red level pool with the Bali beds included was very nice. Our butler, Angel, was very attentive and went out of his way to provide good service. THe pool was immaculate and clean as was the larger pool. The bartender at the Wet poolside grill, Ralfi, made great drinks and kept up with all the customers. We enjoyed the Passion Restaurant the most. The portions were tremendous and tasty. I got the Red Snapper stuffed with conch and my son had the 22 oz Cowboy steak. Both great. The ceviche was delicious as an appetizer as well. The sushi and and italian restaurants were both good too. Typical pricing, nothing to exorbantent. The beach is big and does have rocks but there is plently of privacy and chairs to make yourself comfortable. If you believe the negative reviews you will be missing out. The Red level did enhance our expereince as there is a happy hour each night, continental breakfast (we didn't use this as the restaurant buffet was included with our package- that was good too, great coffee). Any requests we had were attended to immediately and followed up with a letter to the room and phone call confirming our needs had been met. Thanks Angel & Ralfi for a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for a wedding.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler273408
Reviews.Content: We went for a wedding and it was great to have so many guests stay at the resort together. The place is beautiful and the breakfast buffet very nice. The food is very expensive and since it costs so much for transportation to other sites we spent most of the time at the resort. The rooms were comfortable and the service was good. All of the staff speaks English and were helpful. It is very hot there, even in November, so an air conditioned room is recommended for a wedding reception. No one goes in the water at the beach and it is very rocky but the pool was large and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “"Loved the Gran Melia can't wait to go back" 11/10-11/13...”
Reviews.Author: gloria c
Reviews.Content: I just don't get the bad negative reviews from travelers if I were to listen to them I would have missed out on this gorgeous resort and their warm staff that don't know next what to do to make your stay more pleasurable....where should I start from the moment you arrive its breathtaking and we were greeted with a smile the red level is the way to go you are truly treated like royalty the food is so good at Pasion its "puerto rican food" and the other nights we ate off the property at Richie's and Hacienda Calebarbra and both were delish...the room was so beautiful and comfortable with matching robes and slippers, the spa was top notch and the adult pool for red level was so relaxing especially laying on the bali beds that was the icing on the cake. The only I mean only downfall of this property is the beach its very rocky and not swimmable if you don't mind just staying by the pools then you will fall in love with this place like we did...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: wut5880
Reviews.Content: With hesitation, I booked Gran Melia after reading about it on Trip Advisor. I was initially concerned about the "moldy smell," "long walks" or other complaints others stated. I was pleasantly surprised. We booked the ocean front room, red level -- well worth it. Check in was fast and easy with welcome drinks. The room was immaculate. The breakfast (included in the red level rooms) was outstanding. Every night, we took advantage of the 6p-9p complementary happy hour. Aside from my note below, it was fantastic. I would highly recommend it. Note: we had the noodles with black bean sauce at Nami and it was the worst bowl of noodles in my adult life.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not grand!”
Reviews.Author: GaryS007
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 day trip to the Gran Melia Resort. We went there for a family wedding. The wedding was great and the wedding took place in a beautiful setting. The resort is extremely large and some of the rooms were very far away from the pool and restaurants. They have golf carts ferrying people back and forth to get from place to place and we found this to be quite distracting. You actually had to be careful at night to not get run over! The pool was the best thing about the resort. It was very large with a nice swim up bar and lounge chairs built into the pool. They had a volley ball net set up with free ball rental and table tennis and billiard tables near the pool. You could also get an air brush tattoo there on the weekend. We only ate breakfast there so I cannot comment about lunch or dinner, but we all found breakfast to be quite forgettable. Breakfast is a buffet and wasn't particularly good. Most of the hot food was not hot and was picked at. The omelet stations were pretty good but whenever we seemed to be there, the lines were quite long. We actually did have lunch one day at the outdoor restaurant by the pool and the food and service was very good. The rooms were ok, but somewhat dated. Two of the nights we were there, the cleaning lady forgot to give us towels and we had to call to the front desk. Both times after we called, we got the towels almost immediately. The floors were never cleaned out entire stay. The beach was unimpressive and we really never went there after exploring it the first day. Overall, we had a great time, but I think that had more to do with the company we were with, we probably would have had fun anywhere. The place wasn't very expensive, so for the value minded, it might be ok, but I will not be going back to this resort. For me a smaller resort with a much better beach would be a requirement.

Reviews.Title: “It was an excelente experience for my family.”
Reviews.Author: Tosado
Reviews.Content: Everything was right since reservation with Isabel until the front desk with Felix. Soothe staff was great and the hotel was a dream. Thanks to all of them.

Reviews.Title: “Okay if you are there for a convention, otherwise NO NO NO”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerTara
Reviews.Content: Thanks for reading my review. As a 2nd time traveler to PR, this was a Huge disappointment. There is nothing authentic about this hotel. It is 45 minutes from the airport. This could sound great if you end up in some super local spot, but you don't. You just end up a bit too far to really experience the island. Be prepared to feel very locked into the resort and their costs. Going out of the resort area is a task and bc you are in a remote location which is super expensive thus uber American sterotype, the locals in the area (rio grande) do not really care for you. On a good note, you are not too far from a couple of really cool island hops...Culebra Island and Vieques Island. There is nothing to see beyond San Juan west of the island. So, Old San Juan and East (island mentioned) are great routes. For a true love for the island, travel to Ponce....beautiful. This is south and east. As for the Gran Melia itself, I have stayed at a few Melia resorts and they have been quite lovely, this one is not. You are on a golf resort, so prepare to ride a cart to get to anything associated with the hotel and prepare to tip, tip tip and tip again. Drinks are $13. Small bottle sanpellagrino = $7.50. You are very locked to this resort. Have a car...that is $25 per day for parking btw. The rooms were clean and nice....not special or local feeling just clean. You could compare it to a Hilton stateside. Other things to keep in mind: $20 gym fee per day, $35 if you lose towel or room card, ice is a bit of a walk to get to, refrigerators are not allowed for personal use and you will be charged if anything is touched, you will be given a tour of the area via golf cart when you are there...have cash ready, magazines at gift shop are double priced and are several months old, bottled water (tap) $4, no bringing groceries in - you will be stopped by security and the will confiscate so keep it on the DL if you must. To summarize on the Gran Melia, I would never ever pay for this. If you must stay there due to a company paid trip, than great...it is a company trip so blah blah. Otherwise, you will feel like you are on a golf resort hotel anywhere US and once you leave you will not feel welcome just out of the gates. Oh and internet is $5 for every two minutes. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “The Best 5 Days of Gran Melia-Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Carlos2998
Reviews.Content: I traveled from 11/10-11/15.....arrived on a Thursday.....check in was a breeze. But there was a lil snag...depending on how days you decide on spending there....they need a valid credit card...not a debit card...a credit card that they will "hold" $100 a day on that card til you check out....Meaning...I stayed 5 days...so they needed a credit card so that they will put a hold of $500 on it....as your days pass by....and depending how much you have purchased at poolside (drinks, wings, appitizers), breakfast (23.95 pp), parking fees etc.....luckily I had a credit card. After that was taken care of...they assigned a room to you and give you 2 "Towel Cards". The "Bag-Men" get your bag and summon a "Golf-Cart" to take you to your room. The "Golf-Carts" are always around, there is about 3 to 4 carts always driving around the property to pick up guests and take them where ever you need to go-FREE!!.....Parking is an issue on friday and saturdays...mainly cause of the casino and/or convention events. Breakfast runs from 7am to 11am @ 23.95 pp......fruits, fresh squeezed juice, pastries, custom made omelettes, etc....When you check in they give you like $30 bucks in gambling money....but dont get too happy.....they come in $5 dollar increments....which...when you place a bet of $5 bucks..you have to match the bet with real money, $5 bucks. The rear lobby area has indoor Bungalows to lay and relax, they are all over so you be without one...they have lounge chairs.....beware...cause if you lay on one of these you will fall asleep... between the music that was pumping and the lounge seats....it is soooo relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC VACATION IN A GORGEOUS ELEGANT RESORT PROPERTY”
Reviews.Author: floridaspaceghost
Reviews.Content: We just came back from visiting the Gran Melia Golf Resort in Puerto Rico (We Do Not Play Golf) The Resort is like a Grand Palace. We felt like we were part of a Royal Family in Paradise. It is our reccomendation that you rent a car. It is the best way to explore the island and truly see some wonderful sights. Dont miss fishing for Wahoo, Mahi-Mahi, Snapper and Grouper. Take the time to visit the Puerto Rican Carribean Islands of Culebra & Veakes, (a short distance by fast speed Catamaran) Scuba or Snorkel on the most beautiful beaches in the world. The Rain Forest is a quick drive and well worth the time to view some awe inspiring waterfalls. At the Gran Melia there are several very fine gourmet quality restaurants. The Nama serves excellent teppan style japaneese cuisine and also specializes in a wide variety of tasty exotic sushi rolls. Passiones restaurant served great typical Puerto Rican Style food with a Fine Gourmet Twist. Tempos Italian restaurant, features a great menu serving up great Italian dishes. Freshly made pizzas are available at the poolside bar as well as available to be delivered to your room. Great Pizzas Luigi. Coco Locos served at the swim up bar can put you in a very pleasant relaxing mood. All of the normally expected fast food can also be ordered poolside such as hamburgers, sandwiches (many types) and great seafood dishes served with rice also available. The girls working the breakfast area Jeanette & Milagros were very friendly and helpful (when you take the time to talk with them and allow them to understand thet they are not disturbing you.) Jeanette went way out of her way to help us with many of our inquiries and special requests. There was a tall sweet waitress working pregnant who worked the register at the breakfast place as well as evenings at tempos who went above and beyond to make our stay there very memorable.The female Bar Tender at the Lobby Round bar had a terrific personality and was a beautiful person both physically as well as spiritually. Steven our waiter at the passiones was delightful, well informed and attentive. Andres at the lobby to the Tampo and Nami restaurant was an incredible asset to this place. He made both my wife and myself feel so special and welcome. This was truly a great place to visit. I enjoyed a nice Romantic retreat and Plan on returning real soon.

Reviews.Title: “Slow service and not very helpful”
Reviews.Author: mfcuan
Reviews.Content: We stayed Aug 2011 and we were not very impressed with the service. The issues began prior to our arrival when I had called the resort to find out about the car rentals and where it might be best to rent a car, my car was transferred five times between the front desk and the car rental desk and no one could answer my questions. when we did get there everyone was a little too lax in service, and highly unorganized. The property is beautiful but i would not recommend it. The food is also mediocre. We did better by going off the resort for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Yaritzi C
Reviews.Content: The resort was absolutely gorgeous. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. if we had any concerns or questions, they were open to help no matter what. Our trip was unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Loud and terrible.”
Reviews.Author: duran1513
Reviews.Content: I would never stay there again . The service was horrible. The pool areas were okay except for the very very loud music. Rooms are old and need upgrade. Not worth the 200 plus bucks we paid.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hotel in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Carlos M
Reviews.Content: Excellent nightlife in the hotel with all kind of music for everyone and very good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: Susan R
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent experience at this resort. I've been to Puerto Rico several times, and this is my favorite resort. The staff was beyond terrific - to be able to walk around the property and have staff greet you by name, is wonderful. The resort is just beautiful, and while I wouldn't swim off the beach, the view from my Red Level Room was phenomenal.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Tqalexander
Reviews.Content: Everyone was pleasant. Grounds was emmaculate. Pools well maintained. Food was delicious. Location was amazing

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel”
Reviews.Author: irisdcolon
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of hotels in Puerto Rico, but this one has a high rating with me. Friendly staff, cleanliness all around, a great pool, good food are things that make this hotel one of my favorities. Will be going back there soon. Great price with a delicious breakfast buffet included.

Reviews.Title: “Just a Shame, The Beach is Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: BRK2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Oct 2010 so late in writing this review. We didn't have a good experience at all. Stayed in a vacation club apartment. They gave us a room with two beds, and we requested a room with a queen sized bed, and were told "no". This started us off on the wrong foot to say the least. There was a terrible moldy smell, and upon closer examination we found mold on the cloth furniture in the room. So we constantly had the glass doors open. The room was not as clean as I would have liked. It's really a shame since the beach is gorgeous. The drinks were decent and the bartenders were nice which helped us endure the stay. We will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “This is why I booked it which is why im writing a review”
Reviews.Author: kelsie p
Reviews.Content: I booked the Gran Melia for our honeymoon based on the ratings that had been given in the past..... Boy were we wrong. Upon arrival they told us they were needing a credit card for incidentials ... she said she would charge 100.00 we agreed Then she came back with a receipt for 400.00 dollars... just a little different and her responsewas oh i meant to tell you it was 100 a day for our duration... anyway The service was mediocre the staff seemed more interested in their cell phones and tecting then helping customers. We spent 600 in the casino and never were offered to have anything comped.... the rooms were pretty but not well maintained.... we were extremly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Rio Grande Gran Melia”
Reviews.Author: CJ-Mass
Reviews.Content: Ended up at the Gran Melia on a Priceline bid. The grounds and facilities were very nice. I had read a number of review stating that the staff was rude. From my experience this could not be further from the truth. I found them to be extremely friendly and accomadating. We ate at 4 of the restaraunts including the bar need the pool. The food at the bar was ok but the food at the other 3 was very good. Expensive and small portions but very good. No one in my group played golf but the course looked great. The pools were very nice and always clean. If you're looking for a great beach at the door step this is not the place. Luquillo Beach is about a 10 minute drive and is supposed to be very nice. Rt 3 is the main highway and had plenty of shopping plazas and places to eat. Some other folks in our group stayed at El Conquistador in Fajardo. They had a beautiful view but the Gran Melia definitely has a nicer facility. What I did like about the El Conquistador was the location. If you're not looking to spend a lot of time in San Juan and plan to spend more time on the beach or fishing, this is a better location. A $5 ferry ride gets you to Culebra which has powder sand beaches and excellent snorkelling. El Conquistador also has a private island called Palimino which is very nice and they have a free ferry for their guests. It is also close to several marinas which is something that I like since I will always fish multiple days on vacation. We fished with Captain Marcos Hanke. You can check him out at www.787fishing.com. I've chartered fishing boats up and down the East coast, Mexico, Alaska, Hawaii, and the Carribean and Captain Marcos is right up there with the best I have found over the last 20 years.

Reviews.Title: “Shameful!”
Reviews.Author: Jheq
Reviews.Content: Gave the resort a second chance sorry to say on our part. It was a bad choice once more. Mold yes. Terrible Japanese tepanyaki restaurant in my life.

Reviews.Title: “Golf Resort mostly”
Reviews.Author: Tropicalsunset96
Reviews.Content: OK, I gotta admit the I knew there was no real beach at this resort but with Liqullo Beach 10 minutes away, I was ok going here. It says Golf Resort, not beach resort.
