They have placed sand so you can sun bath but this is not a swimming beach. Next, the grounds and pool are first class. The pool is great with swim up bar with ocean view. Rooms are very large with lots of marble. I enjoyed the rooms and I am well traveled throughout the Caribbean and Mexico. Food was very very expensive and not that good but as a "seasoned" traveler, I know the resorts are high priced and its better to go off property got autherntic more reasonable meals. This is a solid 4 star resort and possibly better if your a big golfer. The Trump international golf club in right next door. Go for the resort, golfing and its close location to the rain forest and Liqullo beach. Don't go expecting a Beach Resort, this is not it.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: sheila t
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for one night in one of the suites with their red level service. Woke up itching the next morning but did not think anything of it - never expecting to have been attacked by bed bugs. The bites became increasingly red and unbearably itchy after I had already checked out. Contacted the hotel to inform them and they sent a standard "sorry" letter. Now, I have to deal with ugly scars. And for a red level service - definitely, not worth it! Service was so poor, drinks horrible, food tolerable - simply put, not a place I would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Obed R
Reviews.Content: Its a nice place to stay with many security the 24hrs. Has nice pools close to many nice places. In general I would highly recommend this place for a good stay and hideout.

Reviews.Title: “False advertising, disgusting food, a joke!”
Reviews.Author: dba80
Reviews.Content: I am SO surprised that this property has not changed hands into a reputable hotel/resort company that can accommodate actual guests. Beautiful grounds, accompanied by disgusting food in all the restaurants with bad service provided by rude employees! I was trapped here for 1 week!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok , no Americans”
Reviews.Author: moononk
Reviews.Content: Me and the wife went for 4 days at the end of Sept 2011. The hotel was ok, room and pool. Don't expect any Americans, they must have a PR resident special. We only meet 2 other American couples. My overall problems with this resort: 1. Outside coolers were not allowed (security was waiting at the parking lot) 2. Overpriced drinks (8.00 per beer) 3. Overpriced food 4. Half of the slots were broken. 5. No fridge in room 6. 17% gratuity included in everything (seems high for the level of service we received 7. No internet (is it 1970?) 8. Shuttles from room to pool were almost non-existant On a positive note, the pool was awesome... Spend the extra 20.00 per night for the El Conquisidor

Reviews.Title: “It's not bad...but it lacks essential services.”
Reviews.Author: noblehalogen
Reviews.Content: The grounds and the place of the Gran MeliÃ¡ are beautiful. The atmosphere and the pools are great too, but the place lacks essential things. For the price that we payed we could have expected(at least) continental breakfast. If we wanted to have breakfast at the hotel we needed to pay $25 for the buffet. The hotel doesn't let you bring food from the surroundings so we needed to smuggle it one of the days we stayed there. We didn't had any problem with the housekeeping, and one of the housekeepers helped us when we were having problems with the hotel keys. Not every employee was that nice and there was a concierge (white with green eyes...I don't remember the name) which was kind of rude. Also, the parking fee is $16.50 the night (add that to the price of the rooms too) except if you rent a car from AVIS. We enjoyed the stay but it could have been much better.

Reviews.Title: “Living Social pkg makes great value”
Reviews.Author: BABetty
Reviews.Content: Pkg red level oceanfront junior suite (picture online was accurate); a Swedish massage (very professional pretty facility); a free dinner; food (resort prices, good food & presentation); staff (helpful & polite, quick to fix problems); beautiful lobby/bar/grounds; beach and water (very few waves, muddy green water, rocky sand);large iguanas wandering around (saw one get into pool & poo:(ewwww!!!); took ATV excursion to rainforest, went to fort & old san Juan, had a day to relax; great for a long weekend with a group of couples. Wouldn't stay long.take some Lysol if room smells moldy--it's a humid climate

Reviews.Title: “Save your money and go to the St. Regis!”
Reviews.Author: Lyndsey124
Reviews.Content: We were very excited for this trip, and even more excited when we were upgraded for our anniversary to an oceanfront Red Level suite. We thought that it would make the perfect weekend getaway. We were wrong! We did not receive house keeping service any day of our stay. Every night, we had to call and ask for house keeping to come, certainly not what we expect from a hotel of this caliber. Additionally, the service in general throughout the hotel was abysmal. We attempted to speak to the concierge at several points about tours, and she was the least knowledgeable and the most rude concierge that we have ever dealt with. The breakfast service and room service were so poor and the food quality so lacking that we opted to eat away from the resort for all other meals. The pool staff and "butler" never even asked if we might like a drink, and the supposedly "adults only" Red Level pool had an infant and several children in it. I don't expect to see children in dirty diapers in an "adults only" pool, and it disgusted me to the point where I did not even want to swim, which is unfortunate, as the "beach" was non-existent at the property and you could not swim in the water (not that you would want to- it was brown!). Even attempting to leave the property was difficult, as golf carts never came when requested and were impossible to find. We travel throughout the world, but I can guarantee the Gran Melia Puerto Rico will not be on our list of places to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Emazinggggg!!!”
Reviews.Author: Denvik
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the resort! We loved it! we stayed at royal suite and had an excellent service! Overall we fall in love with the resort! The only one little thing is a night life! May be it changed now bc we were there Jan 2010. We spent 3 hours in royal private lounge drinking shsmpagne and talking to other guest, and then we went to casino! Unfortunately, if the resort had more entertainment program, that would be great!!! Anyway, the resort and grounds are beautiful!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: Emily S
Reviews.Content: I've been here already with my family twice & can't wait to come again! The staff was friendly and the villas are very comfortable & spacious! I highly recommend for a trip of relaxation, not for fun. There's not much to do besides thegolf, pool, casino & 2 restaurants inside the hotel. The tours are overly priced, and the location is not the best for entertainment. Overall great hotel though, thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend .....”
Reviews.Author: wendymuriel
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 days here and we had the best time. We have traveled worldwide and this was definitely one of the best places. We had a junior suite with an ocean view which was like being in paradise. Our suite was lovely.......clean and very comfortable. Bed was comfortable our our pillows were soft......absolutely no complaints. We thought our coffee pot was not working (operator error!) called and they were there within less than 5 minutes. The staff were constantly checking to see if we needed more towels or any other sevice. The golf carts ran constantly and the entire staff could not have been nicer and more friendly. It is a walk to the main building but in beautiful surroundings and not very far.......we preferred to walk as had all the time in the world and admired the gardens. The Pasion restaurant was awesome --- great service and great food. All in all, the staff could not have been nicer or more attentive and nothing was too much trouble for them. We highly recommend the Gran Melia. It is close the El Yunge rain forest and also great snorkelling etc.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: MagdalenaSolorzano
Reviews.Content: I've been to a few resorts and this one truly impressed me. So classy, clean and elegant. The service is amazing the moment you step in the premises. I love travelling and try to do it at least twice a year. This is a place to return to if we ever go back to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it but...”
Reviews.Author: jonfhills
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of Sol Melia's hotels. But I felt it wasnt as nice as their resorts in Punta Cana or Mexico. I went during a lower peak season. While the hotel was reasonably staffed. I always felt I was being rushed out at the end of the evening and service was slow. I also found their payment system a bit annoying, but they do give you a little discount if you have a Melia Rewards card. The casino was small, but they had all the basic games to play. The breakfast was good. The dinner was average. I found much better places to eat nearby for better values The pool and facilities were incredible. The beach water was nice. but it was quite rocky. However, Luquio beach is like 15 mins away. So that more than made up for our beach needs I liked it, I wish it were closer to some nightlife. I would probably go again if a nice deal popped up.

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay in the Grand Melia before our Cruise”
Reviews.Author: Daveandjane8
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic resort if you dont mind travelling a bit outside San Juan. Paradise comes to mind when we looked around it and the staff were pretty friendly. Food was plentiful but very expensive to eat in resort. ( ask the concierge to recommend some local resturants ). We were advised to hire a car with a sat nav and it was well advised. It takes a long time to travel short distances due to number of traffic lights, cars on the road and the poor condition of the roads. Beware though, the resort will charge you $15 per day to park in the hotel and it can be difficult to even get parking. Old San Juan was worth a visst and the FREE Bacardi factory tour.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beatiful place”
Reviews.Author: Guayaba33
Reviews.Content: Big luxurious rooms. Good Service. Nice Atmosphere. The only thing is that it is a hotel made of different bungalow, so if you don't like walking, ask for a room close to the pool. Otherwise any where is fine.(there are golf cars that take you around the property. Don't forget the YHI Spa.

Reviews.Title: “Worst honey moon ever!!”
Reviews.Author: WHATSERIOUSLY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the gran melia for 10 days!!!! 10 days and thousands of dollars later we left this resort thoroughly pissed off and disappointed! First off, they only had one person at the customer service desk! We waited forever to be checked in and when we recieved our room key we were told that they were unable to give us the honeymoon suite we requested but it was their mistake but they would be glad to put us in another ocean view room for an extra $150 a day! Of course we refused after all it was an error on their part not ours. So we were given a regular room with a garden view. As soon as we walked into our room I thought, oh how Beautiful it was! Until i went to the restroom. Their was hair all over the floor around the toilet and no soap just shampoo! So my husband tried to call the front desk to complain and request ammenities But of course with only one staff member at customer service no one answered the phone. We ended up walking back to the front desk and waited 20mins on line to complain! We had no amenities for atleast a week! And an uncleaned room for 5 days as we were told that due to lay offs they were short staffed and that the suites on the ocean side were top priority! What the hell!! To top it all off they had no parking spaces available for paying guest! We had to park 10mins away in the condo area and had to walk back to the hotel in 100 degree weather and hope that someone will escort us back to our bungalow! Unfortunately we had to walk from there too. The power went out atleast 4 days we were there long before the hurricane and we were told abt the hurricane after it already arrived! Our room was so hot we had to go outside several times for relief! The beach looked NOTHING like the advertisement. The water was brown and full of seaweed. Their were sand fleas everywhere. We looked like we had some kind of disease after a 20min walk long the shore! Our legs were completely covered with flea bites needles to say we never went back to the Beach again! I could go on forever abt the poor customer service we recieved, the lack of staff members and the over all neglect for paying customers on a daily basis but the worst thing for me was being dropped off at the spa which was off the premesis just to try to make the best out of a bad situation and the spa was closed!!! Before I was even escorted there I asked 2 different staff members and they assured me it was open and we'd have a great time! Oh did I forget to mention it was raining and our escort left us there! We walked back to our dirty room! I wanted to cry! Thanks gran melia for the worst vacation ever and also for ruining what was supposed to be our honeymoon!! I'm sending a certified letter of complaint to your corporate office I'm Miami and am writing a poor review on every website I possibly can!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Blain S
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the late afternoon and it took almost 45 minutes to get checked in, the we waited 15 minutes to get a ride to our room. It's a far walk and the trolley service is slow. Got to our room and it smelled like mold. The furniture was old, the pillows were like rocks. We called to get a different room....and that room smelled also. No beach and very slow service. We left after one day and took a cab to San Juan (40 minutes) decided to try the La Concha Hotel. It was awesome! Best thing we ever did!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T BOTHER !!!”
Reviews.Author: ANTHONY G
Reviews.Content: Nice location, but that's about it. The beach is terrible, staff is extremely slow, not one day went by without missing towels, soap,etc.... .The power went out every other day turning the suite into a sauna. The Resort will charge you for selfparking even though there is no space left for long term guest on weekends, also the place is in the middle of nowhere only good if you're not planing on never leaving, once again don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous grounds, pool, So-So service, room...and forget the beach.”
Reviews.Author: lurom
Reviews.Content: Get the Mas card on-line before you get there for the 2 for 1 breakfast. Make sure you know what you're paying for before you book packaged deals. Red level packages allows you to use both pools and spa.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort! So worth the $$$$!!”
Reviews.Author: goodfriends3
Reviews.Content: We went to Gran Melia for Labor Day Weekend. We got 2 rooms for 2 couples. The place is just amazing! It is a beautiful resort worth its 5 stars. The check in was smooth...I had asked for an early check in because our flight was arriving at 9am. They charged me $35.00 which I thought was not bad. Our room was beautiful!! We thought it was going to be a first floor but it was a 2nd Fl. They also accommodated our request to be close to one another. Her room did smell like mold but it was probably because it was a first floor. She did not want to go through switching rooms so she stayed. The beach sucks. Don't go if you are looking to relax by the water. The pool is really really nice! Our room service took forever but I do understand they were full because of the holiday weekend. I thought I would just ask to have our check out time adjusted and they did. Everyone was really nice, extremely polite and very professional. Jesus from the vacations desk helped us find a tour even though they were all booked! He went out of his way to do this for us! The golf carts were always running except when we got back at like 3:30am. The walk is literally 5 minutes so I don't understand why people complain about "long walks". The scenery is beautiful so we would walk most of the time. We would definitely go back!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has a very confused image - would not return”
Reviews.Author: JRVTexas
Reviews.Content: My husband, brother and sister in law found what we thought was a good deal for labor day weekend. We were impressed when we checked in with the lobby and what appeared to be a nice resort. The people were anxious to help take our luggage on the golf carts. The area for check in is really nice, the rooms are nice with the exception that neither one of our rooms refrigerators were clean. One of them had spilt milk in it and the room attendant failed to clean it before we got there. Then the other room had open / half drinks in it. Unfortunately this hotel has a very confused image. It appears to be an upscale nice resort, but once you are there the staff is not helpful. We were charged for calling the front desk. This hotel does not even own their own parking lot. The company that does cares more about filling it up so there were a couple nights that we couldn't even park in the lot because it was full of people in the casino. Talk about customer service. To top it off, the parking charges were sporadic, some days we were charged others we weren't. The people on the golf carts never appeared to be around when you were carrying your stuff to your room after not being able to park in the hotel lot near the room. Also, they have sand flees. Don't plan on going to the beach you will come home looking like you have chicken pox. The other areas besides the main lobby and pool do not have the same grand appearance and looks completely different. It tries to be an upscale resort with the golf course but has no service and is lacking in consistency. Also, the dive shop listed on the website was very adequate, the people were very nice and professional. The guy that did the iron man was very personable and fun but the admin and the guy that we were in contact with also was gave us inaccurate info about visibility etc., which was not appreciated. That being said, of all the dive operations we have used throughout the Caribbean this was one of the the most professional and safe operations. They also provided the largest selection of cold drinks, fresh cut fruit and cracker\cookies we have had with any operators.

Reviews.Title: “Black Mold!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rncon1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had booked 3 nights here for the second half of our honeymoon. We booked one of the best rooms they have to offer, ocean front room with a hot tub on the balcony. Pictures looked amazing online and the place looked like it had a lot to offer. We did this all without looking up any reviews online...big mistake. When we checked in and were given a quick tour, the place looked amazing and seemed to have a lot to offer while we were not sight seeing. However, When we got into the room it wreaked of mold and mildew. We called the front desk to let them know, they said they would send someone over to freshen up the room. Thanks, but no thanks, I don't want to mask the moldy smell with air freshner and asked for another room. They were very responsive in getting us another room in a different building which was great, however this room smelled equally as bad and now it was almost 1am. We decided to stay the night since it was so late. Not one of our best ideas but we needed sleep from traveling. When we woke up and had sunlight in the room I was able to see the mold build up in the air conditioning vent. If the vent was that visible, I can only imagine what the entire AC unit looked like. I proceeded to the red level service desk and spoke with them about the situation. They offered me a new room, but at this point they were 0 for 2 and I just wanted to get out. They allowed me to cancel the rest of my reservation and charged me for only 1 night. We were guests for about 12 hours and still walked out with a $400.00 bill. I looked online at some other reviews and this mold issue appears to be going on for quite some time now, this is not a great revelation, I just did not do due diligence before booking. A few other bad notes about the resort, parking is $16 a day and was never mentioned until you pull into the place. They charger serv you for everything you do. If you fail to return a beach towel you are charged, if you lose a room key you are charged, if you loose the red level bracelet they make you wear you are charged, you cannot call a cab, you have to use there car service. Everything in this resort is a massive production, it takes about 10 minutes to park your car and just walk to your room. The plus side, the staff is very nice and friendly. The bell hops were hard working young guys and extremely friendly, the woman who helped me in the red level desk was very helpfu and nice. The problem with this resort had nothing to do with the staff, it is has to do with how the place is run from senior management/owners. Clearly the owners do not care for the wellbeing of there guests with black mold in ACunits. Black mold is unhealthy to breath in and I am surprised the health department has not stepped in. Be advised, do not go here. The negative reviews are true.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of customer service..”
Reviews.Author: nyrican11
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went there for the labor day wknd..looks can be deceiving on the hotel website..they gave us a rm and it smelled like mildew. We called the front desk and gave them the complaint . They changed our rm to one that was worst than the first one. My friend n I were tired, had a headache and feeling a bit frustrated. we called the front desk again they said the rms will smell like that due to the storm that passed (hurricane Irene) we stressed out to them that we are very tired , have a headache from the smell we need a different rm or we were leaving they changed us rms the rm smelled like Orange mixed w the mildew..and to top it off the curtain rod in the bathroom has black mildew stains ..this hotel lacks cleanliness n customer service ..managers were nowhere insight. not recommendable..

Reviews.Title: “Worse Customer Service My wife and I ever received.”
Reviews.Author: Pete L
Reviews.Content: This was our honeymoon. It was suppose to be the trip to start our marriage together. Service at this Hotel is by far the worse we have ever encountered. Slow, Rude, Expensive. Rooms smell moldy. Also if your planning to use Vacations To Go think twice. Hidden fee's insurance that we purchased covers nothing. We spent $300 for a rental car for the week we were staying there to find out upon arrival that it would be an additional $23.00 a day to park our vehicle at the resort we just spent $6,000 to stay at. That was never mentioned to us by Vacations to Go! Ordered room service just a pot of coffee was $12.00. We spent close to $8,000 at this resort when it was all said and done. Save your money. For that type of money We should have went to Hawaii. Pete L. Chicago,Il

Reviews.Title: “amazing for honeymoons!”
Reviews.Author: Sashaenyse
Reviews.Content: I just got back from the gran melia resort and I fell in love our suite was beautiful we had no problems with ground transportation they were just a phone call away everytime we called for service someone would call and verify if it was delivered it's a romantic place being all candlelit at night what o do have to say is that the parking is overpriced and TEMPO restaurant is beautiful but the food just doesn't cut it if you want to relax this is the perfect place

Reviews.Title: “Nice ground but terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Cool_Breeze_78
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we got bracelet tag just like in other resort. We were transported to the room using a golf cart from the parking lot to the room. The ground landscaping and garden was wonderful, meticulous and well maintained. When we got to the room, it was quite a disappointing. old, run down, stain on sofa and dirty floors. The curtain does not closed completely. We smelled mild dew but maybe because of the tropic. The mini bar was empty, tv remote, AC and safety box lock were not working properly but got fixed later by the hotel staff. The service in the hotel and restaurants were terrible. The food at the restaurants was OK but not superb. buffet breakfast was good. but expensive so, get MAS reward program for half price. the casino was closed for 2 nights and only one black jack table, so had to wait esp on weekend. Water puddle in front of the room did not get cleaned for several days. The resort is away from anywhere. We had a car during the stay so it was not a problem driving around but they charge $16/day for parking in the hotel plus $11/day resort fee. We stayed for a week and over all we had a great time in PR. Will not return to the same resort tho.

Reviews.Title: “Would never go back”
Reviews.Author: dbtort
Reviews.Content: MILDEW and BED BUGS (April 2010) The grounds are beautiful, but the service and rooms are absolutely terrible. When we first arrived it took over an hour to get our room. When we finally got to our room it smelled terribly of mildew. The couch near the sliding glass door actually had black mildew stains imbedded in the fabric. We tried to make the best of it but after 2 hours we both had terrible headaches from the smell. I called the front desk and the girl had the nerve to tell me "It's Humid in Puerto Rico", implying we had to live with it. Eventually she agreed to send someone over and take a look. About an hour later someone from maintenance came with a bottle of air freshener in his hand. I asked him not to spray all over the room, but he seemed to speak very little English, and did just the opposite. Now the room smelled of Mildew mixed heavily with Orange scented air freshener, making things much worse. I called the front desk and demanded a new room. They called me back and agreed to send someone to drive us there. After two hours of waiting I walked across the resort to the front desk and picked up the keys myself. The new room was only a couple buildings away so we just carried our luggage. Our new location was much better with no mildew smell, but after the third night in the room we had welts all over our arms and legs! BED BUGS! Again, the grounds are beautiful and after the first night the service was pretty good, but I think the standard had been set and we didn't expect or ask for much. Fortunately we did not get any stowaways. Needless to say I won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely grounds but run-down rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelwith5yokid
Reviews.Content: We're actually still here right now. The grounds are really amazing and beautiful, and the pool is well designed so it never feels crowded, and it's very kid-friendly. Those aspects get a 5 star rating from me. But the rooms are disappointing. The first room we were in had no bathtub (we're here for a week with a 5 year old who doesn't like showers), and they quickly switched us to the room next door that had a bathtub. So far so good. But this room smells mildewy. I thought the smell would go away over a day of A/C and being lived in, but it hasn't. The other problem is that they advertise these rooms as 'suites' but they're not suites at all. They are one long room, 2/3 taken up with beds, and 1/3 has a couch, small table and desk, and two chairs. Also a coffee maker with no filter. And curtains that don't quite close. And outside on the small balcony, two small plastic chairs (no cushions or anything of the sort) and a small plastic table. To me, this does not add up to a 'luxury suite,' as advertised. And it is very disconcerting given how nice the rest of the grounds are. For us this is a major problem, because we are here with our daughter who goes to sleep at 7. We always stay in suites when we travel, so we can close the bedroom door at 7 to let her sleep, but we can stay awake for a couple of hours with the lights on in the living space. I called the place I had made the reservation through (SaveOn Resorts) and they said they always have these rooms and if we want a different room we have to go through the hotel and pay the difference. Even though the word 'suite' seemed like false advertising, it seemed better to pay some more and move into a normal suite. But the front desk said none of the rooms have doors that close, they are all one big room unless you reserve 2 rooms with adjoining doors. So we're making the best of it, but it's disappointing. Also the restaurants are terrible, and there's no kitchenette or fridge in the room, and the nearest supermarket is miles away (I tried the local market but they didn't even sell any fruits or vegetables).

Reviews.Title: “Sol Melia....We had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: Katie G
Reviews.Content: Okay...there are so many reviews for this resort/vacation club. I think what the resort has done poorly is mostly in its advertising. When I booked the trip, the pictures on the website were photos of the Gran Melia Resort, not the Sol Melia Vacation Club. So we were expecting lavish and grand facilities, but the reality of the room was a very nice hotel suite. Please don't misread what I wrote, we were quite happy with our room! It was clean and very comfortable....it just isn't what you see in the pictures. If you are expecting a 5 star resort but have booked your stay with Sol Melia, you will be disappointed. If you are expecting a very nice hotel suite, you will be very satisfied! The resort side is open to all guests regardless of where you room is located, but we actually enjoyed the smaller pool in the vacation club instead of the large pool in the resort. It seemed cleaner and not as crowded. The larger pool has the Wet Bar and people would swim away from it with drinks in hand...I presume some of those drinks ended up in the pool. People were also eating in the pool on some of the lounge chairs that were in the water. For a clean-freak - bordering on OCD!- like me that was a little much!! We had fun exploring the beaches and playing with the hermit crabs. There are many photo opportunities...sunsets, palm trees, little critters everywhere!! There aren't a lot of activities for young children, but we didn't spend a lot of time just hanging out at the resort. The island it too beautiful and has too many sites and tours to sit around a pool or two for a week! All-in-all the club and resort are very nice facilities. We had no issues with the services provided. The staff was helpful and pleasant. We didn't try any of the restaurants, so I can't rate those! Don't read too much into the negative reviews. This is a nice facility!!

Reviews.Title: “The resort is amazing. The service not so good. People are nice though. The restraints on the resort are to over priced.”
Reviews.Author: AAtexas88
Reviews.Content: The resort is absolutely nice. However they have guys drive around with there golf carts. They should be giving you rides to the front of the resort or a ride to your room. Do they not really they more pass you up. It's a driving distance from San Juan. So rent a car. Nothing would really be walking distance. They have shuttles but are high on price what you would spend on 4 rides from the resort to the place it's taking you it's best to rent a car. After all will I go back yes puerto Rico is wonderful it has alot of history. The beaches are amazing. For my week stay next time I know its probably best to rent a condo. The food at the resort is good but to pricey there breakfast buffet ia about 25.00 a person.

Reviews.Title: “I expect greatness and I got it”
Reviews.Author: Vandmd
Reviews.Content: Wedding Anniversary. Royal Service is great for a couple retreat if you want more privacy and they helps you with reservations all around the place.

Reviews.Title: “Gran? More like grand! Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: KimberlyONE
Reviews.Content: I loved this resort and will definitely be back. Good: Our room was spacious and mostly beautifully decorated (one exception noted below). The shower in our room was phenomenal. The staff is very polite and helpful. The buildings and facilities are truly lovely and the grounds are well-maintained. Lots of staff/security personnel around at night - very safe feeling. The pool is huge, with lots of fun nooks, in-pool lounge chairs, sunning spaces and games. There are big poolside cabanas with king-size cushions to lounge on. The resort is on a nice beach (where we spent most of our time), with lots of lounge chairs on the sand. Bad ***: I reserved a room with two double beds but was given a room with one king at check-in. Not a big deal as the room had a pull-out sofa. However, that pull-out sofa was WELL past its prime, stained and with patches worn through. It was however the only sore point in an otherwise very nice room. Mixed bag: The on-site small convenience store is well stocked, but is very overpriced. A small town is just a 10 min or so drive away and I recommend making the drive if you'd like to buy wine, liquor, snacks or assorted sundries. Better yet, stop on your way in and stock up. Don't miss: The resort's large population of iguanas is fed at 10am every morning. *** I want to note that the hotel sends an email a few days following check-out requesting detailed feedback. I let them know about these issues in that survey and they were extremely quick to personally reply with a sincere apology and a few more questions to make sure it didn't happen to another guest in the future. I was very impressed with both the speed of the reply and its content.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go!”
Reviews.Author: AMS21
Reviews.Content: This resort is older and uglier than shown in the pictures. The pool is greenish and has floaties in it. We did not feel welcome at all and we had to wear wristbands just to walk around. It is in the middle of nowhere and is very out of date. The rooms smelled and the pillows were like rocks. We had made a reservation for three nights and tried to cancel as they showed us our room. We stayed one night and left as soon as possible in the morning. I will be more wary of nice pictures on the internet. I should have read these reviews before we went. Two thumbs down. Oh and the beach is a swamp!

Reviews.Title: “This is paradise & we wished me could have stayed longer!!!”
Reviews.Author: fourgators
Reviews.Content: I cannot say anything bad about this resort except that there were very few ice machines, no mini fridge & no microwave. The help, grounds, room & pool were all great!! The help was some of the nicest people anywhere. My husband kept calling it "fantasy island". Regarding the distance between amenities & the rooms, they did offer to golf cart you wherever you needed to go. My husband & I enjoyed the exercise most of the time. Although the beach looked ok, we were told by an employee that it was not good for swimming, so, we went elsewhere. We were told that the pool was open 24 hours a day, however, went we went to the pool at 8pm one evening it was closed for cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Two many nice buildings but dad service and have to walk too much.”
Reviews.Author: Ivonenna
Reviews.Content: To many nice buildings but may have to walk most of the time. Main building facilities with airconditionor problems. Resturant Tempo's food not good, airconditionar problems as well as in the bar. Ants coming into the room.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy pool”
Reviews.Author: mayin
Reviews.Content: The hotel needs badly a complete renovation. We could not use the pool. It was green and dirty and terrible. Maintenance badlu needed.

Reviews.Title: “the resort is georgous but......”
Reviews.Author: oalvelo
Reviews.Content: the service sucked, after checking in at 3pm my room was not ready, and was told to go for a walk, they will call me when it would be ready. after a long trip with my kids i wanted to go directly to my room and get settled in. after a hour of walking around in the hott sun, i receive my call that the room was ready, all this time my bags are thrown in the front of the resort entrance. i assumed my bags should have been taken to my room while i waited for the room to get ready, so i waited around for 30 min for the bell hop to help me and no one asked if i needed help, i had to take a luggage cart and take my bags myself to my room while everyone else is taken by golf carts....after all that trouble, i did make the best out of it for my kids, considering that it was a five day stay , i only spent one full day at the actual resort, because i was exploring how beautiful Puerto Rico is. i was not going to let the horrible service stop the fun i wanted to have with my kids.....by the way my son is still waiting for his steak sauce;)

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous resort, great price but crappy beach”
Reviews.Author: coolleen
Reviews.Content: So we just got back from our vacation three days ago andit was amazing. My boyfriend and I travel often and I have to say PR is just a gorgeous place and the Gran Melia is a fabulous resort for the money. The only real issue was the beach...it sucked and the pool was a s##t show...WAY to many people squeezed into it. Before we deicided on the Gran Melia I checked Trip Advisor...allot. The reviews were mixed--i think parlty becaus there were people out that that don't travel often and expected a 5 star hotel. The Gran Melia is a nice hotel but definetly not 5 star..maybe 3. The rooms are nice, clean and large, the gym is great, the resturants are very good...and not badly priced, the pool is pretty to look at (although crowded)and the Casino, although small is fun. A fun little tod bi go to the spa hotel--it is by the gym and empty--it is likme your own private sanctuary --it even has bed's and such. I do reccomend renting a car--if you don't you will not have a good time. The hotel is in the middle of nowhere (thats why it is so fabulous) so definetly rent a car. There is a parking fee--but honestly it is not a ton of money-15 a day. Parking can be tricky but there is another parking lot on the other side of the entrance...a 3 minute walk. The staff is nice, we had an issue with the coffee machine and hair dryer not working and literally we had new ones within 30 minutes. If you are looking for a nice hotel that is nicely priced stay here.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: devlsfn
Reviews.Content: amazing resort...must go with extra red level service. Butler Edgar Romon is excellent, but Butler Angel Melendez is the greatest! Be sure to request him... He will do anything for you and he means it... It looks like he really enjoys his work... Also, he is non-stop...not like others... He is a go getter! Food is good, of course, overpriced, but good enough. Staff around the grounds are friendly and helpful. Only downside is bartender Jorge at red level pool. Looks like he will help the local people or if you speak spanish... he totally ignores the americans.... his service is terrible... all and all...this place is worth the price! beautiful, beautiful, beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again...STAY AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: CoolMom1965
Reviews.Content: Red Level: Butlers and Red level staff were fabulous.....Pool and the area was spot on. Room was a disgrace...Mold in Bathroom.....Broken Lamps.....Dampness.....heavy musty smell in closet.....Comments were heard but never a follow up...Just a smile and statement of I understand.....Room was not cleaned one day until after 6pm....Furniture chipped...Stuffing coming out of chairs....could be a fabulous room but the maintenance is missing from the whole resort. in a matter of three days the resort lost power three times! Restaurants: Way over priced! Food not up to par at all....Breakfast was good....servers were fair to midland...they favored the residents.....and always rushed you out by giving you a check prior to the client asking. Main grounds: Gorgeous Ice Machines.....well I was given a pir pan and the employee directed me to a bin with a large chunk of ice...I was chipping away for a bucket of ice!!!!! Main pool: FILTHY FILTHY FITLHY! Dead bugs flating....Cig Butts...and cloudy beyond belief.....they also ran out of towels by 3pm two days in a row that the employee asked me to complaint to mgmt since they were not listening to her..... Kids activity ctr: NOT RUNNING...THEY ARE STILL IN THE MIDTS OF CONSTRUCTION! Upon Check in, only then are you informed that they will be hlding 100 dollars a day for incidentals.... Nothing in the area.....rental car service at the resort ran out of cars!!!!!!!!! At $330 a night...this is a disgrace...hence a hotel employee stated that they have had these issues for a long time......Frustrating....Next time...I wil go back to the Intercntinental or the Caribe Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, Beautiful and Entertaining!!!”
Reviews.Author: Veraniz
Reviews.Content: First of all this hotel is extremely beautiful, is full of palms, flowers, great opened architecture the lobby have this great and relaxing smell that you never forget. Also if you are thirsty they always put water with a hit of fruits that taste like heaven. My favorite part of the hotel is the pool, WOW! super big clear and beautiful, they have a lot of activities that you can make like some happy exercises in the pool. Later you can relax listening some steel band with calypso music! and you can have access to a bar in the pool to order your PiÃ±a Colada! The casino is very nice, the hotel also have a SPA, Gym and Yoga classes! also there is a playroom for kids, the kids never will be boring they can play ping pong, chess, play in the pool and a lot of games available. The room is extremely clean, clean!!! and the bed is so soft and comfy. I have one of the best vacations of my life! #1 recommended! The staff is very nice and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Sharfire
Reviews.Content: We don't golf but we love this resort!! Not only is it beautiful but they treat you like royalty. We are members and stayed in a gorgeous studio with kitchenette, dining room, private balcony, nice living area, fantastic master suite. The resort is beautiful, the food is good, and we especially love the fact that we rented a car and drove around Puerto Rico and it was very convenient from our resort. Will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for the rates and family oriented”
Reviews.Author: riveraza
Reviews.Content: The check in line location is a little bit confusing for first timers, employees are polite, valet parking went with no problems $20.00 daily for guests. Rooms are a little bit far away from hotel but they have golf carts running 24/7 to take you to the restaurants area. Swimming pool is huge good for kids. Passion restaurant is excellent to try Puerto Rican cuisine make reservation as soon as you get to the front desk. Breakfast was included and was excellent. There are not too many places for lunch and the one they have on the pool area is small but service there is pretty decent once you are seated. I would recommend first floor rooms even though I stayed on a second floor. Room service take a little bit longer than usual, but it was excellent. I would recommend to check out early than check out time because it is harder to get picked up at your room by the cart. They have express check out which is good, valet parking at check out was a little bit disorganized but went fine. The hotel is good and family oriented and beds from 1 to 10 I would scaled them 8. Pillows are a 10.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Facility, Very Spread Out”
Reviews.Author: Trey1096
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 days before heading over to Vieques. We have been to PR 6 times and this was our first time at this facility. It was easy to find off Hwy 3 and our check in went pretty well, especially considering it was the 3rd Monday in July, a holiday weekend. We arrived around 5:00pm and it took about 20min to get checked in and about 20min to get to our room. The place is very spread out and parking is minimal. From our room, it was 0.45 miles from where we parked, 0.25 miles from the pool, 0.2 miles from the restaurants, and 500 feet from the beach. They have golf carts ferrying people around, but it always seemed like there wasnâ€™t one around when you needed it and requesting a ride from the front desk takes as long as walking. The distance away from everything was constantly an issue. We had a lot of trouble getting ice. It may have been because of the number of people there for the holiday, but it seems like you should plan your facilities around full capacity. The staff did realize the problem and were trying to help by putting out carts of ice to supplement the machines. The dining was great, though expensive. We ate at PasiÃ³n, The Wet Pool Bar, and Tempo, with PasiÃ³n being our favorite. One thing they could improve on is keeping a casual dining restaurant open into the evening. After a long day sightseeing in El Yunque, it would have been nice if there was a place to just grab a burger. Service was so-so. Once they brought my wifeâ€™s meal 10 minutes before mine. We started the checkout process around 10:30am and we finally pulled away from the place at 12:15. The bulk of that time was spent in the checkout line. They had approximately 6 terminals, but only 3 employees working to check people out. If you didnâ€™t have any problems with your bill, you could just drop one copy of the bill they slide under your door along with your room cards into a drop box. The problem was that we, along with the rest of the people in the line didnâ€™t get anything slipped under our door. All in all it was an ok stay. However, there were enough negative aspects to prevent us from returning. Puerto Rico has a lot of really nice resorts. This level of competition doesnâ€™t allow room for 1.75 hour checkout times or a quarter mile walk to the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation Club Rental - could be very good with better maintenance"”
Reviews.Author: Caves_3
Reviews.Content: This review is of the Sol Melia Vacation Club rentals on Gran Melia Golf Resort. I rented three one bedroom "time share" units over 7 months before the trip and received a great rate at 1/3 of the going rate through Sol Melia's Vacation Club's own website. The signage on Hwy 3 in Puerto Rico, was very clear "Coco Beach, Grand Melia". However the signage to the resort is very poor from that point, keep on going to the end of the road to reach the Gran Melia resort. We rented two cars with GPS for the week. Vacation Club rentals have free parking. The vacation club rental units were beautiful and spacious. They included a jacuzzi and small kitchen. The grounds of the resort are beautiful and the rooms were cool and dry (great air conditioning). The negatives: the vacation club front desk was understaffed. They were very pleasant, but sometimes the wait was over 10 mins. The maid service was poor with inconsistant service (missing towels etc.) My unit had a jacuzzi and didn't work, no hot water for the tub, no light in the shower, no hair dryer and then the ceiling started to leak rain water onto our floors and bed. I complained and within the hour we were switched to a older unit, however it had a working jacuzzi, hot water and a light in the shower and a blow dryer, it also had a full frig., dishwasher and washer/dryer in the unit which was great. Suggestions: Vacation units should have the supplies necessary to use the items included like dishwashing soap, sponges, dishwasher soap and washer detergent. The units were missing a "service requested" or "Do not disturb" type door hanger, we needed to request them. Units with washer/dryers use laundry rooms, however many dryers were out of order. Great desserts and auth. Puerto Rican food can be found at the Coco Sweet Bakery on the street (955) before your reach Hwy 3. We only tried the "Cafe Soliel" on the food was poor at best. Overall it was good value at the rate I paid.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Hoffman121110
Reviews.Content: We loved the Gran Melia. We checked in Dec 12th and stayed for 9 days for our Honeymoon. We rented a car and arrived in the late evening. We did not have to wait in line. We were checked in quickly and someone helped us to our room. The room was AMAZING!!! We had a Jr suite with a garden view. It was low season so we didn't notice too many people around. The pool was HUGE! I don't remember ever seeing the swim up pool bar open, but we didn't stay around the resort too much during the day. The beach is so beautiful. It is not a swimming beach as it has a lot of rocks and it is thick with sea grass. But still very beautiful to look at. If you want a beach to lay on and swim in then you can easily go 15 mins down the road to one. There is not much close to the resort, so unless you plan on spending A TON of money eating at the resort and just laying around the pool I HIGHLY recommend renting a car. Parking is expensive though. There is a little bakery as you are driving in to the resort, I think it is called Coco's. They had good food. You aren't supposed to take food or drink on the property. The first few days though my husband was sick with a fever and so he had to stay in. I had a beach bag that I smuggled food into him. I got food from Coco's and there is a grocery store up the street that has a little lunch line where we were able to get a BIG plate of food for around $5. We would split those almost every day. We did upgrade to the royal service for our last night. This allowed us access to the adults only pool with a Bali bed (VERY NICE) and we had a beach view and a private Jacuzzi on the balcony. Both rooms were HUGE and AMAZING though. The royal service breakfast was really wonderful! And it was nice that they had the cocktail hour. We went and got Champagne to go and took it to dinner with us. We only ate dinner in one of the restaurants. It was good, but was no better than some other restaurants that we had found that were less expensive. I would HIGHLY recommend this resort! Especially in down season when it is not too busy. If you are thinking of going, email me and I might be able to provide you with additional information.

Reviews.Title: “The problems were from guests, not staff.”
Reviews.Author: islandhunterraar
Reviews.Content: I booked this trip a few months ago and watched in horror as bad review after bad review rolled in on Trip Advisor. We were definitely scared about what this trip would turn out to be. Upon check in, we opted to upgrade to Red Level and the couple next to us was yelling at another staff member about how horrible their stay was. I eavesdropped and learned it had little to do with the staff and more to do with the fact their travel agency claimed this was an all-inclusive resort. They also were upset that a hotel employee said a taxi would cost about $60 to San Juan and they were charged $85. Regarding the taxi service, we got a cab from the air port and paid $65. He gave us his business card and we called him to get us. This is a reasonable rate. It's about a 35 minute drive to San Juan and price of gas, as expected on an island, is a little higher than the price here in Chicago. It would be cheaper for you to rent a car ON SITE if you need to go anywhere, because daily parking is $16 or $20. The grounds were immaculate. The buildings are all gorgeous and frankly the price of food and drink was not high for a resort. If you are not expecting resort fees I can see it coming as a bit of a shock. $9 for a drink is normal. $16 for a burger is normal. This is, as they say, how it goes. The room was beautiful and for us, the upgrade to Red Level and ocean front was worth it. This allowed us to get away from the other guests. The staff was awesome, too. I never had a problem with them. Everyone was always very nice and accomodating. We ordered room service twice and got it delievered within 45 minutes - which is reasonable. It was always hot and it was worth it. We ate at Wet, Pasion, Cafe Soliel, and all were good. Red Level service was the only way to make this trip bearable and I suppose this is the reason I would never go back. As I stated before, we found the other guests to be brash and loud. I was annoyed with the people who demanded to be served like kings and queens by a staff who was very clearly over their attitude problems. They left trash everywhere, got a little too drunk, a little too loud, and a lot of kids were completely out of control. They complained incessantly about everything, including the price of food which they had ordered and was clearly marked. I have never witnessed so much complaining in my life and that caused my mood to decline. Red Level gives you a private pool with a guy on security detail who checks wristbands. Someone complained about that before, and I assume it's because they weren't paying for the upgrade because I'd probably be very ticked if they DIDN'T check. The drinks are watered down. I brought my own liquor in mini bottles to compensate and saved quite a bit of money over the course of 6 days. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable, and I was concerned about the air conditioning not working but upon arrival I can tell you what the problems really could be - PR has high humidity. Very high. Air conditioning units aren't going to eliminate everything. Could you still feel SOME of it? Yes, absolutely. But the room was cold. It did have a faint odor, but honestly... I have never been to a carribbean resort without some sea humidity effects with the exception of a highrise in Mexico. There is no beach to speak of, and I was disappointed that for many days we had no wind (the resort faces the leeward side of a peninsula) and the absence of waves sucked. This probably compounds the issue with people at the pool because there is nothing else really to do there. I never went into the main pool, but stayed in ours. Contrary to the signs, the pools do NOT close early and are, in fact, open 24 hours. You do get a pool card, and they will charge you for late pool towel return. But you really, really don't need a towel. It was hot enough to dry off very quickly and this time of the year it wasn't chilly even at night. Red Level's cocktail hour is beer, wine, soft drinks, water, and sangria. Sangria was awesome. You can get bottled water all day for free if you are RL. Breakfast is included and worth it, but don't be fooled by the separate dining. It seems if you are newly checked in, they seat you in separate rooms. However, after day two we were seated with the still out of control masses. Annoying, but no different than say a Denny's on a Saturday morning. Expect that. Paying for things could be tricky. As I said, we upgraded and paid $75 PP. In addition to that, you MUST pay a $100/night inccidental charge they will refund after you check out. It is charged all at once. 6 days, $600. If you don't have space on your card, you need to tell them. We saw MANY people who didn't and then started freaking out. The resort either charges things to your room or you pay with another card for purchases. We charged everything to our room and had no issues with our bill, probably because we noticed you must return pool towels by 6PM regardless of your swimming. The resort is very secure, and as I said, the only issues were with other guests. It wasn't everyone, but it was enough for us to give pause. It seems there are locals who come in on the weekend and get drunk and rowdy, and I could see problems happening from them clashing with other people for sure. Security was always around though. Lots of iguanas, lizards, PR tree frogs, toads, and birds. In the end, we spent way more money than I thought this would cost and it would have been in our best interest to go to another resort for more money, maybe in Fajardo and ferry over to an island off the main one. Rent a car for a day from Avis (no parking fee) and go to El Yunque. It was very pretty. We drove around the east end and up to Old San Juan (the driving wasn't worth it, nothing to see). We had our best meal in Old San Juan and it was wonderful to go there. Stay close to Columbus Square and be vigilent, we were close to an attempted mugging about 50 feet from the square on a side street. Don't let that scare you, it happens everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “BEST VACATION YET”
Reviews.Author: MrsKnight0325
Reviews.Content: This was the first vacation that my me and my fiancee went on together. The resort was absolutely beautiful and romantic. The staff was friendly and very helpful. I keep looking at the pictures that we took. The negatives: The room smelled like mildew but we called the front desk and they came and sprayed with a deodorizer. The food choices were limited and very pricey. You have to rent a car if you want to experience PR and save money on food.Overall the positives out weighed the negatives by far. I enjoyed myself, made some new friends and actually tried to extend my stay but they were booked. I cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Melia for one night”
Reviews.Author: cocopud
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Melia for one night before heading over to Vieques. There was 7 of us traveling, so we had reserved 2 rooms. After exploring the rain forest, we headed back to the hotel to check in. Well they claimed that they did not have our reservation and the hotel was packed, so I;m sure they gave our rooms away. After dealing with them for an hour, they finally gave us the presidential suite, we included two rooms in separate buildings. The hotel was very nice and we had a nice dinner at the restaurant. it would have been nicer if they didnt give our rooms away and put us through such a hassle before finally finding us something.

Reviews.Title: “It's average but I expected more (4nights 5days)”
Reviews.Author: Sam_Whang
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the cons of this place: ** I checked in roughly at 3:00 on a Tuesday and it was probably the WORST check in I have ever experienced. I waited about an hour and five minutes from the end of the line to front desk. It amazes me that such a large resort has ONLY 3 employees working the front desk. **The private beach is inadequate so much that I went off the resort to a local beach (Unfortunately I can't remember the name of the beach). The gran Melia beach is lined with rocks and boulders and there are practically zero waves. I don't recall any swimmers whatsoever to give you an idea. This is no fault of the resort but if you're looking for a private beach -- LOOK ELSEWHERE. ** Lots of walking and the parking is a joke. If you rent a car, self parking is roughly $16 and valet is $21. I don't mind paying for parking since it seems that every resort in the area charges something similar. What I do have an issue with is if I'm a guest staying at the resort and there is NO available self parking and you are FORCED to valet. Pros: ** The main lobby is pretty awesome. Unfortunately they probably needed to spend a little less on the lobby and more on the rooms. The rooms are pretty spacious and probably per sq footage the best value of what I saw. The mini fridge was not stocked either which I didn't mind since I bought drinks at the local Walgreens. ** Red Level butler service. These guys are great and always more than willing to help you with whatever you need. The vast majority of my interaction with the staff was with the butler service. Tips that can help: ** Rent a car!!!! It cost me roughly $115 to rent a car for 5 days and I couldn't imagine being stuck on resort for my entire trip. I believe if you rent a car thru Avis the resort waives the parking -- I booked thru Enterprise so I wouldn't know. ** Red Level service -- there is almost ZERO difference in the rooms vs the standard room. What you are paying for is free breakfast buffet - access to the ADULTS only pool ie no kids (BIGGEST PERK is free cabana) -- Free drinks from 6-9pm -- Butler service (I used mostly for shuttle service from room to car/lobby.

Reviews.Title: “what are all the complains about?????? loved gran melia”
Reviews.Author: rp_mariel
Reviews.Content: I dont know why are people complaining so mucho about this hotel. I stayed there for 2 nights with my boyfriend and we had a great time. Check-in was quite fast, although we had too wait a little for our room since we ask for an upgrade. the girl at the front desk was super nice. Yes is true you have to walk to get to the lobby, the pool and the restaurants, but please people dont be so lazy!!!!! is not even a 5 minute walk!!!!! and most of the time golf carts from the hotel are passing by to take you. If you have the chance ask to be placed in a room near the main are so the walk is shorter. The pool is super great and really big, you dont even need the beach. the room was pretty big and the bed was super comfortable, yes it does smell of humidity but not a big deal and you get use to it after a few minutes. If you are staying for a few days you probably dont need to get out of the hotel, but if you are staying for a week or so I highly recommend that you rent a car so you can go anyplace you want around the area. El Yunque national rainforest, Luquillo's beach (balneario de Luquillo) and the kiosks at Luquillo are a must do! Also, there are 2 walgreens and a supermarket close to the hotel where you can buy some snacks and beverages so you dont have to buy at the usual hotel-expensive prices, but buy a little cooler or something because there is no fridge in the rooms. Our reservations included free breakfast buffet, so get that if you can. During our second night we had dinner at Passion, and omg!!! it was incredible!!!!!! best skirt steak I ever had. everything that we ordered was super delicious and the waiter was very nice. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding trip”
Reviews.Author: salleygirl
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent. The resort was very clean. The staff were knowledgable, friendly and very gracious. We plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Never never again”
Reviews.Author: Gp1983
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Melia Cancun and didn't have a good experience so I was giving the Melia a second chance in Puerto Rico which was a mistake! After waiting in line for 3 hours to check in only to be told the room was not ready with no estimated time, we proceeded to ask for the manager. They were of no help. Going to dinner was a disaster because there were low class drunk people looking for problems. I felt very uncomfortable and in danger. Security was non-existent. The Melia only cared about their money and not the customer. I regret tipping the waitress. I would never stay at another Melia ever again. They confirmed that this Spanish owned company only cares about Money and NOT their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Erazo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely amazing. The service was great except when dealing with young inexperienced staff. The Red Level Beach Front Room is to die for....Great view with your own Jacuzzi on the balcony. If you want a relaxing, quiet vacation this is the place to be. Very clean and refreshing. Staff was great except for one or two. Our Butler EDDIE was GREAT! He should be leader and teach everyone customer service. He was very attentive and on point. What disappointed me was the fact that my husband requested our room to be set up for a romantic evening with candles and the works, but our Butler (not Eddie) went to the wrong room and gave them the surprise. Hotel management did nothing. Hotel is about 20-30 minutes from airport. I will definately be returning.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay at a Melia hotel again!”
Reviews.Author: Swalk5
Reviews.Content: We traveled for 24 hours to get to the resort and upon arrival were greeted by a mob of people trying to check in. Three hours past check in time and letting the Manager know this was unacceptable we were finally assigned a room. I knew at this point that the Melia did not care about their customers. The "free buffet" was acceptable but the line was out the door and there was a very long line to get an omelette, took 2O minutes. At dinner at their fine restaurant, we were rushed to order and to pay the bill...I'm on vacation and didn't appreciate it. This place has such poor management and their customer service is horrible. I would never recommend the Melia to anyone and put them through this dreadful experience, recommend this to my family and friends maybe enemy. We moved to the Wyndam Rio Mar which is awesome! BIG Difference great check in and they worked with us and gave us a great rate. They care about their customers and the service is great. Puerto Rico is beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “This place sucked”
Reviews.Author: jaywalker5
Reviews.Content: First of all after flying from California and not sleeping for 32 hours we arrived tired at our appointed check in time of 3 00 stood in line for an hour only to be told our room wasn't ready and they would call us when it was :-(. They told us to go to the bar and get some drinks gave us a wristband, took our credit card and told us have fun. Drinks were very expensive. They wouldn't honor our wristbands and wouldn't take our cash made us use our card each time for serveice and wouldn't start a tab. Totalbs IMO we went back to check for our room at 5:30 and were told it wasn't ready we asked for a complimentary upgrade or some sort of compensation for not having our room ready and were told no way take a hike we will call you when your room is ready. We asked to speak to a manager which we finally spoke to and were told pretty much the same. At 6:30 they called and told us to return to the front desk our room was ready. Showered and headed down for dinner at 7:30. We went to the Italian place on premises which was virtually empty only to be told without a reservation we couldn't get in until after 10:00. There were four in our party 2 couples dressed nicely, pocketful of money in our early 50's. Couldn't get a table just ridiculous IMO . The next night we went to the puerto rican restaurant and were seated by some low class kids with ponytails that didn't like my friends or my wife for some reason. They were bein very insulting claiming we were too loud for there taste. We decided that there was too much friction and asked to be moved to another area which we were. After dinner the aggressive jerks came to our table and tried to pick a fight with us. We are 2 old guy with our wives we didn't want to fight and asked the waiter to call security which they did. The 2 punks were screaming obscenities and pushing us when security arrived finally . They got the trouble makers out of there and came back to tell us to hurry up, finish our food and 60 Dollar bottle of wine, pay and leave. We explained the we had done nothing wrong and werein no hurry to vacate. They promptly brought the 300.00 bill and demanded we pay and leave. We didn't really get to enjoy our dinner and had to rush out. We weren't even offered desert. Just a bunch of poorly trained non caring people. We moved the next day to Wyndham Rio Mar beach. We got a room for 99 a night and the facility's and service are top notch wish I would have come here first.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks ... but no thanks.”
Reviews.Author: Nicie143
Reviews.Content: The hotel and grounds are lovely, however, the rooms and the service - not so much. The rooms never seem to get cool enough and you can't seem to get the humidity out. They seem to have shortage of wait staff. There are a handful that are exceptional, but for the most part you are inconveniencing them by staying at the hotel. We did the red level service - no biggie. Went to get coffee one morning in our "Private Lounge" and all they had was decaf, no milk and a young lady that could not be pulled away from her phone long enough for me to ask. Overall - just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience, inept management and the worst check-in experience ever”
Reviews.Author: procpr
Reviews.Content: Just arrived to the MeliÃ¡ for a relaxing day and dinner at nearby Fern at the St. Regis. Arrived at 5 pm to encounter a line of over 100 people for check-in. After a 45-minute wait, in a rainy, humid day, I was told that there were no available rooms and that we had to wait for an indefinite period of time. A supervisor and manager were on the scene telling people that the only available comp were movies and popcorn at a salon. They said that it was enough to make up for the wait. The check-in agent Edwin was courteous enough through it all. However, we were amazed at the lack of power these agents had to compensate guests. We booked a red-level oceanfront suite, but were checked into a garden view, regular room. All in all, a disastrous experience at this property. I will let management know of their incompetence upon check-out. It's a shame that for a large hotel in a resort setting they treat the customer as if they're "doing us a favor". Older people and children had 4 and 5 hour waits from what we could hear. In the future, would rather go to the equal star Rio Mar or splurge a bit on the St. Regis rather than encountering this disaster again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds - hard to maneuver around”
Reviews.Author: batyl
Reviews.Content: Everything went well except front desk. Really, really slow check in and check out. Long lines. Don't know if it's the people manning the desk or the computer system. Front desk people really didn't care if you had a problem or not. It was their way and too bad if you didn't like it. Outside of front desk, staff very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “So beautiful, in every aspect. A mother /daughter trip..never to be forgotten!”
Reviews.Author: april4472
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Gran Melia was fabulous. The facility is beautiful and our rooms were clean, luxurious, and comfortable. It was exactly to our liking, though some might feel too far separated from town. The hotel is about 20 minutes east of town on the coast which was terrific for us. A car rental is your best bet unless you are one to stay at the facility or to only do tours. We like exploring at our own pace. We elected the Red Level Service which was well worth the extra money--it included breakfast each day, attentive service from the butler/pool staff and refreshments from 6-9 each evening. Here is is only real criticism of the stay. Red level service says it includes "open bar" with house brands. It DID NOT include liquor--they only served wine, beer and champagne. We ate at various restaurants on the island as well as two on-site. Both the Asian and Italian restaurants were exceptional. My compliments to our butlers Angel, Eddie, and Joshua who were outstanding. I must relay that the facility is quite large and golf carts are running through the facility constantly for a ride to your destination; walking between destinations is most common-- or you may call for a special ride such as loading your luggage. Drivers were all very courteous and helpful. Remember tipping and bring dollars. The casino is quite small. Parking is an extra expense unless you rent your car from the concierge at the hotel. Having an "all adult" pool included in the Red Level service is a real plus. I am not really a beach addict, but others said the beach area was a little rocky. Our pool was beautiful and we could reserve a cabana for the day if we chose. I would DEFINITELY return to the luxurious Gran Melia on future trips. Oops, forgot to mention the architectural beauty of the facility and the wonderful works of art throughout. Evenings, the hotel is exceptionally beautiful with candles lighting all the public areas, creating a romantic atmosphere--lots of ambiance. Just make sure the location is to your liking--if you want to walk to restaurants and clubs, this is probably not your best choice. Check-in and out was expeditious for us on Tuesdays. For me, it was a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK...room for improvement! Wish I would have known these tips!”
Reviews.Author: MaggieCincy82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our honeymoon in PR and we stayed at the Gran Melia. My husband and I found this resort on price line (considered 5 starts). We checked in late on Sunday night, mentioned it was our honeymoon and asked if we could upgrade to an ocean view/front room. The women at the front desk agreed but said it would be an additional $75 (not including taxes etc etc) per night....we wanted to relax the first three days and then planned on going on day trips the rest of the week, so we upgraded for just 3 nights and then on Wednesday would downgrade to our original reserved room. All of the Ocean Front rooms are considered "Red Level" , so included in our upgrade was red level access which means 1. Free Breakfast every morning (they have everything at the Breakfast restaurant...omelets, pancakes bacon, muffins bagels you name it) 2. Access to one of the 5 butlers at the resort (the butlers can make you reservations, reserve private bungalows, draw a bath with rose petals and make towels out of swans, candles on your balcony...whatever). 3. Free Happy Hour 6-9 House Wine and Beer Only 4. access to the private pool with private bungalows, bar etc....no children allowed....This is totally worth it Just for the pool, room and Breakfast alone. While we were red level guests the service was really good.....and then we downgraded... BIG mistake! We packed up in advance so we could switch rooms quickly and go on our tour of the Rain forest we had planned ....We called at 11am to let them know our bags were ready to be moved at 12:15 still no sign of the bellman we called three more times...still no sign. Finally at 1:00 someone shows up to move our bags and we arrive to our new room...it was dirty ( I mean cob webs, dirt on the walls, bugs in the tub etc and had an overwhelming smell of mildew/mold. The couch was covered in black mold on one side. We called to switch rooms the front desk never called us back so we went back to the front desk told them we were late for our tour and we had a problem with the room. They said someone would come spray the room while we were gone and if that didn't fix the problem they would move us. We arrived back at the hotel around six. No one had sprayed our room or followed up on this. It took an hour and a half to get the head of housekeeping to come out and "smell" the room. He immediately agreed it was really bad and left to see what he could do. He came back and showed husband two other rooms options. All we wanted was a clean room that didn't smell like mildew...were not picky. Going back forth with the front desk getting the housekeeping supervisor out to the room to see for himself and then moving rooms again took 3 hours that night and 5 hours out of the entire day....I found this ridiculous. The Controller on duty called to verify the sequence of events (she has the story all wrong) and offered to comp our breakfast the next day and send us a bottle of champagne. My point is if you stay here, only stay as a red level guest or it's not worth it. I would also buy a few staples, beer, liquor and mixers, to go cups, at the liquor store down the street I cannot remember the name of the store, but it is at the light/across the street at the intersection at the end of the main street to get into Gran Melia next to Martinis (they only except cash but have good prices on liqueur) and snacks at Amiga (the Grocery about 5 minutes away). Because room service and all of the restaurants on this resort are extremely overpriced. You can walk around with drinks or pack a small cooler with a few drinks for the pool so you are not spending $150+ just on drinks everyday. I would also venture off a couple of nights for dinner and lunch off the resort. We went to Richie's about 10 minutes away in Rio Mar. This place is a little pricey but has an amazing view, great food and great drinks!! If you just want to grab a quick dinner or get something to go, I would go to the Kiosks about 10 minutes way from the hotel. There are about 30 Kiosks each with different types of food...from Pizza to authentic Puerto rico specialties.. as well as sit down restaurants and bars. The first time we went to the Kiosks it was during the day and it looked a little scary (because the majority of the Kiosks were closed) but after doing some research we learned that at night they open all the kiosks it's mixed with locals and tourists and all of the kiosk owners must be licensed to serve food...it was a much better experience. Many of the vendors take credit or cash. For a quick lunch check out La Familia Bakery 2. They have amazing desserts and fresh baked sandwiches. The Cuban and Tripleta Sandwiches are great they also have breakfast sandwiches with eggs and ham...sugar free desserts as well. We did eat at the Asian restaurant on the resort on our last night. The Sushi was really good and we got out of there with 2 drinks a few Sushi rolls for about $100. We only checked out the private pool during our stay I believe only red level is allowed at the private pool during the day. The private pool was great, but we met a lady that said her daughter would not get in the regular/main pool because it was filthy. I had never been to a casino, but we did try out the one on the resort, It's the type of casino you would spend an hour max of your time... it's pretty small they say drinks are on the house but it is nearly impossible to find the waitress (plus the drinks are pretty bad) and they only come around if you are spending lots of $$. I would again grab a drink from the bar and bring it in or make your own and bring it to the Casino. The Market is the little shop/bakery/coffee shop on the resort. I will say they have AMAZING Espresso and Coffee (I am a HUGE fan of starbucks and I thought there espresso was better at the Market). The Resort beach is nice, there are hammocks and lounge chairs set up along the beach, you have a lot of privacy...keep in mind though this is not a beach where you can swim out in the water because it is rocky and rough. We rented a car at Enterprise for our stay because we wanted to do things off of the resort....(there is nothing in walking distance of the resort) If you have a car rental make sure you budget for parking I think it's around $16 a day (do self park, valet is not worth it). If you don't rent a car, I believe they have have Avis rental on site so you may be able to to do daily rentals. Also make sure you allow yourself enough time to check out the day you leave. Check out is 12pm ...We left on Sunday and had to wait in an hour long line to check out. They leave a list of all your charges in your door the night before you leave. Take time in the morning to make sure you don't have any charges to dispute etc..because this could take even longer to check out. Overall the resort is beautiful, the decor is outstanding and it is really relaxing. The service definitely needs to improve, and food and drinks are overpriced ....I would recommend this resort if you can get a good deal on price line and upgrade to red level...if not I would look else where.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: admneely
Reviews.Content: My wife and i had a great time here.
