The only down-side is that it sits at the back of the golf course, and u have to taxi or rent-a-car everywhere outside of the resort, and that can get expensive..... The food is great, the service is great, the casino can be fun on a good night, the pools are excellent..........and the staff are friendly.............. If u like wildlife, there are Iguana's everywhere from anywhere to smal ones to big ones.......saw a couple stray cats on the property, but thats about it. You have the option of taking a golf-cart which is free of charge around the property, as they come around...........Over-all, we had a great experience here, and may come back...........

Reviews.Title: “Ultra snotty place, did not like it”
Reviews.Author: raghu2383_1
Reviews.Content: Went here on a trip with my wife after our wedding. Everything about this place is snotty. You have to drive to this place, there is no other go. They charge you $15+tax for parking a day. That annoyed me to start off as their confirmation mail had nothing to that effect. Its possibly present on their website on a fine print in a hidden corner. Annoying nevertheless. On reaching there the receptionist insisted on putting a wrist band on me and informed me that according to the agreement I signed, if I lose the band I would have to pay $50. The best was when I was told that if I did not return the pool towels before checkout I would be charged $35 per towel. The bell boys were also rude. The guards would make it a point to shine light on us at night in the pool to ensure that we had 'bands' on. I was told the Hot tub was part of the spa which closes at 6 pm - which defeats the purpose of a hot tub, who wants to go during the day in the heat. Overall a very annoying experience. And the main pool water was literally green all the time. The room phone had a print stating $2 per minute will be charged for dialing toll free numbers - someone should tell these guys the definition of a toll free number. Considering guests pay so much for a night, one would think complimentary wi-fi would be present, but no, of course not. After 3 days when I diligently returned everything and made it a point to look at my check out sheet - I had a charge of $70 for pool towels and two charges for drinks at a bar which I never went to. On informing the front desk the girl replied - This bar is located at the pool if you dont know where it is. Annoyed me again, as if I didn't knew where the bar was. She finally removed it after failing to find a receipt. Overall a very annoying stay right after the wedding.

Reviews.Title: “The Vacation Club is Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: xkydox
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Vacation Club for the Thanksgiving weekend. It was amazing. We rent a suite with two conectings rooms. Our Suite was huge! It had a full kitchen, dining room, living room, balcony, two bathroom, two jacuzzi's for 3 peoples (one in the bathroom and other in the balcony) and the bedroom was awesome with the most confortable bed I slept in my years staying at hotels. Ask for the romantic turned down if your staying with your husband, wife or partner.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $$$”
Reviews.Author: MikePagan
Reviews.Content: Overall and service was awful. Worst of all my 6 yr old suffered a rash due to the excess chlorine the pool was autimatically throwing without notice to parents. Her face was severely swollen and red. Not worth the money, venue is great but as for the rest not at all good. Cafe Soleil was the only place worth it. Customer experience rate 0.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed with the service”
Reviews.Author: w0rldExpl0rer_0
Reviews.Content: The Staff was not friendly -front desk- we asked to change our room because it had a strong moisture smell, they said they cannot change because the hotel was full, but it wasn't -another employee confirmed that- finally at my third night they changed it, big difference!. The rooms are nice and clean if you are lucky to not get the smelling ones. The resort is nice but there are no activities at all. The beach cannot be used. We had kids and we needed to use the kids zone at the pool, sadly it was dirt, it has that nasty foam and plastic glasses from the bar. One night somebody stole our shoes at the pool, so it looks it happens at the 'best' hotels too. The pool shape is very nice. The restaurant was not inviting, very pricey and there are no activities at all, it can get boring after two days. In general, it was not an expected experience for a Gran Melia hotel. To the hotel staff: -Include activities -Add kids friendly restaturants/menu at evening. -Keep fresh the rooms, and make sure are in that way all the time -Bring a smile all the times at the front desk, learn to give 'apologies' when you make a fault to the guest. -Make changes to make the guests back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort”
Reviews.Author: marymollymaggie
Reviews.Content: It amazes me that anyone who stays at this lovely resort would not have a car rental for their stay. Did you not look at a map? The car rentals are inexpensive compared to many other destinations and having one opens up all kinds of possibilities. We stayed here in March and loved every minute. Yes, the food is on the expensive side, but having a car, we went out to dinner every night. Also to El Junque rain forest, Fajardo, where we caught the scuba boat, and to a lovely long sandy beach just 10 minutes from the hotel. We also went into Old San Juan to see this lovely area and to have dinner there. We went to the Amigo grocery store and stocked up on snacks and wine and foods for lunch. The only meal we had at the resort was breakfast each day. The buffet is great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facility - Poor service”
Reviews.Author: dld8
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Gran Melia for 4 nights in April. Beautiful hotel, nice faclities and very poor service!! Stayed in the Red level accomodations - which the website leads you to believe you are staying in a "special" part of the resort - not so - was no different than the rest of the place. Only had 2 decent experiences with the staff - waiter at breakfast and the fellow who assisted at the pool. We actually made a comment to the bar tender "how about a smile", he turned away and started making comments in spanish to a co-worker. Too funny because my friend also speaks spanish and knew exactly what he was saying. Needless to say we left the next day and went to La Concha which was much more fun! I am writing a review on our stay there too. Sad that this hotel doesn't have it together - nice faclities and a sour puss staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever at a spectacular resort!”
Reviews.Author: ewilliamsandrallen
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia Resort in Puerto Rico is fabulous!!! I do not know even where to start. The grounds are beautiful and at night the whole place it lit up with soft trail lights, pool lighting and even candles. The open air lobby and main areas are breathtaking with instrumental music playing that really sets quite an ambience of tranquility. The breakfast is to die for with every type of food you can imagine available. Any room/level of service would be great but if you are willing to spend a few extra bucks I would highly recommend upgrading to red level service. You get an ocean view room with jacuzzi on the balcony, free open bar for a couple of hours in pm, butler service, exclusive pool that is adult only and so much more. Eddie, Joshua and Angel were the butlers that made our trip go so well. They went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed. We went on excursions through the hotel which were reasonably priced and well run. If you go I would recommend Culebre and bio-bay...amazing!! We did not have a chance to get to the rainforest but other guests we talked to said it was peaceful and a must do. There are two things you need to know when you go there. They will charge your credit card (or you can pay in cash) a $100 a day for incidentals (meals, excursions, etc...anything you get you just charge to the room). If you do not use the amount held they refund it back. We had no issues with our bill and check out was a breeze. The other thing is you should know that the ocean around the hotel is beautiful but due to a lot of seaweed growth it is not the best for swimming. However, you have clear ocean views from the pools which are spectacular and you can rent snorkeling gear and kayaks. The water is caribbean blue and you can go out in some places but water shoes should be worn. All in all it was the best vacation we have had and I can't wait to go there again. I have no idea why other people have given bad reviews. The Gran Melia and it's staff deserve five stars across the board.

Reviews.Title: “Eh.”
Reviews.Author: stevil555
Reviews.Content: For the price, I guess we got what we paid for. Make sure if you choose this hotel, you get a really good deal, like we did. Room smelled of mildew when we got there; a/c took all night to catch up to heat/humidity. The housekeeping staff would prop open the door the entire time they cleaned (door opened to the outside) so a/c had to start the process again each day. We got a "Flair Card" which was included for Red Level guests. The Flair card was good. We got 20% off meals on site, free breakfast, and drinks at bars. Red Level entitles the guests to some light beer, bad wine or really bad sparkling wine from 6-9pm in the Red Level Lounge and free water bottles. Whatever. Tempo (Italian) restaurant was really weak. Nami (Asian) restaurant was better (fair to good). Pasion (Puerto Rican) restaurant was good. It's not affiliated with the resort although on campus. The bartenders short pour the alcohol at the pool bar and the Avenue Bar (I watched them measure the alcohol short for drinks behind the bar, over and over). 2oz or 1.5oz drinks were poured significantly less than 1.5oz using a stainless measuring jigger. I confronted them and they looked at me like I was crazy, but I wasn't. Trust me, I was repeatedly sober. Beds were surprisingly comfortable. Linens were dirty and not changed when requested. One housekeeper even gave a very audible sigh when she saw that we had put our towels on the ground (to be changed). Housekeeping had to be forced to sweep the room (at least the floor was marble). My wife and daughter got what we believe are bedbug bites nightly. The pool area needs a coat of paint and is really rough to the touch. Other hotels in the same price range seemed like they would be about the same quality, however. The more expensive hotels were much more expensive. We did eat lunch at the Ritz's Mares restaurant on our last day. That was a really good idea, and cost the same as the lack-luster food at the Gran Melia. Oh, yeah, the grounds are beautiful and spacious. Beautiful veneer, but if you scratch the surface at all, it's gross underneath.

Reviews.Title: “Not a beach vacation I would recommend”
Reviews.Author: rearojas
Reviews.Content: We are Sol Melia Vacation Club Members and ususally stay at the Paradisus in Punta Cana, DR. We wanted to try something different and reserved at the Gran Melia in Puerto Rico. We were dissappointed from the beginning of our stay. The Hotel is not located on a beach, it's on a reserve and when it rains the rivers run off comes straight to this area and makes the water dark and ugly. The pool is not kept up to other Melia standards and the service is mediocre. We reported a leak in our bathroom 3 times and still did not receive attention to the problem. The food and drinks are extremely expensive and the prices are not warranted. The location is also an issue. The area sorrounding the property is not appealing and does not feel safe. The rooms in the villas were we stayed were very noce and comfortable. Although equipped with a full kitchen, there was no dishwasher and housekeeping did not clean any of the kitchen items, not even the coffee maker. We used the sleeper sofa and were expected to leave it open during the whole stay so they would not have to make it every night. This was also a change from our other Melia stays. In other worods think twice before planning your dream beach vacation at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: CLML
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 yr old, and I went to this resort for a 6 day vacation. We have been thoroughly disappointed. The main part of the resort is actually very nice. Nice main building and the main pool is pretty nice as well. We came over Memorial Day weekend and it was jammed packed with locals celebrating the holiday. All those people made for a very dirty pool that was never cleaned up after the fact. We had a royal service room which was not worth the money. The only thing it got us was free breakfast each morning, which was great. The food is really not good and is ridiculously overpriced. I would say you'll spend about $70-$90 on food (and thats with a free breakfast). You have virtually no options for outside food venues as the resort is isolated. We brought tons of food with us (b/c of our toddler) and even that didn't cushion the monetary blow we took to pay for gross food. There are NO microwaves or fridges in the room so its virtually impossible to eat anything for meals aside from the hotel food. Now, onto the room. The room itself, at face value, is nice. However as soon as you enter the room you can't escape the smell of mildew. And the humidity. O.M.G, the humidity. Now you would expect it outside, but in the room as well WITH AC blasting?! What do you get when you combine these 2 forces? A sticky, yet cold place to sleep. Not so conducive for comfort OR allergies. Before we came to the resort, I read alot of the reviews and just kinda shrugged and thought we'll have to see for ourselves. Well, every single negative review here has been dead on. Oh, and also, there is no swimmable beach. You have a beautiful coastline with inaccessible public swimming. That was probably my single biggest disappointment. I can swim in a pool at home for free. The staff is really awful. They are unknowledgable and make mistakes constantly. While I understand that PR is Spanish-speaking, you would think working in hospitality at the kind of resort GM "claims" to be, you should be able to converse with people a little bit easier when they screw up your dinner reservation. We rented a car as they had an Avis on site and the rental rate was 3 times the amount more than you would pay normally. Unbelievably overpriced, but worth it for us so that we weren't chained to the hotel and got to at least see Old San Juan (which is very nice). To sum it up, stay away from this place!!

Reviews.Title: “I loved it, but I was informed - so we'll go back!”
Reviews.Author: Dymples805
Reviews.Content: Okay, so let me begin by saying that knowing what to expect ahead of time is the key to enjoying yourself here. I booked our reservations on a 3rd party site, so when I called the hotel to confirm (which was unnecessary), I learned that we would still have to pay the resort fee - because it isn't included in the fee that you pay on priceline, expedia or orbitz. We stayed at the Gran Melia for 9 days and 8 nights! I called ahead to make sure of what would happen at check in and I read on one of the reviews that there was a charge to your card for incidentals. I inquired as to what would happen if we didn't have money on the card to cover incidentals and I was told that we could leave cash at the front for the incidentals, but if we only left the minimum ($100); that our account would be closed - meaning you can't charge anything to the room. This was perfectly okay with me, especially after reading about all of the issues that guests have had on their bill at the check out. I also liked the fact that nothing could be charged to the room, because then every charge would have to be approved by me before payment was made....it worked out very well for us. By the way, the hotel doesn't accept cash as a form of payment, so everything has to be paid with a debit or credit card. This is good to know, especially if you were going to give them a card for incidentals - you may not have funds available after the $100 per day incidental charge and having to pay for things with that same card. So, we gave them $300 cash at check in and used the card to pay for everything. Next, I strongly suggest that you sigh up for a MAS rewards card before you arrive. You don't need the actual card, but you need a printout of the temporary card or the card because it will save you quite a bit on the breakfast buffet. There were 2 of us and we went to breakfast and the bill before the MAS card discount $44. (I can't remember if that was before the tax and gratuity or after, but $44 none the less) and after the MAS card discount which also earns you points the total after tax was$23.54. I thought this price was extremely reasonable with the spread and the cooked to order omelets. We never did eat at any other restaurant on the property because we rented a car. You definitely need a rental car at this property because after you get on the road that the resort is on, it is a 3.9 mile drive to the resort and we met a couple that was going to walk, but even the locals suggested against that. We rented the car from Enterprise and paid around $120 for the week for a compact car. Now, this was extremely reasonable, but remember that there is a charge of $15. per day before tax for self parking. Including this charge, we paid $250 for the week for the car and parking, but that was still incredibly reasonable since the cost per person of a shuttle to and from the hotel from the airport was between $64-$72 per person each way. Then we would have been trapped at the hotel and forced to overpay for the food that may have been mediocre. We wanted to experience local puerto riccan food and without the car, that wouldn't have happened. Gas is sold in liters in PR, so it was $.99 a liter - about $3.78 a gallon, we filled up once the whole week and returned the car. Thanks to having the vehicle, we were able to go down to the Luquillo beach kiosks to eat and relax on the beach several days. There are 60 different kiosks there and about 45 of them were open. We ate at La Parilla twice, the food is excellent, but beware there are no refills on the soft drinks. It may sound ridiculous, but 1 soda was like $2.75 so if 2 of you have a refill and are unaware, the bill is going up quickly. The next place that we loved we El Jeffe - it's a burger place that also has amazing Pina Coloda's, for probably the best price on the island $3 without rum and $5 for the alcoholic version. Jesus, the concierge at Gram Melia suggested trying the kiosks and we were so glad that we did. The resort is on a beach, but it isn't the best beach in PR. However, making the 10 minute trip to Luquillo is definitely worth it. The beach had amazing waves and was consistent - you could walk out and have sure footing. It was great. There is a great bakery "Coco Sweet" that is at the beginning of that drive down to the hotel and they have some amazing donuts. They also serve lunch around 1 and make sandwiches when they aren't serving lunch. We didn't upgrade our room to any of the special services levels, and I was very concerned after reading reviews, but our room was perfect. It was clean, the shower was clean and everything was perfect. The "chambermaid" as they were called, came everyday and did an amazing job of keeping the room clean. Our linen was clean and everything was awesome in this aspect. I would be curious to know what villa or bungalow the people that had dirty rooms stayed in. We stayed in building 2. We were also close enough to things that we didn't need the shuttle service for everything. We met a couple that paid $900. for 3 days in building number 16. This did include access to the private pool, but we didn't need that. The pool at it's peak only had 20 people in it, so it was never busy. Check in and checkout was a breeze, neither took more than 10 minutes, so I was thrilled with that and the service that we received was impeccable. The shuttles may take a little bit to arrive (5 minutes) if you call for one, but they do come and they are very friendly. The casino was quiet during the week and busy during the weekend, the main waitress was horrible. She only came around to offer drinks about once an hour. This didn't matter to me (I don't drink at all) but the premise behind serving continuous drinks at a casino is to get people to be loose with their money. They should fire her and hire one of the other 2 ladies that worked the casino, they did a much better job. They kept the drinks coming and people were gambling into the wee hours of the night. They were kicking people out at 3 when they closed. We will go back to this resort in the future since we had such a positive experience at this resort!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: MrsSharer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Melia for our honeymoon in May. I've been to several all-inclusive resorts in Mexico so I wasn't sure what to expect. We purchased the red level package, which I highly recommend. The service was impeccable. All we had to do is ask and whatever we wanted was delivered or done immediately. The grounds are amazing and the resort is immaculately groomed. This is a great place to just sit back and relax. There is no night life, so if you are looking to party you will want to pick another resort. The food is on par with most four star restaurants with the price of five star. We used the 20% discount card that comes with the red level service and the prices were more doable. Don't forget to present the card, they will not automatically give you the discount. With the red level you get free beer and wine from 6-9 in the red level lounge, which prevented us from ordering alcohol at the restaurants and greatly reduced our bills. You cannot use cash at this resort, everything must be charged to your room. Drinks are very expensive here. On our way to the resort we had our driver stop at a local grocery store which sells liquor. We had a small soft side cooler which we used to bring liquor and mixers to the pool each day to help with the alcohol cost. Of course, we bought some drinks from the bar too and no one ever said anything to us about doing this. Both pools are beautiful, and if the main pool got too busy, we just had our butler set up a bali bed at the private adult only pool where it was always quite and relaxing. You must do the bali beds, if you make reservations with your butler they will make it up for you and decorate it with flowers and it really makes you feel special. The beach was very pretty, but not much for swimming. There is no surf because the waves break at a reef prior to reaching the beach. Honestly, we never missed getting beach time because the rest of the resort was so beautiful. We took the excursion on the catamaran and went snorkeling. We went to a white sand beach with crystal blue water and visited one of the most memorable reefs I've ever seen. This is a must do. If you want to go to Old San Juan, rent a car from at the resort. It was $50 versus a $180 cab ride and the roads are navigable. Just beware that there aren't many street signs once you leave the highway. The resort will provide you with maps and suggestions. There is also a local restaurant called Ritchies that will provide a complemantary car to pick you up if you want to dine off site, just ask your butler to arrange it. The rooms were above average, but not stunning. The bed was very comfortable and our chambermaid cleaned twice a day and provided turn down service. Overall, I was very pleased. We stayed 6 days and our bill from food and alcohol was $900 not including tips, even with being a bit frugal. We felt like this was worth the money with the quality of food and drinks. Suggestions: tip well (it is worth the service you get), use all the amenities available to you to get the most for your money, leave the resort for at least on excursion, try the Puerto Rican restaurant (Passion) and order something you've never tried, and get to know your butlers beacuse they will go above and beyond if you are personable. Overall, well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service and dirty rooms.”
Reviews.Author: jojointx
Reviews.Content: From the website the rooms look beautiful, but they are very run down and dirty!! I would rate this a 2 1/2 star hotel. We were there with a large group and everyone had the same issues we did. The wait service in all of the restaraunts was horrible, and the food was average. WARNING this resort is on a beach, but your can't swim in the water because of rocks and the "beach" or sand area is very limited. This resort is also off the beaten path and you will need to rent a car if you want to go anywhere off the property. Also there is no nightlife if that is what you are looking for. The only bar closes around 10pm.

Reviews.Title: “OVER RATED”
Reviews.Author: opinion1968
Reviews.Content: PR if you have a choice go else where. The Hotel Check in people took 40 mins to find my reservation that I made weeks in advance with credit card info and email info When it rained during our week stay the Movies showed were so poor quality that the color would not come through. Beware if you have kids! Their so called Market, for such a large resort was pitifull! They had 3 post card selections, over priced beaded jewlrey (no unique gifts) and spf spray 30 is $15 if you want anything other than key chains and coffee mugs they suggested that you should go to the mall 20 mins. by car away. In which you can shop at Sears, JC Pennys, Old Navy ect... there is NO Waiter service at the pool bar they have 4 boring restaurants with served cold over cooked food and the Beach is too grassy to swim / no one swims there / the kids club was a cheap backyard playground and the girls in charge only had the kids watching movies / a shame if the movie was adult-base and if it rained all day - that is all the kids would do! This place is expensive and boring especially if it rains and if you don't Gamble (if you do - you will not spend your money at the 1 store they have) - If you are accustom to traveling and like the tropics/beaches enjoy fun with the kids and want good service you will be disappointed at this resort !!

Reviews.Title: “Blah”
Reviews.Author: Jaslach
Reviews.Content: Yes the resort is gorgeous but it's just blah. We went to the ME by Melia in Cancun last year and loooooved it. This, not so much. Yes the rooms do smell like mildew. I thought people were complaining too much in other reviews about it, but there's no way of not noticing the continual mildew smell lol People ARE complaining about having to walk around the resort. The distance from point A to point B isn't bad. Maybe those people don't like to take a 3 minute walk. I don't know. But they do have staff riding around to give you a ride on their golf carts. So for those of you who think walking for 3 minutes is too much, there ya go! This resort is honestly at the end of a pretty shady road lol the locals love parking on the side of the road all throughout Puerto Rico for whatever reason, and on the road leading to the resort, it's no differnt; besides them coming out of the bushes with machetes; again, for whatever reason. DO go into Old San Juan. La Barrachina is delicious. I recomment the crab cakes and pina colada. Golfing at the resort is $140! Another $40 to rent clubs. Looking at the golf club and Trump's other investments, you feel sorry for him. They're really bad investments. But the land is beautiful! Just sorely occupied. The food is okay. It's hard to give compliments having been at their ME by Melia in Cancun. That knocked this place out of the water. If you're more scenic-oriented, wanting to stay by the pool and drink all day, and not minding TNT not working during a Heats and Bulls playoff game lol then this palce is for you! Just be careful about the invisible mosquitos that they have lol obviously you'll wake up the next day with both legs covered in red bumps like my boyfriend and a few other guests did. The pharmacy down the road will be your best friend. You'll soon learn how to mix triple antibiotic ointment with a pharmacist-given cream. Fun times! If by beach you mean the ocean with rocks lining the front of it the entire distance of the resort, then Gran Melia has a beach. Make sure you get a rental car!

Reviews.Title: “The BEST hotel service EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: anniewindy
Reviews.Content: We booked the Red Level Service for our honeymoon and we were a little nervous that it wouldn't be everything they advertised. Yes it is a bit far from San Juan but we knew we weren't leaving the resort. Our three-night stay was amazing!!! From the moment we arrived, it was one delightful experience after another. The hotel itself is gorgeous. If aesthetics matter to you, then this is the place for you. If you are a romantic, then this is the place for you. If you like to relax and rest, then this is the place for you. The food at the sushi restaurant on the property is delicious! Both women sushi chefs (we ate their twice) prepared some of the best combinations we've ever had. We really didn't think the prices were all that pricey. I mean it isn't cheap, but who wants cheap sushi? Now onto one itty bitty tiny negative.... the sheets really do smell. We had to laugh because they really do stink. We surmised that because it is so incredibly humid there, the room is constantly saturated. Which in turn might account for that not so fresh smell. Now onto the pros.... SERVICE! If you like to feel special, this place is for you. The staff and butlers go out of their way. Especially Jose our breakfast waiter, Edgar in the Royal Service Lounge, Eddie another Royal Service Butler, Angel C., and last and most importantly Angel M. He is without a question an asset and a credit to the Gran Melia. We had the time of our lives!!!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Merienda
Reviews.Content: My happiness with our stay could be colored by the fact that I'd just spent several nights at another resort on the west side of the island that failed at everything they promised, where the Gran Melia delivered. I was traveling with my husband and 2-year-old son and approaching the property -- which is stunning -- I was expecting to be treated as a second class citizen for our humble rental car, disheveled appearance (got rained on in the the rain forest) and general exhaustion after a less than ideal stay elsewhere. But we were treated graciously at every turn by staff and guests alike. From the lobby onwards, the property is just breathtakingly gorgeous. Our room was huge and well appointed. The food at Pasion was delicious -- a shade pricey but I expected that. The pool alone is worth the visit. I was so very sad to leave that little bubble of peace. I didn't get to go to the spa, but even just being on the property made my stress melt away. It is for sure not a budget stay. The breakfast was quite expensive -- that was the only part I thought was over priced. But seriously, I had a two year old cranky boy with me and didn't catch flack for it from anyone at any time. These people are golden. There were a fair bit of families there but the property is so big (and the pool is so big) everyone gets their own space. We will be back as often as we can and I wish so much my sister had gotten married here instead of the trap she chose on the other side of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: Eyedoc99
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful. Food and service have much to be desired. Extremely overpriced. They charge you 5 star quality, but the reality is that they should be at most 2 stars. The best meal was a turkey club sandwich!?!? I mean come on! How can you mess up a burger?!? The company Dragonfly which is in charge of the excursions has one of the worse services I have ever experienced! They don't seem to understand the concept of the customer is always right. We wanted to go to a night kayaking tour or an ATV jungle tour. They said that they would call us for availability and we never got a call. Even after we went back to talk to them they said they would definitely call us an NOTHING!!! The green fees are also very expensive. 145-185. I really would not go back. Old San Juan is much more worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Suite but awful bed sheets!!”
Reviews.Author: Atimonan
Reviews.Content: Here it goes, rent a car, it's worth it!! Got a good deal from Hotwire. We're time share owner, so we have a different deal. We stayed on the other side of the resort and we had a big oceanfront suite, one bedroom with a partial kitchen, big living room, nice bathroom with a shower and a jacuzzi tub in separate room, king size bed and a balcony with a jacuzzi tub, two flat screen TV, full size refrigerator, a little stove and a microwave. The room was huge but my complain is the sheets, the room is like 5 star but the sheets are terrible!! Nice towels and soaps, shampoo, conditioner, and body wash smells good. Like I said we're time share owner so you have a different place to check-in, free parking for 1 car, free breakfast on Saturday and Sunday, free drinks like wine, beer, sodas but you have to consume it in the VIP Lounge. You get 4 tokens for laundry and free dishwashing soap and we didn't buy water, you can get it from th VIP Lounge also, just go in with your empty water bottles. Did I say the bed was comfortable!! Oh and we didn't smell the mildew that a lot people complained about. Let me say our swimming pool is clean but the main pool was terribly dirty!! No beach at this resort but a big lawn grass. We didn't try the restaurants we always went out for breakfast and dinner. Breakfast is really cheap at Panaderia by Amigos, my husband enjoyed it (from the resort go Hwy 3, turn left at the light and another left on the next light and it's on the left side across Amigos). There are a lot of restaurants on Hwy 3, you just have to adventure! We wanted to go Culebra but we missed the Ferry so we ended up going to Vieques, didn't really like beach we went and it cost us $20 to get to the beach, roundtrip. Not worth it, don't waste your money!! I've been to so many beaches in the Caribbean, in my opinion it's 2 star. You have to bring your own towels, chairs, food and drinks because they no restaurants on site. The ferry ride cost us $8 roundtrip and $5 parking, not bad!! We wanted to see Flamenco beach on Culebra but the line is really long for the ferry, you have to get there early, and the ferry ride was so rough that I got sea sick on the way to Vieques that's why we didn't go to Culebra. Anyway me and my husband had a nice relaxing time for 1 week at Rio Grande!! This is a nice quiet resort, not a lot of things to do at night. There is a casino but we didn't even go, we're not gamblers. Nice staff at the VIP Lounge, sometimes you could be waiting for a while to get help. By the way watch out for the crazy Puerto Rican drivers, there's a lot of them.

Reviews.Title: “THE CASINO IS FRAUD!!!! I feel so ripped off”
Reviews.Author: Wideawoke
Reviews.Content: I was playing a slot machine when I realized the machine was not working properly and still taking my $$. I called the employee over which he then seen the problem as well. He called his manager over which also saw the issue. After the main guy was called over, the hit cash out and shut the machine off and I was asked to leave and not come back. They claim computers don't make mistakes and that I'm wrong. I was wrongfully treated and almost feel I've been robbed. The hotel claims no accountability for the casino on their property. They way this was handled was wrong and fraudulent. Think about it, stay somewhere else... Not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “This is the worst I ve ever been in and ive done a lot of traveling”
Reviews.Author: islandgirl010
Reviews.Content: Moldy rooms poor service. The only food thing is the weather and the pool. Our room was t ready the we were locked out then it was moldy. The pool is lovely. That is all. Do't even come to this country. Everything is poorly done.

Reviews.Title: “Why does my phone smell so bad?”
Reviews.Author: ettay
Reviews.Content: I need to get the positive out there first: the food is fantastic. For dinner, I went to the Pasion restaurant and had the lobster in garlic sauce, with a side of rice and beans (mixed) -- phenomenal. My fellow diners had the house special, a kind of seafood turducken, and the skirt steak, both of which were devoured with rapture. The Coco Beach Salad with shrimp from the poolside bar was also so gorgeous that I had it 2 days in a row. The shrimp mofongo I had for room service was likewise tasty, although the fruit platter was missing the pineapple I specifically requested. Now that we got that out of the way... Most of the rooms seem to be pretty much identical. Both phones in my room stink like dirty old rags, as do the sheets -- they just don't smell clean. The way the shower was installed made it impossible to use without flooding half the room. All the rooms look like they are in serious need of renovation: at the very least, a new paint and caulking job. Upon check-in, having paid for the room in full, your card gets charged an additional $100 for possible incidentals (shady). You will end up spending a tidy sum during your stay here, because everything on hotel grounds is (unsurprisingly) overpriced, and you're pretty much in the middle of nowhere so you won't be nipping out to the corner store to pick up drinks and suntan lotion. When you get your room keys, you'll also be outfitted with a bracelet -- I'm still not sure what this is for, but don't lose it, because that'll cost you an additional $50. Service is mostly very friendly but amateurish. I stood watching a sullen girl clean out the cash register and organize the bills and coins for 10 minutes before I could pay for my bottle of water. Checking in took over half an hour, with 2 guests ahead of me (and 2 people manning the front desk -- no idea what they were doing). Assume that everything will take twice as long as humanly possible, and you'll be much happier for it. No wifi outside of the lobby area, although sometimes you luck out for a few minutes at a time on the beach or by the pool. You can also pay $15 to use wired Internet -- just bring your own ethernet cable. There was a power outage in my bungalow this afternoon; let's see if we can make it to check-out tomorrow without that happening again. Lots of iguanas and feral cats. All in all, not horrible but I certainly wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT RESORT IF YOU PLAN ON STAYING ON THE RESORT ONLY”
Reviews.Author: PHILLYFREAK
Reviews.Content: We have visited this resort 2 times. The first time was 2 years ago. Some things have changed since then. We elected to get a ocean front "Royal Service Suite" which turned out to be a great move. You had unlimitted drinks from 5-8pm at the lobby bar (anything you wanted all top shelf including shots) since then they have dropped that (which when we booked the 2nd time we did not know) they still have "happy hour" which now is in a quiet room with nothing going on and it is only beer and house wine....very very upsetting! The royal service rooms are spectacular however and the actual resort is very very nice. Since we live so close to the beach at home it was not a big deal that the actual beach area is pretty small and very rocky! The pool definitely makes up for it. All in all it is a great place to stay, it is very far from the airport and downtown San Juan so if you plan on traveling I highly suggest you rent a vehicle. It is very close to El Yunque which is a must. You can also order food to be delivered if you ask the bartenders they will hook you up. I suggest that since the resterants on the grounds are expensive and nothing special. Small casino that is only open in the evening till 12pm

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Go if Your Expectations are Low”
Reviews.Author: sgf1025
Reviews.Content: The review below mine isn't accurate in that she is solely complaining about the catering service that was at the resort of the Jewish holidays. I happened to be there during this time not on the special catered trip and felt like an outsider. The resort is huge. My room was located at the back end of the resort so the trek to the main area was almost a 1/2 mile. While I am young and active it got tiresome. The room was adequate, but dated. It definitely smelled of mildew which is common down in the Caribbean. I get that, but it was way worse in our room versus the room my parents were in. The fan didn't seem to work in the bathroom and things never seemed to dry. We only ate one dinner at the resort. The restaurant service was slow, the meal was pricey, and the food itself was nothing special. The included breakfast was nice, but there wasn't much variety after day 3. We booked a snorkeling tour through their service, and I noticed that it'd be $50 cheaper p/p for us to drive ourselves there (we rented a car, another MUST at this resort). We mentioned we had a car, but it wasn't till I pointed out that it was cheaper to drive ourselves there did they give us that rate. Also they told us to arrive at the boat at 8:00am... we did and the boat wasn't boarding till 9:30am. There is no nightlife and the casino is a bit dated. We did go to the Wyndham down the road for dinner one night with friends and all the amenities of the hotel seemed to be closer together. Also the beach there was much nicer. The beach at Gran Melia was rocky & grassy. If you like to sit and do nothing in a chaise on the grass or at the pool this place is for you. If not, I suggest staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “SUCKY PASSOVER TRIP”
Reviews.Author: mwaingort
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was pretty decent the rooms were nice. the kosher caterer provided the most disgusting food and served in the most obnoxious presentation. From the plastic plates to the wilted lettuce .The food was inedible. When confronting the caterer,Isaac . He simply ignored all the guests. The dining area was constantly filthy, unorganized,and not accommodating . There was no open bar as stated. All the food that we did get was cold. I highly recommend that nobody uses this caterer EVER again !

Reviews.Title: “This is an attractive resort with no substance.”
Reviews.Author: ibfinetwo
Reviews.Content: I vacationed with my husband and adult children during the Easter/Passover recess. Unbeknownst to us, there was a large Kosher Tour group who took over a large portion of the resort during our stay. Their presence definitely affected the atmosphere since quite alot of guests were observant.The grounds are quite attractive, but frankly there's not much offered to guests. There are no outdoor water sports. The beach is scenic, but the water is filled with grasses and plants. There was no night life other than a DJ playing music. The restaurants are quite expensive and the service is slow. Our rooms were at the farthest end of the resort and were not in tiptop shape. Overall we would not stay here again and I'd recommend that you go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: laurenbrooke00
Reviews.Content: This place has horrible service. Nothing for children to do and the restaurants have weird hours and arent always open. there is no one cleaning up at the pool and trash is left laying everywhere. There is also no one to serve you drinks and food around the pool, you have to go up to the poolside restaurant. The upgraded red level service is a waste of money... the only perk that i wanted was a cocktail hour, on the first night i found out that it was only beer and wine, so i cancelled the red level. The excursions available on island are great, but dont book through hotel, book for yourself and get your own transportation,... you will save a ton. Rooms were nice but just a little far from pool and main lobby. Gym was nice and i heard that the spa was nice as well. I just wish there would have been more for kids to do. Customer service needs to be stepped up.... everyone seemed angry and not willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “What a romantic & peaceful beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: MADYJJ
Reviews.Content: I stood here for 4 days with my boyfriend & enjoyed every second!!! The staff was very friendly so I don't understand some of these comments even the older gates man that let's you in is a sweetheart.... Room are so clean & neat breafast buffet delicious, the pool was so beautiful & warm swam at 11:30 pm one nite security guards all over very safe place the landscaping is so perfect!!! & the bar at nite there are candles lid up very romantic settings!! Great music by the pool during the day it's pretty from from the time your make your right or left but it's worth the drive..... Beautiful golf coarse I will return to this hotel, let the gran melia & went to the El San Juan hotel.... What a nightmare is all I can say!!! The 1 only problem I had & it was taken care of someone used my room number for there dinner but it was taken off my bill with no problem & by a very friendly staff member, I recommended this place in a heart beat!!!! We were so sad when we lefted. If your looking for a partying night this isn't the place, if you want romance & peace then book it!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful place !”
Reviews.Author: beachbum1094
Reviews.Content: I can't understand how anyone could have anything negative to say about this place. The people who gave it a bad review are crazy ! This place was paradise, from the incredibly well manicured grounds to the breath taking view on the beach. We loved it so much we're making plans to go back with more family. The food is pricey but very good. you can't go wrong, if you want a relaxing beautiful place to lie in the sun.

Reviews.Title: “If you can go somewhere else -do it”
Reviews.Author: magicmully
Reviews.Content: THe resort is lovely and the food was good but the hassle of getting room cleaned and incorrect charging spoilt our trip. I had read the reviews about incorrect charging so we made sure that when we checked out we had a final copy of the correct bill (as they had overcharged and added incorrect charges) and then when we returned home we found they had put nearly $1000 worth of charges on our credit card! Just hassle we don't need.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the hype - there is nothing wrong with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Klunky01
Reviews.Content: I have seen so many bad reviews on here about the Gran Melia, but I believe there were alot of misunderstandings or the people were being overly critical and/or did not know how to "navigate the system". Really, the only thing wrong with this hotel at all is the over-priced crappy food. Here's the real deal: Hotel: Check-in and check-out were a breeze, except for one thing. When we first checked in and got to our room, our key didnâ€™t work. But that was easily solved â€“ we picked up the courtesy phone in our building and called the front desk. Within 5 minutes, an employee arrived and let us in. They then made us new keys and slid them under the door so we had them the next morning. No problem. The grounds were absolutely beautiful. Lots of iguanas too! The shuttles were usually pretty timely â€“ most of the time we called them, and by the time we walked outside, one was waiting to pick us up. You can also flag them down. Many drivers ask people walking if they need a ride. But our building wasnâ€™t all that far from the main lobby anyway. Hotel advice: 1. Get the Mas card before you arrive. This is a frequent stay card for the hotel similar to a frequent flyer card with the airlines. Itâ€™s very easy to do â€“ go to http://www.solmelia.com/mas-rewards/mas.htm, and click Register Now. They will mail you the card. If you have that card, you can get 2 for 1 breakfast at the buffet breakfast place, CafÃ© Soleil. You can also get a small discount at the other restaurants, but more on those later. 2. Rent a car. Rent a car. Rent a car. I cannot stress this enough. If you do not rent a car, you will be resigned to eating every single meal at the expensive (and not very good) restaurants at the hotel. There are tons of meal options outside of the hotel. Plus then you can drive to other attractions and beaches. Parking is $16/day. You can reserve a rental car ahead of time online, and itâ€™s quite cheap. Itâ€™s way more expensive if you wait and do it from the hotel. Just use Expedia or Kayak.com or something, and pick the least expensive option. We rented from Dollar and had no problems. 3. If you plan on getting Royal Service, do so ahead of time when you are booking. We were planning to do the upgrade when we got to the hotel, but we were unable to because the hotel was fully booked and there were no upgrades available. But we later realized that we arenâ€™t really sure if the Royal Service upgrade is really worth the $50 per person per day charge anyway. Our room was just fine â€“ we were actually in one of the RS buildings but did not have an ocean view room. That was just fine â€“ just step outside and walk 2 steps and there is the ocean. Hotel Restaurants: Pasion â€“ Although this restaurant is on the hotel grounds, Pasion is not actually part of the hotel like the other ones. Itâ€™s owned and operated separately. Thatâ€™s why they donâ€™t accept the Mas card there. This place has authentic Puerto Rican food, which was pretty good. However the service absolutely sucked. Nami â€“ In contrast to Pasion, this Asian restaurant had excellent service and crappy food. CafÃ© Soleil â€“ This is the buffet style restaurant. While we were there, there was a convention in town, so it was never open for dinner unfortunately. The breakfast there was pretty good, as buffets go. They had a waffle/pancake station, omelette station, bacon/sausage/eggs/potatoes, bread/pastries/fruit/cereal. The breakfast price includes coffee and orange juice. Remember to use your Mas card here for 2 for 1 breakfast. If youâ€™re Royal Service, your breakfast is free. Puerto Rico in general: Itâ€™s ok to drink the water. We drank tap water all week and were absolutely fine. Pretty much everybody speaks English, but obviously the preferred language is Spanish. There are fast food restaurants practically on every block â€“ especially Burger King, McDonaldâ€™s, Subway, and KFC. These are all very close to the hotel, in Luquillo. If you plan to drive there, be aware that Puerto Ricans do not believe in using turn signals. If you are used to driving in a large metro area, you will do just fine. If youâ€™re expecting it to be leisurely and scenic, you will be disappointed. They drive pretty aggressively, and as long as you conform to that driving style, youâ€™ll do fine. As for the scenery, our hotel is not in that great of an area. In fact, the surrounding area is pretty run down. There are some scary looking â€œrestaurantsâ€� on the side of the road, and every building/ house in the area has bars on the windows. Thatâ€™s really what we experienced in most parts of Puerto Rico that we drove to, with the exception of Old San Juan. Things we did: Camuy Caves â€“ If you have a rental car, this is a highly suggested attraction to drive to. The drive is long, as itâ€™s on the other side of the island â€“ I think it took us over 2 hours to get there, and when we got there, THE CAVE WAS CLOSED. We were so mad and disappointed. Sometimes they close it due to cave flooding. But while youâ€™re out that way, you can always go to the nearby Arecibo Observatory, so itâ€™s not a total wasted trip. Arecibo Observatory â€“ This is the worldâ€™s largest radio telescope. Itâ€™s quite impressive to see, and they have a visitorâ€™s center you can walk around in. This telescope was featured in the movie Contact. We had a very yummy pina colada here at the little shack on the hike up to the observatory. Foodie Tour â€“ We did the Flavors of San Juan Foodie Lunch Tour. While we were glad we did the tour, we were slightly disappointed in it. We felt it wasnâ€™t worth the money. But we did get to sample foods we wouldnâ€™t have otherwise known about, and we got an Americanâ€™s view of how it is to live in PR. There are other food tours there that may be better â€“ google them. Segway Tour â€“ This was one of the highlights of our trip! We booked through Segway Tours of Puerto Rico, and did the Fortifications tour. This tour was worth every penny ($84 pp). Itâ€™s so fun to ride Segways, the scenery was amazing, the obstacles were fun (done in Old San Juan), and it included a tour of El Morro (a must-do!). You catch the tour at the pier where the cruise ships doc. So, so fun. Vieques â€“ If you can, I highly suggest a side trip for a couple of days to the island of Vieques. We flew Cape Air in a 6-seater Cessna plane to get there. Vieques has a much different feel than PR. Itâ€™s a small pristine island with great beaches and breezy island open-air bars and restaurants. But the best thing on Vieques â€“ something I am very thankful to have done in my lifetime â€“ is swimming and kayaking in the Bioluminescent Bay. Also known as Mosquito Bay, this is the best and brightest place in the world to see the glowing water. Google it, and DO IT. It is the experience of a lifetime. Luquillo Beach / kiosks â€“ Luquillo Beach is actually quite nice, and a very short drive from the hotel (10 min?). They have full facilities there, which you pay like $2 per person for. Showers, lockers, bathrooms, etc. You can rent beach chairs and umbrellas as well. Snorkeling there was undesirable (no fish), but the beach scenery is beautiful â€“ white sand, palm trees, blue water. Reminded me of Hawaii. There are a ton of tiny restaurants they call â€œkiosksâ€� right along the side of the road, near the beach. Itâ€™s very odd, because every single one of them had the same food â€“ all fried stuff. The food was â€œokâ€�â€¦most of it had been sitting under a heat lamp all day when we were there. But you should experience it at least once. Old San Juan â€“ Take a drive to Old San Juan one day and just walk around. Itâ€™s much like the French Quarter in New Orleans with the wrought iron balconies and cobblestone streets. And the forts are there to add to the scenery, as well as the ocean. They have some really good restaurants around there. One of our best meals was at Old Harbor Brewery â€“ a steakhouse in the heart of Old San Juan. El Yunque Rainforest â€“ Drive to the rain forest. This is a must-do, and itâ€™s easy to do because itâ€™s quite close to the hotel. Visit the Visitorâ€™s Center there, and take the scenic drive up the mountain, through the rainforest. Stop and take a short hike if you want. Itâ€™s VERY scenic, and you can do as little or as much as you want to. You could spend an hour there or you could spend all day there.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: babyzena
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews on this resort prior to our arrival and I must say I was shocked at all the negative responses given, now that I have been there. From the time of our arrival to the time of our checkout we have nothing but wonderful memories, the staff could not be more accomadating, the grounds were beautiful, the food was excellent. Our room was a Junior Suite and it was very spacious with a wonderful view of a pond right off our balcony, our room was done everyday and fresh white towels were given. I will recommend this resort in a heartbeat. Thank you Gran Melia for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful resort that was well worth the trip!!!”
Reviews.Author: hoosierhoot
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews here, my wife and I were a bit nervous about going to the Gran Melia Golf Resort in Puerto Rico. But after we arrived and spent a wonderful vacation there, we have nothing but positive comments and praise for the resort. The food at all the restarurants was really good. A bit pricey at Tempo and Nami as well as Pasion but worth the value. If you like large cheeseburgers and fries, salads, wraps and overall good food for the price, then Cafe Soleiol and the Wet Bar by the Lagoon Pool are the places to go. What resort can you go to and get a large cheeseburger and hefty amount of fries for $14.00. Not bad for both eh? The service at the resort is wonderful, the conceriege to talk to is Jesus! He is truly a gentleman who enjoys his job. He can make all your dinner reservations and any other requests you might need happen! We had Ricardo as our bellman who took us to our room and insisted on carrying all the luggage to the room. He was very kind and friendly to us and throughtout our vacation at the resort he was there if we needed anything. We stayed in a Deluxe Gardenview Suite that was very spacious with a King Bed, large living area and balcony. The bathroom was huge with an updated roman theme look. Very nice and pleasureable to stay in. Renting a car is not the way to go in Puerto Rico! It is easier to take a taxi to where you need to go to visit or tour. Our tourista taxi driver Harry was the man for the job. He took my wife and I around Old San Juan for a tour as well as dropping us off for a 5-hour break to do some shopping and tour Old San Juan. The Fort at El Morro as well as San Cristobal is definently a place to tour and visit. The museum was nice as well, alot of history to be seen explored and seen in Old San Juan. If you need assistance with making reservations to the Gran Melia in Puerto Rico, go thru Liberty Travel. Very prompt, upscale service that takes all your worries away about scheduling a fun, relaxing vacation to the Carribean.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't want to do ANYTHING, than stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Happycrys
Reviews.Content: I will try to keep this short simple and informative: First things first, RENT A CAR! A roundtrip ride to and from the airport is $71 per person, a compact car is about $150. Also, any trips that you will want to take, either to the El Yunque Rainforest, La Cuelbra, or downtown to Old San Juan is at least $35 per person. I took a trip last year to Old San Juan using their tour service Dragon Fly and although I enjoyed it, it starts at 8:30 am, and there is a lot of extra walking and touring that may not be of interest, if you just want to shop and see the city. PR, is pretty easy to navigate, traffic wasn't too bad, and we didn't have to use much gas. Put in your GPS Calle 3 @ 955, because the Hotel address may not show up on your GPS. But in any case, once you get on Calle 3, its about a 20 minute drive, then you will see the sign to the resort. Stop by one of the local grocery stores and pick up some liquor, snacks and drinks, it will easily save you TONS of money. Our room was beautiful, clean and comfortable. We didn't smell any mold or mildew. There is no carpet in the room, so for me, it added to the cleanliness. Just be sure to flip over the cards in the bathroom and night stand if you want clean sheets amd towels every day. If you can, try going in the early part of the week, we stayed Monday-Saturday and Mon through Wed, we basically shared the resort with just a few people. We practically had the beach to ourselves. Make sure you get a MAS card as soon as you arrive. It will get you two for one breakfast and 10% off at the restraunts Tempo and Nami but NOT the Puerto Rican restraunt Pasion. Again, if you have a car, you may be able to find some better food off the resort. The food was just OK, not spectacular. Especially lunch, you are better off driving ten minutes to Burger King to get a Whopper for $2.99 then spending $14 on an average cheeseburger by the pool. The dinner portions were large, but not really worth the price. Gratuity is automatically charged to your bill. Service is very slow, but hey, you are supposed to be relaxing and no need to be in a rush. And honestly, if you are worried about money, you can get away with eating a big breakfast at the buffet, and then eating a decent sized dinner as well. So if you don't plan on playing golf, there is absolutely nothing to do on the resort except for sitting by the pool, sitting by the beach, eating a drinking and going to the Casino. THATS IT! There are no water sports, the beach is extremely rocky, you will defintely need water shoes if you plan on going any where near the beach. Everything that you can do is off the resort, so again, rent a car! We enjoyed doing absolutely nothing, so it was fine for us, we didn't go anywhere except for an occasional off resort lunch. We didn't want to be bothered, and I liked the fact that there wasn't people around telling us what we could and couldn't do like at some other resorts. There is also a spa there, which has a private pool and hot tub that you can use if you book a massage. My boyfriend said it was little pricey because he felt that the accomodations were below his standard. It was my first massage, so I didn't know what to expect, but I absolutely enjoyed it. And after all of the walking we did just on the resort, a massage was needed! The Casino was very small, not busy, but we did win a couple hundred playing black jack. However beware, they do not offer comps!! So if you lose a lot of money, don't expect a restruant voucher! I also wouldn't reccomend the resort for children, again because there is nothing to do except go to the pool and feed iguanas. Also, on the Friday night we were there, there was a man with a very high powered telescope. If you see him, check him out. He showed us some beautiful shots of the moon, and we even got to see Saturn! All in all it was a great trip. The resort was beautiful and well kept. It is very romantic. I would stay here again. but not for 5 days, I would defeintely stay just for a few days of relaxation and stay somewhere else maybe at the Wyndam at Rio Mar (where I stayed last year) its not as nice as Gran Melia, but the beach is better, a little busier, and more things to do.

Reviews.Title: “overall great place, rent a car if you go.”
Reviews.Author: jason75
Reviews.Content: My review pretty much mirrors most of the others already posted. Beautiful resort. Immaculate grounds keeping. It is Secluded. Rent a car and eat in town, about 10 minutes drive. Be sure to get directions to the Gran Melia from the hotel itself as the directions we got from rental car place were not accurate. Its a 30 minute drive and was fairly simple. Hotel is about 15 mins from El Yunque, 35 mins from Fajardo, the town where the bio bay tours are and also ferries to Culebra and Vieques. Luquillo Beach is about 15 mins away, it was a beautiful beach, easy to find, bathrooms and food kiosks. We ate at Antojitos and Richies cafe in town. Both were clean, charming and food was good. They are both on the same road off the main hwy and are about 12 mins. from resort. Also worth eating at is Coco Sweet which is 5 mins from the resort. The pastries were fresh and delicious. We had local food for lunch at Coco Sweet and it was also very good. Great prices too. The restaurant prices were very high. 3$ per soda adds up, 7-8$ for alcoholic bevg. We ate a few meals there. 70$ and up easily for family of 4. We brought water, gatorade, snacks etc to leave in the room and bring to the pool etc. You will be charged for almost everything there. Parking, refrigerator usage in room (25$ for the entire stay.) etc. You can get trolley service to and from your room for those who do not wish to walk. You can swim in the water at the beach, it's great snorkeling, but is not your typical beach. A word of advice, the ferries to Culebra and Vieques have priority boarding for local residents. Then they board toursists. Several of us were not admitted on the ferry to Culebra so instead went to Vieques.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: digioral
Reviews.Content: Just emerging from a long New England winter, we were really jonesing for some sun. We figured Puerto Rico was a perfect weekend getaway from Boston, due to the short direct flight. We booked this trip on Monday, were PR bound on Thursday, and the Gran Melia provided us with EXACTLY what we were looking for for the weekend. The Resort: The resort is gorgeous and very well kept. Yes, it is a little bit secluded... but for a 3 day trip I had no intentions of leaving the resort anyways :-). I spent most of the trip on the beach at the resort (while the pool is lovely, it gets a bit noisy). There are plenty of secluded areas on the beach that we usually felt like we were the only ones there. Also, the mountain looming as the backdrop made the resort feel particularly exotic (many times while walking on the beach I really felt like I was in Hawaii). Upon reading some of the negative reviews before going, I was a bit nervous... but i have to say that I didn't encounter any of these issues while there. I found the beach gorgeous, the food appropriately priced for a Caribbean resort, the grounds clean and updated, and the location perfect. For what you pay (I think we paid around $180/night), I would definitely recommend the Gran Melia. The Food: Yes, the food is "pricey," but it is no more expensive that any other resort in the Caribbean. SIGN UP FOR THE MAS SOLIA CARD! This gets you 50% off breakfast (making the total for 2 for a hot breakfast $18) and 10% other places on the resort. I would the breakfast to be exemplary. The food was delicious and the service was doting. All other meals are pretty standard resort fare. The Service: I knocked of a star primarily for the service. I did often find myself ignored by hotel staff (except at breakfast). But, this wasn't a huge deal for me... because I was on vacation, so who cares if I had to wait a few minutes for my drink :-) All in all, I would definitely recommend the Gran Melia. It is a quintessential Caribbean resort filled with palm trees, elegance, and romance.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Melia was simply beautiful and a great buy”
Reviews.Author: DanielleFields
Reviews.Content: The resort was lovely. Our room (junior suite) was beyond spacious and looked as though it was recently updated. My main buikding was breathtaking and the cabana's eveywhere (inside and out) were wonderful and complimentary. The dinner food at the Puerto Rican restuarant was average as was the pool rwstaurant. But the beauty of the place made up for what was lacking in food quality. With the exception of breakfast on 2 of our 4 days, we ate all other meals offsite, but we would have done that even if the food was excellent. The location is not an issue if you have a rental car (about a 20-25 minute drive to Old San Juan if you use the toll road). it was real close to the rain forest. If you really enjoy lounging on the beach, you could be disappointed becuase the sjoreline along the property is not very deep and as a result walking along the beach with your feet in the water is not a pleasant experience becuase the terrain is full of broken shells, etc. However, the pools were great and picturesque and more than made up for that fact.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: Dostr4111
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Gran Melia during April 2011. One can only be impressed with the breathtaking beauty of the facility itself. The scenery around the immediate property is beautiful and certainly conducive to relaxation and the feeling of getting away from from everyday cares. In general, the staff were very friendly and accommodating and very responsive to the needs of the guests. We were never disappointed in the answers to our inquiries and the fulfilling of our needs. There are a variety of restaurants on the property. Most of them are very pricey. We ate at several of the restaurants and particularly the Asian restaurants was a real treat. One evening we dined at the hibachi table and was truly entertained by the chef and the quality of the food was exquisite. The breakfast buffet at the Cafe Soleil was excellent. They offered very fresh fruit and omelets, pancakes and waffles cooked to order. The negative comment we have about the food was the small pool side eatery ( Wet Pool Bar & Grill) that was extremely pricey and the quality of the food was poor. Drinks at the bar were very expensive (approximately $10 a drink). This high drink prices tends to put a damper on your pool side partying. The pool accommodations and other outdoor facilities was very relaxing and very appealing to the eye. Alongside the poolsides, they offer small very tasteful Spanish styled ceramic roofed cabanas with with soft mattresses and pillows that are very conducive for sleeping. resting and reading with adequate shade from the hot tropical sun. Our overall impression of the facility was very good. We would recommend the resort to our friends and would return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: chrisngary
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Resort is beautiful but needs to be better kept. The rooms huge but were not cleaned, pool was dirty, lounging chairs were very old. It is a shame since the resort is very big and has lots of potential. The people running the place really need to take a look at re-training their staff to do a better job at the upkeep of the place. It would be very simple as cleaning does not cost much. The place has everything there already, including elegance...just needs a little more TLC. The staff was very helpful and friendly. The beach is not much for swimming or snorkeling, but very beautiful to sit and enjoy the scenery. We only ate at the breakfast buffet, not the dining restaurants therefore can not comment on those. If you do stay here, be prepared to walk a fair bit as the place is so big, it takes lots of walking to get around. There are some staff members who drive around in golf carts and will take you where you want to go as long as one comes by when you're out and about.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: MarkOrlando034
Reviews.Content: The best vacation ever no doubt about it , i will dying to go again and again, their food, service , cleanliness, courtesy, paradise in all the sense of the world

Reviews.Title: “OH you need to read this review!!!”
Reviews.Author: justaword
Reviews.Content: i will start with, i have never taken the time to write a review ever, however this place is a real MESS!!, i can not believe it has the Trump name!! Chesseeey!!! Good Part: The hotel has taken a great amount of land and its nice not great! Our room was very big and the AC worked so well it never turned off, we had to get someone to come and control it. The staff was very nice. check in and out was fast and easy. Bad: the rooms need to be updated with new things because our bed & sheets and everything in there was just straight up old! even the towels are dirty, i mean they were white at one point , i think but they really need to get new ones ..so stained and dirty, ( bring your own). Our room was never cleaned only the beds made. ( i know this because there were leaves in the hallway that made it in our room and stay there for the 4 days we were there). OH and the FOOD! GOD HELP THEM! They suck Big time. you pay $40 for lunch at the Wet Grill and want to keep yourself . the Burger bad, steak bad, even a F**King Salad with grill chicken bad! There are no umbrellas just pool chairs and then the beach..they lied..they lied the beach is a joke rocks, dirt, mud and if you are a bird watcher great for you, because they are all in the water , in the pool area and pooping in the chairs as you read a book!! you need a car to get out quick!! best of all was that i was able leave a day before i just could not take it! I rather have taken a stay at the "Holiday Inn" in Detroit .

Reviews.Title: “This place is beautiful but the service is atrocious!!”
Reviews.Author: jayatl2011
Reviews.Content: We last week, March 27 - April 2 for our honeymoon. Upon arrival we were supposed to have a bottle of champagne and strawberries. There were neither in the room. We called management and after two hours we finally received it. It was around 11:30PM when we arrived and there was also no room service available. Two days later we waited one hour in the vacation club to speak with someone regarding renting a car, we then went back to the room and tried calling the vacation club / front desk and were constantly getting no answers and or dropped off. The guy at the Avis desk was handling the paperwork and washing the cars and delivering to the customers!! After 3 hours of badgering, we finally got a car and were able to go visit San Juan. The next night we ate at Passion, the Caribbean restaurant. My wife bit into something as hard as a rock in her rice and beans and was so disgusted she had to be excuse herself from the table. My lobster was completely overcooked and had the texture of a rubber tire. We tried to explain the problem to the server, who was offering no type of remorse or suggestions so we asked for a manager. The manager/head chef came out in the middle of the restaurant and threw her hands out and yelled "Whats your problem!" We explained the issue and she yelled at us explaining my wife ate a caper or olive!! Then the server had the nerve to bring us a check for our two glasses of wine. To top everything off we had arranged for a shuttle home with dragon fly the final day at 5:00 AM for a 7:30 flight at the airport in San Juan. No shuttle showed and at 5:20 we scurried to the front desk to find out what happened. Finally at 5:40 we were placed on another shuttle van and barely made it in time for our flight!! If you have any problems and try to go to the front desk, the manage will tell you that Avis, Passions, or even Dragon Fly are outside companies in which they have no control over. They provide 0 accountability for anything on the resort that goes wrong and gave us no compensation or even apology for the way we were treated. The room and resort was beautiful and well kept, but if you're looking for good service, forget about it! Even at restaurants and bars we were constantly waiting to be served. This place is a joke at providing 5 star or even 1 star customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for 2 nights.”
Reviews.Author: A_Thru_Z_Travels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Melia for 2 nights prior to our Cruise our o San Juan. It is a little out of the way, but it is a very nice resort. The rooms were very clean and the beds are HUGE!! We spoke to some people that stayed for 5 nights there, and the one thing they said about the Gran Melia was that there wasn't any activities after the 2nd or 3rd day. The beach isn't that great, no snorkeling, and it's quite a drive to go anywhere else. I would highly recommend staying for at most 2 nights before a cruise, or as part of your travels through Puerto Rico. It is a big resort, and walking to your suite is a workout. They are more than happy to give you a ride on the golf carts. Just stop at the front lobby or call them from your room for a pick-up. I read some reviews about the mildew smell in the rooms. Yes most of the rooms have that, if not all. I don't think you can avoid that because of the location of the resort. When I traveled to Costa Rica, every hotel we stayed at had the same smell. It's the humidity and ocean air that cause it. So if you don't like the musty smell, don't go to those countries. Use AVIS and your parking pass will be validated by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: jsindo1
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 days and was crazy to leave the beds were very small none of my family slept well the bed were old, one of them was broken and no one helped us with the problem, the sofa bed was terrible. The hotel was beautiful and we loved the area. The room service was very bad on a day no one was to make the room. But another problem had no clean towels. My stay was rather terrible I hope to solve these problems. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Remote Relaxing Resort - Terrible Beach”
Reviews.Author: rrw715
Reviews.Content: The good - Beautiful hotel grounds, several pools, comfortable rooms and beds and a relaxing setting. Costs were in expectation of "resort" style.. i.e. moderately higher prices on all food and drinks due to the convenience factor. MAKE SURE to sign up for Melia MAS reward program for 50% off at the breakfast buffet. Our group passed on the Royal Service add-on, after reading reviews i just didnt feel the upgrade was worth it. The bad - You most certainly should get a rental car, as the hotel resort is tucked away and you will likely want to get off the property to visit other areas of the island and for a reasonable (and tasty) dinner. (the hotel food was very blah). No Wi-fi in the rooms, which for the price of the rooms was a major let down. The ugly - While the hotel pool was nice, the beach at this resort was pathetic. Small, very rocky, no ocean waves and alot of seaweed algae and other crap which made the water extremely uninviting. In comparison to several other beaches on the island this was indeed a huge let down.

Reviews.Title: “just what the doctor ordered...”
Reviews.Author: worktovacation1
Reviews.Content: This is the type of vacation my boyfriend and I needed. Soaking in the sun, relaxing, drink in hand. This is not the place to go if you are looking for a wild night life. We both had a great time, this is a perfect couples resort, it is also very family friendly, but if you need to get away from it all this is the place to go. There were plently of guests during our stay, but we were always able to find our own private place on the beach/hammock/lounge chairs, it sometimes felt like we were the only ones there. I highly recommend the Red Level accomodations, full buffet breakfast, private pool, bali beds included, free internet access, unlimited beer, wine and champange from 6:00 pm until 9:00 pm, they will actually give six packs to go... The rooms were large, private balcony, really comfortable beds, immaculate. We had a couples massage at the spa, it was great, 20% off with the flair card! I'm from New York, the resort wasn't pricey at all, we ordered in dinner from room service every night or watched the sunset at the outdoor grill, it was very reasonable. We didn't eat in any of the 3 fancy restaurants for dinner, we went to live in our bathing suits and that's what we did. We also bought our own vodka with us from home and snacks, it wasn't a problem at all. They sell alcohol and snacks at the gift shop, so I don't understand why other people are saying it's against resort policy, the price of alcohol in the gift shop is very expensive. The resort is very big, they have golf carts that you can call and be picked up at your room, or you can just flag one down to get from point a to point b. The staff was very courteous, clean cut and well groomed, it looks like someone inspects them daily. Iguana's run free, watch your drink's, they like rum... We had a late flight out, they have a changing room, with a shower and all immenities right were they hold your luggage, a real nice way to end your stay. The Gran Melia is a piece of heaven on earth, can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - a bit remote, you need a car!”
Reviews.Author: BigCheeseOxford
Reviews.Content: Hotel â€“ the hotel is remote, about 3 miles off Route 3. You really need a car unless you are happy to just chill in a resort. If you drive from the airport â€“ head for Fajardo (East along the Route26 which changes into the toll road Route 66.
