Go all the way to the end of the toll road ($1.50) and you come to traffic lights and a T-junction, go right towards Fajardo. You are now on Route 3. The Gran Melia is quite well signed, off to the left after a few miles (2?). It takes around 30mins if no traffic jams. Join the â€˜MASâ€™ loyalty Club before you go for 2-for-1 breakfasts (continental $12, full $17) and 10% off restaurant meals. Also I had a free bottle of champagne since it was my birthday (another MAS club thing, but you have to ask for it). Also as a MAS member you can more easily get a late check out for free. The â€˜MASâ€™ desk in the lobby also has very good tourist information. They have copied sets of detailed driving instructions to a variety of places to go and are very helpful. There was a $15 + tax charge for parking (why?). I booked through Priceline so got a good price for my room BUT when we checked out there was an additional $12 per night. We asked and it was something to do with Priceline only paying part of the 23% tax, so the hotel had to get it from us! Apparently they are in negotiation with Priceline to sort this out. If I had known in advance that would have been fine, but I was not please as it added nearly $100 to our stay! Rooms were nice, canâ€™t work out why everyone complained about how far away from Reception the rooms were â€“ do they never walk anywhere? Itâ€™s a nice stroll, say 0.15 mile (5 minutes) or golf carts come along often. The toiletries were very nice and if you need extra coffee I just left a note for the maid to always leave 4 coffees and 6 creamer packs. I put a few little items in the mini-bar and our maid left them there â€“ some cheese and chocolate and small milk cartons. Beds very comfortable. Free wi-fi in reception and restaurant/public areas. Very few beach umbrellas but plenty of shade under palm trees. Towels can be supplied form a hut near the pool or Reception. There is an Amigo supermarket nearby â€“ like a small Walmart, also a Walgreens and a Burger King. Turn left on Route 3 head, itâ€™s at Marker 28km. Nice day out is drive to Fajardo (30min drive turn left on R3). Get the passenger ferry to Culebra ($2 one way) ferries are at 0900, 1300 and 1900 return at 1300 and 1700, so a great day out is go on the 0900 and return on the 1700. There is a parking lot near the ferry terminal for $5.25 per day. The Ferry is signed from Route 3. Allow plenty of time to allow for rush-hour traffic (we left at 0750). 1hr 10mins on the ferry to get to Culebra, you arrive at the main town called Dewey. Lots of mini-buses to beaches â€“ good one is Flamenco Beach - $3 each way or $5 return. There are toilets (very basic) and kiosks with snack food just off the beach. A beach umbrella + 2 sun-beds are $25 for the day. Azure sea, soft sand right into the sea. â€œThe Kiosksâ€� are a set of eating places ranging from restaurant quality (No 2) to snack shacks. At No 2 our bill was $65 for 2 beers and 2 entrees, slow service. We liked No 36 best nice food, good size portions, reasonable price ($40 for 2 drinks, 1 appetizer, 2 entrees), good service. We also ate at the Ceviche hut (No 38 Peruvian) which was quite nice. The beach behind them is NOT good, it is full of litter and debris. You can drive to Old San Juan about 30 minutes â€“ there are a few parking garages but you might also get a spot on the street. We also had a day trip to Ponce, which was a very charming old Spanish town â€“ around 1hr45min on fast roads through interesting countryside. There is a tourist trolley ($2) and some interesting buildings like the 1883 Fire Station (which is also a tourist information centre), a Cathedral and the Armstrong-Poventud Residence ($3 admission) just off the main square. Also ask directions to the board-walk which had snack shacks. Nice trip. The El Yunque Rainforest was a good trip â€“ take a picnic. Its about a 20 min drive. If you have a National Park card, take it for free admission to the orientation centre which was worth a visit. The rainforest is well signed, turn left once you hit the Route 3 and its off to the right. If you like to hike it would be great.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: radge44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Gran Melia in late March. There have been no "additional" charges to our credit card and overall our experience was great. The facilities were beautiful and we were really happy with our experience overall. For our future trips to Puerto Rico we plan on returning each and every time.

Reviews.Title: “Not for those traveling on a budget”
Reviews.Author: APJrzGrrl
Reviews.Content: I got an excellent deal from Cheap Caribbean. If I'd paid full price, I'd be angry and disappointed. The resort is very pretty, but they nickel and dime you. Nothing is complimentary except the toiletries in your room. If you go here you will need a car. The cost of a day trip to San Juan was $55/person. There were 5 in our party so we opted for a car. I should have called Avis rather than go through the desk at the hotel. They only had a mini-van. I rented it for one day then called Avis and got a smaller car sent to me. There is no wi-fi in the rooms and it will cost you $10 for every 15 minutes you use their lobby computer. The food is expensive at the resort, but nearby there is a very good bakery called Coco Sweet. We also found a grocery store, Ralph's, where we bought some food and drinks to have in our room. Warning: This was against resort policy and we smuggled it in. I thought this was a bit ridiculous. They seemed to want to get every penny out of us that they could. The pool is beautiful, but there are not enough umbrellas. You can rent one of the pretty "bali beds" they show on their site for a start of $35/day. So if you don't want to burn get an umbrella early or put up the cash for the shade. I've never had to buy shade before. The beach is pretty, but it is pebbly so don't expect a sandy white beach. However, the water is warm and lovely. You will need a car to get to the nicer beaches north of the resort. Our room was very nice and big. I really liked the patios. It would have been nice to have more than two chairs for it though since there were three in our room. We did have a few issues. Our safe was very touchy and we had to hold it tightly shut to get it to lock. One night I woke to the toilet overflowing onto our bathroom floor. I called and was told they were having problems with the pipes "did I want someone to come and mop the floor?" "umm. Yeah". They came, but our toilet did not work again until the next afternoon. No apologies offered and nothing in the way of can we make that up to you. Not even a free drink. Nothing here is offered complimentary. A few days later the toilet backed up again and at least then they fixed it quickly. We ate at two restaurants. Pasion, the Puerto Rican restaurant was good. They aren't part of the hotel though. Tempo, the Italian restaurant was not so good. After that we rented our car and we went to the kioscos down on Luquilla Beach. Those were great! I think I still would have let all of this go, but on the last day when I went to check out there was a long line and only one person at the desk. Everyone was having problems with their bills. Several people showed me that they'd been double billed for their rooms. Others had charges from restaurants they'd never been too. It was frustrating and I finally grabbed a bell boy and asked for help. He was great. He went into action and got everyone's room number and bills. We made it out of there with only 5 minutes to spare before we'd miss the shuttle to the airport. I recommend that you check your bill the night before you leave to avoid this mess in the morning. Be careful with your room charges and if you have a flair card double check to make sure they always applied the discounts. They often "forget". I didn't use the spa because it was out of my budget. I also didn't opt for the tour of Sol Melia which gives you some perks because I didn't want to waste my time looking at condos. Overall, I got a great package price. I like to travel and I think Puerto Rico was wonderful. I think next time I'll stay in San Juan. Gran Melia is the place for you if you've got a big budget and want to stay in a resort and relax. If you want to sightsee and enjoy the local culture then definitely rent a car and do it online before you get there. Once at Gran Melia only the room is paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: happycampermtl
Reviews.Content: no beach..lot of rocks and no clear bathroom cheap furniture bad smell in the room iron / hair dryer not functionning

Reviews.Title: “The worst stay every at a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: adiindc
Reviews.Content: As mentioned by other members of this forum â€œThey will charge extras to your credit card after check out! Beware...â€� Be ready to wait in line for check in and check out.Our room had a weird smell and we had to change our room.The toilet in the new room was clogged and nobody informed us that the hotel was doing a pipe maintenance. Worst decision every made had to book this resort as there were no available rooms at Wyndham Rio.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, friendly staff, terrible beach, ridiculously expensive food and drink.”
Reviews.Author: YoungJosh
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a place to hang out by the pool all day, this is a great hotel, as long as you don't mind paying $10 for an average Mojito and $27 for a medium pepperoni pizza. If you want to swim in the ocean, lay out on the beach, eat authentic food, and experience Puerto Rico, stay somewhere else. The pool is very nice and big, and wasn't crowded at all during our stay. The beach is very rocky and has a lot of seaweed. I saw one person the entire week swimming in it, and maybe 10 people laying out by the beach. This hotel is very close to El Yunque, a great National Forest site with a lot of trails and waterfalls. It is also only about a 30 minute drive from the ferry to Culebra Island. You will need a car if you plan to stay here and see anything outside of the resort. The room was very nice and spacious, and though housekeeping was spotty and came at different times every day, they cleaned the room very well. Our room had a kitchenette instead of a balcony, and was located in Bungalow 1, but this is the only building that had kitchenettes. We went to Wal-Mart about 15 minutes away to buy groceries. There was a sign saying no outside food or drink, but they didn't care. The one thing the security guards did care about was coolers. You cannot bring a cooler onto the property. Kind of ridiculous, but they were stopping people who had coolers and telling them they could bring the contents, but not the actual cooler. So, people would carry their coolers all the way back to their cars and then bring the bags of food and drink back to their room. The concierge was incredibly friendly and helpful. She helped us figure out a lot of things we wanted to do. Take a day and go to Culebra Island - Flamenco Beach. It was absolutely the best beach I have ever seen. The water was like pool water, clear all the way out even when you're in over your head. There is a coral reef there that is easy to swim to, and if you bring snorkeling gear, you can see all of the tropical fish and reef life. In addition to the room charge, it was $16 per day for parking and $12 per day for a resort fee. There is free internet, but bring your own cable so you don't have to buy one from them. The wireless internet is not free.

Reviews.Title: “They will charge extras to your credit card after check out! Beware...”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedTrveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 5 days and the trip was all paid for through priceline. Upon check-in the hotel asks for a 100$ security deposit for "incidentals". Even though during check-in I confirmed all room fees and taxes were already paid for by my priceline reservation, they charged an extra 75$ to my credit card without my consent. And they keep claiming they are allowed to deduct 75$ from the deposit which was for potential incidentals only. They place is nice. But beware of this scam.

Reviews.Title: “IF you want the resort experience, won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: LambyFlysFirst
Reviews.Content: American-style travelers who want a gated resort experience will enjoy the Gran Melia's set-up and philosophy. It's a reasonably big, luxury sea-side resort, with aging 2 story villas spread out along the property from the pool and main buildings. I had no security issues during my own stay, although there was a security guard on duty between the car park and the villas after dark. The resort seems catered for the U.S. traveler seeking a resort experience, and they do a good job of creating a family-friendly atmosphere. During spring break, there was a reasonable mix of college students, families and retirees and the hotel seemed to accommodate all quite comfortably. The large and excellent pool with wet bar is right by the beach, making it easy to swim in the ocean and return to lounge around by the pool afterwards. The golf course is magnificently maintained, and if heading there for golf you won't be disappointed. Views of the El Yunque national rainforest, often shrouded in mist, from the golf course add to the visual appeal. The breakfast buffet at the Cafe Sol had a good selection of everything, just like a Hilton or Sheraton, including a chef to do omelettes etc. Otherwise the restaurants were a bit underwhelming, and the bar and live music scene divey to say the least. Ask for dinner recommendations out of the resort if you can. Staff during my stay were impeccably polite and very friendly. I agree with other reviewers that this is an overpriced resort experience (I had a 50% off deal), but if that's what you're after you won't be disappointed. It has all the gym, tennis court, pool, spa etc. vacation stuff that a resort visitor wants. Not sure about child minding though. Gran Melia is about 45 minutes drive from the airport down highway PR-3 - usually very busy, often bumper-to-bumper. If you are going to rent a car to get around, expect significant traffic jams geting into San Juan, or onto highway PR-52 if heading south to Guanica, for example.

Reviews.Title: “You honestly may lose your life here”
Reviews.Author: Kittieprincess
Reviews.Content: On March 3-7th, 2011 my husband and daughter were booked at the Gran Melia PR. On Sat night, March 5th, 11pm, we heard a huge disturbance coming from the room next door. We called security but nothing changed. At 3 am, we heard the disturbance come outside. Someone slammed into our front door and was demanding we open our door. We looked through the peephole. It was a shirtless man, drinking and smoking and cursing. We called security again. A man came and was actually "handling" the situation outside demanding we open our door our door. It did not stop, but they were loud and arguing. My daughter (who is 3) was crying and scared. My husband, who is a very big guy, would not open the door. He speaks Spanish and was listening to a whole bunch of men fighting outside. We asked security to call police (which WE should have done) They never did. They could have easily had a weapon. It finally subsided around 4 am. NO one from the hotel called to make sure we were okay. We went to the front desk and after hours of asking for management, a girl who stated she was an assistant manager, offered us free breakfast and told us the "guests" left. We found out they had NOT and that they rented the room for the evening to "party". OH MY GOD... we finally got hold of management and they told us they would move our room, but that "handled it perfectly". (They said the "police would take too long if they called them". I kid you not) We emailed the hotel manager days after and he was in complete denial. No apology, saying they handled it perfectly and they offered us a free 2 night stay. Trust me, I am a travel writer- do NOT go to this hotel. Security breaches are everywhere. It is a huge complex and we had also heard of men outside the rooms, waiting to rob, etc.. try the Wyndham instead. We had other family there who had a perfect experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Beach_Bumgirl03
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on here I was nervous but the resort was gorgeous! Arrived at night so there was no line to check in. One thing I didn't like was that they require at hold of $100 for each night you stay so $400 for us because we were there for 4 nights. This is to charge food, drinks or any other charges from the resort. We did use some of the money from this but also used different credit cards for dinners at the resort. The pool was so beautiful and we loved the swim up bar. The beach wasn't the best but we did spend some time in the water. The room was very big and nice and we had no problem with housekeeping. They only came late one day and we had to call to the front for clean towels but they brought some to us immediately. I read the reviews and thought service would be a problem but they were very helpful. The food was very expensive but we did sign up for the mas rewards card that gave us 10% off meals and buy 1 get 1 free breakfast. Cafe Soliel breakfast was good but dinner was terrible! We did like Nami the Japanese grill. Also if you plan to rent a car rent ahead because it is very expensive from the Avis desk at the hotel and they are very rude. But even if you rent Avis from the airport you can park for free at the hotel.. wish I knew this ahead of time. Would definitely go back now that I know all this.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: cbh1011
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned after reading the negative reviews. We did not experience any of the negatives noted by other travelers, Resort is lovely and immaculate. Rooms are large and quite nice, Grounds are beautifully maintained. Resorts restaurants were reasonably priced. You can also drive off the resort for meals. Be sure you get a rental car. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The most desirable resort we had visited on our four trips to Pureto.”
Reviews.Author: Louannblank
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this resort. Very friendly staff. Large well appointed rooms. Great breakfast buffet included in our room rate. Would recommend a car for site seeing and additional food choices for longer than a few days stay. Italian & Asian Restaurants on site for dinner. Resort adjoins Trumpt International Golf Course. Beach area private for resort only. Beautiful blue water and very calm because of reef 150 ft from shore. Sea grass along shoreline.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: peggy2357
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place. If you can, sign up for the upgrade when booking at the Melia website. For $50 extra a day (when available) you have access to a private lounge and an oceanfront room with your own private hot tub. The place is secluded but there are plenty of places to eat on site, including a wonderful Puerto Rican restaurant. The breakfast buffet is one of the best I have ever seen. Love this place, and I am picky ! It is very romantic and quiet yet there is something going on most nights (music) .

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: Lawdog8877
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money. Customer service is bad. Food is bad and expensive(small portions $30). Moldy and musty rooms.

Reviews.Title: “horrible customer service/food & beverage lack of quality”
Reviews.Author: Mr-Mrs_SmithXOXO
Reviews.Content: Gran Melia is nice but isnâ€™t worth the cost! My husband and I stayed here for 6 days for our honeymoon during the first week of March 2011. We booked our trip through a travel website which also arranged our transportation to/from the airport. The transportation company was awesome and non-affiliated with the hotel (it was not Dragonfly). Here are our observation from the our experienceâ€” 1. Check-in took about an hour, the front desk agent claimed his computer was down yet others were checked-in without problem. 2. Upon check in, the resort requires for a $100 deposit per night for incidentals on your credit card. This is not stated anywhere on their website nor were we advised prior to our arrival. 3. Upon check-in we were instructed to advise the bellman of our room number (note check-in desk is about 5 feet from the bellman desk yet somehow the 2 desks do not communicate), which we did and requested our luggage be delivered to our room immediately. After waiting 2 hours I called for a status on our luggage delivery and only then did our luggage arrive to our room. 4. Upon check-in no information was provided to us regarding the resort such as you can call the front desk to request a shuttle pick up from your room -- our room was a hike (about a 1-2 city blocks from the entrance). On our last day I request a shuttle to be sent to our room to pick up our luggage, the operation told me to carry my luggage to the walkway and wave down a shuttle for assistance, I had been at the resort long enough to know that the shuttles do not stop for anyone unless you call the front desk! Just another example of the POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE! 5. Since it was our honeymoon we were suppose to receive the honeymoon amenity upon arrival (a fruit basket in our room). I called the front desk and was transferred 5 times (to different departments) as they all claimed to have no idea what I was talking about. We never received the honeymoon amenity during our stay. 6. We choose this resort since the website stated â€œThere are non-motorized water sports for a nominal fee such as kayaking.â€� and since it was a beachfront property thus it would be swimmable beach. DO NOT BE MISTAKEN â€“ THE PROPERTY DOES NOT OFFER KAYAKING, SNORKLING OR SWIMMING IN THE OCEAN. They taped off all access to the beach and HIGHLY DISCOURAGE kayaking, snorkeling and swimming. The option to rent â€œnon-motorized water sports for a nominal fee such as kayakingâ€� was discontinued two years prior to our arrival yet the website has not been updated with accurate information. 7. We rented a car from Avis but booked online rather than going to the resort Avis desk and save about 40% . Also we had free parking. We took a taxi to the outlets (about 15 miles away for a cost or $70 round trip vs the $50 per day to rent a car). 8. The mixed drinks at the Avenue Bar were about $12/each; the mojito was horrible! Never had another during our stay. Were disappointed to learn the other resort bar with a beach view closed at 6pm. 9. The two restaurants (Nami and Tempo) on the resort were never opened at the same time, only one was open per a night. DONâ€™T WASTE YOUR MONEY AT TEMPO--- the food was horrible! This food makes Italian chain restaurant look like a 5 star restaurants. The food at Tempo tasted like crap, arrived cold, waited about 30-45 minutes for our food to arrive, was expensive and made us sick that night. My husband had pasta and I had the lamb chops, it was just a waste of money we were both still hungry after our meal. 10. Room service was $3 fee plus 20% gratuity included. 11. We stayed in the Gardenview Junior Suite. The suite was nice but no information/booklet about the resort was in our room. The only binder provided was the room service menu. The rooms are cleaned daily but the TP was never filled and on the third day the maid took the last of our TP and we had to call for more. In summary, we would never recommend this resort to anyone. The customer service was horrible, the food & beverage lack quality for it high price.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Melia was an amazing resort but I wish I had more tips to prepare for our vacation.”
Reviews.Author: tmwhightower
Reviews.Content: Gran Melia is gorgeous and has everything you are looking for in a resort. But here are a few tips that I want to share with others planning their vacation. My husband and I stayed here for 6 days and it was also during the Puerto Rico Open. 1. There is only one shuttle allowed to pick guests up from the airport and take them to the resort. The shuttle is Dragonfly. They charge $35 each way ($70 roundtrip to the airport). This is unless you decide to rent a car. You could take a taxi but they are very expensive. 2. Make sure you rent a car from Avis (either from the airport or from the Avis desk at the resort). Avis is the only free parking allowed at the resort otherwise it is $15 per day. And you will want a car to see other parts of Puerto Rico. And to get to the main road, the resort is a good 1-2 miles. Also, go online to get the best rate for the car - the resort's location is RG9. I include this because we couldn't find the location without the rep's help at the desk. We were able to get a car for $20+ cheaper online than the price the rep quoted us. 3. Upon check in, the resort asks for a $100 deposit per night for incidentals on your credit card. This is not written anywhere but it is in other reviews and we were asked. We told them we didn't have $600 to put a hold on a card so that they wouldn't do it. And they just held $100 for the entire stay and told us that we couldn't charge anything to our suite which was fine with us since we planned to sightsee and eat food outside of the resort. Let me also clarify that the deposit is used for any charges made towards the room - the shuttle, drinks at the bar, snacks at the market, meals, etc. so if you plan to stay at the resort the entire time then pay the deposit. 4. Make sure you sign up for MAS Rewards before you arrive so that you can take advantage of the benefits - buy one, get one free breakfast buffet at Cafe Soleil (regular $18 each), 10% off dinner at Nami and Tempo (two restaurants at the resort), and points for your stay. The other restaurant on site is Pasion which has caribbean cuisine. The food was out of this world -we had the whole red snapper stuffed with lobster and the churrasco mofungo. Do not order the pizza. 5. We stayed in the Gardenview Junior Suite. The suite was nice and very clean. But it smelled moldy for a majority of our stay. We read this in a review so we expected it. The rooms are cleaned daily but the smell lingered. 6. There is a shuttle (large golf cart) that will take you to your room from the lobby. They will also pick you up from your room when you call which is a great service because some rooms are 1/4-1/2 mile to the main building. However, with the pick up from the room (on weekends), make sure you call at least 10 minutes before you are ready to leave. The guys are more than happy to take you anywhere on the property including the Avis parking lot. Overall, we had a fantastic time, the resort is amazing and has everything you could ever ask for. If you would like more information about the resort, or tourist areas, email me at tmwhightower@yahoo.com.

Reviews.Title: “Thieves!”
Reviews.Author: shets10
Reviews.Content: Hi , first the good things- the resort is beautiful, , the cafe within the resort has a sumptuous bread (breakfast/lunch and dinner) a little far away from the city , but since most ppl rent cars, that is a non issue. bad things- My husband's brand new Tissot watch(worth over $1000) was stolen from our room, when we were out!!!! The resort staff handled this issue so carelessly and did not even attempt to reimburse us or any option thereafter. Then they request you to attend a 90 minutes "time share" kind of a presentation and promise you a stay at their property ins cancun/dominician republic. We attended that session and got a voucher in return, the phone line that needs to be called to activate this voucher has been ringing since the time we've come back home. And this is valid only until 30 days after the voucher has been granted to you. Very unprofessional and thug-like behavior. Good place to go , BUT without ANY valuables. Disappointed with the customer service!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Grumblebea
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful hotel but staff needs much improvement. Bring your patience if they misplace your reservations, took well over an hour to check-in. Food was good but pricey. Again, hotel is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: jfehrenb
Reviews.Content: I read several reviews questioning the service. My experience was extremely positive. The staff was friendly, polite, helpful and always smiling. The food was also excellent. The location is about 45 minutes east of San Juan. Close enough to go to Old San Juan for dinner (we used shuttles; cars cost $75/day; taxis are $180 round trip I am told). Close to snorkeling, the rain forest, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: CoreyLady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 7 days at this wonderful resort. It was absouletly breath-taking. It was the perfect resort for our honeymoon. The grounds were kept up, the staff was attentive, and the ambience was sooooo romantic and sexy! :) Nothing bad to say about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Check out their timeshare incentive!”
Reviews.Author: MTMB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and basically swapped the 4 nights of would be payment for attending 90 minutes of our time to attend the timeshare presentation, which was a good swap I would say. Timeshare folks were not over bearing. Restaurants are overpriced but OK. Grounds, pool and beach are nice. From Gran Melia we went about 20 miles west and stayed at the Waldorf's el conquistador for the weekend. Now that place was just awesome! One bad restaurant on the Marina, the circular one was just terrible! el conquistador even has a water park for the kids including ability to keep teenagers happy. A small empty fridge in the room that doesn't try to charge you $5. for a can of soda like at Gran Melia was nice to find. Also, el Conquistador has Paolmino Island which is just awesome!!! Check iot out-

Reviews.Title: “Beyond unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: lgold521
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with my husband and several others for a wedding weekend. Upon arrival our room wasn't ready, it was in fairness 2pm and check in is at 3pm. I left my cell # for them to call us at the pool when ready. We checked our baggage to be stored in the meantime. At 3:30 pm when no one called, I called and was told a room with 2 beds is ready which I declined and said I would wait for a King. By 4:45 with no word, my husband and I went to the front desk (we were "red level" vip's sine we were withi the group.) the gentleman there was CLUELESS and spent 10 minutes on the phone trying to figure out a room for us. When he said all we have is 2 beds, I demanded to speak with a manager. To sum it up, a supervisor (melissa) came out- she offered nothing but the same two bedded room. We were booked for a king confirmed 4 months prior. I told her to bump someone else arriving later that night. She went behind the desk 3-4 times during the course of ONE HOUR and came out each time with no king room for us. At this time it was 6pm and I had to shower for a rehearseld inner. I went to get my luggage which was SITTING ON THE CURB in the hot un ALL day- never checked in a secure location, and my dress hanging bag a MESS. When I went back to demand my king room, I asked to with a manager 4 times; or the General Manager...NO ONE else came out. After threatening to call Amex and cancel payment, and to write this reivew, she miraculously appeared with keys to a KING room! All that aggravation...... No excuse for luggage being unattended....no excuse for the delays.... the next day our room wasn't cleaned until 5pm when we were going in to shower for the wedding, so our room was only halfway cleaned. the "VIP' pool was a joke--- not even waitress service! Room service took over an hour to get to the pool. To be part of a Preferred Hotel....this was disgraceful. I won't ever return and would strongly advise everyone I know not to go. I could continue but why waste anymore energy.....

Reviews.Title: “DON'T VISIT THE CASINO”
Reviews.Author: NickCincy
Reviews.Content: I was on a reward trip from my company and was at the Gran Melia for 5 days. The resort is absolutely stunning. The rooms are nice, the pool is fantastic. The facilities overall are wonderful. Don't visit the casino. If you're from the US you won't get the same type of experience you'd expect back home. Let me be clear. I do not care what the rules are in a casino as long as they're consistent. The main game I play in a casino is blackjack. I stood and watched for about 15 minutes before sitting down. In this particular casino, the dealer does not take their second card until everybody has either hit or stayed and is done with their additional betting (double downs, splits, etc). While I was standing behind watching, a local puerto rican got blackjack. He was immediately paid 1 1/2 times his bet which is standard. His cards were removed and play continued to the next seat. The dealer was showing a face card (a jack if I remember correctly). The dealer proceeded to get an ace and therefore a blackjack. The player who also got blackjack did not have to give their money back. I thought this was great. You could get blackjack and get paid without having to purchase insurance. I sat down and about 4 hands into it the exact same thing happened to me, but with one major difference. I DID NOT GET PAID. I immediately called over the pit boss. She told me that maybe the other player had asked for even money. I asked her why I was not offered insurance or even money. She told me the dealer does not have to do that. I told her that I saw the other player get 1 1/2 times his bet, therefore not receiving even money anyways. I asked that they get a video review to clear this up. She refused to do that. I got up with my remaining chips and walked over to the casino manager. He informed me basically what the pit boss had said. I asked why the dealers did not have to be consistent. He informed me that he only has 3 dealers. When there are a lot of guests at the resort (there were this week due to my company being there) they will contract out for more dealers. He told me that those dealers do not have to follow the same guidelines because they do not actually work for him. I told him that if they're going to be working in his casino there needs to be consistency. He told me this isn't the US and they don't have to follow the same rules. Wow, good job Gran Melia casino.

Reviews.Title: “If someone else is paying hope to get the villa ;)”
Reviews.Author: marek1978
Reviews.Content: I was on an incentive trip there and somehow one of our colleagues got a villa instead of a standard room. It had a nice cabana and swimming pool. This became the center of fun for the whole party. The hotel itself is very nice, on a large area with two swimming pools and access to ocean. Breakfasts are very decent with great fruit selection. Unfortunately dinner food is very average.

Reviews.Title: “No in room WiFi--bring your own data cord!!”
Reviews.Author: 2011_lapope
Reviews.Content: I give it a reserved thumbs up. First, the hotel and grounds were beautiful. Our room was nice and I found the advise of others on Tripadvisor to be completely accurate. The pool is great and also the beach is wide and inviting. The people at the hotel are very helpful and friendly. However, whatever you want during your stay you had better already have. The resort is very remote and at least 30 minutes from any store or supplies besides Walgreens which is only 15 minutes away. We were there for a meeting and we were completely disappointed in the food provided for the association dinners. I had stomach upset after every event. However, the one meal we ate a resort restaurant was very good. The bar tenders were also good at making interesting cocktails. Others with our group said that they had had difficulties ranging from broken phones, being bitten by fire ants around the property, rooms not being ready or cleaned regularly, and restaurants being booked ahead of time so getting food at the resort for some was a challenge. The only issue I personally had was that the concierge did not want us to leave the resort and I had to argue with him to give me directions to a restaurant in Fajardo. He repeatedly told me how much better the hotel restaurants would be. I had called ahead to the concierge twice before my arrival and they promised to send me information on off site restaurants for a business dinner but never did. The business center did not have a working printer for me to print invitations and 5 minutes online at their center costs $5 which is outrageous. There was no one to help with any issues in the business center. But by far the worst thing was that there was no wifi in the rooms and you had to purchase a data cord for $15 (they were out the first day we were there) or pay $15 a day for wifi in the bar and beach area---crazy!! The hotel also makes you wear these arm bands---for no reason I ever figured out--that are uncomfortable and ugly and they tell you when you check in that if you do not return your towel cards they give you that they will charge you $30 per towel card upon your departure if you do not return the card...... I felt the food was overpriced and that they should have offered somewhere to have a light breakfast without the $18 for a continental breakfast. They did have a coffee bar in the Market shop thankfully. They will not allow you to bring in food or water or supplies---they want every penny of yours going to the resort. Overall we had a nice stay but I think that having more breakfast offerings, less expensive food in general, and wifi in the room would have been more in keeping with most resorts of this type where we have stayed in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Melia was everything we hoped it would be- Join MAS Rewards before you go!”
Reviews.Author: MissPlanner
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia was outstanding. I went online and became a member of their rewards program: MAS rewards, and that gave us a 10% discount at all their restaraunts and buy one get one free breakfast everyday! We had a rental car which made traveling to the rainforest, Luquillo kiosks, and Fajardo for our bio bay tour easy. In El Yunque, we hiked Big Tree Trail to La Mina falls, it was nice, too hard to get in the water at the waterfall though, and kind of crowded, but a nice hike- not too hard about 45 min each way. We packed some snacks to eat on the boulders at the basin of La Mina, that was nice. Definitely take the toll road 66 from the airport to the hotel, it saves about 40 minutes vs. just taking highway 3 the whole way. The hotel beach had gray gravel/pebbles on it instead of white sand, but it was still beautiful and peaceful, and you could walk for quite a while if you enjoy walking on the beach. We tried Seven Seas beach and Luquillo beaches, they were alright- nothing like other Carribean island's beaches though, our favorite beach off the resort was Isla Verde in San Juan- it had the prettiest sand and water, with plenty of places to eat on the beach. It felt a little like Miami or Destin though, ha ha. But the Gran Melia beach is perfect for privacy and seclusion, so Isla Verde was a nice change. I loved how open the hotel was, so we could find a private hammock or chairs on a part of the beach no one else was on, to feel secluded. The pool was large, but it was pretty crowded on the weekend. The bali beds around the pool are sometimes free and sometimes $15, $30 or even $60. Depending on the occupancy of the hotel, I thought that was silly. Our room was a garden suite in building 10, it had a king bed and was extremely clean. Tastefully decorated and very spacious. Housekeeping came every morning and cleaned well. I am allergic to mold and mentioned that at check in so perhaps they made sure our room had no history of mold. It was a wonderful room. Check in was a breeze, about 10 minutes, however we waited until just before checkout deadline of noon to get in the checkout line... and that was long, took about 40 minutes. Everything was correct on our bill except one mini bar charge which they promptly adjusted. We did go to the grocery store nearby and stocked up on a few drinks and snacks, put them in an insulated lunch bag we'd brought and refilled with ice. That saved us a lot of beach/pool drink charges, but still, the bartenders were super nice & their drinks were delicious & priced fairly. The pool bar was lovely and had good burgers and a great childrens menu for a quick lowpriced snack, but the quesedilla and nachos had really small portions. The drinks were great. The asian restaraunt was yummy, romantic setting. We did hear the puerto rican one wasn't good & terrible service. We enjoyed our breakfast each morning, it was $16 for full hot/cold buffet w/ waffles, omelets, etc, or $12 for just fruit & breads. With our free MAS reward card, we got a breakfast free everyday which really saved $! We loved going into Luquillo for lunch/dinner at the kiosks (#2 was our favorite, #9 was good but took 2 hours to get food once we were seated- literally), in downtown Luquillo- King Seafood was outstanding and we heard Pasta and Pueblo was delicious but it was too crowded when we got there without reservations- it only has about 6 tables. We loved Gran Melia. Beautiful resort, great people.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Awesome, beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: Charmagne88
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Feb.23-27. We mostly enjoyed this hotel. I read the reviews here and took the advice of earlier reviewers and we rented our car from avis so we could save money on parking. (20 dollars a day self park) We also got coffee and breakfast at the Coco Sweet Bakery which is off property but very close to the hotel(you pass it on the way into the hotel). The coffee and muffins at the hotel store was bad coffee and dry rolls.( coffee and rolls averaged for family of four 10 here vs 80 dollars at buffet) We generally ate at the buffet for lunch and dinner. It was our best option because it offered all kids of foods my kids liked, including soups and salads, pasta, cooked vegetables and meats, lunch meats and cheese and a whole desert station with cakes, canollis and ice cream sundaes. We loved the beach and the pool. I really enjoyed the large pool and the fact that it never felt crowded. The beach was very very nice, beautiful and gentle water and gorgeous palm lined beach. Always plenty of space it sometimes felt like we were the only ones there. Our room was nice and big, although they said it was a suite it really didn't feel like a suite because it was one large room with a couch at one end. The bathroom was nice, tiled and clean. But bring your own shampoo and conditioner because the hotels brand was awful! The other things I didn't like was wearing a wristband for our entire stay. That way I guess people could tell you were guests at the hotel. I also felt food prices were high We loved the beach! We brought our own snorkel and mask and the kids used them constantly. There are huge boulders on the edge of the water but pathway in between them.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect golf, amazing ocean view”
Reviews.Author: jabnolla
Reviews.Content: Our stay went without glitches. The hotel was fully booked, and we found out about the Melia Vacation Club that is part of the hotel property. The apartment we got was much better than what we expected. Fully equiped, with kitchen, bfst area, dinning room, huge double bathroom, two whirlpools, one in the balcony with pool/ocean view, and another inside. Everything was clean and neat. The decor, minimalist with very good taste. The Trump International Golf Club on site was second to none. No wonder the PGA will play there in March. Food there was fabulous for a golf club.

Reviews.Title: “Would go again”
Reviews.Author: dooner61
Reviews.Content: I was scared after reading the reviews but I was extremely happy with the whole trip. The only thing I would have done different would be to rent a car. The $140 for transportation to the hotel and back to the airport was insane. The resort was a great! The pool was great and the swim up bar "WET" was great also. Small beach.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T DO IT!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SamMississauga
Reviews.Content: Never ever ever again would I stay here! Reserved Royal Service Ocean Front Jacuzzi Suite, it was given away and I was placed out of Royal Service way at the other end of the resort in the timeshare section away from my friends. Food and drink is very very expensive. Beach.....WHAT BEACH?? Bed bugs.....up and down arms and legs. One couple were covered and looked like they had some kind of disease. BORING BORING. No entertainment at pool, beach or in the evening. Management is in total chaos. Watersports......nil, unless you want to pay $50 American to rent a paddle boat. Restaurant service is very very slow. Reserve at least an hour before you are hungry. Reservations are never granted on time, and waiting for your food takes forever. Totally isolated. If you want to leave the resort to see some action, or see San Juan it is a $100 cab ride there and $100 cab ride back. So $200 to get out and see San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time or your money!!!”
Reviews.Author: BeachLover1286
Reviews.Content: This had to of been once of the worst experiences I have ever had while traveling. We arrived at the hotel before a busy Holiday weekend and walked into an unorganized chaotic check-in experience. First of all, no one is there to greet you or guide you to the designated area to start the check in line. Confusion started to arise and the front desk staff tried to skp over us because we were not in the correct line. The woman at the front desk was completely rude and not helpful at all! First she accused me of lieing and "cutting" in line, which was far from the truth! Then she acted like we were bothering her, when all we wanted was for her to do her JOB! I forget her name, but I remember she was the tallest woman with very long hair. KEEP AWAY IF YOU CAN!!! None of the employees really know what they are talking about. Once we got our keys, we went to our room which had a musty mold-like aroma that was not appealing and the bathroom looked like it had not been cleaned properly! We called the front desk to complain, and they agreed to switch our rooms. We went to the 2nd room and it had the same smell, only worse. Finally, we went to a second floor unit that did not smell as bad. Although we may have gotten rid of the smell, that was not the end of it! The safe was broke, the remote didn't work, and there was fungus on the patio. At that point, we were so exhausted from schleping our luggage around that we agreed to deal with the less then satisfactory room. As much as we wanted to try and enjoy ourselves, things just continued to get worse. We spent one day at the pool, and that was not relaxing at all! They had loud music playing that made me feel like I was in Cancun for spring break for college. On the second day we did a snorkeling excursion, which was excellent!! Make sure you have your own vehicle though! We saved $40 per person just from driving ourselves to the marina! After returning from a long day of drinking and being in the sun, we were unable to get in our room. All of our keys had deactivated and we had to walk alllllll the way back to the front desk to get a new set. Once back in the room (no explanation was given as to why our keys deactivated), we attempted to take showers but had no hot water. I called the front desk and they said someone was working on it but they didn't know when it would be fixed and that I could not shower anywhere else. We spent our third day in Old San Juan which was the best day by far! Once again, we returned to our room and the keys did not work. At this point, we were irate! It was late, we just wanted to get in our room and go to bed. After getting new keys made, again, we entered our room to find 2 keys, that both worked, slid under the door. Who would slid room keys under the door, and why? We finally spoke to security who informed us that housekeeping could not get in the room, so they had to change the keys (without informing us), and they left the 2 new keys under the door, which is against hotel policy. Let's just say we were thrilled that it was our last night. Overrall, if I had paid the full rate to stay at this hotel, I would have been more mad that I already am. This is not a 4 start resort. The Service can be compared to what you would get at a Motel 6 on the side of an interstate. Most of the staff are rude and make no attempt to make your stay enjoyable. If you do decide to stay here, make sure you rent a car BEFORE you get to the resort. If not, you'll be stranded and forced to deal with this horribly managed resort. DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, but watch for bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: melr99
Reviews.Content: I wrote the following short email to reservas@granmeliapr.com "Hello, I just wanted to let you know that there are bedbugs in the first bed of room 1905. My husband and I just returned from the hotel on the 6th. I meant to email earlier, I apologize. The resort is just beautiful, we had a wonderful stay! The service was impeccable! Thank you so much!" We got upgraded to the Royal Service because our room was not ready for 2 hours, it looked bad for a corporate event. They only had one person on staff in the Royal Service lounge at any given time. They also ran out of tequila and mint and a few other bar items over the weekend, it was weird. Also only a few bartenders, it was as if they were not prepared for the crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing holiday and excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: brendajoyca
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Gran Melia with a couple of friends and really enjoyed ourselves. We have stayed in other all inclusive resorts in Cuba and Dominican Republic and had both good and bad experiences. We had also read many of the reviews of the Gran Melia. Although this is not an all inclusive resort, we were able to book a meal plan and found that eliminated any concerns about the cost of food and beverages that other reviews had been unhappy about. To begin the resort property is very welcoming and well kept. The main building is beautiful with lots of sitting areas, gardens and ponds. The main bar and restaurants were all in this building. We found ourselves hanging out here every night playing cards and having drinks before dinner. It was a great place to meet a few of the other guests and there was always either a dj or live music. Our experience with the staff and their level of customer service was excellent. Our check in/out, food service, and room cleaning staff were all very kind and helpful. Any questions or concerns were addressed and everyone was very polite. As with all our holidays we seek out great food and drink experiences and we were very impressed with the two restaurants, Nami and Tempo. The Cafe Soleil buffet was perfect for breakfast, lots of choices and everything was fresh and tasty. We often ate at the poolside grill for lunch which was always very busy, but the key is to relax and not be in a rush. We understood that the beach is not a white sand beach like Cuba, but we still enjoyed it as a place to lounge and walked it everyday. Lots of birds, fish, shells and crabs made it interesting. Otherwise we did spend lots of time in and around the pool. In general, because of the size of the resort it never felt crowded. And although the pool was the popular place for guest (and this is a family resort) there was always a bali bed or lounge chair to be found. We had a garden view junior suite that was at the far end of the resort. We enjoyed the walk and there was always golf carts passing to offer us a ride. The room was comfortable, very quiet and nicely decorated. We read a number of reviews that complained about the mold smell. We found there was a slight mold smell when you first stepped into the room, but it never lingered or was strong. We also recall this at other Caribbean resorts and understand the humidity can cause this. We both slept so well the entire week. The bed was very comfortable and the building was really quiet. We all had massages at the YHI spa. We had heard the cost of the services was high and we requested a price list for services when we arrived. We did agree that the services are expensive, however we decided to treat ourselves and we all really enjoyed our massages and the staff were excellent. We opted to rent a car from Avis (on site) and do our own sight seeing rather than the tours with the resort tour company. The car rental was $68/day, plus insurance. We drove to El Yunque rain forest and hiked for a day. The rain forest is very close and easy to get to and the park entrance fee is only $4/person. We really enjoyed our day. The rain forest is a popular spot for visitors, so expect to see many people on the trails and rest spots. After we finished at the rain forest we had heard from staff that Loquillo Beach was close by and a really nice public beach. We drove to it and spent the rest of the day there. It was worth the couple of wrong turns and tight parking spot. It is a beautiful and surprisingly quiet public beach. We had a lot of fun in the waves, walking the perfect sand and napping in the sun. So for the cost of the car rental and park entrance fee we had a full day of fun within 15 minutes of the resort. We took the car for the second day and drove into Old San Juan. This area of the city is very beautiful - cobblestone streets, brightly coloured buildings and lots of shops and cafes. It was bustling with tourists and we felt very safe and found it really easy to navigate, definitely worth the trip. As for other recommendations, we found the internet access and phone service expensive. There we a number of guests with laptops and cell phones and we didn't take the time to look into what would be least expensive. We discreetly packed into the resorts drinks and snacks. The resort is isolated and the cost to purchase on the resort can be expensive, and the selection is limited. Overall a great holiday and resort to visit.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: 04scooby
Reviews.Content: No complaints from my wife or I! Actually if there was anything I could "complain" about, its that we didnt stay long enough! I took my wife to Puerto Rico for the first time for our anniversary/birthday/early valentines day trip. I was able to book 3 nights at Gran Melia for what I truly believe to be a great deal considering the Resort's 4 star+ rating. We were NOT dissapointed! Although we were not able to fully take advantage all the amenities that resort had to offer (we were actively out and about around Puerto Rico every day of our 4 days there), the short time we did have to "hang out" at the resort were well worth it! The huge pool was beautifully constructed and a marvel to look at; the beach (Coco beach) was a clean and relaxing place; the lounge areas were open air and definitely a place see and be seen. As for our 'villa', it was very nice and clean. Since the resort's villas were spread out like a sprawl, it didn't give us a hotel-like feeling. There appeared to be 8-10 rooms per villa, so it wasnt busy or tight. The bed was very comfortable. The shower was adequate. You had the option of riding on golf carts if you didnt want to walk around (since it IS a big sprawling property). The location of the resort was about 40-45 minutes east of San Juan. It felt secluded and far from the busy and active life of a city. We had a car so it was easy to get in and out and about in PR. All in all, my wife and I were very pleased with our experience at Gran Melia. We definitely do not mind coming back there again!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: traveler1313_11
Reviews.Content: We reserved an ocean view suite with the upgraded red level amenities in November of 2010. We traveled to the Gran Melia in February of 2011 with our infant daughter. When we arrived and attempted to check in we were told the room we reserved was not available. Nothing we said or did (including showing a printed reservation receipt) was able to accomplish getting an upgraded room. The manager told us the best she could do was give us a garden view room with a kitchenette. The room we then checked into had numerous issues. The air conditioning was stuck at 65, the iron was missing, there was no tv remote, the microwave did not work, and the dishes were still dirty from the last time they were used. It took 4 hours to get an iron, 2 days to get a remote, the microwave and dishes were never addressed by management. After two nights we insisted to be moved to a different room. Issues in the next room: Air conditioning stuck at 64 (our daughters feet were blue one morning she was so cold), close proximity to the hotel bar (at night you could hear loud bass music), and there was no hot water in the bathroom sink. We were then moved (after another day wasted complaining to the manager) to a villa. The villa was a fantastic room however we did not have hot water in the shower. Food: Unless you make a reservation two days in advance you will not get a table until 10pm. Even when we did make a reservation for 7:30pm and then when we arrived the hostess told us our reservation was for 6pm and that our table was given away. At the restaurants we did eat at (Cafe Soleil and Pasion) we thought they were overpriced for below average tasting food. Pool: The pool is great but loud music is blasted throughout the day so there is no peace and quiet. One day there was a band that played loud obnoxious music on bongo drums. Service: The service at this hotel is awful and some of the worst I've ever been subjected to. The front line employees at the front desk and in the red level lounge attempt to brush you off by explaining that they will call you when the issue is resolved or have a manager call you. No call is ever made and when you go back to check on the issue the next shift has no clue what you are talking about. Other issues experienced by other people we went with: Toilets not flushing; No cold water in the sink; Dragonfly (the excursion and travel company) attempted to increase pricing of already booked trips.

Reviews.Title: “Very Beautiful Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: ChayaS
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews before staying at this hotel, and here is the truth: I found the hotel to be stunning, and rooms were beautiful. Everyone was very nice and super helpful. The pool is beautiful and huge, and there are cabanas and chairs everywhere to sit and relax. Downsides: The ocean has alot of rocks and weeds growing all over. There are some areas where there are small patches of clear water to kind of wade in, but overall the beach is definitely dissapointing. Also there is no outdoor hot tub which really sucks. While your in Puerto Rico you MUST see Culubra Island,Falmenco beach and snorkling beach. It is worth the trip! Viouques Island is not worth it, and the beaches there are mediocre. But be aware that the ferry situaiton is a nightmare, you need to be in line by 7am to get tickets, and you may not get tickets for the way back to Puerto Rico, which is what happened to me! I ended up having to charter a plane, which with 8 people costs $50 per person. If you go with the hotel its $150, which might be worth it to avoid the hassle. But it is honestly the most stunning beach i have ever seen, so go! The Rainforrest is nice, but i went to P.R. for the beach so i wasnt to impressed. Overall its a very relaxing place and i loved my stay there. Shoutout to Angel and MIgel who were awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Wil NEVER stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: Sunflower1160
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely NOT a four star resort. The service is ABSYMAL! I am my last night of my stay here at the resort. Upon making reservation, I called the hotel to make a request for adjoining room or atleast a room near each other 2 weeks prior to arrival date. We checked in around midnight, you guesses it rooms were in the opposite ends of the resort. The lady that checked us in ( by the way the check in took almost 45 mins) asked to check back in morning around check out time to see what was available. The front desk clerk whispered something to the front desk manager and the answer was there were no available room. Okay, we went about enjoying the resort. The next morning, someone was changing room, so my sister and I ran to the front desk to change the room, again lots of whispering, sorry no rooms available to switch. We asked her what happened to room in bldg 14 that someone was switching from, oh sorry I see it now, just have to talk to my manager and will call you, go enjoy your day. So we actually did. Around 3 pm we called the resort to make sure that the room was changed and that our bags were moved. We were put on hold for a long time, clerk said that the manger will call us back in 15 mins, 2 hrs went by no call. We called back, same routine this went on till we got back into the resort at around 10pm. stood in line again at the front desk to see if our room was changed, first response I don't know anything about a room change. We got angry she then checked the computer, oh yes I see you have been moved to this room, Great finally! has our bags been delivered to the room? The espouse oh I don't know you have to tAlk to the front desk manager. So we waited, finally she is ready to talk to us. we explained what we have had to been through to just change a room. Melissa the manager initially said she was aware that we were calling every hour to talk to her. She checked to makesure that we were swited over. We asked to her to comp as for all the headaches. She dissappered into the back office for 15 mins and came out offered us free breakfast for both rooms. Great, give it to me writing since you won't be here at check out. We did not want to go through the hassel of dealing with fixing the bill on Checkout. Melissa says okay and disappears to back Office again, to write that our Bk was comped. She didn't comeout. Went back to the front desk clerk to find out what happened to Melissa? Clerk informed her that we were STILL waiting! She came out 20 mins later. With NO note! She apparently didnt have a form. Huh? So in other words, she lied to our face and ean of to hide, hoping that we will get sick of waiting. Up until this point we didn't raise our voice, except to be heard over he loud Music. At this point after she lied and hid I got angry and asked her how she could lie and what kind of service was that. She walked away b/c she couldnt work with us. All along we Had been asking for the Manger on duty, who kept coming out of he back office and running back in. When she walks away we finally got the manager on duty to comeout. Hmm! WhT can I say about Mr. Israel Cordero? He is a smoth talker, who wrote on back of his business card that our breakfast was comped and that he will call us to see what else he can do. Never did. Just another Liar at the hotel. It will be very interesting to see what is going to happen at checkout. So if you are planning on staying here, I am sorry you will be disappointed. The service at he breakfast buffet is very poor. The service at the pool bar is no better! There really is no true beach, very rocky and if you have children there is mo room to make a castle or play on the sand. The Pool is okay. Get to the pool side early if wNt to get a cabana or the sparse shady spot by the pool or the beach. There are plenty other hotels that are much nicer with better service in puerto Rico. Just head the warning of the others reviewers about the service at this hotel. It's DEFINTELY NOT the service for a Four star hotels. If I could give I a negative numbers I would have. Up

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and grounds, very poor service, aweful beach, food OK.”
Reviews.Author: Telephoneguy
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at over a dozen 5 star resorts over the years throughout the Carribean, we can give this review with a lot of experience behind us (pre and post children). We stayed at the resort Feb. 13-20th as part of an electrical industry "conference" which arranged the entire trip as an "All Inclusive" vacation for the participants but the resort is normally not an All Inclusive resort. Rooms: We were very happy with the rooms and found them to be very clean, beds were comfortable, bathrooms were clean, plenty of towels, towels changed often, sheets clean, etc. Experienced a lack of adequate warm/hot water on the last night and hope we have enough for morning showers. Grounds/Beach: The gardens near the accomodations are quite nice and a crew can be seen daily tending to gardening chores. We have seen better/lush gardens at other resorts. The "beach" is not a term I would give to the waterfront. There is no sandy beach anywhere! If you are expecting to find a wide beach with loads of fine sand where you can walk around in bare feet and walk out into the ocean freely, this is NOT the place for you. The entire beach front has very little sand and has lots of broken rocks and seashells which make walking barefoot VERY uncomfortable. This extends out into the water (try walking without experiencing painful sensations!) where after about 8-12 feet out, the entire floor is covered in seaweed and grasses which make for uncomfortable walking. I nearly stepped on a sea urchin which was hidden by the grasses (although the kids thought it was pretty neat when I showed them!). Water was nice and warm however and there are virtually no waves as there are offshore reefs no too far out. Needless to say, the kids did not enjoy the beach where they normally spend hours of the day frolicking (hard to do when you are worried about cutting your feet on the sharp rocks/shells...which my daughter managed to do!). Wait staff/service: Without doubt one of the worst service anywhere. There is a serious lack of training at the Buffet restaurant but the service was much better at the A la Carte restaurants. The staff of any resort set the tone for the holiday (to a degree anyway) and we have been to many resorts where the staff seem genuinely happy in their jobs and sincere in their wanting to please the guests. The bar staff at these other resorts are happy, smiling and laughing and bantering with the guests. NOT HERE! Here the staff avoid eye contact so they can mill about and keep pretending to be too busy to serve you. We had to ask for the same thing (i.e. a cup for the pot of tea or milk for coffee/tea) several times before it was ever brought out. I don't think they know of the concept of "clearing dishes" off a table promptly and replacing cutlery if they take it away as part of the clearing process. There were 2-3 people who seemed to shine above te rest (and the got nice tips as a result) but by and large I would say their is a big training problem where the basic expectations have not been instilled in the staff (go to the Majestic Colonial in Punta Cana and you will see smiling/laughing/happy people). The service at the non-buffet restaurants was much better. Food quality: The buffet had decent enough variety but the quality/taste was severely lacking (IMO). Taste of the various dishes served each night (fish/chicken/beef (aweful)/pork) was of different flavours but not flavourful. Beef was always overdone (makes on suspect that they "re-used" the meat?). Salads/greens were very good. Desserts were of good variety and quite good generally. House reds (wines) were very decent and the beer was always cold. The Al la carte restaurants are extremely good and no one should have any complaints about food quality and variety...and the prices reflect this...not a cheap place to eat/drink. Although I did not play golf, many people commented that both courses were of very high quality. I would never return to this resort and would dissuade anyone from choosing this place for any holiday. Signed, Canadian from Ontario

Reviews.Title: “No service! Sol Melia vacation club worst investment”
Reviews.Author: ahetzler22
Reviews.Content: This has been the worst experience. The ""VIP lounge"is not worth a hoot. No phone service, no laundry service, nobody cares....". You have to wait in line in the VIP lounge FOREVER to get any attention. All they ask is, ""Would you like a glass of wine"?"...Yes, I want wine, but I also want service and follow through with what you say you"'re going to do. No basic services here...stay at the Motel 6, you''d be better off.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed _ would not recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: Malteazer
Reviews.Content: Take plenty of bug spray and afterbite as you willl need it throughout the resort. The beach was very dissappointing and service was very poor. Food was great if you asked them to leave out the salt. Rooms need to be redecorated and cleaned better than they are now.

Reviews.Title: “nickle and dime you with added fees”
Reviews.Author: batyl
Reviews.Content: Made reservations for next June and was told there was an additional charge called (are you ready for this?) BUTLER AND MAID TIP FEE". That's $16.40 per day. Why don't they just raise their room rate - room rates are deceptive. Oh, did I mention huge parking fee. Exactly what extra services am I paying for from the "butler". Is he/she going to feed me during meals?

Reviews.Title: “Worst service I've ever expeirenced”
Reviews.Author: daddio017
Reviews.Content: The hotel and grounds are beautiful for a small resort. That's about the only good thing I can say. The service is terrible. I sat by the pool for 4 days and never saw a waiter. The wait at the pool bar was ridiculis. The staff won't make eye contact hoping that you go away. The lobby bar is also the nightly entertainment. It was extremely noisy with a D.J. most nights. Saturday they had kareoke which wasn't good. They have only one restaraunt for breakfast and you always had to wait for a table. The food was mediocre at best. Not once did I see anyone who looked like a manager. The shame of it is that it could be very nice if only it were run properly. Also, did I mention the power and water outages. I'm glad I wasn't paying for this stay.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT SURPRISE !!! NICE STAY !!!”
Reviews.Author: old-man-orange
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect when we booked this place. We stayed last year at Rio Mar - Wyndham and were hoping when we booked 4 stars unnamed with Hotwire it would be Wyndham, which was real nice ... but for $99/night (+ tax/fees =$25 Feb 5 to 11) we ended up at the Gran Melia. It was a pleasant surprise. True ... it is kind of out of the way down a long entrance road off Rt 3 in Rio Grande ...but is a very pretty drive past Trump Golf Course and fountains. I guess driving literally a couple of more minutes when you are on vacation with mostly no time schedule is enough for other reviewers to complain about ...Get A Grip! stay in San Juan or Miami. Now I can afford to pay full price to know exactly where I am staying, or write a "marvelous review" about staying at the St Regis(where I paid about $1000/night full rack rate) ,... but what challenge is that? I am a "value guy" (others say cheap, funny after the bust them off, then ask for details ... go figure!) so ... I am a big fan of Hotwire, when they show 4 star,on beach, R=resort, casino, golf,gym 90% approval ... only 2 options- Wyndham or Gran Melia.... cannot go wrong with either. The resort itself is beautiful. Appears to be well maintained and staff are busy bees trimming, cleaning, shining and so on. Granted it is not brand spanking new, but I didn't think it looked worn. Here are some opinions: GROUNDS/LOBBY - Beautiful ... lots of openess, statues, marble, beautiful landscape with ponds and fountains. Check in desk was friendly and fast, service good. Casino - small not crowded - went in Superbowl Sunday to place $10 bet at Sports Book, betting opened half hour before game time, so we left - Not Vegas! ROOMS - resort rooms are separate 2 story villas with about 8 rooms per building, very spread out forming semi circle opposite end from lobby and restaurant. Lots of walking at this resort because it is so big, but you can get a ride from golf carts. Resort charges for parking ($15 + tax per day) ...they all do so non issue. No need here for valet parking(extra $6/day) because where you park is closer to rooms.The room itself was big and beautiful, king bed and large sitting area with couch, deck with rain forest view and small glimpse of ocean. Bathroom nice! only complaint when A/C on fan runs non-stop is noisy. POOL/BEACH - Hugh main pool, small spa pool, and Royal Service pool. Main pool only has 3 umbrellas for shade, get there early. It was quite slow mid week Feb 8-9 so they let us use cabanas free, usually charge about $50. Beach is OK in spots, it goes a long way around resort plenty of private areas. Not great for swimming kind of rocky but you can make most of it. If you want great beach day have to search out beaches and drive (like 7 Seas). RESTAURANTS/BARS - join Melia MAS program and get # by phone, get 50% off breakfast and 10% other food. Breakfast buffet was fine ($17 hot or $12 cold) good geal with 50%. Also got coffee and muffins from Market, it was OK. Had lunch a few times at Beach Bar/Restaurant, nice view, convenient, decent food, slightly "resort pricy" Did not eat dinner at resort. Lots of great places in Luquillo ... Ceviche Hut, Ay Bonita!, El Jefe Burger at kiosks that take a left back on Route 3 (read write ups) .. Pasta y Pueblo in Luquillo near La Pared Beach is awesome (closed Mon & Tues need resevation), Boardriders on La Pared is great Rum Shack beach joint. In Fajardo near marinas, Tacsa Ole great views - good Tapas. SUMMARY - great resort. If you are looking for Club Med type entainment ... this aint it... some stuff; Zumba, nice gym,some music in bar. The staff are real nice people, generally when you work in hospitality you have to be nice. Check pricing on Hotel.com or Hotwire(unnamed) can be a real deal. They have "Royal Service" that you pay a big chunk for ... included are breakfast, happy hour, and private pool ... you can be judge, but hard to do if you have never been there ... not worth it in my thrifty eye! Check out Rain Forest nearby, Bio Bay is awesome, snorkel in fun with KPR - Miniboats. Remember that the locals love their pardise and get out to beaches on stuff on weekends, avoid beaches and kiosks on weekends. Definitely get a car. CAN'T GO WRONG AT GRAN MELIA or WYNDHAM ... great area of PR to be in. Lastly, when reading reviews, those from Northeast (mostly NY and NJ) tend to be nit picky about stupid stuff (a bunch of cosmopolitan wantabees) ... while reviewers from Western Canada and Mid West USA are easy to please ... you be the judge ... 'Content in Connecticut'

Reviews.Title: “Food poison, sick and fever and no late check out available”
Reviews.Author: Viola079
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I only ate at the hotel premise and got very sick at night that we even had to call a doctor. We were supposed to leave the next day late afternoon and asked for a late check out since unpleasant visits to the bathroom kept us up all night. Talking to Melissa, the manager on duty, she told us that a late check out wouldnâ€™t be possible and when I told her we needed a bed to sleep she pointed out that there were sunbeds on the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like Starlock 13!”
Reviews.Author: wymylo9
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in our stay here. As far as a "grand" resort it is not. The grounds, lobby and pool are beautiful and well maintained but the rooms and stairs are not. Our room was not very clean and the finish work in construction was very poor. We were there for 4 days and there was the same gross hairball on the stairs that whole time. However, our biggest gripe was that we did not feel we were being protected with all the security guards on premises as much as that we were being watched and imprisioned. We were not allowed to bring anything in to the "compound" as I'm sure they wanted you to buy everything there. Also in addition to high room rates they have a $16.00 parking fee!! The hotel is 3 miles away from anything and you have to go through a guard shack and a parking attendant gate - how else are you going to arrive except by car. Its not like there is not enough space for parking they just want to dig into your pockets again. Anyway, if this is Grand they can have it.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing short of spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFunMichigan
Reviews.Content: Wonderful food, wonderful services, wonderful hospitality, casino on site was good (not extravagant, but good), wonderful scenery, wonderful rooms, spectacular views....we travel quite a bit and this was hands down our favorite trip to the Carribean (compared to Beaches Jamaica last year). Beautiful pools, wonderful beach....only suggestion is to make dinner reservations day prior-otherwise you will not eat until at least 10:00 p.m. Spa was wonderful. ATV Rainforest excursion excellent. Transport around the resort was wonderful and accomodating. I just can't say enough good things.

Reviews.Title: “Most definitely NOT a 4* Property!”
Reviews.Author: MichelleSNYC
Reviews.Content: I must say that we found a very inexpensive price for this hotel at the last minute but, unfortunately, as was the case here, you really get what you pay for. This property has so much potential as it really is quite nice. "Beach" is terrible though. From the excruciatingly slow check-in process to the loud DJ and plastic cups at the interior bar, things really start to fall apart. It certainly didn't help that the room had an overwhelming mold/musty smell. No matter how long you left the balcony door open, the smell would not dissipate. One of the most pathetic and down-market requirements is that you wear a plastic bracelet denoting your guest status. Are you serious? This practice must be done away with. We only ate on-site one night which was at the Pasion restaurant and the food was quite good. Every other night (we were only there three nights) food was had elsewhere. Location is not good -- you really need to drive to find decent eateries (there's nothing on Route 3) unless you want to hit the kiosks in Luquillo repeatedly which I can see can get quite old quite soon. Again, we didn't pay much for this place nor would I. I very strongly recommend seeking accomodation elsewhere until they can get their act together here. The only upside I can report is the nice weather -- good to get away from snow and freezing cold and enjoy 85 degree warmth.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible food and service”
Reviews.Author: shereed
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week with my husband and another couple in February. The hotel is very isolated from other hotels and restaurants. You really have to have a rental car due to the terrrible food and lack of facilities on the property. About the only positive thing that I can say is that the golf courses are nice and the snack bar at the turn is the best food on the property. Very sad for what could be a good resort experience if someone only cared enough to improve the place. We ate off the property every night. The St. Regis and El Conquistador are accessible if you have transportation. The casino is very small and there isn't much to do at night.
