They didn't even televise the NFL playoff games even though they assured us that they would be on TV in the bar or casino. Many upset guests over this. Wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds”
Reviews.Author: PA19
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little remote, which is good and bad. The grounds and property are beautiful. The beach really is not bad, you can take a long walk, it's just not a great swimming beach. The pool is one of the largest in the world they say, and it is nice.the food was pretty good, especially the. Sushi, but all food and drink is priced high because they got you. They don't want you bringing in your own booze, so no frig in the room, no where at all to keep anything cold. I don't understand why the resort doesn't correct the musty room smell, and the slow check in, I was the only person there and they couldn't find my reservation, very unprofessional in today's computer age. I really enjoyed the beautiful grounds, pools, the hammocks in nice locations, the cabanas, it wasn't very crowded there. It's a huge resort, and I would recommend especially at the bargain price I got online. If I were paying a couple hundred or more, I might not feel the same way. Also why do they charge 16 dollars to park, when the place is in the middle of nowhere, but at least no resort fee was added.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and private”
Reviews.Author: tess_ohio7
Reviews.Content: You could never go wrong with this hotel. We are impressed with the garden design of Gran Melia. We booked at this hotel after a friend's recommendation. They have plenty of day activities to choose from. My husband had a great time at their casino. They also have a large pool where our kids stayed most of the time. This is also perfect for couples who are looking a romantic and private place to relax or spend their honeymoon. We chose the Junior deluxe room -the design is very elegant and has an ocean view. I can say that this a 5 star hotel a cheap price. We are planning to return to PR some time next year and we won't hesitate to book at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Melia Multi-Faceted Gem”
Reviews.Author: rdmgjr
Reviews.Content: Let me just begin by saying, if you cannot make your own good time and need others to entertain you, you simply don't need a vacation. Gran Melia Golf Resort is simply amazing. From its manicured grounds, to perfectly clean pools, to its stellar restaurants, and fantastic January weather, The Gran Melia did not disappoint. Yes it was all that and more. Do not believe the negative reviews. I would recommend the royal service (now red service) level. We had an oceanfront room w/king bed, jacuzzi on the patio and a wonderful sitting area and bathroom. The room was perfect everyday with turn down service every night. This level of stay warrants the few extra bucks compared to the regular rooms. Our butler/concierge took care of our every need like we had any to request. The restaurants we visited were excellent. The asian restaurant was very entertaining and the food was perfect. The Italian restaurant was my favorite. Tempo is very upscale and the service impeccable. My wife and I both had filet mignon, salads, veggies, and creme brulet for desert. The filet mignon was seriously the best I ever had and my wife said the same. I am a big steak eater and visited many a steak house stateside and non compared to Tempo's flavor and tenderness. Well worth the price. The nightlife is lacking a little but we made our own good time at the Avenue Bar. The drinks were strong and came on a steady pace. It was just the atmosphere my wife and I like. The Cafe Solei we ventured to every morning for a buffet style breakfast. a little pricey but was very good. The wet pool bar and grill was also very good. try the blackened chicken sandwich. Now to two things that personally made my stay special. The Trump International Golf Club and my concierge mr Angel Melendez. Trump is what it should be. A world class golf club that is flawless in everyway. I just loved playing on the courses which are very challenging. Mr. Melendez took care of everything for us. He went out of his way to make sure every whim we had was exceeded. He would get us lunch by the private pool. He would reserve bali beds for us daily. He would escort us everywhere, and best of all he described everything perfectly and never once steered us incorrectly. His honesty and charm will carry him far at this particular resort. I feel so strong about Mr. Melendez's charactor I am personally going to contact his superior and recommend him for advancement. Without Angel our stay would have not been the same. Thank you Angel from the bottom or our hearts for all your hard work and efforts. A special thanks to Eddie and Luis. Luis best of luck in your baseball career with the Astro's Would we go back to Gran Melia? Quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure I'd stay if it were my money...”
Reviews.Author: wholetruth_11
Reviews.Content: My stay at the hotel was paid by my company, so bear that in mind as you read my review. Not my money being spent... Warmly received by concierge staff and guided to front desk. Check in was slow despite no line, but the lobby is almost jaw-dropping in it's beauty. Driven quarter-mile by golf cart to room. Room was nicely appointed but not quite clean - bathroom had shampoo, but no hand-soap and bath towel for getting out of shower had hairball on it, mini-bar was partially empty. We learned the room had only been partially-cleaned after the next morning's cleaning yielded the soap, full mini-bar, etc that was lacking the day before. Also learned that 2 other couples we were traveling with had similar issues with their rooms - some worse than ours. "Adult" pool was very nice and the main grounds are truly beautiful both during the day and perhaps even more so at night. You could definitely call Gran Melia a romantic place. Enjoyed the pina coladas and other drinks & eats at the pool throughout the day. Ate dinner at both the Puerto Rican restaurant and the Italian place. Puerto Rican = Large portions & good food, especially enjoyed Mafunga. Very nice servers, but undoubtedly slow and forgetful (as in, "would you like dessert tonight?" "Sure, we'd like to see a menu", and 20 minutes later he brings the check and asks if we'd be interested in any dessert again... Italian = Also very good and the service was EXCELLENT. Asian Fusion = We heard from others that the service was terrible in every way, despite the food tasting very good. Spa treatment was good for most people we spoke with, though I wasn't impressed with the one I received. My wife and I had a couples massage and the room was too cold for us. My wife was very pleased w/her massage, whereas mine was weak & if I had paid my own $140, I would have been disappointed. I was a guest of a group outing, so at $282/night, it would be difficult to accept some of the lack of attention to detail. As it was, I had a very nice time and should re-emphasize that the grounds are really beautiful and spacious, the employees were typically kind and helpful, and ... despite the seaweed in the ocean, you can still enjoy a very nice swim! GRAN MELIA PR NEEDS TO IMPROVE IT'S ATTENTION TO DETAIL IN TWO AREAS: (1) THE 20% OF EMPLOYEES WHO ARE VERY WEAK ON CUSTOMER SERVICE NEED TO BE WEEDED OUT OR TRAINED, AND (2) THEY NEED TO MAKE SURE EVERY ROOM IS COMPLETELY CLEAN BEFORE CHECKING SOMEONE INTO IT.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - worth a trip!”
Reviews.Author: tmels
Reviews.Content: Although it wasn't all inclusive, the location, cleanliness, and beautiful resort made up for it. It was a nice resort with a large pool, beach access and amazing rooms. The onsite restaurants were very good! The service could have been quicker however, we got everything we needed and it all worked out okay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: Love2travel131
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a two night stay at this hotel. We went with another couple. The hotel is beautiful and offers something for everyone. However, we spent too much time trying to get checked-in, checked-out and trying to straighten out our charges. We booked the trip 36 hours before checking in with Cheaptickets.com. When we tried to check in at 12 am, the hotel could not find our reservation. After 45 minutes and us showing them our reservation confirmation, the front desk manager checked us in as a regular walk-in at the regular rate. She told us everything should be straighten out by the morning. At 9 am we got a knock on the door asking us what time we were checking out. We told them we were booked for two nights. It was then followed by a phone call telling us the room was only reserved for one night. I called front desk and was told the confirmation still hadn't come in and it would be straighten out when it did. Later that morning we ordered drinks by the pool and tried charging to our room. We were told we showed on their system as being checked out. We walked straight to the front desk and and was told the confirmation had just been received. Thankfully, we thought, everything was finally straighten out. Not so. When we went to check out it took over 45 minutes waiting in line to get towel charges removed and the rate adjusted. There were only 2 front desk personnel to handle everyone's check out and everyone seemed to have the same problem of the towel charges. The people behind us were worried they would miss their flight. As for our room, it looked nice and clean. It did have a strong mildew smell. Being the tropics we thought this was normal. On our second night, all four of us had bed bug bites. We didn't think much of it them since we didn't think it was possible with the rooms and beds looking so clean, but the bites we did get. Not a way to end a vacation. Needless to say, for the price we paid we expected more from Gran Melia.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds, But Has Drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: PDM1967
Reviews.Content: Drove to the Gran Melia from San Juan and stayed for one night when our flight was cancelled and the hotel we were in was booked. Overall, the $179 ($220 with tax) we paid for the night was well worth it. My wife and I and three young children fit into the Jr Suite. The hotel did supply a refrigerator for the food we brought with us. The room was clean, but there was a very strong mildew smell. The room clearly had a serious mold problem in the walls. If our stay had been for more than one night I would have complained. Pool and grounds are beautiful. Can't comment on the restaurants or service. Overall I would hesitate to pay much more for this hotel, but if you cang get a good rate (and if you like golf) seems like a good place to stay for a few nights. 10 Minutes from El Yunqe.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it...although we were leary of the mixed reviews.”
Reviews.Author: Troy S
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of the previous reviews and was a bit concerned. We were pleasantly surprised. I was there for a conference and brought my family with me. I would never to there without a rental car, it is in a remote location. We never ate on the resort, I've been to Puerto Rico before so we ventured out each day and tried the local fare. The staff was very friendly. Our room was clean, nicely appointed. No maintenance issues. Cleaned daily to a high standard. The grounds were a bit "yellow" but otherwise in good condition. The hotel lobby was amazing. Would totally stay here again, although we got a great off-peak season price with our group. The wireless internet is quite poor, so bring your lan cable for your laptop and you'll be fine! (Also bring your own rum and coke, the drinks are pricey).

Reviews.Title: “Resort is not clean and customer service is the worst I have experienced.”
Reviews.Author: JoJo60745
Reviews.Content: The resort could be beautiful but our room, and common areas are just not clean. The upholstery on the furniture in the common areas is filthy. The rugs in the common areas look like they have not been vacuumed in weeks. The restaurant at the pool is repulsive. There were birds and a stray cat eating food from an empty table. On the whole, the staff could not be bothered with the guests. There certainly were exceptions but overall, the customer service was horrible. Our room was dirty and the smell of mildew and must was overpowering. Luckily, the bed was comfortable. There are four restaurants at the resort and the food is average at best. The Asian Fusion restaurant was the best of the four. The spa and the pool at the spa were nice and we enjoyed our spa services. I would NOT stay at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “good and less than good....”
Reviews.Author: jeff34895
Reviews.Content: We were there for our wedding, and the Melia was the most convenient location for us and our guests. So let's get the negatives out of the way...The service is definitely slow, but I attribute some of that to rural island living...This isn't the mainland USA. The ground room was musty, so we immediately changed to a second level room, which was fine. The dining was very average, but our expectations weren't very high. And the billing was a bit of a nightmare. We had a lot of people in our group who had issues with the mini bar, and we were double charged for my mother n law's room. On the positive side, the staff were all extremely friendly. The pool is beautiful, and it was perfect for chilling out before and after our wedding. Buying beer/drinks at the pool is expensive, but you can also buy beer from the hotel market and save yourself a lot of money. They technically do not allow outside drinks, but as long as you don't rub in their faces, they seemed to be pretty cool about it. (don't drag a huge cooler out to the pool. pack your drinks in a back pack or something less conspicuous) The location is decent...I think...Luquillo beach is nearby, as are the kiosks and the rain forest. The kiosks are great. I've read reports that they're expensive, but the entrees range from $15-$25. And there is plenty of inexpensive street food. Not fancy atmosphere, but everything I had was fantastic...(highly recommend the Ceviche Hut, the ceviche and the grilled snapper) and the drinks are really inexpensive! Fajardo is a short drive. And from there you can do the Bio Bay (which was great), or a ferry over to Culebra (very beautiful). Whatever you do, either rent a car or find the number for a local Taxi. The shuttle service, Dragon Fly, is out of control expensive, and the hotel staff isn't allowed to help you find a local taxi. I rented from Avis at the airport, and Melia let me park in the hotel lot. But the rules seem to change from person to person, so I wouldn't ask. Just tell the guy at the gate (on your way out) that you're renting from Avis, and you shouldn't have any problem. Having a car will save you money by allowing you to leave the resort for meals or drinking...and it basically cuts the cost of any excursions in half. For example, the bio bay tour was $40 with your own transportation, but $89 through Dragon Fly. Taxi's to and from the airport are $65 for up to 6 people. I think the Melia shuttle is $30/person each way. Taxi's will stop at stores or whatever so you can pick up boos, snacks, food or whatever (my buddy had to buy a belt) to sneak into the hotel...no problem....They're very cool! Overall, we had a nice experience. My wife and I agreed on 3 1/2 out of 5. But we were also on a group rate of $200 (including fees, tips, etc) I'm sure our expectations would have been greater if we were paying full price. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Nice pictures - poor services”
Reviews.Author: ceicil60880
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 night at the Gran Melia Resort. The pool area is beautiful, clean and relaxing (It got a little scared of the iguana jumping in the pool but apparently I was the only one). The beach is very nice for a romantic walk. The property in general is very clean and it is was actually more staffs than guests during our stay. Concerning the room, they are very spacious and clean. during our first night, someone start yelling, banging and screaming at our door at 3 am. I was pretty scared and called the security. The person left after a while but we never heard anything from the security. We went to the front desk the next day and they told us that thing like that happen sometimes, we should not be worry!!! Not apologize or anything. We also tried the first night the "Italian" restaurant of the resort. The is way over-priced and the food is barely ok. My shrimp scampi came undercook and we had to ask 4 times the check before to get it. We had a rent car and ask several time direction to the concierge which was a waist of time. The only information given were printed paper with no information update. We stop to eat at the resort next door Rio Del Mar the next day. This resort is nicer, the golf grill restaurant excellent but the resort crowded. I will go back to the Gran Melia when they have good deal, but won't eat there or ask their service for excursion or rental.

Reviews.Title: “The Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: fireflykw
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at this hotel and are very disappointed. We read the reviews on Trip advisor last night and had the best laugh, a highlight to our vacation so far. We are experienced travlers and thought with the Trump International golf course here at the hotel that it would be a safe bet! Boy were we wrong. The service was slower than slow, there is no service to the "Red level Royal Service", and the beach is narrow with seaweed. The grounds and lobby area are beautiful but that is the highlight to the hotel. The pool bar area was blasting offensive and foul Hip Hop music which could not be escaped. This was also the only place to eat by the pool/beach and was disgusting, mostly fried, burgers looked ok, but nothing to appeal to the experinced pallet. The dining...if you could call it that was overpriced and fair at best. We ordered a grilled shrimp cocktail from room service and received a hot plate of grilled shrimp...what part of that constitutes a "shrimp cocktail"? Grilled and chilled was expected. Also beware the restaurants switch being open, so only one choice pernight. We paid for a jr. suite ocean view, which is spacious but not very clean. On the third night my friend came "home" to an unmaid room and the previous night was subjected to a broken toilet. On an absurd note, they throw away all partially used hotel soap and products in your room everyday. I would use my bar of soap once and gone! I can think of 100 ways to put that money to better use at the NOT so Grand Melia. We tried to rent a car her from Avis and waited 2 hours! Not kidding. When the guy finally showed up he left all the keys to the cars at the other hotel and had to drive back and get them. We did get the car for $34.99 from $75.00 which for us ended up being a score, just unneccesarily inconvient. What made our trip great: Captain Ron (787) 429-8080. We rented his boat for a private charter and went to gorgeous beaches, great snorkling and he has a stellar and professional personality. The Barcardi factory. Skip the free tour and redeem your 2 free drink tickets. Fern restaurnt at the St. Regis Taxi: Jose (787) 486-5049 Tres Cent Onze restaurant in old San Juan

Reviews.Title: “"Quiet, out of the way destination"”
Reviews.Author: parkperson_11
Reviews.Content: Our vacation overlaps the two most recent ones and I find it odd that some impressions are very different, however, I am not questioning anyone else's experiences. As many have stated, the outside grounds, pools, and buildings are lovely. However, our room could have used a fresh coat of paint and some new throw pillows and such. The room was pretty clean, didn't really have an odor but the vents could have used some scrubbing and we had no problems whatsoever with daily services. Everyone we came in contact with from the front desk personnel to the guys driving the carts (they always stopped and asked us if we wanted a ride), to the security people were very friendly and helpful. We did find the buffet (we only got the cold buffet for $12) to be pretty good but we found Coco's Sweet Bakery at the intersection of Coco Blvd and Hwy 3 to have a great ham and egg breakfast as well as pastries and coffee. We only ate dinner at the resort the first night there at the Italian restaurant and it was good, about the same as what we would pay for a good restaurant here in our area. We tried one local place that had ok food but I questioned the fact that salad dressings appeared to stay out on the tables without refrigeration. The Old Harbor Brewery food was good and the Japanese place in OSJ was ok. Definitely rent a car so that you aren't tied to the resort. There wasn't much going on as far as entertainment in the evenings and we didn't upgrade to RS so we didn't have access to those services. If you rent a car from Avis at the airport, you will be charged a parking fee if you park in the guest area but if there is space available at the Avis Rent A Car site at the hotel, you won't be charged. You have to make sure that you do not fill out the sheet to put in your window that shows you are parking in the guest lot. We ended up parking in the lot cause the Avis lot was full most of the time. It was $16 a day. Some people have commented on having to wear the bands that show you are a guest. Our band was blue, we saw red ones, white ones, silver and then the string ones. If you leave the property, you can cut yours off but keep it and when you come back, ask for a new one to wear. If you lose it, then they might charge you for another. They explained it to us so there was not a problem for us. We got a new one every day. We had no problems bringing in bottled water, sodas, and snacks. We put it in our backpack and just entered. They are trying to keep people from coming in with coolers and foods that need a fridge. We asked and they told us sure as long as it was a reasonable amount. We took the tour to the Rainforest through Dragonfly Tours at the hotel. It was alright but I think I would try a different tour company if we went again. We wanted to go to Guanitica, in the SW corner of PR but we were afraid to venture that far away in the little car we rented. We really couldn't find anyone who had knowledge of that area or a tour there. We did go into Old San Juan on Sunday and got into a big mess with traffic while trying to leave. It took us 2 hours to go 1 mile. If you go into Old San Juan, make sure you park south of Constitution Drive, not up near the forts. There are many little streets that feed into that one road and the people believe that if there is an empty space between your car and the one in front of you that it belongs to them! We did return to OSJ on Wed and it was easier to get around. The forts are worth seeing as well as the old churches. Be aware of your belongings and I suggest a tight grip on your purses and wallets for men in front pockets, not rear ones. The streets are very narrow and crowded with people. Prime pick pocket opportunities. Street signs do not exist in OSJ, the street names are on the corner buildings and are not easy to see. Most maps do not have all the streets on them but we finally found a good one available at some of the businesses like Starbucks, free of charge. We left this morning and our bill was placed outside our door during the night. We had no problems checking out, the charges were correct. If you have the money to spend on the golf, like to gamble and can afford to or just want to get away from everything for a few days, the resort would be ideal. We had the opportunity to visit here on short notice and enjoyed our stay. We just like to sight see and spent alot of time on the road getting from one place to another (and getting lost!) The location wasn't ideal for that but overall, we were pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice property”
Reviews.Author: threedragons
Reviews.Content: So here are the pros and cons: Pros: very nice grounds and ocean front, Hotel staff is just above and beyond friendly, huge pool, very clean rooms and large in size. Cons: Dragon fly staff (on site tour booking company) was very unorganized and rude, rooms did smell musky as everyone else has noted which makes your clothes smell the same, resort is way off of the main roads so no walking to any restaurants or shops. Still overall I would stay here again in a heartbeat. If you do make sure you call Tropical Trail Rides for an ATV ride...highlite of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel isolated from everything else”
Reviews.Author: autruche
Reviews.Content: This establishment is owned by a company called Sol Melia that is Spain's counterpart to the Hilton or Sheraton hotel chains. I would guess that the clientele here is about two thirds English-speaking from North America and one third Spanish-speaking from Spain and Central America/the Caribbean. The large rooms are spotless as you would expect from such an organization, and the staff is very eager to please the hotel guests. In this connection, the housekeeping staff sometimes even seems to be intimidated by the "Anglo" guests, something I would attribute to the language barrier. The grounds are beautiful and scrupulously maintained. As the name of this hotel indicates, it is in a perfect location if you play golf, with a large golf course next door. To do just about anything else in Puerto Rico from the Gran Melia, it is advisable to rent a car. The fare in the hotel's restaurants is good, but overpriced; there is a large selection of restaurants in nearby Luquillo and Fajardo. El Yunque National Park (a rainforest) and the bathing beach at Luquillo are within half an hour's driving distance from the hotel; the hotel's own beach is good only for sunning oneself and walking, and you will need sandals to do the latter. The hotel is self contained, or all-inclusive if you please, with a casino, a small store, a spa, large lounges, billiard tables, a small playground for kids, and a swimming pool with Bali beds surrounding it. The swimming pool does not have a lifeguard; if the hotel has one defect, this would be it in my opinion. In sum, Gran Melia is a good spot to go to play golf or to stay if you want to get away from the winter snow. It's far away, both in distance and in spirit, from the rest of Puerto Rico, however.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, Beautiful Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: Rengs30
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my stay at the Gran Melia Puerto Rico. This was my second trip to Puerto Rico and my boyfriend and I decided we wanted to stay somewhere outside of San Juan near a golf course. We stumbled upon this hotel and couldn't be happier. The resort was very quiet and relaxing with beautiful tropical grounds. If you are looking for a wild nightlife scene this is not the place! I recommend upgrading to Royal Service. The included breakfast nearly pays for the cost of the upgrade, plus there are added perks such as the cocktail hour and private adults only pool. You can also rent the bali beds at the pool for the entire stay at no cost. We also upgraded to the beach front room, which has a jacuzzi on the balcony. There is no swimming (or lounging) beach at this hotel. The shoreline is a bit rocky but can make for a nice stroll along the beach in your flip flops. We ate at the Puerto Rican restaurant which was very good. The service is slow but I've found that is to be expected when you are on an island. Cafe Soleil has a great breakfast spread with absolutely anything you can imagine. The hotel is right next to the incredible Trump International golf course. The course is in incredible condition and is challenging for both scratch and novice golfers. We rented a car which I would highly recommend. We took a side trip to the Rain Forest, to Fajardo for the Bio Bay Kayak excursion (which I highly recommend) and also to Luquillo for the delicious restaurants (they call them "kiosks") that are there. One other tip: sign up for the MAS rewards card before you head to the hotel. It gives you many perks like 2 for 1 breakfast, discounted room upgrades, and a bottle of wine during your birth month! I had a very enjoyable stay at Gran Melia and would certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “Most relaxing”
Reviews.Author: springmissy
Reviews.Content: My husband and our two grown kids and I visited 2 weeks before Christmas. This was definitely a "dead" week - like a calm before the Holiday storm! The pool was quiet and I can't comment about chairs or towels as there was hardly anyone else there! I suppose that was good for my husband and I; but I think our kids would have liked to find some singles to interract with. The hotel grounds are beautiful. Very spread out; this isn't a high rise hotel. If you don't like to walk, you might not like this. I loved it! We ate breakfast at the hotel and the buffet was very good. Yes, it is pricey; but I have a MAS (hotel points) gold card which got one free breakfast with a paid breakfast. The first night we ate in the Japanese restaurant. We had been travelling and were starved, so they could have fed us cardboard and we would have eaten it. Actually the food was good; but portions were a bit small. Our room was wonderful - we are vacation club members and had an awesome suite. Housekeeping was very good. The people at the hotel - both staff and guests - were soooooo friendly. Another thing I noticed - no one was hawking anything to us. We could walk the beach and it was so private. We did rent a car - made the reservation prior to the trip - at the hotel (Avis). This allowed us to get out and sightsee at our leisure as well as to eat evening meals elsewhere. About the beach - I considered it to be "natural". White sand has not been brought in as the hotels in Mexico have done. Bring a pair of cheap water shoes and walk along the beach. It was a lot of fun looking for shells. The YHI spa is very nice. I had a massage one afternoon and because I was there near closing, they extended an invitation to use the facilities the next day. There is also a nice gym with a pretty good assortment of equipment. We will definitely be back. Next time will be before summer but after "winter" as the temps were a little cooler than I had hoped for. Only downside that I can recall - after I got home I realized I had been charged for four lost towels ($140). We turned in the towels at the activities center AND gave the towel cards back when we checked out. I have tried repeatedly to contact someone at the hotel but when I get transferred to the desk, they don't answer or the call hands up. I sent a fax and have not heard a reply.

Reviews.Title: “Service is lacking!”
Reviews.Author: chelega74
Reviews.Content: Just stayed from Dec 27th to Dec 31st. The resort is absolutely beautiful. The beach is not very good, not one to actually walk on. The service at the restaurants is lacking. The service at the overall hotel was good. The 1st room we were given was garden view and was not good at all, smelled musty, the hotel manager was able to move us to another room with partial ocean view, this room also had smell. We attempted to upgrade to Royal Service and was told we were not able to get the service, no room upgrade, just the service. The rooms were large, but very outdated. Tempo, the Italian restaurant was good and service was good. Nami, the Japanese restaurant was good. Pasion, Puerto Rican was not good at all. Cafe Soilel, was good for breakfast and lunch, service was good. The hamburger at the pool bar was good. Trump Golf was excellent., would highly recommend. We would recommend seeing El Yunque rainforest, was beautiful. We also recommend seeing Old San Juan and Barcadi Rum Tour. We would recommend using Dragonfly at the Hotel, ask for "Shorty" for your tour driver.

Reviews.Title: “Hardly Good”
Reviews.Author: panthrg1rl
Reviews.Content: I think the main issue comes down to service received for the price paid. I stayed at Gran Melia with my Mom and sister. We had a fantastic trip but there were some things that made this resort seem terrible. On the second day we had traveled to Luquillo (since Gran Melia has virtually no beach... just rock and seaweed) and Seven Seas to spend time in the ocean. We had returned to no housekeeping done! When my Mom tried calling about no housekeeping, she was transferred to many different people and one lady in particular stood out by questioning my Mom about it... something like "Are you sure?" WHAT?! It was so ridiculous that we went to the front desk to complain. Other minor issues would be the lack of nightlife, small maintenance issues (broken lightbulb, broken remote, etc.), outrageous parking fees (ours was about $12 a day), lack of beach, cold (read UNHEATED) pool, and super expensive onsite restaurants. Now for the good things! The resort is gorgeous! The design is very japanese in places. Rooms are spacious and well decorated. An in-room safe was a plus. The bed was comfortable. The pool was nice to lay by with comfy lounge chairs and cabanas that I could sleep in all day! The grounds were well kept. The walk to our bungalow (11) wasn't that bad. Though the resort was big, it was easy to get around. The casino was small but there was plenty of entertainment. Bottom line I recommend staying somewhere else where you can spend less and probably receive better quality of service! The location isn't that bad if you have a car to bring you to some of the kiosks for your meals. There's a bakery called Coco's on the corner of the main road that serves good breakfast food. The beaches nearby (Luquillo, Seven Seas, etc.) are nice and clean with beautiful views.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy rooms and beautiful setting”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuru1000
Reviews.Content: When we first checked-into the Gran Melia, we were a bit put-off by the casino and size of the resort (we estimated ~1,000 guest capacity). The bungalows were beautiful, but are a fair distance from the parking lot and main building, so you need to wear a bracelet identifying you as a guest and take a cart to your room. Also, they charge $16/night for parking. Besides the bungalows, the resort also has regular hotel rooms, as well as some upscale condos. Our favorite things about this resort were the rooms, which were beautifully designed, very clean, a good size, quiet and had their own balcony. Also, the rooms are very close to the beach. We enjoyed a morning walk on the beach, and saw amazing iguanas in the resort gardens, flying fish in the water, and many varieties of birds. The resort has 4 restaurants on the premises as well as a bar. We tried "Pasion", which had local Puerto-Rican style food. We found the restaurant to be over-priced, and the service was very slow (we had to wait almost an hour for our food!). Overall, we would recommend going outside of the resort for your meals, as you can find better value in places like Luquillo (see Sandy's as well as the kiosks near Luquillo beach). The location of the resort is very good for visiting the attractions in the NE of Puerto Rico. By car, it is only ~20 minutes to El Yunque Rainforest, 30 minutes to Fajardo (where you can catch ferries to Culebra and Vieques islands, and ~30 minutes to Old San Juan). Watch out for the $35 charge for beach towels. The resort will remove this from your bill when you return the towels and ask them to remove the charge. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at Gran Melia, but kept clear of the casino and main building as much as possible.

Reviews.Title: “The illusion of a resort with none of the substance.”
Reviews.Author: Eccodeus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with my college age daughter just returned from a very disappointing stay here. While the young staff is earnest and looking to please, management appears to be ineffectual and devoid of imagination. Specifically, an atmosphere of disorganization seems to pervade every aspect of the place. First the food. Because it is located in a remote spot there are no real options for food except for their very overpriced restaurants. The food is good, but the service is abysmal and amateurish. In a land where coffee is a big deal we were never able to get a cup of post dinner coffee. In addition they make it sound like the restaurants offer elegant dining except they don't enforce the dress code so I was sitting next to a guy wearing an undershirt and shorts. Also, because there are no restaurants that cater more for the younger crowd (Johnny Rockets?) dinner at two spots were frequently interrupted by loud children and management said nothing to the parents. While there is a pool bar and restaurant the food is very expensive. The buffet breakfast is $23 for "hot" and $16 for "cold". Since my eggs and sausage were cold and greasy I asked the waiter if i could be charged at the lower price. When you get the final bill you will find that you have spent over $1,000 on food and drinks over a 4 day stay. Second, the facilities. The grounds are well kept and attractive. The rooms are nicely designed but the beds and pillows were terrible. There are no organized events for children - not that it is billed as a family resort- but I noticed some kids trying to play touch football on a small patch of grass. Oh yes they can get an airbrushed tattoo for $7 (my wife did get one). Music blasted across the pool area that included one or two rap songs with lyrics bordering on the X rated. Location: Very remote. Going to Old San Juan takes about 45 minutes and about $160 round trip for three people. In the midst of all this i was being urged to join the "Gran Melia Vacation Club". Wasn't going to happen. In short, a mediocre, wanna be resort that needs a lot of fresh air blown through it. There are alternatives (with beaches which this does not have). My advice is to look to them.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, HORRIBLE service”
Reviews.Author: DianaGL
Reviews.Content: Although the place was beautiful, "things" don't make a resort. It is ultimately the SERVICE that makes the resort, the attitude of the people that run the place. And this was the WORST service we have ever experienced in any Melia, really not the Melia we know. We have been at the Melia Cancun, the Melia from Punta Cana, and even the Melia from Torremolinos, Spain. The service was the distinguishing factor in all of them, impeccable. But this one, Puerto Rico was a disaster. Housekeeping: I think the root of the problem is the manager, Brenda, a woman that was so arrogant, so rude and belligerent in treating my husband and me, who were guests at the resort, we can only imagine how she treats the employees. Employees that are bullied like that will obviously in turn not do their jobs! So, our room was not cleaned one day, we went to an excursion the entire day and instead of returning to a clean room with fresh towels and made beds to rest a little, take showers and go to dinner, we came to a dirty room! When we called, Brenda instead asked: "Did you call for service?". She was blaming us for the room not getting cleaned! Another day, they cleaned the rooms, but didn't put fresh towels, like the cleaning lady was suddenly called away in the middle of her work and didn't finish the bathroom. They sent us the "manager" of the housekeeping who was apologetic and very sheepish, embarrassed, mortified poor man. It was this bully Brenda that was clearly abusing everyone. After we returned from dinner, they had cleaned the room and made cute towel animals; but we would rather not get anything cute and just plain regular service when appropriate. Room Service: Our room never had a room service list or a book or binder with any of the hotel amenities, no spa booklet, and no resort restaurant guide. I didn't use the spa because I never got a list of the services and prices! When you are on vacation with your family, time is essential and you donâ€™t want to waste your time trying to get information. We called room service to get two mojitos, and got this Brenda woman again. She said: "Room service is only for wine and beer". My husband called the bar man who said he could prepare the mojitos and have room service personnel bring them. We called this Brenda again to tell her to send the personnel to pick up the mojitos, and again she said: "No, you can't get mojitos through room service; you have to go down to the bar yourself." So there was this tug of war between Brenda and the bar man, not my problem to deal with. I told Brenda â€œYou know, Iâ€™m the guest, I shouldnâ€™t be calling several people to get a drink, deal with getting me the mojitos, but she refused to do so.â€� Again, we have been at several Melia resorts and have always called for a late night drink to have on the balcony after our boys go to sleep, no problem. On the contrary, in Melia Cancun the room service staff actually made us a special drink he invented, with delicious cream rum, and brought them to our room late at night. This is the first time I ever heard that room service does not bring you a drink! The next night, two engineers came to fix several lights and the AC that was not working properly and we told them about the mojito incident. They were stunned, and made no comment about this Brenda, the kind of silence that shows that she's a problem there. 10 minutes after they left we got a call from the bar man who said "I'm in charge here; I'm sending you two mojitos with the engineers". And so they did and we tipped them handsomely, and of course paid for the drinks and the service, which was never an issue. But this was an individual doing his "service", not the attitude of the resort as it should be. Again, I think this Brenda was the poison apple in the entire system, poisoning the moral and attitude of the staff and the people and there's a tug of war with her and other workers and the guests pay the price. Brenda and her horrible attitude is killing the natural service mind of the employees, killing the resort and the image of Melia. Pool and Jacuzziâ€™s: With respect to the rest of the service, the pool was not heated and neither were the jacuzzi's. So if you go in winter, it is only about 75F and the water was freezing. We would have loved to use the stunning pool and jacuzzi's but what good are they if they are freezing cold? In Punta Cana they heated the pool, even though it was summer hot. In our room the Jacuzzi water never came out hot enough, only lukewarm, so we couldn't use that one either. We were tired of calling for things, so we just decided to get out of there, and did every kind of excursion available. Pasion Restaurant: We booked a 9pm dinner at the resort gourmet Puerto Rican restaurant, Pasion. They sat us down on time, gave us water and menus. 25 minutes later, we had not been served, no bread, no waitress. We flagged the waitress down, and my husband asked to get us another waiter, several were just walking around, but this waitress said: "No, I'll take care of you when I'm done with this other table." Usually, you take care of the guests within 5 to 10 minutes, max, at least have someone come and bring bread, tell you about the menu, bring a wine list. So, 5 minutes later, we stood up and walked out. Again, ridiculous lack of service, in such a beautiful place. Again, either the chef does not know how to manage a restaurant and insists on doing it herself or putting her incompetent cronies in charge. Again, belligerent Puerto Rican women, the male waiters were too sheepish to take the initiative and start taking our orders, they are afraid of the rude and pushy women. We went to the Italian restaurant at the resort and they immediately served us and acknowledged that several other guests had issues with Pasion, which is not Melia-owned but a concession. The problem is that we wouldn't know that since the restaurant is in the resort, so all ill-will goes to the Melia! Even if Melia allows non-resort restaurants, they should monitor that the service is up to standard, but it appears that whoever is in charge of this Melia is in La La land about service. Or, worse, they gave power to the Brenda woman who is an unprofessional, obviously uneducated in resort and hotel hospitality, disaster. Whatever it was, it negatively impacted my vacation. Pricing v. Value: Furthermore, although the Italian restaurant was good, and so was the buffet breakfast, they were very expensive for the level of service and quality of the food. We obviously expect to pay extra when we go on vacation, but we also expect that paying $35 for a plate of penne pasta must come along with gourmet taste, service and ambiance. Living in LA and having Las Vegas really close, we are used to top of the line restaurants and for that price you should be served like a king. A $22 breakfast buffet should include much more than your standard eggs, omelets, and cut fruit. At least it does in the other Meliaâ€™s and resorts we have been to all over the Caribbean, Europe, South America, and even China. Overall: I would not go back to this place, Melia Puerto Rico. If it wasn't for having our own rented Jeep and taking excursions they would have totally ruined our experience. We simply used the resort for sleeping, again the pool was freezing and the jacuzzi's unheated. So, whatever beauty there was, was totally superficial; a total disappointment. I would recommend people stay in Isla Verde, in San Juan, it sounds like those hotels are better, at least you have more to do walking distance, you can escape if the service is poor, but fellow excursion guests stated they liked the service at the various resorts in Isla Verde. I hope this detailed review helps.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money, except...”
Reviews.Author: Noname11111
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, but has 2 cons, and this is why I probably won't recommend it for younger travellers (under 35): 1. No night entertainment at all, except a casino and some music in the lounge which don't count for me at all 2. Due to the lack of entertainment, you would want to go out on your own. And it will add costs for renting a car+parking. The parking is very expensive. If you are looking for a relaxing experience during the day - you can find it there. And a great golf course.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected for the $”
Reviews.Author: Prreader
Reviews.Content: Firstly, check-in took almost an hour and there was only one person ahead of us in line. The hotel staff was very nice, however. When we got to the room, which was kind of a walk, it smelled musty. They did have a golf cart service to your rooms, but no one was at that station when we finally got our room. We called the desk to ask about hot tubs and she directed us to the pool area. There were actually no hot tubs available. The pool was amazingly large and clean, but the night was cool and the water was too cold for us. We tried to take a hot bath, but there was no plug. I took a hot shower and got into the hard bed to find that the sheets didn't even reach to the bottom of the bed. The linens were nice, but the bed wasn't comfy at all. There were only two pillows per bed and no extras were available. Overall, I wouldn't come back. The El San Juan in San Juan was FAR nicer and worthy of the resort label.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star resort with true caribbean beaches and beautiful weather”
Reviews.Author: Lafamiliaone
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spend 2 nights at the resort before our 7 day cruise and had a wonderful relaxing time. We spend most of our time at the beach and pool areas during the day enjoying the band and entertainment poolside. The pool was incredibly beautiful and large, overlooking the ocean with outstanding sunsets! We renewed our wedding vows in the outdoor wedding chapel at sunset, and couldn't have asked for a more serene and beautiful setting. We enjoyed 2 restaurants for dinners (a little pricey), and had lunch by the pool. Since we upgraded to the nicer oceanfront rooms our breakfast was included. The rooms were spacious and very nicely decorated and we had a Jacuzzi on our balcony outside that we enjoyed in the evenings- overlooking the ocean you can't ask for anything more than that. The staff was friendly and went out of their way to assist us with anything that we needed. My only recommendation would be to get the bar staff to interact more with the patrons in the bar. The hotel hired a radio station to entertain those staying at the hotel but unfortunately there was no dancing. You could really relax and enjoy the resort at a slow pace- Island time. Your vacation is what you make of it. You can go anticipating having a good time and make it happen, or you can go and complain during your entire stay and have a bad time. Fortunately we had a fantastic time, beautiful weather and outstanding taste of life in the Caribbean. We will definitely return to this 4 star resort!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay with all of the amenities”
Reviews.Author: vac2020
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Melia over Thanksgiving for 5 nights. Since we planned on sight seeing the first two nights we stayed in a regular room, but then upgraded the last three nights to the Royal Service. We travel to the Caribbean at least once per year, and the only smell we found was the tropical smell you find on the island. Nothing unpleasant. Although our regular room was nice, and the check in went smoothly, it was worth it to do the royal service. The check-in was great, you receive complimentary breakfast buffet (a nice selection of made to order pancakes, omelets, eggs, etc..along with cereals, fruits and bakery items. It was filling enough that we were able to just snack for lunch. You receive complimentary wine or beer from 6-9pm. So we would stop in to have a before dinner drink. Regarding the restaurant: We went to the Italian restaurant at the resort even though we are not pasta lovers. They have a nice selection of choices on their menu. My husband had a steak $32 that was really good, and I had Sea Bass for $27. I eat seafood out quit often, yet I found this was one of the best seafood meals I ever had. I liked it so much we went back the night before we left. We thought the prices we actually very reasonable for the quality of food and service we received. We live in medium sized city in Wisconsin and these meals would cost us more in a nice restaurant by our home. We eat earlier so we had no problem getting seating. And when you are in the Royal Service, and you are sitting by the pool, you can just request the Service Manager to make you a reservation. They will assist you with anything you need while you are sun bathing. Also the bar in RS makes the best drinks. The Bali beds are also complimentary in RS. On your first day you can request a particular bed to be reserved for the time you are staying at the resort. They will make sure a clean sheet and towels are laid out each morning for your arrival. These beds cost $35 rent if you are not in the RS area. Also you get rid of the orange band, and get a nicer looking white string type rope for a band to indicate you are in RS. We did not find the walk from the car to the room, or from the room to any of the facility anything bad. The grounds are nice to walk around and enjoy the sun. The fitness room was nice and clean. It provides treadmills, a few machines and some weights. It you want to use the sauna and steam room, you would have to pay a fee approx of $30 per day. Otherwise it is free with a spa service. We found the prices for the spa treatments to be expensive. Regarding Parking: It is customary to be charged a parking fee at the majority of hotels near us from $15-$25 per day. So we took the advice of a previous reviewer and rented an Avis car at the airport. The resort allows you to park free with an Avis car rental. Since we rented it at the airport and not at the resort, we emailed them prior to arriving to get an email confirmation that they would waive the fee - we had no problems. Location: Make sure you have driving directions with you when you arrive. We relied on the rental company to supply the directions, and that was a poor decision. They had us drive the back roads when took us 3 hrs to get from the airport to the resort during rush hour. The traffic can get really bad, so try to avoid driving during their rush hour times. We would highly recommend a car. In the long run it will save you money, cause the airport shuttles are pricey and then sight seeing transportation is also costly. If you have a car, it is an easy drive to the rain forest and it is free to enter. The forts also only have a minimal charge to enter if you have your own transportation.. Checkout was also easy. They provide you with a breakdown of all your charges and deliver the summary the morning of your departure. Since all charges at the resort are charged to your room, keep an inventory of what you are spending. We were not receiving receipts when we charged any items, but we were able to recall all of our charges. The only complication was when we were in the RS area, our charges came up under code numbers and so it was a little more difficult to confirm. But the check-out clerk was extremely nice to assist. So just give yourself amble time to review. We had no problems with tips as many of the reviewers indicated. We added our tip to the bill and that was all we were charged. If you don't want to be charged an International Transaction Fee on your charge card bill, I would suggest looking into a Credit Union credit card due to the majority of them do not charge this fee. We would highly recommend this resort. We only have a few negative comments...The pool to the swim up bar was cold, so we did not get to enjoy as much as we thought we would. This probably saved us a lot of money. And the bar tender was not very friendly. All other employees were excellent so this was no big deal. ...We would not suggest ordering the bar area pizza. We ordered pizza while we sat in the bar area to watch one of the football games and it was the worst pizza that we ever had. We weren't even being picky. And we don't even mind frozen cheap pizza. But this was not edible....and the last thing is RS should consider making their lounge "adults only" during the happy hour time. We did not find it comfortable to sit around and have a couple drinks with kids running around and watching childrens shows on tv. They also would take up the computers just to hit the keys while the parents would be having their drinks. It was not bad..just inconvenient. Overall great place, good food, excellent service, location OK.

Reviews.Title: “Low Budget Rooms with Big Money Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: klcPAC
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy and the hotel grounds are well kept and beautiful. The room was alright and clean, however, I understand the "musty smell" some reviewers spoke of...likely due to the tropical location and the high humidity as well as a closed room with no air movement...once you turned the air on and had some movement in and out of the room it was gone. I noticed that some people had small efficiency type rooms but some did not, but they were charged the same rates. The mini bar charges you the minute the door opens...so don't accidentally touch it. The staff is very friendly and kind and ready to assist you any way they can. We visited the casino and we found it to be fair, but they are not busy so they sometimes aren't paying attention and clear the tables quickly mssing your winning number/card etc. But if you won and they aren't sure they call up watch the camera and pay you fairly. The pool is huge and beautiful...but colder than you'd expect. They also offer a 1ft kid's pool which is nice for the little ones, as well as 2ft areas in the 5ft pool (which has a pool bar). The beach is not really what you'd expect either...they get a lot of high tide so they have large boulders surrounding the property between the hotel and the beach. It is nice for a stroll but not to lounge. They have hermit crabs on the beach and some side walking crabs which are really cool to see. The biggest problem I had with this resort was the restaurant prices. They advertise 5 restaurants, but in reality they have the Wet Bar & Grill that offers burgers (kids $6, adult $11 both same size but adult has lettuce, tomato, onion, and mushrooms), chicken finger $7, hot dog $7, wings $9 and beer $4, mixed drinks $9. A very similar menu is found at the Avenue Bar however the prices are about $5 more on all of the same food items the Wet Bar offers! Pasion is a restaurant on the hotel grounds offering local cuisine at a hefty price as well. The food is good but not extravagent...I wouldn't rave about it. Plan on spending atleast $120 there. Nami Asian Bistro has excellent food at somewhat reasonable prices, compared to the other choices. This also ranges $20-40 per person. A sushi roll is $9. Hiabchi is $25-40. The other choice is Tempo which offers Italian cuisine, however I didn't experience this restaurant myself. A colleague went and said the food was good ranged in price $25-50 per plate but portions were on the smaller side. The funny thing is some people were offered a "meal plan" for $91/person but others weren't, and it apparently incuded unlimited drinks from 12pm-12am. I wasn't fortunate enough to be made aware of this secret meal plan. There are a lot of inconsistencies. They have a large sign at the entrance that warns of not bringing in outside coolers or food. You basically have to pay ridiculously high prices or smuggle food in. Your best bet is to rent a car and travel to some of the local places outside the resort. They have great food at great prices. Old San Juan was gorgeous and I'd have to recommend the Old Harbor Brewery. It's a restaurant/microbrewery that has great food! Prices are reasonable as well...dinner $75. The Bacardi Distillery is nice to see as well and it's free. The rum to buy in their store is about $10-12...awesome prices! I heard the rainforest was nice as well. I also heard great raves about Flamingo Beach. If you're a golfer...bring a high limit credit card...you'll need it :-( All in all it was a beautiful place to visit but I would never go to this particular hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely location but beware hidden costs & moldy rooms”
Reviews.Author: bbeerbower
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia Puerto Rico is located on one of the most beautiful private beaches in PR. The entire resort was absolutely stunning as far as the physical appearances go, The staff was efficient, friendly and helpful. the rooms reminded me of Italian villas. now for the cons and they were major: I choose a hotel for location, cleanliness and comfort. The Gran Melia's location was great if you had a car which we did. However, if you didn't then you were limited to the resort and had to pay their outrageous prices for everything! There were several restaurants but one was closed the nights we were there and there was usually an hour wait @ the ones that were open. If you ordered food from the bar you had to pay a room service fee even if you ate at the bar. We ate at the Cafe and the buffet meal was only average in quality but cost over $26pp. Daily parking was provided for a fee of $17per day and was located a very long, long way from your room. Golf cart service was offered checking in and out which was nice since the rooms were so far away. you'd never find your room without this service. The physical grounds were well kept. The wedding chapel was stunning and would be a beautiful place to have a wedding. The main problem I had with this hotel and it was a major problem was the fact that Gran Melia put us in a moldy, musty room knowing that it had mold issues. Both my traveling buddy and I have stayed in many hotels around the world and have never woken up ill the next morning because of a moldy room. This was a first. The bathroom ceiling had mold, the bathroom floors were so dirty that I wore my beach sandals everywhere, even in the shower. When we complained, the hotel sent over a person to spray the room with a freshner! We complained again and were offered another room which was also musty but not moldy. Upon contacting the front desk we were told that the service dept had previously noted the mold. I question why the hotel would put their customers in a "known" moldy room. This is not the service I have come to expect from Sol Melia as other Sol Melia hotels where I've stayed have been really good experiences. Unfortunately this hotel places more emphasis on its physical appearance than it's basics. The hotel location, the physical buildings and appearances were top notch, but renting moldy, musty rooms to guests is shameful. I would not stay here again nor would I recommend it to my friends especially if they did not have a car to get away. Too bad as the resort has a fabulous location and could easily be a 5 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful "campus" style Resort”
Reviews.Author: UnclePen
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia is a very well-maintained resort. The rooms are huge with marble floors and elegant bathrooms. We had an ocean view, and I would recommend the units that have the incredible view. It is a little bit if a walk from most of the villas to the main hotel, but nothing insurmountable. There is small but comfortable Casino. The 3-card Poker dealers took a bunch of my money, but they were nice to me while it happened. Cons of Gran Melia are that you are expected to wear an orange Arm band on the Resort. They really should find a more adult way to keep track of their guests. Another negative is the long drive from the main road, highway 3, to the resort. We really liked the Gran Melia and would recommend it highly for a luxury vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful vacation!”
Reviews.Author: rocco94
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews I was somewhat nervous about our plans to stay at The Gran Melia. The ONLY negative was the cost of the restaurants on the premises. Other than that, it was very clean, the grounds were beautiful, the pool was gorgeous and the staff was kind and helpful. I would advise renting a car unless you plan on just staying on the resort. Our entire family, including a 2 year old, had a wonderful time all week!

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort but rent a car”
Reviews.Author: poppazo
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife went to the Gran Melia for 4 nights for my friend's wedding. The resort is beautiful but the location is secluded. I recommend you rent a car if you want to see the island and enjoy the sights. The food at the resort is ok, we just ate at Passon the Puerto Rican resturant and it is very expensive, their are 3 restaurants on the location. I rented a car and ate in the city, their are local restaurants that are ten times better than the ones at the Gran Melia and ten times cheaper. We visited the rain forest and it was moving, we also spent a lot of time in Old San juan, they had a Christmas festival and turn on the Christmas lights, we had a great time in San Juan. The people were very friendly and the food is excellent. We didn't really use any of amenities at the resort but they did an excellent job on my friend's wedding it was beautiful. if you want seclusion, the Gran Melia is your place but be prepared to pay for every little thing there, my recommendation look for another resort but Puerto Rico is a wonderful place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: dangos
Reviews.Content: I too was very hesitant with the negative reviews..However, I cannot say enough how beautiful, clean, and friendly the resort was. Yes, the food is a little expensive along with the drinks but definitely worth it. The Royal Service is the only way to go! Main pool is gorgeous! Anything I asked for, I received very quickly such as a cot and extra towels. The palm trees and coconuts everywhere were a big hit with my kids! The gym size was perfect. I am not sure what others were expecting, but there was definitely enough equipment.

Reviews.Title: “An Escape to Paradise...”
Reviews.Author: VegHealthNut
Reviews.Content: Bad News or the Good News First? Bad News: they weren't consistent with the housecleaning and my sheets never got cleaned, no dvd player in room, overpriced, and one more thing... overpriced. GREAT NEWS: BEAUTIFUL BEAUTIFUL BEAUTIFUL Property!! AMAZING LOCATION! Right on the water :D Heaven! Palm Trees white sand beach the whole paradise feeling. The food was actually (prices besides) was quite delicious. Also the service was superb. We met some very special people that enhance your experience to a whole another level. Here are the names I would like to thank: Eddie (in Royal Services, Jose (waiter at breakfast cafe) and Angelica (in Royal Services. Pool exceeded expecations and there were plently of luxurious lounge areas throughout the resort. Tennis/Gym/Spa all great as well. One thing that stood out was the peacefulness of the resort and how spread out it was. Really was an escape to paradise. TIPS (READ THIS!): Im going to have to say that it makes all the difference to go with the royal service. The benefits are defiently worth it. One thing Puerto Rico doesn' t really have is breakfast. nowhere to be found. anywhere Im serious. Getting free breakfast and drinks at night was the right call. Having the oceanfront room with Jacuzzi was also very beneifical to are stay. Also free computer acces. All in all you are treated like royalty! its fantastic RENT A CAR. This applies to everyone staying in Puerto Rico. The resorts try to lock you in the resort if you don't have a car and charge outrageous rates of taxies. The best resteraunts are in San Juan, believe me I leanrned the hard way, and you want to be ablt to explore the beauty of Puerto Rico without being trapped in the resort. Thanks, enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Close to jungle & ferry/scuba diving...”
Reviews.Author: fisherdvm
Reviews.Content: If you don't have a car, you are stuck with expensive cab fees and eating in this peninsula far from civilization. Actually, it is 3.5 miles from the little "town" of Rio Grande, and take about 10 minutes to get out to Highway 3. Food is expensive (what do you expect from a 4 star resort). Continental breakfast $16... Limitted food selection (only 2 or 3 restaurants are opened during slow weekdays, not the 7 as advertised). Parking is $15 a day. The ground is spacious, and there are frequent shuttles from your room to the main lobby (where casino, restaurant, large pool, etc). The website is misleading - there is no scuba diving on premise. If enough guests want to learn to scuba, they will send an instructor in the pool to teach you. If you want to dive in the ocean, nearest dive shop is Fajardo (15 to 30 minutes away). In slow season, it is hard to find a dive boat that goes out daily, and you might have to drive to Humacao (50 min to 1 hr). Afternoon and night dives are rare in slow seasons. Rio Grand has little to offer except local cuisines, Subway, etc. The local supermarket (1 block east of CocoBeach Dr on Hwy 3 on the north side) has a variety of local food in a buffet style at dirt cheap price - better than you'll find in the restaurants if you do not mind styrofoam and plastic forks. For REAL local flavor, there are about 40 "Kioshes" on Luquillo beach, about 5 miles west of CocoBeach Dr. on Hwy 3 on the ocean side. Here you will find all kind of pastries, fried fish, and the local favorite - land crabs or juezes - in rice, in pastries, and stew. The Kioshes are packed with cars on weekends, and only a few are opened on weekdays. I did not swim in the ocean much, the waves were very large, and the water murky from the wave actions. My guess is with seasonal wind changes, you will find the water much more pleasant when the waves are calmer. The beaches are sheltered from the large waves from natural rocky reefs - so you don't have to worry about the large waves. They have a policy of no cooler or food in the rooms, so you'll have to sneak it in. They have a 24 hour guard to keep food and coolers out. Drinks are permitted across the guards, though. The casino has reasonable odd at the slots (probably 60 to 80% return), so you can have reasonable fun. The staff are friendly and courteous. I do not see Kayak rental, but they suppose to have snorkel rental at the beach. There are several pools (one at the beach, one by the gym/spa, and one huge one at the lobby). The pools are large enough for laps (20m except the gym site). The movies are like 15 bucks on the TV, if you lift a bottle out of the wine refrigerator in the room, you will be charged even if you put it back (duh, what if you refilled it with water?). Rough distances - to airport and Isla Verde blvd beach - 30 min or 15 mile. Old San Juan, 25 mile or 45 to 60 min. Dorado 30 mile, 45 to 60 min. Luquillo beach, 8 mile, 10 min. Farjado, 12 mile, 20 min. Farjado ferry terminal, 15 mile, 20 - 30 min. Rincon - extreme west side - 2 to 3 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great but over priced”
Reviews.Author: JFStahl
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Puerto Rico and staying at the Gran Melia Golf Resort was a good experience. We had booked the resort through Expedia and chose this resort because it was a 4 star resort with a golf course at a very good rate ($130 / night). After reading some of the reviews we were concerned but over the years we have learned to take these reviews with a grain of salt as no hotel with a 4 star rating could be as bad as some people claim. We arrived in San Juan via cruise ship and after negotiating with a tour company we made a deal that gave us a bus tour of Old San Juan and then a lift to the airport ($25/person) were we could rent a vehicle. We were only staying in Puerto Rico for three nights and decided it was not worth renting a vehicle and chose to take a taxi to the resort (government rate of $35 / person). The reviews were accurate in that it took about 45 minutes to reach the resort and it is off the beaten path, however it is not that far from local restaurants and stores and yes you would need a vehicle to reach them from the resort. Our first view of the resort was impressive with fountains and pools everywhere and a dramatic, ancient Greek inspired, open air structure. We were greeted by bell boys that unload our luggage and gave us a warm welcome. Upon arriving at the front desk we were quickly checked in and immediately offered an upgrade to the Royal Service (RS). It turns out that the Royal Service was not clearly explained to us at the front desk nor at the Royal Service desk, so we knew we were getting a better room and some perks but were not exactly sure what. It would have been better if they had given us a brochure of what we would receive rather than us having to continually ask what was included with the Royal Service. We also found it confusing as some of the staff did not seem to know what was included and we ended up not getting some of the services. We thought the Royal Service upgrade was worth it in the end. We drink lots of water and would have had to go to a store and buy a case if the resort had not offered it for free. The free breakfast was worth it as well and it was nice to sit on the balcony or in the balcony hot tub and listen to and watch the waveâ€™s role in. It was $125 per day which brought our room cost up to $250, if we had paid full price for the room it would not have been within our budget. The resort complex is quite large and spread out, all the rooms are a short to medium leisurely walk from the lobby and they do have a cart that will pick you up if you have problems walking or are just feeling lazy. The grounds are beautifully manicured with plenty of lush grass a shrubbery. The beach is large and easy to walk but the sand it hard packed and you would require a lounge chair to spend any time on it. There is a rock barrier between the beach and the ocean that you must climb over in order to reach the water. The ocean is kept at bay with a reef which keeps the waves to a minimum and allows you to swim comfortably in the ocean but sadly there is quite a bit of seaweed which makes the experience less comfortable. The public pool is very big and beautiful while the RS private pool is smaller and less spectacular. There are no hot tubs, the public pool does have two areas that provide a hot tub experience with water jets, and benches but the water is the same temperature as the main pool. We found the pool water to be cool and the ocean was much warmer to swim in. Our room was quite large and elegantly decorated. We had a king size bed and still had plenty of room to wander around in. There was a flat screen TV and game consol. The fridge was fully stocked but be warned, it works on a censor and if you remove a bottle it will automatically charge your room for it even if you put the bottle back. There was an iron and ironing board and an umbrella in case you wanted to go out in the rain or visit the nearby rainforest. The bath room had a very large full size walk-in shower with orange scented styling products. There was a large balcony with a hot tub and great view of the beach and ocean. There was a slight musty smell but it quickly disappeared, we have stayed at other seaside resorts and experienced this there as well, we think it is just the humidity that gets trapped and stales the air. Once the air circulates everything seems okay. They do offer excursions to the most popular attractions. We chose a tour of the Juan Diego Falls, El Yunque National Rain Forest (approx. $60 each) as it was only 15 minutes from the resort and was well worth the money as our tour guide Juan really knew his stuff and was very entertaining. We chose the tour that took us to a waterfall that we had to hike down a two mile trail. The Juan Diego Falls was wonderful and we went for a swim, the water was cold but bearable and refreshing. The waters rejuvenated us which made the two mile hike back up the mountain much easier. We had planned to go golfing as there is Trump International Golf Course right next to the resort but they were closed the two days we were there due to maintainance. Yes we would go back if we could get the same deal. We went during the off season and had the resort nearly to ourselves as we estimate there were less than 150 guests at the time. It was our own private piece of paradise.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful vacation in paradise”
Reviews.Author: kudetree
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Gran Melia. It was a wonderful hotel. The Royal Service upgrade is definately worth the extra cost. The food was amazing and we loved the location....away from the hustle and bustle of the city. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but charges daily for WiFi and Parking”
Reviews.Author: michyluis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is stunning and we had a great time, however, I'm glad by the time we got there I had taken care of some business because they charge a $15 daily fee for WiFi and another daily $15 fee for parking. So we saved some money for the room but ended up matching prices with other nicer hotels when total for parking and wireless is add up. They also couldn't find the reservation I did with hotels.com and forgot to grace the complimentary breakfast coming with the offer in hotels.com. The food was great at the Sushi Restaurant and the nightlife was also very nice. Expect to drive for quite some time when going up to the hotel and it is on a private gated area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, crazy on weekend with the locals”
Reviews.Author: lesly0519
Reviews.Content: We stayed from tuesday to sunday, at check in the gentleman put an arm bracelet (non removable) on wrist for everyone (including 4 yr old) told us if we lost it we would have to pay $35 p/person to replace (hidious looking thing white with a gran melia logo all around) basically targets you as a tourist where ever you go, no need to tell people where you are staying they could all read it, We enjoyed the beautiful pools and the quiet until friday evening, first of all good luck finding a parking space, then we had someone knock on our door at 1 am then 3 am twice, I finally called security and they couldn't find him though they were by my door within 3 minutes, check out on sunday is a joke at least 1 hr in line, they told us 10 am as I was waiting I read the whole brochure and in the back it says noon, overall we really enjoyed it but do not recommend the beach, also the floor in the bathroom shall have a nonslippery tile (at least for when you first come out of shower) we didn't notice a leak from the shower into the main entrance in our room, our son fell and hit his head really hard on tile, also we were told complimentary drinks and there isn't any if you are a returning customer, my sister was not returning but since they didn't bother to ask her she didn't get anything complimentary. We were told free wifi in the room and it turned out you have to go to the pool to get wifi or you could plug into a phone jack and get turtle internet.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED it here!!”
Reviews.Author: Catak68
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon. SO glad we chose this place! We loved every minute of it! Admittedly te service isn't exactly what you're used to in the States... Service staff has sort of a "stay out of the customer's way" kind of mentality which my husband (who is Puerto Rican) says may just be part of the culture. Other than somewhat absent staff (but really, who cares?) we loved everything. The pool was my favorite part. On the last day they had live music by the pool and everyone was enjoying mixed drinks and the sun and dancing. SUCH a good time. Stay here, just don't expect the staff to babysit you. :) you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend filled with great food options”
Reviews.Author: Imlaris
Reviews.Content: This resot type hotel is a great for a secluded relaxing vacation great outdoor spaces for lounging. More than 4 restaurants to chose from different choices from asian to local cuisine. Huge pool area and many more amenities. Rooms are huge for comfortable family stays.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: sunkist0123
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our honeymoon trip to PR, having stayed at the Gran Melia for 4 nights. We got the Royal Service, which got us access to the quiet pool w/ the free Bali beds, free breakfast, free happy hour (had wine, champagne, soda, beer from 6-9) and free wired internet (bring your own cable). The room was nice looking, modern except for the CRT TV. Everything was very clean, no bugs, & the bath products were decent. Housekeeping did an excellent job and provided turn-down service as well. Having read the reviews about how expensive the food was, we brought snacks along with us. The royal service took care of the breakfast (would have been $40-$50 before tip otherwise for 2 drinks, 2 "entrees" and 2 sides otherwise). Breakfast was at Cafe Solei (we also had lunch there once) - was ok at best - def not worth the $ if we had paid for it. We had hibachi at Nami, which was tasty and not out of line for Japanese restaurant prices. We tried the pizza at the bar and it was super expensive and not good. $27 for a medium looking cardboard crust pizza that was awful and tilted!!!! 17% mandatory tip for all the cheese to one side is not good.
