We agree w/ the reviews about the drinks not having any alcohol - they don't. It looked to be between half and 1 shot per drink. Def do not stay here if drinking is important. Also, we did get a rental car since as other reviews indicated, you can't get anywhere otherwise without doing expensive tours. It's definitely worthwhile to go places with your own transportation, just watch out for the locals who don't know how to stay in their own lanes (most of them)! Note: The beach here isn't swimable - it's either stay at the pool or travel for your water activities. The whole thing is full of seaweed, there are no waves but there are rocks etc. Note 2: There were hardly any people there at this time. So while we didn't have any service issues, we were pretty sure that the staff outnumbered the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: mimi11257
Reviews.Content: After reading many mixed reviews, I still was optimistic..WOW! I do not know how anyone that stayed here could say anything negative! The resort is amazingly beautiful, especially at night when the whole lobby/restaurant complex is illuminated by 1000's of candles. I visited each and every public restroom in the complex and at both pools, I could have eaten off the floors! I never even saw a bug!! I saw the grounds staff manicuring the flower beds, they were lush and healthy. The guest rooms( we were ocean front) were immaculate, well stocked with towels and there was no musty smell. A/C was more than adequate as was closet space. The pool areas are spectacular, comfy lounge chairs and the pool service was excellent. The drinks were pricey but no more than the last Hyatt I was in here in the US...We ate in every restaurant on property, Nami, the Japanese Steakhouse was fabulous. Passions, the traditional PR cuisine restaurant, was good and had the most fabulous Mango Sangria I have ever tasted. Our waiter and the hostess here knew we liked them so much, on our last night there supplied us with the recipe! The beach is not a swimming beach, but is just fine for strolling and/or cooling off in. Very similar to beaches in Italy. EACH and EVERY staff member we encountered was friendly and polite..never a rude word to any member of our 4 person party. The upper level management must be commended to ensure this customer service mentality is maintained. There are plenty of free daily activities:yoga, stretching, volleyball, bingo and star gazing at night on the weekend. Although, for 4 middle aged aduts we were looking only for RELAXATION!! This we achieved...My husband and friend golfed and said the course is beautiful! When we needed transportation from the resort, the valet staff was more than accommodating. I would go back tomorrow and have recommended this resort to all my friends. This resort is truly PARADISE!!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway at Paradise”
Reviews.Author: jazzcjr1
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through their website (cheaper) for this weekend. As soon as we arrived we found everything beautiful, we had no problems at the front desk. We had a little wait for the cart that takes you to the room. The room was breathtaking, high ceilings, great view, comfortable bed, gorgeous bathroom, but... the T.V. was old, it didn't fit in with the room. It had beautiful landscapes through out the property and the pool was wonderful (it's huge!). Restaurants are expensive, we at Pasion which is one of the less expensive ones and the food was good. Overall, we had a great time. The hotel is perfect for a romantic getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: MamaDover
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful property! We actually stayed on the Sol Melia Vacation Club side of the property. The staff was very friendly and helpful. October is a great time to go, it's the off season so it felt like we had the place to ourselves. The pool and grounds are lovely. There are a lot of large iguanas roaming the grounds. The beach isn't good, drive over to Luquillo or to Fajardo. It's a good location for a base camp to explore the Northeast part of Puerto Rico. It's a convenient trip to San Juan, Old San Juan and the Bacardi Factory to the west and Luquillo, and to the east El Yunke Rainforest and Fajardo (catamaran rides, ferry to Culebra & Vieques, Bio Bay) I don't know about the Gran Melia side, but at Sol Melia we had free internet, free wine, beer and coffee, free parking,

Reviews.Title: “Horrible - The hotel robbed us blind... it was the worst hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: twoirrisistable
Reviews.Content: The resort is 45 min away and the hotel shuttle is not free. It's $60 or $75 per person. Aside from this, the hotel is located in a random location where there is nothing around. So you are forced to eat all of your meals (which are way overpriced) at the resort. The food is not bad but it's not worth the hefty price either. Additionally every chance they get they rob you. They charged us $7 for iced tea with no liquor, when we complained they adjusted it, they charged us $26 for a quesadilla, when we complained they adjusted it. And they The rooms are extremely small and very humble. Nothing at all to go crazy for. My husband left his $400 Ipod on the hotel bed and it was stolen. The hotel referred me to their insurance company who denied the claim saying that unless it was in the safe they are not liable. The hotel was made aware that we were on our honeymoon and they did nothing to make our trip special . In fact we were charged $150 per day to upgrade to a room with a beach view and the resort wasnâ€™t even crowded.

Reviews.Title: “I would go back.”
Reviews.Author: mdrobins
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I saw a love/hate relationship going on with this hotel. I can understand. So we pricelined and got an deal for under 90 bucks per night. So we could not be mad about much of anything. IF we paid more, there would be an few issues. Here is the deal. The grounds are immaculate and breathtaking. The Lobby is so beautifully furnished, it's stunning. The weekend breakfast buffet at Cafe Soliel is AWESOME for 22 bucks per person. The weekdays everything is overpriced we stayed away from the restaurants and ate poolside once, it was not very good. There is a night club in the Lobby on the weekends. The WI FI is expensive abt 15 dollars per day. bring an ethernet cable. Parking is 16 dollars per day. Avis parking is even father away, dont bother. Rent your car the the airport you'll be free and fine. They charge 100.00 per night ot your card for incidentals upfront and then release the hold when you leave. The pool was beautiful, BUT they kept running out of towels at peak times and telling us to comeback every 20 minutes (never got a towel). They charge 45 dollars per day for the poolside beds (annoying, no one was using them). There is no hot tub, just a whirlpool. So that's a bummer at night. The pool is 24 hours. Our room smelled of mold. We instantly got it changed without a problem. They are super prompt with requests for toiletries/towels for the rooms. The Bungalows are a lined up along the resort about .35 miles (I ran along the grounds all over to the ownership villas etc at 7AM and LOVED IT), BUT for those that dont exercise, there are golf carts picking you up and dropping you off at your whim, like valet service. There is no food anywhere on the premises after 11 PM, and there is no refrigerator in the rooms. Not even a vending machine. You may starve if you are a late night person and have no car ( wake around midnight and am up until 430 AM sooo, McDs and BK ewww) There is no real beach, this is a golf resort. BUT there are chairs tables everywhere that face the ocean. Get up early and see the sunrise over the Atlantic. The beach is less than 8 minutes (with traffic, and lights) up the road in Luquillo, and its great. The rooms were cleaned daily without concern. The air conditioner was a pain in the butt. It comes on no matter how many times you turn it off, the room was FREEZING all the time. And its terrible for sinuses, something is going on with the air quality in those rooms. There are no screens so open the patio door just enough to warn the marble titled floors and close it. The tiny biting gnats are the worst things on earth. You never see them but they are fast and go for the kill 5 times per landing on your skin. So dont think other hotels are better etc, we went to a Hilton Golf Resort just to be nosey, and I almost cried in disgust. The grass is not greener, especially not for the prices we paid. The staff was courteous, and helpful, and happy. The gym is nice too, BUT there are no towels so that was annoying. No business center either unless you pay an extra 100.00 per night for royal service (and you still ahve to pay for parking) which for us was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good place, great people, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: jojopr
Reviews.Content: I was a little concern about the reviews of this hotel since most of the negative comments were the same, bad odor and not really good service. When I arrived at the hotel I was greeted by the doorman who was extremely polite and he immediately identify in a list that I was going to stay at the Royal Service and he escorted me to the area. The Royal Service Lounge was kind of little of what I expected but the service was great, very attentive and polite. When I arrived to the room unfortunately I did received a room with a mold odor. I spoke to the Benjamin, the manager and he was extremely apologetic and in less than five minutes I was in a new room with a great view, near the adult pool and the bar. During my stay I saw Benjamin in different areas of the hotel and he always remember my name and ask me if I was having a great time and always ask me if there was anything else he can do for me. That is truly customer service. In addition the butlers and the Royal Service Staff were magnificent. If you are staying at this hotel, I highly recommend getting a Royal Service room, you will feel like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “NOT COMPLETLY SATISFIED!”
Reviews.Author: tonyeyesDelaware
Reviews.Content: I did alot of homework on this hotel through tripadvisor, and I must say, it made the trip much more enjoyable. Went for my 2nd Anniversary, and enjoyed myself. People, take notes. The room was very nice, it does have a mold smell to it, but I brought some Febreeze, and it took the smell away, my room did always feel DAMP, but I guess you can't change that ...the hotel is on the beach. The grounds were kept very nice. The place is very big so you do alot of walking, by the way I like to walk. SOME of the staff was very nice, but if you complained about anything, then you were ignored a little. RENT A CAR! RENT A CAR!RENT A CAR!everything is so far away, there is NO WAY to get there. Rent a car at the hotel through AVIS, parking is FREE, if not you have to pay for parking. GOOD LUCK finding the AVIS guy, the hotel kept calling him, and he wouldn't answer his cell phone, So be patient LOL! DO NOT BOOK ANYTHING THROUGH THE HOTEL! completely overpriced, the El Yunque Rain Forest is FREE, they charge you $50.00. Bacardi Rum Distillary is FREE, they charge you $50.00. You CAN eat at the resort, the food was VERY GOOD, it's just expensive, we ate there the first night, and ate elsewhere everyday after (to save money), If you want to party, this is not the place, get in your car and go to Condado,you go to Rio Grande to RELAX. Overall, the Gran Melia is a VERY nice place, and I definitely would go back!

Reviews.Title: “A place to comeback again”
Reviews.Author: JUAN96
Reviews.Content: Very nice service personnel very responsive to our needs. The pool is refreshing but specially in the afternoon to see dawn. The lobby is nice with live music very entertaining.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT waste your money - Gran Melia review!”
Reviews.Author: PRresident
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my husband at the Gran Melia the weekend of September 18th, 2010 and what a disappointment! Bungalows (rooms) are far from the lobby [about Â½ mile] and it gets really dark in the night. The room had a very strong smell of mold. There was mildew in the bathroom walls and a used soap left on the shower/tub when we arrived. It was evident that there was no maintenance made before our arrival. We even found a â€œhugeâ€� roach in front of our door! Public areas were poorly clean. There was â€œfungusâ€�/mold in the resting areas. I didnâ€™t recommend spending your money staying in Gran Melia Hotel. Food was really expensive too and the quality was far from good. A lunch buffet was around $60. per person! Please donâ€™t stay there. There are other beautiful and clean hotels in Puerto Rico. Look for hotels near San Juan and youâ€™ll not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay there again for free”
Reviews.Author: hperezs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from Saturday Sept 4th to Monday Sept 6 on a weekend getaway. After traveling about 3 hrs by car and arriving at the hotel we spent at least 10 minutes trying to find a self parking spot. Apparently they had a convention going on. I've stayed at other hotels that offer valet parking at the same rate of self parking when their self parking lot is full but not this one. Once the checkin was completed we were taken by a cart to our room. As I opened the door I smelled a strong cigarrete odor in the bedroom. I asked the cart driver/luggage assistant if this was a smoking room but he mentioned that all rooms were non smoking. One quick scan of the room and I noticed a cigarette but in a small dish on a nightstand next to a half empty water bottle (from the mini bar) and a fully dressed bed with clear signs that someone had "slept" on. One quick glance at the bathroom and there were some trash in a bag on top of the toilet. The cart driver tried to convince me that the room was not serviced before my arrival by mistake but that was clearly not the case. Definetly one staff member had used it for his "leisure". After calling the front desk twice to get a room change we were moved to a different room within the same building. The first time I called the front desk the phone kept ringing without no one answering. Once I entered the second room assigned I quickly smelled mold but I expected it to go away as soon as I turned on the AC. We were all already tired from the long trip and my kids wanted to go to bed so we decided to stay in that room (1018). We still had to wait for maintenance to set up the sofa bed and for extra towels since the room had only 3 of them. The door lock did not work and some one saying he was from housekeeping opened our door around 10:00pm but we had not called housekeeping. He said he was notifying maintenance to have someone fix the lock. No one came during our stay to fix the door. The problem was actually the strike plate which was not at the correct height. Next day we went to the breakfast buffet. Paid full price for the hot buffet 2 adults, 1 children at half price and one free children. At the end of breakfast the tab was $60 believe it or not. Lunch by the pool was another $55 for chicken strips, hot dog, cheese burger and sodas. Way too expensive for regular food. The pool was great but in the night there was nothing to do (family oriented). We got up early monday and left as soon as possible. We were not even asked how was our stay during or checkout. Would not return even to this hotel even if I was paid to.

Reviews.Title: “I would return..”
Reviews.Author: AmySTL2010
Reviews.Content: I read a lot on here, and other sites before picking this hotel. I was aware it wasn't all inclusive and I budgeted accordingly. In general I don't see what everyone has been complaining about recently. The hotel grounds were gorgeous. Everything was clean and none of the landscaping was overgrown or dead. The reviews of the beach are correct. Rockier than most, and the waves are pretty much. However, if you walk over to around where the Royal Service area is you can find a nice area that is wading acceptable. With watershoes mind you. My room was very nice and clean. It did have a musty odor but I found nothing to show that it was for lack of cleanliness or mold. I believe that is a product of the area. I was in the Dominican Republic in May and our room there had the same smell. The airconditioner worked well and I was fortunate to be in a bungalow right across from the spa. I could see where people in other bungalows would be annoyed with the walk. I also had an extra minifridge brought to my room so I could bring food back when I left the resort. It is a $25 flat fee and well worth it. But, keep in mind it is a MINI fridge. Nothing really big, leftover boxes, will fit. I ate at 2 restruants while there: Passion and the Wet Bar by the pool. The wet back is equivalent price wise, to like an Applebees. Passion was $60 for an appetizer, dinner, desert, mixed drink, and a tip. I ordered room service 2x. Food was great. Including the pizza another reviewer claimed was horrible. Was a full size too. They do automatically add tip and there is a deliverly charge so it won't be necessarily cheaper than eating at one of the restraunts. The resort itself is off the beaten path. If you are wanting to mosey about or eat off the resort then I would highly recommend getting a rent. And, book online before you leaven through Avis and pick up the vehicle at the resort. This way you can avoid parking in tinbucktwo by using Avis's parking lot near the entrance! I got a car for 1 day and wished I had gotten it for 2. I tried to get excursions but transportation was an issue. So, again, plan ahead. If you want to eat locally, do excursions, and have the option to leave the resort the get a rental. If you plan on staying at the resort prepare the buget accordingly for taxis you might have to take, the extra money you will have to spend to get any excursion to come to you, and for the resort food. Speaking of excursions the rain forest is a must!!! I also booked the Monkey Island tour, but unfortunately the waters were too rough to actually do it. Even so the guides, Keisha and Bob, were very helpful to me throughout my whole trip experience to Puerto Rico and I really appreciated it! Old San Juan is also a must. Suggestion here too... It is about 30 min from the hotel. If you pay for transportation through Dragonfly (onsite transportation) I would make contact with them when you land, tell them you want them to take your luggae to the resort, and then get a taxi to take you to old San Juan. I did this when I arrived and it was great! Taxis from the airport to Old San Juan are $19 each way; flat rates and Dragonfly was very accomodating. The day I departed I checked my luggage in early, then left the airport again and taxied over to Old San Juan for things I missed. All in all I had a great time. It rained every day but that is typical for the Carribean. I did alot of research before leaving and it helped me out a lot. I have read some reviews where people have had long check out times. I checked out at 8am so I could get to the airport by 9 to head over to Old San Juan. My flight wasn't till 3. I I was back at the airport by 1:30pm and had plenty of time. BUT.. if I had gone on schedule I would have been checking out with everyone else at the resort. Call the front desk and ask them how may people are checking out on your check out date. That will give you some kind of gage as to how long it might take. If you are okay leaving early that might help your wait times. :>) Don't even OPEN your minifridge. It is electronically monitored and you will get billed even if you don't take anything out. Just avoid it. I didn't get billed b/c I didn't open it, but I have heard of people whom have. Just a heads up. Overall I had a great time. I wish I could have stayed longer, and other than needing to get a rental for more than 1 day, I have no complaints. I would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Hold onto your wallet”
Reviews.Author: RScarpa1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful complex . It's all down hill from there with the nickel and diming. I was on a mealplan and gave cash for tips, and they nicely billed my room for another tip, which was hard to disprove. My family and I ate at one of the retaurants, then they gave us a bill and we told them that we are on the meal plan, and there response was "this restaurant is not included", but it was the only one open. I told the front desk, and they said that they would take care of it, and of course did nothing. I prepaid the shuttle, and they hit my card again. It took 10 calls to reverse it. Parking was around 30 per day, though they had tons of open parking so if you rented a car, then be ready to tack on another 30 per day. They are scammers and save yourself the trouble and go somewhere else. They dont deserve your hard earned money.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Deceiving”
Reviews.Author: yttebmarie
Reviews.Content: When driving into the property we notice that the landscape seems neglected. They have a gorgeous fountain that was turned off. As you continue the drive to the hotel you past a residential condominiums called Trump something that seems abandoned. Then you finally arrive to the hotel and as you walked from the parking area to the front desk I can describe it as dull, boring and not inviting. Then as I approached the front desk I was informed of a policy to hold $100 per night for as a deposit in addition to the rental fee. After much arguing they agreed to get only $100 deposit and off we went to the room. As we open the door on bungalow 3 we were hit with an overpowering smell of mold and mildew. Then I asked the bellman if all rooms smell like that and he said no and proceeded to open the sliding glass door as if he was implying that we were going to accept the conditions of the room. At that point we were so disappointed that we decided to check out and as we walked back to the front area we could not missed the poor conditions of the tennis court. Certainly they granted and respected our decision of leaving but this was a mess that cost me the lost of an entire day of my vacation. It is clear that the hotel needs renovations or they need to do a better job at maintaining it. As we were checking out there was another couple complaining also about the conditions of the room. Also it is worth mentioning that there is no beach. For u to go to the beach you will have to walk through rocks to do so.

Reviews.Title: “was the vacation from hel”
Reviews.Author: bellaitalia910
Reviews.Content: I booked my vacation package thru funjet chose the meal plan option and paid in full. Got to hotel and they say that they do not do meal plans anymore. Called funjet said that there is nothing they can do. Hotel does not offer any compensation. Then after that whole issue we finally take a golf cart all the way to our room and when we walk in there is no sheet or comforter on the bed, just a bare matress. The curtians from the windows is laying on the desk. The shower curtian rings are on the floor and there is no shower curtian. I call the lobby and they said they will call me back. Finally they call me back and tell me they will change my room to wait for a door man to come. Finally a door man comes and takes us to our new room. Still no compensation. Moving on from this and tryng to enjoy are vacation we enjoyed the pool and the hotel and its surroundings are very beautiful but the service and the food are horrible. There is only one choice for breakfast and that is a $25 per person buffet which for 5 days in a row is not so good especially when you can't even get the slow staff to refill your coffee and then wait about 20 mins for your check. There are only two choices in restaurants for lunch both with very slow service waiting for ever for your food again no refills on drinks and wait forever for the check for 5 days in a row. Then only two restuarants for dinner when they are open are very expensive and have a limited menu. If you want to eat anywhere else you need to rent a car and drive far thru bad areas to get there. The cabs are $80 round trip to get anywhere. Also the hotel is constantly trying to get you to take there time share tour the whole week they were hounding us and we finally gave in so they would leave us alone. The resort does not except cash at any restaurants or bars. Room service pizza was horrible. We were so excited to leave we went 5 hrs early to the airport just to finally eat some good food. We were never so excited for fast food before. When we went to check out no one offered us any compensation nor did anyone even ask us how our stay was. Apparently they dont care. Took there shuttle to the airport that I paid $65 for only to get pulled over for there reckless driving. My husband said it was like prison but a nice one and I just think is was hell.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous but beware!”
Reviews.Author: tscarpati
Reviews.Content: Gran Melia is a beautiful resort with all amenities you can want. As a couple with a two year old we weren't planning on anything too adventurous-just a relaxing vacation. I am a clean freak so I was worried with some of the reviews I had read about the mold or uncleanliness. I am happy to say the resort was spotless. The grounds were perfectly manicured and the rooms were cleaned to perfection. My only complaint as far as cleanliness would be that the beach area needs to be maintained as well as the other parts of the resort. We stayed under the trees on the little strip of beach, if it were raked it would have been so much more enjoyable esp with a two yr old. As for the rocks on the beach they weren't as bad as it was stated in some of the reviews. If you have been to most beaches in Europe these are hardly a comparison. The resaurants are very pricey and the food is mediocre. We had pretty good food at the Asian place and the cafe. The Italian restaurant was ok and so was Pasion but beware if you are on the meal plan Pasion is the only place that isn't included and it's expensive-we learned the hard way. Another complaint is the communication between the resort and the customers. We were told so many different things when it came to whats included with our deluxe meal plan. We went to the front desk time after time asking more questions. First we were told every restaurant was included then we went to Pasion and spent over 115 dollars to find out it wasnt covered under the meal plan. Then Antonette at the front told us she would try to reverse some of the charges because we absolutly didnt know and she never did a thing. Also, do not listen to the pool bar and grill staff when they tell you your drinks are included under the plan. We got zero bills for two days then someone finally told us that our drinks weren't included and charged us per drink from those days to our room. What a joke! The drinks(vodka and soda) were $9. Wow its like being in Manhatten but in the middle of Puerto Rico. One last super important detail-----DO NOT TIP IN CASH!!!!! Even though we crossed out the tip on the bill when we were billed for our meals and drinks we were still charged what the hotel wanted us to leave as tip. They will tell you that you can just cross out the tip line on the ck and leave cash but do not listen. We payed for tips at the time of the bill( 20% )and were forced upon check out to pay for tips that the staff automatically charges to your room knowing you will have no choice but to pay for it. The girl at the desk told me she couldn''t take it off because she had no proof we left tip. Another problem with communication favoring the resort. Let me just sum it all up-the resort is wonderful and clean. It is so pretty and the staff is very friendly. The restaurants are priced too high for the quality. Make sure you buy a meal plan and demand a printout before you start using it. Try to get it before vacation so you have it with you. The tips are charged to your room for every meal and beverage whether you cross it out and pay cash or not. Finally, the communication with the resort and the customers suck! Overall we had fun and spent an extra 250+ after the purchase of the meal plan. Allow yourselves over an hour for checkout because your bill will be a disaster and whatever you prepay like the shuttle have proof that you payed or else! Also the towels are added to your bill so make sure they minus that $70 out! Overall enjoy the beauty it has to offer- we are happy we rented a car for a day and went to OLd San Juan-the prettiest part of PR by far!

Reviews.Title: “Wrong smell (Mouldy)”
Reviews.Author: Monica608
Reviews.Content: When we come to our room , we think it was a beatiful room, but we felt the wrong smell, but we thought that the room maybe had was closed then we started the air, but the smell was not gone, we tould she who clean our oom, but we didnÂ´t hear anything, when we checkt out we waitet for explain , but nothing ,no answer how our vacation had been. Then there was no battery in the TV control, vi had to buy self. The cleaning in the room could be better.No internet I was sick i think it was from the room, sore troat,thight troat,problem with my nouse, headache. Why dont you listen to our problem!!

Reviews.Title: “Traveled for our honeymoon! :)”
Reviews.Author: jayleensmama
Reviews.Content: I'm pretty surprised at the types of reviews the Gran Melia has gotten. After my experience in puerto rico, I now have VERY high standards on where I stay, and will only stay with melia, or affiliated hotels in the future. My husband and i went for our honeymoon and we had an AMAZING deal. We had flight, car rental and 10 days/9 nights for just under $1800. The grounds were gorgeous, the pool felt like bath water, housekeeping came promptly every morning at 10am, and so did a little kitten who somehow found me (i love animals). There were peacocks, iguanas, hermit crabs, and cranes, and i felt like I was truly in a tropical place :) the room was drop dead gorgeous, the beds were extremely comfortable, and it was VERY spacious! my mother has a wyndham timeshare and my place was better than hers! I didn't want to go home and I'm planning a girls trip with me and my daughter in december. there are things there for kids to do, but i only saw a handful of them. the only downfall is that the food is a bit pricey so we only ate on the resort a few times, but we found these FANTASTIC hole in the wall restaurants that had AMAZING food! me and the hubby both were stuffed beyond means for $12 or less at these places.. we only spent $500 on food and a little souvenir shopping. there are PLENTY of things to do. theres malls like crazy, old san juan, the bioiluminescent bay, kayaking, a rainforest, horseback riding and a LOT more. there is a dragonfly on the resort that organizes the trips for you, but if you do a little research you can organize these things for a LOT less. the kayak trip for the bio-bay with dragonfly?? $199 a person and included dinner. We did it ourselves for $45 a person and went to the hole in the wall! spent half of what it would have cost for one person. the beach?? ehh.. not really a beach of you're an eastern or western shore person, but the pool was outstanding.. the wet bar had live music a few times we were there, and they were actually pretty good.. theres just SO much on the resort that I feel like i can write a small novel.. i love love love the gran melia!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: acana3
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Melia on a Monday around 3pm; the front desk was empty so our check-in was quick. Checkout was quick as well. Lobby area was well kept and looked like the typical spacious Mexican Riviera resorts. The room was very nice, impeccable and clean, we loved it. No weird odors whatsoever or noise. It was a garden view with a look over the Yunque Ntnâ€™l Forest, a pleasure to look out when you wake up in the morning. Headed to the poolâ€¦total disappointment. It looked like a Crocodile swamp down in Florida, green, murky, not clean or inviting at all. Somebody next to us was playing her own music on her IPod dock, which first seemed odd and a bit ghetto turned out to be nicer than the music they were streaming from the pool bar. The beach is not nice here; we did not go in the water. Itâ€™s a shame they donâ€™t keep the pool sparkling and clean. The hotel prices are way too much, almost intrusive, I would say. We ordered coffee for two the first morning: $14 that did not include anything. You can get a continental bkfast at a Mandarin Oriental for that price. There is only a $25 pp Buffet for breakfast. I personally hate buffets. And I also hate having only one option. Except for when Iâ€™m at an all-inclusive hotel. So my strongest recommendation, if you need to stay here, get a car rental, so that you can have the freedom to go out and explore otherwise you will feel stuck. I mean really, what do you do in a hotel in the Caribbean if the pool is not clean and the beach is awful? Do you just eat the entire time? The problem with this hotel is the location and facilities. While the lobby, the spa, gym, and restaurants are well maintained, the moment you live those areas you starts noticing the decay of the hotel. You can enjoy the beach and cleaner pools in Condado and Isla Verde.

Reviews.Title: “Fungus in rooms two hours check out”
Reviews.Author: GonzalezPR
Reviews.Content: I stay for august 27, 2010 to august 30, 2010. When open the door there odor of fungus in all the room. We have to open the sliding doors to sleep. In the check out we have to wait two hours in the line for the check out.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Christy1977
Reviews.Content: I love it!! Is a spot has amazing beautiful views at the beatch. This was my second vacation there , My family have a membership there and we enjoy every minute of it . I will stay there next year too. The rainforest El Yunque is close to it. Is perfect for Honey Moon is a very romantic place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, if you plan to rent a car and drive around Puerto Rico.”
Reviews.Author: Natasphere
Reviews.Content: Overall I am pleased with the hotel, but for people who are used to all-inclusives you might be in for a disappointment because you will not have anything for free except beach towels. For example, we went to the Italian restaurant they have, I ordered an appetizer, two desserts, tea and coffee which came out to $70. You absolutely MUST get a rental car if you are going to stay at Gran Melia, otherwise you will be stranded with not much to do and restaurants with astronomical prices. The walk from the highway to the hotel is not one a normal person would reasonably want to make every day. It's about 10 minutes driving over the speed limit. They won't let you take a big cooler into your room, fridges are available for a fee. We went shopping for breakfast items in the local supermarket, and stored them in smaller containers on ice, which is readily available outside your room. DON'T book any trips through the hotel, such as the bio bay kayak trip, it will cost you at least twice as much. Instead just keep your eyes open when you drive around, there are numbers posted advertising different trips all over, or look at the ads in the magazine in your room. Staff is very nice and friendly. The beach is gorgeous, and the pool is huge. Don't freak out when you see your final bill, they put some charges on ours that didn't belong there but took it off right away when we went to check out. A word about parking-- you have to pay some ridiculous rate per day for it. If you rent a car from AVIS you won't have to. It might be that if you rent it from the avis center at the hotel it's free, but we basically lied and said we did, even though we rented from the airport. They gave us a "member" paper and we didn't have to pay for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Paradise”
Reviews.Author: MarkDTN8
Reviews.Content: Room: Spacious, OK ocean view - but had moldy smell to it. Phone was out of service for 5 of the 7 days we stayed - inconvenient yes, but we survived Room Service Food - Pricey and Average Restaraunt Food - Very Pricey and Average Drinks at Hotel Bar - Completely gouged on drinks - way too expensive: $16 for a Mojito! Hotel Grounds - Beautiful, open, airy hotel with great tropical landscaping Beach - Not a swimming/snorkeling beach for sure, OK for walking but don't expect to use the beach at this Hotel Swimming Pool - Best part of the Hotel really, however it's really a poor system to get towels. Basically you have to stand in line at the FRONT desk to exchange your towel cards and not in a pool cabana. You essentially can wait a while if someone is checking out or is having an issue with their room, just to get two towels - $35 each towel if you don't return the cards, watch out for that one. Casino - Small not very busy, lots of slot machines out of order an dnot many people playing the tables - just penny slot players! Overall a nice place but will pick a different Hotel next visit to PR. The Hotel is in ZRio Grande next to Luquillo so you're a bit aways from the hustle and bustle of San Juan so definately rent a car for a PR trip. ANIMAL LOVERS BEWARE: Puerto Rico has a VERY VERY VERY BIG PROBLEM WITH STRAY DOGS AND CATS. They are all over the island and it is just heartbreaking to see so many animals either sick, starving, dead in the road/just hit by a car and just plain plain poor health. At the food kioskos in Luquillo, the stray animals can wander in and out of the restaraunts, not very sanitary IMO that you can serve food and skinny, dirty dogs and cats are sharing your eating place. As an animal lover this was a HUGE turn off to the entire country, one that obviously has not addressed it's soaring homeless animal population. The island itself is beautiful but every beach traveled you can see these poor animals suffereing, it's just unreal to me. Even on the the islands of Culebra and Vieques there were strays. So just a word of warning to animal/pet lovers DO NOT GO TO PUERTO RICO IF HOMELESS ANIMALS UPSET YOU!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: CULater1969
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Gran Melia from August 10 till the 13. We knew before hand how expensive things were in the hotel so we ate outside. In the hotel, the rooms are clean and big enough for a family of 5 as we are. The pool was beautiful and refreshing. The beach is only good for walking during the day, at night there are some mean bugs by the beach. However, there are also some big fish in the water that you get to see moving. If you want to go to the beach, a short drive to Luquillo and you are in one of the most popular beaches in Puerto Rico plus the kioskos; a hundred of them, were you can enjoy some puertorican food. Outside the hotel in the route to Luquillo you can find Don Pepe cafe for breakfast and lunch and Don Pepe restaurant for dinner. Prices are good and food is delicious. Gran Melia is conveniently located; close to Luquillo and not far from San Juan. The service was good, the checking was quick and so was the checkout. No complaints. We stayed at building 11, we walked all the time and the walk was not as long as other people mentioned. I guess it goes with how much you like walking. One time we bought food at night and brough it to the room, no one asked us what we were bringing.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but not sure I'd go back there again”
Reviews.Author: nlagpacan
Reviews.Content: The hotel decor def. reaches the 4 star part as it is very beautiful and exquisite, but everyone is right about the creatures that lurk in that place! A centepide crawled up the gutter tub when my bf turned on that water when we first got there! We got over 10 bites each because I guess mequitos came in our room from opening the balcony door a lot. We also saw a mouse one night hiding in the corner. But hey- we are in a foreign country where we're bound to see those things. Oh yea, and if your bed sheets feel sticky, dont hesitate to ask for new ones!! The staff was very nice. The beach? It was beautiful, but I guess from reading other peoples reviews, it's not the best... I do recall the sand kinda being rocky in the tides... I guess the only other thing I was unsatisfied with was that it was a distance from the night life- we had to taxi it to the hotel zone night life- which was only about 9 bucks. but next time I think I would prefer staying closer to to night life zone... because there wasn't really any night life at this hotel. I've heard other hotels have great shows or clubs in them I guess. I would recommend this hotel to people that are probably on their honeymoon or would like to have some quiet time. There was a lot of old people with family there.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money staying here.”
Reviews.Author: travelingbeachchick
Reviews.Content: Beach is not good. Food is not good and very expensive. Unfriendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Georgous Hotel; Not So Hot Beach”
Reviews.Author: ibrushum
Reviews.Content: The hotel and all of the grounds were beyound beautiful!! The beach....not really usable. The beach reminded me of the beach in Key West, rocky and shallow, with little to no waves. You will need a rental car to get around or your stuck on the resort!! We did have trouble finding the resort from the airport. We ate by the pool a few times and the food was good. We had dinner on the resort 1 time and it was very good. Both my husband and I slept like babies, very comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “A true paradise!!!”
Reviews.Author: marierika
Reviews.Content: The resort is amazing! The room were clean and safe! The pool area is beautiful and the beach was really nice. The staff was super friendly and helpful..we had a great experience in the gran melia!

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Karthiktara
Reviews.Content: An Amazing place to go if you are on vacation, choose the ocean view rooms .The staff were very friendly and cordial. Food was good,and if you are looking to relax this is the nicest place, but the beach front is very dirty and it will be great if they could make the beaches more neat.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Honeymoon!!!”
Reviews.Author: samplesizeof2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Gran Melia for our honeymoon recently (i.e. arrival on the 8th August and departure on 15th August) and thoroughly enjoyed it! To further understand our feedback and underlying bias, a short description of us would include: weâ€™re both in our late twenties / early thirties; we prefer quiet pool/beach settings; we enjoy mixing activities (e.g. cultural, sports, â€œbum timeâ€�); we enjoy combining high end perks with low cost opportunities. The key characteristics supporting our recommendation to stay at the Gran Melia are as follows: a) Reservations personnel: I planned the honeymoon as a surprise for my wife and worked with Angeritza De la Cruz towards finding the best setup for our characteristics and available budget. We spoke several times on the phone and she was also readily available over email. We ended up booking 6 nights on their Royal Service oceanfront suite and 1 night on their Ocean front garden villa. The Gran Meliaâ€™s accommodation denominations may be confusing in that â€œgardenâ€� in a suite setting means no ocean view, whereas in the villa setting there is only one option (i.e. ocean view with direct beach access). b) Royal service: my reservations included the Royal Service package which I strongly recommended getting if you can. Firstly, you avoid the crowded check-in area and use a separate area with significantly less traffic. Secondly, you get access to a 24 hour private pool (sufficiently large) with several luxurious beds (I lack the technical term but essentially they are comfy queen size beds with comfy cushions which are covered by a nice wooden structure that include a light for evening/night reading). The same pool also has a bar with staff that is very friendly and also makes sure that the pool isnâ€™t mistakenly used by non royal service patrons (note: should you prefer a noisier pool you are welcome to go to the main pool also). Thirdly, you get access to the happy hour every day in a reserved area from 6 to 9pm where free drinks are served. Fourthly, you get free internet access during the royal service office working hours. Lastly, you get the buffet breakfast (valued at $22 per person) which is really worth having (ample selection of fruits, pastries, english breakfast, bagels, omelets, etc). c) Attentive staff: we were very impressed with the service provided by the staff in general. In particular our butler Mr. Angel Melendez and the head of the change-over staff Ms. Maria del Mar. Their dedication and attention made our stay the more memorable! The little things make all the differenceâ€¦ at first we stayed in room 2023 which was next to the private pool (and further away from the main pool area/lobby), and Angel helped us with the timely trolley rides to and from our room (e.g. picking up ice; picking us up at the AVIS car park; etc). Angel also helped play up the surprise for my wife when we moved from the suite to the villa :) Then Maria was equally impressive in arranging for nice towel setups (e.g. swans, hearts, etc) on our bed, as well as readying a bubble bath for us. There was another service personnel whom we didnâ€™t interact as often but who was equally very nice. I believe his name was Pablo (?). d) Location: the resort is just off a main road (i.e. 3) which in turn provides close access to the El Yunque rain forest, to the Luquillo beach, to the Fajardo beaches and kayaking, and within 1 hour drive from San Juan (e.g. airport, old San Juan, etc). e) Facilities: my wife made daily use of the gym and enjoyed it very much. The grounds in general are very well taken care of and the scenery is memorable. f) Rooms: both the ocean suite and the villa we stayed at were of outstanding quality. They both include a free safe. Truth be told that the amenities in the villa are really nice (e.g. bulgari shampoo/conditioner/etc, nespresso, private pool, large jacuzzi, a fridge you can use other than the one stocked with hotel sodas/etc, etc). As with everything, there are factors that arenâ€™t as positive and that need to be taken into account in your decision to stay at Gran Melia. As previously please refer to the characteristics I shared on our potential bias to better understand what we are trying to convey: a) Pricy restaurants: thanks to other reviews here (and thus our commitment in typing out our own review) we avoided the pricy restaurant trap (and thus reflecting our bias of not spending $25 to $50 per person per meal). The cheaper restaurant is the pool side Wet grill bar which indeed provides meals at $10 to $20 per person, but it is only open until 6pm. I strongly recommend renting a car to enable flexibility and access to nearby restaurants. b) Pricy supermarket: it is outrageous that the local supermarket charges the prices that it does on food, and even worse for its medications. Again, with a car you can easily access two large supermarkets (i.e. Ralphâ€™s and Amigo) and Walgreens, which are within 10-15 minutes drive. c) Pricy car parking: as compared to other places the car parking fee ($17 a day I believe) isnâ€™t as bad. However, if you do it right you can rent the car from AVIS onsite and get parking for free! Their parking lot is within 5 minutes walk from the main lobby and if you have royal service you can even call ahead of time for a pick up. Another bonus of renting onsite is that the prices are considerably cheaper than those charged at the airport rental services. Alas, you will have to cough up $35.71 per person each way for your shuttle service from Dragonfly (a tourism operator with a desk at Gran Melia. If you do use the Dragonfly shuttle be sure to take into account their SLOW operations, as our 2pm departure only left by 2.40pm). Finally, remember that you can book your AVIS ahead of time by using the code RG9 on the AVIS website and thus ensure that you get the model you prefer. d) Pricy tourism operator: I canâ€™t speak to the quality of the tours provided by Dragonfly but I can certainly attest to them being overpriced. You are better off renting a car and contacting directly the tour operators to get better pricing. For the El Yunque forest for instance, you only need to pay $4 per person to visit the visitor center, and the hiking trails themselves are for free! Similarly a trip to old San Juan takes about 1 hour and you can either park for free at the Capitol (we found a spot that wasnâ€™t assigned to any officials) or you can use a $4 a day parking lot (be sure to ask which one it is, as some of them charge $20 a day). Dragonfly will charge you a fortune for that same old San Juan trip. e) Rocky beach: the beach hugging the Gran Melia resort isnâ€™t really for bathing as it has way too many rocks. However, once again, with a car you can easily access Luquillo beach which is a 10 minute drive and offers plenty of beach and comfortable bathing. Be sure to park next to the food kiosks as the parking is for free. Also, the food on the second kiosk nearest to the under passing is quite good. f) Noisy main pool: on our last day we noticed a greater number of people by the main pool and indeed they had hired an entertainer that was blasting music poolside. We found this inconvenient and were thankful that we had our royal service access to the private quiet pool. Having spoken with a friend of ours who is from Puerto Rico she conveyed that the 2nd and 3rd week of August are when the locals go on holiday. However I guess that would reflect itself in other resorts as well, thus your only chance would be to avoid that period or get yourself the access to the private pool. We hope this lengthy review is helpful! Other reviews here were extremely helpful in planning our perfect honeymoon in Puerto Rico while staying at the Gran Melia. Last but not least, if you enjoy hiking with a more wilderness experience (i.e. unlike El Yunque, which is beautiful, but paved) do consider doing the Toro Negro ziplining full day adventure! (http://www.acampapr.com/). Our guide, Raymond, not only knew what he was doing (i.e. safety first) but also shared his knowledge about the forest and provided us with a traditional Puerto Rican lunch. The downside is that you have to leave Gran Melia around 5.30am to arrive on time to Plaza de Las Americas for the pick upâ€¦ Well worth it though!

Reviews.Title: “Great for relaxing but not with kids!”
Reviews.Author: PatsyPat
Reviews.Content: I went in April for about a week and it was indeed a breathtaking 1st impression! It's open air set-up is very calming and beautiful... a place for relaxing or for empty nesters! I went with my hubby, a 9y.o. & a 14 y.o. and although they enjoyed the pool and the beach, they certainly lacked age-appropriate activities; especially considering the pricey rates. The rooms are beautiful...absoloutely Gorgeous and quite spacious but they lack fridges and microwaves and I later found out that the reason for that is because they don't allow any food from outside! NONE....No deliveries, no groceries (like juices for the kids, sanwiches etc.) That's a big no no for my family. We like to order out and have deliveries and also have juice in a fridge for when we wake up in the morning, and trust me, with what they chage for a glass of juice there, you can have a full cooked to order breakfast anywhere! I'm a big spender when I travel but I don't believe in giving away my money for nothing! Not me. The hotel is a bit tricky to find if you're driving yourself there for the first time. From the main road to the actual hotel is a whole other road trip ! ! ! I dreaded every time I had to leave and return to the hotel whever I went sightseeing (or anywhere for that matter) because it was such a looooooooooooong drive into and out of the resort, I hated that! It was quite a drive! Overall, it was beautiful and relaxing but I wouldn't go back again until I'm retired and just want trip where I want to lay back and read a book feeling the breeze from the sea. That's really what the hotel is good for. The casino is fairly SMALL. They did have a great restaurant there that I decided to try and it was actually quite good....actually it was GREAT! PasiÃ³n por el FogÃ³n (I think that was the name) I had steak, tostones rellenos, and a few other items and ALL were absoloutely AWESOME!!! My kids are more into less formal dining and maybe mac and chz and stuff like that, so my husband and I dined alone but then was that looooooooooong trip out of the hotel to take them out to a great chicken place that was on the main road!!! Oh yeah, there's also a bakery that you'll see as you dive into and out of the hotel, right on the corner, just before you turn into the main road (when you're leaving the hotel) and their "pan soba'o" is DELICIOUS! So hot and delicious that we had to buy some to bring back but it was so good we ate it on the flight back! (For those who don't know, pan soba'o is the name of a Puerto Rican bread that is usually eaten warm and has a mild semi sweet taste when you eat it...it's really good!) I say the hotel is beautiful but would I stay there again, probably not! For a comparable price, I guess next time I'd probably drive a lil'bit more to the "El Conquistador" which has alot more to offer their guests! I just didn't realize that until we were a day or two away from leaving! Oh yeah, it's pretty easy to get to El Yunque from there and with a good map or GPS, you should do ok getting around to other attractions!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay... Had a great time!! Read below”
Reviews.Author: FamRossy
Reviews.Content: I will be completely honest with this review as I gathered information from previous reviews that were helpful. The HOTEL, beautiful, landscaping , location, setup, very tropical. CHECK In process- waited in line 1 hour in the heat (no ceiling fans) but i have experienced the same in other 5 star resort in Dominican Republic too!! STAFF---LOVED THEM!!! from funny to friendly, every employee went above and beyond to help. FOOD: by a previous review I went prepared and had a suitcase full of food ( in my group, we had 5 rooms and 6 kids total) snacks and drinks were needed . So I brought all of that since someone had advised coolers and bags weren't allowed in. Yet during our whole stay we saw people walking from the parking lot with grocery bags and beach cools... Hotel food prices.. Expensive. But two of our three nights there we opted to eat at restaurants in the hotel, Passions (Puertorican cuisine) and Tempo (Italian) Both restaurants were excellent. ROOM locations: YES be prepared to WALK. They have golf carts you can take by standing in the front lobby to your villa. Half the time we opted to walk because it was too hot to wait ( it was good exercise) But for our 70 yr parents it was a bit difficult and tiring to get around. Room did have a moldy odor, so I brought room spray. POOL : Perfect.. great music, nice bar, big and spacious. Beach: Pretty to look at but too many rocks and coral. My recommendations: For BREAKFAST and LUNCH eat at Sweet Coco Bakery, located on the main road that leads into hotel. Average breakfast price $3-$5 per person for a huge sandwich., compared to the hotel buffet that is $26 per person. For Dinner: hotel prices average about $20-$25 per person, about the same you would spend elsewhere like in Old San Juan. Drive around. Luquillo beach is about 10 minutes away, Old San Juan / Condado 30 minutes, El Yunque Rainforest 10 minutes. Outlet Mall 10 min. Or just stay around the hotel pool.. and relax. Additional tips: PARENTS: DO NOT waste money on the AirBrushed Tattoos : about $8-10 each and they IMMEDIATELY come off, even though the guy says 3-5 days... I paid for one on each of my nieces and nephews and by the next day they were ALL GONE.. Drinks: Pina Coladas $ 7 without alcohol $ 8 with.. so drink Beers they are cheaper. CASINO: needs updating . SPA: Not bad, I treated myself to a deeptissue massage, and it felt GREAT! OHHH PARKING: Yes only one parking lot, not enough for when the hotel is full over a weekend and if they have an event going on. Someone else recommended renting your vehicle at the airport from AVIS, which also has a rental desk at the Hotel. You can park in there lot and avoid paying the $16 hotel parking fee... Hope all this information helps. Enjoy ...

Reviews.Title: “Just so-so”
Reviews.Author: martaplaza
Reviews.Content: Beautiful setting, grounds and restaurants. Check-in clerk did not know how to smile, did not look at us. Suite moldy, air vent black from dirt and mold, shower with black and pink mold, ripped towels, ac did not work (had to leave the ceiling fan on all night). Sofa bed a joke, none of us could sleep in it. Double beds hard and uncomfortable. Old TV sets. Woken up by maid promptly at 9:00am (no "do not disturb" sign). Broken coffee maker caraffe. Thankfully, we were there only for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Absolut relaxation. Perfect get away!”
Reviews.Author: Lyma7
Reviews.Content: Surpass my expectations. A nice cozy room, beautiful sights, amazing arquitecture and fantastic food. Enjoyed the peaceful environment at the beach, the transparency of the water it was just the spa I needed. I was delighted with the service. A smile and great service from every employee. The only detail: parking its too expensive. Definitely, a place to yearn and daydream at work. Will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Resort Beautiful - service & management sucked - stealing not nice”
Reviews.Author: mlasa923
Reviews.Content: So you plan to attend a baseball tournament with your family and 70 other people, they had known for 9 months we were coming! Ya right, you would of thought that we arrived that day and things would be in order! NO - they had nothing ready for us NOTHING. We got there around 1:30 - 2:00 in the afternoon, my family did not get a room until almost 7:00 pm. Yes you are reading this correctly, 7:00 pm and that was after having words with the staff and manager. After 9 months or more of being in contact with these resort, you would of thought that they would of had their stuff together. What a friggin joke. No money exchange for any service, either charge to your CC or Room. They had a store where a med size bad of doridos cost $6.00, 1 pizza room service $25.00. I understand this is resort, but come on you have got to be kidding. We had families that had mold in their bathroom, we had one kids who had money stolen, my daughter computer was taken right from our room. Now we knew we need to put the laptop in a stop where no could see it. So we put it on the top shelf behind the luggage, how could you know it was there? You had to go searching threw the room in order to find it. They security calls to tell me they found it...........please we hadn't even report it yet............What a joke. The only nice thing about this whole trip was the people we traveled with and the people of Luquillo were the best. Next time I will stay at a Holiday Inn or rent a house.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort "BUT"”
Reviews.Author: plelacheur
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Resort, great views, clean, friendly, but terrible setup. 3 miles from any shopping ,food ( pinchos,mufango etc...). Had reservations for 9 months in advance but still took 3 hours to check-in (not air-conditioned). Although the concierge employees were friendly and for the most part helpful, still seemed computer illiterate. Key cards deactivated constantly. Our bungalo was 1/2 mile from front desk, pool, casino, restaurants etc... (thank goodness for the golf cart transportation). In short get to know front desk employees, you will be seeing alot of them!

Reviews.Title: “Our first family trip was a dream come true!”
Reviews.Author: Sandy1020
Reviews.Content: This was our first family vacation... My daughter(3 years old) was so excited to see the beach. Upon arriving at the resort, we were greeted by the friendly staff and told our room wasn't ready yet. No biggie when you're in paradise! They suggested we go to the pool while we wait, and so we locked up our luggage and changed into our bathing suits. The pool was awesome. HUGE! We did spend most of our time in the shallow baby pool section, and it was just as beautiful. Our daughter had a blast. When it was finally time to head to our room, we were once again greeted by another friendly staff member named Angel. We were convinced he really was an "Angel". He made sure everything was perfect for us our entire stay. He followed up with us daily to see if we needed anything, and made sure things were going good. His customer service was excellent, and he really went above and beyond. It was hard to say goodbye to Angel- our new friend. We wish to thank him over and over for such a memorable trip! The room was worth the wait! It was gorgeous! The view of the beach was stunning! It exceeded our expectations! The beach is naturally beautiful- untouched. Kind of seaweedy, shelly, and has lots of hermit crabs. We went in the water,but did not go to far out. Seeing that the seaweed wouldn't let you! Not too many people went to the beach, so it was like our own private beach for the week. Our daughter loved it! Her face was priceless seeing the beach for the first time. The only complaint we had was we hoped there would have been more variety for lunch and dinner choices. Only a certain restaurant is open for that specific night. If you didn't make reservations for that restaurant- you had to get room service. Restaurants are not kid friendly. But still managed to get chicken fingers and fries! "Nami", the japanese restaurant was our favorite- I got my husband to try sushi, and now he loves it! Overall the food was good, but it woud be nice to be able to get something to eat without having to get all dressed up each night. Poolside service was great! The drinks kept coming! Everyone was so friendly! The memories of Puerto Rico will last us a lifetime, and we hope to return again someday. (with both daughters :) Our daughter asks us all of the time if we can go back to Puerto Rico as if it's right down the street from us. The best part of this trip was a few weeks after we got home, I found out I was pregnant! Thanks again Gran Melia!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: taflory
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon and highly recommend it. The rooms were clean and cool, which is a must in the climate. The food was excellent, but a little pricey. We did discover that the cheese pizza from room service was surprisingly good. Be prepared to walk while you are there, as the resort is set up in a community of bungalows. However, the staff is constantly driving around in golf carts and will pick you up along the way. I would highly recommend royal service, but only because we do not have children, and it allowed us to use the adults only pool and included a breakfast buffet. We greatly enjoyed our time at the adults only pool with the bartender "Richard." He was an excellent source of information about the local sights and cultures. Our recommendation would be to rent a car at the airport and keep it for your entire stay. There is a rental car agency at the resort, but the rates are much higher. Also, check in with the concierge on your first day. We waited until our third day and missed out on some wonderful deals at the local outlet mall. It is located approximately 5 miles off of the main road, but this add to the experience of being in a secluded tropical resort.

Reviews.Title: “Just relax!”
Reviews.Author: 3nity
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel for relaxation, really romantic. If you are looking for a lot of action, this is not it. They do have an activity schedule, but we never joined the crowd. The beach is just beautiful. Nothing close by, you can just hear the birds and the waves. It's like you are miles away from nowhere. The beach is not really for swimming, because the water comes right up to the line of rocks, but there is plenty of sand (with or without shade). Everything is sort of spread out, but that makes the bungalows/rooms more private. Rooms were nice. My only complaint was that they smelled a bit musty, specially the bathroom. And if you get a room that's too close to the recreational areas, you'll can hear the live music. Thankfully, the music was good and they didn't play 'till too late. I never had dinner at the restaurants. We bought the "breakfast-included" option; had heavy breakfasts everyday at about 10:30pm, and then had early dinners outside the hotel. Neither valet or regular parkings are included. Have you gas tank filled up, because the hotel is at least 20 minutes from any mall or outside restaurant. The staff was nice, and they have really good deals for low season.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with a lot of activities”
Reviews.Author: traveler_pr_usa
Reviews.Content: I just checked out this hotel in Rio Grande, PR. This resort came to be a lot better than I was thinking. Check-in - We checked in on a Wednesday and it was a fast check-in with any issues. They explained us the check-in process and they also took us to the parking to park the car and picked us up there with the golf cart to take us to the room Bungalow 14 which was not that far from main facilities. Room - Room was beautiful, very clean, very big, balcony, safe box. My wife and I was surprised by the amazing room. Pool - One of the biggest pools that you can find in a hotel. It has a wet pool bar, which had on live music. The pool also has a volleyball net to play. Excellent. "Beach" - Well, hotel "beach" was mainly sand to play volleyball and wet your feet since the rocks on the bottom wont let you stand for long. But close to the hotel you will find one of the most amazing beches in the whole Island (Luquillo beach). Activities - At checkin, they will give you the weekly activities which include yoga, pilates, zumba, billiard tournaments, ping pong, soccer games for kids, aquaerobics, karaoke, salsa and merengue nights. Really amazed by all of the activities. Saturday night they took "pleneros" and everyone was dancing big time. Check-out - Check out on Sunday was not that good since hotel was full and line was over 30 minues. I expressed checkout hoping that they remove the towels charge they made to my toom because I did not have time to make the line. In summary, my family and I had a lot of fun and will definetely come back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing beauty, but poor setup”
Reviews.Author: Niteowl901
Reviews.Content: The location of the Gran Melia is remarkable, at the end of a private peninsula with a long stretch of white beach and the largest hotel pool I have seen. The Junior Suite was large, the marble floor clean, and the bathtub big enough for me (6ft) to enjoy a long pleasant soak. Now for the bad news. The check in desk, concierge, internet computer, and most other amenities were outdoors so by the time I checked in I was sweating. After checking in I was assigned a room about 1/3 of a mile away (according to the sign outside my suite and I was only halfway down the line of suites. I pity the people at the very end) and I had to wait for a glorified golf cart to come pick me up to take me there. After getting dropped of f I felt stranded with a long hot 10 min walk to get to my car/main desk or another wait for a golf cart. There was also no refrigerator in the room and the ice machine a 2 minute walk away, again outside.The next day when i was trying to sleep in late the cleaning lady, who did a great job, woke us up every hour starting at 9:00 until we got up at 11:30. To add insult to injury we were also woken up at 10:0 by a phone call from the front desk to inform us that the spa was 25% off for the next 3 hours. There were many steep fines (130 for late check out, 30 per beach towel if not returned) included in small print to the point that I felt a bit threatened. I wish I could have gotten over the minor annoyances to enjoy this gorgeous hotel, but I walked away with a bad taste in my mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Great place overall (but some things have to be considered)”
Reviews.Author: perez899
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is a really nice hotel. Some good points: -Beautiful facilities, rooms, swimming pool, etc -Very friendly staff -Good location close to San Juan -Very exclusive location: Close to private golf courses, Donald Trump appartments, etc. -Good services: Ice available for rooms, free shuttle to go to rooms, etc. But consider that: -Prices for eating are very expensive: Try to eat outside -Swimming pool is great, but beach not very nice: Try to go to other beaches -Rent a car from the airport is a must: Rental prices from the hotel are very expensive. Without a car, it is impossible to leave the hotel. In our case, we used the hotel as the "base of operations" and used the car all day to visit other places in PR. We got an excellent hotel price offer from hotels.com .(only 99$ a night). If you get this offer, price is a bargain given the quality of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Melia was great, but Royal Service is a must do...”
Reviews.Author: luvliboo22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went here with a friend of ours. We rented from Avis at the airport (per other reviews), and it worked out great. Didn't have to pay the $20 daily parking fee at the resort. But the Avis parking lot was an extra 5 mins away. We were here for 5 days/ 4 nights, per a saveonresorts.com special. It was only $300 all together! So after reading about other reviews on upgrading to the Royal Service, we did. It was an extra $150 per day, per room. We got an ocean view room, with a jacuzzi on the balcony. As well as the RS adults only pool, which we had to ourselves for the first 2 days! The bartender Richard was fantastic. He recommended Kiokos #2 and #9, both phenomenol! We also had free bottled water all day long from the RS lounge. And happy hour from 6p-9p in the RS lounge daily. I had champagne mostly, and it was $8.50 a pop when I had one at the bar! So we all got pretty liquored up at the lounge area. Angelica is an angel, she is the sweetest and most professional. And remembers your drinks as well as exceptional service. Our friend was absolutely goo-goo over her, and if you ever have the pleasure of meeting her, you'll know why. The Martini Bar across the hall is fun too. Illuminada was the best, making up drinks and chatting away! Her pomegranate mojito with brandy-infused cherries on the bottom were the bomb. The 90 min presentation was done in precisely 90 mins. We said no, they said thanks have a nice day. It was amazing, I guess they met their quota already. Anyhoo, yay for us! The spa was a loss for them. I walked in with my husband, and the receptionist girl was helping another couple sign in and when they went to fill out their paperwork, she didn't even glance at us. I went around to the front of the counter and sort of hovered, since she looked soooo busy on her computer. Then while looking at the flyings I mentioned it'd be nice if they had a price list somewhere. She grabbed a piece of paper and handed it my way, without looking, without any acknowledgement or even a smile. She must have thought better of it, because she then said "here, this should help". I walked out and said not too quietly, that if this place had better service, they may have some more customers. And never looked back. Too bad, I'm a real spa-lover, but I will not waste my hard earned money on bad customer service. That was my only bad experience, everyone else everywhere was just the nicest. I smiled and said 'hi' to everyone, and they all responded happily, even the ones who didn't initate a greeting. My friend did get rejected from the African-American Angel butler when he tried to get a ride from the gym to the RS pool. He said they butler just said flat out 'no' and drove off! He was very cordial to us every other time. Not sure what was going on there... But my friend was totally peeved because he gets to the pool and see's the butler chatting it up with a girl at the bar there! You must go to eat at the Kioskos and the ones I mentioned before. They were amazing! The steaks 'Churrascos' at #2 are awesome. And the fried whole red snapper and kan kan pork chops at #9 are out of this world! We only dined at Pasion on the resort. Even then the food was just ok, nothing compared to the kioskos. But be ready to spend at least $100 per meal. All in all, I would love to come back. The mosquitos here were friendly, and I did get bit a couple of times, but nothing compared to Tennacitta, MX (Punta Serena Villas & Spa). Altho, I was much more diligent with the bug spray this time around as well :)

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at Best”
Reviews.Author: GemsVacations
Reviews.Content: If you're planning on booking because of a marketing offer going on, be prepared. My family and I stayed here for 4 nights. The vacation package offered last night free. Since we didn't pay regular prices, we were offered a hotel room on the edge of the grounds, with stained everything. Our first room reeked of mold and mildew so much that my 6 year old daughter walked in immediately asking me "what's that smell mommy?". When I asked for a different room, the snobby concierge made it seem like I was just looking for a room closer to the center of the resort. We were moved to a room in the same building. This room had less stains on the sofa and on the decorative sheets & pillows and we weren't overwhelmed by the stench overpowering the other room. Having already spent $65 on government subsidized taxi service and being told how much we'd loose if we left early, we decided to chance it. We were invited to sit with a vacation club representative who's boss confirmed that our bad room experience was the result of having booked a marketing sale package and used this to motivate us into financing a $25,000 vacation club membership that would guarantee us top of the line accommodations by the same people. Vaacation club members stay at the other end of the hotel. The philosophy governing the Gran Melia in PR is elitist to say the least, reminiscent of all the condescending attitudes of the old world. Sounds ridiculous but believe me, this is what it is. As far as meals go, here's the nitty gritty: If you spend $25 or less on your dinner, you'll be hungry within an hour or two. Spend $30+ and you'll make it to the next meal of the day. Nami had great food and the Wet Pool Bar was descent. Cafe Soleil was a joke. The only enjoyable days we had as a family were the ones we didn't spend at the resort. When visiting Old San Juan be sure to check out Raices, best PR food we had the all week. Good luck to you and many wonderful vacations ;)

Reviews.Title: “Bring a flashlight...and plan on sweating”
Reviews.Author: makenamaui6
Reviews.Content: On the drive up to the hotel, I was prepped to be impressed. A beautiful Spanish-esque fountain on a circular drive led me to believe this was going to be a very special hotel. And, maybe, if you're on your honeymoon or want to hole away in your room it would be, but for me it was a disappointment. The property is an open air type resort. Which may be great in December or January, but when I'm standing in a 45 minute line (and it wasn't even THAT long!) to get checked in, dripping with sweat because the humidity is so high, it's NOT. By the time I get checked in, it's dark, and I mean DARK. So dark I wished I had a flashlight. They hand you a map, like they do at the Gaylord resorts, and at that point I wished I had a compass too. I dragged my luggage to my room - no golf cart shuttle to be found to take me there - and walking to my room I wished I had a flashlight. It felt like camping and I was trying to find the latrines. They have low lights placed every 20' or so and I'd have to put all my luggage down and lean down to check my map to see where I was and where I needed to go next. I was plesantly surprised to find a nice, large room. Very comfortable, clean and tasteful. Bathroom was nice (note - had a nice deep tub but the stopper wouldn't stay in so it was useless), tv channel selection was terrible (supposedly had Showtime but never could find it). Ate dinner in Pasion, which was a joke. I had heard how "fabulous" this restaurant was and I guess I had high expectations. They weren't even close to being met. When I was sat, the snotty waiter basically ignored me for the first 10 minutes or so to spend his time on a 4 top next to me that was drinking up a storm (who drinks margaritas in Puerto Rico?). I guess he thought he'd get a bigger tip from them than me. Big mistake, HUGE! I waited tables for 20 years and have been known to leave obnoxiously large tips (25-40%...sometimes more). For me, 20% is a minimum. This guy? I left him 15% and wished I hadn't left that. He was arrogant and came across that he was doing me a favor by waiting on me. I ordered mofongo with conch and 10-15 minutes later he comes by to tell me they don't have conch. Really? You didn't know this 10-15 minutes ago when you SHOULD have turned my order in?? Beds were just ok as far as comfort. The sheet kept coming off, which is annoying. The morning I left I knew why they had so many umbrellas behind the front desk (I saw them on that 45 minute check in)...it rains and if you have to leave your room, you'll get wet! If you're coming to PR for business, stay at another hotel. If you're coming for romance and staying in your room, this hotel would be fine...but if that's the case why stay in PR anyway, why not just go to the Intercon O'Hare and stay there? MUCH better, nicer hotel and cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “Go someplace else”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaW90
Reviews.Content: Where to begin?? The employees are VERY NICE. It's as if they know you are getting ripped off and feel bad about it. The property is like a condo development and your room, which is a two story bungalow set-up consisting of four units, will be FAR AWAY from everything the property has. (Parking lot, pool, restaurant, market, etc.) So, when you are ready to go out, you walk 1/4 mile to get to anything and are dripping with sweat. They say they have bellmen in golf carts to come and get you. Just don't plan on them getting to your room anytime soon. If you have ANY problem walking medium distances, stay someplace else.The pool is huge but, you cannot relax because of the obnoxious music they play. Do you really want to hear loud rap music in the Caribbean?? No one walking around to offer food or drinks. No open restaurant to get a small snack during the day (teenagers are always hungry). No house phones around to call back to your room. The three restaurants are too formal and expensive. . The golf course (championship course) was okay. Be warned, Marriott is building a hotel right next door. Construction goes on all day. This review sounds petty but, for the money you end up spending, you will NOT be leaving feeling like it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: orlando_traveler1
Reviews.Content: I was a bit skeptical about staying here after some of the negative reviews I had read. Let me start by saying I didn't experience ANYTHING but i great time. Check-in was fast. All the staff is friendly. The resort is well maintained and the landscaping is top notch.
