The resort is rather large so depending on where your room is you may be a several minutes walking from the pool, restaurants, etc. They have complimentary golf carts driving around the premises all the time to give you a ride wherever you need to go. My finance and I never had to walk to get anywhere on site no matter what time it was.....early morning or midnight. The resort is kinda far out from the "touristy" area so if you want to really experience PR, rent a car. But if you'd like to just lounge and relax there's enough to do at the resort to keep you happy. Staff was really helpful when we asked for directions to restaurants and other tour locations even though they had them on site. Rooms are called bungalows and they are NICE.....very clean and comfy! I will definitely be staying here the next time I visit PR again. I can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “If you want a fun vacation do not spend your money here”
Reviews.Author: yungtravlr
Reviews.Content: I will start this review with a caution: if your aim is to enjoy yourself do not stay here. My boyfriend and I, both 22, recently spent 6 days at this resort and were both severely disappointed with our stay. For one thing, the resort is located at the end of a five mile drive way, surrounded by a golf course on one side and a sad excuse for a beach on the other. We took this vacation hoping to relax and feel safe at a resort, while still experiencing the culture of Puerto Rico. This is not something that can happen at this resort. In fact, the only thing the resort does offer is the experience of feeling robbed. There are three restaurants at the resort: Tempo, Nami, and Passion. Only two are ever open at one time and you better not want dinner before six, because theyâ€™re not open. You get one lunchtime option (which closes at three) of an overpriced bar and grill (By overpriced I mean seven dollar hotdogs with nothing but ketchup and mustard. Fries not included). And one breakfast choice of a place they label a cafÃ© but is in actuality an overpriced buffet. It is twenty-three dollars for an overcooked, tasteless breakfast that I served to myself. Tell me how on this earth can anyone make breakfast sausage tasteless?? In fact, all the food at this resort is bland and overcooked. I would really like to know how these restaurants manage to have any stars awarded to them. I can literally find better food at a Dennyâ€™s. The next major problem with this place is that there is ABSOLUTELY NOTHING to do at night here. If you did not bring a car (which would cost you sixteen dollars a night to keep here) and you donâ€™t want to pay for the sixty dollar cab ride to leave the driveway, then the only option you have left is to sit in your room and watch television. What a horrendously boring time.. Oh and if you do decide to stay here for some reason then pray you get an upstairs room, because the floors eco- badly. Other Short Notes: the hotel is esthetically beautiful, but that is the one and only positive. The beach is covered in debris and the water is nothing but seaweed. The dragonfly tours were great, but you better have some luck because all the tours that are worth the money have a minimum of four people that need to go or too bad for you. The casino is a joke, half of the thirty machines they have are broken.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but you will get nickel and dimed!”
Reviews.Author: editorluva
Reviews.Content: This resort is nice, however, beware; there are a lot of unexpected charges upon check-in!! My friends and I stayed for the weekend and arrived on a friday! We waited in a line to check in for over an hour! We were aggrivated by this! I had read reviews that stated the same thing, so I wasn't completely surprised by this! But I was not happy about it either way!! We were told that they were going to charge us an extra $100/day for "incidentals" and whateve we didn't use would be returned to us!! So we were surprised by that! We initially booked a double room and were told that "they were all given away the day before." So our reservation was for no reason. They gave us what was left! And no one in our party got the room they reserved. We finally recieved our keys and were taken to our bungalow!! We were told that if we needed a ride during our stay to another location on the resort, to just call and someone would come get us! When we did this, they told us to just come outside and wait! There was no door to door upon request service, just go outside and wait!! Parking on the resort was horrible!! There is a very small parking lot for this resort and we had to park over 200 yards from our bungalow! The resort has cars you can rent for a 24-hour period!! My friend rented a Toyata Yaris for $85 tax and fees included! We rented from the airport for $113 for the weekend! I was totally surprised by how much they were charging for such a small car! And by the way, parking is $20/day and $24/day if you valet!! Now the rooms! One friend's room was changed midway through our stay because there was a mildew smell coming from the room and her clothes in her bag was soaked!! Another room's air conditioning didn't work properly, an engineer was called 4 times over the weekend! My room's air wouldn't shut off, it stayed 69 degrees in my room the entire time! The towels and extra sheets are housed in a closet outside of the bungalows. They aren't kept in a laundry room or anything, so they smelled like the outside air! The beds are nice and comfy but the resort is inconsistent at best! Dining on the resort is nice, but extremely expensive!! I ate at Passion the first night and 1 appetizer, 2 drinks and 2 entrees was $90! We didn't expect that it would be that much, but we vowed to never eat on the resort again! Friends told me that the breakfast buffet was $23/person for hot food and $16 for just fruit!! Room service stops at 11 on resort, but you can get a box lunch for $10! Basically, the food and drinks are expensive on the resort so beware! The pool area is the best thing going on the resort!! It is just like the pictures on the website! Just gorgeous and huge!! They have little cabanas that you can rent for a price at the pool area and they have a bar that you can get drinks and food! However, in order to get a towel for the pool, you have to use a towel card that you are given at check-in! However, if you don't return the towels, you can be charged $30 on check-out! So be careful and return the towels!! The beach is virtually nonexistent!! No one uses it! There is coral at the shoreline and you can hurt yourself, so no one really uses it!! It didn't look like I expected from Puerto Rico! The staff and service was great!! Everyone was friendly and eager to please! This was one of the best things about the resort! All in all, this was an ok resort, but if I go to Puerto Rico again, I will not stay here! For the money that we paid, I'd rather stay in San Juan and not so far out of the city! The Gran Melia is like 30-40 min outside San Juan!! So beware! I tried to make this as detailed as possible because some of the things were just unacceptible for me and my friends!

Reviews.Title: “What a fun place to stay”
Reviews.Author: novoselsky
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort. I was traveling with my husband and 8, 5, and 1 year old sons. The room was very large with a huge bathroom. Everything was very elegantly decorated and the grounds were gorgeous. The have a huge pool on the property that was very fun to play in. They also have a large beach. The sand with not smooth or white, but it had a lot of hermit crabs, which my kids thought were super cool. The sound of the coquis at nice was so pieceful. I miss it now that we're home. We would stay at this hotel everytime we go to Puerto Rico. The only thing that I didn't like was the food situation. There are no refrigerators in the rooms and there is a sign as you go back to the rooms stating that outside food is prohibitted. The property is pretty far away from the main room so you're pretty much stuck with the food served in the restaurants or sold at the gift shop. Two of the restaurants require reservations, one closes at 6:00, one only serves breakfast and lunch, and the other looked pretty fancy. It was late and we needed to feed the kids and get them to bed so we had to buy overpriced food from the gift shop. The next day we went to the Amigo grocery store and snuck the food in.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Gran Melia was enjoyable...”
Reviews.Author: Whisper4
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Gran Melia was enjoyable. I would definitly recommend this resort for a great visit to Puerto Rico. The resort is definitely 5 stars, but the rooms are not in my opinion...very out dated yet nice...just not 5 star standard. I had a special rate that required a time share presentation. DON'T DO THIS! It's not worth the value. They kept me in the presentation for over 3 hours and that took away fun time for me. If you want to sight see I suggest you rent a car at the airport & drive to the resort..it's only 30 min drive. Be careful driving because they drive very aggressively in Puerto Rico. Again, I had a great time at the resort but I didn't spend enough time there and it rained the entire time! Go and have a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Experience dont miss it.”
Reviews.Author: erivettemarie
Reviews.Content: This was an awesome experience for me and my family. The Royal service is real service beyond your expectations. The cleanliness of the place and the general ambience of the resort are amazing. I recommed this hotel for a relaxing, great service and amazing time to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Waste Your Money”
Reviews.Author: DYoung10
Reviews.Content: We read a lot of reviews before we went to Gran Melia. Still I'm a believer that we need to find out on our own whether this place is worth it or not. Well let me tell you is not worth it at all. The place is beautiful don't get me wrong, but that's it. First of all, let me start with the room. The room is spacious, you get a bed, a small living room and a porch. The rooms are so outdated, the outside could use new paint or pressure washing. The housekeeper did a good job cleaning the rooms, but everytime she swept the room the dirt she collected was thrown on the hallway. I'm not kidding, this drove my husband crazy, everytime we came to the room and he saw the dirty stairs and hallway I had to listen to him. We rented the $25.00 small fridge - Beware - it's not a fridge, is a cooler. If you put something cold it will keep it cold, but if you put something hot it will not cool the drink for you. Everything is expensive at the hotel. We went to Sam's and bought water, beer and gatorade. To our surprise they have a guard at the entrance and he told us we couldn't bring the stuff to our room, not permitted. He said he will get fired if he allowed us to bring the drinks to our room. Well we empty one luggage, came back to the car and put the drinks inside the luggage and the guard couldn't stop us because the drinks were not visible and they are not allowed to look inside your bags. We felt like we were in a communist place - we had to hide everything - in all it was a bad experience. The only restaurant we went to eat was at Nami (Japanesse), with a Puerto Rican cook :) still the food was good, but expensive. We went to the bakery at the end of the road for breakfast, really cheap. We didn't mind eating at the places by the streets so we save money and enjoy authentic Puerto Rican food. The pool at the hotel is very large and nice, with a swim up bar. The Hotel does not, I repeat does not have a beach. What they call a beach is nothing but dirty, nasty and smelly water. We went by one day to see it and that was enough. If you want to go to a nice beach go to Culebra Island. The only way to get there is by ferry. The fee is $4.50 roundtrip and the trip is about 1 hour and 30 minutes each way. The ferry is really nice and it does provide air conditioning. The town is not that nice but the beach is worth it. The hotel charge $20.00 a day for parking, this is not fair to the people that stays at the hotel. Is ok to charge the parking fee if you only come to play at the Casino, but they never should charge the people that stay at the hotel, it is crazy. To top that off, after you park you need to walk and walk to your room. If you are a golf person, you will enjoy this place. The golf course is huge. I'm not a golfer but I was impressed at how big the golf course is. My husband's brother in law played twice, he said it was nice and fun. The location of this place is crazy. Is so far from San Juan - 45 minutes to 1 hour drive to San Juan - depending on traffic. We never made it to San Juan, that's how far the hotel is. My friend and her husband stayed at the Sheraton in San Juan last February and she said they were walking distance to San Juan and that the Hotel was really nice. We have stayed at the Ritz Carlton in St. Thomas and Paradissus Palma Real in Punta Cana (which belongs to the Gran Melia Hotel chain) and we never had problems of any kind. In conclusion is your choice on whether to go to the Gran Melia Puerto Rico Hotel or not, but you have been warned about how horrible this place is. We were so dissapointed, but they said you learn from your mistakes and believe me we did. P.S. if you are looking for nightlife you will not find it here.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed: Who is running this place?”
Reviews.Author: mflatc
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out this place is a real mess. I don't even think anyone is managing this place. There are so many negative aspects to this place from first impressions to a constant nagging sensation that you have been had. I won't waste time with a lot of details just list a few things.Waiting for over 1/2 hour to check in with no real "line" to stand in. Electric carts with many without lights speeding around at night on the walking paths. Poor choice of restaurants that only 1 out of the 3 don't need reservations. Dirty uncleaned areas around rooms. Exposed wires in electric boxes next to walkways and accessible to children. Dirty beaches. No poolside service, so most people with their own rum bottles and beer cans (classy). I won't waste anymore time with this review. On the positive side, the room was nice.Why anyone would come all the way to Puerto Rico and stay here?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but some things dull the stay!!”
Reviews.Author: phantuly
Reviews.Content: The scenarios and the concept of the hotel are wonderful but some things they should improve. The good things: beautiful and romantic scenarios, relaxing gateways, a great personal service hospitality. And some of the bad thigs that they should improve are: first, when we arrive to check in we waited for an one hour to get our room and the lobby was very hot. Second, the room has a smoke odor and the bathtub didn't work properly. Third, in one ocasion we open the balcony door a three birds entered to our room and started to play with the garbage and some lizzards swam around us when we were in the pool. And finally when the check hour arrives we wait another one hour to make the check out.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: nana019
Reviews.Content: The room was nice but we had selected the VIP service upgrade so I am not sure if all rooms are the same. Some of the restaurants on-site were a huge disappointment (actually left one without eating), although room service was great. The biggest problem was the beach. The hotel advertises a beach front property, but the beach is nothing but a mangrove all the way around the resort. If you are in PR for a nice beach experience consider a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 Stars - its 3 Stars!”
Reviews.Author: emailtoingo
Reviews.Content: Hi All, My wife and I just came back from the Gran Melia in Puerto Rico. We booked this trip through Priceline - 120US per night. The hotel is about 40min drive from San Juan. Beach - not good Room - old - air con makes serious noises Food, drinks - fill up your wallet - a cocktail costs 10US Resort - the whole bungalow set up is rather strange. If you stay at the end you walk 10min to the lobby. Casino is rubbish. Gym is old and very small. I would rate this hotel with 3 stars. No desire to go back there. Puerto Rico yes.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Tray0718
Reviews.Content: The grand melia was a absolute great vacation place. You must eat at the NAMI ASIAN BISTRO the food was excellent. The staff at the resort was so friendly. The pool was so big and beach right outside my villa my plans are to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Service beyond compare!”
Reviews.Author: lennamae
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Gran Melia are absolutely outstanding. From the front desk, concierge and bell staff to the housekeeping staff, every person greets each guest cheerfully. If there is anything anyone can do to make your stay more pleasant, they offer, and sometimes surprise you with things you haven't thought of. Traveling with three generations, including a new baby, and a two-year old, we found this a perfect place to be. Very family-friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Jordan1207
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely paradise. Very quiet. Friendly and excellent staff. Unfortunetly I went to visit on a rainy weekend. Although it rained, it did not stop the tourist from activities, or anything else. It was so much fun. This was my first trip to PR and I took my 2 year old son (who loved the kids playgroud, its also near the pool) and my husband enjoyed the wet pool bar & grill which was the bar/grill inside the pool area. We watched the staff give salsa and aerobic lessons, and watched them play volleyball. It was a wonderful trip for us. Oh and another thing, there's nothing like hearing coqui's at night.

Reviews.Title: “Not Pleased”
Reviews.Author: GYP051
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel. I got room 1018 and very disappointed. The room vents had black dust on them, had not been cleaned in months and the room had a moldy smell. I call the front desk and the supervisor informed that there was another room but same smell. Housekeeping came by and sprayed with odor eliminator but the following day it was back to the moldy smell. Would recommend this hotel is they do a mold remediation in thier rooms!!!

Reviews.Title: “Meh.....”
Reviews.Author: disc_girl
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia was a very average place to stay. I suppose I should start by saying that I've never stayed at a resort before, but in my opinion it wasn't even a good as a basic hotel. If you don't plan on spending all of your time at the resort, this probably isn't the place to spend your vacation. The place was fairly deserted being the off-season. However, they still felt it necessary to put us in the farthest bungalow possible. Bungalows are not accessible by car and we were a 10 minute walk from the car, each way.... 2 to 3 times per day. It got old very quickly. You *could* call for a golf cart to take you to and fro if you don't mind waiting 45 minutes every time you need to be shuttled. And if you want to go anywhere, be prepared to spend 10 minutes just getting to the main road. The air conditioning in our room did not even come close to removing the humidity out of the air and as a result every piece of clothing we brought was damp by the time we left....even the ones that never made it out of the suitcase. The grounds were very nicely landscaped, however, and the staff were nice.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Sol Melia Vacation Club, and read this review!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GabeTravel_2010
Reviews.Content: Here is what you need to know about this resort in order to have a great time in Puerto Rico: 1. You may be thinking "Where the heck is it?!" Before I went, my wife and I couldn't find an actual address for it, or figure out exactly where it was from Google maps. Ignore the Gran Melia website and where Google thinks the resort is, use this map instead (with good directions from SJU airport): http://tinyurl.com/3xesn39. Gran Melia and Sol Melia (the vacation club) are right next to each other. As you are following these directions, you will see a pretty big Gran Melia billboard on the right hand side of the road before the exit to the left. You'll also see a "Super Gigante" supermarket on the right just before the turn, and there is a bakery on the corner that has some great desserts. 2. Before you go, pick up "Puerto Rico day by day," a book from Frommer's. This has an excellent overview of many of the awesome things you can do in Puerto Rico, and some pretty good maps for getting around, especially in Old San Juan. 3. If you're going to stay at this resort, you will need a rental car to get around. DON'T BOTHER GETTING THE RENTAL CAR FROM THE RESORT, instead reserve a car online and pick it up from the airport when you get in. I used Budget rent-a-car, and regretted it. On the one hand, we knew ahead of time that things move more slowly in Puerto Rico, so I was ready to wait in some lines, but on the other hand my wife and I waited for quite a while for the shuttle from the airport (which picks you up just outside from the baggage claim area) to take us to the rental place, and then we waited OVER AN HOUR AND A HALF while one person behind the counter (very slowly) helped all of the people in front of us. Also, they never answer their phones. Get a rental car, but avoid Budget. Other tips for the rental car: a. Don't assume that your TOM TOM GPS will work here in Puerto Rico. I brought mine and it was useless everywhere except near the coast. I ended up using my iPhone for directions everywhere, which worked pretty well (I had a great signal almost everwhere we went). If you don't have an iPhone, it's worth paying for the GPS addition to your rental car. b. I consider myself VERY LUCKY to have not gotten into a car accident in Puerto Rico...those people do not drive safely AT ALL. Nearly every vehicle you see has damage from car accidents. I saw one guy driving backwards the wrong way on the freeway at about 40 mph to get back to an off-ramp that he had missed. No one uses blinkers. If you get a rental car and you don't buy the extra insurance so that you are completely free of liability in the event of an accident, you are nuts! c. Budget rentals (and probably all of the others) come with an easypass sticker in the window so that you can breeze through toll booths. Traffic moves pretty fast through the toll booths, I recommend just bringing a bunch of quarters and dollar bills with you and not even using the easypass (you get charged per day that you use it AND per use...not worth it). d. When you inspect the car upon pickup, make sure to mark EVERY LITTLE SCRATCH. I didn't have any accidents, but if I did I would have been very glad that I was meticulous during my inspection. e. If you have USAA insurance, go through the USAA website to rent your car...you get certain perks, like unlimited mileage. 4. Gran Melia vs. Sol Melia - Stay at the Sol Melia Vacation Club, not the Gran Melia Resort. Why? Because at Gran Melia you don't get a kitchenette, and they actually prevent you from bringing outside food into your room, so you are forced to either travel to eat, or pay lots of money for their not-so-good food (so I heard...we didn't actually try it). Also, people who stay at Gran Melia have to have $16/day to park their cars, but Sol Melia people park for free. Also, you get access to some ammenities (VIP room, etc) that Gran Melia people don't. So save a lot of money on this stuff by staying at Sol Melia. 5. People complain about the beach here, that it's too rocky and what-not. In truth, it's not the "white sandy" beach that you see on Caribbean postcards, and you won't swim in the water here, but if you want to hang out on beach chairs as the sun sets in a tropical setting, this is the place. If you get a rental car, it's not much of a drive to the post card beaches. 6. Things you must do while you're here: a. BIO BAY TOUR. I highly recommend the tour to Mosquito Bay in Vieques...yes it's a bit of a trek, and yes it's a little expensive, but it's a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity. Here is the website for the company we used, which was awesome http://eastwindcats.com/. In one evening you'll take a catamaran to Vieques, a taxi (van) to a restaurant, eat good Puerto Rican food, a VERY BUMPY bus ride to the bio bay, a pontoon to the middle of the bay, you swim in the water (AWESOME, but be aware that it is the ocean..one girl got stung by a jellyfish, no big deal), and then they take you back. They have a military discount of 10% b. Visit Old San Juan c. Visit El Junque d. Take a drive down the eastern side of the island down route 3, stopping at beautiful beaches that you see along the way. Go all the way down to Yabucoa and see some of the Colonial architecture there. Plan on getting lost, because the streets are a little difficult to navigate in Yabucoa. Then, if you are a good driver, purchased the top-notch rental insurance, and are not weak-hearted, drive back north through the rainforest on PR-191...ABSOLUTELY AMAZING! Twisted roads, and some of the steepest driveways in existence. Again, people drive crazy, so you'll have to be very careful. I highly recommend a Puerto Rico Vacation, and I highly recommend Gran Melia (but moreso Sol Melia)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place.”
Reviews.Author: frny1
Reviews.Content: My Family and I had a wonderful time at the hotel. We stayes at the Royal Service Ocean Front Junior Suites with whirlpool. It is diffently worth the upgrade, you get private check in and check out. The service was excellent. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that I know.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing scenery, 1st class service, sheer relaxation.”
Reviews.Author: arroyom28
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for our honeymoon, our busy itinerary dwindled to nothing, we quickly found that all of the rest and relaxation we desired could be found within the confines of this amazing property. The list of possible actvities and dining opportunities near the resort are endless, but we preferred the amazing service and cordial staff over traveling from the resort. We had an oceanfront suite w/ royal service and our butler certainly made us feel as such. Highly recommend, we are purchasing a Gran Melia vacation package and look froward to frequenting this and other Gran Melia resorts worldwide.

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful Resort , Picture Perfect, and the Friendliest Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Jazzy72003
Reviews.Content: We have a business convention every two years and this year was at the Gran Melia Golf Resort in Puerto Rico. What a beautiful resort, the views are fantastic, right on the water, footsteps to the beach. The location was perfect, the rooms are very high quality, they look just as the website shows, they are quiet rooms, you get a peaceful rest, the price is right on, and the service is outstanding. I felt like I came to know the people that worked there, they became like friends. I highly recommend this resort to any person traveling to Puerto Rico. I've traveled all around the United States on business and pleasure and this resort is a class act worth seeing!! It's definitely an A++ resort.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: MoniciaEchols
Reviews.Content: The property was breath taking. the staff members were always accomidating and friendly. This by far is the best resort we have ever stayed at. There was pleanty of activities to do not only at the resort but the resort had the means to get you any place in Puerto Rico you wanted to go. I will defenately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Pampered Vacation”
Reviews.Author: gdq
Reviews.Content: Gran Melia was beautiful, luxurious and fun. The staff was excellent, especially Richard at the Royal Services pool, Luisa at Royal Services. The bartenders Louis, Freddy mix great drinks. Angel and Jamina Alvarez made moving in and booking transport easy. Everyone was gracious. I would highly recommend this resort if you want to get away and just relax.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: cardcadie
Reviews.Content: From the minute we pulled up this place stood out. Clean, friendly, quiet, beautiful. We stayed for five nights with two teens and had a blast. The location is a bit out of the way, but once your on the island you'll be happy it is. Not all that far from all the key points on the eastern part of the island. As for the resort. It's clean, the staff is friendly and quick to help you anyway they can. The rooms are beautiful, clean, quiet, and very comfortable. The grounds, the pools, the layout..I have to say I read a few reviews that were somewhat dated and they didn't paint the picture I got while I was there. Those reviews were just dead WRONG. This place was GREAT and I want to stay there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Resort with beautiful grounds, well appointed rooms, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: juankaPuertoRico
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed in this property on April 2010. We were assigned a well kept bungalow facing a not so nice construction site. As we were not satying long times in the room, this was not an issue. What also helped is that there was no construction noise due that it was a long weekend. The grounds are well kept and the pools are of enormous proportions. As per the cleanliness and maintenance of the pools, it can be improved. But they were more than acceptable. The beach is unusable as it is way too rocky. If you want a nice beach you will have to drive to Luquillo beach and it is about 15 minutes away. As per the food service, we only ate at Cafe Soleil, that's why I am not going to comment on the other restaurants. The breakfast selection was broad with many selections both cold and hot. As for the lunch, the selection was poor and with few choices. But on the other hand it was priced fair. I guess that you get what you paid for. Please note that the hotel is isolated and you may need a rental car if you want to go to other nearby attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: robert2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the Gran Melia as guest in a wedding party. We read previous reviews and our experience was consistent with many of those who found this facility lacking in many respects. Staff: Unlike some other reviewers, we found the staff to be friendly and helpful. Food: We dined at the Italian and Puerto Rican restaurants and found the food to be less than mediocre with service delayed more than 2 hours at the Puerto Rican restaurant because of a large wedding party (not ours) and a kitchen that was in disarray (chef yelling at staff). On the other hand, the food at the wedding dinner was outstanding - tasty and beautifully presented so they can do it. The pool snack bar has decent food - including a pretty good salad and burger - at fairly reasonable prices and the market has great lattes.... We did not try breakfast because of the outrageous price. Facilities/grounds: The grounds and common area are attractive but nothing remarkable. The fitness center is very well equipped and the pool is okay but noisy and there is a distinct lack of umbrellas...probably, as at least one reviewer has already noted, because of the desire to rent the cabanas.... The beach is not the best and the nearhore zone is shallow with grass but still fun to wade and you can swim if you just walk out a bit....just be careful of the current.... Kayaks rent at $28/hour!!!!. Unless you are into golf or like to play tennis when it is hot there is really not much to do at the resort. However, visit El Yunque and old San Juan...both great places.... Miscellaneous: You really need to rent a car unless you are there to do nothing or play golf. The hotel posted security to keep guests from bringing in food and coolers...a very bad decision on their part given the lack of reasonable dining options and the remote location of the resort and the absence of easy to find restaurants even in Luquillo.... In summary, much to improve on and much the resort can do to make guests feel more like guests than inmates....

Reviews.Title: “The reviews were too harsh....”
Reviews.Author: CristinaNJ
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to many islands in the caribbean and have stayed at all kinds of nice hotels...big and small, all-inclusive type properties. I booked this hotel, not based on the reviews because they were awful, but because we got an incredible deal. I went expecting the worst but also being open-minded. I am so glad i went through with booking this hotel and did not listen to the reviews. If you are like me, you like luxurious accommodations. Having stayed at many nice caribbean hotels i would rate this on the higher end as far as luxury and cleanliness. The service was above average, which the reviews that i read stated as being some of the worst service. Traveling with my boyfriend whenever a worker saw us taking pics they would stop what they were doing to offer to take one of the two of us. also, it rained a few times and on one occasion a worker gave us his umbrella to use to get back to our room. I cant imagine what people were talking about when it comes to the rooms not being cleaned. ours was cleaned everyday with fresh towels while we were at breakfast. Also, some people said the resort was too big and spread out. I guess these people have not been to many resorts of this size, but it was one of the smaller lay outs that i have stayed at. From the lobby you can see the pool and from the pool you can see the ocean. they do have golf carts going around to drop you off places but i cannot imagine the purpose unless you have special physical needs. Yes the food can be pricey, but it was not anything more than i expected. i am picky when it comes to quality of food and i have to say i enjoyed everything i ate. the pool was not crowded ever, we had our pick of umbrellas and loungers everyday. no need to reserve at 6 am like other resorts i have been to. the beach was fine for us. just enough to splash around in but because of the rocks and reef a few feet out it was difficult to swim around too much or walk the beach. location- far enough from san juan that you feel you are on a secluded island but close enough that you can get to old san juan for the day. it was also a short drive to the rain forest. the reviews i read before booking were so harsh and i could not disagree more. i guess people's expectations differ. i am just glad i went with this property for my stay in PR. It was wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: shellbell09
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia was beautiful, the rooms and all the surroundings are really well taken care of. It is true the beach is sub-par (bring aqua socks for the rocky beach water), but the pool area is woth it. The lay out of the pool is really cool, with built in lounges in the actual pool! The spring break season was soooo crowded... making it difficult to get a spot at the pool. The customer service was excellent and the staff was really friendly and helpful, when needed. There is so much to do in PR, we found renting a car through enterprise on the computer was much better than the one provided at the hotel...much better rates and just easier & friendlier overall. Same, with the tours...we found better tours by calling the places in the brochures. The rain forest is really close by...it is a must! The biobay tour was amazing in luquillo...enchanted island eco tours was the best (if you are worried about the kayaking at night factor...this group was the most organized and safe...the guides were excellent and fun! this is the ONLY bio bay group I would go with after seeing all of them in action)! The worst part of the hotel is the FOOD. Everything was surprisingly American, the breakfast was your usual danish and eggs...but nothing special, no latin flavor. Ritchies restaurant does shuttle service to and from the resort which was good, but renting a car and really going in to PR is the way to go: hit the kioskos (close to hotel), Palmer bakery (near el yunque), and King's Seafood (luquillo). Also, the golf course was beautiful, if you can only do one of the two courses...choose the international one, it is fun and challenging. The casino was small, but fun for a short amount of time. Overall, great hotel and amazing vacation spot!

Reviews.Title: “family reunion”
Reviews.Author: anatal418
Reviews.Content: I want to thank ED O NEAL he was outstanding, gave us a tour andgreat. he treat my family like his own..very outstanding young man. gran meliashould be proud of ED. . ALSO THANKS TO ROBERT FOR ALL HIS HELP WHAT A GREAT TEAM. thank you angel natal

Reviews.Title: “Poorly maintained. Money could be better spent elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: WishIVacationedMore
Reviews.Content: Went for a romantic trip with my spouse in January. We were initially floored by the beauty of the main building and even our room, but almost off the bat we noticed a bunch of problems with the room. Our toilet flusher handle was broken, meaning the toilet flushed, but the handle itself had cracked and was missing a piece. This is something room service should have noticed immediately and had repaired before we even checked in, but clearly, they are not concerned with details. Though we called and told them that the toilet handle was broken shortly after checking in, no one came until we called a second time that evening, when the toilet flusher broke entirely and a repairman had to be sent to the room. The minibar was not full at check-in either, something that also should have been done before we got into the room. We had a beautiful balcony outside our room, with crappy plastic chairs on it, and I mean crappy in both the literal and figurative senses. There are these small black birds everywhere in the resort--everywhere--and while this could enhance the overall tropical experience, the fact that EVERYTHING is covered in a layer of bird [--] really takes away from it. We stepped out on the balcony all of once, only to step back in since the bird droppings were everywhere. The pool is phenomenally gorgeous and huge, but again, bird [--]everywhere. Choosing which lounge chair to sit on means selecting the one with the fewest white streaks on the brown fabric. This is clearly a major issue at the resort, and if the owners cared about guest experience, they would have people on staff whose sole purpose is to go around wiping down the various surfaces where the droppings accumulate. While this seems silly, it is either that or find a way to get rid of the birds. Personally, I think that hiring [--] wipers would be easier. The pool table, which is right near the pool, is covered in tears in the felt. More hilariously, it is positioned directly between two pillars so that at certain angles, you cannot extend your cue and cannot take certain shots. The resort is bordered by what could be a beautiful beach, only it is entirely not maintained (no exaggeration), so there is seaweed piled up the entire length of the beach. It is also quite rocky. Only my husband was brave enough to wade in. Also, there is no section prepared for bathers, either roped off in the water or with a lifeguard present, so swimming is entirely at your own risk. Overall, our impression was that this must have been phenomenally beautiful when it first opened, but since that time, it appears that no maintenance has been done, so everything is just slightly decrepit, dirty, damaged, etc. Given the cost of rooms here and the fact that they are trying to sell this place as a timeshare property, I was shocked at the low level of maintenance. Basically, if you can get a good deal on your stay, go ahead, but certainly don't pay full price. The staff was helpful throughout our stay. Just don't bother to book any excursions through Dragonfly (a company that has a desk in the lobby), they are hundreds of dollars more than other companies. The concierge can give you a Puerto Rico tourism magazine with companies offering the same trips at far better prices and can even recommend specific vendors in the magazine.

Reviews.Title: “Dreamy”
Reviews.Author: Talon60
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days NOT LONG ENOUGH ! it was beautiful service was wonderful , Puerto Rico has a lot to offer , the only thing i did not like was the fact it was either very poor of very rich . felt sorry for the poor and mostly the dogs , cows and horses , they were not looked after very well . but as for the Resort it was on coco beach the best part I think . looked around the Is;and some , roads not too good and very hard to find were you are the signs are very bad and you can get lost easy .

Reviews.Title: “Fraudulent charging, poor service and food mar great location”
Reviews.Author: Exscientist
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here. THIS HOTEL ENGAGES IN SYSTEMATIC FRAUD. If you do stay here, you will no't have to worry about the following: 1, Bugs - the rooms are clean and there there are very few bugs. 2, Location - close to the rainforest, San Juan, golf, and several great beaches but far enough away to avoid almost all the rain. However, you will need to worry about the following: 1, Food - dreadful! Horribly overpriced, dull, tasteless. Would it kill these people to offer some raisins or nuts with the cereal? How about some fruit that doesn't come out of a can? 2, Billing - not only does this place nickel and dime you (watch out for the compulsory tips that will be added to your bill), but they seem to deliberately overcharge every guest. We spent over an hour checking out this morning as we quibbled over the fact that our room charge was 20 dollars higher than expected. The person in line in front of me had an extra 30 dollars per night to deal with. The person behind me had too many parking chargers. Perhaps the most damning indictment: the front desk staff are "used to it." 3, Pool - loud music, lousy deckchairs, roped-off cabanas (does anyone actually get to use them?), no umbrellas, and hordes of screaming children do not make for a relaxing or fun vacation. So, if you stay here, check your bill daily, don't tip anything, rent a car to eat away from the hotel (Avis has an on-site location, but there are many cheaper options), and leave at least an hour to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Resort”
Reviews.Author: L0v2G0
Reviews.Content: It was extremely nice! The employees were overly helpful in assisting with baggage, touring information, transportation, and just simply accommodating! The resort was clean and the rooms were neatly cleaned daily. Wonderful scenery with pools and the beach! It was also in a great location to travel to different tourist sites! I am definitely planning to return!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort....”
Reviews.Author: madilee513
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we were taken back by the beauty everything was marble the front lobby is all open... and absolutely breath taking! It took about an hour to check in! There was never anyone at the front desk... ever! We booked a ocean view suite and a staff member on a golf cart brought us to a garden suite when i told them we paid for an ocean view suite they gave us a hard time and wanted to see our proof that thats what we paid for!!! We ended up in the rite room... 3 hours later! The room was beautiful but dont think it was cleaned before we got there... I cleaned it with clorox wipes... there was pee all over the toilet...dirty sheets and didnt even have a fitted sheet on the bed... the room smelled musty and moldy the sofa was gross and OLD i didnt even touch it it was all stained ripped and just plain gross! the maid service never cleaned our room the whole time we were there!! The staff was trrrible they were not helpfull...they were always busy talking and joking around with other staff members to care about what we needed... the food tasted microwaved like a frozen meal... and was VERY expensive... the drinks were generic not tropical! The beach is beautiful but rocky and u cant swim in the water cause it ia all grassy sea weed... the pool is awesome! rent a car from avis.... and drive to the end of the road and there is an awesome little sandwich and pastry shop on the rite side of the road rite on the corner...we ate there alot...cheap great food! also don pepe restaurant food is amazing!! visit laquillo beach it is amazing and cheep good food and drinks...I loved Puerto rico and beacuse the resort was so beautiful I would stay there again.... they need to hire better trained staff....and put more effort in to the food...really!

Reviews.Title: “Bad food and drinks”
Reviews.Author: ReisenderCologne
Reviews.Content: All has been said already. The resort looks beautiful. The oceanfront rooms have a breathtaking view through palm trees to the blue ocean. Nice! But the food is very overpriced and rates between okay to terrible. The "tropical drinks" are mixed with cheap alcohol and bottled mixes. They don't use fresh limes or lemons or anything. The service is okay but nothing to brag about. I would assume that there are better resorts for this price on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Staff needs better training and managing”
Reviews.Author: viajero5
Reviews.Content: First the pros: The grounds are beautiful. The pool is great. The views are amazing. The rooms are comfortable, spacious and clean. The cons: The staff seem very poorly trained and/or managed. There was a 25 minute wait to check in. We arrived at about 4 p.m. and our room was not ready until after 5:30. We got a cell phone call saying our room was ready. There was not a soul working the reception desk when we went to get our key cards. The woman in front of me had waited for 25 minutes--I had about a 20 minute wait. The concierge would come by and say that someone should probably be coming at any minute and would offer us water. It was all very strange. The staff were friendly and polite but did not seem to be able to help you. While waiting to check in the receptionist told us we could leave our bags with someone but it took forever to find someone. Later when we went to reclaim them and could not find anyone working in that area, the response was, "I think that guy on the golf cart over there might know about it". On our second day our room was not cleaned until about 4:30 p.m. We were overcharged for parking even after talking to three parking attendants and the front desk. Eventually it was cleared up and the charge refunded but it took a lot of time and effort. My reservation was bungled as well and once again, was cleared up but it took about 3 e-mails and 3 phone calls. Even at a modest motel, the staff has general information but here, each person had no knowledge of the hotel beyond his/her position. They did not know who to direct you to for help. THey were often unable to help you themselves. The concierge was well intentioned, walking around offering water to the people who were standing in line to check in but didn't seem to know how to find any receptionists to help. Even a roadside motel does not leave the front desk unoccupied for periods of up to 30 minutes. I wasn't at all angry, just mystified that such a nice looking place would be so poorly run. I can't imagine that they get any return business. The parking fee seemed excessive too--it's a huge property with tons of land. I'm willing to pay to park in crowded city centers but it seemed ridiculous to pay $16.00/day to park on this huge property. Even trying to find a tea bag was a fiasco. The concierge didn't know, didn't know who to direct you to. Three girls in the restaurant seemed perplexed by this request. I hope they get some sort of management or training in place as this could be a really nice place.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise, and a private escape”
Reviews.Author: Dichie55
Reviews.Content: When deciding to book a trip to Puerto Rico, we obviously based our trip on the initial value, ease of travel, and amenities. First, no customs from the U.S. is amazing. Second, This hotel pins you just outside the busy city life of San Juan, amidst a perfect paradise, and has every amenity that you could wish for in a resort. It is breathtaking as you approach the hotel grounds. Do note that walking is plentiful and even trips from the room to the pools, or rooms to bar/casino/lobby/restaurants can be a bit of work. I ABSOLUTELY insist that you rent a car if you are staying here and plan on doing any of the excursions outside of the hotel. Third, The Royal Service is worth EVERY PENNY! They treated us much better, and it added the few extras that proved to be the total difference-maker in our trip (Such as the beachfront room with a jacuzzi on the balcony). The private pool for Royal Service is great, but not to take away from the enormous pool for the general public. Lastly, to all that can make the trip.....fly the $60 prop planes to Culebra Island, and Zoni beach. Flamenco beach is worth seeing...but Zoni is the hidden gem. Get ready for this hotel to get much more crowded. Trump has the J.W. Marriot going up right next door and will likely add 2-3 times more people on the beaches that were comfortable, at best. But it will add a high profile to the grounds. Give and take. Wow. Alot to read....but trust me on this one folks. Worth it. Cheers RD&ED

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation at Gran Melia Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: travelerllz
Reviews.Content: There are quite a few (mixed) reviews out there on this resort. If you do a little research beforehand, you'll have the right expectations going in. We did so and were very pleased with the resort and our stay. We were fortunate to exchange our timeshare from another excellent provider and stay at this resort. Hotel, hotel villas and the timeshare units are all on the same property. The timeshare accommodations were outstanding. Ocean front room on 3rd floor. Pretty room, large, comfortable, trendy, marble floors and bath, granite kitchen counter. Kitchen area a bit smaller than other full kitchen timeshares, but completely sufficient and nice (although kitchen utensils - knives in partic - need to be replaced). Beautiful bath. (No wireless in room though, only 1 hardline...no charge to use it. Wireless avail poolside and central areas). Check in and out for timeshare was great on service and information, but there was a bit of a wait/line. Once you got there was great - Luis in particular was great help and very accommodating. Plusses: - Large resort /grounds- plenty of space for everyone. If you like to be around people, plenty of pool seating. If you like a quite, private area where you can be alone and read or whatever, there are ample opportunities (with shade or sun) - loved this aspect of the resort. (Some other reviewers complained of distance to walk to things - we did not have bad experience in this regard. Struck me that if we were staying in San Juan hotel, which we have before, we would not have nearly the expanse of grounds or opportunity for some degree of privacy/distance from other guests). - Very nice lobby, bar areas - all open air. (No issues with mosquitos, flies, etc). - Sunrise or sunset views - from different points on the grounds. A fellow guest spoke of getting up early and walking beach to eastern edge of resort to watch the sunrise. Sunset was visible right from the shore along poolside or otherwise. - Serene natural beach/foliage - it's true that there is no soft sand beach and no real waves. The ocean area here is different. It is naturally as it should be - and likely has an important ecosystem relationship with the rainforest nearby. There are palm trees, pines and other trees growing right up to the shore in some places, and providing nice natural shade areas - you can pull up a chaise and not even need an umbrella. There are iguanas around the property and beach from time to time - fun to look at, especially for the kids - and they don't bother anyone. And birds too. Anyone who cares about the environment will appreciate the natural beauty and serenity here. Amazing too how clean the grounds were considering size of the property. No trash washed up on the beach, etc. (There are a couple of nice beaches down in Luquillo/Fajardo areas and can enjoy the beach scene there). - Nice spot for younger teenagers - there were quite a few of them at the resort with their families, and they found each other and "hung out" - safely within the grounds of the resort. On one hand, would have been quite boring for teens on their own because the resort is a bit out of the way, but because there were so many there turned out to be a blast - they all seemed to meet up (it was Spring Break week, so may have been more teens than normal due to this). Lots of families with young children also, and other demographics. Worked well for all. - Proximity to El Yunque rainforest. Great excursion, and free. La Mina Falls trail to swimming in pond at the bottom of falls, or hike up to El Yunque peak above the clouds. - Proximity to Fajardo and ferries/planes to Vieques or Culebra islands. Minuses - Hard pillows for sleeping. Not sure if true for all rooms, but true for ours. Other - Can't comment on the food at restaurants except breakfast. Got the buffet. $16 for cold foods and $23 for all in buffet - decent, nothing spectacular, not as bad as some of the reviews sounded. Not out of line with other resorts of this level. Resort must be listening and improving the offering. Also, hotel gift shop offered ham & cheese croissants and muffins, yogurt and a few other items. Did not eat lunch or dinner at the resort - kids did and said was ok. There is a small local place down Rte 3 - just near the intersection where you turn left for Rio Mar resort - called Don Pepe's. Great local food there - eat in or take out. Also down at Luquillo at the Kiosks - some local folks recommended Kiosk #60 - the last one on the far end - and it was "the best". Go for lunch and order among these "frituras": Rellenos de Papa (potato stuffed with a ground beef filling), Empanadillas (pastry filled with meat , chicken, or shrimp), Acapuria con Carne (green banana mash stuffed with ground beef filling), bacalaitos (cod fish fritter),...and yellow rice and beans. All are outstanding. Careful - the kiosks can get jam packed on weekend evenings...avoid them then). - Nightlife - not much to speak of at the hotel or nearby - at least on weeknights - and San Juan is quite a distance away. Gran Melia has decent DJ music at pool, lobby bar and lounge and does have live music of various types nightly - but it's not a big party scene, if you're looking for that. (We did largely miss the Friday/Saturday night on both ends of our trip. Seemed like they had a live band/dance plan for Saturday).

Reviews.Title: “Pretty resort under poor management”
Reviews.Author: NYCtraveller50
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 day "girls' " trip to the Gran Melia. The positives: 1) Great weather 2) Spacious rooms 3) Pretty lobby area The negatives: 1) Food: I think the best way to sum it up was the response we got from the concierge when we asked which hotel restaurant he would recommended: "None of them." In brief, the restaurants had limited menus of mediocre quality ingredients and WAY overpriced (and I am a New Yorker used to hefty prices). Service was slow and the staff was disinterested, also taking down the experience. And, to add insult to injury, even the tropical drinks were a DISAPPOINTMENT (boxed mixes; cheap liquor). 2) Service: The staff was friendly, but gave the distinct impression that they (a) didn't want to be there and (b) beyond doing the minimum to meet job requirements, didn't care what your experience was/what happened to you. Examples: we were excited to book the bioluminesence bay trip. When we went to inquire, we were told not enough people had signed up, but ours would be the first name on the list and they would call us if more people signed up. The next day, we went to check and were told the trip was sold out. And no, we weren't on the list. She didn't know what happened; said sorry with a "too bad" attitude; and that was her customer service. Another day we had to call to get standard room clean when no one came by 4:30pm. At the restaurants, they would tell you there was an hour and a 1/2 wait for a table despite several empty tables in view; when we went back to inquire an hour later with the same tables empty, she said "I guess" she could seat us. I imagine that people with reservations didn't show, but her lack of attention to the list/management of tables was so standard for GM. 3) Lack of ammenities; lounge chairs at pool were lower standard than your typical chairs; they had a strict towel rental policy (which were not always available), which seemed cheap for a resort. Low-end toiletries in the bathroom; cheap sheets/furniture in the room. No "extras" anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “More bad than good”
Reviews.Author: waverrunner
Reviews.Content: It started on arrival (11:30am Tues) we waited for 45 min with 1 person working behind the desk and 10 guests waiting to check-in. At the very last 2 others showed up and completed the last 2 people in quick time. No water one day during our stay. Front desk kept saying 1 more hour for about 5 hours. We finally were offered to take a cold shower in the spa, community style. I arrived with several in front of me and only 2 showers. Food was average but very expensive. If you are going, get the child's plate for lunch at the pool. It is pleenty. It is a turkey wrap and a salad for $5.50. The typical salad was 12 and a burger with fries was 15. In Cafe Soliel, breakfast was 16 for the cold and 23 for the hot. The scrambled eggs on the buffet were cold, so be sure and order from the omelet station if the line is not too long. Pool towels must be returned or your room will be charged. Our business meeting had catered meals for the evening, but our group ran out of everything most nites before the lines were completed. They did not refill. It forced some to scrounge for rolls to have something. The continental breakfasts were refilled but only after the coordinators called the office and complained. The tour business is definately the only option that the conceierge will offer. No matter what your question or insistance on some other choices. Taxi front San Juan airport was $65 for 2 and they charge per person. As stated, the rooms are nice, but the rest is over priced. Most employees needed to be interupted and asked for help before you got assistance. The shore is all rocky,, the beach is flat but but is uncomfortable without water shoes or sandals. The water is not clear, about 5 ft visability. The bottom is all grass, so a walk in the water is no fun. No snorkling on the beach. You must "take a Tour". The hotel offered free internet at the lobby, but most of the time they did not work. When the staff was asked, they just shrugged.

Reviews.Title: “Would never go back”
Reviews.Author: hamana
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at Gran Melia. Before going, we'd been under the impression that we were going to an "all inclusive" resort. Far far from it. Instead, the staff had their hands out every turn, even to tricking you to leave larger tips by "not having any more change." They never let us know that two reasonably large towns were a short cab drive away (I forgot my sneakers and could have bought a pair at a local Walmart!), instead leading you to believe you had to take a $2% cab to San Juan. Our room was .3 miles from the center of activities, so that in any normal day, we had to walk in the blazing sun 2 miles back and forth to our activities. My feet, from having forgot my sneakers, were covered in blisters and this from normally very comfortable sandals. One evening before dinner, the water went out and I had to walk the .6 miles to and from the spa to get a shower before dinner. Around the pool, they had about one umbrella per 10 chairs - this to force you to rent at $50 a day a shade "bed." One piece of sushi at the Asian restaurant was $7. We loved our maid for her personality, but she didn't clean too well. Instead of this place, spend your money on Breezes or Sandals.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like we stayed on a cruise ship”
Reviews.Author: decembergirl5
Reviews.Content: Lovely property on the surface, but it felt like we were on a cruise ship - 2 restaurants for dinner - Italian and Asian. Strange, no authentic PR food. Piped in coqui sounds - you only hear them in the main building and not by your room. Not much of a beach here either. This is not the place to see the lovely people. On the positive side, the breakfast buffet included with our Royal Service room was wonderful and we didn't think that alcohol was that expensive either. The staff was LOVELY. If you're going to El Yunque, stay here for a night or 2, but then move on. We had a nice time, but wouldn't return.

Reviews.Title: “Went beyond our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: beverlyBailey
Reviews.Content: After reading the mixed reviews we were not sure what to expect. We have done extensive travel and stayed at diverse accommodations and found the Gran Melia to exceed our expectations. Upon arrival at midnight we had no problem getting our villa and asked for extra blankets. The blankets came within minutes with a follow-up call to make sure we were comfortable. The resort offered areas for peace and quiet as well as places to celebrate life. We appreciated the natural beauty of the beaches as well as the feeling that we were in paradise with the resort decor. Tranquil and elegant at the same time. My husband found the golf convenient and I loved the spa. We liked the sophisticated romantic ambience without the fake showiness. We appreciated not being heckled to buy drinks or trinkets. We also felt secure walking alone after dark. After taking day trips we would joke as a family that we were returning to paradise or heaven and why did we even leave the resort at all. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Something ugly about this place”
Reviews.Author: ERigby818
Reviews.Content: First of all, the Gran Melia is way too isolated and you need a rental car to get there. If you like to be isolated and plan to spend a lot of time there, great. If you want to explore, find some place more accessible. It has a gorgeous pool and grounds, I'll give it that, and I'm sure it's great if you're into golf and/or gambling, but I'm not. The whole area is under construction (no disclaimers, apologies for this) and I had a lovely view of bulldozers from my room. And the restaurants are so overpriced that I refused to eat there except for breakfast, which was a huge mistake. They charge you 23 dollars for the breakfast buffet! Not knowing this, I helped myself to some fruit (from their unimpressive selection) a bite of dry, cold terrible scrambled eggs and a half a piece of toast, and was poured a glass of oj from concentrate! For that price I would expect fresh. Nothing you could have for breakfast there is worth 23 dollars per person. Yes, this place is luxurious but I found it slightly tacky. My room was ok, but I don't like blasting AC and every time I was gone someone would come in and crank it so it felt like a fridge when I walked in. I really wanted to unwind at the spa but it has very limited hours (10-6) and I didn't even get to go. There was a concierge there named Miguel who was incredibly helpful and gave me fantastic guidelines for exploring old San Juan at night. This place would get two stars from me, but I give it an extra one for him because he was cool.

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely grounds, spacious rooms and above average food”
Reviews.Author: Tennismaven56
Reviews.Content: We had wonderful weather which always helps make the place seem great. The beach is tough to walk on or to go to. It is very rocky. The rooms were very large. We stayed in the Royal Service and it was very lovely. The butlers were very attentive, especially Angel! I noticed that he never wore a hat and I asked him why and he said that they are NOT ALLOWED! I found that terrible with the heat and sun baking on you all day long. I think they should consider reevaluating this rule for their employees. Food was above average. The service was a bit slow but not terrible, especially since we were on vacation. Very clean. All bathrooms in the lobbies and by the pools were immaculate. Overall- I would go back there with my family

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag. Hold your wallet close.”
Reviews.Author: mtnlvr1946
Reviews.Content: The location and public areas are spectacular, even opulent in looks. But the service, as noted by others, leaves a lot to be desired. Plenty of staff were all around, but no one seemed to be in charge. Guests (including lots of children) had the run of the place and at times it felt like a cheap Las Vegas place. The good: The place is beautiful, the room more than adequate, the location is fine if you have a car. The bad: The rugs in the room were filthy, no refrigerator space, patio "furniture" consisted of 2 cheap plastic chairs, the pool is open from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. (making it totally useless if you have day activities or want to swim without the beating sun), no jacuzzi, the beach is tiny and rocky, ice was in short supply, restaurants are way overpriced for mediocre food and poor service, the high prices for food in the market are not marked. We were given a handicapped room without being told by the desk clerk, which meant no tub. We should have been given the option. It was tough to get help with local sights or restaurants without buying the tour packages they were selling. Everywhere we went in the resort it felt as if they just wanted our money but didn't care whether we experienced the real Puerto Rico. The $16 per day to park on a hot surface lot far, far from the room was outrageous. The total experience was not what we generally have in a resort, especially one that bills itself at such a high level. It did not meet our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “A satisfactory stay”
Reviews.Author: Seasonedtraveler100
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia resort was nice. The common areas were beautiful. We enjoyed our stay. All the staff we interacted with were welcoming and friendly. We rented from the on-site Avis car agency so we didn't have to pay for parking. That saved us $15/day. The Avis rental desk at the resort was very slow. Virtually every time we passed by, there was a line. Their computer was down both times we went to the desk. The service was friendly but frazzled. People do need to know that the Avis lot is a little bit of a walk (but not too bad...maybe .2 miles from the lobby?) but it is not that much farther than the hotel parking lot. The resort is quite spread out and at night it is not well lit. Depending on where your room is, you could be walking over 1/4 mile to get from your room to the restaurants/pool/etc. There are golf cart drivers frequenting the area to give rides to resort guests, but they aren't always around when you want a ride. Families with young children may want to bring a lightweight stroller just to get around the resort! Our stroller came in handy with our younger son, who got tired of walking several times. As a side note, the stroller also came in handy in Old San Juan. A large stroller would be a pain to navigate down the streets of Old San Juan, but a portable/small stroller would be fine. The pool area was excellent! There are 4 pools at the resort. One is a separate kiddie pool for babies - maybe 1' deep. Another is the main resort pool, which is a huge pool shaped like an amoeba. Within the huge pool, there are several parts that are very shallow - families can take their pick from at least 3 different areas of the pool that are shallow (anywhere from 12 inches or so up to 3 feet deep). There is no water slide, and there are no hot tubs or jacuzzis in the pool area - only jetted sections of the pool. There is a 3rd pool which is for Royal Service guests only and is strictly for adults. Finally there is a pool at the spa (I did not try the spa). The resort has some Bali Beds by the pool which are very nice but cost $50 to rent all day. There are iguanas all over the resort grounds, including the pool area. One of the photos in the attached link is of an iguana by my pool chair. We ate at the Cafe Soleil every day for breakfast. They only have buffet breakfasts available - no breakfast menu. Since we had the Royal Service upgrade, we had complimentary continental breakfast. For an extra $7 per person, we could add hot breakfast items. Dining options at the resort are fairly limited. The pool bar is open only till 6 pm - it serves sandwiches, burgers, and salads. There is an Asian restaurant, an Italian restaurant, and a native Puerto Rican restaurant, but I never saw all 3 of them open at the same time. The room itself was comfortable and spacious. It had a separate sitting area. We had a Royal Service room which was in one of the closer buildings to the main resort area. The room decor and overall feel was nice...marble vanities, nice bedding. The maid needed constant reminding to stock our room with 4 towels, since we are a family of 4. I had to call for extra towels more than once. Another downside was that the rooms do not have fridges other than the hotel mini-bar refrigerators. There are no microwaves in the room either. The mini-bar refrigerator is not intended to be used to store guests' personal items, and if you remove their mini-bar items to make room for your things, you will be charged for the mini-bar items even if they are not consumed. I had been forewarned about this from reading reviews online, so I avoided the entire issue by bringing a portable cooler and using that to store our drinks during our vacation. There are a few central ice machines located around the resort. It would have been nice to have an ice machine in each building; as it was I had to walk maybe 1/8 of a mile to get ice each time we needed it. It wasn't far, but at night the resort is poorly lit. I brought my own ethernet cable and was very glad I did, because otherwise I would have had to pay $15 at the desk to rent one. Their wireless service was extremely slow. Families who stay at the Gran Melia should know that there is a beach but it is very rocky and there is a lot of seaweed. The good news is that nice beaches are very close. Luquillo Beach is 15 minutes away, and Seven Seas Beach (in Fajardo) is 20-25 minutes away. We went to Seven Seas beach and it was gorgeous. For some reason though it seems there were no public services although it was a public beach...there were no lifeguards even though there were lifeguard stands, there was no running water in the bathrooms (so the toilets wouldn't flush), and there was barely any toilet paper. The Gran Melia resort's shuttle service leaves something to be desired - the van they use has no working seat belts so I had no way of securing my children's car seats, and the guy who picked us up at San Juan airport drove like a maniac.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Resort”
Reviews.Author: latinag67
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at the Gran Melia PR enjoyed our stay both times. We enjoyed time spent at the pool,and beach. We recommend dining off the resort the restaurants on the resort aren't that good and overly priced. The wet bar food was great for lunch just a little over priced. We also had to pay for parking daily which was expensive.The Gran Melia staff were all great very helpful, courteous and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated, priced & lacking in service & choices for food - would not recommend or return”
Reviews.Author: Manytripstogo
Reviews.Content: We have definitely learned to do your own homework on choice of accommodations - After a fab cruise we wanted to go flake out by a beach & maybe get in a round of golf or two... We were led to believe that "our all inclusive" with a notation on the "price" difference being the major variation from a true all inclusive... The our suite was spacious no doubt however for a hotel only opened since 2005 there were several cracks throughout the tiled floor & obvious signs of mold starting in the bathroom... The lovely smell of which hit us as soon as our door was opened... When we complained they sent an employee with a bottle of Febreeze (or product similar) to spray down the room ??? We were also told t he smell was humidity ??? We are both experienced travellers and have been in many climates with even more humidity and "THERE IS A DIFFERENCE" - We were shown to an alternate room only with no view, so we elected to stay put... Each day we had to ask for coffee for our room & facecloths... Coffe pot or tables were not wiped down until our 4th day... Sadly we did not experience the service we thought a high priced resort would automatically provide... I noted a comment on the beach - THERE IS NO BEACH!!!!! We took a video of their beach & again for the swanky place it all appears - you can't walk out more then 3' max and then you are in seaweed (YUCK) and then there are the boulders - hard to even walk along the beach (which is more like crushed gravel - no bare foot walking there!!!).... The restuarants are very over priced, however the service was much better then the housekeeping department... Selection disappointing in relation to how big the resort is.... Chlorine system in pools seemed to consist of large buckets of same placed in the bottom and once you finished a dip you had to get a shower.... It is a big resort and the Donald Trump Golf Course (as per hubby) was excellent... I know that is where I had my most favorite meal which was reasonably priced... Thank god we did rent a car (boy they have you over the barrel in that regard also) so we could escape and were able to see other areas of Puerto Rico, not enough to ever go back .... Sad but true Dale & Donna Werner

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, would go again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: Parisa63
Reviews.Content: We loved the Gran Melia. While it is not the Ritz Carlton, it was a very nice resort with all that we needed for a short vacation to PR in February with our two young daughters (ages 6 and 9). We loved the bungalows and the fact you are not located right on top of the pool. The pool was expansive and clean, but we never used it. We spent our day at the tiny beach which was perfect for our girls who are not strong swimmers. There were lots of shells and it was very calm. (If you are looking for great expanse of beach with crashing waves, this is not the beach for you!). The outdoor cafe for lunch and drinks was good and affordable. The restaurants for dinner were excellent and priced for what one would expect at a resort ($25-30 entrees). They were accommodating with our children and offered selections tailored for them. We were surprised at how good the Asian and the Italian restaurants were. The lobby and bars were pretty and the complex very pleasant. We found the staff all helpful and friendly. The only thing we did not like was breakfast. For the four of us it was $60; it was always cold, the service poor and just not very tasty. The last two days when we had a rental car we went to a bakery at the end of the road and had donuts and coffee for $11! If you rent a car you can easily get to the rainforest or Old San Juan which was a great day trip. The other piece of advice someone gave us upon our check in (because the hotel doesn't tell you this) is book your dinners either when you make the reservation or when you just get there. You can always cancel, but otherwise you might find you can't get a table until 9:30pm. This is especially true on weekends. Our only "bad" experience was upon checkout. It was pouring rain and it took the bellman 45 minutes to get us with our luggage and the front desk was rude every time we called for an update. Other than that, the overall experience was excellent and affordable and we would definitely go back again. Oh, and don't pay for the $15 internet cable until you are sure you need it. We bought it at check in, but then found we picked up the WiFi without it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly wonderful”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaTinTin
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort, VERY LARGE, wonderful service. incredible pool. impeccably clean. friendliest staff. it was so nice, we never left the resort! would definitely stay here again. in fact, would stay at any Gran Melia. can't be beat! There are four restaurants on the property. All very nice but the Italian place was incredible. The food delicious but more importantly the service was off the charts thanks to Tamara, the head chef. This beautiful woman took such good care of me. i have a lot of food restrictions and she went out of her way to prepare me something special. this was not an expensive meal. she made me a garden salad and perfectly steamed spinach, so this was not about making a lot of bucks for the restaurant. But still, she visited my table to get a clear picture of what i could eat and then visited again after my perfect meal to make sure i was satisfied. i was VERY IMPRESSED. please visit Tamara at the Italian restaurant. her talent is matched by her graciousness. thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, secluded and bring your own snacks”
Reviews.Author: ald656
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on here; my three friends and I were expecting a mixed experience - but were very pleasantly surprised!! As many reviewers have said, YOU MUST RENT A CAR! We found it invaluable as the food/entertainment options at the resort are very limited. We found the staff to be friendly and so kind! We were 4 in a room - and the maids made up our sofa bed neatly and left extra towels daily. We were approached only once by the condo sales pitch team and even after we agreed to go on the tour (for a free spa services, which we received promptly ) - they were very hesitant to take us through the presentation and not pushy at all. However, we were single girls, and I suspect they would rather target couples. As others have said, the casino and nightlife are nil - but the resort itself is very beautiful and relaxing. The Spa was top notch; beautiful, clean and very luxurious with steam, sauna and whirlpools etc - and very affordable as were given coupons from our bellman and the concierge. I would say my biggest disappointment was the food. We found the restaurant choices to be pretty awful. There was Asian, Italian and allegedly a Puerto Rican restaurant (but the 5 days we were there, including a weekend, it never appeared open). The food was about $23 an entree but for being in a resort - it was expected. We heard there was only buffet options for breakfast and lunch (about $29) so we never did that. We went to the bakery down the street for coffee (but the only breakfast takeway options were donuts!) and ate at Don Pepes, several of the Kioskos and seafood restaurants in Luquillo. Overall, I was disappointed. ALOT of fried food, mashed fried plantains and fried fish. Being on an island, I was hoping for fresh fruit and fresh veggies - but I can say with 100% honestly - I did not eat one piece of fresh fruit or vegetable while there (I snagged a mealy apple from the spa - the only place I saw fruit at the Melia). This resort is perfect for relaxing by the pool and is well-situated to beaches and the rainforest - you just may want to leave ffor meals/entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Too spread out”
Reviews.Author: snickerjam
