Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are very far from pools and cafe. I have to say the service was excellent. The food was overpriced. No options unless you want to leave. The beach is bad it has lots of rocks. Decor is nice. Gift shop overpriced. Many other places to stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: SammiDad
Reviews.Content: We signed up for the Royal Service package. What a good choice. We had private check-in and out. Enjoyed cocktail hours each day plus a continental breakfast each morning. We particularly enjoyed the "adult only" pool which was very relaxing. And we had the privilege of internet access in the Royal Service lounge. The service at Gran Melia is the best. The staff was so welcoming, courteous and helpful. We didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “I think I can present both sides...PROs & CONs”
Reviews.Author: alanbones
Reviews.Content: Decided to spend vacation there based on attractive rate for listening to an entire morning presentation to buy a club membership. PROs: Scenic, nice pool, nice rooms...some helpful staff (if you complain enough)...quiet...if you go on vacation to be isolated CONs: RESTAURANTS (Pasion) terrible and wayyyyyy over priced. Was so hungry after day of travel, decided to treat myself to $38 steak...it was the quality of Sports Bar $12.95 gristle-filled cut. NO bread at table...Soups came in crocks HALF-filled (for $12 each) and no crackers of course. Chicken dishes were $30...Lobster was $64... Others confirmed Italian restaurant was like Ragu sauce an i did not visit Asian place. SERVICE: Slow but so are most islands. Maid left door open one day AND SOMEONE TOOK SOMETHING FROM MINI-BAR (i did get credit after 2 rounds of complaining) NIGHT LIFE: ZERO ACTIVITIES & MUSIC SCHEDULE: essentially fabricated and misleading.. CASINO: DISAPPOINTING 2 blackjack tables, roulette wheel and a few slots...NO CRAPS PARKING: $16/day!!! GOLF: $180!!! Good thing i had a car to visit outside restaurants and drive to san juan casinos....or else i would have considered i was in high-class prison...

Reviews.Title: “Open air lobby is spectacular with tons of places to have comfortable conversations”
Reviews.Author: RRRoss
Reviews.Content: Bring your suntan lotion....The ocean views are incredible with plenty of lounge chairs. The pool is clean and has places for everyone to lounge, adults, teenagers and children. The staff is extra friendly and making every effort for their guests to have a comfortable stay. The rooms are spacious, clean, modern with oceanfront type interiors, ....Many activities for every age group.....Beach, pool, sitting lounge areas, yoga, pilates, three restaurants, outdoor game area for teenagers, covered pool lounge areas, outdoor pool bar, tennis...etc. If possible upgrade to "Royal Club" met allot of nice people in the evening lounge, free wine and Champaign. Itâ€™s Great way to have an Excellent Vacation. Hope to go back soon. RR & KM

Reviews.Title: “REALLY BAD EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: updil93
Reviews.Content: The service at this resort is horrible!! There were 3 of us who stayed at a garden view deluxe junior suite garden view and we asked for 3 sets of towels and additional coffee condiments on our first night. You'd think they would know to keep on doing that every time they clean our room but we ended up calling room service every night after coming back from the pool. One night, they even left a pillow without a sheet exposing the nastiness (I already know hotel pillows are nasty but I didn't need to see that!) None of the staff is friendly (with the exception of the golf cart drivers and those trying to sell you their time share). My friend asked for a band aid at the front desk and they had to call security for it. We ended up waiting for half an hour and we ended up not getting it!! On cleanliness, there's 3 trash cans in the property (ok, maybe I'm exagerrating). The room was ok. Location was ok but the beach was a JOKE! Pool and the rest of the property was nice but because the property was so expansive, if you're room is in the garden area, it's a hike to get to the pool area. They do have golf carts to take you around. All the restaurants are ridiculously expensive! We have a rental car so we were able to drive out for dinner. For the value, if you're just getting the gardeb view deluxe junior suite, i guess it's a good value but this is NOT A LUXURY resort!! I woud have rather stayed at a regular Marriot without the resort amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: WilbertoCordero
Reviews.Content: Great experience and perfect place for a quiet time, and relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Gran Melia”
Reviews.Author: maggie076
Reviews.Content: On our recent holiday to Puerto Rico we had the pleasure of staying at the Gran Melia Resort for 3 nights on a half board basis unfortunately 3 nights wasnt enough We dined at the asian restaurant each night as it had three different styles of cooking all being delicious in particular the sea bass and teriyaki beef The resort was spotless as was the large and airy suite and the layout of the resort had a feelgood factor with its own beach and safe swimming to the leeward side of a break water which sheltered you from some spectacular Atlantic waves The public areas behind the foyer were very oppulent with even areas you could lie down in and listen to the soothing background music while enjoying a drink from the bar The staff could not have been more helpful and attentive The Gran Melia is secluded and peaceful just what you need after a long flight from England and set us up nicely for our Caribbean cruise Thankyou Gran Melia Peter Armstrong

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place but.........”
Reviews.Author: mharris777
Reviews.Content: I just left this place and I must say the resort it self it beautiful and the property is as well, with the nice pools. I was expecting more from this resort. The beach was truly a joke, seaweed 8-10 inches deep covers the bay floor so there is no way your gonna swim. The restaurants on the property is "EXPENSIVE" so be ready to spend at least $22 per person for a meal that is not so great and very basic. There is no dancing or club scene, and salsa lessons that they offer were canceled every night we were there. There customer service is kind of rude indirectly, but they want a tip for everything. Its about a hour drive to Old San Juan and renting a car is about $90. a day from the Resort. After saying all this would I stay here again? If I had kids yes, if I just wanted to relax with my spouse and doing nothing, yes. But for excitement and fun, dancing, NO!

Reviews.Title: “Average Resort with Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: litlbet167
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 day 4 night stay at Gran Malia. We got a great last minute deal- if it weren't for that my rating would be lower. After reading the reviews, we got a car at the airport and made plans to spend most of our time off the resort. Don't get me wrong, everything is nice, but if you don't want to sit by the pool drinking $9 pina coladas or golfing in 90 degree weather than you will need to look outside the resort. We ate once at the pool bar and once at the Asian restaurant. Okay, but not great. I was happy with our room- nice sized with high ceilings. Our only complaint was that as the week progressed, we got fewer and fewer towels. By the last day we had no wash clothes, no shower mat, and were short 2 towels from when we started. Not sure if towels were sparce, but the couple we went with also complained that there was a shortage of beach towels too. Service for the most part was good. The front desk was very helpful with recommendations and if we had any questions/problems. Our only incident was a very surly female security guard who was quite short with us one evening as we returned from dinner. Overall, it's a fine place to stay if you get a deal and are looking for a clean bed and a nice pool. It's close enough to enjoy San Juan as well as the Yunque rainforest and beach. However, I've definitaly been to other places that were better.

Reviews.Title: “very disapointed”
Reviews.Author: azhenyz
Reviews.Content: Donâ€™t believe anything they post on their website! The ocean is full of rocks and seaweed, nearest beach is $80 cab ride away. No kids club, paid one is only kids 5-12yo. food is very expensive and nothing special (add another $60-90 per day per person) I even got food poisoning; all they offered was doctor services for $180â€¦ management is very rude.

Reviews.Title: “wow, an experience of our life that we will repeat annually until we die”
Reviews.Author: adamcindy
Reviews.Content: absulotely loved every experience of the resort. we were worried about not being able to speak spanish but did not find any problems once we were at the resort. yes, it is true that the beach area was small and rocky but the pools are all wonderful. the pool with the wet bar and live music was our favorite area and we are planning on returning every year for a week until we die.( next year we will take our teenegers)/ we fill this resort is safe for the family with the security and constant attention of the staff. finally, the golf courses.....wow. more beautiful than can ever be imagined. everyday we golfed, relaxed by the pool , used the free shuttle van to local restuants( or drove to a recommended favorite of the staff and finished the evening in the casino where we were treated wonderfully by everyone.......can't wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Not As Advertised”
Reviews.Author: ClaudeBawls
Reviews.Content: RENT A CAR... it's a must. Even w/ daily parking rates, it's still the cheapest way to get around given the Gran Melia's secluded location. Upon arrival, you will be impressed w/ the "open air" layout of the check in area, restaurants, & lobby bar. The pool area is very spacious w/ a swim up bar, however the "beach" is very small. As others have repeatedly reviewed, the resort restaurants are over priced & the food is average at best. I thought the pool side fare would be impossible to screw up, but they managed to underwhelm there as well. So, utilize your rental car to visit the local restaurants (many of those mentioned here @ Travel Advisor) in the San Juan area. As for the service, most of the support staff was courteous & helpful, however the restaurant staff was glaringly unattentive. Also, remember to scrutinize all bills... we found a few mistakes. The rooms are above average, yet some of the furnishings were ready for retirement. Important note: the AC unit has a motion sensor & regardless of the setting will reset to 80 degrees when no one's in the room. We had maintenance override this feature. Overall, this resort is very average & unless you can steal a package deal at a great price, I would recommend sticking w/ the name brands you know & trust. Either way, come to Puerto Rico... it's a magical meld of history, beauty, & natural wonder!!!.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but no swimming beach.”
Reviews.Author: kirka35
Reviews.Content: Hotel is nice but widely spread. There are many town house/bungalow types of buildings with two rooms in each one. We were staying in beach front bungalow and it was pretty nice. Very large rooms with the balcony overlooking to the ocean. But it is a long walk to the pool and restaurants area. Hotel is very nice, somehow even close to luxury, stuff is friendly. Food is good. There are 4 restaurants in the hotel but they arenâ€™t all open at the same time. The bar/restaurants by the pool was always open and serves nice food. There are few little stores before turning to the hotel driveway and we would usually stop there and buy drinks and snacks since it is much cheaper. You will need to rent a car if you are planning on visiting old town and nearby beaches. Renting a car was much better deal than using hotelâ€™s taxi. No night life in the hotel, besides the casino, but not much action there either. We were out to Old San Juan a lot. Go for bioluminescent bay tour, it is really nice! We were disappointed that there was no sandy beach. There are some chairs on the edge of the rocky beach but I was not able to swim since had very hard time to walk in to water the underwater rocks were very sharp. We had to drive to nearby beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably bad”
Reviews.Author: zorbatv
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival we were asked to carry our own bags due to the fact that the staff was very busy to do so .......... As we were wondering around the hotel in order to find the beach we realize very fast that the rocky beach side with rocks , stones and with no access to the water unless you are wearing boots (in order to avoid cuts from the rocks) was their idea of a beach front hotel....... As for dinner since the earliest reservation was available no later than 9 30 regardless my plea that my3 and 4 year olds need to eat earlier. Their suggestion was room service since taxi service was not available for 2 hours at least........................... It took one hour and a half hour since we ordered for the food to reach our room and at this point we had already called another hotel and moved in order to save our vacation week from being a disaster. Only in my worst dreams I would expect a beach front hotel in PR without a beach and the service not existing. Even if they were paying me to stay there i wouldn't what a misrepresantation on behalf of the Sol Melia. They should be ashamed and embarrased for this one...........

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel lacking effective management”
Reviews.Author: Jeolive
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia in Puerto Rico was one of my favorite hotels just a couple of years ago. We recently stayed here (wife and twin 5 year olds) on Valentines day weekend 2010 and I was disappointed. Although I have raved about Gran Melia to others before and here on Tripadvisor, I have to say this time around it was different. My room had a play pen in it that I never requested and the view I had of the lagoon was less than desirable. The pot holder outside my balcony had zero plants in it and the grounds out the window were shabby. The pool was packed and although I was fortunate to find some chairs for me and family there were NO TOWELS for anyone available. The attendant simply had a sign at counter reading sorry no towels. When asked he had no idea of when, if at all, they would have more. The bar and servers do not supply receipts for sales and charges by pool and like to over charge at check out. Request to see anything you signed at check out. I AM ASSUMING that due to shortened staff and economy issues everyone is dealing with, they were well short of staff and not ready for the valentines day rush. Since I checked in very late I probably got one of the less desirable rooms. The couch was stained and old along with older tv sets. I got this via priceline and payed about 40% less than standard rate so it was a good value nontheless. Passion restaurant with Chef Mrylta (my favorite in PR for three years now) was not up to par as-well. Again lack of staff for the crowd. My usual favorite plate, Cheviche was simply simple and blan. But shouldn't they know that in PR valentines is a big deal and be ready? Passion had my reservation an hour later than I requested and host at restaurant was MIA for 10 minutes at entering. They were busy, ofcourse BUT again at those prices hire extra hands and make my $200 dinner for two worth it. Still love you Passion but this was my least favorite visit. Yunque is close by and the property is very nice. Melia!! Spend some money on better TV sets and keep all gardens fresh. Add some large hammocks around he beach (not those crappy ones you have) and increase staff by pool area. Generally vacationers are looking for this when away from home and cold weather like NJ/NYC/PA ect... I hope you bounce back and address these things.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place but very bad costumer service skills all over the resort”
Reviews.Author: MariAmarillo
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the looks of the resort its defenetly a beautiful establishment. But the whole staff has a lack of communication and need costumer service skillls. From the moment you walk in you'll get ignored and your needs will not be met ,they don't make you feel welcomed at all.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort with a few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: janedds
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights 2/14-2/20, got a nice deal with Hotwire and decided to upgrade to an ocean front room after the first night. The up-grade gives you complimentary continental breakfast ( or add the hot buffet for $7) and 'butler service'. Since my husband and I were traveling with our 15 and 10 year olds, we needed breakfast in the morning and it would have easily cost $50 per day for that. The pool was great and they have a quiet pool for adults. The beach is beautiful to look at but not suitable for swimming. They had a water sports hut, but I never saw any attendants and the beach doesn't lend itself well to water sports. Too much seaweed to snorkel and the bottom is rocky. We took a day trip with East Wind to Culebra for snorkeling and to enjoy the fabulous Flamenco beach. You can check out their ad in the Puerto Rico travel magazines. That was one of the highlights of our week. My husband really enjoyed the golf club adjacent to the resort, he played 3 times (my 10 year old also played). It's not cheap $160 for 18 holes, $30 less after 1pm- but golf isn't an inexpensive game. We ate at Pasion once, which was very good-try the crab soup tostones and don't forget the flan. Again, not cheap but this is a very nice resort and they aren't giving anything away. We also had dinner at Tempo which was quite poor, we are used to delicious Italian food on Long Island so we should have known better but we just felt like having a dish of pasta that night. You need a car to really appreciate this part of the island. We went to the kiosks at Loquillo beach for dinner one night (Parillo #2) which was fantastic and reasonable. We also ate at Richie's one night which was very expensive and just okay. Go in to Old San Juan and eat at Cafe Puerto Rico, one of the guests recommeded it to us and it was a great meal ( and under $100 for all of us whereas Pasion was $200. . Gran Melia doesn't offer anywhere to grab a quick bite or a cup of coffee so if you don't have a car you'll have to bring your wallet. The staff is very pleasant, the rooms were nice and clean and had beautiful views, the service could have been better though. We called twice for the bellman and after a half an hour we took our own bags to the car.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL RESORT, BUT NOT FOR TEENS.”
Reviews.Author: travelwanabe_10
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia is a beautiful resort, but does have its short comings. I traveled with my wife and 2 boys ( 15 & 12).The Royal service upgrade is good for the breakfast buffet, which will easily carry one thru dinner. The happy hour and appetizers were not as adverised and really is for adults only.You are offered no appetizers except peanuits in a dish,and the only drinks are beer,wine and champaigne. The rooms offered in Royal Service are in the 17 - 20 units are much larger and are very comfortable. The are really no activities for teens except a small vidoe game room. The on site restaurants are over rated and expensive. I read several reviews and utilize this information to my advantage, You will definitly need to rent a car at the airport. The Gran Melia is 2 miles off Rte 3 and once there you are secluded. I had read that you need to pay for parking every night at $16.50/ night. I was able to come and go as I pleased and really only got charged one night out of five. I think this is dependant upon the security gaurd and this is not monitoried very closely.Local eateries in Laquillo beach are LaPrilla and King Seafood, both serve excellent food and are priced accordingly. ( $125.00 for four with drinks& tip). A must see is the El Yunken rainforest, Old San Juan, Laquillo beach and if snorkilng is desired pay the $74.00/person for the East Island Excursion. This was fun, relaxed,and took you to 2 great snorkling areas. The crew was very amusing, lunch was fulfilling and the drinks flowed like water if you were so inclined. The Gran Melia is a fine resort for couples, the pool is great, but the beach is rocky and the ocean water is not suitable for snorkling.If you are traveling with teenagers you will need to venture out everyday to keep them occupied. Sitting at the pool and lying on the beach is only good for so long.

Reviews.Title: “It was great for the money I paid”
Reviews.Author: eastdennismolly
Reviews.Content: I did priceline and got it for $100 per night. And it's nice. Totally agree that it feels like it's out in the boonies, but if you have car, just plan an extra 10 minutes of driving in and out. No biggie. We did not eat at the resort, too pricey and people posted that the food was not that great anyway. Coco Sweets which is a breakfast lunch dinner(?) place as you enter the street to the hotel (on the left) has donuts, great coffee for 70 cents, and sandwiches which the puerto ricans eat at 9am for breakfasts. The place is 12 mins from El yungue and we did go to L:uquillo, I would skip that town, and head over to farajado instead, even though we did not go there ourselves, I'd take a ferry to culebra and beach hunt. One thing to prepare yourself for is a ton of little strip store fronts and dumpy roadside food stands. We went to Richies place which is over by the rio mar and it was average food but awesome atmosphere. Long time to get food but great view at night.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff that doesn't know what it's doing.”
Reviews.Author: JackWoo
Reviews.Content: The service is very bad - So slow that we decided never to eat at the resort which means you drive to San Juan because there is nothing around the resort. I would never go back. There is no beach, it's rocks and sea grass.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place,great for relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Yelnit
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia is a awesome hotel. The best part is the enormous lobby area. Lots of different seating areas to hang out in. Live music on Fri,Sat & Sun. Amazingly no air conditioning but then again we were there in Feb and the weather was absolutely beautiful..you didn't even need a little sweater in the evening. The only thing that was not so good was there is nowhere to get a quick bite to eat . Say you just came back from a day outing there is no place to get a cup of coffee and a sandwich and also nothing open except the bar after dinner. We only ate in the italian restaruant whose decor is beautiful.. but the food was just ok and way overpriced. We each had a drink from the bar,he a soup,me a salad and each a main entree.. $87.00. not really worth it. We didn't try the other 2 eateries. We did have lunch twice by the pool...poolside food nothing to jump up and down about. The room was great except that the air conditioning just kept blowing and blowing and it felt kinda humid plus there was a slight musty smell. Although I was not 100% wooed I loved the atmosphere...hanging out in the gorgeous lobby was the highlight of the trip and will go again if I get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “excellent weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: admiller3404
Reviews.Content: very good resort & getaway. it rained everyday we were there, but still had a great time--plenty of relaxation! spa was very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Total relaxation and comfort in a beautiful setting.”
Reviews.Author: msbanker
Reviews.Content: As members of the SM Vacation Club, we selected this resort to spend our vacation week. This was our first trip to Puerto Rico and we will return! The resort is definitely a 5 star plus. The accomodations were comfortable, clean, and with all amenities. The views from the front and back balcony were gorgeous. For your information, the beach isn't for swimming but beautiful to look at. However, there are lovely swimming beaches within a few miles of this resort. The golf course is one of the best. The resort is within easy driving distance of many sites, activities, and good restaurants. We had to extend our visit due to weather conditions at home and the resort was very accomodating. We would definitely return. I suggest renting a car if staying outside San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Best Budget Friendly Honeymoon Ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Orchid1010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were trying to have a budget friendly honeymoon and were blessed to find an awesome deal off of priceline a few months before our wedding. We could not believe that we got such a bargain for a 8night stay at a 4/5 star resort. We thought for sure something had to give. We were so wrong, it was really a blessing. The resort, is breathtaking. The staff was very friendly and always there to pick us up from our room. We had an oceanfront villa suite and the view/sunsets were gorgeous! The resort is large and it was very hot so walking to our parked car was a hassle so we would call the frontdesk to send a member of the staff to pick us up. The pool, we will never forget. It was the best, the swim up bar was a great bonus feature to the magnifecent pool. The resort dining was expensive, rent a car (from the airport is cheaper) and drive to the local places for food. After the 1st day we ate out everyday and found inexpensive dining spots for breakfast/lunch/dinner. Absolute must eat out "La Parilla" kiosk at Luquillo Beach and for the best pina coladas go to luquillo beach and see Ed, the beach is 5 minutes from the resort. The resort beach is not ideal for swimming, more for viewing purposes only. Also visit Lolitas mexican restaurant (pass luquillo beach).We met the best tour guide ever Louie Robles (from the states and fluent in english) who was very trustworthy and friendly. I was scared to hire a tourguide and get in a van to go around the city but he was super friendly, and even gave us his tag#! He studied in PR history so you learn a lot about everything there when your with him.We held onto his contact information to pass along to our family/friends we used him for the el yunque rainforest tour and bio bay tour in fajardo. His # is [--].Let me tell you I was scared out of my mind, but he had a great safe tour group that took us out to see the bay. It was mindblowing and a must see! Dont worry about scary stories of jellyfish and sharks, if I could do it, anyone can, nothing dangerous out there, just gods creation at its best. Enjoy PR and dont be scared to eat the food, its all delicious and it will have your tastbuds jumping for more! =) Must eat Mofongo's, Pincho's & Pionono's!! Yummy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: MMBarnes
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort with lots of space and large nice rooms. We went down for some business and stayed for 225 for 4 nights through a timeshare promotion. The 2 hour sales presentation was not bad but they were a little pushier than I would like. The resort again is nice. The beach area is huge and not packed at all. They have a number of restaurants to go to but they are somewhat expensive in the 30-50 per person range. There is a swim up bar area with decent prices and good burgers and drinks. I would recommend this to anyone staying there. The hotel is laid out in newer and older villas. You of course want to stay in the newer ones that are closer to the beach. The staff is great and they have lots of activities from yoga to live music on some nights. The casino is small and not incredibly exciting but it is there. I recommend also the lounge beds on the beach which are quite comfortable. There are a number of things in the area to do from visiting the rain forest to seeing the glowing algea at night. There are also outlets and tons of Golf courses in the area. There is also a JW marriot being built next door which will be completed in 2011. This may crowd the beach and golf course potentially. We had no complaints except we had to ask for face towels each day, the cable had limited channels, no plasma TVs, bathtub layout is awkward (you need to get in the tub to turn on the shower), no place to hang wet pool clothes. But overall a nice resort.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: VargasGirl
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter & I tagged along with my husband when he attended a big company meeting. He was stuck in PowerPoint presentations all day. The kid & I had a blast! Hotel staff was friendly and helpful, but we were very self-sufficient. We knew what we wanted to see and had rented a care from Thrifty for $20 a day and we figured out how to get everywhere on our own.It's not that difficult. Be warned, directions in Puerto Rico are more landmarks than street signs. We were not charged for parking at the hotel. Hotel is convenient enough to lots of things to see & do. We hit Old San Juan, Loquillo Beach and the fun and cheap food kiosks (went here twice -- beach is beautiful, food is mostly fried, but good), El Yunque National Forest and a bioluminescent bay tour in Fajardo in basically a 3-day trip. We did our best to eat local food each day, but did have one meal at the Italian restaurant at the hotel. It was very good, as was the service. We stayed in a bungalow room, which was very nice, although the AC was kind of loud at night and there was no view. We spent our last 1/2 day (Wednesday morning) sitting in the water at the hotel's beach. We had one stretch of the beach to ourselves, with the exception of a lone iguana and an older couple who wandered our way, but didn't stay long. It was very relaxing. And you can see a lot in this area for very little money. The most expensive thing we did (other than buying a very big coconut mask) was the bioluminescent bay tour for $45 a person. Kayaking Puerto Rico did a great job. Their staff was big enough and very, very nice and attentive. Bring extra bug spray of your own, though. Even though they give it out at the beginning and halfway through the mangrove part of the trek, the bugs in the evening are everywhere. El Yunque rainforest is very inexpensive and there are places to eat when you get there. I'd get the map off the internet and skip the welcome center next time. I wish we'd had much more time to explore the rainforest. We only had 1/2 day. We did not have time to hike to the observation tower at the top. Loquillo Beach is beautiful and has very soft sand. The hotel beach is rougher, much more shell debris, but still nice on the water side of the rocks. Overall we had a great time and can't wait to go back on a real vacation. There's so much more to see & do.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: SW-travel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Gran Melia from 1/30 - 2/6 & loved it. We didn't experience the negative situations that previous reviewers had. - The grounds & our room were gorgeous. The room is very large & also functional (good lighting, safe, wi-fi, great bathroom). There are 8 rooms in each two story "bugalow". Only problem was that we were occasionally awakened by slamming doors or people in the room above us dragging their chairs across the tile floor - a 2nd floor room would have improved this. - The service was wonderful. Every time we had a problem, they sent someone right away. We had some problems with the air conditioning, but the engineering staff improved it. When we didn't have enough towels, housekeeping always sent someone. The staff was very friendly - everyone said hello. - While the "bungalows" are far from the main building, this was okay with us because we enjoyed walking in the gorgeous weather. Every time a golf cart came by, the driver would ask if we wanted a ride. - We had the full breakfast (hot & cold buffet) each day & it was fabulous. We didn't need lunch. - We left the resort each day for excursions, so the Royal Service wouldn't have been any benefit to us. - The location is great for getting to El Yunque & to Luquillo/ Fajardo for ocean activities & to San Juan for touring.

Reviews.Title: “Great long weekend”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglandSnowman
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here for a three night long weekend the end of January. We were warned about driving so we didn't rent a car which was a mistake. it is far from San Juan so we never made it to the city. The hotel was beautiful. The grounds are magical and the rooms spacious. We had an ocean view room. It is definitely worth the upgrade to royal service. If you get royal service you get a butler, which we never met or had any need for and you also get access to the royal service adult only pool where the bali beds are free of charge ($50 a day otherwise by the main pool). The bartender at this pool made the worst drinks and was not very accomodating. He refused to put my tab on my credit card. There were a few bad things about this resort that would probably never happen at any other "5 star resort". The hot tub did not work and was not repaired even after several requests. My wife and i stayed here for a three night long weekend the end of January. We were warned about driving so we didn't rent a car which was a mistake. it is far from San Juan so we never made it to the city. The hotel was beautiful. The grounds are magical and the rooms spacious. We had an ocean view room. It is definitely worth the upgrade to royal service. If you get royal service you get a butler, which we never met or had any need for and you also get access to the royal service adult only pool where the bali beds are free of charge ($50 a day otherwise by the main pool). The bartender at this pool made the worst drinks and was not very acomodating. He refused to put my tab on my credit card. There They told us the pump was broken but made no effort to repair it. Every time we passed a golf cart they offered us a ride to the main buildings. I also recommend, as others have, on this site that you use your credit card to pay for food, drink and extras instead of charging the bill to your room. Check your credit card statement before you check out. If you are looking for a nice beach this isn't the place to go....there is basically no beach. This side of the island doesn't have the beaches. I must make a comment about the restaurants. The Asian restaurant was the best the Italian the worst. My Filet Mignon was overdone, I had ordered medium, but there was no one to complain to. When the waiter finally showed up after I was almost finished with the meal he commented that the meat was too well done and gave us one complimentary dessert. There signature Mojito was just awful. We didn't even try the Passion restaurant after reading about it in these pages.The best drinks were at the bar and the main pool bar. The services were great and the people in the Royal Services lounge were very acomodating. The best part of Royal Service was the complimentry continental breakfast. I expected a bagel and coffee. Turned out we were entitled to all cold food which included meats, cheeses, fruits, cerials, juices, and just about everything you could imagine that is cold. With a small snack at 3 PM we were good til dinner. We would go back in a heartbeat. My travel agent priced this trip with a garden view room and standard service at $600 more than we paid through Orbitz

Reviews.Title: “Impecable Service and Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: wewantotravel
Reviews.Content: After reading on line reviews, we had some reservations but none of the bad things we read about ever happened. The staff is fabulous and helped with anything we asked for. The food was expensive but it is a resort. Every restuarant had excellent service but the food did not exceed expectations for the most part. We tried all but the pool bar and the Passions restuarant. We were upgraded to a beach front room which included the Royal Service pool, cocktails from 6-9 every night, continental breakfast and help with everything from dinner reservations to extra linen in the room. They DO try to get you to go to the time share talk but they aren't tremdously overbearing and I'd go back at the reduced rate and attend the hour and half talk just to get to go back to this most beautiful resort. The iguanas were fascinating. Do the rainforest on your own but be ready to walk...alot...uphill. They are missing a place for dancing that we would have used. The casino wouldn't let us in with a cap on so we never went back. The massages at the spa were nice but not the best I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “The best place yet”
Reviews.Author: sand1der
Reviews.Content: My wife and I with our three boys her sister and her brother in law my sister borther in law and my nephew all went there for a big family get away . It was by far the best resort that I have been to this far !! there was so much to do in Pureto Rico and such beautiful pools at the resort that you dont have to leave if you dont want to . We stayed in the vaction club section (for people who have timeshares ) it was the best ! There is a pool just for club members if you want some queit time with family or you can go to the main pool with the wet bar a bit more noise there ! There is wifi all over the place if you need it and its free yes I said free there was also computers for you to use if you needed them great for looking up things to do addresses and outher stuff .To much to write about but I will say that I will try to be back there Next year !!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice resort..service not so great”
Reviews.Author: NycLuv2trvl
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed here for a week in january..it is pretty far from san juan so i recommend u rent a car...however the area is much nicer than san juan...more caribbean less city..the hotel happens to be beautiful..the grounds are nice as are the rooms..it is definitely worth the upgrade to royal service bc from what ive heard there is absolutely zero service in the main pool or anywhere else in the hotel for that matter...if you get royal service you get a butler (angel m is a great guy that will do anything for u)...you also get access to the royal service adult only pool where the bali beds are free of charge ($50 a day otherwise by the main pool)..richie makes a great mojito at the rs pool..there were a few bad things about this resort that would probably never happen at any other "5 star resort"...the hotel is not a highrise but little buildings which is nice bc the rooms are bigger but everything is hard to get to..other hotels ive stayed at that use golf carts to move the guests around had a much better system..there is basically never a golf cart around when u need it and even if there is someone driving by they never not once the whole time we were there stopped to ask us if we need a ride! so basically be prepared to walk wherever you want to go..for the last three days we were there for some reason the hotel decided that smack in the middle of the day would be the perfect time for the landscaping crew to come in and mow the lawns and trim the trees..all this noise while you r sitting by the pool trying to relax..it was ridiculous..and it lasted for about 2 hours..nonstop mowing of the grass...i also recommend as others have on this site that you check your credit card statement before u check out..there was a large mysterious charge on our cc that we happened to catch before we checked out...the hotel claimed they didnt know how it got there but im sure it would have been much harder to fight them had we been back home already instead of face to face..if ur looking for a nice beach this isnt the place to go...there is basically no beach..its just some rocky dirt area with some lounge chairs...this side of the island doesnt have the beaches of san juan...basically the service here is not great...royal service here is equivalent to regular service at really any other hotel..the staff in general is no where to be found and when u ask them for something (rs staff excluded) they look at u like ur crazy..you generally get a feeling like theyre doing u a favor and for lack of a better way to say it they dont seem happy to be working and seem like they resent you for being on vacation while they have to work..there also seems to be no one in charge...no one wants to take responsibilty for anything...if theres a problem there is no one ot talk to ..everyone sends you to someone else..all in all if ur not expecting a five star resort with over the top service this hotel is just fine, pools are nice hotel is clean and spa wasnt as bad as i thought it would be...but if service is what ur looking for then keep looking

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the rooms, nice beaches (private); relaxed atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: SKI_Road_Warrior
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Dec/2009, loved the rooms - pretty decent size: we had a king bed, large bathroom, and a separate seating area/deck that looked over the ocean. There's a casino on site, and the beaches are pretty clean. Customer service is good (critical thing). If you go to PR, rent a car with a GPS - and DO NOT MISS OUT on: 1. the Bio-luminescent bay tour (local one near San Juan). Seriously, it is the most spectacular things (even if you don't know how to (2-person)kayak) - we booked a private night tour, and it was simply magical (plus you get more time in the local bio bay - as opposed to the viques tour operator whom we contacted). 2. Guavate - there is the famous/delicious pig roast. We found El Cunao, the most revered (but difficult to find). you can google the directions, and go early. it's a breakfast/lunch (and not dinner) place.

Reviews.Title: “great place to re-energize in winter”
Reviews.Author: SFMJ
Reviews.Content: Gran Melia PR has a lot going for it. Central to sights, not far from SJ or beaches, Trump Golf around the corner, other courses nearby, great lay out of facilities around the grounds, always a place to suit your mood (close to or far from other people, water, music, ... ) friendly staff, super rooms, rapid service, choice of rstaurants, nice gym with -amongst other machines and weights- at least 4 running/treadmills, on grounds Avis car rental. So this is a great place to wind down and re-energize at a reasonable price. Certainly in January and away from the weekends, when the crowds seem to be elsewhere or nowhere at all. Of course there are also some opportunities for improvement. One of which is arriving. We got in at SJ Airport and found a Hotel Shuttle that would not take us along because of reservation issue we did not understand. Strange way to say hello.... In the hotel we were checked in rapdily and very effectively and booked in room with ocean view, where we had reserved gardenview. Getting in the great and spacious room (not taking the royal servcie, as we did not see the real value of the extra service), there were some technical details (slide-doorhandles, leaking faucets, ...) that were quickly taken care of. However with peace and quiet untill at least 8 in the morning as one of the natural expectations for anyone being here, early morning traffic by all the grounds staff in gasoline powered carts cloud easily be improved by changing to electric carts all round. Prevents waking up guests at 6AM too. It should be noted that the hotel location, while situated on 'the beach' does not offer the opportunity to actually swim in the sea. You can of course wade in a little way. The lagoon is not deep enough for a proper swim and there is no real surf. Which confines guests to one of the poosl. Which have a great lay out and enough surface to accomodate for everybodies pleasure. However, the continuous music at the Wet Bar can be annoying. The DJ-ing qualities of the bartenders explains why they are tending bar. And the choice of tracks, apart from taste, seems to be too small to tide over more than a 1 day stay. The Mojito's make up for a lot of this little detail though ;-) Try the Razzmojito! The restaurants (Passion is relaxed and for local food, Tiempo is positioned as more upscale and serves Italian, while opposite Mani serves Oriental - and then there is of course the breakfast restaurant and the poolside lunch place) are all good enough, however not special. As Europeans we are always suprised by teh sheer size of the portions. At home one dish would do us (approx 50 year old active adults), for a day, even when sharing. And one remark with regard to design: We would advise the hotel management to re evaluate the lighting in all of the restaurants. In Tiempo we could not read the menu. Adding a few spots to the single point central lighting rthat is now in place would already do the trick. Of course this is a hotel, so restaurants are not the prime offering. However a few points could be made: When in Tiempo try the Melanzane (egg plant) appetizer. Delicious! We went on to order the Rombo. expecting Turbot (Rombo is Italian for Turbot). The fish we were served was actually Halibut and overdone. So that was a bit of a let-down. In Mani the rolls are great. The rest of the dishes are average and again too large in terms of portion size. Passion we would not reccomend. Mostly because of the very average service we got there. A commendation goes to the fact that there are good French, Italian and other European wines on the wine list as well as New World ones. So in all, we would reccomend this location to anyone who, as we did, wants to relax after too much 'all work no play' and does not want to spend fortunes. The rest of PR and SJ is close by enough to get away. Which we would reccomend as well in order to get some alternatives to eating in the hotels restaurants alone. Try Luquillo beach (20-30 minutes from the hotel) for swimming in a real surf. Old SJ's SoFo provides for a great choice of restaurants, as do some of the surrounding smaller places. Have fun here! We did ;-)

Reviews.Title: “This hotel staff literally saved our lives”
Reviews.Author: profpat
Reviews.Content: The testament of a good hotel is mostly based on superficial criteria such as having enough towels in the bathroom etc. A GREAT hotel requires a true tragedy to fully appreciate the staff etc. Unfortunately, I had the misfortune to experience tragedy on this trip. Luckily, I was at a great hotel. I took my 83 year old mother-in-law to the Gran Melia in Puerto Rico for a combo b-day/xmas gift. She does not have a passport, so I was limited to PR and the USVI. I specifically chose PR due to the medical facilities in San Juan. I was thinking â€œjust in caseâ€� when I booked the trip, but my concern became a reality on the third day of our trip. We left on Thursday, Jan 7 and had a nice plane ride from Oâ€™Hare to San Juan. By the time we arrived in San Juan and were driven to the Gran Melia, it was about 4 pm. After a smooth check in, we had a delicious dinner at the Nami restaurant, admired the grounds and made an early night of it. Friday we camped out by the pool, ate at Tempo and hit a shopping mall in the evening. Saturday, was gorgeous. The perfect day. We spent the afternoon by the pool and beach, eating at Nami again. After dinner, we relaxed in the room, "packing up" for the our Sunday flight home. Unfortunately, my mother-in-law woke up at 1 am and was sick as a dog. I wonâ€™t bore you with the details but she was later diagnosed as â€œhaving a gastrointestinal virus.â€� I asked if it was something she could have eaten. They said absolutely not. (Besides, we ate the same food, drank the same water etc. so I knew it wasn't that, anyway...) One doctor said she probably started contracted it before we even left. It's just one of those things.â€� However, she lost a lot of fluid within a short 2 hour period. I went to the front desk, which was staffed with young girls who seemed genuinely sympathetic to our situation. One had the foresight to alert the head of security, Miguel Rodriguez Benabe, who got a doctor to our room within an hour. Bottom line, I decided an ambulance was needed. I didn't want to take any chances. She needed to be hydrated and FAST. The manager called an ambulance for me. The hotel sent a friendly, young guard named Gonzolas in a Gran Melia hotel van containing our luggage to the hospital with me. Gonzolas stayed by my side the whole time, helping me translate her medical bkgd, talking to my trip insurance carrier on the phone for me, keeping in touch with the hotel etc. We missed our flight so, so my trip insurance company faxed 16 pages of forms to the hospital - some for me to fill out & some for the doctors. The hotel guard was a lifesaver, interpreting for me. Plus, he took me out to get something to eat and help me get a charger for my phone which was going dead from all the battery time being used on "emergency" calls. When mom got released from the hospital, the hotel van transported her back to the hotel. Miguel himself lifted her out of the van and into a wheelchair to get to our same suite. They had it spotlessly clean and delivered everything I needed (7up, gatorade etc) in a coolers with ice. She slept all night after midnight and was better in the morning. We were able to make our flight home. Another manager, Luis Rivera Gomez was involved in helping orchestrate a smooth transition such as working with staff to help me arrange new land and air transport. The management even sent hotel security staff to get momâ€™s pills at the local Walgreens for us! I was blown away by the willingness to help and go the extra mile for us. Iâ€™m writing this for two reasons. One is to outline how fantastic the staff of Gran Melia are at handling difficult situations. Second, is to remind everyone that sometimes the staff might be assisting folks (like us) in true emergency situations, so you should cut any hotel staff some slack on any service-related issues. There may be a valid reason for a missed turn-down service, for example. Ironically, my mother-in-law STILL had a good time (hospital visit aside) and enjoyed the warm sun, palm trees and gorgeous ocean. Attached are some pictures I took with my cell phone. I still have to get my camera pictures developed. Warning: They aren't your "normal" vacation pictures! I want to thank the staff of the Gran Melia for helping me salvage my trip and getting us out of Puerto Rico safely. I want to thank you for your reponsiveness and professionalism during a very stressful situation. Iâ€™m actually â€œtearing upâ€� as I write this, because there arenâ€™t enough words to express the full extent of my gratitude. Being at a great hotel, literally saved my mother-in-lawâ€™s life.

Reviews.Title: “The lap of luxury”
Reviews.Author: NecmiyeEker
Reviews.Content: Impressive is an understatement. The grandeur, cleanliness, and luxuriousness of this resort, even leaving aside the affordable price, is astounding. Simply beautiful architecture, it is a self-contained artwork--everything gleams with polished marble, inviting eastern and Roman themes, candles galore, infinite beautiful beds and furniture on which to rest. The rooms are immense, each with personal porches overlooking man made ponds. Overlooking Coco Beach, it has a gorgeous location. The staff are personable and very professional. The dining is high priced, but there is much variety for American/European/Asian tastes (from Sushi to Italian). A lovely bar area and casino make it more of an "adults" couples type resort than a place for children, although there were children's areas available. Overall, I give it 5 stars except for the following reservations, which do not detract too much from my overall VERY positive impression: 1. There is very little entertainment at all. We arrived on a rainy weekend, and so expected perhaps in the evening some type of dancing, games etc. Nada. If you don't like to gamble at the casino, you're out of luck. 2. There is no place for a low-cost, casual quick bite or coffee. Not a single cup available without a formal reservation or sit-down meal. 3. The location is rather remote from other towns, so you are really stuck on the complex. There are tours to the Yunque and Old San Juan, but these are at additional cost and are dependent on availability.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but......please read!!!”
Reviews.Author: capecast
Reviews.Content: we traveled from 1/14/10 TO 1/20/10 OK, YES THE HOTEL IS BEAUTIFUL VERY VERY BEAUTIFUL AND ALSO CLEAN. BUT here what people should know before they decide to book this hotel, we wish we would of known this before. 1. transportation from airport to hotel is $36.00 PER PERSON EACH WAY. 2. there is no fridge in the room, you can rent one for $25.00 i think but i think is very weir and i still can't belive they dont have one. 3. the restaurant are very very very expensive and there is not a variety of places to eat at either. 4. plan to pay $25.00 PER PERSON FOR A BREAKFAST BUFFET every morning, there is no other option for breakfast,. 5. for lunch and dinner they have 3 other restairants and they all average $30.00 per person, NOTHING CHEAPER THAN THAT. 6.there were not a lot of activities while we stayed there actually i dontl think there were any at all. 7. if you are sitting by the pool but not close to the bar, they cant serve you. you will have to go and get your own food and drinks, that was very ridiculos and not fair at all. 8. they will place a $100.00 HOLD PER NIGHT on your credit card and if you rent a car they will place a $400.00 hold also. THEY DONT TELL YOU UNTIL AFTER THEY HAVE MADE THE TRANSACTION. 9. there is not walking area outside the hotel, once you are in the hotel you will have to pay a lot of money for a taxi to try to leave the hotel and go anywhere else. TAXIS ARE VERY EXPENSIVE. just keep in mind that you will probably spend appr $200.00 OR MORE PER DAY ON FOOD AND DRINKS, for 2 people, a beer costs $7.00 HOPE THIS HELPS,

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort, Royal Service worth it! Great deal for the price!”
Reviews.Author: AJ_Boston_2010
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia resort is beautiful. The rooms are large and comfortable. We were 4 rooms of adults, and the hotel put us all close together. One room was upgraded to oceanfront, the rest were garden side in the same building/entry. We were all five steps from the beach - that close to the water, we didnâ€™t miss the view at all! We were close to the resort center w/restaurants etc., helpful for the oldest in our group. We spent almost all our time at the pool, beach, or somewhere else outside. The Royal Service really made the trip. RS personnel were very helpful, and everyone was cheerful - thanks Jari, Joshua, and Luis especially!! RS includes a separate adults-only pool, with free â€œBali bedsâ€� there. We also really appreciated the included wine/champagne before dinner, which you can bring to the restaurants if you're not done (NO hors d'oevres though). And free coffee and water and soft drinks all day. The cold buffet breakfast is usually included with RS, but they upgraded us to include the hot buffet too. Adding the hot on your own was very reasonable, at an additional $8. The restaurants were fine. Pasion (Puerto Rican food) was excellent, we went twice. Order the shrimp in garlic sauce, the house special! Both Tempo (italian) and Nami (Asian, minimally fusion) were fine. Prices seemed inexpensive to our NYC contingent, and reasonable to the rest. If you werenâ€™t Royal Service, they do charge for things like bottles of water, and $50/day for the â€œBali beds.â€� So spring for the upgrade if you can! The beach was pretty, but rocky as we expected. Great to walk along or sit by, but you can't snorkel from the shore. Lots of shade, which we need. And the tennis courts could use some repair (but were definitely usable, and always available). For us it was ideal. There was enough for everyone of 3 generations, we could just relax and enjoy each otherâ€™s company. It was a great deal for the price, and we are all very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings About this Place”
Reviews.Author: Nguyen4
Reviews.Content: While reading others reviews prior to our trip on this site, I came in with not high expectations of the place. I agree with everyone that the resort is beautiful and lovely. But here are the few bad things that happened or were inconvenient to us. 1-there is a daily parking fee if you have a car rental ($16) 2-upon arrival and checking in even though we had paid for our hotel stay in full, the hotel had put a hold on our cards ($100/day=$700) I thought that was strange and just brushed it off that maybe they do this in all resorts since it was our first time 3-We were there for 7 nights and noticed on the 5th night the hotel had put another hold on our cards without letting us know (we knew we had stayed under our original $700 hold and realized they had charged us an extra $150/night for 2 nights because they thought there was a 3rd person in our room, might I add we were there on our honeymoon! so that put us over the original hold amount and they held an additional $900 until those fees were removed, they eventually removed those two extra charges) on the day we checked out we noticed they had put those two extra nightly charges back on to our room. We talked with a different front desk representative and she was making it sound as though we were lying about the 3rd person. Thankfully we had the printed out receipt we originally received from the other front desk lady who took it off) 4-we stayed in room 1605 and everynight our room was very musty. Our bedding clothes and everything else was very musty. I asked the front desk on our 3rd day there to either move us to a different room or send someone out to see if the AC was working correctly. The front desk told us they would send a housekeeper to our room to switch out our bedding. We waited 4 hours and no one ever came. 5-the food at Tempo and the breakfast place (cant remember the name) was VERY expensive. The breakfast joint cost us $25pp!~ 6-the spa services were very expensive. We did a couples 50 minute massage and thought it was $140 total, it was actually $140pp and ours started 10 minutes late so we only received 40 minutes of our $300 service! 7-the casino closes at 1am vs being open 24 hours which I thought was a bid odd so they usually kick you out of the casino between 1-2am 8-we really didnt enjoy the loooong entry drive everytime we entered back into the hotel Now here are a few things that we did like about our stay there: 1-they had daily free activities that you can do (etc, yoga, pilates, bingo) 2-We had a car rental so the location of this resort did not bother us. We felt central to San Juan and Fajardo 3-the service everywhere in the hotel minus the front desk was really good 4-the view and layout of the resort was beautiful

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort with mixed service...”
Reviews.Author: dakster11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Melia Puerto Rico over New Years (Dec. 30-Jan. 4) and have mixed emotions over our stay. The resort is located about 1/2 hour from San Juan Airport and is in a remote location. This was not an issue for us because we did not have a rental car for the week and had decided beforehand that we were going to stay at the resort the entire time. The grounds and buildings were beautiful! We reserved a Beachfront room with Royal Service. Check-in was easy with no wait and a mostly helpful staff. We were immediately carted to our room by a friendly staffer. Our room was an end unit overlooking the beach and water. Room was large and comfortable , but not luxurious. Bathroom and shower were sufficient. The beach was nice to look at with numerous palm trees and had beach chairs strewn all over, but was not ideal for laying out or swimming. The Royal Service pool was just a few steps from our room and, for us, was the best part of the resort. It is an adult only, huge pool, and has great Bali beds available and also bar service. Lunch could be ordered from the room service menu and was just average. We did this each day. Our bartender was attentive and fun! We had the complimentary continental breakfasts and it was sufficient for our needs. We were always seated fast and there was enough 'cold' choices to be satisfied (we were comped two free 'hot' breakfasts, but it was not good except for the omlet station). We ate at every restruant and never had a bad meal. Our favorite was Nami and our least favorite was Pasion. Each place had great, fast sevice and excellent food. Yes, it is not cheap...but this is resort fine dining, not some kiosk on the side of the road. We also took part of Grand Melia's New Year's Eve party (comped as part of our package $100 each!)...LONG line to enter the ballroom and everyone was dressed to kill! The food was very good and the drinks were weak and expensive ($10 per). They had a 14 piece Merengie band blasting out Latin music and the dance floor was crowded. Loud, but good. Sounds good so far, right? Here's why I gave this resort only 3 stars...for the money ($500+ per night) I would have expected nicer much rooms. The Royal Service basically gave us the private pool and the lounge (which had two computers for emailing and a tv with free beer and wine for happy hour!) The other services (airport transportation, pillow menu, newspaper, hot tub set up, and especially concierge and butler service) were non existant. Also, this resort (at least when we were there) definitely catered to the Spanish speaking Euros and Latin America crowd vs. the U.S. guests. I know, I know...Puerto Rico is a Spanish speaking island and the resort is owned by a Spanish corporation, but there seemed to be some bias towards the sparse American crowd (I would guess the guests were 3/4 Spanish speaking). For example, the entire New Year's Eve party music and dialoge was in Spanish. One evening, as we were walking back to our room, a resort cart passed right by us and then stopped to ask the couple 10 yards ahead of us (non-American) if they needed a ride!?!? We felt out of place, but made the most of it. So, despite the beautiful grounds and good food, the rooms lacked enough for me not to give more than a 3 star rating to the Grand Melia. ...BTW...the best part of the trip was renting a car for one day to take an early morning hike to El Yunque rainforest...VERY close to the resort and well worth the trip...Fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “It's all a matter of preference”
Reviews.Author: cnc123
Reviews.Content: I read numerous reviews of this hotel myself before arriving. One thing that all seem to agree on is that this is a beautiful property. And then there are the buts... I am not considering my opinion of this property as a bad review. For some, this location would truly have it all. It all comes down to a matter of preference. I traveled with my husband along with many others for a conference--therefore I cannot comment on the cost other than would I be willing to pay the cost to stay here myself. The answer however would be yes and no. Yes, because based on the published price of the hotel it would be well worth it. No because the property does not offer what my family and I would be looking for. I'll address some of the negative comments that I recall from previous posts. #1--check-in. It was a breeze, and we were greeted by friendly staff. So those who have had bad experiences with that just happened to catch them at a bad time I would say. #2--housekeeping. I'd describe it as: random and sporadic. We had turn down service only 2 of the 4 nights we were there. No washcloths were replaced in the room twice. We had no hairdryer the first night (I called to request one and received it about 15 minutes later), there were random toiletries (no more shampoo one night, a different brand one day, no extra soap the next day), and our bathroom door was locked when we arrived in our room. All small, inconsequential items--just puzzling. #3--the beach. I've read the beach described as rocky. Not really an accurate description. The beach is actually a coral and sand beach--there are many large pieces of coral scattered about (I'd estimate it to be half sand/half coral chunks--not finely washed small pieces). Not a good beach for taking the kids to play. But beautiful to view and stroll along (with shoes.) Again, just a matter of preference and what you're there for. I read previous reviews about a musty smell in the room. I will concur with that--but it went away (or we got used to it) by the second night. Pool area is beautiful. Property is remote from any other areas/restaurants. It takes 7 minutes to drive to it after turning off the main road. Property offers very little excitement after dark, other than sitting at the bar and listening to the band. Once again, all a matter of preference. So if youâ€™re looking for a remote get-away-from-it-all location where all you want to do is be in a beautiful, tropical location and sit by the pool all day, this is your place. If you prefer being able to go into â€œtownâ€� to shop and have numerous choices when it comes to dining, and prefer to lay/play on the beach, you need to find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Can find better location, better beach, better service, better price”
Reviews.Author: terimaldo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in December close to Christmas day. They had live music the st night which was great dance music and we enjoyed. They were supposed to have the same the following nights but seems that it was cancelled, since the following nights the piano was covered and only a DJ was playing. We found there was no life at night, the casino was boring, the bar was boring, the restaurants were closed with the exception of one, the pool areas were completely dark, it was lifeless. The hotel 'social' areas were mostly empty. The food at the only resturants that was open was pricey and not great at all. It was italian, and nothing special but expensive. The rooms were big annd comfortable. They charge $25 for the stay to have a mini fridge which does not work very well. The ice machines are few a far away from your building. Each building does not have an ice machine. The beach is not good at all, PR has so many other beautiful beaches but not near Rio Grande. The pool was nice, although I was very concerned aboit this one palm tree in the very center of the pool that was fool of coconuts that can fall down at any time in someone's head. I kept telling the kids to stay away from that area. Very irresponsible and bad management on the part of the hotel. A coconut falling from a very high tree can cause serious harm even death. For the price, you can find much better in PR. There were no employees to assist you when you needed help or had questions. Also, they did not seem to be very friendly either. ANd you have to pay for parking $20 per day.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous - just make sure you have a car.”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkJo
Reviews.Content: I had limited expectations of Gran Melia after reading the reviews on this site, but I was pleasantly surprised. We had a car, and we know Puerto Rico well, so maybe we had an advantage over other travelers. As stated by others, the hotel is beautiful, the rooms huge and comfortable, and the staff helpful. The front desk service was more than acceptable, although it seems that management needs to add some staff around check-out time. Not all Caribbean beaches have gentle waves and white sand beaches, and this one doesn't - it's at the end of a peninsula and is subject to waves and currents - but Luquillo is just around the corner, if that's what you're looking for. And you can the sample food at the great kiosks there, too! One helpful piece of information is that the hotel has a store where you can buy cereal, soy milk, chilled fruit, ice cream and the like, so you don't always have to use room service or the cafe - both of which were fine. Traveler tips: I couldn't get a Verizon Wireless signal on the property to save my life, but I bought a phone card at the local Walgreen's and used that. The hotel charges $2 per 800 number call from the room, which seemed reasonable to me. If you bring your laptop, there's free Wi-Fi in the public areas. And, my partner needed a haircut, and we noticed a barber shop in the town of Rio Grande, near the hotel. Best haircut of his life, and only $12!! And there's a self-serve laundromat there as well, in case you have stinky kayaking/caving/hiking clothes to wash.

Reviews.Title: “If you get a good enough deal and you are willing to overlook things, go there”
Reviews.Author: rb818
Reviews.Content: First, i have to say that I now trust Trip Advisor even more. Re reading some of the other reviews, I must say that the problems with nonmanagement, and inconsistencies of personnel are absolutely true-- along with the nicely furnished rooms and the beautiful grounds. The place does leave you with a feeling of being ripped off if you get the "Royal Service" as It is NOT so royal! Basically. it seems like there are no seasoned fully trained people who work there. nobody is walking around with apparent seniority . there are smaller hotels where there are people walking around all the time inspecting and acting like they love the place. That does not happen here. At all which explains a lot. Seems like a lot of less than motivated people doing their jobs to the best they want to or need to. Looks and feels like a luxury resort though in many ways so it does indeed more than suffice if the price is right: If you go and you sign up for royal service, know you must sign up and reserve the palapas a day ahead of time ( pool beds) in the royal service pool. Dont let yourself be disappointed and kicked out by a rude employee..The royal service pool is for adults only which was nice for us as the other pool ( which is the one with the swim up bar) is crowded and noisy with people and little kids. You must get your free drinks during the day at the royal service lounge. You can get sodas and juice there included with the Royal Service. At night there is also wine, beer in the lounge and I am not sure what else. No food. Having a butler supposedly is a non event. We never met ours. RS includes the cold breakfast buffet. get there early as you may have to wait for table otherwise. Again, the people taking names dont seem to care about waits or hussling. Food at the hotel is between bad and fine. Always on the higher side of cost. You must have a car. We did. If the restaurants are booked, ( make your reservations ahead of time if you are depending on them) there is nowhere for you to eat as there is no restaurant in walking distance. You can however have the hotel call RICHIES CAFE. they will pick you up and it is good food with a nice view and warm hospitality. I recommend this place. I agree that the place COULD be terrific but it seems as though there is insufficient training of personel. lots and lots of little details are not met. we had to call for towels. We got kicked out of palapa as nobody told us they were reserved. very long wait at pool restaurant more than once. not clean tables at the restaurant even after we asked to have them clean before we sat down, surly personnel on various occasions perhaps i would be too. they have to hear many complaints. The place needs a warm, talented,visible GM and it could be perfect. Sitting by the beach is wonderful. There may not be great sand but the lounges and feeling of seclusion is great. Our room was very nice and comfortably very slept three ( or more). two double beds and a double pullout couch.large nice bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, nice pool, very far away from everything, not nice beach”
Reviews.Author: ChatoAguilar
Reviews.Content: I brought a group of 16 others to Puerto Rico and we stayed four of our 8 nights here. this is the skinny. + Beatiful property + Very nice, large pool + Large comfortable rooms + Close to el Yunque rainforest, Fajardo biobay, the Vieques/Culebra ferries, Loquillo dining kiosks + Very nice gym - VERY far from any acceptable nightlife - A car is necessary to eat off the property and test a variety of restaurants - The food is expensive. Pasion restaurant was a good price for the local cuisine, other than that... expensive. - They don't let you bring in your own food or drinks. We had to sneak it. - The beach is just so-so and the water is full of seaweed Given that we were going on the biobay (do Vieques instead of Fajardo!), going to Icacos Island (AMAZING!!!! Call Captain Mingo at [--] to arrange a tour), and visiting the rain forest (so-so), the location was fine. HOWEVER, if this is the only place you are staying at during the trip it is VERY far from a variety of options for any restaurants and nightlife and the ocean in front of the property is full of seaweed. We paid $150 a night and for that, it was a very strong deal and worthy of four stars).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: dhjj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two teenagers 18 and 15. It is about a 30-45 min. drive from San Juan airport. The hotel is lovely, picturesque and has a very nice pool. The main attraction is the pool as the beach area is pretty to look at, but not one you would play in too much. The restaurants were excellent especially the new Puerto Rican one. However, if you are looking for nightlife, the hotel is very quiet in the evening. They do have a small casino, but 1/2 the machines were broken and there is not much to do except sit in the lounges. They also promised planned activities, complete with a calendar, but I only saw one or two in 4 days that I was there. The water sports hut was never manned although the equipment sat by the beach. I believe the hotel was quite empty for high season. The only other negative is that we had to call housekeeping daily to reissue our supply of towels, etc. Overall, a very pretty place, quiet and relaxing and excellent food.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: pumba8
Reviews.Content: I like many others was leery about this place ,due to the varied reviews. We returned a week ago and are still talking about our delight with the resort. We did upgade to royal service and highly recommend it. Many thanks to Angel C. who was helpful, charming and informative. His service was impeccable (including going off property to get a cigar for my husband.) We generally found all of the staff helpful. People seem to complain that the place is pricey but compared to many other places we have been this was a real find. We stayed Monday thru Monday and checking in on a weekend is likely a very different experience. the resort was very quiet when we arrived and stayed that way until saturday when there were weddings and a convention and checking in then was likely a hassle. We golfed four days out of seven at the nearby Trump course which was gorgeous. the only negative I had is that there are "noseeum on the beach " those miniscule little biting things . Didn't get warned about them and the first morning at dawn I walked on the beach and itched for days. I avoided the beach the rest of the trip. Room was lovely with Jacuzzi on balcony. (jacuzzi on balcony is really a little silly because there is not real privacy on the balcony.) restaurants on property were good and prices a little high but expectable in a nice resort. If it's a busy time of year make your reservation at the italian or asian before you arrive or you will be out of luck for the nite you arrive. The puerto rican restaurant had great food but a coffe shop decor ( a few tablecloths would help). Would love to return

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Karmucha
Reviews.Content: We love this place, beautiful golf course, very friendly staff, good restaurants, We"ll be back...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, far from City”
Reviews.Author: MeeraS
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at the Gran Melia Resort. Chose this place despite previous reviews on the quality of the beach due to the size of our party. The beach was incredibly rocky, although just as beautiful as any other. The service was impeccable, all staff members were prompt and polite at responding to requests. Downfalls included having to walk a lot to get to even our car or front lobby (guess that's why it's a 'resort' and not just a hotel!) and it is close to 45 minutes away from Old San Juan, a popular tourist attraction. Lots of cheap breakfast places nearby if you don't want to eat on the resort, though, and fairly close to El Yunque National Rainforest. Despite the pitfalls, I would recommend the place for anyone looking for a getaway in beautiful Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Superior Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelCat999
Reviews.Content: We found this resort to far exceed our expectations. The grounds, the rooms, the pool were exceptional and beautifully maintained. The staff was highly professional and contributed to a wonderful stay with their 'can-do' spirit. I would recommend a car for exploring; day trips to the rain forest and Old San Juan are enjoyable. In summary, I would have no hesitation in highly recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful place that needs lessons on how to run it's place!”
Reviews.Author: Jeffjet
Reviews.Content: Let me start off to say that this place is beautiful and has one of the best Bell mans on the Island. All the bellman I encountered bent over backwards to be courteous and as accommodating as possible. Dario was so nice he even gave me his private cell phone number to call him if I needed anything or any help. The head of security, Israel also was a true gentlemen and oversees a great staff of security personnel. When we arrived, our bags were swept away and taken to our unit. The bellman (Dario) walked us to the front desk and we were greeted with cold water. After reading many of the reviews on this page, I tried very hard to be non biased! Waiting for a receptionist, even though the place was empty was not expected at a well appointed resort like this. The receptionist seemed a little tenacious with her attitude towards me as a guest... as though she was doing me a favor for checking me in! She immediately asked for an imprint of my card of $100.00 per day, even though my trip was fully paid for! I asked why and she stated for incidentals, I then said that there will be no incidentals and that I was nervous to give an imprint because I read of other guests on this site complaining of getting unauthorized charges. I also stated that I was shocked that there were so many negative reviews of the resort on many websites. She then stated that I could give a $100.00 deposit but I would need to come to the front desk to have my keys re-keyed. At this point I asked for a manager who seemed to have the same attitude as the receptionist. In our conversation she told me that on average 5 out of 100 people are not satisfied at the end of there stay. 5% seems to be a bit high for unsatisfied clients at a resort. Now I understand why they were less than 50% unoccupied. We arrived to our room, which by the way was absolutely gorgeous and appointed like I never have seen before. The only problem was it smelled like a mildew problem. If you must stay at this resort I recommend a car as it is about a 10 minute ride to just get out of this secluded property. (I never saw a taxi) I am glad we had a car since there restaurants seemed to be a bit pricey $23.00 for a breakfast buffet that was less than average. The pool was breathtakingly beautiful, however service at the pool bar, was by far the poorest that I have ever experienced at any resort I have ever been at, and I have been practically on every Island in the Caribbean!
