There is no reason for a guest to wait over 10 minutes to be served especially with two bartenders and no one else at the bar! A good percentage of the other workers at this resort could not speak or understand a word of English! Having a pool table at the pool was nice, if only they had working pool sticks to compliment it. Getting a cork screw to open a bottle of wine, took well over an hour even with two phone calls to remind them that I needed one. The maids did a fair job of cleaning as my feet always looked black after walking in my room barefoot for 10 minutes. Towels were nice and ample. The soaps, shampoo and other toiletries were of high quality. The internet worked, but the signal by wireless and by cable was very weak. A dial up would have been faster. The beach or should I say the lack of sand was very disappointing. Definitely bring water shoes as the stones and rocks will make you feet sore. The Casino was a real joke, through out our stay 50% of the machines had signs on them stating they were out of order. One $10.00 Black Jack table, one roulette table were open. No craps tables and one entrance seal/locked which made me nervous because of the incident many years ago where people died in a fire in a casino in Puerto Rico because of locked exits! Be prepared to pay over $16.00 a day for parking as a guest, which is a total ripoff. The hotel does this to discourage you from going off property. If the Hotel was more service oriented, had reasonable prices for food and a half decent Casino, there would be no reason to go off site! This is the first time after my first day at a resort that I could not wait to leave the premises to eat, gamble and use a public beach that had sand!. In closing, management's lack of management at this hotel/resort has a lot to learn to run a successful profit making business. Gran Melia, if your reading this, you need to put the customer/guest first and do a much better job of pampering your guests/clientel instead of robbing them blind! I would never come back to this resort let alone this Island. No one wants to speak English, even the Police! More than half of the Puerto Ricans on the Island have an attitude and are not very tourist friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Flash in the Pan”
Reviews.Author: tenthtry
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort facility with splashy architectural details in a lobby that goes on forever, has spacious and comfortable rooms, a spectacular pool and landscaping and a lovely beach. The rate in early December was reasonable. But it has forgotten the central purpose of what a hotel should be: attention to basics (or is it that the standards go down with the price...?). Two days in a row, our room was not made when we arrived back from a long day`s touring, late in the evening. The first night, we had to wait a half hour before someone came to make the bed and change the towels. It was only on the third day that someone actually cleaned the room and bathroom. The bathtub didn't drain properly, the electrical outlet in the bathroom was dead, the thermostat was ''frozen'' (in every sense of the word) at 63 degrees resulting in the patio doors dripping with condensation -- the alternate option to shivering was to turn it off and swelter. The coffeemaker in the room produced cold coffee which in itself was tasteless anyway. What really rubbed us was that repeatedly, when we registered complaints about the unmade room, we were told it was our fault because we had left the ``Do not Disturb`` sign on, while in fact we hadn't even been provided with one in the first place. We ate at the on-site Italian restaurant once, where waiters did swan dances around the room but had to be asked three times for a roll and brought the wine after we had been served. The table was not dressed (no candles, no flowers, no under-plate for the bowl of pasta, etc..) all of this echoing the overall impression that this hotel is big on flash but low on class and service. Ultimately, our bill was reduced by $80+, the outlet and bathtub were repaired and the coffeemaker was replaced, which we appreciated, but we had to become very cranky in order to get attention. As an added thought: the hotel is located some distance from San Juan and most other tourist sites and there is virtually no public transportation outside of urban centres so that a rented car is necessary, but be prepared to pay $17.00 per day for parking at the hotel even though the property sits on acres and acres of land. By contrast, parking in downtown San Juan is inexpensive (about .75 cent per hour). The young chap at the hotel who fixed our flat tire with a smile was the best part of the experience and we were happy to tip him generously. Overall, Puerto Ricans are extremely affable and the island is rich in sites, street entertainment, restaurants, etc. We will readily return, but not likely at the Gran Melia.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, will be back.”
Reviews.Author: iqtsarah
Reviews.Content: I book the Garden View Royal Service room for 3 night an 4 days for me and my boyfriend. They have free drink hour from 6-9pm at the Royal service Lounge. The Royal service pool was not crowed and nice. I also have wi-fi in my room, so I was uploading my vacation photos online. I love this place so much. Food are a bit expensive inside. We rented a car so, me and my boyfriend ate out in Old San Juan two evening. It's about 40 minutes drive there. If you like a quite area resort, Gran Melia is a nice resort for you to relax. I can't wait to go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort with a bad location.”
Reviews.Author: Benito_G
Reviews.Content: Ok, I bought a resort in another hotel (Melia Caribe-Tropical, Dom. Rep.) so I went here as part of my collection program (free exchange), but the second time I went, I had to use the hotel facilities, not the resort. My experience before and after (using my resort exchange) was really great. But the hotel has some problems. First, the good stuff. The hotel is just beautiful, great finishes and textures everywhere. The pool is amazing but gets a little cold in "winter" (Caribbean winter). You can enjoy walking (if you travel with small children it might be wise to ask for a room near the lobby) due to the gardens. The bar/lounge is very relaxing and comfy, except during "shows". Now, the regular stuff. The restaurants are quite nice, I do recommend Oriental restaurant, but the others are not a good value, don't take me wrong it is not just the total cost (easily $100 for 2 adults), is that you might be expecting a little more for your money or at least a cost of $80 (not including alcoholic beverages). On the other side I bet they do this for you to buy the "all inclusive" package, that is only worthwhile if you drink alcoholic beverages (premium included). If you are using "all-inclusive" option you will find it a better value ($130 per day-person). The barmen and waiters do expect some gratuity (and these people are great). Let me end with the bad stuff. The front desk is slower than usual. With an empty front desk, expect to wait at least 5 minutes, with people around more than 20 (they do offer some free water/juice but who cares, I want to go to my room!). The front desk manager is a little on the rough side and I expected better service (The resort people are totally different). Also, I don't know why but they charge $50 per day if you want to use the cabanas around the pool (I can partially accept that in high season but with the hotel half full, come on!). Albeit, once paid for the cabanas and its totally worth it (the resort includes the use of the cabanas). The location requires you to rent a car is FAR from everything. To go eat outside my guess is at least 15 minutes to a BK, longer for better restaurants. If you have felt that I am in love with the resort part, you are not mistaken. Just let me be clear it is not the best business (as always), but their system is different than the typical time-share and I love their system and the two resorts I've been to. If you want to enjoy a time of relaxation this might be your place, if you want to know Puerto Rico my recomendation is go West (Rincon, Cabo Rojo).

Reviews.Title: “beautiful resort, rent a car”
Reviews.Author: brighttstar
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with 4 of my 20 something friendss- we got a really great value on this resort on cheapcarribean.com - i've been to a bunch of resorts in the carribean, and this one honestly has some of the most beautiful grounds i've seen. the pool is amazing. the beach isn't that great- but i highly recommend renting a car if you're going to stay here. there is a really nice beach about 15 minutes east of the resort, right off route 3. also, if you have a car, it's easy access to the rainforest and other restaurants in the area (richie's is recommended, go in the day for lunch or around sunset) food is expensive here, and so is parking. but because we had a car, we definitely saved money on food by exploring other options. the lunch restaurant right near the pool was reasonable, but dinner prices were ridiculous- we only ate at the puerto rican restaurant, which was good, but was about $200 for 4 people, with a bottle of wine. also, this is really a happening place nightlife wise- we hung out at the bar a couple of nights, but we weren't really looking to go out. i'd definitely recommend staying here if you can get a good deal- the rooms are huge, room service is very responsive (we called and asked for a corkscrew and got it right away). and everyone on the staff was really nice, and great about recommending off site restaurants and activities,

Reviews.Title: “Additional fee charged after we came back”
Reviews.Author: Christina80
Reviews.Content: They charged us additional fees after we came back from PR. When we checked out, they told us there was no additional fees except for parking. We paid for the parking at the front desk and left. However, i found my credit card was charged $47.8 besides parking after we went back to NY. I am not happy with this.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location and Property”
Reviews.Author: travelforlife05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for a 5 day trip. The property itself was very nice and the rooms were very large and nice. Our biggest complaint was the food. It was very expensive and not very good. Upon arrival, we found only one of the restaurants on the property was open. You need to check to see which restaurants are open which nights. I would HIGHLY suggest renting a car from the airport, not the resort, and using that car to travel to local restaurants and do all of your sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Melia amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndreaL4
Reviews.Content: We had terribley slow service because of the change over from an all inclusive hotel to non-inclusive but this was by far the most beautiful, clean hotel. The beach was not the greatest very rocky, but the decor and people were amazing. It is set far back from the main roads but was very quiet at night

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous resort, made for a fabulous trip!”
Reviews.Author: kton
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a gorgeous resort. A bit more expensive than what I typically would spend on a 5 day vacation like this (I enjoy going all-inclusive), but the resort and service was fantastic. I'd say 95% of the time I felt as though I got what I paid for. I was there for a friends committment ceremony so didn't have a choice with choosing the location, but enjoyed the resort thoroughly. It was a good 30 minutes from the airport and probably 40-45 from Old San Juan. We rented a car which was nice to have....almost necessary if staying there very long and want to get off the resort to do anything. Check-in was fairly smooth....it was early evening so no others at the front desk checking in at that time so that part was quick. However it started to rain once we got there so there was some confusion among the valet guys and the bellman who take you to the room so we had to wait a bit to get a cart/van to take us there. We had a gardenview room (no royal service) and while our villa was a ways from the main lobby (villa 800), the room was absolutely amazing! An in-room fridge would have been nice since the only one there was stocked (and sensored) so we left it alone, but the room/bathroom itself was large, nicely decorated, very clean, cool and our king bed was extremely comfortable. I thought the cleaning and service staff around the resort was extremely friendly. Everyone driving by on golf carts always said hello when passing if they weren't stopping and asking you if you'd like a ride. The pool is amazing....loved the built in layout beds which allow you to be half submerged in the pool. The beach left a lot to be desired though....barely any beach there really. But we relaxed one day on the beach chairs (on the grass) near the beach and could still listen to the ocean waves crashing so we managed. Also waded in the water one day and while the bottom of the ocean is a little rocky, you could find some sandy areas to stand in for a while and cool off. We went off the resort to a public beach to find a more 'picturesque' beach which was nice during the afternoon (during the week) because was almost entirely secluded. I did get bit up a ton though by mesquito's or whatever the little gnats were that were around the grounds. And it seemed within the wedding party half of us were bitten up and others weren't. So I think it just might depended if you're more prone to getting bit but until you know...strongly advice the use of some bug spray. I had a few swell up into huge welts on my legs that were rather miserable at times. We ate at Nami (Asian Bistro) and Tempo (Italian Resturant) and found them both to be very delicious and reasonably priced. I really think the food around the resort was very good and not priced too badly. It's not cheap by any means....but reasonable for that type of resort. I think some of the drinks were overpriced....but no different than if you're out downtown in a big city. Expect to pay roughly $8-12 for a mixed drink or martini. Even though we were paying a hefty price I always thought they seemed relatively strong at least. We used the pool one night and even had a little "party" gathering with some beer we brought in ourselves with a few of the other wedding guests and never had anyone tell us we weren't allowed to do that or that we were being too loud...so that part was nice. I had read reviews about being "nickled and dimed" with additional room charges so anytime I charged something to our room, I made sure to ask for a receipt so I could remember everything charged. My suggestion would be to just use your credit card instead (it will eventually go on there anyways). I only charged drinks probably 3 different times but the bills are a bit difficult to review as every individual thing was seperated out on the bill. Meaning if your drink bill at one of the bars was $24, you'd see that charge plus the $3 tip you left. Also note: we did not tip housekeeping staff (not on purpose either), thought about it on the 2nd day but never did end up leaving anything and noticed when checking out, we were charged $3 a day for housekeeping so in my opinion, that's probably good enough. Whether those individuals actually see that money is probably another story though. Also were charged $15 for bellman service (I'm assuming that was for when we checked in and bags were taken to our room). I thought that was rather unnecessary as of course we tipped them ourselves up front. But then I thought about how many times were were given rides around the resort in golf carts and just decided to leave well enough alone. After reviewing our bill, didn't see anything on there that we didn't charge so was happy I didn't have to haggle upon checkout. We were there for a short stay (3 full days, 2 travel days) but were still able to do some great sighseeing. We enjoyed going into Old San Juan...seeing the historical sights, walking around and grabbing a bite of "authentic" Puerto Rican cuisine. Also went up to the rainforest and hiked to the waterfall that you can swim in. Good 30 minute hike but the waterfall was amazing and while the water was extremely cool to get it....found it refreshing and would have felt like we missed out on something had we not gotten in the water! Overall really enjoyed Puerto Rico and would love to go back. I'd go back to Gran Melia possibly to stay a few nights if relaxation is what you're looking for....but probably stay a few nights closer to San Juan to be a little closer to the action. Overall Gran Melia is a gorgeous resort....maybe a bit on the expensive side, however for the price I do think you get what you pay for in quality and service. So don't be afraid to stay there at all....even if on a bit of a budget. You just have to be a bit more selective with you're spending but guarantee a fabulous time will be had!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED Gran Melia! Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: jess116000
Reviews.Content: I returned last night from the Gran Melia. Let me start out by saying that I loved it & will most def be back in the future. We had the regular garden room, which was just perfect. The grounds are beautiful on the resort. Very maintained! The staff is very helpful & went above and beyond to give us helpful info about PR. Noel the concierge was extremely helpful & very friendly. The Gran Melia is very open and the lobby/bar areas are just gorgeous. They had a DJ and a caribbean band every night we were there. The band was great. Bar drinks were good (not any more expensive than anywhere else). We only had Thanksgiving lunch @ the resort, and it was excellent. The rest of the time we ate in Old San Juan and tried a few local restaurants around the Gran Melia. We rented a car bc i dont like to depend on a cab/shuttle. I like to be able to go anytime i want to. So i highly recommend getting a car. The resort is only about 30-40min from airport...its not far in mileage but there are lots of redlights & traffic is kind of crazy. The resort is very close to the rainforest, which is a must while you are in PR. We also did the Biolumenescent Bay which was probably one of the most amazing things i have ever seen. Old San Juan has great shopping, nightlife, some amazing restaurants, and not to forget the fort! There is so much to offer on this island! I have been all over the caribbean and i have to say this is one of my favorites! Not to mention they have the same shopping as we do back home! ha! I had lots of ppl tell me the beaches are ugly in PR...but the Gran Melias beach is BEAUTIFUL!!! I loved it there and will be back no doubt! Just rent a car, and explore the island as much as you can. It has alot to offer, and is truly a beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Melia honeymoon review”
Reviews.Author: AdrianM1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent three wonderful days at Gran Melia for our honeymoon and loved every aspect of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a nice stay but check your bill!”
Reviews.Author: camolady
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with a group of 25 of us for a wedding. The hotel is about 30 min. from the airport. We knew this going in so we rented a car. Overall, the hotel is clean and well maintained but there was someone in our group that had a room that smelled like mold as other people have mentioned. The grounds are beautiful but very spread out. It was a .3 mile walk from our room to the main lobby/pool area. This was fine when it was nice outside but it did rain one day and we waited for over a half hour for a cart to pick us up. It never came so we ended up walking in the rain. The staff was always very helpful. Especially Angel. Overall I would say the service was good. We only had the breakfast buffet and ate at the pool bar. Breakfast at $22 a person seemed overpriced. Lunch at the pool bar was reasonable at around $10-$15 for sandwiches and salads. Drinks were pricey - beer was $4.50 for a 10 oz. can and frozen drinks were $9-$10 each. We had dinner at Richie's offsite and it was excellent. Entrees range from $15-$40. They provide a shuttle and will pick you up and bring you back to the resort. Make sure to return your towels every day or they will charge you $30 per towel. Also check your bill with the front desk frequently. Almost all of us were overcharged for something along the way. Towels, extra drinks, double charged for spa treatments and one person's entire bill was charged twice on their credit card. It seems as though this was done on purpose as I'm sure not everyone checks their bill as closely and they hope to get away with it. When we asked them to remove the incorrect charges they did so without hesitation. I've stayed at alot of four and five star resorts in Aruba, Cancun and Jamaica and although I enjoyed my stay here, I would probably recommend the others I stayed at first. For a five star hotel, I wouldn't expect to run into some of the problems mentioned above. I suppose I would recommend this hotel but make sure they were aware of these issues

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Fantastic Resort!”
Reviews.Author: NYTraveler57_9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for 4 days and 3 nights to get away and unwind from our hectic life. While some say this resort is remote, since it is 30 minutes from San Juan, we found the seclusion perfect to relax from the hustle and bustle of the city. We could have stayed closer to the city but that's a personal choice and the distance in no way detracts from the amenities of this wonderful hotel. The grounds are absolutely stunning and well maintained. Wild life included chamelons, iguanas and various large and small waterfowl which made the walk from our room to the main building seem like a nature tour. The staff were simply amazing, catering to our every whim and need. We stayed in the junior suite by the adult only pool and were pampered by our personal butlers, Angel C and Angel M. Simply put, they took care of our every need from reserving poolside palapas to arranging for transportation for day trips to making reservations at the various restaurants. Angel M was particularly adept at getting things done and making things happen sometimes before we even finished verbalizing our request. He arranged a beautiful anniversary dinner reservation at Tempo, the resort's Italian restaurant, fixing us up with a wonderfully attentive waiter Joel who made the night particularly memorable with his excellent service and meal and wine suggestions. The resort has a large central pool with a wondefully convenient swim up bar and grill. We spent most of our time at the adults only pool which is smaller but more secluded. Rich, the poolside bartender kept us happy with a panopoly of special drinks, one better than the next. He was extraordinarily attentive and jovial. In short, the staff was incredible and in my various world travels, I can honestly say I have never been so admirably served and attended to. In four days we became so friendly with the staff we disparaged leaving them. Rich quipped he was not sure I was still breathing because I was so relaxed and asleep each morning on our palapa by the pool. The spa was beautifully appointed and we had a "couples massage" that was simultaneously relaxing and sensual. Once again the staff was extremely accomodating. The three restaurants , Italian, Asian fusion and Puerto Rican venues were all fantastic and the prices were reasonable from our reference point of inhabitants of New York. Every night there was a free open bar Happy hour from 6 to 7 pm. The casino was moderately sized but quite functional and we fortunately were able to win back some of our vacation expenses at the slot machine and black jack tables. We took only one side trip to old San Juan. Rental cars were available on site but the resort offers an evening shuttle from 7 to midnight. We took a cab to go in earlier and were in Old San Jan in 30 minutes. While some reviews say this resort is somewhat remote, it was a nice contrast returning to its peacefulness and solitude after a bustling day in San Juan. In summary , we loved the Gran Melia and would return there in a New York minute. The rooms were spacious and well appointed, the staff including Angel M, Angel C, Rich the bartender and Joel the waiter were beyond amazing and the restaurants were fantastic. If you want to get away and spend a relaxing, peaceful, pampered vacation, THIS IS THE PLACE TO DO IT!

Reviews.Title: “What a Staff”
Reviews.Author: Crkt
Reviews.Content: I will try to keep this as postive as possible but this resort has some problems. First off the staff was absolutely incredible. From arrival, check-in/out, bartenders, and butlers were all top notch. Friendly, professional and willing to do whatever it took to make our stay wonderful. Many of them thanked us for spending the time and money in the dour economy and hoped we would return. We upgraded to an ocean front for an added charge and upon moving in found the room to have a musty or moldy smell. My wife and I are both very sensitive to this problem so returned to the front desk the next day to request a move. It was granted but before we packed our things I suggested we check it out first. Whew! It was terrible. Much worse than the first one. So we went back to request another room. This was granted later in the day and we were moved one building over and upstairs. This room was much better although my wife could smell the odor in the bathroom. The room was very comfortable with a large bath, bedroom and sitting room. There was also a patio with a jacuzzi but we didn't spend much time there due to the mosquitoes. Ouch. The resort is very, very isolated. We bought R/T transfers with our vacation package so unless you rent a car (the resort will charge you $25/day parking) you are stuck with the resort. However, that being said, with a very large pool and a somewhat more quaint butler service pool, four restaurants and enough bars available, one really doesn't need to leave. The food service was very good for both breakfast and dinner but ask about Richies. They'll come to get you in a van and drop you off after dinner. Absolutely awesome food. The owner even bought our table a round of drinks. Cool. Richard, the bartender at the BS pool along with Angel M and Angel C were incredible. In most cases you didn't need to ask for anything, they seemed to know and were more than willing to go out of there way. All three were a great asset to the resort. This was at the smaller quieter pool compared to the large and noisier pool for kids. There seemed to always be a lot of noise around the grounds as the groundskeepers stayed busy, plus a new JW Marriott's is going up just behind the Gran Melia. In short, would we go here again? No. Although I was led to believe this was a new resort, it is an old Paradisius with a new name although it is in fairly good condition. But the mold problems require immediate attention or they won't have a very good occupancy rate. I could deal with it being isolated but like to go to a close by store to pick up a few essentials ie, beer and snacks. You can't do that there. The beach is very narrow with brown sand, unlike the wide, white sand beaches of Condado, and the water has lots of sea grass so you can't see what's in the water. Also, if you decide to taxi in towards the city you'll need about $60/person each way into Old San Juan. Take the checkbook and have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Will never come back again”
Reviews.Author: BoriquaPuertoRico
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay over night in this hotel to have time for ourselves on our anniversary. We picked this hotel because it was close to our house. We booked online through hotel website. When we're checking in the front desk offered if we want to upgrade to royal service. But we decided not to just because we only stayed for 1 night. The room was ok, but that's the only thing we got for the price we paid, not even a bottle of water as a complimentary. Then we had dinner at Passion Resturant, boy..ooohhh..boy...I wished I didn't had dinner there. The food was just ok and it was so over priced. I found a piece of plastic wrap in my soup. In the morning we decided to use the pool. We went to the pool right across our room. When I was about to get into the pool, a guy approached and asked our room number. Then he told us that we had to use main pool which is on the other side of the hotel because the one accross our room was only for Royal Service. They should have told us when we're checking in. No body did, not even the front desk. How embarassing is that?? I felt like I was some kind of thief got busted. And it's fot the stupid swimming pool. I will never ever get back to this hotel again !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: jcgn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for an entire week, during their low-season and had a wonderful time! I have to say that the butler that took care of us was INCREDIBLE... yes, we had what they called butler service and I highly recommend you go for it if visiting this hotel. Our balcony had an amazing jacuzzi on it that our butler had ready to go for us, complete with bubbles, candles, wine... you name it, and when we would request it he would have a fairy-tale setting ready for us to enter into after coming back from dinner. Simply paradise... We LOVED, LOVED, LOVED the "palapas" next to the private pool (access to this pool came with the special butler service) and chose one between the pool and beach. We spent the week lounging in our palapa with the ocean on one side and the pool on the other... with fresh fruit and drinks delivered to our own personal, romantic, comfortable bed... We were there every day from right after breakfast through to the late afternoon and enjoyed every single second... I want to have a palapa in my backyard now! Bottom line, pay extra for the butler service. You will be taken special care of with special private pool access and palapa, butler service to prepare your romantic jacuzzi tub, and you will be waited on hand and foot. The spa services were also VERY nice - at least my massage, manicure and pedicure were very, very well done. A little pricey, but very well done. Food was delicious with a great variety of restaurants - I just wish you didn't have to pay so much to go to restaurants outside of the hotel! They want you to dine in their resort so it's a challenge to go elsewhere unless you rent a car. I must say though that the food at the 4 hotel restaurants was VERY good.

Reviews.Title: “Bad security, they stole my laptop!”
Reviews.Author: PRVacationist
Reviews.Content: I was staying on the Hotel, and from our room the last day my laptop was stolen. When we spoke to the Security people in charge they told me that they were very sorry, and this happened a lot on this hotel. Other things that were stolen were wedding rings and jewelry from guests! Please don't go!!

Reviews.Title: “For a 5 star hotel they did not show us 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: NJDentalGrl
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from the Gran Melia Puerto Rico today and we were actually pretty disappointed. I have been to other 5 star resorts and sadly it didn't live up to the others. We were at the hotel for a family wedding I felt my main issue with the hotel was how shady the business staff was. After checking in and having to wait 3 hours for our room, come to find out we were all offered Royal Service upgrade at different prices. Some people were offered as high as $200 per day and other couples received it for $75 per day (for the same exact service). When confronted on this fact, they could not answer us as to why this was happening. Upon reviewing our final bill we were automatically charged for bellman service at check in and again at check out (no one once offered to pick up our bags), my husband and I were never informed that tips would automatically be added to our bar bills when we were already tipping (very well might I add) the bartendars. After reviewing the receipts that I signed, the automatically added tips were not on there. Long story short they weren't honest with us. As far as value goes....no one goes to a five star resort is looking for value we know this. But if you want us to pay for 5 star, give us 5 star. The rooms were so-so, definitely did not live up to the Excellence Cancun. Food was served cold or extremely dried out. The service was mediocre at best. We went to the Puerto Rican restaurant for dinner and my cousin had to wait for her steak for 45 min after everyone's food had come out and not even offered an apology. However, I did find that I liked that restaurant the best as far as food quality is concerned. The grounds and view were beautiful and kept very clean. As far as service goes, for the most part people were friendly and helpful, again with the exception of the business staff. I must say the wedding and reception was ABSOLUTELY beautiful and very well done. To wrap up, would I go here again? Absolutely not. The Excellence in Cancun, which I am partial to, is 4.5 stars and the quality, value, resort and service is way beyond that of the Gran Melia

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Best”
Reviews.Author: justice1950
Reviews.Content: After reservations about negative coments from others about this resort, I was very concerned about this property. It is quite possible that other travelers are not comfotable with Five Star Resorts and pricing or they just expect something for nothing. Let me just assure you that this place was incredible. Having stayed at numerous resorts in Costa Rica, Dominican Republic, ands others in the Carabbean I was just blown away. We booked a Royal Service Ocean View room and when we checked in, It was not available, they put us in a private villa WOW. Private pool, cabbana, indoor and outdoor shower, great room and Angel our Butler. As far as the resturants they were terrific with the exception of the Carabbean which later I found out was a consession facilty not operated by the Hotel (I wound skip this one service is slow and food bland) The others are just great and prices are normal for a resort like this. As far as prices, service and cleanliness this is truely a five star resort. Negatives Spa extremely overpriced Casino small beach is limited for walking Positives Great service, good food, relaxing, quiet and worth the $ Yes they do charge your credit card upon check in for deposit ( that is normal anywhere) They do charge for parking (big deal) Mini Bar will charge you if you take something out and put it back (sensors read item) Bar drinks around $3.00 normal for carabbean Free happy hour with Royal Service do your drinking there All in all a very relaxing resort of quality and Service (Angel our Butler was just fantastic) So just forget those reviews you read about negative comments about this place, I know from traveling some people just can't be happy and complain about everything, you see it at every review site Austin, Texas

Reviews.Title: “Stay away of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: namaral
Reviews.Content: Our experience with this hotel was unpleasant to say the least. We reserved a deluxe ocean front suite to celebrate my birthday. At our arrival the room that was given to us had a tunberable of mold (which I discovered, it was all around the bathroom ceiling) and was quiet uncomfortable to breath. My son is very allergic, and we could not remain in the room. We immediately complained to the front desk Manager and was told that another room would be provided, however we had to wait to be cleaned up. After lunch, another room was given to us, only to discover in the evening, when my husband turned up the air conditioner that the system started to make a strange noise, and was not working properly. The noise kept my husband up most of the night. My 7 year old and I were able to sleep out of exhaustion of long flight and delay in getting another room. Next day ,we went to the front desk about the matter and were told that the only room available was a Villa (which seemed odd based on our observation that the hotel was pratically empty during our arrival and at breakfast). After seeing the Villa which was nicely furnitured and appealing, we were promised a rate of $850 a night which we agreed. However, at check out 9 days later, we discovered that was not the case. We had pre paid the total of 10 days for an ocean suite via orbitz ,and could not get them on the phone to help us with this issue. The Hotel Manager told us that the $850 was on top of the rates already paid via Orbitz for an ocean suite, which is absolutely ridiculous. I was not in a PRESIDENTIAL Penthouse . In other words, they trick us into getting a Villa and paying a price of almost $1,500 a day, especially after all the aggravation we went through with previous rooms. When we continue to check the bill, we realized that there were charges for water sports, which my 6 year old could not have ever used. The charges were placed by the Children's Club babysitter, and meals that my son, told me he did not have. Also, don't touch the items on top of the desk in the Villas, which they told us were complement of the hotel, whatever we ate or drink from that tray were all in our bill, down to the peanuts!!! Another thing that we were not told about is the distance of this hotel from downtown and Airport. The hotel provides no shuttle services to any area outside the premises. Prepare to spend a minimum of US$85 on a cab ride to downtown (45 to 50 min ride). Hotel is totally isolated, and the 3 restaurants in the premises, leave much to be desired. One is japonese, therefore, if that is not your type of food, you would have to wait hours to be served on the only so called "gourmet" eatery in the hotel. My husband got so annoyed with the time the waiter was taking to get him a drink, that he got up and went to the bar to get his own. The food again after almost 2hrs wait for 3 dishes ordered ,came lukewarm, and it was nothing to brag about. This hotel will never see us again......Stay way from the beach, unless you don't mind to swim in a pool of seedweed . We went mid May - which is probably low season for the hotel, and still had to wait for everything, room service, meals. The only positive was the weather, which was nice and warm and gave us reason to go to the pool, since the beach, neither one of us cared for. My son, made a friend there and that helped him past the time. We ended up renting a car to avoid having to eat on the same restaurant and deal with the extreme slow service every night. The Marriot hotel and the the local restaurant on the top of the hill became our lunch & dinner hang out. Avoid the Ritz Italian restaurant in downtown, overpriced and the food was not at the level one would expect from this hotel. There was absolutely alomost zero entertainment during the evening, aside from the casino which was also very empty compare to other Caribbean islands we have visited. Very very very disappointed ex-Customer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: MDTraveler99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Gran Melia for five nights in August. They were running a special, so we got a great deal. The resort is beautiful and our room was very large and nice. The resort is kind of out of the way, so you will definitely need a car, otherwise you may feel trapped in the resort. It does take 30-40 minutes to drive to Old San Juan. As far as the hotel itself is concerned, I would give it four stars. We had fun staying there. The pool area and the grounds are very nice, but the beach is very rocky. They do have a number of overpriced restaurants in the resorts. We only tried the breakfast buffet once, which was very nice. I also tried the burger at their poolside grill and I must say that it was probably the worst burger I have ever had. The meat was very tough. I was afraid to ask what it was. For the most part, we tried to find local restaurants that people had recommended on the web. So, if you have a car, I would recommend doing this. I did not experience some of the negatives that people had reported here, but I did have some minor issues. They do hold a daily charge on your credit card that you can charge against around the resort. This was not too bad, but based on what I had read here, it seems that they pull the amount out of the air, since it seems to be different for different people. On Sunday around 11 AM, they were out of towels for the pool and they kept saying that they would have more in 30 minutes. There is no excuse for this, since the hotel was barely half full. Also, the Marriott is starting to build a resort next door, so the construction noise could be a factor in the coming months.

Reviews.Title: “Simply, incredible!”
Reviews.Author: ABFSpain
Reviews.Content: Just...go and enjoy for your own! Incredible property, nice people, amazing pool, huge and nice rooms, beautiful gardens, lovely food and restaurantes...and, soooo cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but feels like your kept hostage!!”
Reviews.Author: monroe121607
Reviews.Content: First of all I read so many reviews trying to decide where I wanted to have my honeymoon. I finally decided on this rsort because the pictures looked really pretty and the reviews weren't so bad about the resort itself. The only big complaint was the fact that there's nothing around the resort. I thought that it would be fine and that most of the people were just picky. So i booked the trip. The first impression was "WOW"! This hotel was beautiful and the grounds and gardens are so well kept. The ocean is beautiful and the view is amazing. Our room was very nice. We got a royal service jujior suite with a huge spa tub with jets on the balcony. The view was ocean front and it was spectacular!! The firsat day we relaxed and enjoyed some time by the huge pool and ate at the swim up bar which was resonable and the food was good. The drinks are small and overpriced, but that was expected. The first night we were still excited by everything new and had dinner in 1 of 2 restaurants open. The food was not that good and it was soooo expensive. But we had planned on one nice dinner out for our honeymoon. The next day we had seen everything at the resort, yes it was relaxing, but after you've seen everything it gets a little boring. There is NOTHING to do at this resort at night. There is only the lobby bar (which is pretty) or the Casino (where no one was winning anything) We tried to play and the machines seemed like they didn't give anything back at all!!! The cafe and the swim up bar/restaurant all close at around 5:30pm. These restaurants are the only place with resonably priced food. After that you only have 2 restraurant choices that change each night for food. They basically force you to have to spend that money for not so good food. Almost everyone was complaining about the food!! They do this beause there is not any other way to get food unless you rent a car for the entire time you're there which is minimum $70 a day. The resort is so far away from anything in walking distance. This brings me to my next point: The hotel should offer some sort of shuttle into town or something for entertainment, but they don't. I thought I would be okay with just hanging around the resort, but my husband and I were bored out of our mind. We joked around about being hostages in the resort. I am really torn about writing this review because the resort itself is gorgeous and the people were really helpful (Manuel and Mark at the concierge desk were fantastic). But there isn't any form of entertainment in this hotel short of a lobby bar and casino. If your not on any sort of budget then this resort is for you. Food cost wouldn't be a problem and renting a car for the days wouldn't be an issue. For people on a budget and trying to get the most for your money then find another hotel closer into town (San Juan) where taxi rides are feasible (taxi ride to this resort one way is about $60) Puerto Rico itself is a beautiful place and we wished we had gotten a hotel closer to old San Juan and enjoyed more of the island. I hope this helps someone out there looking for the right place.

Reviews.Title: “I WANT TO GO BACK NOW!”
Reviews.Author: pieces74
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I stayed at this hotel for a bit of business and much pleasure! We had planned to go to Puerto Rico a few months back and I was invited to stay at this resort as a site visit. This resort was beautiful, plush, clean, inviting, and breath taking. We stayed at one of the Villas and had the Royal Service treatment. You MUST sign up for this service when you go. Angel, the Royal Service butler, was PHENOMENAL! He really cares abouthis customers, which is evident from his service style. Regardless of how many people he is working with he makes you feel like you and your party have all of his attention. Richard, who handles the bar at the private Royal Service pool was also another great person working at the property. He was very helpful, made the BEST drinks, (Blue Special and another fruity drink for me) and was so gracious to us. He gave us great suggestions on places to go to at night and just a great person. Angel and Richard defintiely made our stay special. Next, Illuminada, one of the bartenders during happy hour took great care of us, too. She had a pelasant attitude and, again, made special drinks for us. The food at the resort is DIVINE! We ate at Tempo, the first night, which is Italian cuisine. The chef is phenomenal. The seafood risotto, calamari, and unique desserts will take your breath away. We also at sushi at Nami, which is also on property. The prices are so inexpensive for a resort and the quality was at th highest! Finally, our site inspection manager, Edward O'Neill was an awesome guide during our stay was THE BEST! He is very kind, funny, sincere, and knowledge able about the property. This resort is a great place for weddings and business events, too. If you are looking to have a piece of paradise and literally, forget what time it is, this is the place to go. This will be an annual trip for me, no doubt!

Reviews.Title: “WOW... Romantic place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Islandtraveler069
Reviews.Content: We went to the Melia for our 25th wedding anniversary. It was wonderful from the start. Everyone was so friendly and professional. Our every need was taken care of. We were in one of the junior ocean view suites. The whirlpool on the balcony was great, champaine, stawberries, candles and flowers.... We had five star service all the way. We spent an evening on the beach getting a couples massage. Worth every penny! Only a short drive, about 30 minutes into San Juan. A great place to return to after being in the city. Pool was clean and beautiful. Spendt a lot of time at the swim up bar..... It was a wonderful place to stay and I will return. If you want a quiet place to relax and enjoy someone special this is the place to do it.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: NHlovewarmweather
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. We truly enjoyed our stay. Angel and Richard in the royal service area were absolutely wonderful. The royal service upgrade was definitely worth it! We would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Second Trip to Gran Melia, even better than the first...”
Reviews.Author: lovePR1
Reviews.Content: We loved the Gran Melia so much the first time, that I couldnâ€™t resist coming back a second time after finding a great deal online. This was a last minute trip, with no regrets. Everyone was as friendly as the first time, and attentive to our needs. We had dinner at Passion, and the Bisque was amazing. Our waiter Daniel was very nice, and made wonderful suggestions. Check in was a breeze. Checking out took a little longer, only because we were making small talk with the friendly girls at the front desk. They gave us lots of wonderful suggestions to local shopping places. We also went to the casino one night, which is small, but fun. We left with more than we went in with. My friends and I have vowed to make this place a yearly trip. It still amazes me the things people complain about. Why would anyone want an additional credit of $150 after receiving a room for additional nights at $50? Isnâ€™t that a good enough deal for such a nice hotel? Also, clearly not everything has a price tag, if you received a free fridge rental.

Reviews.Title: “A little slice of heaven if you know what to expect . . .”
Reviews.Author: whonew
Reviews.Content: We travelled to the Gran Melia for our honeymoon and read many reviews prior to our stay. The resort was AMAZINGLY beautiful - beach front and very grand. We got the Royal Service upgrade which I would HIGHLY recommend, you have access to a smaller, adults only pool with attendant, beachfront balcony with private jacuzzi and it also includes basic continental breakfast (fruit, cereal, toast, bagel, etc) and drinks at happy hour. A few other travellers had room difficulties but ours was perfect - clean, well stocked and luxurious. The pool side "beds" at the royal service pool are included and can be reserved, definitely worth checking out to relax in for the day by the pool. Ask for Angel, he is fantastic. The main pool seemed very crowded and loud (many kids running around) at times and the poolside beds there are $50/day. We rented a car at the airport - MUCH cheaper than at the hotel and allowed us to venture out to do things like hike in the rainforest, kayak at night and horseback ride on our own. You can do all of this through the hotel for 2-3x the actual cost, so renting a car is definitely a $$ saver. The downside is that the hotel charges you $16/day for parking. We were aware of this ahead of time and still saved $$.. Watch for hidden fees, don't touch the mini bar, the hor bar items at breakfast are NOT included, and the onsite restaurants are overpriced and not all that great. We had read this in previous reviews, were prepared and had a GREAT time. Would stay here again. Call Richie's for a great meal and they will pick up at the hotel and return you after dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience in 15 Years”
Reviews.Author: Bunnsarelli
Reviews.Content: As many times as I have been to the Caribbean, this was a hotel that should be avoided. The room bathroom and pool were fabulous but the good things end there. It began with a dirty room, smelling of mold which was black and visible on the air vents. The hallways were unkempt and the room was also not swept with dust bunnies rolling around the floor. When we asked for a different room we were told that a group was coming in two days and they couldn't move us. The hotel was only at 10% capacity when we arrived. Upon arrival we had asked for an upgrade and were refused. Basically they refused everything I asked for the entire trip. I had purchased this trip 10 months prior through Back To The Caribbean and had bought 6 nights. When I made the reservation, it had been reduced to 4 nights, but alas they said I could purchase additional nights for $50. Everything you want or need has a price tag attached and the customer is never right. Housekeeping had to be called everyday to get the items they forgot to leave in the room, like towels washcloths and bath mat. Even though they profess to be green and ask to re-use towels by hanging, they disregarded this and took all the towels every day. Guests are not permitted to bring food from off premises though most of the people staying there did. The restaurants and bar prices were double for the value received. Do not open the fridge in the room because when you do, if you lift something out of it, they charge you for it even if it is not consumed. Michael the bell captain was instrumental in getting us a spare fridge for our room for no charge when it usually costs $25/day. As far as customer service goes, he was the only one on the property who was the least bit helpful and courteous. I did make a mistake and charge a tiny cup of coffee to the room. $2.41. Upon checkout this bill turned into $9.58. Though they had my signed receipt for the coffee they also had a separate receipt for coffee and a sandwich with no signature that had been charged to the room as well. When I told them it was not mine, they said it didn't matter because it was charged to my room so I had to pay for it. Causing a scene at the desk about this did get me a manager who generally was just a figment of anyone's imagination who finally removed the charge from my tab. The usual time share speech was also a challenge. Most guests received $150 off their bill. They gave me nothing for my two hours. They said because I had purchased a discounted room rate that I was not entitled to a gift because the lower price room was my gift. UNBELIEVABLE. After speaking to 5 people, including showing them the letter saying I would get the gift, I still was told too bad. No gift. They had previously said if I had a letter indicating such, it would be granted. NOT! The lobby bar even at 50% capacity had bartenders who took twenty minutes to ask what they could get us. No smile, no thank you, no "are you having a good time?", just.. "room number?" Don't waste your vacation time on this poor hotel that doesn't care about it's guests, and only wants your wallet.

Reviews.Title: “A lil' slice of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: TerryTy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the Gran Melia in Puerto Rico for our 3rd year anniversary. I will keep this as brief as possible, but give good insight by doing a Good and Bad list. Good: marble floors in the bungalows and the main lobby, surrounded by the ocean and less than a 5 minute walk from the beach. We had a garden view, but we could look off our balcony or out the front door and the ocean, so paying for ocean view would have been a waste, the restaurants at the resort are top notch. We had the best Shrimp Alfredo we have ever had at Passion. Friendly and knowledgeable staff, the landscaping is breath-taking, the resort pool is also awesome. Luquillo also has awesome food. Old San Juan is also very cool. We didn't experience the nightlife, due to not being comfortable with the highway signs at night, but will do so next time. A rental car is a must! Drive around to become acclimated more quickly than we did, but by the end of our stay we were fairly comfortable. Bad:during days when the resort is full, parking is very, very, very,very scarce. Tends to rain between 12-3 daily, so hit the pool and the beach at the resort early to be sure you won't be rained out. Drivers generally are very aggressive and have little regard for traffic rules or road courtesy. Beware of gnats on the beach if you are an early riser. I captured some pics of the sunrise over the ocean, but I suffered over 30 bites that still itch after 6 days! Lastly, our room stayed cold(you can't turn it off), so my camcorder and camera would often fog up once taken outside, so allowed 15-30 minutes for your camera equipment to get ready. All in all we had an awesome time and are looking forward to going back to Gran Melia in the next 2 years or so.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, decent location”
Reviews.Author: Bellesie
Reviews.Content: The hotel property was beautiful, check in was a breeze (but it was not right at check in time). The bed was comfy. Our only issue (and it was MINOR) was with housekeeping. We had issues on a few days with getting restocked with toiletries, towels, hand towels, and I think there is a washcloth shortage there (we kept getting hand towels when we asked for washcloths). When we called, they were very responsive on getting us what we needed and had housekeeping there within 5 minutes of calling. I can't comment on the restaurants because we dined at local places (and cheated- BK is EVERYWHERE and a frosty just hit the spot in the humidity). We had no issues with parking (we had an Avis car that we got from the airport but we just said "Avis" and they let us in- no fees!) and had a small soft sided cooler that we didn't get questioned on- maybe because it looked more like a tote than a cooler. There was two different areas of beach, neither of them I'd swim off of, but it was nice to wander and see all the little hermit crabs, shells, etc. If you aren't on the main "beach" part though, beware of sand fleas and pick up some bug spray. (My legs look like I got attacked by a swarm of mosquitoes and it's almost a week later- and they ITCH!) Everyone at the hotel was friendly and helpful. We had a bungalow towards the front of the resort so we did not have far to walk, but we were always getting offered rides on the golf carts. We enjoyed our morning coffee watching the iguanas, little lizards, egrets and other wild life, and if you're driving down the road to the hotel at night, watch out for crabs crossing the street! Overall, there was nothing that wasn't fixed to our satisfaction or was totally terrible or worth complaining about. I read everything here and wasn't sure what I was in for, but did know in advance that the food was going to be expensive, they were going to hold money on my card, and that I'd probably have to pay for parking. I travel often for business and pay $25 in Cleveland at the hotel, so I don't think paying for parking is unusual or unheard of. As many others have said- rent a car, it's worth it to have wheels. Just watch out for traffic- it's not like on the mainland at all! Police drive around with their lights on and no sirens, there are a few street names, mostly numbers, and getting good directions is a challenge- "go down about 6-7 lights, drive by where there's only trees, you'll drive over the road that goes bump bump bump, and you'll see it." LOL! And, watch out for the occasional stray dog, cat or chicken in the road... and people trying to sell you water or panhandle. They are brave souls for sure! Other stuff: Coco Sweet at the entrance of the resort road had good pastries and breakfast sandwiches, and very reasonable prices too- pastries were $1, same for juice. We enjoyed a few meals at the kiosks in Luquillo- El Jefe Burger Shack had great burgers, excellent service, and cheap beer! Their cheese sauce is DELISH. We also dined at La Parilla for a nice dinner- their flank steak is incredible with the beans and rice, and my boyfriend really enjoyed his lobster. Fina China on 3 was decent quick Chinese food- no won ton or egg rolls though- it came with fries instead (they were good, just a peculiar combo with fried rice- to me anyway, and they'll even give you fries at Taco Bell) Enjoy the different fruit shakes that you can find just about anywhere- mango, guava, passion fruit, etc. The Camuy caves are pretty cool to check out- it's about a 2 hour ride from the hotel. Other reviews said to call ahead- we tried but got no answer. We were fortunate that they were open. If you can make it to Culebra to check out Flamenco Beach, it's worth the ferry ride (only about 1 hour, 15 min), and at $4.50 round trip, it was very economical. There are little kiosks there too with food that is reasonably priced- some sandwiches, but a lot of fruity frozen drinks, empanadas, pinchos, etc. Take your sunscreen for sure, and it's worth it to rent a chair and umbrella. The rainforest was amazingly beautiful, count on getting rained on- a poncho or umbrella is a good idea. There are a few stores over by Luquillo that specialize in local art- everything from homemade candles and jewelry to beautiful masks- The Carribean Trading Company and Coqui International. Their prices were better than what I found in Old San Juan. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort!!”
Reviews.Author: christybb
Reviews.Content: The resort is beautiful and something you need to see for yourself! So much fun to watch the wild iguanas eatting grass in the common areas. The only bad thing was the price of food - the breakfast buffet was $22 per person - ouch! My suggestion - rent a car (resort is only 20 miles from the airport) and go out for the local food which was awesome. A bakery is just a few miles away and it was awesome. We discovered the hard way that the resort will not let you bring outside food or drinks or even a cooler. But they will charge you $3 per can of soda and $25 to "rent" one of their coolers. They do have free ice, LOL.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: panophonic
Reviews.Content: My experience at was one I will never forget, great accommodations, great staff, great facilities, and tons of activities to take advantage of. Breathtaking views, from the ocean to the magnificent mountains of El Yunque, the beautiful night sky with so many stars, and the fauna all around the resort (iguanas, cranes, birds, hermit crabs, tropical fish) The staff was courteous, attentive, welcoming, accommodating, and very friendly. Our bungalow was clean, maintained and serviced daily. The food was excellent, Chef Myrtaâ€™s PasiÃ³n Restaurant served traditional dishes with a gourmet twist, served â€œlatin styleâ€� (E.G. extremely large portions), the Japenese Restaurant Nami probably serves the best sushi I have tasted (and I eat a lot of sushi at very reputable and rated restaurants), and the breakfast at CafÃ© Sole was great. It was great to be so close to the tropical rainforest including being able to bathe in the beautiful waterfalls 2000 feet above sea level, the sister islands of Vieques & Culebra, the florescent bays in Viques, all of the eateries along highway number 3, las Croabas (in Fajardo), the food stands at PiÃ±ones & Loiza, and only minutes away from Old San Juan (with houses the oldest fortifications built by Europeans in this hemisphere). The hotel had salsa lessons, music every night (both live and DJs), games, heckâ€¦ they even had a NASA astronomer teaching about the stars, and we event saw Jupiter and its rings through his telescope. Will we return? Will we recommend it? OF COURSE we will! I must thank Angel (our butler there), Yanitza & Itzmel (our servers at Nami), Yadira (our server at CafÃ© Sole), Tony & Jose (our baggage handlers), Richard (our bartender at our private pool), Juan (our bartender at main bar), and everybody else I am forgetting (btw, sorry if I spelled any of your names wrong too) that made our stay at the Gran Melia such an unforgettable experience. Recommendations: Rent a car, be prepared to pay for parking (my only negative thing to say), and like our glass door to our Jacuzzi read: BEWARE- PARADISE!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found!”
Reviews.Author: JLugo227
Reviews.Content: I had read some reviews on this site before booking and was a little nervous. Because I had traveled in many similar locations and to many similar 4-5 star hotels, I took my chances as it seems many people tend to be overly critical and never pleased no matter what. My husband and I booked this trip for our anniversary. Puerto Rico is a land rich in culture and the most welcoming people I have ever met! My experience at the Gran Mehlia Rio Grande was FABULOUS! The staff could not be more welcoming, warm, friendly, and accomodating!! We upgraded to the Royal Package upon check-in and we are so glad we did! We had a beautiful, clean, bongalo complete with private pool, balcony with a jacuzzi, continental breakfast, a Butler, and ocean view for the duration of our stay. Our Butler was Angel and we affectionately called him our "Guardian Angel". He could not do enough for us and he made sure everyone who serviced us or our room did five star work! We will never forget how attentive he was to our needs and he went above and beyond EVERY day. Insist on Angel if you want the ideal Butler who knows how to make you feel special. The food is quite good but the MUST "go to" restaurant is Nami for the Criollo sushi - YUM! We are sushi fans and Nami's sushi was in our top 3 of best ever! On our anniversary we were given complimentary champagne with our dinner as a surprise. Our room was beautiful and our view of the sunsets were breathtaking. We could hear the coquis in all directions. The night sky had so many stars! Iguanas walk the grounds and cranes stroll by the beach! We had fish swim right up to us in the shallow water circling our feet and tickling our toes. The private pool was heaven and our bartender Ricardo made delicious drinks: from the Passion Fruit Mojito to the Puerto Rican Original Pina Colada! There were so many wonderful staff that I hope I can remember them all: Jose, Tony, Glorimar, Madeline, and so many more! Sorry for forgetting anyone! :) An area to see if you go is El Yunque rainforest to swim in the fresh waterfall. If you go to Vieques Island BRING YOUR CAR otherwise you will not have much time to see the beaches on the southside of the island - they are the MOST beautiful. The ferry is so cheap but about an 1 hour ride. Our best time in PR was at the hotel itself - dancing salsa, eating great food, lounging in our cabana, swimming in our private pool, sipping champagne in the jacuzzi while watching the sunset, and enjoying cool tropical drinks with friendly people at the bars. The only things I would say were somewhat negative was paying for daily parking - I never had to do that before. The beach is ok - compared to the others like Hobos in Isabela. It is just ok but still a lovely and relaxing place for ocean lovers. What bothered us most were guests who just seemed to WANT to complain about anything and everything they could as if just to hear themselves talk or whine!! But I guess that just goes to show that money can buy many things except love, happiness, and class. Do yourself a favor visit this hotel. Experience the people of Puerto Rico first-hand. You will be so glad you did!! We are considering a timeshare there we loved it so very much!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect ......”
Reviews.Author: antigua1078
Reviews.Content: What a lovely place, with friendly and caring staff. The location was ideal. 20 minutes from town for shopping, 20 minutes from the rainforest for enjoying nature, and right in the middle of a lovely piece of property. I swam in the ocean and the pool. The beachfront lends itself to leisurely walks and incredible sunsets. If I wanted privacy, I had it, and when I wanted to be around the other guests, there was ample opportunity to do so. Yes, a rental car is neccessary, and you must pay for parking...I didn't mind either of those factors. I'll try another Sol Melia resort, and will be grateful to return to Puerto Rico and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was absolutely wonderful...in every way!”
Reviews.Author: luvtravel389
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler, both domestic and international. I have visited a large number of hotels and resorts, in 26 countries on 6 of the 7 continents. I can't express how much I enjoyed our 4-day stay at Gran Melia Puerto Rico, and how very disappointed I am with those who have posted negative reviews on this forum!! These are clearly people not accustomed to top-notch properties, or who can't really afford the hotel they've chosen. My husband and I returned from the hotel on Sept. 5, after a wonderful stay, celebrating our anniversary. The grounds and gardens are immaculate, the pools are lovely, the food was exceptional (more about that later), our oceanfront room was gorgeous, and I am hard-pressed to find anything negative about the hotel. Okay, okay, I'll try! So you have to rent a car if you want to explore the surrounding towns, but we couldn't imagine leaving the area for a second, since it had everything we were looking for. I would recommend it highly, to anyone from honeymooners, to young marrieds with children to seniors wishing to enjoy a pleasant, relaxing vacation. The ocean was literally steps away from our room, and within 2 hours of arriving at the hotel, we were swimming in the ocean on a sunny afternoon! I've attached a few photos to give you an idea of the property. I have used TripAdvisor to plan vacations in Spain, Paris, and other areas of the world, and I rely on it heavily. Therefore, I would not like to steer anyone wrong, and when I say you won't be sorry if you chose Gran Melia for your Puerto Rico vacation, I can assure you I'm leveling with you! Now, about the food. The morning breakfast at Cafe Soleil was excellent, with any and everything you could possibly want from fresh fruit, to eggs and bacon, to salmon, to a variety of juices and coffee. We ate dinner at the Italian restaurant, called Tempo on the first night, and I had a wonderful risotto dish, while my husband enjoyed the red snapper. But far and away the best meal ever was had at Pasion, a genuine Puerto Rican restaurant on the Gran Melia property, but separately run by Chef Myrta Perez. I had a shrimp dish which was by far the best I've ever eaten! The restaurant came highly recommended, and I can guarantee....it didn't disappoint!! Try to ignore the negative ratings you've seen on this board. You'll be happy that you chose Gran Melia!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be swayed by negative reviews - Gran Melia is worth the trip”
Reviews.Author: erinx84
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent an extended Labor day weekend in PR - what an awesome time we had. We made sure to actually READ OTHER REVIEWS before we booked the trip, so we knew what to expect. Here goes a few FYI's: - Yes, the hotel books a deposit for incidentals. We paid $100 per day, which is reasonable in my mind. - Parking was $16 per day, which we didn't end up paying for some reason; they never asked for our valet slips. - We did NOT upgrade, we had a regular old Joe Schmoe garden view bungalow and it was perfectly fine. In fact, we met a couple who upgraded and saw their room - only difference besides being 20 feet closer to the beach? A flat screen TV. They didn't even use the Royal Service pool because it was way too quiet for them. - We booked a rental car ahead of time (again, weren't charged for parking) and we had NO problems, not even once, exiting and entering the hotel. The "guards" waved and barely said a word. - You most certainly can use your credit card at the bars and restaurants at the resort. You have the option to charge to your room, or use your card. - The "long, desolate, scary, dark, isolated" walk from the main lobby to the bungalows is probably 1/4 mile at most. It's extremely well lit and there's people walking to and fro constantly. Not to mention, about one golf cart per minute driving by, asking if you need a ride. - If the food's too expensive for your taste at the hotel (we didn't want to spend on every meal), venture off the resort and hit up a fast food place.. there's KFC, Burger King, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut, McDonalds, you name it - just like home. ** Things that I would recommend doing while there: - El Yunque Rainforest. And don't pay a dime. We drove our rental all the way through and did our own self guided "tour" for free. We got some awesome pictures in front of waterfalls. Don't get swindled unless you need a tour guide and can't do it on your own. - Old San Juan. It's about a 25 minute drive up the highway but so worth it. There's some awesome old forts, and you can take the ferry to the Bacardi Distillery. Cool little bars and restaurants too, and a pretty commercialized area. - Eat at Coco Sweets bakery at the end of the resort road. $2 for the best ham and cheese sandwich you've ever had in your life. - Also check out El Verde bar/restaurant right near the resort. The food was unreal and cheap... good, home cooked Puerto Rican food at it's best. If you have any questions, feel free to email me; ErinX55@aol.com - I'll tell it like it is :)

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: mornate
Reviews.Content: What a great place!!!! we have a great time dispite the rain or liquid sunshine at they call it. Miguel was AWESOME!! Just remember they move slower than we do don't expect anyting in a hurry ! Had lots of fun , saw many sites - definately rent a car!! Not that bad once you get the hang of it. Go to the Verde bar on the corner for food (real Puertican) Tommy's for lobster, best I ever had. Thanks for the great memories

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: Whites0901
Reviews.Content: My husband and I vacationed here for our 5th Wedding Anniversary and from the moment we got out of our car, we knew we had done good. It was first class all the way. We had an amazing Ocean Front Suite complete with Royal Service. The day of our anniversary, we returned to find our suite adorned with petals and tealights. That alone was worth it! Loved the private/adult only pool RS had to offer. Let's not forget our bartender, Richard and butler, Angel. Although a little far from San Juan and not much beach - we were truly given the royal service. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Do your research”
Reviews.Author: Inluvwithpr
Reviews.Content: Well like most people on here I read up on this place. First I'll start by saying it is a beautiful resort. The landscaping is breath taking. RENT A CAR it's definitely a must if you really want to see puerto rico. It is really secluded but I didn't mind it. It's 30 minutes away from San juan and about 20min from Luquillo beach, the most beautiful beach I've seen. The resort does freeze $150 from your account everyday you stay there but it's only so you don't have to carry cash or credit cards. They make it seem like it's all inclusive. If you don't charge anything to the room you really have nothing to worry about. They charge about $16 for parking a day but their tracking system is crap so you might get lucky. Food is crazy expensive there but there's a bakery on the road that takes you up to the resort where they have amazing food and it's cheap. My boyfriend and I got juice at the supermarket so we would have drinks in the room. The pool is so nice, it's so big you feel like you have the pool to yourself. And the bar is pretty cool too and just about the same price as a club in the city. The whole staff is really friendly. If your not afraid to hop in the car and go explore you'll definitely have a good time. I honesty have no complaints about this place. You're on a beautiful tropical island, enjoy it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “OVER RATED!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tre_220
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the website were the best thing about this resort. As other postings have stated â€“ this resort is very secluded. This resort is also NOT KID friendly!!! You have to either rent a car or take taxisâ€™ everywhere. Keep in mind that you are far out so the taxisâ€™ are not cheap. Do not take the shuttle service from the airport to the resort - take a taxi. The resort shuttle is $35 per person (including kids). The taxi is $63 total for the first 5 passengers. Also this resort does not take cash, make sure to bring a credit card! Any drinks or food have to be charged to your room. We also had ants in our room. As another posting stated, they ask for a $500 deposit upon arrival and we knew nothing about that until checking in. The concierge lied to us. They told us that taxisâ€™ were not allowed to enter the rain forest. However, there are some taxisâ€™ with a special permit that are allowed to enter the rain forest and our taxi driver gave us an EXCELLENT tour of the rainforest. He took pictures of my family for us. He made hats out of the huge leaves for our children and he was great. He charged a family of 4 $180 dollars which might seam a little pricey but the resort was charging more. If youâ€™re going to San Juan and need a taxi please call taxi driver by the name of Albert on [--]! You can also call the company that he works for their information can be found on their website www.cabspr.com. You can call them or email them ahead of time to schedule your transportation needs.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY SUPERB!!”
Reviews.Author: sandyb83
Reviews.Content: I become VERY annoyed when I read negative reviews of this hotel. I am CURRENTLY a guest at Gran Melia Puerto Rico, and although it is currently raining, courtesy of Tropical Depression Erica, I have nothing but positive things to say about this resort. The food, the service, the ambience, the pleasant staff..........our overall experience has been excellent! I have traveled extensively (more than 25 countries), and I cannot recommend this hotel more highly! If you are considering a stay in Puerto Rico, you won't go wrong at Gran Melia!! So long for now! I'm off to El Yunque Ballroom, where the staff has planned all sorts of great rainy day activities. Then, it's back to our oceanfront room, where we'll probably soak in the spa pool on our private balcony, overlooking the ocean! What a life!

Reviews.Title: “If you want relaxation and paradise this place is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: bklyn82NewYork
Reviews.Content: My husband and i just returned and had an amazing trip! Yes the hotel is far but if your willing to rent a car it;'s a 30 minute drive from old san juan and 10 minutes from lo chio beach (which is surrounded by restaurants). T he resort restaurants are pricey (manhattan prices) but incredible! Richie's cafe is 10 minutes from the resort and provides free transportation to an from the hotel (Both the view on the mountain and food is outrageous!). We had royal service and our room an jacuzzi on the balcony were meticuluos and beautiful. Yes, the drinks are pricey and they put a $300 hold on your card but do you expect to spend less than $300 on vacation?? The hammocks, beds in pool and the beach which is not the best but is quiet an calm are all like paradise. The resort is family friendly, but huge...I don't recall hearing yelling kids or too many children at any time

Reviews.Title: “We've had better service at a Super 8”
Reviews.Author: MrsP04
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 5th anniversary. We wanted to go to somewhere special. When we booked through a discount online vacation company were promised 10 days/ 9nights of pampering and fun from this 5 star resort. When we arrived the resort was beautiful and tropical looking. It's a sprawling resort. If you don't ask for a bungalow/ room near the main building you need to walk quite a bit. We didn't mind the pleasant walk. We also noticed there were many families w/ young children. We are not against kids at all (we have 2 ourselves), we are just saying that if you are expecting a "couple's only" resort- you have picked the wrong resort. There is a main building that houses the check-in desk, several restaurants, a shop, large lounge areas with several bars. The main building is surrounded by several smaller buildings/ bungalos, pools, beach and beautifully manicured grounds. One of the highlights of our trip was watching the (several) beautiful iguanas walking around the resort and sunning themselves during the day. They are completely harmless and are very tame creatures. We were able to get pretty close to some of them. Our standard garden style room was larger than we expected- king sized bed, sliders leading to a little patio, larger than normal bathroom and beautiful marble everywhere. As we were unpacking our nightmare began. Our room was without hand and wash towels, no hangers, the tv/ cable was broken and we were missing a coffee maker-coffee items were there on the table. We called the front desk and asked for a supervisor. We explained what was missing and broken. She assurred us that she would take care of immediately.
