She offered to give us a computer cable free of charge for the trouble we had. The price for renting a cable was only $7.00. Looking back, for what we went though it wasn't worth the free cable! While waiting for someone to take care of our missing/ broken items we went to the beach. The main beach was crowed with families so we walked to an area of the beach that wasn't as crowded but still part of the resort. There were plenty of lounge chairs. However, we were speechless. There was trash/ broken glass every where, a tire tread and plastic cooler sticking out of the sand. When we went back to our room we were greeted by several resort staff asking what was missing/ broken. We told them what was heeded. Someone looked at our tv and said that it was the cable box. So he took it . Someone else came back with a coffee maker however it was broken. Someone else came with several beach towels instead of wash/ hand towels. Someone else came with 3 hangers- that's all they had! You ask why did it take that many people to take care of our issues? We had wondered the same. By late night we were still missing several items and there was no coffee for the morning. That morning I (again) called the front desk, maintenance, and housekeeping asking for our missing/ broken items. We only recieved a working coffee maker and more than enough beach towels. I don't know if they just didn't understand what hand/ wash clothes are or if they just didn't have any to give. Several days and calls later, we gave up asking. We were here for a vacation, we were not going to take time asking (pointlessly) for our items. We were going to do the best with what we had. One of the mornings we were awakened by our fire alarm going off requesting us to leave our room. When we left we saw other guests standing around and asking each other "whats going on?". Several minutes pasted the alarm was still sounding and there was not one Gran Melia staff or security person came to address it or to check for our safety. After 30 minutes went by we all decided to go back in our room. Gran Melia staff didn't care or check for our safety so it must have been a false alarm. We were never given an explanation. Each day we kept going to the beach but was very cautious where we walked. As long as we had a lounge chair and our books we were happy. Our meals were nothing fantastic for the price we paid. All the waite staff was always pleasant and helpful. We tried all the restaurants. For breakfast there is only one restaurant open. If you didn't have a vacation deal (we did) which has breakfast free, guests paid $22.00/ PP buffett style. Average dinner meals for two w/ two appetizers, two main meals and non- alcoholic drinks were over $100.00 not including tip. We didn't have any desserts since the main meal was nothing to write home about. For lunch we ate at the grill near the pool. There was one other restuarant if guests wanted to eat in. Lunch for 2 w/out alcoholic drinks and dessert averaged $20 without tip. The restuarant that we were not impressed with and only went once was the Asian restaurant. The chef cooks in front of the guests (which was fun for the kids) and the dishes were all the same but with a choice of meat/ fish. Just before leaving for our plane we were still missing wash/ hand towels- but still had plenty of beach towels! We only had 3 hangers for the two of us, our tv worked but we couldn't watch movies because they took our broken cable box! We have never had such poor service. For issues as simple as ours we couldn't understand why there was not one Gran Melia person or supervisior that could just take the reins and resolve our issues. Yes, there were plenty of "I'm sorry, someone will take care of this or I'll take care of these issues myself"!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time...very relaxing and JUST what we needed”
Reviews.Author: DenoMeno
Reviews.Content: After reading on here other reviews my Girlfriend and I were very anxious and nervous about this trip. We were able to get 5 days 4 nights for around $700 with airfare. We were stressed about the $150 a day hold but made it work. I am glad we read about it on here FIRST before showing up and then finding out, that would have ruined teh trip for us, but at least we had some time to prepare for it. The hotel was great, everyone we encountered was very helpful. The prices were pretty expensive for the food in the resort so we ate around the area. Alcoholic drinks at the pool run about $7-$9 each and are good! We ordered a chicken sandwhich and chicken wings and it ran about $24 with tip, not too bad. They have wild iguanas running around so its cool to see and take pics of. Overall we had an amazing time! We both had been stressed with work and just personal stuff and this was a great trip to get away on. We will visit Puerto Rico again in the future among other places we want to see in the Caribbean.

Reviews.Title: “It's good for your honeymoon...kids not so great...”
Reviews.Author: venessa9
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia was absolutely gorgeous from it's open lobby to the grounds and the water features. Our room was the size of a small studio. The shower fit about 3 people. Our balcony faced the ocean. Unlike some other comments, our sheets were clean, cups clean. The bed was comfortable. My 6 year old had to sleep in the bed with us because the sofa bed was extremely uncomfortable. The beach was nice but rocky. The pool was clean when we visited. The cons to the trip where that the distance between our suite and the lobby was more than a 1/4 mile. While they offer shuttle service 24 hours a day, the shuttles were nowhere to be found. We had to rush out for check out at 12 pm, lugging our luggage for the 1/4 mile. The food is extremely expensive, a burger for $16???? Parking for $15.00. They do put a $150 hold on your card so be prepared. My suggestion would be to bring in food to the suite or visit local restaurants rather than pay the expensive food. This is an ideal place for honeymooners who have a couple of days at the resort. And yes bring your car so you can adventure Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “In Paradise for a week !”
Reviews.Author: MaraMichigan
Reviews.Content: What a place ! Nature ! Landscaping ! Decor ! Yes ! This was by far the best hotel room / resort we've ever enjoyed. "How beautiful" are the words you will use the most... Then the Rain Forest nearby... a jewel that will remind you of what you have to loose if - as a human - you keep destroying resurces for one minute gratification when using whatever unnecessary stuff... The Ocean, a few steps away from your room, will remind you of the same ... Beach with unique beauty, romantic and calm... That Flamboyant red-orange blooming tree by the window, in the gardens, down the road, in-your-face everywhere... Imagine how much is being spent just to mentain those amazing grounds, the detailed decoration of all surroundings and so on ... Come on ! Reading the negative comments I wondered which are legitimate complains and which are not .... Well, just by looking at the pictures you must realize that being in Paradise cannot be cheap... Once you have a room and a car (rent from the airport or ahead of time to save money - you MUST have a car in order to save) you can come and go as you please... In the resort food is overpriced. We were shocked by the room service prices ( as an example) For 2 eggs-and nothing else!!!- for breakfast it will cost you 15$ + 17%tip + 3$delivery + 7%tax It was ridiculous ! Our teenagers got some sushi - it was 62 $ ! It was little food not a big deal ! We took a van and drove all over and eat where the locals eat ! It was awsome sometimes and not that good other times. But we wanted the whole, unadultered experience ! Expect natural beauty mixed with ugly local poverty , stray scared hungry dogs, chickens and horses in the streets... Pleople outside the resort did not seem friendly to us at all - it was strange to see vendors totally indifferent ! We are friendly and would have loved a chat sometimes.. Did I mention the pool ? Gorgeous! Way better than in the pictures! In a few words .... A short 7 day vacation in Paradise !

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location, Terrible Customer Service, Not so great maintenance.”
Reviews.Author: travel1231233
Reviews.Content: This hotel certainly looks nice in the pictures, but when you actually get there it can be a little disappointing. Our room smelled strongly like mold, the pool was murkier than their beach, chunks of concrete were missing from the pool, we could never get anyone to answer the phone at the concierge, etc. All these little things were very annoying and when added together they significantly detracted for the overall experience at this hotel. On top of it all, the security at this hotel will try to get you arrested if you speed on their property. This is no joke. They stopped me at the entrance check point while I was leaving to the airport, lied to me, stole my ID, and told me their security guard would arrest me if I tried to leave before the "policia" arrived. That the crappiest hotel service experience of my life. Needless to say I will never ever return here.

Reviews.Title: “There are Better Hotels In Puerto Rico For The Price”
Reviews.Author: jmkelemen
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt the Gran Melia is a very elegant hotel, impresive lobby with beautiful ponds and exotic decorations. The pool is a great size but very dirty, in my stay we experienced a lot of iguana droppings around the pool, we reported them with out any results. The rooms are great! They are spacious and clean, and that is a great plus, especially with kids. This hotel is an outdoor hotel including the lobby. This is very important to know, in case of any T-storms!! Unless you are going to stay all day in the room or restaurant, be prepared to get wet all the time. The hotel does not allow any food or drinks to be brought in from the outside and you are required to put a deposit of $150.00 per day for incidentals. I personally, would not stay in the Gran Melia again. You may want to check the Caribben Hilton, I had a great experience there last year.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: Lapome
Reviews.Content: My Fiance surprised me with a wonderful trip to Puerto Rico. The Gran Melia really blew us away once we arrived. It's a gorgeous resort. Very spacious with lots of privacy, the rooms are huge weather its a RS room or a regular room. Fully serviced with all amenities. At times it felt like no one was around but you and a few others. During the night there is lots of entertainment. The employees were very friendly and hospitable. Our entire stay was perfect! We only had one bad experience with our room on the first day we arrived. After taking a short nap we discovered our room was filled with water from a leak in the ceiling. We called the front desk immediately after almost breaking my neck on the floor, they claimed a plumber was on the way but never showed up. We waited 30 minutes and finally decided to make a huge stink. We were unable to reach the bathroom or door because the puddle kept getting larger. Extremely slippery on marble floors. Thank goodness they upgraded our room to the Royal Service with beach front view to make up for the inconvenience. I thought the 30 min wait was ridiculous on their part. Being part of the RS you can take advantage of the happy hour from 6-7 @ the Avenue Bar,free contential breakfast, however, if you want anything "HOT" its $7 pp. We definitely enjoyed the perks of the RS. Cons: $16 a day parking fee, dirty main pool, $150 a day hold on your credit card, coco beach is not really a beach, no fridge in the room..just a mini-bar, ice machine was far from the rooms, avoid the Melia Vaction Club presentation, they should incorporate bar service out by the beach. It can be a long walk to the pool bar or back to the room for refreshments. Pros: The grounds were beautiful, lots of picture opts, Royal Service upgrade, customer service, Tempo Restaurant(Excellent), kayaking

Reviews.Title: “Not Likely to return :(”
Reviews.Author: Wutzy
Reviews.Content: After staying 5 nights at this resort I really did not mind coming home. The grounds are nice, lots of iguanas running around and I LIKED the beach. Not really for swimming but you can find a secluded area and cool off in the water. For us the pool was too crowded! We stayed in bungalow 8 that had easy access to the beach, room was fine but however it was a guess at if you would have a warm shower or not. We ate at Tempo and Passions at night. Both of these places were good, especially Passions. Beach bar food and lunch cafe were terrible. We did not rent a car for our stay. To get a taxi is a total nightmare at this resort. No need to repeat what others have complained about, but it is true. Lucky for me I had packed 2 beach towels, a soft cooler and lots of aspirin. Would highly recommend these things. We made the best of this stay, enjoyed the 2 restaurants, the beach, and had fun at the casino and Avenue A bar at night. And if I didn't have such good company...the wonderful husband, it would of really stunk! I doubt very much we will return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, housekeeping needs a kick in the pants”
Reviews.Author: Mainlander49
Reviews.Content: The resort and landscaping is very nice. The bungalows are spaced out from the main lobby, so be prepared to walk a little, but nothing that was too far. On our first day, the bathroom had little stinging ants in it. Another day we came back at 6pm and our room was not made up yet. The shower was fine, but our curtain was ripped down. If you are looking for a 5 star beach this isn't the place but there are plenty of amazing real (not man made beaches ) close by. The asian restaurant was very good and the service was awesome. They recommended the best dishes and they were right on. For prices on PR, the hotel restaurant wasn't anymore than a restaurant in Old San Juan. If you are planning on going anywhere, renting a car is the way to go. Rent your car online days before and it is cheap. Be prepared to drive like a maniac if you do rent a car. Off of the main city streets you really get to see the REAL PR. The pool was nice and had enough chairs to accomadate all guests. Check in was fast and the concierge was very helpful. They print off step by step directions to any destination you would like to go to. Bring an in depth map if you plan to drive though because the map they give you dones't have all of the little side highways and streets. They had live music on friday night and was entertaining. The parking is kind of tight on the weekends because of the casino, but you can literally part your car anywhere you can fit it without getting into trouble. All in all we have had a very good experience and would have had the best hotel experience to date if the housekeeping was a little better. Get out of the resort and get a taste of what the real PR is like. You will have a great experience and many unforgettable memories.

Reviews.Title: “kinda like not,,”
Reviews.Author: elo38
Reviews.Content: 3 burgers with fries 33.00...extra small cokes 3.00 each,,no refills,,you have to pay,again,,total with small tip almost 50 bucks,,at the water bar next to pool..mind you this the the cheapest food area at the resort,,restaurants are a lot more,,,nice landscaping,,my room came with spit dried on sofa,,lipstick stains on drinking glasses and coffee cups,,hardly any bath towels,,,the rooms are nice though,,,we got a handicapped room even though we are not,,you need to rent a car,,to eat nearby for cheap...all stateside eateries are on the main road 65 infantary rd or 3,,,go the el yunque rain forest,,5 mins away,,dont drink from mini bar in room,,7.00 for a beer,iguanas the size of alligators are everywhere,,nice,,the golf car rides to and from rooms are lu why wounonexistent,,they drive right by you and nod,,,,the room attendent didnt clean our room on our last day?,,and yes you can bring food in from outside eateries,,dont order room service unless you got bucks for cold food..remember rent a freaking car,,online before you go,,,traffic on the main roads is horrible,,like any city in states,,but once your out drive,,,,,enjoy the mountains,,,take 15 rd to guayama,,scenic,,pool area had sludge muck building up on one area,,and no one cleaned it,,yuck...if you drink bring and extra 1000.oo for 7 days of stay,,plus tips,,wear sandals to beach at gran melia,,quiet beach,,lots of rocks,,,little beds at pool area with canopy are 50.00 a day,,wow,,dirty beds..lots of ants at our balcony area,,they sprayed bug stuff,,,,,get ice from behind icemachine near pool,,they reserve this for water bar,,if not wait till they drop,,,,i was never approached for timeshares,,so that was good,,donald trump is building condos and villas right next to this place starting at 1.2 million,,,,yuck,,,nasty looking apts ,,,better at 150.00 thousand a piece,,not millions,,,you ll see...dont walk alone to bungalows if ur a young girl..scary,,silence and darkness,,walk with someone,,our sheets had food stuck.on them,,they cleaned them by flicking the food off,,but stain was still there,,yuck,,,15.00 a day to park car,,20.00 a day for valet,,wow,,parking is right there,,just park ur car and walk a few mins to ur room,,gasoline is in liters not gallons,,ok,,,,and further more dont go now,,,,3 tropical storms are forming in the waters,,and all 3 so far are going thru pr,,,look at weather.com,,,i tried to be as honest as they come,,,stay in san juan on the strip..lots of food,,,cheap,,no car needed{1 or 2 mile trip from gran melia just to get to main road,,much less get food..more miles after that,,,love ya all,,spend wise ,,not stupid,,,if its possible go to internet and book airfare car and hotel,,in pr,,,,and for g---dsake spend wisely,,,,,,,,elo......

Reviews.Title: “Grand Melia Beware”
Reviews.Author: smromkey
Reviews.Content: This is by far a beautiful resort in deed. We booked in advance with cheapcarribean.com and thought everything was cool until we went to check in and then we were told to stay at the resort we had to put down a $150.00 deposit a day for incidental. We did come on a budget with plenty of cash, however I forgot the credit card in the car back in Florida and no cash is excepted any where in the resort. This is a secluded area and to even get out to the main street you have to go through DragonFly Shuttle & Tours. They control all transpertation coming and going from the resort. Just to go to the end of the street cost $20.00 round trip, but anywhere else local is $25.00 each way. To go to San Juan or places of interest is $65 to $75.00 dollars. Dragon Fly also does the tours, with ridiculous prices, because we rented a car through Avis (They worked with us) for a day and went every where and everything is free El Yunque Rain Forest, The Bacardi Distillery, Old San Juan. Dragon Fly charged $65 to $75.00 per person per tour. To rent a car was $69.00 and there was three of us. Eating at the Resort is also expensive with everything charged to the room. Breakfast was $23.00 per person and the service of refilling coffee and juice was bad. Room Service was $14.00 for a hamburger $3.00 for delivery and 17% gratuity. The mini bar in your room for a beer I bought in the local gas station for $1.00 cost $5.00. Don't pull anything out to check it out because if its out of the mini bar for 30 sec. you get billed for whether you drank it or not. If you are a baller on a budget this might not be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “The most beutiful resort I have ever been to.”
Reviews.Author: jstone2882
Reviews.Content: The resort was gorgeous, food was wonderful, service was pretty good. My only complaint is the small beach. But when you have swim up pool bars most people don't spend much time on the beach. I was also here in 2006 and it was just a wonderful then.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place - Service Needs Much Improvement”
Reviews.Author: martiz
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds, nice pools; very pleasant place to stay at. Great eastern location if youâ€™re looking to explore El Yunque, or if going to Culebra or Vieques for the day, which we did. Check-in took about 30 minutes â€“ unacceptable. Forgot to put towels in our room one day. When we got there after being out all day, had to constantly call for about forty minutes until someone showed up â€“ also unacceptable, especially since we were exhausted. Tried two restaurants â€“ the one with Puerto Rican food was average; the Japanese place was very good. Would go back only if their service reviews on Trip Advisor (I can attest they are accurate) improve; otherwise, there are other places to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Melia - I would go back!”
Reviews.Author: taberdl
Reviews.Content: There are a number of things that people evaluate when spending their money to go on vacation. In the case of Gran Melia, the upgrade to the Royal Service was the best thing that we did. The two individuals in the Royal Service area, Angel and Richard, were by far two of the best service employees I have ever encountered (I am in the hospitality business). I would go back to visit and would definitely upgrade to the Royal Serice. The pool area for the R/S guests was excellent and the location in regard to the other general population pool was excellent. It is unfortunate for both Angel and Richard that the front desk experience was less than satisfactory. The arrival experience was great until we got into the check-in line. Two front desk agents and probably 15 plus people standing in line for service. It took us over an hour to get to the front of the line and there was never more than two agents. When we did get up to the counter to check-in the girl was pleasant and did a good job accept that she forgot to put room keys into our packet. The bellman had to run back after we got to our room and gather keys so we could get into the room. The bellman was great and very personable. I left a business card identifying which hotel I ran and requested that the desk agent have the general manager/director contact me. I have yet to hear from him. Check out was about the same experience as check-in only with one less desk agent. Again, I left my business card and requested that the GM contact me. As of today, nothing! This hotel/resort was wonderful and the staff members outside of the staffing issues at the front desk were incredibly friendly and very engaging. But above all else were the two absolutely wonderful employees at the Royal Service area (Angel and Richard). I would go back again just to be able to experience their outgoing, friendly, relaxed and customer oriented work ethic. A great experience overall....if you go, upgrade it was the best.....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort with Horrible House Keeping Service/issues”
Reviews.Author: Drew1269
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Gran Melia Hotel Resort on Friday, July 17, 2009. Upon my arrival, I had to wait 20 minutes on line to check in. My 4-year old daughter was getting restless. The hotel is beautiful. There was always sweet smell of candles in the main lobby area. On that same night, I got really upset when none of the bartenders in the main lobby area would ask me what I wanted to drink. I was waiting there for about 10-15 minutes trying to get their attention; it was like I was invisible. I understand they were very busy, but if someone is standing at the bar, it would have been nice for 1 of the 4 bartenders to ask, "What would you like sir?" I got upset and went to my room. There were moving a little slow too. Don't get me wrong this is a really nice hotel. It's their House Keeping Service that is of very poor quality. Let me give you a couple of examples: (1) We had to call for House Keeping to clean the room and make up the beds on all 3 days ( we were there for only 4 nights) I was there. On 2 days of our call, we were suprised that it was alreay going on 5:30PM in the evening at House Keeping did not arrive. (2) House Keeping ran out of clean towels. (3) On my last night, I called for an extra blanket and sheets, I had to wait almost an hour and a half for those items. When they finally came, they only brought the sheets and not the blanket. I ask the gentleman where is the blanket, he said they did have any available. What a mess for a supposedly 5-star hotel. The travel agent told me when I was booking that the Gran Melia is a 5-Star. This is certainly not a 5-star hotel. I would rate it has a possible 3 and half. If this was a 5-star, they would not have had any of these horrible house keeping issues or service. (4) A day after I check out of the hotel, I called House Keeping about my weight training gloves I had left in our room somewhere. They took my number and said they would send someone to find them and then they would give me a call. At this point, I have already left Puerto Rico and back at home in NY, and have yet to hear from House Keeping. After all, they had a lot of issues. I guess they kept my gloves as a souvenir. I guess they got me back for the everyday reminders for House Keeping to clean our room and make-up our beds (lol).

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon gift”
Reviews.Author: Honeymoongift
Reviews.Content: July 24,2009 Was the worst experience for my daughter and husband. This was a honeymoon gift from my husband and myself we wanted to give them a good start up we are very disappointed. The check in was the worst experience for the groom, the room was not prepare he waited until 4:00 afternoon the room. He got dress up in another room . Still at 12:00 midnight after the party they returned, they had to wait for more than 1 hour for the check in. Customer service very poor. They had to take their luggage to the room which was a very far walking distance. Plus 15.00 per night parking . I have to be fair and honest the room was excellent, food excellent but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Most horrible experience at a Melia Hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: irdnek2
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worst of the Melia experience for myself and my partner. I originally had the pleasure of staying at the Gran Melia in Cancun several years ago and was so impressed by the resort, that I have decided to stay at different Melia's across the country. I have been to four different Melia resorts so far, including Gran Melia in Panama, and by far the Gran Melia in Puerto Rico has been the worst experience ever. I have told all my friends and family not to stay there and am in the process of writing a formal complaint letter to the Corporate offices and upper management. From the moment we arrived, we were checked into a room that was dirty, and charged for all the items in the minibar, just for merely opening the fridge and taking a look. The pre-arranged, pre-paid!! hotel-sponsored airport transportation (Dragonfly) was an hour late for our transportation back to the airport once we checked out, almost making us miss the flight back, and on top of all that, the hotel makes you leave a $150/day deposit to cover "incidentals". We proceeded to pay cash for our expenses upon check out and the hotel still processed the hold on our credit card!! Unbelievable. The staff is very apologetic for "any inconveniences" we may have had, but very dismissive as well and no-one accepts responsibility for their errors. This experience has been the worst ever and as such I will not be traveling back to Puerto Rico. I recommend anyone considering staying here to seriously reconsider the choice of resort and stay elsewhere, if at all possible.

Reviews.Title: “We loved being spoiled and still miss the heavenly beds!”
Reviews.Author: Steve&Leslie
Reviews.Content: This is GREAT hotel. We were very impressed with the staff, grounds (complete with iguanas and hammocks - very tropical), decor, lighting, etc. The difference is in the details. Hard to find a flaw anywhere!! The rooms are very nice, clean, spacious, and have the most comfortable beds ever. The housekeeping staff was, well I almost hate to say it but they were prefect. Hotel staff drive around the grounds all day on golf carts and will pick you up along the path and take you where you need to go. Everyone is quite friendly and helpful. Especially Mark in the RS Concierge lounge! We were so relaxed and spoiled here and enjoyed the resort so much that we never even went to the rain forest! Whoops! Important tip: Upgrade to Royal Service!! This was SO worth the extra money. Mainly, you get your own lounge with internet so you don't have to wait for all the kids in the main lobby to get off the computers, you get breakfast each morning, bathrobes, free drinks from 6-9pm at the bar, and MOST importantly (okay, along with the free drinks), you get use of the exclusive pool that is clean, quiet, adult only(!), has it's own bar, and has free Bali beds!! CONS(?): I had to work hard to come up with any "cons". It really was a superb stay! 1. If you do not have a car, you will be 'stuck' eating in the expensive hotel restaurants and not being able to sight see very easily. The car rental place within the Melia charges much higher rates than if you rent in Fajardo or San Juan but is quite convenient. 2. Unlike the in-room coffee, the coffee they serve at the Cafe is horrible. Tastes charred like Starbucks. We started bringing our in-room coffee to breakfast with us! 3. There is very little nightlife. There is a bar there that has a DJ (and bar lounge beds :), but not really any dancing to speak of, and no nightclub at all. 4. Since they sell timeshares (oops, not timeshares - Vacation Club), most staff you engage in conversation will eventually ask you to go to one of the meetings. They say it takes 90 minutes but count on twice that. 5. The beach/ocean is rocky but honestly we did not care at all since the pool was so lovely and we had already done our beach activities elsewhere in Puerto Rico. 6. Although the main lagoon pool is very pretty and has the submersed chaise lounges and swim-up bar, it was loud with children and (after July 4 weekend anyway) was disgustingly dirty. We opted for the adult only pool which was wonderful. PS. PapiHenry's review suggest that those of us that did have a good experience may not have been to a nice resort in Punta Cana. Actually our favorite AI is there and the Melia was much nicer than that one on almost every level. Just an FYI that we are not reviewing blind.

Reviews.Title: “Hated to leave”
Reviews.Author: craigcobbak
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Melia for 6 nights and hated to leave. The resort was absolutely beautiful, and we found everyone on the staff, from the bellmen, the front desk, housekeeping, and parking valets to be extremely friendly and accomodating. Our room was spotless upon check in and housekeeping kept it that way during our entire stay. Angel and Richard at the Royal Service pool were fantastic. The resort is a very easy drive from the airport (about 30 minutes) on a modern highway. Renting a car at the airport is definitely advised, as the resort sits by itself a considerable distance off the main highway. However, there is a large road sign right before the exit which points you in the right direction. Several beautiful beaches are within a 15 minute drive, and many excellent local restaurants are nearby as well. There is a beautiful golf course on the grounds. The resort has a number of pools: the very large main pool has a swim up bar and a good poolside restaurant. The prices are what one would expect to pay at a beach side resort. The adults only Royal Service pool has wonderful cabanas that you can reserve for a day or your entire stay, as well as a personalized "butler" (Angel) and a very likeable bartender (Richard). There is a pool attached to the spa, as well as other pools adjacent to each block of rooms. We did not use the Spa services while we were there, but I did use the workout room on several occasions. It is extremely well equipped with modern equipment. In addition to the pool side restaurant, there are 4 restaurants on site, as well as room service. We found the food to be decent, but not memorable. However, since we spent most of our time exploring the island, we were seldom at the resort at meal time. As I said above, there are numerous excellent local restaurants in the towns of Rio Grande (where the resort is located), Luquillo (15 minutes away), and Fajardo (avbout 30 minutes away). In addition, there is a wonderful fresh bakery at the turnoff to go to the resort. It is truly one of the best bakeries I have ever encountered. Best of all, they bake all day. It's a great place to stop in the morning for a fresh pastry and cafe con leche as you start off exploring the island. We will recommend this hotel to our family and friends, and cannot wait to return for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: lavendarskies25
Reviews.Content: The accomodations were as great as the view out your window-the ocean, rainforest, the architecture, extensive water gardens, etc.. It's secluded and very safe. The beach wasn't the best, but everything else made up for it. Definitely an upscale relaxed vacation spot-not a spring break hang out! Exceptionally clean-staff was more than friendly-ask and you shall receive service. Went all over the island not knowing much Spanish with out any problems. People could definitely tell I wasn't local, and everyone was more than friendly. Lots to do, eat and drink around every corner. We're planning on going back for our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: ksargemt1
Reviews.Content: Vacations are what you make of them and although we had a great time at the hotel, they have horrible customer service. They allow anyone and everyone to park in their tiny parking lot- so there's not that much room for guests and you have to park away from the hotel in the residence section- if there is parking. All of the employees walk around with their bluetooth on and don't offer to help you in any way. When we arrived to the hotel- they put a required $150 hold per day on your credit card which we were not aware of in the beginning (for us it was $750 because of the length of our trip). Our room was not prepared at all when we arrived and the air conditioning was broken which left the room at 78 degrees. There was also cigarette burn marks on our bedding. How classy! The hotel is a nice place (architecturally) and they had a good pool, but there was way to many people there who weren't guest ALL the time. They are also swipe happy- so be prepared to see multiple charges for the same items on your bill. This not only happened with the items that we charged to the room- but the charged us multiple times for parking. and charged my credit card twice for the same meal.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away From The "Discount Deal"”
Reviews.Author: 2barefeet
Reviews.Content: we decided to try the $149 deal for 3 nights thinking that it would be great since the average room rate is $150 a night. in return we had to go to the 90 minute vacation club sales pitch. it was gilligan's 3 hour tour, not 90 minutes. we did not get the promised free gift. the guy told us 4 times it was such a great place to be that ben affleck stays there all the time and loves to go running and he is not bothered, so other celebrities stay as well. bet they love to know the sales people are talking about where they stay. as for the resort, it's a shame the management doesn't read these reviews. how many times do people have to comment on the charges and the parking for an improvement? the sidewalks are so shallow that 2 people cannot walk comfortably side by side and forget it if someone comes the other way; you have to step off into the grass or in front of a parked car. the walls are very thin; i actually counted 13 people coming out of the room next to us including babies. noisy. the garden staff were whistling at 7:30 in the morning right outside the window and door. this is relaxing? the parking is $16 every time you go in and out so stay out all day and it is limited availability, definitely not enough spaces. no car, you are stuck. the shower was not cleaned. the towel rack is so high in the shower a short person cannot reach the towels. there is no hook in the shower to hang wet things. there are carts, but if you are a white person, forget the ride. the tv in the dining area didn't work. there is no beach, only pool. $20 a day for internet; there are computers in the lobby area to use, but they are busy or not working. you cannot change the temperature in your room. the food is EXPENSIVE. i can only imagine that the previous reviews were trying to talk themselves into "we had a great vacation". if you stay in the royal area i imagine you might be treated better but for the average person, it was nothing special. stay downtown at the el san juan; by the time you pay for the rental car, all of the incidentals and expensive food i would have preferred to pay the regular rate and been able to walk to everything or at least not spent an hour of my time each time i went out to get back to san juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: rhodeisland44
Reviews.Content: We went for a weekend wedding...it was fabulous! The room was musty smelling but 2 phone calls took care of it. We stayed at Royal Service Area...no kids allowed in pool. It was so great and relaxing. Yes, service can be slow, but you're on vacation....relax!! The spa was wonderful too. Hubby said golf was fantastic. We didn't rent a car, so can't talk about parking, etc. I have found that some people will complain about every little thing....heard people complaining about the staff speaking spanish, not english. But, you're in PUERTO RICO.....maybe you should learn a little spanish perhaps? The beach is nothing to speak of, but it is pretty to look out over. Our room/bathroom was beautiful. The wedding was amazing and they were very pleased with the wedding planner.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Quiet Grounds”
Reviews.Author: Brad-Buyse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Melia from June 13th through June 20th of this year and were quite happy with our oceanfront suite. The room was clean and fresh when we arrived and was very private and quiet. The grounds were nice, and not crowded. Breakfast and lunch were quite expensive as were cocktails by the pool ($18.00 for two drinks) The pool boasts as being the largest in the Carribean. We were happy to stay outside of the town of San Juan with all of its noise non-stop honking of auto's. I would reccomend this resort. The staff were attentive to our needs. Parking is FREE if you stay at the RCI suites of the Gran Melia, they gave us a place card for our window that allowed free in and out priviledges.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort - Horrible Transportation”
Reviews.Author: Sangrene
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia in Puerto Rico was beautiful. Watch out for transportation (to or from airport) though. We arranged transportation from the Aiport to the hotel thru DragonFly Adventures, which has some arrangement with Gran Melia. The driver stood us up. The hotel told us to take the DragonFly shuttle back to the airport after we checked out. The driver asked us if we had prepaid for the shuttle, we said no. He collected $71.40 plus tip in cash. When we got back in the states, we found that Gran Melia put a charge thru on our VISA for the shuttle ($71.40) as well. After weeks of calling the accounting department of the hotel, we were told that DragonFly Adventures denies that we paid the driver in cash, and if fact claims that they don't even accept cash. DO NOT use DragonFly Adventures.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Football_Wife654
Reviews.Content: This resort is amazing...we would definitely stay here again! My husband and I enjoyed our stay. The suites are spacious and absolutely gorgeous. The grounds are immaculate...the lobby area has many places where you can sit, or even lay down, and relax! The pool was great and the swim-up bar was a nice place to get drinks/food. The food and drinks are a bit pricey, but we splurged one day at the pool and it didn't disappoint. On our last night, we even won some money at the casino...both of us! If you can, rent a car and go out onto the island instead of staying at the resort all the time. There is a bakery at the beginning of the road (Coco Sweet--I think that was the name), which had breakfast sandwiches, pastries, and even lunch items at very reasonable prices. Try the Tostipan sandwich with Cafe con leche. Each morning, we would leave the resort and have breakfast at the bakery before venturing out. There was also a restaurant on Route 3 going east, Don Pepe, which had really good food and you can pick up a Puerto Rico tourist guide there. Using this guide, my husband and I were able to plan which towns to go to and what to do in them....This guide is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Great trip”
Reviews.Author: AlmondRoca
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived into San Juan at about 9 pm. We rented a car from Avis and made our way to Rio Grande. After getting on the wrong highway we were given directions from the toll road clerk and headed in the right direction. We finally arrived at the Gran Melia at about 10:30 pm. The check in process was easy and only took about 10 minutes. They do hold $150 per night for incidentals. We were then taken to our room by golf cart. Our room was clean and beautiful. The next morning we went to the lobby to get directions to all of our activities. The staff was great and helpful. We also signed up for the 90 minute presentation. We ate breakfast just about every morning at the CoCo Sweet bakery which is located up the road right before highway 3. The food is good and the prices are very reasonable. The sandwiches are made cuban style on pan de agua. The hotel is located about 30-40 minutes from Old San Juan, 15 minutes from the rainforest and about 25 minutes from Fajardo. Although we didn't spend too much time at the hotel except for the evenings, the location was convenient. There are several fast food restaurants near the hotel such as Subway, Burger King, Church's Chicken and Baskin Robbin's. We ate at Richie's Cafe which is about 15 minutes from the hotel. The food is decent but pricey with an incredible view. The hotel property is large. The golf carts are always coming and going. The beach is not good for swimming but Luquillo is located about 10 minutes away and is good for swimming. There are lizards, hermit crabs, birds and iguana's throughout the property. The pool is large and very nice. There are also hammocks around the property. The staff is helpful. The casino is small but has slot machines, 3 card poker, blackjack and rouillette tables. The property is beautifully decorated. There was also a band playing the night before we left which was really good. They played some Bob Marley songs. The 90 minute presentation only took about 30 minutes. We received $150 Melia money good towards food and drinks. We dined at Nami and loved it. The food was great and the service was excellent. Our bill came to $100. We had breakfast at Cafe Soleil which is a standard breakfast buffet. Our bill came to $ 50. We used our Melia money for our only 2 meals eaten at the hotel. Overall, we had a great experience and enjoyed our stay. We will definitely return to the Gran Melia. We were a bit apprehensive due to some of the other reviews. Thankfully all was good.

Reviews.Title: “Thank God for Angel! Even though he had no wings!”
Reviews.Author: Bela192
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to say that it was my first time at the resort and "THANK GOD FOR ANGEL" He was our butler for royal service and he made our trip! Not only did he go above and beyond, he made us feel as if he was paying for the trip! He really paid attention to us and we actually felt like "princesses". I also have to say that Richard from the royal service bar was outstanding as well! He was always there for us and made sure we had everything that we needed! Even Julian, the guy who takes care of the pools/ponds made sure we had everything we needed and were happy! I really must say " Thank you Angel"! He would be the (only) reason for my return to this hotel! Also, please note: the only reason I am filling in "Excellent" in my overall rating for service is only tbecause of Angel and Richard

Reviews.Title: “What an awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: BirddogZ28
Reviews.Content: My family just got back last night from our vacation. I have never posted about a vacation but this one time I will. I booked this on my own, no special packages or timeshare deals. My wife and I have been working hard and staying in the states for vacations for several years. We decided that Puerto Rico was the place to go with our 6 year old daughter. After a lot of research I picked this place because: 1.It was off the beaten path. (so if you complain about no nightlife or excitement, next time do some research as it is clearly not a party spot) 2. The accomodations and the pool. (if you were interested in a nice swimming beach see 1) We rented from enteprise went without a hitch, My GPS was acting funny but it worked well. (previous tip is true they give great directions) it's about 30 minutes max to the hotel from the rental company (take route 66 and pay the 1.50!- you save a few headaches on RTE3) Check in was flawless, about 10 minutes, I asked for my upgrade as I am a melia member, none were satisfactory for walking distance so we kept the orginal room. We were taken to the room quickly and were at the pool in no time. We did hit the store and brought back food. Mind you we were RESPECTFUL of the fact that they did not want us flaunting the fact we ad food and beer so we kept it in a beach bag. We came back the room was musty. We went to Luisa and asked to have it fixed, and by the time we finished dinner we came back in and the room still was not up to par, and the refrig was not working. I asked for my upgrade and was given another room. My wife packed up and I headed over to the room to check it out and there was the bellman with the new refrig and on the phone as the room was a pigstye! The manager called me direct and aplogized immediatley, yes I was a bit upset but within 1/2 hour we were moved into a beach front Royal Suite room. ( Mind you I did not ask for this, just a new room for my family) It was a wonderful room, we received all the amenities that the room called for, breakfast,jacuzzi on the patio and 3 hour happy our at the avenue bar. They truly went out of their way. The rest of the week we enjoyed food at all the restaraunts and also saw the sights. The owner of all the Melia resorts stayed next door to me, everyone mentioned they were glad we were not partying all night. :0 People: 1. The food is no more than20-30 per plate, lunch-10 bucks for burger and fries thats about right? 2. Rent a Car 3. I paid for parking 2 days as a couple guards hassled me, just pick up the ticket and wave to them and drive out. 4. Your on vacation yes they put a 200 hold on your card. oh well! 5. On a rainy day we went on the tour as my wife and I have considered a vacation property, we were treated well (lunh and drinks) and received quite the bonus in Melia Money which helped. 6. The people are wonderful, your on their island, just relax. If you are looking for a wild time, don't go there. I spent 4 months working over 100 plus hours per week. I needed the peace and tranqulity of this place. Its not yet a 5 star, but well on it's way! I will recommend this to friends and family and will consider heading back next year. This was truly one of the top vacations I have had!! It was a nice 7 days!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware $199 Vacation club offer.”
Reviews.Author: norlinda76
Reviews.Content: My friends and I traveled to the Gran Melia Puerto Rico in June with a vacation club special. It is a beautiful hotel. The view is beautiful, the pools are fabulous. The rooms are spacious and comfy. The service is good, as well tas the staff are friendly and helpful. But , you are hit with so many hidden fees it is simply ridiculous. First upon check in you are charged a security depost of $150 per night. Then you find out that all the meals in the resort are billed to your room. And dont forget to put a tip amount on your receipt because if not, their service charge is 18%. Room service has three different service fees before you even order your food. You are basically trapped on the resort for the duration of your stay unless you rent a car. They have a rental counter on the resort ,which rates change by the hour. Or you can take an overly priced tour, the groups start at four people and there were only three of us. The food was another issue this is supposed to be a five star resort and the food really sucked. The breakfast menu was limited and overpriced. There restaurants were really limited and didn't show quality. In all the resort should make you aware of the fees and charges you could acquire while on a stay at the hotel. If you are prepared you can have a decent stay. If not you can really be in for a rude awakening.

Reviews.Title: “What I thought would be a distaster turned out to be GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Cruisintwin1
Reviews.Content: After reading these reviews I thought "What have I gotten us into?" The service was wonderfull-very friendly and helpfull staff-especially the Vacation Concierge. My GPS wouldn't work her so I went to them and they gave me maps and printed directions on every place I wanted to go. Even had the resort phone number and their ext. if I needed help or got lost! Granted-it is a long way out-but all these posts state this so we rented a car at the airport! Parking is fine--you get a ticket when you pull into the resort each day-put them in the car and forget about it! Parking is FREE folks! I don't know about the food as we RENTED A CAR and there are tons of places to eat outside the resort! The maid service was very good- our room was cleaned every day-no problems at all! Toby did our 90 mim. presentation and was not pushy at all. We had a wonderfull time here and would recommend this Resort to ANYONE !! Don't let the bad reviews stop you-go for yourself and then YOU judge-I just hope you have the wonderfull time we did. Feel free to E-Mail me with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay except the Hotel Transportation.”
Reviews.Author: DRMauricio
Reviews.Content: Last month I stayed at Gran Melia Resort in Puerto Rico where I enjoyed very much my stay. The hotel accommodations where beautiful, the personnel where very professional and hospitable. However, the last day of my stay at Gran Melia, when I was departing, I was part of a very uncomfortable situation. I needed transportation to San Juan, and the (Benny) employee of the transportation company, Dragonfly, told me the price for that trip was $90.00. At that moment a Taxi arrived and I asked the taxi driver how much is the price to drive me to San Juan and he told me it was $65.00. When I decided to take the taxi to San Juan all hell broke loose! The guy from the transportation company told me that I couldnâ€™t take the taxi to San Juan. Then the transportation company employee threatened and yelled at the taxi driver. He told the driver that if he took me to San Juan, he wouldnâ€™t be able to get into the hotel again. This was a very disturbing incident that bothered us a lot. I have no complaints about the hotel and the service they provided, but the transportation company was horrible. I suggest renting a car, rather than using the transportation services provided in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort but they do nickel and dime you”
Reviews.Author: rherb27
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the resort from May 28 thru June 2nd. It is really a great resort and the people are very nice and accommodating however, the resort does nickle and dime you. Everything is very pricey and the food was not very flavorful. However, now that I know what to expect I would stay there again. The scenery was awesome, its very quiet and relaxing. The spa tho pricey does have a period of time 1pm -3 pm thats free for pool, hot tub and gym. Otherwise, they charge quite a bit for every little thing. Overall the resort very beautiful and very clean and the beds are great. Go there its really worth it! Just be aware of the pricey thing. Also if you stay here and you plan to go sight seeing rent a car because its really off the beaten path and that's a good thing.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL AND OK SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: wunene7
Reviews.Content: First impression was the hotel is beautiful and better than i'd imagine. However, when they drove us to our room on the golf cart, the room was not ready. There were no pillows or sheets on the bed and there were toe nails on the floor. I had to call front desk several times to get someone to our room. They expressed their apologies and gave us one hour of free message at their spa. It was wonderful and just what I needed. There was entertainment at night, dancers. I got to use a coupon at the casino and won a little bit of money. Overall it was wonderful. When you check into your room be sure to check the stocked refridge for missing items and notify the front desk so you are not charged. There were some items missing that we did not use but they took it off our bill.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: brittanykono
Reviews.Content: My sister recently planned her wedding there and I cannot say enough amazing things about the hotel. I stayed there for an entire week and I felt that the hotel couldnt do more to try to accomodate us. The food was great, the hotel was beautiful, and everyone had a great time! My room was nice and big, everyone that worked at the hotel was so sweet, and each person (90 people) had a wonderful weekend. The property is huge and can be exhausting with all the walking but they have many carts driving around the place and you can always call one to pick you up at the room. The pool is gorgeous, and the wet bar/ grill is delicious. The only negative thing, and I wouldnt even call it negative, is that the restaurants are not open every night. I guess they alternate but it didnt bother me bc the japanese restaurant was so fresh and delicious. I definitely recommend this resort to everyone. It is so beautiful and I had such a great week. I was also with my 5 month old daughter and they were able to provide a crib for her to sleep in and were very accomodating when i wanted to blend some of the delicious fruit they offered at the breakfast buffet. By the way, the breakfast buffet was so good, there wasnt anything additional I could imagine being there!! Slightly pricey but well worth it! Also, my husband played golf there one day and said it was one of the nicest courses he's played at!

Reviews.Title: “Do you like rude people and overpaying for second-rate accomodations?”
Reviews.Author: koko_lopez
Reviews.Content: My impression of this hotel can be summed up thus: they very much want to make the sort of money associated with running a luxury hotel, but do not care to expend the resources necessary to actually run an establishment of a higher caliber. I am of course happy to illustrate with examples. Firstly, the staff is not polite. Nicole at the front counter would simply ignore point blank questions time and again,and seemed extremely distracted by some paper work and the telephone. Secondly, they issue you a 'towel card' which you must use to exchange for a beach towel. I am not thrilled about this concept in general, particularly at a "4-star" hotel, but I suppose if crime is a problem, then preventive measures such as this must be enacted. The receptionist brusquely informed me that I could get the towels at the pool, however, when I reached the pool, there wasn't actually anyone with towels. After circumnavigating the pool entirely I was able to ask the bartender who informed me that the towel master went off duty at 5pm, and so I had to return to the reception desk (I'm not lazy, but it is a bit of an unpleasant trek when in beach attire), where I waited in line for 20 minutes and was finally issued a beach towel, after which point my evening swim became a pitch dark night time float. Next-up, there are stern warning signs indicating that "NO OUTSIDE FOOD OR DRINK IS ALLOWED" etc. Presumably this is nothing more than an extortionary business practice meant to drive guests to the myriad of hotels which all look very much like they are from the Orange County mall. I was a bit afraid to even bring my bottle of water in as I wanted to avoid an antagonistic conversation with one of the many disheveled security guards loping about. Speaking of extortion, the parking situation is nothing more than insulting. You pay x hundreds of dollars for a room to pass the evening, only to find a surprise bonus $15 parking fee. Worse yet, the gate-keepers of the parking lot seemed to have a difficult time understanding that I would be coming and going several times throughout the evening, and every time I passed their way, I had to have a 5-minute conversation about what I was doing. These gentleman were also far from polite. Poor business practices aside here are some other things you can look forward to. The less than satisfactory: 1. Stained bed sheets 2. Mosquitos in your room (I had several, one tore into me like Cerebus himself for all 6 hours I was able to sleep) 3. Exposed and scary / cruddy looking circuit box in the room 4. Weird muddy looking marks in the bath tub. 5. The beach past the water line is very seaweedy, the corresponding slime which many ocean-critters call home. In the 3 minutes I was in the water, i almost stepped on what I think was a sting ray (although to be fair, mine is an untrained eye, and I got only the briefest of glimpses as it flitted away) which immediately predicated my return to dry land. 6. The hotel seemed to be entirely abandoned. My best estimate would be that of the however many hundred rooms they have, perhaps 10-20 were occupied. It was a bit eerie. 7. The have a good looking excercise room with totally respectable equipment. I started to use the stepper thing and turned on the television, but all of the channels were fuzz, and got bored rather quickly and gave up. 8. The majority of the people in the area, both at the beach and using hotel facilities (including the pool) seemed to be not guests but local residents. 9. No free internet, on top of all of the other money they have seen fit to remove from your possession, they want 10 dollars a day to use their wireless. The good: 1.The pool is pretty nice, its quite warm and largish, although very shallow (never more than 5.7 I think) 2. The air conditioning in the room works rather well 3. They provide you with a copy of the paper in the morning (Although I would prefer the Times to their selection The Wall Street Journal) although this morning when I checked out at 9am, they didn't have any. Unknowns I cannot comment on the food or casino, as I did not have contact with either. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Like having tasty filet mignon... served on a nasty, garbage pan lid!”
Reviews.Author: webgenesis
Reviews.Content: We were charged a $200 deposit for each day we were at the Gran Melia... and we were staying for a total of 5 days. NO WHERE on the hotel reservation site did it say anything about that exorbitant amount of deposit being charged. We had already prepaid a good amount of money to reserve the room at the Gran Melia in the first place... and being forced to place $1,000 for a deposit, without being notified about it until we checked in at the front desk is ABSOLUTELY uncalled for and unprofessional in my opinion, because what if we did not have that amount of money on our credit card. The lady at the front desk, however, was kind of enough to drop the deposit to $800 after I made a fuss about it. On top of that, we were charged for daily parking fees (which were not notated on your website). The sign at the front entrance states parking is $15 daily... and when we go to the front desk, they charge us $16.05 daily. Apart from this we loved the resort, all the staff were VERY friendly, the beaches/pools/facilities/lobby were splendid... but our initial first impression when we were confronted with this HUGE deposit and the parking fees was ANGER and DISTRUST. This caused us to have anxiety over whether we should use any of your other services... out of fear of getting unexpected charges and fees. Gran Melia really should state the fact that you charge a $200 daily deposit as well as the daily parking fees to your future and potential customers... so that they are not as surprised and as angered as we were, when we first arrived at their hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Fourth Grader from NYC Gives Gran Melia Five Stars”
Reviews.Author: SML99
Reviews.Content: My mama, papa, brother and I went to this beautiful hotel to celebrate spring break. We would like to thank Hendrick Santos, the person who made all of this happen to us, and, personaly, I'd like to thank Angel from Royal Service, for giving me towels in different shapes and treating my family like royalty. THANKS so much! I LOVE the pool -- it's everything I ever wanted! The services is great! The food--OMG -- I LOVE and highly recommend Cafe Soleil. They've got gr8 greakfasts and lunches. I think the beach view is beautiful and tht staying in Ana maria for your honeymoon would be awesome! My mama and I really enjoyed the jacuzzi -- we made it into a bubble bath jacuzzi by filling the water with bath and shower gel. That was really cool! I also like the arcade and the private pool--too much fun for you to imagine! And-wow-sitting in the lawn chairs at night is sooooo cool! I love watching the stars! I hoep you will/had (have) a wonderful trip/stay. I will definitely come back soon! I will definitely say good things about this hotel to my friends and family! Sarah L (10 years old) and Family

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel on Golf Course”
Reviews.Author: galveston_gal
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before we arrived, so I knew to expect the emphasis to be on golfing rather than the beach. With that in mind, check -in was quick and painless. We arrived on a late flight, so we were the only guests at the time. The casino did not serve food, and room service had stopped being served due to the late hour, so they offered to send a box lunch to our room for $10. It never arrived, oh well. We looked forward to breakfast. We had a garden view room with a nice balcony. The room was large, clean, and had a wonderful bed. The bathroom was large also. We did not even open the bar since we knew that removing any item for even a short length of time would result in it being charged to our room. There is a sticker on the bar that indicates this, so no one should be surprised when they receive their bill. I enjoyed walking from our room to the pool and bar and restaurant areas, but older people or handicapped persons may not like this aspect of the resort. The walkways are very busy with laundry carts, room service buggies and golf carts full of guests being driven to and fro. Our room was not close to any of the above, so we ended up walking quite a bit to get to the car park to leave. We enjoyed swimming in the large pool, and had no trouble finding chairs with an umbrella. We used the swim-up bar once, and charged the costs to our room rather than carrying money around in our swim suits. The jacuzzi areas located within the pool are not hot, but the same temperature as the pool itself. I'm not sure why they have these areas. We had rented a car at the airport in San Juan, so we traveled outside of the resort for our meals. We tried Coco Sweets, the small pastry shop at the turn off to the Gran Melia that many of the TripAdvisors contributors had recommended. They have a large assortment of pastries and donuts, and also sell plate lunches, and sandwiches and cold drinks. I tried a Cubano sandwich, and found it quite tasty and a good buy for about $5.00. The plate lunches had traditional Puerto Rican food, and would be a good alternative to spending a lot of money at the restaurants at the hotel. We also tried the restaurant Tierra Madre that is on Carr. 3 very close to the resort, and although the service was friendly and quick, I found the food not so good. Several of the other guests mentioned to us that they had been picked up and driven to Richie's Restaurant, so we decided to try this on our own since we had a car. This is where I tried mofongo, and my husband had the skirt steak. The food was expensive and we were not impressed. The view was very pretty though, which is why I think people like this restaurant. Parking became very crowded at the hotel on Thursday and Friday, and there was an increase in the number of guests. We were able to grab a parking space every evening, but just barely, and people were beginning to double park. My recommendation is to definitely rent a car if you are traveling to the Gran Melia. You will be bored out of your skull without one, and will pay a fortune for food. The construction at the JW Marriott was sporadic due to the rain we received off and on all week. The sound of the construction can be heard from the rooms at the Gran Melia, but it did not bother us to any great extent. We kept our doors closed and the air conditioning running at all times and were not bothered with any excessive noise from it. The grounds at the Gran Melia are beautiful and well kept. We saw many iguanas, birds, ducks and lizards scurrying around. In addition, there are all sorts of beautiful plants and flowers. Bougainvillas of all colors are planted everywhere, along with plumeria, oleanders, and plants I was unfamiliar with. It was lovely! I chose the Gran Melia based on it's location in Rio Grande. We planned on visiting El Yunque, the beach at Luquillo, the town of Fajardo and driving to the Caribbean side of the island to check out those beaches also. The Gran Melia was a great base of operations for all of these. We were here for 5 nights and then moved on to San Juan for the remainder of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, but sadly thats where it ended, HORRIBlE service”
Reviews.Author: sahtna
Reviews.Content: My sister and I went with our friend to Grand Melia Puerto Rico through our friends parents timeshare. When we arrived everyone was very nice and helpful and we were offered a $50 voucher to attend a presentation where they would try to sell us their timeshare. We reluctantly decided to go but when we got there and filled out the paperwork stating we were students they made up some excuse of not having enough staff to give us a presentation (code: we didnt make enough money) but they still gave us the voucher so we were happy! The ONLY place that was some what reasonable to eat at on this resort was the pool bar which had hamburgers and salads for around $9-12 the food was good but drinks were pretty expensive. We had rented a car thanks to a previous reccomendation on this site we saw and it was the best decision we made! If you go to this resort you NEED to rent a car, unless you want to spend $20 a plate even on a small breakfast! It was easy to get around much like in the States so that wasnt a problem! The pool was beautiful but we sadly had bad weather the entire time we were there. I think we had one sunny day and the rest rained almost the enitre day. We heard many different times were the rainy season but I suggest not going in May! The service was pretty unfriendly. We had a couple problems and it was hard to find help. We stayed in the villas which were AMAZING but we had a very odd room! It made very loud banging sounds in the vents and pipes waking us up repeatedly throughout the night the entire stay. We didnt complain but we heard of a couple (in the room next to us) got moved due to the loud banging. To use the phone to call out of the resort costs money i believe $1 which wasnt too bad. When we went to use the voucher they had lost our previous tab so we told them what was on it and they took it so we didnt think there was a problem. When we went to check out though we realized first they hadnt taken off the voucher, and second we had an extra $20 charge we know we didnt have. We went to the front desk and told them even giving them proof that we were offered the $50 voucher they said they would have someone call which never happened. When my friend called them she tried for over an hour and they wouldnt give us the voucher back! We are college students who couldnt afford much but we still made sure to be generous and tiped the maid and the bell boys and the servers but in the end got screwed over by the resort. After reading over the other reviews I am realizing that the resort as a whole is way to expensive and tries to screw you out of money! If you are young like the three of us I wouldnt suggest this resort. There werent any activities focused on our age group at all and there just simply werent enough to do unless you had a car to leave the resort (the age to rent a car in puerto rico was 21 not 25 like in the states). We of course had a fun vacation together but the resort didnt help much! Beware of this resort! I think since we were young and not the owner of the timeshare they gave us little respect!

Reviews.Title: “NICE RESORT BUT BEWARE OF RIPOFF FEES!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelguruler
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just returned from the Gran Melia resort May 16-23. The resort is nice however be aware of being overcharged for parking. I was charged $15.00 a day for parking without notification. The hotel has a car rental company on it's property that comes with free parking. Basically they force you to use their service or pay $15.00 a day to park. One must also review the final room bill. There were additional charges of over $100.00 for items that were never consumed in the room. However, the hotel did remove those charges from my bill. The hotel does have an onsight casino. In the room one will find a match bet ticket for $20.00. The Casino management was reluctant to let me use the voucher and was rude when I tried to claim it. Another issue to note: Security will not allow anyone to transport food items from outside the resort to the room. I recommend that all food brought in should be done hidden in luggage.

Reviews.Title: “A License to Steal With No Consequences”
Reviews.Author: ElViajero2112
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Gran Melia for our honeymoon. Apart from the absolutely horrible service, we were treated like second class citizens. Upon returning from the pool restaurant we found housekeeping in our room at 4:30 p.m. They seemed quite nervous, and in a rush to leave. We later found out why. I noticed that roughly $75.00 that I left on the night stand was missing. I assumed that they thought that it was a tip, but reported it anyway. We were told to fill out a report, but to no avail. a couple of days later, when my wife went to take her Navigator out of the safe, the safe wouldn't open. We realized that we essentially reset the combination, then it opened. The $1,000.00 in cash that she left inside her Navigator case was GONE!!!!! we once again filled out a report, and were told that their insurance company would cover the loss. Since we were still going to venture out to the beautiful island of Puerto Rico, we were told by the head of security that we should stop back at the resort before going to the airport, and they would take care of the problem. They also told us that someone would be contacting us in a few days, but this never happened. When we went out of our way to return to the resort, Security tried to discourage us from reporting the incident to the police, telling us that it would take about 5 hours for the police to show up. We decided to gas up the rental car, and get dinner. Within a half hour their security department called our cell phone, and reprimanded us for not being there. I decided to drive to the local police department, and file the report there. The officer on duty was not at all surprised to hear of our theft, as he said that it has happened before. Read other reviews about this resort's thefts!!!!!!!!! We wasted our last day in Puerto Rico, waiting for these corrupt thieves' stall tactics to try and discourage us from filing a report. we have gotten nothing but lip service from them from that point, and they are NOT following up on their promise to reimburse us the $1,075.00 that was STOLEN from us while on our honeymoon. In fact, FELIPE CERVANTES is not responding to my e-mails. FELIPE CERVANTES is the person who feigns concern for the resort's guest with his empty-gestured responses on Trip Advisor, writing generic comments like, "We are so sorry that you had unfortunate experiences..." I don't know if he believes that his hollow diplomacy is actually making anybody feel any better, but I don't buy it!!!!!! Where's our money, Felipe? I cut and pasted negative reviews on this website, and forwarded them to Mr. Cervantes. There were so many that I didn't even have the time to attach all of them. When I first read the sign in my room, "Beware Paradise" I thought it was nice, but I now realize that it should read, "BEWARE THIEVES...US!" Now I have to pursue this matter further, through the Puerto Rican Chamber of Commerce, and with the help of my local assemblyman. It's not over!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Relaxing Stay at the Grand Melia”
Reviews.Author: DzKyutee
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I traveled with another couple and we all thoroughly enjoyed our stay in February. Compared to other resorts we have been to, this was on par. The weather was warm and it only rained twice in our 5 night stay. The leg up that this resort has is that the lobby and grounds are very well maintained, comfortably spaced, clean and beautiful. The grounds are spacious, with areas to stop and sit, and there are palapas and hammocks hidden all over the resort; we spent many afternoons finding a secluded spot to lounge and read or play cards. It was a bit of a walk getting around, and the shuttles were scarce, but there are shady rest spots all around and I don't mind a short walk. The walkways had many maps & signs that indicated distances, and there were unique lizards and birds everywhere, as well. I never felt like I was crowded, except during peak pool times by the pool bar or in the chaises directly by the pool (as could be expected). The focal point of the resort is the pool, as the beach is rocky and not swimmable. I was slightly disappointed in the pool, as other resorts I have been to had more than 1large pool, especially considering there are children at the resort. Unfortunately, the cool nights harkened a soak in a whirlpool since the pool is 24hours - but alas, there wasn't a jacuzzi to be found. Even during the day the pool temp wasn't always comfortable, unless you had been sitting in the sun for a while. All this being said, it was a beautiful pool, they obviously spent a lot of time on the landscaping, and it definitely beat the below 0 temps back home. Back to the beach - it was still nice to wade in if you had swim shoes, and actually further up from the main part of the beach there were beautiful fish. The Rooms - Very nice and not at all outdated. I am a bit of a germaphobe and was alarmed by some unsightly stains in our bathroom, but they were immediately cleaned once we brought it to their attention. We also received several follow-up calls to ensure that we were satisfied with their work. I also had to call because our tub wasn't draining - it turns out - user error - the drains are push button and if you don't push up all the way you will run into this problem. We only ate at the pool bar restaurant, as the others on site were out of our price range and we prefer to sample local fare. Our experiences with that restaurant was good service, but rather pricey. I second(third?) the recommendation to go to CoCo Sweets. Wonderful food, very reasonably priced, great to pick up some beverages to bring back to your room. The Fitness center was adequate, but not exceptional, the cardio machines were really loud. One in our party got a massage, that was nearly twice of what you'd normally pay, but she thoroughly enjoyed it, very relaxing, perfect pampering, it was the highlight of her trip. A few in our party passed some time in the casinos, and won some cash on the slots. Drinks in the lobby bar were extremely expensive, and a couple of the nights we were there the lobby turned into a sad excuse for a nightclub. One night, there were kids running around without their parents in the mix of this soiree, that was a major turnoff for me, but this was just one of the nights, so maybe a fluke? There also seemed to constantly be children on the 2 PCs in the lobby, so the free internet access was not really all that accessible. IMHO, unless $$$$$ is no object, rent a car so you can enjoy the local sights, and you aren't tied to the resort. I personally would have gotten bored of the resort itself if I wasn't out visiting El Yunque, etc. Overall, it is a beautiful resort, tastefully decorated, and I would recommend it for a nice base while you're visiting PR, especially if you can catch a good deal on your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury but very expensive”
Reviews.Author: gdiet
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently it was booked in a hurry as we were supposed to go to Mexico and had to cancel due to the swine flu outbreak. We were delighted with our last min choice the rooms were big and spacious the lobby and surrounding grounds very impressive and the atmosphere created with lighting and water features at night is so romantic and relaxing. The pool and pool bar were very nice and a great place to chill out during the day. The only negative things I will say are in relation to the amount you pay for food and drink at the hotel. The staff are friendly but there is a constant feeling that they are looking for tips not that they want your stay to b perfect. There are exceptions to this of course but it was just a general feeling I got. I'm Irish so we don't have that tipping culture so mayb that's why I was uncomfortable with it. Dinners at the hotel are outrageously expensive compared to what it is to eat outside the resort. There is also an upselling process going on particularly in the Puerto Rico restaurant. We were told we would enjoy the sangria so we said we would have a pitcher at dinner in europe this is cheap plonk so we agreed and the sangria ended up being the same price as our food bill!!!! Outrageous!!! Another downside was that in the spa they give you the opportunity to tip for your treatment but when you get your bill there is a service charge included already. As we are Irish we do enjoy a drink or 10 but at a hefty cost in this hotel! The service is very average you would expect more for what you are paying, It is a fabulous resort but you have to rent a car to leave it and taxis are not an option as they are so expensive. I would recommend this resort for about 4 days but after this it starts to get a bit claustrophobic and you want to see what else is out there.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton wannabe”
Reviews.Author: hotspots719
Reviews.Content: We loved the facilities. The room and the grounds were just lovely.
