Even though rain was forecast for each day we were there, we had sporadic showers which I'm told was to be expected considering our proximity to the rain forest. Not that the hotel could do anything about it, but the weather was very nice. My primary focus for leisure travel is always the beach and their beach sucks -- rocky and uneven. However, because it was so large, there were plenty of romantic secluded areas. Plus I found the staff to be a wealth of information about other local beaches which were very nice. They were also very helpful about sightseeing excursions either guided or unguided. However, there are four things that you should be warned about: (1) The hotel holds $200 on your credit card for incidentals even if you've prepaid for the room. Then the goal seems to be to do everything possible to keep the $200. I think this cheapens them. (2) Rent a car from the airport. The ride to the hotel is expensive ($60-80 one way!). That alone is worth the $16 daily parking fee. Not to mention the distance from the hotel to the highway -- more than 3 miles. Getting a cab just to the highway can be quite expensive. (3) Eat at the resort only if you are prepared for a limited menu and sticker shock. I wasn't impressed with the food offerings or the prices. Breakfast was especially overpriced. (4) Don't use anything in the armoire if you aren't prepared to pay for it. I removed the scented diffuser only to be billed $45. Let's just run through that one again, $45 for scented oil -- that I couldn't take with me! At least I could drink the other items in the minibar! The staff told me the minibar items are on a sensor which automatically bills your room if you remove any item for more than 5 seconds. Again, I think this cheapens them. I would suggest they at least have a price list for the minibar items. My only complaint was that I had to ask repeatedly for face cloths. They kept bringing hand towels. We did the 90 minute -- or I should say 3 hour (did someone say no pressure?) presentation. The vacation package as presented seemed ok, but I am philosophically opposed to being asked to make a decision of that magnatude (over $40,000) on the spot. Plus some things happened during the presentation that struck us as a bit curious. Our suspicions were confirmed while chatting with another couple who were given a lower price. Why? We make more money.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort!”
Reviews.Author: ClassyAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I just come back from Puerto Rico and I stayed at the Gran Melia for 6days and 5 nights. I was there celebrating my 29th birthday. I too was very reserved when reading all the negative reviews and Iâ€™m not sure where these people stayed but my experience was absolutely amazing. The staff was extremely helpful and nice. The housekeeping was on point everyday and the grounds and the lobby on the resort were like something out of a Hollywood movie. AMAZING!! The one thing I noticed people failed to tell it that they charge a $200 hold on your credit card for every night of your stay. Thank God I had $800 on my credit card at the time of check in. (should have been a $1,000 but she only authorized $800.) I cant image how embarrassed I would have been if the funds where not there. So make sure you have $200 on your credit card a night for the length of your stay for incidental fees. Itâ€™s just a HOLD and the funds ARE deducted from your available credit from your credit card and put back upon check out. Which leads me to this. The restaurants on the resort are expensive!! We ate at the Nami Asia our first night which the food was really good. Our total came to $99.51 for two people we paid CASH money. When we received our bill at check out the $99.51 that we paid cash for was charged to our room! Thankfully we had our receipt and it was cleared up when we checked out. ( keep all receipts when paying with cash) We order room service for lunch and for a bowl of soup, 10pc wings, and fries the bill came to $45!!! We also ate at Tempo, which was an Italian restaurant I was very disappointed because my pasta tasted like over cooked mush a four-year might have made. The next three nights we went else where. I highly recommend Coco Sweets bakery at the end of the street right before road 3 on the right coming from the resort.. I had a bacon egg and cheese sandwich the size of my arm for only $3. The breakfast at the resort is $20 per person so $40 for two people to eat breakfast?? I think not! The only â€œaffordableâ€� eats are at the wet bar by the pool. They donâ€™t allow you to bring in outside food to your room but we did anyways.. Stocked with a cooler for our juice, water, and liquor. By the way they sell liquor at the gas stations! WOW The pool was amazing and they swim up bar â€¦lets just say I want one in my backyard. The bartender was soo nice he gave me complementary shots because it was my birthday..gotta love that! Also a rental car is a mustâ€¦the resort is about 30mins from the airport and once you turn on Coco Beach road it sits way back the road. For transportation to and from the airport its $40 per person each way so that would have been $160 for the both of us, but I reserves a rental car for $90 bucks for 5 days at Hertz. The beach is defiantly not impressive, but we caught a 1.5 hour ride on a ferry to the island of Culebra where the beach was amazing. We also did an hour of horseback riding, which is about a 10 min drive from the resort. For all the shop alcoholics ladies, such as myself please take the drive down to old San Juan and skip over all the outlet on Road 3. They have the most amazing shops, jewelry, clothes, shoes ever and really affordable! Theres a Coach factory outlet, store there too.You will be in heaven down there! And there are great places to eat too Overall the stay at the Gran Melia was very relaxing and peaceful I def will return!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay, good value, highly recommend...”
Reviews.Author: viggo_2005
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to there for our honeymoon. We became members of their resort club (this company has several tropical resorts around the world) and are glad we did. As Melia club members We took advantage of a free room upgrade, and buy 1 get 1 free breakfast every day. I recommend that you get a rent car so that you have a lot of mobility as far as when you want to go sightseeing, although they did offer scheduled trips at the hotel. My wife really enjoyed the pool. We also rented a 'Bali bed' for the day. Basically a huge shaded outdoor bed that can comfortably seat a family and keep them in the shade. Towards the end of our stay, we noticed a lot of guests were local to the area, so that tells us that it is a good value seen by the people that live there and chose to stay there over any other resort on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, friendly staff, nice but not good swimming beach.”
Reviews.Author: Ohiotravelinggrandma
Reviews.Content: We had read some bad reviews of Gran Melia, so I wasn't expecting much when we arrived. We got a good deal through agreeing to go to a 90 minute time share presentation. It was not high pressure and we were out of there in 90 minutes. The resort is beautiful! We stayed in a 2 story villa with about 12 rooms in it. There were many of these villas, The rooms were large and nicely decorated. For us the service was very good but we do not expect to be waited on like some people do One day the maid forgot to give us new bath towels, but we didn't bother to tell them because we didn't feel we needed them. If you rent a car, which I would recommend unless you want to stay at the resort the whole time, the parking is about $15 a day. We did not eat at the resort because we read that it is very expensive and we wanted to try out some local restaurants. We had fun eating at Kiosks scattered along some of the roads and other places recommended to us by some of the staff. A good very inexpensive bakery at the end of the resort road came in handy for sandwiches and pastries. We saw a lot and learned about the culture by driving around. We rented from Enterprise for $187 a week . The resort was at a good location for us. We went to Fajardo t(about 30 minutes away) to catch the ferry to Culebra and another day to Vieques and there are more stores and restaurants in Fajardo. I t is also very close to the Rain Forest. The beach is a draw back. It was always clean and looked nice than I expected, but don't go there for the beach. The water is shallow and has a grassy plant growing in it. We tried snokeling there but didn't see much. It is nice to walk along the beach, but you may want to wear flip flops if you're right at the edge of the water- quite a few stones. The pool is very large and beautiful. It has a swim up bar and several more shallow areas with benches and jets shooting out water. There are built in chaise lounge type chairs in the water to relax on. Looking one way, in the distance you can see the rain forest which always has a foggy look over it and the other way you see palm trees and ocean. Beautiful !!! We didn't spend much time at either the beach or the pool because we were out and about exploring the island, I cannot comment on the restaurants because we did not eat there oncel They have golf carts to pick you up and take you around the beautifully planted grounds. We got a room close to everything so we usually walked. The resort lobby is totally open with lots of water with fountains and at night there are candles everywhere. There are 4 computers with high speed internet in the lobby to use, but they were not always working and it was hard to get on them in the evening. Some people would stay on them a long time. That was the only frustration we had at the resort.. We were extremely happy at this resort, but we did get it at a very good price and probably would not have been able to stay there if it were not for the time share presentation (Puertoricostation.com is where we signed up for it.. Wish we could have stayed another week!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place - nice service - liked it alot”
Reviews.Author: TitanShane
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gran Melia Puerto Rico for 4 nights and had a very nice stay. This place is beautiful and truly breathtaking. For my wife and I it was our first experience with a carribean resort so maybe we can't be the best judges but after our stay we both suprised about some of the negative comments that people had put on tripadvisor. Maybe we are just easy to please but were really happy with the place. The positives include: the Pool (best I have ever seen) the silence (quiet peaceful place) the sun (can't beat the Carribean) the service (the people were professional and nice) free internet in the room (bring your own ethernet cable) the ambiance (it was hard to describe but you will like being here) The negatives include: breakfast is expensive (go to Coco Sweet on the entrance road to the property instead) the beach - rather rocky and thin (can't walk with your shoes off, can't swim in the ocean here) parking - $15 per day We did the 90 minute vacation club presentation which allowed us to get 4 nights for only $129. Quite a deal and well worth the 90 minute sales pitch, which really wasn't bad or pushy, suprisingly. We booked through Wannadoo Vacations on eBay. It could not have worked out better. Call them first to check the dates you need.

Reviews.Title: “Awful resturants”
Reviews.Author: travelhappy029
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty good, beautiful grounds, rooms really nice. But the restaurants are awful, not to mention very rude service. We tried dining at the PASSION restuarant on our first night. We were seated, waited 15 mins, no waiter, asked for one, still nothing so we left. The last night, at 8:45PM it was open for business, but when we went in, it looked empty. However the girl at the front said, "sorry we can't seat you we have three tables up front with 9,6 and 4 people so we can't feed anyone else!! Then why didn't they close the doors? Outrageous. The Sol Melia restaurant was the same story, very rude service, awful food, and indeferent attitude towards the guests. I think that because we are a "captured" audience, they feel they can treat guests like that. What a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Here are a few tips for the traveler!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlust1099
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 days/4 nights at the Gran Melia. I am the spouse of the business person, so while he was in a meeting, the most work I did was get out of bed and walk to the pool! I, too, was concerned after reading some of these reviews. I don't think these people stayed at the same place! The resort is wonderful. It's very large, but walkable, and golf carts are around to drive you from the main building to your room. I felt safe the entire time -- even when I walked alone, at night, along the beach. Here are a few tips that I hope will help you: Tip 1: Upgrade to the Royal Service; ours was included in our corporate event. There is a separate check-in behind glass doors. This room also has computers for RS guests. The RS pool is a good size and adults only. There is a bar and room service is available. The cabana beds (I don't know the correct term) are free for RS guests at the RS pool ($50 per day at the large pool). Tip 2: In the RS package (can't say about the standard), you are given one pool towel card per person. This card has a $30 value. If you go to the large pool, you have to give the attendant your card in order to get a towel. Once you return the towel you get your card back. This automatically kicks in the $30 charge on your bill, so be sure to return the cards to the front desk at check-out to be credited the $30 per card. Tip 3: Avoid room service; it's expensive (but what room service isn't?). The RS pool orders from room service, so keep in mind that the pricing is the same. "Wet" - the restaurant/swim-up bar at the large pool has a limited menu, but the food is good and reasonable. Tip 4: If you need anything, call Angel. He is what customer service is all about. Always there and always working. Tip 5: Do not keep your room key near your cell phone. This does erase the magnetic strip. I had to replace mine three times before I found out about the cell phone. Tip 6: Avis is the rental car company, so if you think you'll want a car, rent it before you arrive. You can do it there, but you may get a better rate booking from home. Tip 7: This resort is "out there." It's about 30 minutes or so from the SJU airport. The ride is not bad, but traffic can be hellacious. The driving is pretty bad -- no directional use, lots of weaving, etc. Be careful if you drive. Tip 8: Be sure to go for a night swim in the large pool. It's huge and gorgeous. There are 5 jacuzzis in the large pool (not hot tubs). Tip 9: Don't touch anything in your room's mini-bar without checking the prices! If the item is removed for more than 30 seconds (could be 15), you're automatically charged. $3 for a candy bar is a lot to pay to look at the calorie content. Tip 10: Bring a book if you plan on reading, because the gift shop doesn't have a wide selection. I think it only had 3 books. You'll read reviews on here about the construction -- new construction is at the entrance to the resort and is not near the guest quarters. It's not a white, sandy beach, but you can walk in the water. Hope this review helps! I'd return to this location in a heartbeat. It's really a beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par with other 4 and 5 star resorts”
Reviews.Author: mdsoll
Reviews.Content: Our family recently stayed at Gran Melia, PR and must say that the grounds are beautiful. The pool and the rooms are great too. The service, however, leaves a bit to be desired. The staff, on a whole, is very nice and tries to be accommodating and is very pleasant. The problem, we think, lies with management. We got to the hotel at about 1:30pm and asked for an early check-in if possible. We were told that the room was ready and need to be inspected, so there shouldnâ€™t be a problem. At 3:30pm we were finally told that we could go to our rooms. We had some small situations, which needed attention; the only problem was getting someone to answer the phone. We had to try many times before someone would answer. Once they did everything got straightened out and the staff was very pleasant. I needed something, so I went to the front desk, at 10:30am, and no one was there. There were a few people waiting to check-in and we all waited a good 10 minutes before anyone came to the desk. I find that very strange for a resort with such a good rating. What we also found strange was the restaurants. There were only three and the Japanese and Italian were closed on alternate days, which left only two. There was no place to get a little snack or a quick bite for the children, except for the swim up bar which closed a 6pm. We all had a nice time and got a lot of exercise walking since our building was pretty far from the pool and restaurants. That is not a complaint. You can ride in a golf cart if you choose to. When we got home and after we paid our bills, we found an additional charge on our credit card. It was from 4 days before we checked out and a evening we were not on the premises. Maybe someone gave our room number by mistake, who knows, anything is possible. I called the resort after I called my credit card company and was told that they would put a credit on my card , after four days I was told that a credit was going to be put thru but it never showed up until my bank gave me an ok on my dispute. You also have to watch your charges at the resort since they do not give you a receipt for anything unless you ask. Mike and family

Reviews.Title: “the place is great and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: flowman692003
Reviews.Content: i don't know why the reviews on some are bad the place is great you need to rent a car i went with my wife we rented a car we traveled and ate outside the resort . breakfast was $9.25 total for me and her and it was at the first trafic light outside the resort lunch and dinner we ate out side the resort there are plenty of places to eat make a left or right at the light and its a main road with plenty of places if you make a right there is a large outlet which my wife loved im not to crazy about outlets and again plenty of places to eat , we traveled all over san juan etc and just went back to the resort . we had a great time and everyone was friendly so if you travel and all you do is stay at a resort for the week and not travel around then its a waste because you are not enjoying yourself

Reviews.Title: “199$ Gran Melia Vacation Club w/90min. presenation”
Reviews.Author: cmwelo
Reviews.Content: Almost 3 hours to get a room Too expensive Had to call front desk 2x for towels/soap/toilet paper floors were never swept/ Restaurants too expensive(resort food) the whole place is BORING-BORING-BORING Parking 15-25$ aday( just tell them u r parking in the avis lot) no charge 5$ a beer local Medalla Lite which cost approx 48cents to make(buy ur own w/ice on Rt.#3 there are a few supermarkets) Pack it in a dark colored cooler bag and take it to the pool or beach. I was born on this Island was very dissappointed with this location the way I was treated, The employees don't give a [--] about anything, Next time I visit my place of birth I will stay with family or do 1 or 2 stays at paradors... My advice to travelers take ur hard earned money invest in a all-inclusive 4or 5 star location in the Dominican Republic/Mexico.. believe me u won't be sorry.. Any ? email me at CMWELO@aol.com

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!!!!!!!! Roaches in the restaurant!!!!! Rooms are Dirty!!!! Expensive!!!!”
Reviews.Author: innash
Reviews.Content: We had three room at Gran Melia Resort. The only thing that was nice is the view and landscaping. Rooms were dirty and no properly clean. Since it is far from the real world or any stores, they overcharge for everything - example can of soda $4.50!!! there are no water fountains, so every time you will want to drink - you will have to pay $4.50. Pool is very nice - but only the main pool you can use - all other are for private use!!! Beach is horrible - you cant swim it is full of corals and stones and weeds. MAIN CONCERN WAS WHEN WE WENT TO ASIAN RESTAURANT THERE - HIBACHI - AND THE CHIEF FIRED UP THE STOVE - THE ROACHES STARTED COMING OUT... IT WAS DISQUISTING AND UNBELIEVABLE!!! We were so shocked and should've realized earlier not to pay for food that was almost not touched. We went to the manager twice and she told us she will reimburse us for it. The next day, the director of food and beverages said that things like that happened, they have spray once a week and we will not be getting our money back. Then we spoke to hotel manager - he said its not a big deal either and gave us 30% discount - REDICOULOUS!!!!!!!!! WHO NEEDS THIS EXPENSIVE HOTEL - THERE ARE SO MANY BEAUTIFUL PLACES OUT THERE... SO SORRY THAT WE WENT THERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: Mondon
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at the Sol Melia Vacation Club side of the Gran Melia. The room is very nice and the pool is nice. We have had many other problems. We wanted to rent Kayaks however, the person in charge of this is out sick for the whole week and there is no replacement person. We have to go to another hotel to rent kayaks. Also, the food is very expensive and the service is incredibly slow. We waited 5 hours for sheets for the pullout bed and had to call several times to get someone to bring them to our room. The pullout couch is terribly uncomfortable. This hotel is currently under construction all around it. Also, our room is supposed to be ocean view, while we are facing the ocean we cannot see it at all. Also, the beach is not good for swimming. It is very rocky and full of coral. The other problem is that this hotel is very far from almost everything. You cannot walk to any restaurants or attractions. If you stay here you MUST rent a car. I would definitley recommend staying closer to San Juan. The traffic is terrible and the drive is around 45 minutes each way to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: gidgetNYC
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment. We recently have just traveled back from this resort and I am still aggravated. The service was terrible. We waited over an hour for ice in our room. Another day we waited over an hour for pool towels. We waited 2 days to get a working safe. We had to wait 45 minutes to get bedding and then had to make our own sofa beds. They give you a schedule of activities and with a teenager and two small children they were looking forward to some of the games and entertainment just to be told they weren't running any. So why give a schedule? So no activities at all!!! No waiter bar service by the pool unless you go get it yourself. The staff is rude and also complains about being over worked. You are at their mercy for transportation if you do not have a rental car, which book early or you will not get one and if you rent one from the airport they make you pay parking daily. The front desk is rude; the travel club employees are rude. The gym had broken equipment and only three treadmills. The restaurants have a long wait to be served and our air conditioner broke and it took three phone calls for Maintenance to come and work on it for over two hours, they left our room at 2:15 am.. Do not waste you money or your time exchange. I wish someone would have warned us... Oh yeah PS.. No beach

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotels, with plenty of hidden fees”
Reviews.Author: luke1131
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Gran Melia.. but expect some unexpected fees and very costly ammenities. The entire hotel lobby is open and beautiful. There is plenty of water. The restaurants sit you overlooking goldfish ponds, there are several fountains. The best pool I've ever seen, with a servicing bar you can swim up to. We stayed for 3 nights, and paid for the stay and about $60 of hidden fees (parking, use of phone for local calls, internet). They have a hot tub, but its $30 per person for day and gender separated. You aren't suppossed to bring food into the hotel and the cost of the buffet breakfast is $30 per person. They have tennis courts, but you have to rent rackets. They have canopy bed like structures by the pool, that you have to rent. Our room was beautiful. We had a balcony. The size and decor of the bedroom and the bathroom was impressive. The air conditioner in our room wasn't working. I called and placed a service order about 8am that morning, and by 4pm no one had come to fix it. I had to call back and complain. The parking was a pain. Every time you wanted to leave the hotel compound, you had to have your parking ticket validated.. and they were never readily available. We stood by the desk and waited 10 mins one day for our parking to be validated, then every time you leave, you still have to stop at the guard post so they can look to make sure you did the validation. The complex is in a great location if you want to be inbetween Old San Juan and the bioluminescent bay and rain forest; but next time I think we'll stay closer to Old San Juan. There was no night life during the week.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely setting”
Reviews.Author: widgeon
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was apprehensive about our visit but found it to be fine. Yes, there is construction but if your room is facing the ocean, you will not hear it or even know it is going on. The room and grounds are lovely. The staff was always friendly and efficient. When we arrived, they had us arriving the following week. Fortunately, I had my confirmation letter which avoided any problems. The good: as I said, the room and grounds were gorgeous. The staff was friendly. We had a great rate. The pool was large and beautifully landscaped. It was away from the crowds and massive hotels of San Juan. The bad: Not a swimming beach. Great for walking (with some type of shoe on as it is a coarse sand with broken shells/coral. Restaurants were expensive if you planned to eat there daily. We rented a car as we knew we couldn't walk to conveniences. There is a great bakery at the end of the road which we used to get our breakfast. There is also a grocery. We rented a small fridge for $25 for week and got fruit, juices and veggies for snacks and lunches. Our dinners were at restaurants on the main road as well as the kiosks. We found the food at the kiosks to be great and reasonable. You have your choice of Puerto Rican and 3 that cater to American. The Puerto Rican are more reasonably priced but much of the food is fried. Very good though. The only meal we had at the hotel was 1 lunch at the pool bar. It was good but it was very limited. They seemed to be out of everything we ordered. The things I had read the most complaints about were the prices and service at the restaurants. Having stayed at other hotels on the island, we thought the prices were comparable. The compaints about paying for parking--paying for parking is standard at most of the island hotels. We love to snorkel but it was windy throughout our stay. We went to some southern beaches but it was that way throughout the island. We had done a biolumenscent tour on a previous visit to Puerto Rico and I would definitely recommend it. Car rental through Charlies which had the best price. Loquillo, which is where the kiosks are, had great beaches for walking and swimming. Would I recommend this hotel? Yes, for those who are looking for a quiet, laid back vacation. If you are looking for night life, stay on the strip in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Service to make your grandma cry.”
Reviews.Author: bigstuff26
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel physically. The grounds are pristine and peaceful however as polished as this resort is on the outside, there is an aura of Laize Fare with the staff and how the hotel is run on the inside. From no soap in the public restroom to taking two days to pickup a roomservice tray from our room, this resort was heavly flawed. The food was way over priced (think Outback steakhouse food at Smith and Wollensky Prices) and whats worse is they couldn't bring the entrees out at the same time dispite being half empty. Forgoten drinks and sides also helped agrivate me. The rooms are very well appointed but our plasma TV was fuzzy so whats the point. The AC duct made a thumping noise but no one came to fix it. There also was never enough towels either; some days we didn't have a hand towel or face cloth? Many problems excist here including no one answering the phone when trying to call for assistance or services. The hotel also nickel and dimes your for everything including parking, poolside cabanas for a measly $50/day, $30/hour for an ocean dingy. There is little to do here other than swim under the blazing sun, golf, or spa. Very boring unless you just absolutly want to do nothing and I mean nothing. Fortunalty they had an onsite AVIS so I and my wife high tailed out of there and made our own fun in Old San Juan, Aricebo and the Rainforest. I will better plan my next trip after staying at this hollow shell of a resort.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning”
Reviews.Author: Cheeseheads
Reviews.Content: Two families of four stayed at the Gran Melia Puerto Rico for a couple of nights prior to our cruise. We were extremely pleased with our stay. The lobby and pool areas are absolutely stunning. We experienced friendly service at check in. Our junior suite was clean and spacious. We appreciated the business center area with internet access. We dined at the pool area twice. We thought the food was good and the prices were not that outlandish considering we are at an upscale resort in the Caribbean. We also had a light dinner at the Asian restaurant. The service was a little slow there, but the food was good. We also enjoyed the plentiful breakfast. We spent a day lounging by the enormous pool. We loved the lounge chairs underwater. It was fun to have drinks in the evening in the beautiful bar area listening to music. When it came time to check out, they arrived on time with the luggage carts. We will be back to the Gran Melia Puerto Rico. We highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared for food & drink expences.”
Reviews.Author: Lash99
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort. Great views. Great service. Rooms were nice as with most resorts of this type. The food was not up to par with the resort and very expensive. Lunch for two (2), buffet on Saturday without alchohal: $63.00 Breakfast for one (1) scrambled eggs, breakfast potatos, bacon, english muffin, coffee & juice: $43.00 Two (2) mixed drinks poolside: $21.00 The Sushi Bar was very good. Suggest that you visit the local supermarket before coming in to the resort if you plan to drink or snack. We travel a lot and we expected that the food would have been more in line with the appearance of the resort. Also, there is construction going on at the Marriot Hotel being built by D. Trump.

Reviews.Title: “Posh home base to explore the island”
Reviews.Author: DougHaddix
Reviews.Content: The negative reviews of this resort had me worried, but our stay was exceptionally relaxing. First, it's very easy to find, with a billboard giving you the 3-mile heads-up, then a huge green/white sign telling you exactly where to turn. Suites are large and spotless, with unusually comfortable beds. Pool area is phenomenal, with the Atlantic just a stone's throw away. As mentioned in other reviews, the beach is not great for swimming, but incredible beaches are just a few miles east at Luquillo. Definitely rent a car so you can explore the beautiful island and sample different food. The nearby El Yunque rainforest is awesome. We also explored Old San Juan, the Arecibo Observatory and Fajardo. We never ate at the overpriced resort restaurants -- preferring instead to get out and eat with the locals and immerse ourselves in the culture. If you're looking for an all-inclusive type of experience where you spend all of your time at the resort, the Gran Melia is probably not for you. If you're looking for a beautiful, lush home base to explore Puerto Rico, it fits the bill nicely.

Reviews.Title: “Pass it up and stay elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: Itzhotstang
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a number of resorts but this one was well below what it should have been. I will give it great points for beautiful grounds & buildings but that's where it ends. The service is slow & terrible! The food is way overpriced and not very good. Some hints if you stay: Bring a cooler, there is plenty of ice to be had but you can't use the mini-bar for a refridgerator. If you move something you are charged. We went to the local market - Amigos and bought snacks etc. Bring your own booze - drinks are way overpriced too. Except at the casino where you can drink for free if you are gambling. Rent a car but do it at the resort. Avis is on location and the rates were great plus you don't pay a parking fee at the resort. If you rent a car don't book any tours through the resort - huge rip off. Must do's are Old San Juan & the Rainforest. If you are on a short stay and don't want to rent a car Ritchies Cafe will come and pick you up for dinner. Great views and the food was good. Williams Pizza will deliver to the resort. We decided on this trip we will never come back to Puerto Rico - much better service at the resorts in Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “I kept expecting to hear tattoo say the plane, the plane.”
Reviews.Author: amarill0traveler
Reviews.Content: We recently went and stayed 6 days and had a blast. From the time we arrived it was a great experience. Our 14 year old and 12 year old had no fears of walking anywhere on the property. The poolside cafe and bar needs to stay open longer, the food was delicious. Nami is also really good. I even enjoyed the Italian but the kids spaghetti was worse than Chef Boyardee spaghettios. The only down fall is that they rotate which restaurant is open and closed on a daily basis. A car does come in handy and they are available at the resort. Ritchie's will pick you up and drop you back at the resort (free) and the food is fantastic, also try La Parilla in Loquillo at the Kiosks. Don't' be afraid of the iguanas, there everywhere. The 14 year old said she was getting married there and asked if they have a university so she could go to school there. the 12 year old wants a pool like theirs at home, good luck. I grew up on the west coast and Texas and I know what a beach is, do not believe any negative things you hear about this beach, It is not a white sandy beach, but I did not see one anywhere near us, except when we went sailing and snorkeling. If you want to kill a day go on this trip. Booked it at the hotel and was worth every penny. Food, open rum bar and sodas, deli sandwiches, snacks all gear included plus transporation and beautiful water and reefs that hold a lot of marine life. I would choose this over Hawaii any day, it is a lot more relaxing. I you go have fun.

Reviews.Title: “it was OK”
Reviews.Author: jpcz
Reviews.Content: Service on a hotel side: very friendly, with a smile all the time, never had a problem. We booked two rooms for 3 adults + 2 children and had to be persistent in getting the rooms in the same building, but all was accomplished without anybody being frustrated. We were offered a ride to our car (rental) to get the luggage and they carried everything up to the room. Staff (mostly male) were looking for ways to help with everything, ladies at the counter were more reserved, sometimes short in responses, but polite and efficient. Rooms: great room size, nice beds, all clean, sofa in each room that folds out, serviced well as far as towels, balcony with 2 plastic chairs (but not comfortable enough to sit there). My major complaint is that we could not control the air conditioning in the room, so the fan was going all the time regardless of what setting you put it on (low, med, high) and we could not turn it off. We ended up setting it up to 80 F to avoid freezing us and the kids at night, but it did not help. If you can, ask for a room facing the water, i.e. NOT facing the construction. No matter how far you are from the construction site, the noise will invade the room as soon as you open the balcony door. It was great to enjoy the fresh air and tropical noises (frogs) and look for birds and iguanas during the weekend, but you cannot avoid the big construction noise and view of two cranes. Our other room was facing the other way (facing the water - although we were in the second row of bungalows, so we did not see the water) and it made all the difference. You DO NOT hear any of those noises at the pool, beach, restaurants, garden etc. Refrigerator: we paid $25 for a week for "refrigerator". It is a good deal, but do not expect a real thing. It is a small cooler rather then refrigerator and we were able to fit in a couple of yogurts, half gal milk box, half gal juice box, botle of vine and a bottle of water. It kept the milk fresh for the whole week. It is an interesting system that they let you have a cooler, but post a sign that you are not suppose to bring in outside food. We were asked a couple of times to carry the food in a bag/backpack rather then in a plastic bag. Food source: We were not too keen on food available at the resort, mostly due to high prices. Grill by the pool has a wonderful view/location and good food (pool type) - like chicken fingers for kids ~$8, burger ~11. But a bottle of water or a cup of sprite is $3. We did not use the restaurant that serves breakfast, because we did not want to pay $20 per person. They have a corner when you enter the restaurant, that offers coffee and small items. 8oz cup of coffee is $2.50 there. Staff was not very friendly there. We went for Hibachi dinner at the asian restaurant next door and it was OK ($26-32/pp) , but not great. I ordered Daikiri and received strawbery daikiri - sweet mix from the mixing cooler topped off by some rum - no shaking... it was too sweet for me and I just wanted simple daikiri, so I gave it back and was not charged. - I was hoping to get a great mixed drink, since I visited the Bacardi factory/museum in San Juan earlier that week, but they do not do it right. There is a bar at the lobby and really nice places to sit and hang out there, with 4 computers free for all. Mojito there is $10. Food alternatives: got water, milk etc at supermarket "Amigos" 10 min away. For ready to eat food: CoCo Sweet Bakery is ~ 3 min by car from the gate to the resort and has rice/bean/meat variations for ~ $6 - very good warm food, pleasant local service. They also have cold and warm sandwiches and the "bakery" side of it with all sorts of cakes and white bread. Kioskos is a line of ~ 60 permanent food stands - popular with locals + tourists, but not very atractive to me. Most serve almost identical local food with some exceptions. Local food choices are fried or fried or fried. I loved the "pinchos" - meat kebabs on a grill - $2 for piece sold along the road. Beach: not sandy, just thing layers of tiny pieces of shells. Pleasant to walk on, completely empty and beautiful in the morning (7:30 AM). Pool: Fantastic due to its shape, large size, temperature, swim up bar, fountain. Clean and great for relaxing swim. Not a lap pool.

Reviews.Title: “The resort was fantastic- relaxing, beautiful, and away from the busy scene.”
Reviews.Author: FortMyersCouple
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our five year anniversary here and LOVED the resort! However, we were given bad directions by the travel concierge, which cost an hour of sitting in traffic due to being lost- recommend having an I Phone with GPS! There were also limited excursion options out of the hotel, so research on your own first- East Island Excursions were GREAT! Also, buy some food because the restaurants are very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking Hotel!!!!! Food...so-so”
Reviews.Author: loopo27
Reviews.Content: We planned a short trip to the Gran Melia at Coco Beach. First thing you notice is the amazing hotel and lobby...words cannot describe the open air build with birds swooping past you and some iguanas just traveling around. The statues, marble and wood everything is mind blowing, not to mention the little avenues and walkways surrounded by water alleys. My goodness! Now the bad part, well kind of...the staff is extra helpful, however the downside is that most are young-aged and can be a little disorganized. For example, the first room they gave us was occupied and we walked into a room with a half-naked person...unless you like that sort of thing. If you don't rent a car, you are completely limited to eating at the resort. Only 3-4 restuarants with so-so taste and only 1 breakfast buffet-everyday. Not much of a beach, but if you look carefully you can find amazing private hideways to lie under the palms and have a little private entrance to the ocean. The pool? I'm speechless. Overall, a gorgeous resort...can get a little pricey. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “From the looks of the lobby this place is heaven, but wait...”
Reviews.Author: bosnomar
Reviews.Content: I came to Gran Melia for 5 days in March 2009, a Monday-Friday, and traveled with a 1 year old. I actually ended up book this hotel as a vacation package on priceline so didn't pay the normal 250+ a night for the room but still didn't feel it was worth what i paid. 1st, the directions are terrible, and the place can not be found in the gps or on a map, so i called the hotel from enterprise for directions, I was told to go to 26 then 66 and call for more directions then...i was put 40 miles in the wrong direction...once i made it to crtr 968 not 955 as they told me- the drive is about 3 miles from the main road and very well landscaped, security is mediocre no one ever asked who i was or where i was going at the gates just raised the bars for us. On a side note the hotel is a good 30mins from anything worth seeing or doing and a rental car a must. Check in was fast and painless, our room was ready and we immediately had someone to take us on one of the golf carts to our room, this was the only time we had a cart immediately available, other times they seemed to be nearly nonexistent...our first day there we found swarms of fire ants on our nightstand between the 2 beds, desks and tables and they continued throughout our stay, our bathroom shower rod was also rusted out, at night the a/c was turned off by the hotel to conserve energy i guess and the fanning system ran so loudly it was hard to sleep. Then, "the beach", the waves break about a mile off the shore, the shore is almost all rocks and it was all landscaped to be shaded- absolutely no swimming here and it was pretty much deserted. Parking is 16 a day, but you can get away with paying almost nothing for it b/c they give u tickets to be validated but if you don't take them to be validated no one ever knows you have a car there. Roomservice was outrageously expensive, 2 cheeseburgers and a grilled cheese was 60 bucks and not good, the fries were cold and soggy and the cheeseburgers were tough. The Nami Asian inspired restaurant they had however was very good and priced just like any other hibachi here at home would be about 50 for 2 hibachi dinners. Finally, the staff, while very nice, their English comprehension level was pitiful, i called at one point asking about eye doctors in the area and they said they would send security to my room, i then explained in Spanish my situation and that i needed an optometrist they wanted to send their physician for 150 and said they didn't have info on any services available outside of the hotel area. So in a nut shell, if your ok with fire ants, walking, no beach, driving a car in roads with crazy puertorican drivers, speak Spanish fluently then this place still isn't worth your money. The lobby was heaven, the rest no so much...

Reviews.Title: “Great experience- I would do it again, although not too much of a beach”
Reviews.Author: DillyDc
Reviews.Content: I was a bit concerned about staying there after reading many of the reviews. However, I was positively surprised and the stay exceeded my expectations. The Hotel is beautiful and full of charm- just the lobby is breathtaking- our rooms , both Jarden View, were nice, very clean and extremely comfortable. We also tried two of the restaurants - the Asian and Passion- and had great meals. I agree that they are a bit pricey but not much more than the dinner we had in Old Town Puerto Rico. We also took advantage of the many free classes the hotel offers - aquagym, pilates, yoga- which made our stay more fun. The only downside is the lack of a proper beach. If you are into beach activities than this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Redeployment Vacation”
Reviews.Author: jorgeaponte
Reviews.Content: I would say theat our stay in Gran Melia was fenomenal, my family and I enjoyed our stay in the Hotel. I would definetaly recommend this Hotel to anyone with or without children who want to relax, and enjoy one of the most exotic cuisine in the luxerious restaurants. We will definately stay there again. Moreover, the Hotel staff "all of the ones who I interacted with were professionals" Just like the saying "PUERTO RICO DOES IT BETTER" JORGE A. APONTE CPT, LG US ARMY

Reviews.Title: “Partial ocean view”
Reviews.Content: Room with a (partial) view. We book a room at the Gran Melia in Puerto Rico that was supposed to have an "ocean view". It had what the front desk called a "partial" ocean view. No place on Orbitz or the Gran Melia websites was a "partial" view mentioned. In order to see the ocean we had to go out on the terrace, look left past a big electrical box to see the ocean. That was our biggest complaint. The food was good, but very expensive, especially the breakfast. Most of the staff were nice. I had a little trouble getting my sick husband some dry toast between 11am and noon. Nothing is open. The person I talked to at the restaurant stopped speaking english when she understood I wanted something special. The staff at the pool bar was very helpful. Great pool. Our room was at the end of the peninsula, the ocean there is pretty, we were the only ones there most of the time. Several other guests told us that they had extraneous room charges that they had to straighten out, we didn't. One thing to note, you have to charge everything to your room. It would be easy to charge up a lot in a week and have a shock at the end of your vacation. Parking was supposed to cost us $16 a day, but we were never charged. Never had a problem getting a ride from the staff to or from our room. Would not recommend this hotel, I was turned off by the staff at the restaurant, the floor in our room was not clean (I had to brush off my feet before getting into bed) and our "partial" ocean view-misleading. There was a lot of construction going on, both at our hotel and the new Trump complex down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty resort and pool - overpriced food and not much of a beach”
Reviews.Author: tlcpt
Reviews.Content: Not crazy about the check-in...My partner and our 2 year old daughter checked in just as it started to rain. We weren't offered a ride to our room (lots of golf carts around for staff use) and once we walked there in the pouring rain, we found we hadn't been given a key. A maid notified the front desk, it took 25 minutes to finally get in to our room as we waited undercover. The room was clean and nicely decorated. The staff was friendly but we had to call everyday for linens to be brought to our room that had been forgotten by the maid. The food was just okay and overpriced - we were charged $90 for 2 entrees, 2 drinks and a kids meal our first night there (at Passion) - our toddler started to lose it and after ordering we decided to take the meal to our room. We were charged a gratuity even though we didn't eat there! We were glad we had a car so we could try some of the local cuisine - especially La Parilla - #2 in the Loquillo kiosks - right by the beach. The rainforest was close to the hotel and a great place to hike. Construction could easily be heard from poolside - so much for getting away from it all. Overall our stay was okay but we wouldn't return.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Melia has potential just not quite there”
Reviews.Author: rnocn
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 days at The Gran Melia some days it was five star resort and on others you just shake your head. The resort is breathtaking. The open air lobby is quite grand. I had requested two rooms together since we were traveling with our 16 and 18 year old daughters. Our rooms were not ready upon our arrival and was forced to wait an hour or so. When our room was finally ready after 2+ hours the rooms were located in different buildings. Our garden view room overlooked the future Marriot Resort barren land with lots of construction and noise from 7am-4pm. This really put a damper on our experience. When I complained to the front desk the answer was we can't stop the construction can we? Well an offer to move us to a different room would have been appreciated.Spent most of our time at the pool and beach. The ocean was beautiful bought a tube and floated over the rocks and enjoyed the serenity. The wet bar was good for a quick lunch. Order from the kids menu for an inexpensive pool side meal. The cleanliness of the room was suspect considering we found pieces of latex balloons and clumps of hair all over the floor. Took awhile for housekeeping to come back. But they did with a smile on their face. Much better from there on in. My daughters room was immaculate the housekeeper even organized their clothes daily (they wanted to bring her home with them). Tried to eat at Tempo only to be told there were no reservations available until 10pm. We tried Passions the service was very poor. Ran out of chicken by seven pm. Took over an hour to get a glass of wine and an order of soup. My dinner was brought to the table and I waited patiently for the three other dinners to arrive after 15 minutes we requested the wiater Danny only for him never to arrive maybe he was in the back preparing the caesar salad my daughter ordered after another 15 minutes with only my dinner on the table we requested a manager to come to the table only she was too busy in the back finally 15 minutes later the waiter arrives sans the glass of wine we had ordered 45 minutes ago reporting that because they ran out of chicken for two of the dishes the order had gotten messed up. Well now my dinner has been sitting on the table for 45 minutes and still no sign off anyone elses dinner arriving or even the glass of wine. Table next to us got up and walked out because they waited 30 minutes and never got a menu or water. Requested the check paid 40 dollars for a bowl of soup a glass of wine a diet coke and virgin daquiri . As I am paying the bill the manager /chef /owner walks by and doesn't even attempt to stop at the table. The whole time the maitre de and the service staff were bickering. Well off to Burger King at 10:00 for a wonderful meal in our rooms............. Found out the Melia rents out the space. Spoke with Raphael Sevilla Food and Beverage Manager he was very attentive and promised to speak with owner chef . Never heard a reponse from Passions. The pool ran out of towels occassionally but were soon replenished. Kudos to Luz the concierge at the vacation planning desk. Everyone should take a lesson in customer service from her. Checkout your bills carefully charged for meals that were not ours. Advice don't charge anything to your room use your credit card to avoid this hassle. Would definiately go back after they have their ducks in a row

Reviews.Title: “This resort is a study in ambiguity”
Reviews.Author: Macable
Reviews.Content: Our week long stay ended on 3-1-09. What could have been a dream vacation was marred by a less than promised visit to this beautiful place. Having booked in Nov. 08, we were looking forward to the level of "Royal Service" that our friends experienced last year. They convinced us to go with them & were mortified at the changes. Now we all know the economy is in sad shape, which is the reason we were notified just before the trip that there had been some changes to the Royal Service level. The hotel did comp us a meal & offered gratis cocktails from 6-9 PM to make up for the lack of perks promised. Our R S garden view junior suite was lovely & well appointed, We did not appreciate the blood spots in the bed & the hundreds of bites we received however. If you are as tasty as we are, beware. Never saw a bed bug, but I believe they were chiggers. I finally stripped the bed myself! Fleas around the RS pool, added to our misery. The Royal Service pool was the biggest & most disgusting feature. It is gorgeous for sure, but from Monday to Friday was completely unstaffed. No towels, no drink or food service until Saturday when the locals checked in. Numerous complaints to the front desk were shrugged off. The worst part was that guests not paying the premium price that we were, were allowed to use this pool. RS guests are identified by bracelets. Children are not allowed,& yet there were babies in diapers in this pool! The Palapas at the main pool were renting for $50 per day. Not a problem as the regular guests were just plopping into the RS palapas for free. My advice.. don't pay for RS, just take advantage of all of the RS amenities, nobody will notice! We spoke to many other RS guests who were as disgusted as we were. It just isn't fair to pay a premium for services that others don't & to have them get away with it is so wrong. Staff has been cut due to the economy & the ones that are left are very nice, especially the bar staff & restaurant staff. We ended our stay very upset at the lack of policy enforcement on the part of management.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time, Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Staadust
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 6 day trip to Gran Melia. I traveled with my 14 and 9 year old daughters and my mother. The resort is landscaped beautifully and service was attentive throughout our stay. We did not have any issues with food service, in fact the wait staff were wonderful. We rented a car at the airport and brought our GPS from home, but did not use to find the hotel. Other reviews state the resort is hard to find...we had no trouble, despite all signs being in Spanish. They let us check in super-early and the golf carts were always available to bring you around the resort. We were disappointed with only two things - the lack of beach (great for walking and kids exploring, but not lounging) and the music at the bar in the evening. Schedule said one thing, but DJ played mostly dated 80's and 90's. We wanted salsa and merengue. I can understand the reviewers who felt trapped and bored. Definitely rent a car and go check out the area. There are plenty of familiar chains to stop for provisions. We bought bottled water and snacks - security never made an issue. They just don't want people rolling in with coolers. I had packed a small soft cooler and we used ice to keep juice and soda cold and although not allowed, we brought it to the pool area in a larger tote bag. We ate at the hotel only three times: breakfast and dinner at the Italian and Asian themed restaurants. Joel at Tempo was the BEST waiter I've ever had (and I go out to eat a lot). He made my younger daughter smile more than any other time during the trip. The prices for dinner were what you will pay at any hotel or higher end restaurant. Breakfast is a bit pricey at $22 for the buffet. As stated in another review stop in at the bakery at the end of the road (Coco Sweet) and get a breakfast sandwich ($2.50 and its huge!). They do not really speak English, so find out how to order before going. Lastly, check out the "Kioscos" in Luquillo, about 15 minutes east on 3. It is a line of about 60 food stands. They look like shacks and you might want to pass by based on looks, but don't. We spent a few hours our first day at #8, sitting at the counter talking to the owner who was explaining (and making) his food for us. Everyone we talked to in the area suggested #2 and 9. They are more of a sit-down restaurant than the other stands, offer a higher end product & presentation and a bit more expensive . Actually, #2 prices were comparable to the hotel food. For activities we snorkeled, visited the rain forest, Old San Juan and kayaked in the Bio luminescent bay with Kayak Puerto Rico. The Bio tour was by far the coolest thing we did. Overall everyone was friendly and accommodating at the hotel and everywhere we went. Loved this trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! will definitely go again!!!”
Reviews.Author: StargirlJ
Reviews.Content: I loved this vacation. The resort was clean, the rooms were clean and the staff was extremely friendly! i was nervous to go after reading some of these reviews, but i had an amazing time! i went with the royal service room and had a blast. people were so nice there, i even ended up making friends! the beach and pool areas are beautiful and there is a great view of the sunset. WELL worth the money. Nami, the asian restaurant was great and I loved the fact that I could go night swimming! i honestly, can not say enough about how enjoyable this vacation was for me. the grounds are beautiful and the lobby is impressive. everyone was helpful and friendly. i will be going back again!

Reviews.Title: “advice for families with younger kids”
Reviews.Author: cobblehill
Reviews.Content: Last time we were in Puerto Rico, we stayed at Villa Sevilla, in a 2 bedroom cottage on a mountain in the rainforest, which we found on Trip Advisor and loved (it has a lovely pool). This time, we decided to try a resort, and Gran Melia had cheap rates. It has some good points, a nice pool, a pretty spot, good ocean views and natural beach for splashing and walking (but not swimming), but I wouldn't recommend it. The service at the front desk is unbelievably bad, ranging from merely inept to downright obstructionist. If you want a resort experience, I imagine that El Conquistador or Rio Mar are much better, and if you just want a base of operations, Villa Sevilla is preferable. That said, if you get a super cheap rate and go, here are some suggestions: -Join their MAS program before you go, and bring your number with you. It entitles you to a free room upgrade and buy one get one free breakfast. They will ask you to provide your number numerous times, and act like you are trying to cheat them and are perhaps committing a criminal act, but it's worth it if you ignore the attitude. -Ask for a fridge in your room. It's $25 per week and then you can buy food and drink and store it in the room. If you have to eat at the resort restaurants, go for the pool bar. It's somewhat random when it's open, usually until 6, and sometimes for dinner. For offsite restaurants, try Antojitos Puertoricanos on the Rio Mar road, right after you turn left off of rt. 3. -We loved Las Cabezas de San Juan and El Yunque, and actually had fun snorkeling with the kids on the East Wind catamaran booze cruise. It was mainly families. -Rent a car at the airport. -We forgot to validate our parking tickets at Gran Melia, and they never asked us for the validated tix, so we didn't end up paying for parking. In general, we enjoyed our days in inverse proportion to how much contact we had with front desk staff. Also, the kid's club seemed either non-existent or to consist of one bored teenager. And there's construction all around, so noise is audible from rooms. Ask for a room far from the noise. They'll ask you "what noise?" Persist. If you go, game the system, enjoy the pool, eat offsite, and try not to give Gran Melia any more money than you have to, they don't deserve it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't always believe what others say need too experience it your self”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi Like other's almost canacelled my trip to the grande melia due too bad rap and bad feed back. If you are looking to relax in paradius, this is the place. Stayed here for few nights before my cruise and loved it. The people and place was just what i needed.Take the reviews and use it to better your stay.The only negative point i have about the hotel was the beach, But for me didn't really mind because i got to see 5 other beautiful beachs on a cruise. Hope this helps and i would recommend this hotel for a relaxing get away. If you compare the price it was just great

Reviews.Title: “Really nice for LAID BACK vacationers...”
Reviews.Author: nybrit
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice, trendy resort that I think is probably best suited for young professionals and older singles. I guess it would be fine for a family vacation but I don't think they have kids clubs, and there is heavy drinking around the pool area. Check In: Great, wasn't greeted with anything like a cold drink, but it was fast and we got into our room right away. They gave us a tour of the grounds, and the concierge and bellboys were really nice Lobby/Grounds: Were absolutely stunning. Everything about it was fabulous especially the scent! They had these great diffusers throughout that made the place smell so good. Free computer use for everyone...Also-They were pretty good about always having a little cart take you to and from your room if you don't feel like walking. Food: Was REALLY good! I found the specials were always really on par and the fish was nice and fresh. Not a lot of authentic Puerto Rican dishes which was a little disappointing. The ambiance was really nice at the a la carte Restaurants. The buffet was really good and had fresh juices, an omelet stations, fruits, great coffee and all the regular breakfast staples. It is EXTREMELY expensive though! about $40 each! Drinks: Very good, expensive...but very good. Rooms: Beautiful, roomy and BEAUTIFUL marble bathrooms. Stayed in Junior Ocean Suite. Maid Service: Very nice except I encountered one problem which grossed me out. On the first night there I went to get into bed and there were crumbs and hairs under the sheets and bed. I immediately called the front desk and it took about and hour for them to send somebody up! (it was about 11pm when I called) I was really annoyed, but I just let it go. When the maid came she changed the sheets,pillowcases, and entire duvet cover so I was satisfied. Other than that they were very nice and we never ran into them, just came into a clean room! "Activities": If you could call it that. I was really excited that they had water sports on site and went down to the shack and decided I would rent a jetski. Both were broken. Okay, I opted for a mini speed boat. Broken. Basically the only things that weren't "broken" is what we took, which wound up being a little catamaran and motorized Kayak. The guys taught us how to use them, and off we went. About 200 ft out, We all got stuck out there!! We were yelling for the guys and they were insisting that we were doing something wrong, we weren't! Anyway, after about a half hour of SITTING there. They finally dragged us back to shore, but they were nice enough to refund us, so whatever, not that big of a deal. Gift shop: Nice, not too expensive unless you were buying sunblock! It was $28! LOL stupid me for thinking one spray on can of sunscreen would last me 7 days. Overall, I would suggest this place for young singles, Couples without children, trendy professionals...etc. Would not go there if I had a family. I really had a wonderful time, but I could see some people with higher expectations might get frustrated with the service especially for it being four stars and very high prices.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place soon to be too exclusive.”
Reviews.Author: beatdownbonanza
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia was everything advertised.10 million $ in renovations really showed. .Beautiful grounds,fountains,and primitive art made this a relaxing get-away. True, the beach was not the best in front of the pool area,but if you go to the left or right for a short distance,you can find a nice relaxing area. We did not spend much time there in the resort.We (my wife and I)like to explore the area. It was a short drive to a really nice beach in Luquillo and the El Yunque rain forest was a 25 minute drive( worth it ). You will need a rental car.I also suggest you get a GPS.It can be confusing when you can"t read Spanish.Also,Puertoricans don't know their right from left,so if you ask for directions,you will get lost.Nothing against them.They were very nice and tried to be helpful.Be careful driving,though.There are no rules to be followed.Drive as fast or as slow as you want.And when the light turns green,make sure no one is running their red light. This is definitely an up and coming area.Donald Trump has bought up most of the area to build condo's and a Trump Tower.He already has a nice golf course there. The casino is small but that didn't matter to me.I don't like casinos. The pool was nice,but I didn't get in.At 83 degrees and a constant breeze,it was a little chilly. It seemed the hotel got very crowded on the weekend,so check in during the week(Monday,Tuesday).Prices seemed to go up the more crowded it got.Cabanas around the pool were unoccupied during the week when the guests were sparce,but when it started to fill up,they posted 50$ a day signs on them. Try to get the best deal.We took a 90 minute sales presentation on a time share and saved about 200$ a night. If you like to relax this is the perfect place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly people in general”
Reviews.Author: Dmadisonk
Reviews.Content: My BF took me to the Melia for a nice 5 day getaway. The place was immaculate, the food was descent, the beach was non-exiistent. I have been to many beaches and this by far was the worst I've ever seen. The only thing you can do is try to walk on it for a stroll. I was also upset with the hotel charging for the non-motorized sports... really??? The staff was accomodating and the guests were friendly, but I don't think I will return. Oh did I also mention that you get caught on the charges... please be sure to get the meal plan as well as the liquor plan. Oh wait!! my BF also paid for the Royal Service. It was being renovated at the time and really don't understand why they advertise it.

Reviews.Title: “great trip - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LouAnnMichigan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from Feb.1 â€“ 8 and wish that I never had to leave. Donâ€™t know where some of these reviews are coming from but my experience is as follows. 1) The biggest most beautiful swimming pool imaginable and the hotel lobby and dining areas seem to be floating on water. All super clean. 2) Excellent prompt check-in service. We werenâ€™t sure if we wanted oceanfront or garden and they let us look at each and then decide. Good housekeeping services. No problem getting extra towels at the pool or in the room. 3) Friendly staff always willing to help. We played golf at the Trump courses next door and the Gran Melia staff and the Trump staff made the shuttle service effortless and fun. Two great golf courses also. 4) Ate dinner at both Nami and Tempo restaurants more than once and both had excellent selection, service, and reasonable pricing for that quality of menu. Nami has a hibachi restaurant and a traditional restaurant and the wait on the hibachi side is too long if you are not the first table. Ate lunch either poolside or at the golf course â€“ both were good. Great shrimp cocktail poolside at the hotel. 5) Called to get more sodas for the minibar and they delivered them within 60 seconds of my call. 6) Do a rainforest tour/hike (mainly downhill) through the hotel tour desk. Ask for Lucy as a guide â€“ she was fabulous. Took us to eat lunch afterward at a mom & pop restaurant for real PR food. The rainforest is awesome. 7) Had fun playing roulette and bingo in the casino. Play bingo with the locals â€“ they are charming. 8) I needed a prescription while I was there and the staff made all the arrangements and went to get the prescription and delivered it to my room. 9) Everyone seemed happy and having a good time â€“ as it should be. Youâ€™re on vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “5-star looks, but nothing else about it is 5-star, including prices”
Reviews.Author: jmw74
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia is a beautiful place. The night we arrived we said to each other "wow, look at this place". The very large pool is really the main attraction, but the whole resort is quite well done, with great landscaping, design, furniture, architecture. We got a room with a kitchen, dining area, and separate bedroom near the main resort building for a pretty great price for a "5 star" hotel. However the hotel is not really 5 star. I was not surprised, since I hadn't paid 5-star prices to begin with. The service is nothing special, and there is none of that "extra" stuff you expect from a 5-star hotel. The woman at the front desk for checkin was very nice and pleasant, but after that no one stood out as particularly helpful. The room was well done, big, complete kitchen, 2 flat screen tv's, comfortable king bed. However one of the 2 a/c fans would not turn off until i cut the power at the circuit breaker box. After that the a/c worked fine. A light in the shower was out, and was never fixed even though I reported it. One very maddening experience was that we were told on the way to the room by the porter that there were dishes and cooking utensils in the kitchen. He said we could buy groceries and cook if we wanted. So we attempted to do exactly that. As we were walking to our room with groceries, a security guard stopped us and informed us that no outside food was allowed in the rooms for (if I recall correctly) "security reasons". When I objected, the guard suggested that I sneak the food in in a suitcase. Rather than argue, I just sneaked the food in. I have no idea what kind of lunatic policy this is, but it wasn't just one rogue guard, the rule was posted on a sign near the main building. I had seen the sign, but thought I must have misunderstood, because the hotel couldn't be that idiotic. I stand corrected. I think the resort tries to keep you eating and drinking their overpriced food as much as possible, which I understand, but to forbid you from cooking in your room, in which they've placed a kitchen and utensils, is unforgivable. The food at the Asian restaurant in the resort was actually quite good. It seemed overpriced at first, but as we travelled around PR, we noticed all the food everywhere was pretty expensive. So no complaints there. The restaurant at the pool was another story. Grossly overpriced, and the staff was completely overwhelmed, even though the pool was not crowded. We had to chase down waiters and bartenders, who were at least polite given their workload. The drinks are definitely overpriced, though, which isn't surprising either. Cheap beers are $5, and I got a very substandard martini at a bar called "The Martini Bar" for $10. The beach at the hotel is disappointing. You really can't travel to the Caribbean and spend all your beach time there, it's a waste. It might be nicer than your beaches at home, but there are better beaches here within reasonable driving distance. We wanted to take a ferry to more pristine beaches, but it sold out minutes before we got there. I advise you to buy tickets the day before. I saw other people using the free internet-connected computers, but all of them were non-functional when I tried to use them. Overall the Gran Melia is great on physical beauty but not much personality. However given the low price we paid for the whole package, it met my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Rebuttal To Negative Reviews”
Reviews.Author: DisplacedIslandSoul
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews after booking this hotel stay and I almost cancelled due to the negative publicity it was getting. In the end, I am VERY happy that I decided to stick it out and give it a try. I am sure that every experience is different, but apart from the beach not being the greatest, I have no complaints at all about our stay at Gran Melia Puerto Rico. The hotel grounds were immaculate. All of the staff gave service with a smile and the restaurants were not overpriced, as some people noted. If you are looking for a hotel in a metro area, this is not the place for you. However, if you are looking for a slice of paradise in which to relax, be sure to visit Gran Melia Puerto Rico. All in all, I would definitely return to Gran Melia Puerto Rico, and I would recommend it, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: KanDLand
Reviews.Content: The first mistake I made was to believe everything that was posted on this websiteâ€¦.. My husband and I just returned (yesterday!) from Puerto Rico and stayed in the Gran Melia. I booked this trip before reading so many negative reviews of this resort. After reading these reviews, I was really very sorry that I chosen this hotel, but as this trip was non-refundable, there was nothing I could do about it. After a very trying airline encounter, we pulled up to the hotel about 8:30pm and I was expecting another bad experienceâ€¦â€¦â€¦ The open-air hotel lobby, surrounded by numerous ponds with waterfalls and beautiful scents lingering in the air, was lit almost completely by candlelight. Candles were everywhere, water was everywhere, and the front-desk staff could not have been any nicer. It was SO luxurious, so calming, and so exotic. We got a ride to our room from a very nice bellman, and the room was beautiful. At that point I was glad I had chosen this hotel, and that opinion did not change for the duration of our trip (5 nights). To answer some of the negative postings I read: There are safes in all of the roomsâ€”so, if you have any valuables like money or jewelry, just lock them up in the easy to use safe. I donâ€™t understand how $$ can be stolen if the safe is used. Room theft is present at any hotel you stay in. I read that one person waited 45 minutes for ice. The hotel is pretty spread out (but no building is more than two stories highâ€”a nice feature), but ice machines are EVERYWHERE. I cannot understand why someone would wait for ice to be delivered, but if they did, 45 minutes would not be out of the question. The restaurantsâ€”If one is paying attention, they tell you at check-in which restaurants are open and the times of operation. We did not eat breakfast at the resort. My husband and I ate dinner at Nami, Asian Fusion. It was delicious!! The prices are commensurate with what you would expect at a four-star hotel. Our meal was $68 including two drinks and tip. It was great. We did not eat at Tempo and I have read some negative reviews. But our neighbors did, and they could not have been more pleased. They got a beef meal (not pasta), and their exact words were: â€œit was so tender, it could have been put on bread and eaten like a sandwich.â€� We also ate at Passion, a new onsite restaurant, privately owned. We ate outside under candlelight and the stars, and had a very enjoyable meal. While somewhat over priced, the atmosphere and service made the experience worthwhile. We left the hotel early in the morning and ate most of our meals offsite to try and get some Caribbean flavor. (This worked out greatâ€”we had some fabulous PR food!) The room was cleaned daily and toiletries replaced. The room was immaculate. There were no mosquitoes to speak of, and there was no â€œbellman fee.â€� The beach is lovely to look at, but not to swim in. The pool is BEAUTIFUL! I noticed that you were able to rent kayaks, small catamarans, and jet skis for use on the beach. Nice touch! The resort is definitely â€œout there.â€� There is really nothing nearby, so if you want to go anywhere, rent a car. My husband and I thought it was on the quiet side of PR. The resort is totally peaceful and far removed from the TREMENDOUS HUSTLE AND BUSTLE OF SAN JUAN. We felt so relaxed when we re-entered the resort grounds and the biggest regret of our trip was that we did not spend just one day exclusively at the resort! We checked our bill the night before we were leaving to avoid any problems in the morning. There were a few charges from moving things around on the mini-bar and the associated top rack. We indicated that we did not purchase the items notated and the charges were immediately removed without question by very pleasant front-desk staff. Some other comments: We did a snorkeling trip from Fajardo on the Spread Eagle II. The trip was WONDERFUL AND WE HIGHLY RECOMMEND this charter to anyone! The staff was great! The resort is only about 20 minutes from the rainforest, El Yunque. This is a must seeâ€”it is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not a beach resort”
Reviews.Author: BusTravelerWisconsin
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we are members of the Sol Melia vacation club. The Puerto Rico property is not our home resort. In all fairness, we didn't explore this hotel very well before choosing to go there. We are "beach resort" people and this is not a beach resort. However, it is directly on the beach , but the beach is a mess with stones, debris, seaweed, etc..You won't find anybody on the beach who isn't just walking by. There are no services on the beach (bar service, vendors...). So where are the people? Well, they are either around the pool or golfing. This is more of a Golf Resort and Casino. It is about an hour South of the San Juan airport. There isn't much in the Rio Grande area where the hotel is located except a few local restaurants and businesses. You're pretty much out on your own here. I think the area will get built up in coming years with more hotels, restaurants and things to do, but for now we won't be going back. There was a fair amount of construction in the area, so it looks like this location will be more attractive in the future (about 5 years would be my guess). The hotel itself is nice. And, the restaurants inside the resort are fine. The pool is large and has a swim up bar. It does have some night life inside the resort, but not every night. It seem to be more lively Thursday - Sunday. Unless you're a golfer and actually going to golf every day, then I would recommend staying in the Old San Juan area instead. There just isn't enough to do in the Rio Grande at this time and like I mentioned earlier, this isn't a beach resort (at least not yet).

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Come True”
Reviews.Author: kchildersstein
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Gran Melia right before we got married on a cruise . We stayed in the oceanfront royal service suite and we loved it . Our room was beautiful and the butler service was great ! The resort also aloud us to have other people who were coming on the cruise for our wedding spend the day with us by the pool . This resort isn't for people who want alot of nightlife . It is very relaxing and peaceful. The drinks are great and the food is good but alittle expensive but it is like that at every resort . My husband and I planned another cruise for April 2009 and we will be staying at the Gran Melia again for three days before . Awesome Place !!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A series of unfortunate events...”
Reviews.Author: Caribbeanlover1
Reviews.Content: I know our comments may be a tad overdue but, as they say, "Better late than never".
