Don't get us wrong, the resort IS a beautiful place but what goes on behind closed doors damages the view. Let me start with check-in... more than 20 minutes with no line before us (???) Not even a little white lie for an excuse (just chit chatting and laughter amongst the staff.) Lack of bell personnel to help with our luggage (add about 10 more minutes to the waiting period). The concierge mentioned a free gift and all it was, was a 90 minute presentation offer. At the concierge we asked for recommendations for good local food and were sent to a place called Martins BBQ (very odd for a recommendation.) This was just the beginning of our stay so we decided to overlook the situations and hope for the best. Moving on to the our room, on our second night we requested for two additional towels which never arrived; needless to say, we called every afternoon for them and complaint with no luck which led us to keep the pool towels on a daily basis. Our bed sheets were only changed once during our stay. Still we remained calm and with high hopes. It was the day before our last which caused us such distress when during an absolutely awesome bio kayak trip I returned to the van to drop off my sandals to find the young lady who had arrange the trip (who had hitched a ride with us) in a very compromising position. We chose not to mention this incident to the resort but it is certainly not something I would wish for someone else to see.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it!”
Reviews.Author: NYCandaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: I'm going to start with what i believe is one of the most important qualities a leading hotel SHOULD have...and that is good food. I actually think that I had the worst meal of my life at this resort in their "Italian" restaurant. They have no idea how to make pasta, and I'm not talking about rolling their own dough here...basic boiling of water pasta with red sauce. NO CLUE! Chicken...nope, that was not chicken. FIsh, they kill it. Seriously, worst meal ever. Besides that, this hotel will take you for every penny you are worth. Prices vary by day, room service menu comes and goes, you get charged for tips when you don't even use a service...my list goes on. And the fact that people get money stolen from their rooms is unacceptable! The safe is too small to put everything you would need to put into it and then you have to live in fear that someone is going to steal your stuff! There were so many other problems with this hotel I can't list them all but here's a try: -bugs in food -check in desk did not have proper reservation in their computer even though we had a print out with our conf # -you get 1 towel at the beach -Rooms smell like mold -Food sucks everywhere at the hotel -Bar closes super early Don't go here, it's not worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Really? I mean really??”
Reviews.Author: marsyas
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, if it were not for the reason for the trip and the exceptional people I was with (able to have the best time anywhere), I would be building a time machine at this very moment to go back and change my accomodations. This resort has got it all, from the pools, to the beach to the golf course, to the incredibly manicured grounds. The question is... why would you choose to screw this up?!?! Was the reservation mishandled? Check. Was the staff not immediately accomodating? Check. While we are on the topic of staff... how long does it take to deliver a bucket of ice... if you guessed 45 minutes, you are correct! Personally, I love beach weddings and this one was no different. Except for the fact that at minimum 6 people were robbed during the event. Inside job? Until I hear that someone who was not in attendance of that wedding got fleeced, my mind is made up. And finally, just to give an idea of the ineptitude of the staff, I called 3 times to get a slightly later check out (the line for checking out was probably about 20+ people deep mind you), the first person said, NO, there was someone checking into the room at 3. The second person said sure, pay $150 and stay until 4. The third said 1:30 no charge. All that was in 15 minutes. So if you have taken the time to read this far, my summary is this, the place is beautiful, but it is staffed pathetically. Nothing stays open long enough, and some things aren't open at all. You'll get what you ask for at some random point in time so leave your watch at home... especially if it is worth anything because it could get stolen.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and Dimed”
Reviews.Author: NycTravelingBuddies
Reviews.Content: Our friends chose this hotel for their destination wedding, given the beautiful manicured lawns and marble buildings. While the appearance of the hotel was pristine (all-be-it a bit over manicured) the service was lacking for the high price tag. Also, be alert that the hotel will nickel and dime you for every activity while on-site. The mini bar is censored and will automatically charge your room if something if moved, tips for housekeeping and baggage claim is included in a daily fee, noodles at the pool seem to be on a floating price scale $1 one day, $2 the next, the $22 buffet breakfast is highly over-rated.... Perhaps most upsetting of all was the robbery of multiple wedding guest rooms the evening of the wedding. The management wouldn't accept accountability for the missing cash and it was too large a coincidence that all of the rooms registered to guests were victimized... Very disappointing overall!

Reviews.Title: “UN-Gran Melia: CRIME + Overpriced with Horrendous Service”
Reviews.Author: brooklynpsu
Reviews.Content: We were just there this past weekend for a wedding. While the company of friends was great and the resort was aesthetically beautiful, the service across the board was horrendous. Also, 6 people's rooms were ROBBED during the wedding ceremony. They're also short-staffed so only 2 restaurants of the 5 are ever open at once. The food is extremely mediocre, the bar & casino close very early, and you're too far from San Juan to go anywhere else. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “No Christmas this year, sorry.”
Reviews.Author: travelinggirlOttawa
Reviews.Content: Please read reviews before booking, the Gran Melia has some serious problems. My family of 4 stayed in a Royal Service room for 3 nights prior to a cruise over Christmas, and were shocked to discover the gifts we had brought for our children were stolen from our room. After many attempts to speak to management, the hotel finally responded to an email with very little resolve. The lack of accountability is very frustraiting and disappointing. The hotel it's self is difficult to find, especially in the dark, the food is terribly overpriced for the quality, there is no real beach to speak of and clearly the management is very hand off except when it comes to taking your money. If you value your things, please do not stay at this hotel for if everything you own does not fit in the room safe it is free for the taking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for things to do....”
Reviews.Author: KittenLori
Reviews.Content: I'd like to say first that a vacation is what you make of it.... Having been to Puerto Rico a few times before, and doing my research beforehand I had an unbelievable trip. My husband and I traveled with our son who's 5, and another couple with their son who was 9. We had a garden view room on the first floor....the room was clean and spacious....nothing fancy, but we try not to spend time in our room, after all we are on vacation. Our check in was quick...the room was ready at 1230 when we arrived.. The resort is very expansive, and beautiful....we had no problems getting a ride when we went to the pool, or were going to our car.... the carts were always driving around. Yes rent a car... do it before you leave.....this way you can drive yourself from the airport..Hertz is great, as they have a machine that prints out directions to your resort for you...It was reasonable compared to the resort rental. You need one, as you are trapped otherwise...If you don't mind sitting by a pool all day and doing nothing then it may not matter to you, but just remember if you want local food & some fun...you'll need it. The restaurant we ate at was not that great, but we were in Puerto Rico for local food, so we only ate at the resort one night, as they don't have local cusine. Every morning we went for coffee and an egg/cheese or ham/cheese or danish up the road at the corner bakery. The place is delicious, and the prices can't be beat..If you like coffee this place makes the best I've ever had. There are also the kiosks up the road for dinner, make a left out of the resort road and you'll have to make a u-turn a few miles down, the first one is authentic food, & sits on the ocean....There is also a woman on Sundays that has this little tent set up, where she cooks plantains & chicken...really to die for...$10 for a lunch for three. She is a little after the kiosks... If you need to have food in your room, ask for a fridge in your room, $25 for the week. You can buy what you need and put it in a duffle and bring it thru. Security knows that people with kids or on special diets need stuff, they just aren't allowed to "see" it being brought in. There is so much to do.....the rainforest where you can hike down to the waterfall, there is a great little stop half way up on the left, where you can get some more local food, also coco frio..they will stick a straw in a cold coconut for you to drink, then hack it open when you are done, to eat it..There is also a great natural river type place that we went to swim one afternoon off the same road as the rainforest, you park on the road and there are boulders everywhere and fresh water rushing thru...it is cold, but very refreshing & fun.... The best part of our trip was our private island day. Since we knew about the beach at Gran Melia from research beforehand, I found a boat captain online that will drop you on a private island for the day and pick you up later....15 minute boat ride, it was the most gorgeous beach.. quiet...and cost $25 pp for the trip....We picked up sandwiches and packed a styrofoam cooler full of drinks & snacks and made a great day of it.... Overall the resort was in a great location...the pool was nice, the beach was nice for shell collecting and the kids loved all the tiny hermit crabs....The food we'd have to give another try perhaps, but they need some local flavor for sure. We just did our research, planned and made a great trip. We have a trip planned to goto Puerto Rico again this August, but in Dorado where my parents own a place...we hope to return to Gran Melia in 2010. ** If anyone owns a timeshare here feel free to contact me about exchanging...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! To say the Least!”
Reviews.Author: MCAMV23
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I decided to go on our Honeymoon after two months of being Married and it was absolutely spectacular. The Resort offers a Royal Service package that can go along with any room or villa you stay in. You get a Butler, a Private Pool which is Adults only surrounded by Beautiful open Villas and your own private Bar Tender. He gives you fresh towels and snacks and drinks. One in particular, his name is Leslie. The staff at the Resort were always very kind, but especially kind were Leslie, the Royal Service Bar Tender and Manuel a Royal service Butler. The Beach was completely empty! The Water is so warm and completely clear. The water breakes about 100 feet from shore on a Reef so you can walk all the way out to it. The weather was absolutely perfect! The beautiful breeze was nice and warm and the Palm Trees blowing in the wind made it even more beautiful. They offer different Restaurants which are all fantastic along with a Puerto Rican non-offiliated one which was really not good at all. The Resort Restaurants standards are above and beyond vs. the non-offiliated Restaurant was not good at all. We waited about 15 minutes just to get water and then another 10 or 15 to get a waitress to come and take our order. And as I said, the Food was really nothing special. Ironically the Italian Food was amazing, and I'm Italian! All and all, it's worth the Airport Headache because once you get there, you will never want to leave! The Beach, The Pools, The Food, The Service, very, very nice. And not only for a Romantic Getaway. There's a kids club and all that as well. Good Luck and Bon Voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay!”
Reviews.Author: bokson
Reviews.Content: I read many of the reviews on Gran Melia as my wife and I were looking for a short 3 night stay in Puerto Rico. Of all the 4-5 star hotels in Puerto Rico(i checked on sidestep.com) , Gran Melia's price per night was sig. lower than it's website price(we got 800 including taxes on lastminutedeals.com, compared to 1100+ on other sites). I even checked other comparable hotels which, during Christmas, were well above 300+/night for this hotel class. So all in all a great deal! btw, we did not order Royal Service To add to the other reviews listed: Positives: 1. Absolutely beautiful resort landscape and lobby. We've stayed in the Four Seasons Maui which had an awesome lobby where you literally felt the stress go away. Gran Melia's lobby and outstretched gardens, walkways, places to sit +lounge made us feel that way too. 2. Service generally above average- our room was cleaned every day, staff was nice, also our rental car's battery died. the front desk jump started my car within 5 minutes. Golf cart attendants were offering us rides to our room +back 3. There are daily activities that the resort offers--from exercise, to pool volleyball 4. No bed bugs(as other people reported) +short check in time/out 5. Hotel is close to San Juan(recommend visiting old san juan for restaurants) and El Yunque, Vieques island Negatives: 1. It rained a lot when we were there---the bathroom ceiling leaked a bit, but room service took care of that 2. Cafe soleil for lunch way overpriced---almost as expensive as Tempo for dinner 3. Good service from staff, but generally the hotel is understaffed--i think that when Gran Melia took over this hotel, they decided to cut costs in staff(e.g. we saw certain employees working lobby and restaurant; one employee asked us if our room was cleaned---i thought that was a given?) 4. no beach (as mentioned before) but still a relaxing resort Suggestions: 1. This is the hotel for you(vs. those in Isla Verde or other parts of San Juan) if you want a peaceful, relaxing, quiet stay! 2. Take advantage of the numerous activities that hotel offers---but book in advance--e.g. mosquito bay kayaking, el yunque horseback riding, or old san juan 3. other than local food, search out other places to eat in the area---Brass Cactus has 2 locations on rt. 3 . 4. Always do a comparable price check before booking this hotel(e.g. use a search engine like sidestep.com or aaa.com)

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Paradise!! I don't understand the bad reviews!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Love2TravelfromVB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 12/14/2008 - 12/16/2008 and didn't want to leave!! Our stay was after a week long cruise for our Honeymoon which we thought we were spoiled from until we arrived at the Gran Melia! As soon as we arrived we knew that we were in absolute PARADISE!! This hotel and the landscaping is beautiful! The decor is fantastic and every detail is definitely paid attention to! We had the Royal Service Ocean Front Suite, which was definitely worth the upgrade. Everything was extremely clean, all of the staff that we came into contact with was very friendly, the grounds/ room/ lobby/ pool/ restaurants were beautiful and clean (didn't smell one bit of mildew anywhere) and the food that we ate for breakfast and in the Asian Fusion restaurant was very good! We can't understand where all of the negative reviews are coming from! We are so glad that we didn't take any of the bad reviews to heart and we can't wait to bring all of our friends and family back to the Gran Melia! Also while we were there we were told by one of the staff members that George Clooney was staying in one of the private villas, and if you have the Royal Service upgrade you can see pictures of all of the other famous people that have stayed there. The best part of all was that it was just so beautiful and relaxing! It was great being surrounded by nature (iguanas, birds everywhere, little geckos, and even peacocks!) and we loved that the rooms were in two story "villas" instead of a monstrous building. It was nice strolling along the paths during the day or night and just taking in all of the beauty. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort and Worth the Cost”
Reviews.Author: flatfender
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day stay at the Gran Melia for our anniversary and can't say enough good about the trip. The facility is A+, the staff was great, the food was wonderful, the grounds are immaculate and the weather was perfect every day. The beach was 20 feet from our room and the distances from room to other buildings was not bad, they will always drive you in a cart if you don't want to walk. You must rent a car and explore on your own, it is very easy to navigate around the island, make the reservation through Avis before you go and just pick it up at the Hotel location. We parked in the rental car lot and didn't have to pay anything for parking. The rain forrest is a must (only 30 minutes away) and Luquillo is a must for the local food at the Kiosks (only 40 minutes away). Even driving to Old San Juan was easy, just ask the car rental ladies for directions to the parking lots in Old Town. If you want to really experience the island get out of the Hotel and meet the people and eat the food. There is a grocery store (Giagante) very close by on Route 3 if you want to buy food or drinks. At the emnd of the road to the Hotel is a pastry shop that is great for breakfast foods and there are about 4 small restaurants nearby on Route 3. Of all the places we have ever visited, this is the only place where we said we are definetly going to go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place!”
Reviews.Author: TravlerKat
Reviews.Content: I've now learned to take lots of reviews with a grain of salt....I was a bit nervous about the mixed reviews, but I've seen it with my own eyes and LOVED IT! This place was BEAUTIFUL and the staff EXCEPTIONAL! The hotel itself was kept in perfect order. The Pool was nicely kept, the rooms were immaculate and the staff very friendly and helpful. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to my family and friends. If you are beach lovers, the beach is a bit rocky and not all that great for swimming. But if you are pool loungers - its perfect! My fiance became ill while we where there and we called the hotel doctor. He was there in 15 minutes! And since we didn't rent a car and it was at night, the head of security himself went to Walgreen's to drop off and pick up my fiance's prescriptions for us! The staff was wonderful! We did end up renting a car the next to last day we were there to drive into Old San Juan for the day. Everything is at the hotel. Car Rentals, excursions, an incidentals and souvenier shop, a small casino and outdoor and indoor event space (saw a wedding, birthdays and a Quincinera). The food was very good, but there really wasn't a large variety - only 2 restaurants (one Italian) and the other either Asian Fusion or Habatchi (one restaurant with two sides). No buffet in the evening - only for breakfast. There was also just the pool bar or restaurant for lunch. We are late eaters, so if you tend to eat late - make sure you get there no later than 9 pm. However, the staff was very gracious when we arrived 15 minutes before they closed for the evening. The bar and lounge is beautiful and large - they have live dancing/music and then a DJ. The only downsides we experienced was the room smelled a bit musty, but it wasn't anything we couldn't deal with. And we were a bit concerned that the person who checked us in didn't explain the extent of their meal plans when we purchased. I.e., there were restrictions to certain plans that we didn't know exsisted until we met and started chatting with another couple there. Again, not a huge deal for us, but if you are drinkers - make sure they clarify at what times the meal plan includes alcoholic beverages. Otherwise get to the Gran Melia - they have a lot going on and lots more going on for them in the future too (Trump bought the golf course and its one of his now. Plus he is building gorgeous villas nearby).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort with Issues”
Reviews.Author: wckdcj
Reviews.Content: We choose and paid an extra $1300 for breakfast and dinner. Two daily non-alcoholic drinks were part of that meal plan. Breakfast according to the internet write-up was buffet style. Dinner was also buffet but had two other a la carte restaurants available. Because the resort had virtually a handful of guests, there was no buffets. This meant guests had to eat at the other a la carte restaurants... and they only had one of these open evey other night. In addition, tipping was thus required (where it would not have been with buffets). There was no entertainment. This resort was out of the taxi zone... which was not specified upfront in the online hotel description. Service was not good in general. The beach was not walkable nor the ocean swimable (strong under currents), The main building however is very beautiful. If you go there plan on your trip costing a lot more. And just beware that if you want buffets... you might want to go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not-So-Gran Melia (Thumbs down for Trump)”
Reviews.Author: HappyInTheStates
Reviews.Content: If you want to get away, stay in one location, and spend a ton of money, then this is your place! I don't want to write a novel, so I'll make this fairly short and sweet. Room smelled like mildew. Was charged $50 for 3 days of parking. The food is absolutely garbage! And definitely not cheap by any means. (We ended up eating McDonald's a couple times - great honeymoon dinner!). Don't plan on bringing leftovers back to your room either.. .....no fridge in the room. Unless you feel like possibly getting murdered, seeing some farel dogs, or checking out some snails and doves in the lame rainforest, then your pretty much stuck at the resort. Which I wouldn't say is the best thing either. There's not much to do, other than getting [--] face drunk for a pretty penny. If your thing is to just lay around the pool, then you'll be fine. The pool is actually quite nice. That's about the only thing that is. Don't waste your time or money!

Reviews.Title: “Potentially A Great Resort, but not yet”
Reviews.Author: 717pilot
Reviews.Content: At first glance, this looks to be a first class resort. Airport pickup was fast and efficient. Had to wait to checkin even though there were two girls behind desk, only one appeard to be working that day. The rooms are very nice. We immediately noticed ours smelled of mildew. I noticed a large clump of twisted hair on the floor. Evidence of poor house keeping. Also, with every flush of the toilet a cacaphony of sound came from the water line. Air conditioning was also a challenge. There is alot of room for improvement there. However the rooms are very nice just need more attention to detail here. The resort is beautiful and has everything you need except a jacuzzi whilpool. I have a hard time paying 5 star hotel prices and getting 3 star value. If they can bump their game up a couple of stars I will definately stay there again. If they don't, then Hasta La Vista baby.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Time - Shocked at the Horrible Reviews”
Reviews.Author: Chicoferhen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Gran Melia during Thanksgiving week and Thanksgiving. After reading some negative reviews we were amazed at what a wonderful vacation we had. Our check-in was quick and the front desk person explained how everything would work (we had the American Meal Plan). Our room was very nice and clean (we did not do Royal Treatment though) and we were carted there by one of the staff. Like everyone says, the grounds are amazing, tropical, tranquil, wild - AWESOME. We found the staff to be more than accomodating and friendly. We did rent a car and drove to the rain forest and hiked and also went to Liquillo... a bit run down. We ate at all the restaurants and had good meals at every one except the hibachi side of the Japanese restaurant. We did meet nice ppl at our table though and hung out with them that evening. All in all it was very relaxing. The food was good. Drinks were plenty. Staff were fun and friendly. The location beautiful (and we didn't think it was that far from anything if you had a car). And the weather to die for, condsidering it was 42 degrees when we left home!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect setting for couples”
Reviews.Author: Jgomez65
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just beautiful. The lobby area is huge, with plenty of places to sit and relax. It has several water fountains and ponds that give you the sensation of being in a truly tropical place. The room was very clean and spacious. It includes a balcony and sitting area. Although our room was not ocean front, you could see the beach from the balcony. The beach is less than 50 meters away. The staff was very courteous and helpful. They can provide you with maps and driving directions to all the mayor attractions in the area and even to farther places like San Juan (the hotel is about 45 minute drives from the Airport and about 1 hour from San Juan) Grand Melia Puerto Rico is not a traditional hotel .The rooms are villages grouped in units of 4 to 6 each (three on the bottom and three on the second floor) There are not elevators and you cannot park in front of your village, instead you must park near the lobby or the casino and they will take you to your room in a golf card. If you donâ€™t want to walk you must wait for the golf car to pick you up and take you back to the car. They pass by frequently or you can call the front desk and ask them to send someone to pick you up. The hotel also have separate villages, most of them ocean front, that are reserved for the Royal Service category. Meaning you pay more, but they also assign you a personal butler to take care of your every need. These Royal Service villages come with a private outdoor Jacuzzi and you have access to a pool that is also reserved for guests using the Royal Service. The casino is small, but clean. You can drink all you want for free as long as you are playing. No smoking allowed in the casino. Parking is expensive. I canâ€™t believe they charge $16.00 a day for self parking or $25.00 for valet parking. I can understand when hotels charge you for parking when they are located in the middle of a mayor city where parking space is scarce, but in this case there was plenty of parking space within the hotel property to justify the charges. On top of that, you must validate your parking ticket every time you leave the hotel. The hotel has three restaurants. One with Italian food, the other with mix American and Caribbean food and the third one is an outdoor restaurant by the pool which opens only during the day (it serves mostly hamburgers, sandwiches and salads). Food in Puerto Rico is expensive compare to other places like Miami. On average, be prepared to pay around $30 per person every time you eat out. The restaurants at the hotels are of course even more expensive. Forget about ordering room services, unless you are willing to pay $15.00 for a hamburger (no fries included). We ate twice at the hotel and the food was decent, but not outstanding. The beach is clean, but the water is not too clear, at least not during this time of the year. Several staff told us there was a huge coral reef in front of the hotel that you can snorkel to, but we did not went into the water because it was way to cold in November. They rent snorkeling equipment at the hotel. Overall, the hotel is beautiful, clean and very well kept. Staffs are friendly and they all speak English and Spanish. The swimming pool is huge, with plenty of area to sit down and relax. The beach is clean but not spectacular. This is the perfect place for a honeymoon or romantic getaway. I did not see too many children at the hotel, but plenty of couples.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!!”
Reviews.Author: clorany
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days and 4 nights at this "resort". Here's what I found: PROS: Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful grounds. Despite everything being so spread out, there are golf carts always making rounds to take you to your destination (eg: pool, front desk, etc) Beautiful room Enormous pool Generally friendly staff About $20 / day parking for your rental car No nightlife except for the casino which closes at 12:30 am. CONS: Nearby construction detracts from the beauty Restaurants are WAAAAAY OVERPRICED!!! Eat out if you can. The local joints are great and won't break the bank. Don Pepe's was one of my faves. You can't bring outside food or drink into your room (HUH!???!?!) The mini-fridge is loaded with their overpriced items. What's the point ?!!?!?! The nearest gas station is a better bet for late night snacks and beer runs. DID I MENTION THE BEDBUGS??? The morning before I was checking out I was nearly eaten alive. When I complained at check out , I was told I'd have to wait at least 1/2 hour to see the "secretary of health" and security to file a report. My flight was leaving in two hours, so I had to check out without putting anything down in writing. I called the very next day from home, and was told that since I didn't do it at checkout, I really had no other recourse. A few days later I called again, and was promised that I would be contacted by the necessary parties. I'm still waiting..... I have the photos.....

Reviews.Title: “If you want to be treated like royalty...”
Reviews.Author: delgman
Reviews.Content: We had a glorious and outstanding time staying at Gran Melia PR on our honeymoon. Their General Manager and staff made our celebration one that will live forever in our memories. They are all true professionals at this resort. Gran Melia Resort is like a fantasyland. The level of customer service that we were provided was 5 star all the way. We found that every person we encountered from the Royal Service Staff down to the lawn maintenance staff all were polite and pleasant and regularly asked if we were enjoying our stay and if there was anything they could do for us.Our butlers, housekeeping, and wait staff were all friendly people who were attentive to our every need. The landscaping and the physical structure of the resort made every day special and exotic for us. The weather was perfect also. This is a wonderful resort and we wanted you to know that our stay was very special. Some blogs and reviews on the internet have totally bogus information posted. This resort had a caring professional management staff. Do not believe these blogs, as they are meant to alarm potential users. We found that information was all false and not accurate at all. This Resort is 5 Star should be recommended to anyone who wants a great stay in PR.

Reviews.Title: “Held Hostage at the Gran Melia”
Reviews.Author: Moochanator
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Gran Melia as part of a conference. We've stayed in many nice resorts and hotels but we've never stayed in a resort that went so far out of it's way to take advantage of the guests. The illusion of luxury is little more than an overwrought resort experience lacquered over modern-day resort piracy. You begin your sentence with a $35/person shuttle to the resort. You can rent a car in San Juan but they charge you about $15-20 a day to park it. Each group's calculus may differ but we should have rented a car in San Juan. The Avis agency in the actual resort charged me a little over $70 to rent their subcompact for the day. In the end, the resort does everything they can to keep there, preferably running up your bar tab. The food was outrageously overpriced and not very good. Your dinner options include an Asian Fusion, Italian, and a sort of Caribbean themed Cafe. (During our stay one was closed each night) The portions were very small and the dishes, while very artistically plated, were substandard. I asked to see a wine list but was dismayed when A) half the wines were not actually available and B) the rest cost almost as much as my airfare. There's also atmosphere problems- you're not close enough to the ocean, the napkins are disposable, and since there's no casual (or cheaper) place for dinner, half the guests look like bums. Olive Garden or Red Lobster would have been a substantial improvement. The waitstaff was polite, but not very charismatic, helpful, knowledgeable, or experienced. While Gran Melia's grounds get high marks for being immaculate, it has atmosphere problems, too. No actual sand was harmed in the making of the beach. It's rocky, silty, and not great for swimming. A walk at dusk on the beach led us to discover hundreds of tiny hermit crabs which was enough to make my inner naturalist jump for joy. The pool is enormous, which is great, but there's no shade. After seeing the pool at the Rio Mar resort I realized how disappointing the Melia's sun-baked pool was. A hot tub/spa is available for those guests that wish to spend $28 for a one-day spa membership. Gran Melia's lodging sprawls across 16 different multi-room bungalows and a handful of more expensive villas. The rooms themselves are exquisite with marble tile and nice fixtures. The compounds are connected by paths that are adorned by tropical plants, immaculate bermudagrass, and endemic iguanas. (My wife and I found the large iguanas endearing but other guests were a little put off) I liked walking the paths but I grew weary of the golf carts that the staff used, buzzing through and roaring like B-29s while I dove for the bushes. The rooms were nice but there weren't bathrobes or sandals or any of the other sundries you might expect from true "luxury establishments." Our unit's air conditioner only worked 50% of the time but I'm not a real "A/C-o-phile" so it didn't bother me that much. I imagine that it was a problem with our room and not with every room. The Casino was a little anemic-.a Casino without craps is like a prom date without a corsage- in bluejeans. Puerto Rico has SO MANY awesome things to do close together that I don't know why I would stay in a resort that penalized you for wanting to get out and see them on your own. Pros: Beautiful Grounds, Rooms Cons: Food, Location, Beach, just about everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon at the Gran Melia”
Reviews.Author: Santiaguero43
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at one of the Royal Service oceanfront suites #2007 from 11/14/08 to 11/17/08. It was by far one of the greatest experiences we ever had, the service is impecable, the personnel could not do more to accomodate us and overall I met some of the most amazingly friendly people you will ever see. We highly recommend this place to take your family or to have a quiet time as a couple. Everyone of their personnel is very proud of working there and they go above and beyond for you. We cannot wait to go there next year for our anniversary. Alex & Pat

Reviews.Title: “Enlightened all of our senses: Beautiful resort with Grade A Service!”
Reviews.Author: AustinMcKs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Gran Melia for a week Oct 29th-Nov 6th. The location was ideal: 5 minutes to El Yunque, 20 minutes to Fajardo (Ferries, Kayaking) and 25 minutes to Old San Juan where we spent the weekend. After a busy weekend in Old San Juan, returning to Gran Melia was like a coming home to a private oasis in Paradise... The interior and exterior of the grounds are aromatic and illuminary. Exotic, melodic, up-tempo music fills each of the indoor and outdoor spaces. Our room was beautiful and the bed the most comfortable one we've ever experienced in our lives (coming home to what we thought was a nice bed, was a bit of a disappointment)! Spend the money for the Royal Service Treatment, it pays for itself in spades with a free nightly happy hour from 6-9pm, a private Royal Service Pool, discounted services, and truly amazing, personalized service from the staff. We would specifically like to thank our butlers Manuel and Angel, who were amazing! Manuel took the time to call us on his days off to ensure our side trips were going smoothly and truly, gave us extremely personalized attention. As well, Pedro in the RS Lounge was fantastic, Leslie at the Pool was delightful, and Josh the Manager was always on call. The breakfast buffet is fresh and fantastic, Tempo for dinner was above average. Definitely venture out of the resort for more local flavors. With a rental car (highly recommended) access to all points of interest were quick and easy. As well, thank you to all of the proud, gracious, and kind people of Puerto Rico who took the time to ensure we always saw the most beautiful businesses and lands of the island. We will definitely return to enjoy your paradise again... Best~ Rachelle & Eddie McKinney

Reviews.Title: “Paradise at Gran Melia”
Reviews.Author: lelie40ct
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Gran Melia for five days. It was the most romantic and special five days we've had since our honeymoon! We wanted a beautiful quiet resort that was easy to get to and was reasonably priced. We took a direct flight and we did not have to deal with customs or passports. We booked the Royal Service package and as soon as we landed at the airport the wonderful "royal service" treatment began. Our ride to the hotel was easy and our check in was a snap. We were given a ride down a lovely path in a golf cart to our room. Our room was absolutely beautiful. It overlooked the Royal Service pool and the ocean. It was very clean, the bed was very soft and cozy and the best part to me was the sparkling tile floor. I'm not a big fan of rugs in hotel bedrooms. We had breakfast every morning in the cafe and ate dinner at the asian restaurant. All of our meals were delicious. The gym was perfectly sized for a resort. We never had to wait for a machine. I would go for a run out on the grounds-it's about 3.5 to the front gate and back-when I returned a fresh towel and water bottle was waiting for me. Relaxing by the pool on a Bali Bed was one of the highlights of our trip. With our hectic lives back home, I couldn't think of another way to spend our days. The views from the beds were spectacular and the service was fantastic. We would have our lunch there, we were offered a cold towel and Leslie truly knows how to make a delicious pina colada! Overall, I would recommend the Gran Melia to anyone who wants to take romantic getaway in absolute paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Fantastic Time”
Reviews.Author: Bruingal79
Reviews.Content: I must admit, I booked my stay at the Gran Melia before reading the reviews on this particular site and after reading them, I started scouring the hotel change policies in my vacation package. Fortunately, I was unable to change my hotel and I am so happy I didn't. First of all, the grounds are phenomenal. Breathtaking. The attention to detail in the architectural and stylistic choices greatly enhanced my experience. The room was large and the views were phenomenal. We were originally put in the wrong room (possibly a sign of the "poor service" so many rant about). We were given a garden view when we paid for an ocean view. However, the garden view was amazing (fountains and flowers were everywhere) and when the mistake was brought to the resort's attention, they quickly remedied the problem and sent guys over to move us. The pool was not dirty...it was lovely and the the swim up bar was just awesome. There was a giant chess board set up near the pool too which was great fun. Had a great time at the Casino as well. Gets busy on the weekends. Service: there were definitely some lapses there but it didn't change my overall opinion of the resort. For one, the lapses were more than made up for by the times when the staff went above and beyond the call of duty. As noted above, they put us in the wrong room. Also, they failed to clean our room one day. But on the flip side, the vacation concierge was AWESOME and she gave us great advice and directions for many fun things to do in San Juan. Also, the front desk staff and the golf cart drivers bent over backwards to make sure we were taken care of. Food: We ate at the resort only once and were not completely impressed. The decor and service were great but my fillet was severely undercooked and mealy. I told the waitress about it and since I didn't want a replacement, they gave us both desert for free. The pastry place near the resort has an amazing pastrami sandwich and 2 people can eat for about 10 bucks. Also Ritchies restaurant will pick you up at the resort and take you up to their place for dinner which was cool. Beach: Sure, the beach is not a swimming beach but there is a swimming beach nearby which the vacation concierge will not only tell you about but they gave us pre-printed directions and then proceeded to personally explain how to get there. Check in/out: Since we checked in at 10 pm on a Wednesday, there was no line nor a wait. I would suggest checking on on off hours/days if possible because the front desk did tend to be understaffed. For check out, they placed our room charges under our door the morning we were checking out and if we agreed with the charges, all we had to do was sign and drop off the paper with the concierge. So check out took about 5 seconds. There was a long line though for people who, for whatever reason were not doing express checkout. Things I wish were different: Paying for parking for residents. This can get expensive and its really offputting especially since you REALLY need a RENTAL CAR if you're going to be staying at the Gran Melia. Overall, it really was the "paradise" experience that was advertised. A few shortcomings but this is a huge place and expecting perfection is a set up for disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed with a toddler and loved it!”
Reviews.Author: njoy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our 2 year old for one week in the spring. We were worried after reading earlier posts on tripadvisor about the service at the hotel, but were pleasantly surprised. Everyone was nice and helpful, from the concierge to the wait staff. They helped us arrange babysitting for our daughter so that we could have dinner alone, and arranged tours etc. The beach has a lot of sea grass, so its not the most enjoyable experience. We drove to a beautiful one 15 minutes away. We will definately visit again.

Reviews.Title: “a 5 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: PRPollack
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous after booking our vacation to see the reviews that were posted. Our plane landed just before Hurricane Omar was to arrive. We rented our car and took off towards the hotel. The traffic was slow because of the rain and the traffic lights. Route 3 has a lot of traffic lights. It took us 1 1/2 hours to get to the hotel, but on the return trip only 45 minutes. The hotel was on shortened staff because of the hurricane, but still we got into our room, which was very nice, very quickly. We were told that most of the restaurants were closing early and that the casino would not be open that night. That was understandable. The next day, the staff was at full force and little by little all the services returned. The pool was clean even after the hurricane. The beach was not, unfortunately. But after a few days, the water cleared up. But a lot of coral, so if you need to go in the ocean, bring water shoes. I heard that Trump is going to clean it up, but who knows when. The beds around the pool are great. We paid $50. for 2 days. It was well worth it. Comfortable, cool and shady. They do have a lot of lounge chairs and umbrellas around the pool, but eventually the sun gets to you. The restaurants are OK. We ate Asian one night, not that expensive, Italian another night, not that expensive, (NY prices) The cafe which serves breakfast, lunch and dinner cost more. They have buffets for breakfast and dinner. Breakfast was $15. for continental, which included anything cold, and the regular buffet was $22.00. Not worth it unless you had a very big appetite. Check it out and judge for yourself. We never ate dinner there. It didn't look like it was worth it. We ate one night at Riches, which was a restaurant that would come and pick you up and bring you back. They had a mixture Puerto Rican or American food, so you could enjoy anything you wanted. The view was magnifcent. Bring your camera. If you have a car and want to experience some real PR cuisine, go left on Rt. 3 towards Luquillo. You will see a sign that says Kiosks. Exit on the right and make a left turn under the highway and then another left turn and go into where the Kiosks are. There are numerous food establishments that sell local food. The first place was really good. Well, that is all I can say. The hotel was great, even the casino. We won, but then put it back, but the odds were better here than in the other casinos we played at. The $1.00 machines paid the best. Enjioy yourself, we did.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort-Perfect wedding!”
Reviews.Author: krystlev22
Reviews.Content: What a perfect wedding we had at the Gran Melia! All our guests were extremely happy! From start to finish everything was perfect! The hotel transportation was cheap and well coordinated, the food was excellent and the service was better than ever expected! We had royal service and so did many of our guests. We had 55 guests and ALL are still talking about how great the Gran Melia is! The service for Royal Service was amazing. There were out of bananas and the butler went out of his way on his time off and brought some in the next morning for my nephew! They also set up an adorable birthday party for my nephew. They staff treated us all like gold! I just don't understand when I see bad reviews. We have stayed at exclusive resorts before and Gran Melia is still one of our favorites! Its great for families, couples and kids! Our wedding day was as smooth as can be and we will never forget all of the great memories we have! Please feel free to email me with any questions! We hope to go back again for our one year anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service!! It was so bad I had to write this review...save yourself.”
Reviews.Author: allanallanMichigan
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on Trip Advisor before we went and we should have known better. Don't book this hotel -- you have been warned. First of all, they are understaffed. I'm not looking to be waited on hand-and- foot, but you have to wait in line for everything. Did I tell you there wasn't a beach? The water is very cloudy and almost dirty there. One mile away they have a great public beach....they won't tell you that there though. To stop me from ranting I will just include bullet points: - There are no waiters, you have to wait in line to get anything. Wait in line to get a hamburger from the pool bar. You have to wait in line to get a drink at any bar and by the way, they are doing you a favor to get you a drink. Tip them and they don't move any faster (I tipped one waiter $50 -- keep your tip). - The place is very spread out and therefore, once in a while you want to take a shuttle service (e.g., forgot the sunscreen) back to your room. Forget it. The shuttle service is random and almost non- existent. It may be a 8 minute walk to just get to the pool -- don't forget anything!! - We had to wait in line even at the buffet restuarant! The food was OK and sometimes very good. That was one plus. Don't get the steaks - -they are very tough. - The check-in took two hours. We wanted a couple of rooms next to eachother, but we got rooms with our party located in opposite sides of the resort. I called multiple times to confirm we would be next to our friends during check-in. Didn't happen and the staff didn't care. - Don't take the hotel shuttle to the airport. They charge you way too much for this trip. They don't tell you the price and in fact, they act like the shuttle service is free to use. Use a taxi van and you will save yourself at least $100 for a party of four. - The water toys at the hotel are almost useless because the hotel is located on a shelf that has a break reef about 100 yards from the shore. Nobody can pass this breaker wall and therefore, you are stuck in mucky water that is shallow and full of leaves and seaweed -- let alone the rocks that hurt our kids feet and mine. - The beds were soft..huge plus for an island hotel. This was a postive surprise. However, back to the staffing -- the cleaning help barely cleaned your room. They would change the sheets and that was about it. They wouldn't even sweep, or move your shoes, to sweep under them. Overall, the staff takes on the management's attitude. I never complained to the management once, but I heard multiple parties that did call them and complained about the above items. You can join them and go to this hotel, or learn the hard way. This is the first time I used Trip Advisor and I will be sure to update folks of places like this. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Gounds and Service but Far”
Reviews.Author: rkl1130
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay at the Gran Melia despite mixed reviews because it looked nice and we were not disappointed. The grounds are impeccable, staff friendly, everything clean and rooms spacious and everything gorgeous. The hotel has a beautiful 24 hour pool with a swim up bar and grill. They also have a beach with chairs set out that is great and you can rent kayaks and paddle boats on. I did, however, have a few negative things. The property has few dining selections--some of which were not open everyday. This hotel is far from everything so without a car, you are stuck and the prices are fairly high. There is also no authentic Puerto Rican restaurant on site, which is highly disappointing because when traveling we like to eat local. Again, the property is far and there isn't much to do and they don't provide free shuttles. In addition, I felt like they charged for every single thing which was annoying. Despite that, we still enjoyed our stay but would recommend that you rent a car because it will be pricey to go out.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, Outrageous prices”
Reviews.Author: tlc_cozmo
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my stay at Gran Melia, and I wouldn't recommend it to anyone, unless you have reason to throw your money away. Where shall I begin? We went there on our honeymoon, and booked a beachfront Jr Suite. When we arrived it took almost an hour to check in and we were told no beach front rooms were available, but they would make up for it in other ways...which we never saw. We were carted to our room, and looked out the window to a construction site where they were drilling, and had a very large crane, great view, great noises. No calming sounds of the waves, instead the pounding of the equipment all day long. On the first night there we decided to eat at the Asian "inspired" restaurant. I ordered the blackened tuna, and my husband had the seabass. The food was flavorless, and my Mai Tai all of ten ounces was 10$. We charged it to our room,( I figured since they already put $900 on my credit card I may as well use it) and there was a spot for tip on the receipt. Our bill was 60, so I left a 12 tip. I signed for $72. Little did I know they were going to add a 17% tip to what I paid I was unaware of. Make sure you check your charges on your room before checking out, we were charged double for some meals. The BEST AFFORDABLE place to eat is the kiosks on Hwy 3 towards Luquillo. Five bucks for a full authentic meal, we went to them afraid no one would speak english, and we ended up staying there for three hours, the one guy that worked there was from Chicago, the other from Florida. They told us places we definatly should visit, and places that weren't touristy. We wanted to steal the guy from Chicago!! Luckily we rented a car, this is a must, driving isn't THAT bad, just be prepared to run red lights!! On our way back to Gran Melia we stopped at Amigo's grocery and bought some groceries and liquer. When we arrived back at resort, one guard stopped us he didn't speak english, so he found someone who did. This guy gave us a ride to our room, and told us to make sure if we bring anything back to hide it, what they don't see is fine. The internet computers set up in lobby rarely worked, I figured them out and was helping people every time I went down there. Make sure that you validate your parking ticket every time before you leave which takes ten minutes, that is if you even get a parking ticket when you enter, it's broke half of the time. On monday, I went back to the front desk and they were able to move us to a beachfront suite. Much nicer, this is what I was expecting! The pool: Yes it was amazing, but the pool bar closes at six, stops making food at 530, but is the cheapest food at the place, the burger was HUGE and great. The pool, beautiful as it was had a layer floating around the edge which was quite disgusting. What else... Make sure to buy bugspray, they eat the newbies alive!!! This resort was a beautiful thing to look at, but that is where it ended. I would never stay at a place like it again. We had a good deal through CheapCarribean, but the resort made up for it in anything else you did. A few years back they had the music awards there, and according to one of our guides, he said the stars were complaining about how expensive it was, and how they wouldn't let them leave. Don't stay here, unless your just here to sleep, because one positive thing, the beds were the most comfortable things!!!

Reviews.Title: “a perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: Camil20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Melia for our vacation this year. I read reviews on this site before we left - some of them were so terrible, it made me a little nervous about the trip. However, we decided to go with an open mind and come to our own conclusions and were very glad we did. Every person we encountered in P.R. (from the airport, to the resort, tour guides & locals) was so friendly and helpful. We arrived at the resort at dusk and were greated with beautiful music, candlelight, a frangrance wafting on the breeze, and the sounds of water fountains and the ocean waves. It instantly begged us to relax. Check-in was a breeze and despite not getting the room upgrade that we were promised from cheapcaribbean.com, our room still had a view of the ocean and it was beautiful. The bell staff was happy to zip us around on their golf carts wherever we wanted to go, all we had to do was flag one down or pick up the phone and ask. The restaurants on site seem to alternate being opened, so we never got to try Nami. However, we ate at Tempo twice and loved it! The food was terrific and the prices were very average with what we would pay for a normal dinner out in Columbus ($12-25/plate). The Wet Bar at the pool was also great - the angus burgers and chicken sandwiches were delicious and in the $10 range. We never ate breakfast at the resort (we packed some cereal bars), but we did get pastries a few times from the bakery at the end of the main road from the resort - they were delicious and very inexpensive! We had dinner one night at La Parrilla (about 10 minutes from the resort) at the recommendation of someone at the resort - it was great local food, but it was actually more expensive than our meals at the resort. We had booked day trips (tours) to El Yunque (it is much more HIKING, than the leisurely stroll that the travel brochure suggests - but really beautiful!), and Old San Juan/Bacardi (you get free drinks at Bacardi!). After we arrived, at the suggestion of the concierge, we also decided to do a day trip to the island of Culebra and were so glad we did. We went on a Monday, the ferry ride was only $2.25/person, Flamengo Beach was GORGEOUS (crystal clear water in 5 shades of blue) and we almost had the whole thing to ourselves (we had not been forewarned about the mosquitos though and are still itching). Due to the weird ferry schedule, we took a plane back from Culebra to Fajardo - it was a beautiful 10 minute ride and only $35/person. Well worth it! We only rented a car for 1 day that we were there, and Avis is on-site at the resort. It's $65/day, but if you book it in advance online, it is less. Also, there is no charge for parking if you have one of their rental cars. We could have probably saved money by renting a car instead of taking the "tours" the first two days, but in the end, we also had a tour guide that was full of all kinds of stories, information, and tips - he also gave us all the ice cold bottled water that we could drink, which probably saved us a good $30 each day! Plus, we didn't have to deal with directions and navigating the traffic. The Gran Melia is about 40 minutes from San Juan, so if you are looking for hopping night life, you'll have a little drive. Also the beach at the resort is not really swim-friendly, but I prefer swimming in a pool anyways, and the beach was still great to walk on. Just be careful about picking up shells, cause some do contain hermit crabs as I later discovered. The weather when we went was perfect - mid 80's every day. It would rain for a few minutes at least once a day, but by the time you turned around it would stop and the sun would be shining again. Sometimes in the mornings or evenings it would be humid - so much so that the camera lens would fog up. We had such a terrific vacation - it was a great mix of getting out & about and seeing Puerto Rico, and just relaxing in the tropics. We would definitely go again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facility, services lacking”
Reviews.Author: velvetstar2
Reviews.Content: This was a good deal for the hotel & flight bargain that I booked through cheapcarribean.com I went on a view of the vacation club with my husband. The elevator got stuck on us. Apparently, it wasn't the first time happening. Thankfully, the guide had a cell phone on him to call for help. My only issues with this place were the fact that I had to keep asking for clean towels and wash cloths. I use a clean one everyday at home but for some reason, housekeeping did not realize that placing the spent items on the floor meant that they needed replacing. Also on my last night there, housekeeping did not clean the room at all nor replace any of the toiletries. Twice during my week stay, the room was not cleaned. The food was not that amazing either. Room service food was horrible. There is a sign saying that you are not allowed to bring in outside food so if you purchased some local delicacies, you have to hide them in your bag to avoid being stopped by security. When I checked out, I signed the room bill with all of the charges. For some reason, after I got home, an additional charge was added to my credit card. The facilities are beautiful. I like the feel of being away from the action but close enough. I liked having a room in a far away bungalow. The restaurants were ok but way over priced and left us feeling hungry. Ask the concierge to call Richies to pick you up for dinner. They're excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very Over Rated”
Reviews.Author: Nyda87
Reviews.Content: VERY DISAPPOINTED. I was very excited to have booked this trip. First off all the telemarketing department needs a whole new staff. I WAS LIED TOO! When I asked to speak to a mangager I was hung on 5 times. This was just the booking part. When I treid to cancel I was told that this was just a small error and that it would be worth the trip. Once I arrived it was ok the incense KILLED ME. EXTREM OVER KILL ON THE INCENSE TO MUCH NEW Contstruction. Checked in and was not told of the BIG DEPOSIT I had to leav on my credit card. Rooms are nice. Pool is beautiful. Beach, is only nice to look at. No open resturants and the nearset fast food was 7 miles away. Ordered room service. Two saldes and two tea tip and sur charge $69.00 dollars. NOT WORTH IT!!! PARKING> Yes you pay for parking and Friday nights you can not find parking, because guest and out side vistors have to share the same parking lot. Took us 20 minutes to find parkng and I paid to stay at the resort. Very poor organization. I am puert rican and after my visit as a tourist in my home town, I hate to say I wil never return and this resort makes me think what kind of person treats guest and worse allows their employees to have poor customer sevice skills and attitude with guest let alone a native born. I was very disappointed and extremly unhappy with my stay. I WILL NOT RETURN. I RECOMMEND YOU TAKE THESE REVIEWS TO HEART BEFORE BOOKING.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: gipsy61
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I and another couple spent 5 nights (Sept 14-19) at the Gran Melia and we all had a great time from start to end. We had considered other hotels (Inter-Continental, Ritz-Carlton, Rio Mar, Marriott, and El Conquistador) but in the end we decided we didn't want to stay in San Juan, we didn't want a large property, and we wanted to be close to El Yunque. I read all the reviews as I always do when we travel and I know that you can't always please everyone. I myself am hard to please and can usually find something that isn't up to par however, not this time. Roundtrip airport transportation was included in our package and we were met by a very nice young lady (sorry I misplaced her name) as soon as we came down the escalator by baggage claim and we were at the hotel within 25 minutes courtesy of our driver Cesar. We were introduced to our Butler Hector who told us not worry about anything anymore and we were led to the Royal Service Lounge for check-in and offered cold drinks. Check-in went smoothly thanks to the ladies of the RS lounge, Veronica, Omyra, Sara, and Angelica (I know I've forgotten one or two more names...sorry!) who were always friendly, gracious and helpful. We arrived early and our rooms weren't quite ready so we went to lunch and by 2:30PM, Hector was giving us a tour of the resort on the way to Bungalow #18, when he left he gave us his cell# and said to call if we needed anything! We both reserved Ocean Front Royal Service Junior Suite rooms and although we thought a ground level room would be good either Omyra or Veronica suggested the second level for more privacy with the Jacuzzi on the balcony and we were so glad they did! Our room was exactly as pictured on the website with the canopy over the bed, large bathroom (huge shower with great water pressure and drainage) with plenty of towels and bath amenities, big balcony with 2 person Jacuzzi and a fabulous view of the ocean. Before dinner we had a few drinks in the RS lounge (our rooms were really warm but the RS staff said they would take care of it and by the time we returned to our room that night our rooms were much cooler and we never had another problem with the air). We had dinner at Nami, the Asian restaurant, and we all had a delicious meal and was surprised when the bill came considering some reviews stating that it was expensive, we thought it was quite reasonably! Nami is actually like 4 restautants in one; Hibachi, Sushi. Teppanyaki, and then outdoor dining over the water, we ate there a few times and it felt like a different place each time. We also ate at Tempo and loved it (also reasonably priced). The resorts open-air lobby is beautiful with floral arrangements everywhere, lots of comfortable sitting areas, and a really cool bar, The Avenue, with lounges and palapas. Very relaxing, exotic music is played all day and night, and at night candles are lit everywhere, the grounds are beautiful and are constantly being tended to by the staff. The main pool is huge with lounge chairs partially submerged in the water, a swim-up bar, jacuzzi's in the middle of the pool, plenty of lounge chairs, and palapas (Bali beds) that can be had for the day for a fee. The casino is on the small side but that wasn't an issue with any of us. One afternoon while the guys went kayaking, we went to the Spa, our Butler Manuel made the arrangements. I had the "Rain Forest Body Glow Scrub" with Yadira, followed by more down time in the spa jacuzzi and pool, it was fabulous! Continental breakfast was included as part of the RS package however, if you wanted the full buffet breakfast it was just an additional $7, we thought it was well worth it. The restaurant's host - Angel, was always friendly and helpful, the staff were attentive and always smiling, and Gregorio the Chef prepared the best waffles, cheesey potatoes, and various Puerto Rican specialties each morning. When we go on vacation I always try to get a deep soaking tub to bubble bath in, my daily life is so busy I rarely have the time to luxuriate in a bathtub so I was really looking forward to our balcony jacuzzi. You can't imagine how thrilled I was when we came back after dinner that first night and my husband called me out on the balcony, it was the best bubble bath/jacuzzi I ever had for no less than 5 reasons . I could describe it but I would rather you go and be surprised yourself, many thanks to our fabulous Butler Mario who made me a wonderful jacuzzi almost night! We loved the RS pool which is exclusively for RS guests (no kids). The pool has it's own bar, is surrounded by palapas, and played soothing music, we loved it so much we stayed all day even having lunch there. Sergio and Leslie were perfect and took great care of us: we loved the cold, scented towels, they were so refreshing, it was heaven! One day we rented a car (thanks Gina, hope your Mom is well!) and went to El Yunque, the light house in Fajardo, and Luquillo. We had a great time, the rain forest was beautiful, went to the tower, hiked to the waterfall and swam in the pool underneath it! The beach at Luquillo was very nice but we thought the beach at the Hotel was just as good. Yes- it was rocky, yes there was grass in the water but it didn't matter, we loved the beach and we found a lot of beautiful shells there (just be sure there aren't any hermit crabs in them). Many thanks also to our Butlers Angel and Marco you made us feel special while we were your guests! Also the Housekeeping staff were great, our room was always clean and taken care of in a timely manner. I think you really have to know what you want or can reasonable expect, in order to be happy with what you get. We loved the two story bungalows, the beautiful grounds, friendly staff, delicious food, relaxing atmosphere, and the RS treatment was so worth it, I would never book this hotel group again without it ! I have recommended Gran Melia to everyone and will definitely stay there when in PR!.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some reviews make you believe”
Reviews.Author: ladausa
Reviews.Content: After booking our stay at Gran Melia, I started reading all the bad reviews posted here, and got a bit worried. However, it's definitely not as bad as others have mentioned. One caveat - we were there during the low season, and the resort was virtually empty. A rental car is an absolute must if you're staying there - there's nothing within walking distance but a golf course. Location: The resort is located about 20 miles east of the airport, on a little peninsula. The location is great if you want to go to San Juan (30 min), rain forest (15 min), Fajardo (30 min) - as long as you have a car. Finding the hotel: It's so new, GPS (or Google Maps) does not have it's street address, however, as you take Route 3 east from San Juan, there's a huge sign pointing to the hotel. Parking: Parking is not free, and on weekend night there are a lot of locals who come to the casino, but we never had problems finding a spot (or parking right alongside the drive if there were no spots). Check-in: There were two employees checking people in, and it took us all of 5 minutes to check in. The do put a hold of $150 a night on your credit card as a safety deposit - never seen this anywhere else. We asked for a room close to the main area and parking, and were placed in bungalow 16 - a 100 yard walk from the pool and very close to the main area and parking. The room: Very nice - roomy, marble floors, nice furniture and art, decently comfortable beds. All rooms have private balconies or patios (depending on the floor). The only issue was the towels - it seemed that every day we had one less than before, and they did not replace the hand towels at all - just took the dirty ones away... Resort amenities: The only amenities we used were the pool - nice and clean, the gym - it's super hot in there - no A/C it seems, the casino - has an ok selection of machines from 5c to $1 and several tables, and the beach - full of seaweed as it is a nature preserve... Food: Restaurants at the resort are expensive as many reviewers have pointed out, so we had to fend for ourselves. For breakfast and lunch - go to Coco Sweets Bakery - it's at the intersection of the road that leads to the resort and Route 3. Wonderful staff, 70 cents for a cup of excellent coffee, $4 sandwiches, and great pastries. For dinner - if you want real Puerto Rican food and ambiance - go to Liquillo Beach - you can see a long strip of shops along Route 3 a few miles east of the resort - these are all bars/restaurants. They may not look like much, but the food is out of this world and it's cheap. Go to the last one (#60) for the best seafood on the island - try their whole red snapper. Staff: Most of them were very nice and friendly - especially security guards by the bungalo area - their job is so boring, they like to chat with guests - they are a great source of local info. The guest concierge desk staff were also helpful - they have info and directions for most local attractions. Conclusion: A nice hotel if little things don't bother you. We had a good time exploring the surroundings since there's not much to do at the resort itself.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay! But wont return”
Reviews.Author: Nenagurl
Reviews.Content: So When we 1st got there the rain was non-stop. The Resort was not GPS compatible so this was extremely hard to find since we got lost and i have no idea where we ended up in. The Security when we finaly found it was rude and nasty. We just met him so it wasnt feed back. He had a really bad attitude. [During our stay we informed the front desk agent, she was a doll cna tbelieve i forgot her name, she said she will pass on to superiors] The HIDDEN FEE IS TRUE!! $150.00 Deposit per night! So not worth it! The resort is really far from most attractions. Overall experience was nice! the rest of the staff were really pleasant and helpful. The pool not like the other reviewers say it is.. IS CLEAN! and beautiful the beach not the nicest but nothing is ever perfect! 1 - 10 i would give it a 6.5 will i come back?... no.. too expensive too far and just not "IT" for a vacation in puerto rico.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasure in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: KeishaWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: My family and I vacationed at the Gran Melia PR September 13-19th and what an awesome time we had. Iâ€™ve been a lot of places, but this resort by far is one of my favorites. I would highly recommend placing this resort on your top 5 places to vacation list. Please allow me to take a moment of your time to share my experience at the Gran Melia with you. To begin, when you enter the resort, youâ€™re going to think you stepped into a place like bath and body works. They have these scented oils all over the place and they smell great. The scenery is beautiful, the people are very helpful and friendly, the rooms are spacious, and the pools are huge. If possible, I recommend upgrading to the Royal Service. The Royal Service includes a private butler ready to tend to the most detailed request (Thumbs up to Mario), free happy hour everyday from 6:00-9:00pm (Thumbs up to Pedro) to include alcoholic beverages, evening hors d'oeuvres and cocktails, free all day coffee and tea in the lounge, free continental breakfast (you can upgrade to the hot buffet for $7 if youâ€™d like), and if you'd like to relax feel free to lounge at the exclusive adults only Royal Service pool and beach area. Believe me you will feel like royalty during your stay. I wish I did not have to return home. While on the resort, you can take advantage of the casino, the spa, the gym, the restaurants, the pools, and the beach. If youâ€™d like to get off the resort Dragon Fly Adventures can assist you with making reservations for New & Old San Juan City, The Rainforest, Carabali Horseback Riding, Mountain Bike Challenge, Four Track Extravaganza, Catamaran - Snorkeling, Bioluminescent Eco-tour, Deep Sea Fishing, Bacardi Tour, Belz Factory Outlet Tour, and Bubble Maker for Kids. Since we were at the Gran Melia for a week, we did a little bit of relaxing and activities. This is absolutely a wonderful resort to visit. I would like to give a very special thanks to Felipe, Yahdira, Mario, Pedro, and Temary for making our vacation worth every penny. Many Thanks, The Lewis Family Washington, DC

Reviews.Title: “One of the nest experiences”
Reviews.Author: Omari1977
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best experiences that my partner and I have ever had on vacation. Typically my partner and I like to have the native experience and not the atypical tourist experience. However, on this vacation we decided to take a luxurious vacation at a resort and after thoroughly investigating about 4 different resorts we settled on the Gran Melia. As you enter the resort you get the sense and feel of luxury and seclusion, the staff was spectacular and very very helpful...any problem, any complaint, any issue they took care of it immediately. One of the things that impressed us the most was the fact that our suite and the hotel in general looked exactly like the pictures on the website and in some instances better. We woke up every morning to sunlight and the beach staring back at us. I would highly recommend the Gran Melia Resort in Rio Grande, Puerto Rico to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “This is PARADISE!!”
Reviews.Author: edbeverdavidson
Reviews.Content: Although I do NOT reccomend using price line EVER again!! This Resort was "The Bomb" The people are sooo friendly and accommodating! They cater to your every whim, the grounds are PERFECTLY maintained, the food (although pricey) EXCELLENT! I've been to alot of places, THIS IS BY FAR MY FAVORITE!! If you take any tours, ask for George! he ROCKS!! Take the rain forest tour through the resort NOT ON YOUR OWN like some sugguest!! TRUST ME, you do NOT want to go there alone! Take the Old San Jaun tour with Bacardi distillery (with George) he's sooo nice, so informative!! The ONLY negative I have to say (besides the pricey food) the ocean/beach! there's LOTS of seagrass and it's not really good for swimming, BUT, with all the BEAUTIFUL pools, ya really don't need the ocean!, beautiful for walks, just not swimming!!! I would HIGHLY reccomend this resort! it by FAR exceeded our expectations!! Thank you Gran Melia! it was PARADISE!!! Mr. Davidson! rm 901 lol

Reviews.Title: “If you don't have a passport....Purto Rico”
Reviews.Author: jagermasters
Reviews.Content: At first we thought that this resort was overpriced but after going to different venues around the lsland, it was very much in line. This is a beautiful resort. I would recommend it to anyone. If you are looking for a party environment go to San Juan. That is a party town but if you are looking for a laid back, family friendy place...this is for you. We were looking for a party but still loved this place. You need a rental car definately. If you are looking for a lot of fun off the beaten track. Fajardo is awesome. You can charter a boat for $25/person or less to go to a private beautiful island. Make sure you have plenty of food and drink. Absolutely worth it. It is like the Jimmy Buffett environment. You sit a little bar by the ocean....of course when you get back or before you go to a private lsland. The rain forest is ok but we were too hungover to hike. Hiking is definately a must there. Any negative reviews you read about this place must be from anal, unhappy people. This is a great resort but once again....very quiet....no party. The beds were fantastic....OMG. Have fun and enjoy every aspect of Purto Rico!!! We did.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property, Service a Disaster”
Reviews.Author: Beaurex212
Reviews.Content: What a gorgeous resort that is trying to shed it's all-inclusive past and embrace design. While all of the trappings at the Gran Melia are designed for one's utmost comfort - I loved the pool chairs, the pool itself and the infinite, airy lobby that barely had walls but tall wood celings, gorgeous statues and bali beds throughout - the service at the resort is just lacking. When I checked in the person at the front desk couldn't have cared less about me and mumbled her way through the spiel about where to find what (these resorts are huge, it's easy to get lost) Had I not rented a car I would have been subjected to the loooong, daily cues for breakfast. Unfortunately the food at the resort, aside from the burgers and chicken fingers by the pool, is beyond overpriced and poor quality. Upon checkout, there was another very, very long line consisting of mis-informed people who didn't know they could sign the check left under their door and leave it with one the concierge in the lobby. The highlight, however, was my very, very comfortable room which came with a huge bed, plenty of pillows and a plush comforter. So, 10 points for presentation and decor and comfort 2 points for service...

Reviews.Title: “Do not believe all of the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: littleone10479
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful stay at the Gran Melia! I can not say enough about the property...beautiful pools, spacious rooms, most comfortable beds I've ever encountered in a hotel, serene and stylish lobbies, nice fitness center and spa. Biggest tip of the year... pay the extra for Royal Service! Butlers to draw a bath (nightly if you wish) in your own jetted tub on your balcony with candles and flower petals, aromatherapy pillows with your choice of scent, free drinks from 6-9 in the royal service lounge, free all day coffee and tea in the lounge, free continental breakfast (you can upgrade to the hot buffet for $7), free palapas at the adults only Royal Service pool (these rent for $50 a day at the main pool). The staff are wonderful; Hector, Sergio, Angel and Leslie you all rock! Thanks also to Yahdira (sorry if I spelled your name wrong) for taking the time to answer many questions before we arrived. A very special thank you to Joshua, Royal Service Manager. I have never encountered someone who truly cares about the service of his guests the way he does. I hope the Gran Melia management realizes what a gem they have in him. About the food...we ate at Nami twice. Dinner the first time was good and the sushi was awesome and very reasonably priced. The Nami roll was outstanding! Veggie wrap, chicken wings and the burgers from the Wet Bar at pool are all good choices! I would skip the dinner buffet. Unfortunately did not get to try the Italian restaurant. If you are looking for a lot of beach activity this is not the place for you.
