However, if you're looking for a beautiful resort to relax and regroup with Royal Service (they literally make you feel like royalty) then I would highly recommend the Gran Melia. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “the good, the bad and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: travlemom
Reviews.Content: Suggestions: !)Rent a car! It's an American territory - most signs are english or easy spanish, roads nothing different than lots of other places. 2)Get used to the idea of bugs - there are even cockroaches-it's the tropics! Bring some Deet -ingredient bug juice if the biting ones particularly like you! 3) Appreciate that this is a travel experience, it's not going to be what you have at home - or else, why travel? We are a family of four - with two late-teen daughters. We were celebrating our 20th anniversary and a daughter going off to college. We looked forward to a place away from the "Waikiki of San Juan" party environment. We found that the resort is lovely - and although far away from most everything - we enjoyed the peaceful, lovely atmosphere. TRANSPORTATION We had rented a car, because 1) in doing the research, including these reviews, the fees for the transportation to and from the resort to the airport were as much - or more than - renting a car for a week!! This was a great decision , EXCEPT that the DAILY FEES for parking were NOT DISCLOSED TO US IN ADVANCE ,by the resort or Travelocity, and this added an unpleasant surprise of an unbudgeted expense for a week! (unless we had used AVIS - they have an office at the resort -and rental charges probably include those fees) 2) Also, the car allowed us to explore on our own; the east end of the island offers quite alot of activities! (the rainforest is great and so close, the luminescent kayak trip is "work" but SO worth it, and several swimming beaches close by) and we could get our own food - good & cheap restaurants nearby on the hiway or in other towns - instead of paying the exorbitant prices at the resort! And we could go into San Juan when we wanted (*take the toll road - for $1.50 TOLL it saves MANY slow miles of stop light travel) We did eat one dinner at the resort @Asian restaurant $20.00 - 45.00 pp range, very good and 'gourmet -type (small delicious portions)but very $$$$! Also the breakfast buffet there $25.00 pp / $16.00 for continental(=no hot food) ROOMS: The resort was not particularly busy the last 2 weeks of August, but we still were relegated to the units farthest away from everything (bungalow 7) we figured it had to do with booking through a discount broker, although they denied it. The rooms were great; the musty, tropical air is what you find in the caribbean- it's very much expected. AND bugs of all kinds are also tropical, I doubt there were bed bugs(claimed by another reviewer) -because I didn't get bit, but my husband did- and he always gets bit wherever we are) more likely it was "no-see-ums" that are everywhere in the tropics in the late summer ! If you want exterminated and sanitized accomodations - stay in the 30th floor of a high rise american hotel! I did object to the fridge- apparently electronically controlled (ie: they know when you pick something up) filled to the brim with outrageously priced waters & booze (& no room for your stuff) and the candy tray -out on top -with equally exhorbitant prices $5.00 for a .75 cent candy bar. The walk was pleasant when we did walk to the main pool, sometimes hot if it was a muggy day, but sometimes breezy! The golf cart transportation was fairly regular and the staff running the carts were very attentive - or possibly it had more to do with having two cute blonde young ladies with us! The pool was great -almost too warm- and since we live in Calif, we were not looking for A Beach like we have, (again, we read the reviews) we were satisfied with the wonderful snorkle beach they have and the many colorful fish we saw!! All in all we enjoyed our stay and did not want to leave as soon as we had to.. The Parker family Camarillo, CA

Reviews.Title: “IF it wasn't for....”
Reviews.Author: i-heart-travel-too
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Gran Melia was just okay... the grounds appear well maintained, rooms are ample size and have great amenities. But here are the true things that you need to know about the hotel. 1 - the rooms are entirely too far away from the amenities, you'll have to walk back and forth to access any and everything on the grounds, there were supposed to be carts running every 5 minutes but we never saw any. And calling the front desk was a joke. 2 - there is no beach on the grounds... although the resort is surrounded by the ocean the water is not really suited for swimming seaweed, and other growing organisms will discourage you from doing so. 3- there is nothing to do in the area for miles...so you're better off renting a car so that you can drive if you plan on doing anything off of the resort. 4- the restaurants are overpriced and not that great of quality. 5 - the main pool is just nasty! Looking at the "stuff" floating around the family pool turned my stomach and with so many children and babies in the pool there's no telling what that foamy "stuff" was. There are two other pools on the property one which is only accessible to Royal Service guests and the other for people who choose to indulge in spa services. We were stopped from entering both of these pools although no one was actually in them 6- BED BUGS! The morning after our first night I noticed that I had several bites on my back...thinking that they were mosquito bites I went to stock up on the Off. The next morning a few more bites...it wasn't until the plane ride home with I noticed the strange looking bites on my feet and ankles and realized just what they were. Needless to say I really probably wouldn't recommend the hotel to anyone unless your willing to shell out the cash to pay for Royal Service, then they'll probably kiss your [-] to make sure that your stay is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “met my expectaions”
Reviews.Author: noahbrain
Reviews.Content: I rate this property at about 3 1/2 stars, which means that it offers a number of amenities that are pretty good, but not exceptional. The beach water was not crystal clear, and there was a growth of seaweed underfoot. The shoreline was long at about a mile, so there is potential for privacy. The only water activity that I saw was 10 small boats and kayaks that were off limits because (they claimed!!!) that the water was too choppy. The pool was large, with a swimup bar/restaurant...that was pretty nice. The room was nice, but lacked a view. I dined in only one venue (there was a hurricane watch and the hotel was virtually empty) ... the restaurants were closed. The food was ok. The buffe dinner cost $35 pp. I passed on the breakfast because I wouldn't pay $25 pp. I rented a car so I could sample the local cuisine. The staff was friendly, except the front desk who wouldn't give me a more choice room, even thought the resort was empty.

Reviews.Title: “Deception in the Paradise”
Reviews.Author: cjlos
Reviews.Content: Wow, what a deception! It is fthe first thing that comes to the mind when I think about my stay in the Gran MeliÃ¡. I was in this hotel from the 8/21 to the 8/24. The reservation was done with two months of anticipation. It is really hard for me to think that such a beautiful and elegant hotel has been of such deception for me. Next I will summarize and expose my points of view having used this order: Value, Hotel and Facilities, Front Desk/Activities/check in /check out. A little about me, I was born in Puerto Rico. I have been living in Philadelphia, PA for more than 18 years. I studied in LaSalle University. I travel constantly inside and outside the USA. I consider that the value by money of the hotel is absurd due to the reasons that I will expose ahead. The right price by stayed in this hotel should be $70-$95, not more. The hotel does not work as four stars rather work as two stars top. Moreover, 80% of the employees have a lack of courtesy and respect towards the guests. The facilities are gorgeous, elegant and clean with an enormous swimming pool that is opened 24/7. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable you can accommodate up to four adults and you can request to prepare the sofa bed for you if you needed. The rooms are far from Front Desk. The resort has golf carts that run throughout the grounds to transport you to and from your room every 5 minutes. I do not recommend using the roomâ€™s towels they are dirty and stained. Bring your own towels. The rooms are equipped with a ridiculous electronic candy bar right under the TV set. This potentially will ruin you vacation if you brings kids, the prices are extreme. The resort is near the ocean but, you cannot swim in the beach. There are so many rocks and, seaweed on the beach that make it impossible to swim on it. You cannot use the beach volleyball court because the sand is very hard. I assure you that if you fall on it they have to take you to the hospital with big lacerations. The restaurants are expensive and there is no restaurant with a Puerto Rican flavor. There is an absurd parking fee of $16.05 per night. The resort never told me about it until I arrived. This, I consider is a robbery and a disrespect to the guests that not only have to pay this fee but, to make matters worse a 22% of tax or IVU, whatever. Let talk about check in; when I arrived to the resort an employee made me wait 45 minutes for the check in, first she did not find it in the list since I am member of MAS and soon she requested to me to be seated while she resolve the situation. After 45 minutes and feeling that they forgot me I decided to look for another person in Front Desk. I decided to look for another person in Front Desk. I finally found an excellent employee Jose, who helped me. In the Front Desk most of them are rude and slow with the exception of Jose. We decided to stay at the Gran Melia because we wanted to relax and stay away from all the action. I have to say the Gran Melia ruined my wished vacations planned with months of anticipation because they never informed to me about one of the worse event I have never seen "Heineken Fantasy Island" The hotel made me spend an horrible day WHERE Not only they restricted the entrance to the main swimming pool but, in addition, they constantly harassed with stupid questions. The security of this event was very rude, and constantly obstructed the flow and freedom to walk inside the resort. In the event djs and singers were constantly using obscene words. Do not take kids to the resorts if you know the resort will held an event. The swimming pool could not be used because not only was full to the top also were people drinking, smoking and apparently some of them making sexual things the Djs constantly found it funny. The security never acted on the matter; they were worried only for wrist bands. A Lots of drunken people. In that night the only thing that matter to security was to received money for the event and drinks, not to the security of the hotel, nor of the guests. In less than 30 minutes I observed to leave drunk and unconscious with paramedics to more than 2 persons. The check out was long. It took me over two hours to check out. Most of the time they only had 1 representative working and there were a lot of people in line. In conclusion: Thursday and Friday were excellent days of relaxation and enjoys outside the mishaps with Front Desk. Saturday and Sunday were the most horrible of my life. I strongly believe that the hotel must warn everybody in case of any event or celebration where they would limit the use of the facilities. The best thing of the resort is the physical beauty. Unfortunately, I cannot say that I will be returning to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience all around”
Reviews.Author: WebGirlUsa
Reviews.Content: I just returned from this resort with my family. We attended a wedding there. Unfortunately even though the place had "natural beauty" the staff and service were deplorable. I tackled bed bugs, mildew smelling rooms, overpriced food, nasty service, slow bellman and overall service of low quality. I would not recommend this place to anyone at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not the perfect party spot but its sure nice..”
Reviews.Author: maysbelline
Reviews.Content: I went to Gran Melia Puerto Rico August 18th-21st with my boyfriend. Were both 19 and we were just looking for a fun vacation before going back to college. the resort is BEAUTIFUL..the pools are amazing as well, the best part is that they're open 24/7! i was pretty upset i was coming home the 23rd cuz thats when the heineken party was and prolly a lot of young ppl like us wouldve attended. when arriving at the airport we were supposed to be picked up by the hotels transportation which they call "dragon fly" if your smart dnt take it! they wnt bring you back to the airport plus they charge extra! if ur planning on staying the whole time at the resort just take a cab, or rent a car from the airport because if u rent it at the avis in gran melia they will charge you extra if you want to return it to the airport. also theres nothing around for miles so if you dnt have a car you would have to eat at the resort which is not so bad, they have descent restaurantsbut are a little expensive. theres no beach..well theres a beach but not the beach u want to go ir ur going to puerto rico, is not really nice. bottom line if ur looking for nice beaches and a party town stay in isla verde the beaches are beautiful they have jet ski rentals and all that good stuff also thats were all the clubs are! we went to brava in the san juan hotel and casino resort which is as well absolutely beautiful, and also the water club rooftop, it was pretty fun.

Reviews.Title: “Go Royal Service or don't go...”
Reviews.Author: Joaquinsdad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back last night (8/25) from the Gran Melia in Rio Grande, Puerto Rico. We were originally going to stay at the Ritz but my wife changed plans at the last minute for what she perceived to be a better deal of comparable quality. We participated in the Royal Service option that the hotel offers and did spend considerably less than we would have at the Ritz, but this hotel is currently a 3-star at best. To follow up on some of the earlier comments, the place is really beautiful. The grounds are well maintained and all of the buildings and interiors are for the most part quite stylish. A couple of big points though: 1. There really is no beach. A line of boulders skirt the waters edge to prevent erosion and at a few points there is about 10-20 feet of rocky sand. If a nice beach is a part of your ideal Caribbean experience, do not book here, you will be disappointed. If you call and ask the hotel if they have a beach they will dutifully say 'yes' and technically speaking they aren't lying. However, buyer beware. For a hotel with 500+ rooms, you will see maybe 0-10 people actually in the ocean or on the beach at any point in time. This is a pool-centric hotel. 2. The food is marginal at best. The breakfast buffet is very standard and unimpressive. Lunches and room service are limited and basic. We ate at the Italian restaurant and the Japanese restaurant and had mixed experiences. The Japanese place served a great lobster meal but my wife ordered the sea bass and was sick by the time she got back to the room. We both had the filet at the Italian place and it was good. Not great, but good. The dinner buffet cost $35 per person and was basic cafeteria-style fare. In short, one way they are able to charge less here is by skimping on the food. 3. Royal Service. Josh, the manager, and his staff go out of their way to try and take care of you. If you aren't happy, tell them, they will try to fix it. If you have an issue with your room or anything else, let them know and they will do their best. For example, the hotel hosted an enormous Heineken music festival last Saturday that was open to the public. The place was filled with 18-25 year old kids and had the feeling of an all-day rave with loud music, drunk parties and delays for everything in the hotel. Not at all what we expected, wanted or even knew about. We complained and Josh made sure we were credited appropriately on our bill. End of story. The Royal Service staff does try hard. The best example of the Royal Service attitude is Leslie who works at the Royal Service pool (separate from the main pool with no kids allowed). He is a ROCKSTAR! He anticipates what you might want and brings it. He remembers what you ordered the previous day and has it waiting for you when you arrive. If everyone at the hotel was as solid as Leslie, the reputation of this place would skyrocket. Another worthy mention is Pedro who serves drinks in the Royal Service lounge at night during the cocktail hour. He is another one who anticipates needs, remembers favorites and doesn't wait to be asked, he just takes care of things. And finally, we hired a nanny recommended by the hotel named Evelyn. She was awesome with our 10-month old son, always showed up on time (or early), was very reasonably priced and even bought him a small frog toy stuffed animal as a parting gift. I highly recommend her if you need a babysitter. These people literally salvaged what could have been a negative experience. It seemed to me like the hotel is still trying to figure out what it wants to be. It's not an all-inclusive, but has much of the same cheesiness and cheap feel of one. On the other hand, the spa, hotel facilities and Royal Service options are decent values. When we were there, a famous ex-NBA basketball player was also staying there so the place can attract a good clientele and does have potential. In my opinion, if you are going to the Gran Melia, DEFINITELY go the Royal Service route and don't have lofty expectations.

Reviews.Title: “ehhh...if u want to RELAX and SLEEP, this is the place for u”
Reviews.Author: phillychic928
Reviews.Content: + i am a vaca club member so i had a villa, it was beautiful and HUGE..however the sofa bed for my daughter was heinous, held together by white ties, no sheets, no blankets.. + maid service made the beds but thats it.. + if u like to party THIS IS NOT THE PLACE FOR U, we arrived @ 9pm (flight delays), had to rush to dinner and then we wanted to unwind with a few drinks and last call was at 1130p...THEN there was electrical work going on so we had NO cable and the property was DARK...we had no choice but to sleep.. + remotely located and taxi's are $$$$$..so your stuck on property unless ur willing to rent a car or pay out the nose for a taxi to take u god knows where.. + if you are a beach person DO NOT COME here either, the beach is lousy, and i never ever saw the activity person or anyone in the "ocean" + staff was helpful but nothing earth shattering + italian restaurant was great and cost was average, better than eating at teh pool bar...i would never PAY the addtl all inclu cost though + landscaping RIGHT by my window at 7am, i literally jumped out of bed to an employee at my bedroom window, i was furious and let him have it..

Reviews.Title: “The Bad Prevails”
Reviews.Author: frmorris
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I returned last week from staying at the Gran Melia Puerto Rico for 8 days (August 7th â€“ August 14th). We are 2 single females that travel very often. We decided to stay at the Gran Melia because we wanted to relax and be away from all the action. We were very mindful that we were supposed to be at a 4 stars resort (SO NOT) and we were willing to pay the extra. I am one who does not mind paying extra if I am getting good service and besides I was on vacation. Then on the other hand, I am one that believes that if you provide poor service, then you WILL NOT get my money or business. You definitely want to get a rental car because there is nothing else around for several miles. The resort knows this therefore they overcharge for a lot of things. I think some things were reasonable, but others were ridiculous. For example, do not book tours through the resort, you will definitely overpay. If you get a rental car you can drive through the rainforest free of charge on your own. Also, do not pay to go into the Rainforest Center. There is nothing there and they are only going to send you back out to the main road onto your journey. Get directions and a map from the resort free of charge. LOCATION/TRANSPORTATION: The resort is 45 minutes away from the airport. Gran Melia Puerto Rico offers transportation to/from the airport for $30 one way/per person. Our package included transportation to the airport. However, we had to find our own transportation back to the airport. This was not a problem because we made a rental car reservation before we left home. We were able to pick our car up from Avis at the resort and return it to the airport when we left. This was such a great idea because if you wait until you get to the resort to rent a car, the price more than doubles. We paid $30/day for a subcompact car. Cars at Avis rental at the resort starts off at $59.99. The price goes up $10 additional for every car size you go up (ex. Compact $69.99). Parking is free if you rent your car from Avis at the resort, otherwise, you will have to pay $16.05 a day for parking. We were not schedule to pick up our car until the 3rd day there. When I arrived to pick the car up, the representative told me that they didnâ€™t have my car available, however, she had a deal for me. She told me that she was giving me an upgrade to a midsize car at no additional charge but I would have to clean it and accept it dirty. She continued to state how they did not have anyone to clean the cars. She explained that she was the only one working and they send the employees home at noon that are suppose to clean the cars. I told her that I did not want a dirty car or a midsize. I explained to her how my car was reserved far in advance and I did not want a midsize car with the price of gas. After going back and forth for a few minutes, she reached in the box and gave me the keys to a clean subcompact car. Then she stated that she would just tell the next customer that the person never returned the car they were supposed to have. CHECK IN: When we arrived at the resort we were told that our rooms were not ready, but it would be in 15 minutes. Fifteen minutes turned into at least 40 minutes. Once we arrived in our room (#1111), we found it to be everything, but ready. Neither bed had comforters; all the sheets and pillowcases were stained; my bed had little black things in it; under the sink in the bathroom, housekeeping swept trash in the corner; the bathtub was filthy; there were only 3 towels, no washcloths or hand towels. I called the front desk and someone came within 30 minutes. I took pictures, so I have proof of these things. They switched us to another room with no problem. When we arrived in our new room (#1323), we had some of the same problems. The tub was dirty, the sheets and pillowcases were stained, 3 towels, no washcloths or hand towels. However, this room did have comforters on the beds, but they were stained as well. It took 3 calls to the front desk and 2 Â½ hours to get someone to come to the room. Lernie, Housekeeping Manager finally arrived with an assistant. I wish I had a video camera because they were putting sheets and pillowcases on and ripping them back off like no other. I cannot tell you how many times they did this. Everything they were putting on the bed was stained. I come to realize that they do wash the linen, but whatever they are using to wash them does not work for stains. We had the same problem with the towels and wash cloths. Eventually, we were able to get clean linen and towels. My advice is to definitely bring your own wash cloth and towel. For our inconvenience, Lernie was able to get us free breakfast the next morning. I would like to say that Lernie was great and he was 1 of the very few that really tried to satisfy the customer. FOOD/RESTAURANTS: We ate breakfast the next morning at CafÃ© Soleil. The cost is $23.95/person for the buffet. Here you can get omelets freshly made, pancakes, waffles, coffee, bagels, etc. I am so glad that we did not pay for it. I do not feel that it is worth $23.95. It should be half this price. Not because of what they offer but because of the quality of the food. I found the cook to be rude, but our waitress was very nice. We were told that our names would be in the system for free breakfast, but when we arrived it was not. After eating we had to wait at least 45 minutes for this issue to be resolved. We ate at the Wet Pool Bar and Grill twice for lunch. There is an employee by the name of Jay who was great, excellent customer service. Jay gave us a list of nice restaurants to go to with great food. The first day we ordered the Monterey Jack Chicken Sandwich with French fries. This meal cost $9 at the Wet Pool Bar and Grill which closes at 6 pm, but if you order it for room service, it cost $17. The first day it was wonderful; so wonderful that we went back the next day and ordered it again. The second day we decided to sit down at the pool bar and order. Unfortunately, this time it was terrible. Not only was the food terrible but so was the customer service. They were not busy, but we still had to flag down the bartender who barely understood English to place our order. There was a female employee just standing there on the cell phone. The waiter got both of our orders wrong and did not bother to ask if we wanted anything to drink. We decided that we would not give the resort any more of our money and decided not to eat at Nami or Tempo. However, we did look at the menu. I found Nami to be reasonably price, but Tempo was overpriced. We did not have this problem, but we saw that several people did, the resort ban you from bringing outside food in. They have security guards at the gate that will not allow you to bring in food. However, you can get around this by putting it in a suitcase or backpack. This really doesnâ€™t make sense we they have rooms that have stoves, refrigerators, microwaves, etc. Why would you have these appliances in your rooms, but wonâ€™t allow your guest to bring in outside food? RESORT/ POOL/BEACH: The resort was very clean, well manicured, and ABSOLUTELY gorgeous. The resort has golf carts that run throughout the grounds to transport you to and from your room. I know some people complained about being able to get a ride, but we never had a problem. The pool was just as beautiful as the resort grounds as well as the lobby. Surrounding the pool are some cabanas that you can rent for $50/day or $100/day for VIP service. Unfortunately, I cannot say I feel the same way about the beach as I do about the grounds and pool. The beach is a completely different story. I have travel all over and never seen a beach look like this. It is not clean. Rocks, boulders, seaweed, and trash were all along the beach. You can barely fit a lounge chair on the beach to enjoy the ocean. You cannot swim in the ocean because of there are so many rocks, seaweed, etc. ROOM/ROYAL SERVICE: We had a nice garden view room. From our room you could see a pond and fountain. The room had a safe (free of charge), small refrigerator, and was stocked with candy bars, candles, wine, etc. However, there is a fee for these things. Like I stated earlier, some things are overpriced. The cost of a candy bar was $5. The resort does offer Royal Service for $50/day for a garden view room or $100/day for an ocean view room. With this service you get access to a private pool, free daily cocktails, and free continental breakfast. During our 2nd day we had an Ant problem. There was a trail of ants coming in our room from the patio. I ran into Lernie, Housekeeping Manager the next day and he had someone to spray that day while we were out. After returning from a 5 hour walk through the rain forest during day 6, we found ourselves to be locked out of our room. The resort had deactivated our room keys. We were not scheduled to leave for another two days. We used the hall phone to call front desk and they told us that they would send someone immediately. After waiting 35 minutes, we called front desk again & told them that we were still waiting for someone to bring us new keys. They apologized and said they would send someone immediately. Well, after waiting for over an hour my best friend decided to go get the keys. No one ever came to bring us keys. STAFF: I did not find about 90% of the staff to be friendly. I have never seen so many employees on their cell phones nor have I ever received such bad service while on vacation. They canâ€™t assist you because they are too busy talking on the phone. The customer service that I receive was definitely not the service that you expect from a 4 star resort. However, I do want to give kudos and praises to Lernie, Housekeeping Manager and Jay, waiter at Wet Pool Bar & Grill. With the exception of Lernie, Jay, & a few others, everyone else needs to go to a â€œCustomer Service 101â€� class. CHECK-OUT: Check out was long and painful. It took me over an hour to check out. They only had 1 representative working and there were several people in line. DO NOT JUST PAY YOUR BILL! PLEASE CHECK YOUR BILL BEFORE LEAVING THE RESORT. When we got our bill we had charges that were not supposed to be on there. My bill was over $216, but after removing charges that was not mine, it was $56. They tried to charge me $71.40 per person for picking us up from the airport and $16.05 for parking. The couple in front of me had several charges on their bill that was not theirs. They had already paid their bill. Someone had charged hundreds of dollars to their room. The problem is that the resort will not allow you to pay cash at the restaurants. You have to charge it to your room. You do not have to show proof. All you have to do is give them a room number. The representative pulled the coupleâ€™s receipts from the restaurants and found that the signatures did not match theirs. Someone had been using their room number and getting away with it. This is so easy to do. I cannot say that I will be returning to this resort. This resort should be 2 Â½ stars tops. The only thing this resort has going for it is the physical beauty of it. If you want a pleasant stay and a real 4 stars resort, Gran Melia Puerto Rico is not the one for y

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: madmanmarty
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just retured from one of the best vacations we ever had. At first I was a bit weary about the reviews I read about the resort but took the chance since it was already booked. The place is a palace. It is absolutely beautiful. It was the paradise we were looking for. The restaurant are all upscale with great food presentations. The beaches are private and great for snorkeling and the pool is awesome. You park in the parking lot and a 24 hr trolly takes you to your bungalow or you can take a quiet walk through the beautiful gardens. I couldn't say enough about the Royal Service we received and the beautiful rooms we got accomidated with. We highly recommend The Grand Melia and we are looking forward to returning again next year. Martin & Cindi C. Brentwood, NY

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous place but whats the point....”
Reviews.Author: supasta88
Reviews.Content: let me just start off by saying that i am not a travel snob by any means. when i go on vacation i like to keep it simple and fun, so when i saw the reviews for the gran melia hotel and the problems that some other guest have had i just assumed that they were being ridiculous. The Gran melia is one of the most gorgeous places i have ever been, so much so that i was considering getting married there. the pool is open 24 hours, the room was amazing,the grounds are well groomed, the view from my window was stunning, and if you have a car the location isnt too bad, but thats where it ends. Parking at the hotel is $16/day which wouldnt have been a problem if there was anywhere to park. the hotel bar and casino are open to the public and there is no seperate lot for guests so if you want to leave the grounds not only will you lose your parking space but you will more than likely have to walk about 15 minutes back to your room. the second day we were there we were told by the parkin manager that if you rent your car through Avis (which we did) parking was free so you can imagine my suprise to see 4 days worth of parking on our bill at the end of the trip (along with 5 bottles of water from the mini bar that we didnt drink). when i told the front desk clerk what i was told by the parking manager she informed me that i would have had to park in the avis parking lot to get free parking, and when i asked why no one had informed me that there even was an avis lot she replied " I dont know" and walked off. so i went to get a manager, but convieniently all the managers in the entire hotel were in a meeting and no one knew when it would be over. Add this to the constant fire alarms in the middle of the night, and the ridiculously expensive room service (which is the only way to get food after 10:30 because you cant bring in outside food or drinks) and it was just not a pleasant experience. I thought that once i got home the dramatics would be over but when i went to check my online banking the gran melia had charged $150 to my card when they were just supposed to put a hold on it and when i called them to get my money back i was told that i was wrong and that they hadn't charged me it was just an authorization. when i explained to the hotel accountant that i work for the bank and that i know the difference she laughed at how upset i was getting and put me on hold for about 20 minutes before she came back and told me she had returned my money. I know i've been rambling but i guess i'm just upset that this place is so gorgeous and i had such high hopes but none of it matters because of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Experience...Fabulous... Loved it”
Reviews.Author: GQGeneric
Reviews.Content: After booking at Gran Melia Puerto Rico and then reading the reviews, I was very apprehensive, to the point that I emailed them ahead of time to share my concerns, as this was for my wedding anniversary... They responded promptly via email AND phone assuring me that everything would be fine... they were right! Upon check in (which took all of 5 minutes, no waiting, maybe because we checked in on Sunday afternoon) they upgraded us to an ocean view suite which was AWESOME! The place is GORGEOUS! The staff was VERY friendly and many of them called us by name in their greeting. We had ZERO problems... the first night our air was not blowing cold, in 10 minutes they were there and fixed it promptly. The only thing BAD was the food and the mini bar, which we avoided... food was bad and WAY overpriced! RENT A CAR AT THE AIRPORT AND PAY FOR PARKING, as we did. We drove out for all of our meals and LOVED the local food.. try Beebo's BBQ by airport in SanJuan for best local food. The whole island is beautiful and we spent a whole day just driving around it looking.... AGAIN, I cannot stress how wonderful our stay was, I am not sure I believe the extent of all the bad reviews, if you are apprehensive as I was, contact them ahead of time....

Reviews.Title: “The Good, Bad & Ugly....”
Reviews.Author: naw5080
Reviews.Content: Okay - I just got back from this hotel a few days ago and can give you the entire scoop as it is quite fresh in my mind... First: There are a series of bungalows on the property and the property is QUITE expansive. We were in Bugalow 6/7 which was the very farthest one from the main club house, restaurants and pool. They have golf carts that supposedly drive by every 5 minutes... but its not nearly that frequently and they tended to be full many times when they passed us by. Make sure you are aware where your bungalow is and you are NOT so far away from the main area of the resort. Walking constantly in the PR heat gets annoying Second: I had no idea this would be the case. We rented a car with intentions of getting snacks, sodas, etc to consume IN OUR ROOMS (not at the pool or on the public areas of the property) and they continually stopped us from visibly bringing it in. That is ABSURD!! If I want a bottle of water, a granola bar or a can of coke in the middle of the night, how dare they tell me I cant bring it into MY room that I paid for. They actually have guards that stop you when you try to do this. The trick? Just empty a suit case and do it anyway. Still VERY annoying. We are not 3rd graders and should not be told what we can and cant eat in the rooms we PAY for. Third: This resort is remote. IF you want to do anything (Rainforest, Loquillo, eat elsewhere, etc.) you MUST rent a car. Its far cheaper to do this at the airport than at the resort. The rainforest and an amazing beach (Loquillo) are all within a 10 minute drive, so do rent a car and dont waste your $$ for the guided tours. Fourth: The front desk is a NIGHTMARE. OMG! It takes them 20 minutes to check one person in or out of the hotel. The inefficiency is absurd. The Beach: Okay, it is beautiful but very natural and not the beach you tend to think of when PR crosses your mind. The sand is not white, there is a lot of seaweed and there are rocks and boulders everywhere. I still found it to be highly beautiful, but nobody was swimming or really out in the ocean. There are also NO waves, its more like a bay. The Pool: The pool is beautiful. There are 3 pools (the main pool, spa pool and Royal Service pool). The main pool is expansive - during the day they have loud enjoyable latin influenced music playing. There are lounge chairs built into the water (amazing), there is a swim up bar (pricey - but nice), and there are rentable cabanas. They have pool waiters to grab you drinks and food. The restaurant at the pool is VERY reasonable with decent sandwhich-y foods. Restaurants: There are 3 main restaurants on the premises - an Asian Fusion, Italian & a buffet. The buffet is mediocre & somewhat pricey. We also ate the Asian Fusion which has a Hibachi option. The food was good and somewhat pricey. I was actually pretty impressed by the Asian restaurant. As I mentioned before - the pool bar is your best bet for lunch. A meal is only like $10. There is also a breakfast stand with bagels, coffee, etc which is reasonably priced and much cheaper than the restaurant option. The Room: I found the cleanliness to be mediocre. They ration towels and at times we would only have 2 new towels replaced in our room. The beds are AMAZING. Some of the most comfortable beds I've had in a hotel setting. The bathrooms were also nice... but the maids always closed the doors after cleaning and it smelled musty & like mildew constantly. The staff: For the most part, I found them to be pleasant. The golf cart drivers were very sweet and should be tipped. Bring singles on you to tip because I constantly needed them. I found the front desk workers to be somewhat rude and at times not helpful. My key kept losing its strip and it would take me 20mins at the front desk to get it reactivated. We also had a fire alarm in our building go off once at 3.30am and once at 11.30 pm. When I would call the front desk sometimes it would ring unanswered. Then when I would get someone they were unapologetic and somewhat rude. The alarm was supposedly a glich in their system - but nobody wants to be awaken to that. Nightlife: Other than the casino this place turns into a 'pumpkin' by 10pm. The pool bar closes at 6 on weekdays and 7 on weekends. Although the pool is 24hrs, I think its ABSURD that the bar closes that early. They need to keep it going for at least 3 more hours. There is also the 'Avenue' bar which has some nightlife, but its average at best. The casino is small and simple, but it'll do if that's your thing. When I was there they had BJ tables for $10 a hand and lots of slots. Not too bad. The resort is WAYYY off the beaten path, so you cannot walk to anywhere close by for nightlife. We took a shuttle to the nightlife of old san juan. I wasnt all that impressed for the cost of the shuttle ($45pp). Its a nice resort - but its got several flaws that are not (in my mind) worth the price or going back to.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Service Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: aes2167
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the fact that I booked this hotel (2 rooms) three months in advance, and called several times to confirm the reservations; I recieved assurances that the reservation was booked and that we can arrive at the hotel on Jul 31 at 3:00 pm. Well needless to say I arrived to the hotel at 4:30pm expectign to have my room ready, however was told initially to wait in the lobby ( I waited for 45 mins-1 Hour). I was then told by the front desk that the hotel had overbooked and that we would have to move to another hotel 15 minutes down the road (mind we had gotten lost finding the hotel and was the reason we were late gettign to checkout). The front desk clerk assured us that we would need to stay in the other hotel for just one day and they would accomodate. After waiting another 30 mins for manager and were set with the fact that we would only need to stay at the other hotel one night we were asked to sit and wait for a van to pick us up; another 20 mintes later the manager told us that we would need to stay in the wyndham hotel 2 nights instead of the agreed upon one night. The manager (Isabella) then stated that we would be accomodated for each night we spent in the other hotel spa and/or free meal when we came back to Gran Melia. It was hard because when you go on vacation you want to relax and unpack once not have to pack again, unpack, have your vacation interupted etc. Needless to say the other hotel Wyndham had much better service, better casino and a better attitude towards their guests. We fel so much apart of the hotel not a number or cattle to be shipped around. Evening though Wyndhams' rooms were not better than Gran melia the service made up for it--This was the most we felt on vacation and they even have a better beach than Gran Melia. When we returned to Gran Melia there was a mix-up with the accomodations we were to recieve because of the move, Isabella initially told us that she did not say that we would be accomodated for each day, causing a mix-up and some what of more disappointment in the Gran Melia system. She allowed it and then on check out day there were charges on the bill that we did not spend, although they took the charges off we had to prove that we did not use some of the services and items in the mini bar (which an attendant went to the room to check-which felt like we were discredited or not trust worthy), If any one is not trust worthy it is this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Family Reunion at the Gran Melia”
Reviews.Author: EasyPhysics
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from having a large family reunion at the Gran Melia in Puerto Rico. As a family we have traveled to many Caribbean islands and experienced a large selection of hotels. Our Stay was fantastic, the accommodations were very comfortable and we felt as if the staff went above and beyond the call of duty. Given that some of our family members had never been to the Caribbean before, I found Puerto Rico to be an excellent first Caribbean experience island. ( Make sure you visit Old San Juan ). Vivi Puerto Rico

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: fcouve18
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very nice. Unfortunately we were there during a convention of a company called Econo and the attention was focused on these people. For example we'd come downstairs to the waiting area where the golf carts transport you to the parking area and they would first ask if we were from Econo. Many of them did not give us the ride and would tell us we had to wait for the next cart to arrive which at times took as long as 10 minutes. There was one day we left our hotel room around 11am and didn't return until almost midnight and our room had not received housekeeping services. The beach is not good for bathing, too many rocks in the way. On our first night there it took the front desk almost 45 minutes to get us checked in and we had reservations several weeks in advance. And since we were there during this convention many times we'd get there late in the evening and could not find a parking which by the way is not free. The hotel staff is not very warm and many of them need to learn some manners.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay Ever... No kidding”
Reviews.Author: fperojo
Reviews.Content: This hotel perfectly fits the description of looks can be deceiving. The property is located in the north east part of the island about 45 minutes from San Juan. The resort is beautiful, but the service is the worst I have ever experienced. My wife and I traveled to the island to join my parents and siblings for a small get together. In all we booked 4 rooms for 3 nights. The booking process alone was an ordeal. We showed up at 3pm and were immediately directed to a ball room for checking instead of the front desk. There was a line of about 30 people waiting to check in with only two hotel employees handling the reservations. After 2 hours we finally were given our rooms but without the room keys. It turns out the rooms were not ready yet. I demanded to speak to a manager and after demanding to get some resolution I was given keys to two of our rooms only. The explanation for the delay was that the hotel did not have any clean sheets available and we would have to wait for new ones. We ended up getting the other two rooms two hours later. In all the checking process took 4 hours. When we got to our room we noticed the bathroom did not have any hand or face towels. Upon inquiring about it we were told there were none. My guess is either the hotel is short staffed or they don't have enough supplies for all the guests. Another issue is the charges for room service and meals at the resorts restaurants. My mother ordered breakfast for two in her room and she was charged $100. Needless to say, during our stay we bought our meals outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice!”
Reviews.Author: prchic65
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gran MeliÃ¡ the last week of July and had a really great time. My sister and I took my parents there- who had never stayed at a hotel before- and we are sooo glad we chose it! It has 1st class accomodations and service. Beautiful pool and we really enjoyed the water aerobics class, since it was more for fun than anything. The atmosphere at Ave Nue Bar was great ,except that we wished they'd had the live entertainment- "batucada"- that was printed on the schedule. Loved the indoor gazebos at the bar and the beautiful furniture alll around. everyone was very friendly and helpful. Highly recommend it! Do go out to eat since the food is so expensive for a party of 7.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaSunshine2008
Reviews.Content: I went to the Grand Melia a month ago with my family and we had a terrible experience. We waited for more than 40 minutes to check in! (Only 4 people were in front of me and they had three clerks working). Besides their poor service not only at the front desk and pool area, it was repulsive to find blood in our bed sheets and pillows. The beds were made without changing them!! And blood on white sheets!!!!! It was disgusting!!!! We complained of course and waited forever to have the room clean, it was after 10 PM when finally they changed the bed sheets and acted like it was no big deal. The bathroom was also filthy and had a hole on the wall. This hotel it not a 4 stars hotel!! If you want a pleasant stay and a real 4 stars hotel Gran Melia is not the one for you! We have stayed in the past at El Conquistador a real 4 stars hotel maybe check that one and stay away from this one!

Reviews.Title: “5 star prices, half star service”
Reviews.Author: nolatele
Reviews.Content: The place is clean and beautiful, but the service is unbelievably bad. On the first day, our room wasn't ready 'til 5:30 pm. While we were waiting for the room, we waited an hour and 20 minutes for 2 hamburgers at the pool side "restaurant". They don't let you bring any of your own food in, but all of their restaurants have awful food, worse service and ridiculous prices. $9 bottle of water anyone? (from the mini bar). I strongly suspect the calamari in the "Asian fusion" restaurant was really fried rubber bands. The sampler platter, which was supposed to include grilled chicken, beef, shrimp and eggplant, was a plate of chicken with two bites of beef, and the waiters couldn't care less when they screw up. The staff zooms around the property day and night in very loud, gasoline powered golf carts, so it always sounds like a parade of lawn mowers. They charged us $70 to pick us up from the airport and $85 to drop us in Old San Juan (a 20 minute ride). The ice machines are always empty and they're always out of towels. Even the car rental desk charges twice what the rest of Puerto Rico does. Gran Melia also makes extra money by letting non guests pay to use the pool, so the place is crawling with kids during the day. We really felt like they went to great lengths to squeeze every last dollar out of us, but made no effort at all to deliver even passable service. We travel a lot and don't mind paying for something nice, but this place charges 5 star prices and gives you half star service. They nearly ruined our honeymoon. Puerto Rico is great, but stay away from Gran Melia!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, Inconsistent service”
Reviews.Author: amcConnecticut
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I stayed at the resort the last week in July. Upon our arrival greeted by a very friendly and competent bell man, Dario. Dario immediately made us feel welcome. However the experience went downhill from this point on. Our room was not ready, which was understandable as check-in was not until 3pm and we arrived at 2. there was a room availabe with a king size bed which was not what I had reserved so we chose to wait. The woman checking us in at the front desk was apologetic, however could not give a time frame for when the room would be ready. She advised us that we could change and leave our bags in the hospitality suite, took my cell phone number and said we would be contacted when the room was available. A different person took our bags to the hospitality suite. This person was rude and acted as if this was an imposition. Upon going to the beach area no towels were availabe for three and a half hours. After all this time I finally went back to the front desk as at our 8th try at towels the girl there told us our room was still not ready. We went to the front desk to inquire and the girl told us the room was ready and offered no explanations as to why I was not contacted. When the card keys were handed to me, it looked like there was only one. When I asked the firld for two she rolled her eyes and flipped the cards apart and thurst them at me. At this point I was so frustrated I didn't trust myslef to say anything to her. The suite was beautifully appointed. The bathroom was huge with a suken tub. There were no complaints as to the accomodations. The next day we had breakfast at the hotel. There was one person making omeletes, one at a time. The food was standard fare you would get at any hotel. My cousin wanted several treatments at the spa but no one could explain the services to her. We went to the beach and again no towels were available. After the 7th or 8th try (and 2 hours later) at towels, my cousin was so frustrated that she complained to a manager. The manager listened to all her complaints (some which to this point I have not mentioned) and comped our breakfast for the duration of our stay. We had a problem with the light being out on our terrace and after 4 hours and another phone call someone came to fix it. A follow-up call from the hotel was made to our room and appreciated. Our last full day at the resort we got towels at 8am with no problem. However on this day both keys to the room were deactivated for some unknown reason. The parking situation at the hotel needs to be addressed as there are not enough spaces for guests. Upon checking out we asked to speak to the manager. We spoke to Felipe Cervantes who attentiively and patiently listened to our complaints. Mr. Cervantes apologized and promptly comped all parking charges. Mr. Cervates assured us that if we chose to stay at the resort in the future he would personally see to it that our stay there would be comfortable. All in all the resort and grounds are beautiful. However a resort of this caliber should not put there guests through the hardships we endured. When you go to a 4 star resort you expect to be pampered, not have every day with thoughts in your head of what went wrong. Hopefully these issues will be resolved as this resort has great potential. The service we received was either exceptional or horrendous. There was no middle ground. I would love to come back when the staff is better trained. A. Curet Milford, Connecticut M. Negron Boston, MA

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!! Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: fotografikdesign
Reviews.Content: First off, I must admit I was a bit skeptical about this resort from reading these reviews. We wanted to get away for a couple of days before we got married. We definitely made a great choice! Getting royal service was one of the best things we did. With this, you get exclusive check in, a separate area. Also from 6-9pm, they offer complimentary unlimited drinks (Hennessey and Coke, our choice). Tamehri in Royal Services was very friendly and helpful and the waiter in there was awesome!!! He never hesitated on bringing us drinks! Angel was one of our butler, when our TV wasn't working, he got right on it and made sure it was fixed before we got back. With Royal Service we also got free breakfast every morning and got to hang out in their private adults only pool...it was so peaceful, relaxing and never crowded. Also, they have golf carts driving you around wherever you need to get to on the resort. Someone was there in two minutes even though we were leaving at 4am. We showed up at the pool and the waiter reserved one those beds right by the pool (cost $0). From listening to these reviews, we did rent a car and that was one of the best things we did. Cabs out there are very expensive. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants there.....we went off the resort to eat authentic PR food everyday. Yes, it does cost $15 a day for parking and it does get crowded in the evening at the resort. Our room was amazing!!!! We even had a jacuzzi on the balcony with a view of the ocean. Our room was clean everyday we came back. They do have a natural beach.....but hey, it's still beautiful. I just wish they had more of a nightlife, perhaps a mini club, to cater to the younger crowd. It was still an amazing trip and as always, too short......we definitely learned not to base our opinion to everything other people write. Wherever you go, there are gonna be some positives and negatives, you just gotta plan ahead for these bumps! Overall, I would definitely go back with a group of friends and service was always with a smile! Thank you guys for making our pre-wedding trip an unforgettable one!

Reviews.Title: “Very bad service”
Reviews.Author: boraboralover
Reviews.Content: The property itself is very lovely (especially at night when it has gorgeous candlelight) but be prepared to hike to your rooms. The beach is not very appealing but the pool is nice. Did not appreciate the cabanas-to-rent signs for only something like $100 a day but my daughter tells me this is commonplace. The staff are all very friendly and I hate to write a negative review but I must. There was a dispute over our bill and they said it would be taken care of but I was not contacted by them just saw the bill on the charge card and have no clue as to how they arrived at that figure. When we first arrived there was apparently only one bellman on duty so we had a 30 minute wait to get to our room. There was no in-room safe so I waited at the front desk for assistance. By the time I got to the counter itself, it had been a long wait and then I was told that I would have to wait for security to show up to escort me to the safe. The whole episode took over 50 minutes at the least- I was pacing in the lobby and went up twice to beg for a time update, it was that bad. When it was time to check out we called for a bellman and waited. Finally I got fed up and took my own bag out to the car. And then waited and waited for the rest of my party. Eventually I drove up to the check in/check out area, got out and inquired. As this was taking place my son and his friend finally arrived in the cart. I let the staff know that I felt I could have crawled to the car with the baggage in my teeth and made it quicker than their service! The casino is pathetic. Some machines were not programmed yet to pay out in paper so if you wanted to cash out you had to wait for an attendant, who was on break...One lady pointed out to me that the bingo game is only for the locals as it is all in Spanish, she was disappointed The restaurants were fabulous but only 2 open at a time and very overpriced. It cost me over $120 every meal for our party of 3. I must say that when I wanted to use the internet at the business office I noticed a sign giving their rates. I was prepared to pay but the woman at the desk said no charge. I went back during their business office hours before we checked out to print up our airline tickets but the office was closed. Thank goodness the staff at the Royal Service were able to help. Overall a very nice place but be prepared to wait and don't plan on any time frame.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: aceit
Reviews.Content: Nothing short of perfect. A small piece of paradise. Girls trip, we stayed 5 nights, 6 days. The people were incredibly friendly and always wanting to help. You really got the feeling they enjoyed working there and they were all a team. The property was open and airy, well thought out for everyones needs from beach side lounge chairs to poolside comforts to indoor reading nooks. The ambiance was superb. The rooms were inviting, clean, comfortable in size and quiet. Unlike a hotel, each bungelow gave you privacy and no door slamming. Safety was never a concern. There was always plenty of suttle lighting, security personnal visibly on-site and patrol. We felt we had the best of both worlds, we were enough of a distance from San Juan to really feel the resort atmosphere but close enough to tour the island comfortably. Instead of paying for the tours we rented a car and went on our own. We got around easily and were able to do and see a lot on our own time frame. We spent a day in Old San Juan, saw the Fort Castillo San Cristobal-El Morro, shopping, lunch and dinner and even the Baccardi rum facility. Another day we went to the El Yunque Rainforest and loved having our own car to get around, (hint, wear your bathing suit and a cover-up and walking shoes) after leaving the rainforest we enjoyed the nearby Luquillo beach. There is an Avis car rental on site at the Gran Melia and Gina who works there is wonderful. She used to be a tour guide. One day she sent us on a scenic route to Ponce, south west/central, carribean side of the island. It was beautiful. Saw the eastern exterior, beachs and the interior mountains. We toured a coffee plantation just outside Ponce, (we got the 2 hour tour because they only harvest in October, which is when they offer the 4 hour tour) then we went into the city and toured the Serralles Castle, a beautiful mansion that sits high above the city with an awesome view of the caribbean and city of Ponce. Visited the town square (the trolly's end at 4:00 so we were to late to take a trolly) but after that we went to the boardwalk, five minutes from the city square. We had dinner at El Paladar Bar & Grill right on the boardwalk, very obscure but we had the the freshest, most delicious, seafood meals. We took the interstate back to San Juan and on to the Gran Melia within 2 hours. This day away really made us feel like we had experienced Puerto Rico, because we saw so much outside of the commercial and resort area. One of our favorite memories will be the Coco Sweet Bakery. It sits at the red light entering the road to the Gran Melia. Every morning we had breakfast here. Fresh island coffee was 70 cents, 3 scrabbled eggs with vegtables and fresh baked bread was $3.00. Cuban style, egg, bacon, cheese sandwich was $3.25 (great to go). It opens at 5:30a.m. and closes at 10:00p.m. Donuts were superb. We sun bathed Sunday afternoon, Tuesday after the rainforest, all day Thursday and Friday morning before heading out to the airport. It was truly a great trip and yes I would return and visit the north west side of the island and the caves. I will always stay at a Gran Melia hotel when it is available for future travels. It was a very hospitable and welcoming experience.

Reviews.Title: “NIce Hotel, Very Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Jayant98
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were recent guests at Gran Melia Puerto Rico, where we stayed for four (4) nights (July 12th -July 16th), and I have to say that for being a four (4) star hotel it sure did not meet our expectations service wise. The quality of service was extremely poor. During our stay I was told by at least 4 different employees that they were unable to fulfill my services being that they did not have time or were too busyâ€¦ this is something you do not tell your guests especially when they are paying $265 per night!!!!! The hotel should be prepared for any given number of guests on any given day. Iâ€™m sure the hotel gets a list of the number of guests that will be checking in/out on a daily basis in advance. Therefore, they should have the proper staff to cover the number of people staying at the hotel. Now I will go into details of the services that I was totally disappointed about: 1. When we first checked in, the check in procedure went smooth; however, we had to wait around approximately 40 minutes for a bellboy to escort us along with our luggage to our room. That took away from our first impression of the hotel. How are you going to have your guests, who are trying to get away from stress and finally relax, get aggravated and waste time sitting around waiting as soon as they begin their vacation??? Obviously the hotel did not have the sufficient amount of bellboys needed for the number of people checking in. The least they couldâ€™ve done was given us some guidance on how to get to our room and around the hotel this way we couldâ€™ve enjoyed ourselves upon arrival rather than wait around and then bring our luggage to our room when possible. 2. Housekeeping was good the first day, then after that it went downhill. The 2nd day our room was never made, we had to call for clean towels and was told that they did not have clean towels cause they did not have time to do them?!?!? How can you say that to your guests???? Finally, like two hours later housekeeping came by (at 9pm) to make our room and after we had already showered provided towels. The 3rd day, again they came pretty late in the evening to do our room and did not even bother to take the dirty dishes that were sitting on the table, which actually stayed there till we checked out. 3. There arenâ€™t refrigerators in the hotel rooms; therefore I was unable to store several items that needed to be refrigerated. Yet, I figured Iâ€™d get enough ice to keep them in the ice bucket and that should keep them cool. Well all the ice machines were out of ice throughout my entire stay and when I called â€œServiExpressâ€� to have them bring ice to the room once again I was told that they did not have ice cause they did not have time to make the ice?!?!?!?!? EXCUSE ME???? No ice in a 4 star hotel??? As a result my husband had to walk the lobby bar almost every night to get ice; mind you it was approximately 1/3 of a mile walk since our room (911) was almost at the end of the hotel. 4. We had a tee time to play golf at 3:45pm, however from previous experiences we decided to call the bellboy to pick up our golf clubs at 2:30pm, figured an hour and fifteen minutes should be enough time, specially since the golf course is only a two minute drive. Well good thing we call with plenty of time in advance cause after 3 phone calls and a 45 minute wait the SECURITY GUARD, NOT THE BELLBOY, came to get our golf clubs. Wait, thereâ€™s more to itâ€¦ when we were done playing golf, we requested for the hotel to pick us up, so we gave them enough time to come by walking around in the clubhouse, since we know they are never prompt. Well as we are walking out of the clubhouse the guy is driving away, he never even bothered to come inside and ask who needed a ride back!!! Ok, so then he finally turns back â€“ well the guy doesnâ€™t even work for the hotel, the bellboy ask this guy (the driver) to do him the favor since they were so busy!?!?!? CAN YOU IMAGINE???????? 5. Our last night we had our children stay with us since we were flying out the next day and figured they can sleep on the sofa bed, after all we only needed extra blankets and pillowsâ€¦ well once again it took them almost 3 hours (past midnight) to bring us the blankets and pillows. UNBELIEVABLE!!! Overall, I do have to say itâ€™s a beautiful hotel, great ambiance, nice rooms, good location and decent food. However, due to its lack of service Iâ€™d give this hotel 2 1/2 stars and would only recommend it to people who do not really care for good service.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Time!”
Reviews.Author: Citychick_0274
Reviews.Content: I almost didn't book this hotel based on the not-so-great reviews but I am super happy that I went with my gut and booked the Oceanfront Royal Service. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous and relaxing. My only disappointment is that we were only there for two days as we traveled all over the island on our trip. If you can swing the Royal Service, do it!! It's completely worth it. A lot of reviews have complained about how long the drive is to the resort and how far away it is from everything. Considering it only takes approximately 2.5 hours to get to the southwestern municipality of Guanica from Rio Grande, it's not that big of a deal. However, unless you are only staying in Old San Juan you definitely need a car to fully enjoy PR. After a long red-eye flight we stopped for lechon asado and batata off the freeway (OMG! Amazing) and a Medalla at a roadside bar a bit further up the road from our meal. We were on vacation after all and in no huge rush to get to the hotel. It is true that the resort is a bit of a drive from the airport and about 3 miles once you pull off the main road but the view is so stimulating you don't even notice it! The plants, golf course, flowers and birds are pretty and vibrant. When we finally pulled up I took one look at the parking lot and it was decided we would spend the extra cash for valet. Totally worth it! The last thing I wanted to worry about on vacation was finding parking. Check-in at the RS lounge was quick and easy; it should be noted that when I called three days prior to arrival they did not have a reservation under the booking number I was provided by the website. Two phone calls later it was fixed. Save yourself the hassle and call ahead. We were greeted with cocktails and our fab butler, Manuel, picked us up and gave us a tour of the property all the while providing us with useful information about the resort and surrounding attractions. Our room was right next to the RS pool and was big and beautifully appointed. I loved the huge shower! Manuel took care of everthing we needed, whenever needed, and my boyfriend loved how close it was to the beach. The outdoor whirlpool was so relaxing at night with the sound of the waves lapping the beach and the coqui chirping. *sigh* I miss it already! Another big complaint that I read about was that the beach was rocky and full of seagrass. It totally is, but we thought it was fun that you could walk out super far and the bathtub warm water is barely thigh deep. We enjoyed looking for shells and playing with the colorful hermit crabs. Again, you are on vacation and walking along the beach in Puerto Rico, enjoy it and stop sweating the small stuff! HAHAHA We only ate at the resort twice. Once for dinner and again for breakfast. Although the food is a bit salty, it was still pretty good and coming from San Francisco we thought the prices were reasonable. Service is a bit slow but our waiter was personable and accomodating at dinner and the waitress at breakfast was awesome as well. Our big thing was to eat Puerto Rican food so we only ate at the resort when necessary. By choice, we did walk alot on the resort but there were always carts going by. When we did want a ride back to the room it was not a problem catching one. All in all this hotel is beautiful, the staff is amazing and we had an AMAZING trip. I am so glad that the Gran Melia was apart of our grand time and I can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand Melia!”
Reviews.Author: greenbeltdan
Reviews.Content: I've been to Puerto Rico, many, many times, and always like to try newer hotels. I didn't want to stay at the Grand Melia when it was an all-inclusive resort, but was very interested in trying it out when it became a regular hotel. For comparisons sake, I have stayed at the Rio Mar (when it was a Westin) several times and the El Conquistador many times as well. I'd put my overall experience at the Melia up there with both of those resorts. The hotel is located about 7 minutes from the main road and there's a lot of construction going on before you get there, but once you get to the hotel, it's beautiful. I stayed in the Royal Service part of the hotel, so you have a dedicated check-in desk away from the masses, although they don't tell you that (I waited in line for about 15 minutes before I was shuttled over there). My room was spacious, marble-laden, and luxurious. I appreciated the private pool and cabanas that are reserved for the Royal Service clientele. The restaurants were very good, and the sea bass at Nami, for $22, was a relative bargain and outstanding. I had a late flight, and they accommodated me with a 3 p.m. late check out, even though the hotel was completely sold out that day. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat, especially if you can get a deal.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star quality the staff is Excellent !!!”
Reviews.Author: berend2nd
Reviews.Content: I do not even know where to begin, this was the best vacation my wife and I have ever been on. The whole staff was exceptional from the minute we walked on site after we were personally greeted by the manager Felipe. Jose and Melvin were the best, room service was great and the maid cleaned our room perfectly everyday. I am wondering if some of the negative reviews I read prior to going were written for the wrong resort. I must say the resort is beautiful as well as very well kept. Everyday the landscapers were hard at work keeping the resort in top notch condition. As you may have read swimming in the ocean off the beach can be done, but is not the best, consider this if swimming in the ocean is important to you, for me I prefer the pool so it was not an issue for me. As far as the people complaining about the prices being too expensive, come on folks you are on a beautiful resort, you get what you pay for, and if you think it is too expensive then maybe you should consider staying in a hotel and not on a resort. Getting around is requires a little work and research, Jose and Melvin were very helpful with this; I would recommend speaking with them prior to making any plans outside the resort. Things you must do are visit old San Juan, plan for a full day if you want to see everything, and rent a car for the day. I also say you must go to El Yunque rainforest, it is close by and a must do.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the reviews”
Reviews.Author: jonesa67
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from 29 Jun - 5 Jul. First of all, as I have learned from many reviews off Trip Advisor, don't believe everything you read. The only thing I have read consistently with any accuracy is the need to get a rental car. Let's break it down. Rooms were spacious and well kept. The first night we arrived the maid never came by, but it was minor to us. We had plenty of towels and only slept in our bed for a night. I gave them the benefit of doubt and never complained, and to there credit we never had that problem again. They called us daily to see when we would like housekeeping to come by. Yes, the room had a bit of a musty smell, but it wasn't due to the lack of cleanliness. A candle fixed that. We even had an extra fridge in our suite so we were able to keep our own supplies readily cold in our room for consumption. Property was awesome. We were in villa 924 with ocean view and yes, it was a bit of a walk to the main resort and pool, but that was how we liked it. We enjoyed our daily walk to and from the pool/resort. The scenery was amazing so we enjoyed taking in all of it during the walk.There was never a time that as we walked to and from our room, a staffer with a golf cart stop to offer a ride. Never ate in any of the restaraunts since we had a rental and wanted to experience Puerto Rican food while in Puerto Rico rather than Japanese or Italian. We ate daily at the pool grill for lunch and it was decently priced. C'mon folks, a $9 Cheeseburger with fries is the norm. If you want a value meal, then stay close to a McDonald's. Same goes for the drinks. I don't know where some of the reviewers normally go, but where I am from and where I have been $5-$10 for a drink is norm. Bartenders took care of us and never skimped on alcohol content. Try to stay during the week if possible. Service is different when the volume increases, but that's to expect anywhere. One thing I was frustrated by was the parking situation on the weekend. There was so many guests and so many people visiting guests, parking was non-existent beginning on Thursday and no one in the hotel seemed to care whether you found a spot or not. We ended parking on the other side of the resort. A small discrepany, but definitely something that needs attention. That Friday we had a problem at the pool grill too. The servers didn't have a grip (nor cared) on who had what tables so several families waited for some time to even get to order a drink. A couple next to us called management and to their credit the grill was swarmed with management and additional staffers within minutes. They personally stopped by our tables, took orders, and comp'd drinks and food for the inconvenience. Every resort working on that scale is likely to have problems. It's how they react and attempt to wrong the rights it is what counts! There it is. Don't let such a great place/deal be overlooked because some people expect way too much even though they got a great deal. We thoroughly enjoyed it and because a few good reviews, we were prepared and it made our vacation so much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great...rent a car for a complete vacation!”
Reviews.Author: TravelClarion
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this resort. If you want a complete vacation to visit the island, rent a car. Accomodations: Everything was clean and well cared for. The beds were extremely comfortable (fluffy and huge). AC and cable TV, Free safe for valuables. Balcony with nice views of the resort landscape (not brick walls of adjacent buildings). Free coffee; (buy bottled water and beverages for minifridge). Pool: Great! Warm waters. Can sunbathe on "island platforms" within the pool or nearby Coco Beach. Watch for the friendly hermit crabs that children like to collect. Food: We had been worried about eating at the hotel because of the other reviews, but the resort is located just off Route 3 with malls, supermarkets, a pharmacy, fast food places, and a deli nearby. For breakfast, there's also a stand called Gran Melia Cafe that sells juices, coffee, and sandwiches. We opted for Coco-Sweet Bakery & Deli (located by the highway exit for the resort). The resort food was delicious also; we had the churrasco with yucca fries and salad ($14) at the Wet pool grill. They give an ample portion, so my husband and I shared and ordered a side, as well. (No refills for beverages). One night, we ordered the pizza from room service ($16 + $3 service charge). We loved the way they made the crust and extra cheese. For a typical Puerto Rican meal, the vacation concierge recommended Richie's Cafe, located at the Rio Mar hotel area a few minutes away. (Try the mofongo and guava pastelitos with "mayo-ketchup"). The place has wood sculptures and opens up to overlook the cityscape (very romantic). If you want quick and convenient, there are many stops along the highway as well as the food court at Belz Factory Outlet Mall, which has a variety of familiar and local options, as well as a movie theater. Entertainment: There are events each night and activities during the day. We caught a lobby show of a Flamenco dancer and singer to the tune of Bambolero (very festive). Day Trips: Belz mall, Plaza Carolina, El Yunque Rainforest, Luquillo Beach, and Old San Juan, which are all accessible through Route 3 Worship: Several Christian churches (Jesus thank You for the whole trip!)... along Route 3. We were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again, shame shame shame”
Reviews.Author: JavierDiaz4
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I have a list I made up right in front of the manager, I walked the guy through each issue I had. All he said was thank you and dropped it in the comment box. So here's the list in no particular order; 1. Don't touch the minibar in the room. Each item has a sensor, the second its moved, you are charged. The minibar is a small tray under the TV, on a Desk and also a small refrigerator. The second something is moved, you're charged about 5 times the average retail price. MM's was 3.50 and Water was 4.50. We didnt want it, we just picked up the MM's but them back, and the water was hot, went back later for the same water to see it was colder, and was charged again, for the sameeeeeeee waterrr. Had to wait until someone could come to the room and verify I didnt actually consume the items. 2. Our room was exactly 1/3 of a mile from the lobby. So they have these trolleys that take you to the room after you check in right. Well that's about it, after you check in you're on your own to walk back and around the grounds. If I wanted to walk two miles a day I would have stayed home and gone to the Gym. Finding a trolley at night is impossible, we couldnt actually. After arriving from dining or from outside of the hotel, we had to walk, and much further because at night you have to park really far because parking cant be found since there's a casino and a lot of locals come to play at the casino and they take up much of the parking that the guest could use. 3.Ohhhhh, don't use their public bathrooms near the pool, they are broken, doors wont open if you can manage to get in, and the toilets are disgustinggggggggggg. I complained each day I was there, "Arent you guys going to clean those bathrooms, send someone for crying outloud." 4. So we were told of this great vacation program that we were"eligible"for.
