My fiancee said sure, no problem, especially since the hotel employee advised us that we would get 3 nights free in Dominican Republic in their hotel if we went. So the next morning we went. A gentlemen by the name of "Toby" showed us a video, made us walk around a fancy hall with pictures of their other hotels around the world, and then asked us if we would like to stay in them. We said sure why not, then he mentioned to us that for $24,000 with 15.99% for 10 years we could own a timeshare. Whattttttttttttttttttt? I didn't go to no stinking hotel on vacation to think about buying a timeshare. So he bugged us and bugged on, we told him thats not what we came there for, he didnt want to let us leave, until we decided to just ignore him and walk out while he kept talking. 5. No parking at night, dont leave unless you want to take a hike at night back to your room or risk waiting for someone to leave. That kind of sums it all up. Remember, no trolleys at night. Also total mess with the parking tickets, you cant leave without going to the lobby and having them stamp your parking ticket so that they can charge you etc. 6. Oh so they have this VIP stuff all around the hotel, VIP lounge, VIP pool, VIP internet. No one explained this to us. So we decided to ask, its a royalty service they provide. Mind you, this "Royalty Service" you have to pay extra which is the same service you get for free at a regular hotel. Why in the world would you pay extra after paying close to 300 a night for a room. 7.Ok, our room door was broken when we got to our room. So we called up to have our room switched as we wanted to head back out to enjoy our brief vacation and we wanted to leave our stuff nice and secure. They advised us they couldnt and they would send a maintenance guy. That took over an hour to happen and we had to wait till he fixed it, so we wasted about 3 hours waiting for a freaking door to get fixed. The problem with the door was it didnt lock, so anyone could come in and take our cameras and passports. 8. Ohhhh, towel card, Cant get a towel at the pool without it. And if you loose the card, like we did, its thirty dollars for a little pc of cardboard credit like card. Its one towel per guest per card.. Once youre done with the towel, you have to return it, and before 6. Cant take it to your room, cause you need the card. Again, nothing like other hotels. 9.Check in was a mess, they had something called a precheck in to make check in when the room was ready nice and easy. Well we did that for nothing, because we still had to do everything again when it came time to really check in. Waste of time. We're like we already gave you guys all of this info, why are we doing this again?

Reviews.Title: “Gran Melia Puerto Rico--Do not waste your time or money, read this review.”
Reviews.Author: PapiHenry
Reviews.Content: Ok, I will preface by saying I am Dominican (my grandparents were from Puerto Rico) and my wife is 100 % Puerto Rican, so for us to be disappointed, annoyed, or upset regarding one our OWN island is extremely difficult. We are very laid back and are very low maintenance. We went for 5 days, 6 nights without the kids as we try to travel on our own at least once a year to relax and this was that trip. I'll start by with the check in. So my wife and I get there in an older toyota corolla that we borrower from my father-in-law (1) because he insisted and would feel offended if I rented a car (2) I really didnt care since we usually get to a hotel and stay there until it's time to leave and we were also staying at other hotels and different places around the island. But we wanted the "RESORT" lifestyle for the time we stayed. This was my first mistake of many. So anyways we get there, I pull up, my wife gets out, I get out and we just stand there while the two bellmen just talk to each other and ignore us. After 5 minutes or so (again we are pretty laid back) they turn to us and don't even say welcome or address us. My wife immediately says something to them (obviously a little annoyed) but nothing out of the ordinary. It was something to the effect of thanks for noticing. In any case the guy goes "But Honey I waiting for you" in spanish. I almost flipped since my temper goes awry when it comes to those things but I let it go. I then asked what to do with the vehicle, they kind of just grunted and pointed me to the parking site which was not too far way. I actually wanted to Valet since I didnt care to pay whatever it was (I later found out it was 25/day if I recall correctly) but they never asked nor gave me any options. So we then check in (took about 30 minutes), and it was ok. Again no Welcome, no cold towel, no smiling faces, nothing. Everyone seemed bored and upset to be working, which we can all understand since we all work, but I dont expect that at this type of resort and not at the price I paid. We, unfortunately, went to Punta Cana and had the greatest hotel and resort vacation and experience EVER so we compare it a LOT whenever we go anywhere and this was like comparing the experience of Disney World (live in Orlando) to watching TV in black and white with rabbit ears in 1980. Maybe, we expect resorts and hotels like Punta Cana or just people in General like Dominican Republic but not here, not at this hotel, not even close. On with the appearance of the hotel. The hotel is Beautiful and has a lot of potential for the location where it is. It is pretty well kept, the grounds are usually nicely trimmed. The Beach is "blah" at best, not the hotels fault but if you think you are going there to swim in the beach, think again. The pools are nice and long, well cleaned and kept . Pools are pools so what can I say? The service at the "Wet Bar Grill" is HORRIBLE to say the least, aside from very expensive. I will pay whatever if the service is good, but this was something out of the twilight zone. I went to the bar and said, "Hello, how are you doing today" and I just saw the girl stare at me and say "what do you want"? I said politely I'd like a mojito please, she then looked down, walked away, came back, talked to her coworkers about 5 minutes, then made it. I said "thank you". She just grunted. Mind you this is all in spanish, my native tongue, and I'm just a nice guy that just always says please and thank you, I figure everyone works, so just be polite. In any case the mojito was $11.00 which is a lot even on vacation, and I still gave her a $4 tip--I dont think I should have but I thought this was just an anomaly. Wrong--This is the attitude of the hotel in general. I wont bore you with details, but most employees were exactly like the one I mentioned--bored, unhappy, unprofessional, jerkish, and just plain rude. Food- ate at the cafe for breakfast and dinner- 70 and 95 respectively for two people. My wife had a coke i think and i had water. Yea. Both Buffets, both horrible. Very little selection. Very expensive for what it is. My wife had some cheese, crackers, and ham. Crappy service again and crappy food both times we went. We kept thinking things wood change--never did. Again we are really outgoing people and very nice--we met some couples and they shared same sentiments with us. Dont eat the food here, it's overpriced and just crappy food. We didnt eat at the japanese restaurant or the italian (I learned my lesson after this next story), but we talked to some guests and said it was equally crappy. Ok---so the morning we're having breakfast (1st day after checking in previous night) and I get up to get some bread and behind the bread I find two HUGE cockroaches, which I dont care for but I'm pretty cool with these things and I just laughed about it. So I go up to one of the ladies that host and I say discretely what I saw and to take care of it before anyone notices. She shrugged it off and said ok and dindt even thank me or anything. Again, I dont care that much about this---it's the caribbean and insects are all over the place, but I expect better service. 30 minutes later we finish eating and I notice the same bread basket and layout still there, so nothing was changed or removed. I never went back to ANY of their restaurants. Enjoy Rooms are not that clean, we found a lot of dust (extreme amounts) throughout the room and candy wrappers under our bed. The bathroom was "ok", not greatly cleaned. I found hair in the shower and the tub was somewhat dirty. THe room looked good an we had a nice balcony and nice view on the 2nd floor. If you dont like walking a lot from your room, I dont suggest you leave it. The golf carts supposedly are all over the place, my wife and I walked a LOT because we would just wait and wait and wait and even if they saw you they wouldn't stop or even say I'll be back. We walked a LOT to and from the rooms, and were pretty far from the main lobby. So yea. The one and ONLY person that made us feel welcome was the Manager/Supervisor "OTTO". This guy us very friendly and understanding after we vented about some of the things we found out towards the end of our stay. He is extremely helpful, professional, understanding, and always had a smile. I asked him why he worked there because he's by far the best treatment we received. I would only go to this resort to say hi to him, but I would not stay here again. Thank you, Otto for all your help and comfort. I have more to write but this is long enough. To those that have very good reviews about this hotel, you were one of the few lucky ones and you probably have not been to Punta Cana or a comparable resort--this hotel is terrible on so many levels I am missing so much because it was ALL so bad. Oh by the way, the day we checked out I had to walk with 3 suitcases from my room to the lobby (about 15 min walk) because front desk would not pick up the phone for whatever reason and no carts would pass by either. We did speak to a manager when checking out because we had it. She was very nice about it and apologized, so we did tell her all the things we found right and wrong with the hotel. I cant recall her name, but she was nice about it. We didnt yell or act inappropriate but we let her know we were upset and disappointed with our stay and treatment. If you want to have a good time or just relax, dont come here. The people we met at the pools were great. Some locals, some tourists and most agreed with our perception. There was one couple that said they were having a good time and that this was the 1st time in a resort like "this". When you have nothing to compare it to, I guess it's mediocre at best instead of horrible. Puerto Rico is beautiful and most of the older generation is very helpful and nice. There are a lot of beautiful places to visit and we actually had a great time EXCLUDING our stay at the Gran Melia. I will never come back here, ever. I may give them another try in a different country. Good Luck in your future vacations! If you would like a more in depth look or review, please e-mail me as I have probably missed a lot more things that went wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: MaratMiami_Florida
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the 4th of July weekend at the resort. The resort was beautiful and the staff was very attentive, polite and helpful. The pool area was great- the beach is rocky and sea grass near the shore. A car is a necessity to get out, the restaurants are OK- make sure you have a reservation if you plan to eat on site. As you leave the resort not much there or pleasing to eat, we tried Martin BBQ chicken on C-3-it was very good. If you are going for Beach and Pool I would recommend the Dominican Republic all-inclusives, $5 a can of beer, specialty drinks, breakfast, lunch and dinner it all adds up at Gran Melia. If you like the mountains, rainforest and relaxing in the pool this is a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 star hotel could pass as a 5 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jessng83
Reviews.Content: We honeymooned for a couple of days at this resort and could not have asked for a more relaxing time here. This resort was huge with a great golf course and spacious rooms. We did not use the royal sevices but still felt the service was excellent. One problem that we did have was the check in and check out times were considerably longer then we expected. They seemed to be short staffed and created a long wait for rooms and then again at check out. But after that the conceirge was excellent and proficient in making sure that we were comfortable. The rooms were large as well as the bathtub and all were immaculantly clean. And our beach view was excellent. The pool is luxiurious with a swim up bar and lots of room to be comfortable. The beach however is not so hot. This is not one that one would like to swim in. The "sand" is rocky and unpleasant without shoes and the man made beach was not something I would recommend to swim in. The lobby, and other common areas of the hotel were lavish and beautiful! Had an exotic feel in the evening with candles lit everywhere. The restaurant was beautiful but lacked the service at the outside terreace seating and the food at "Tempo" the italian rest was mediocre at best. But overall the experience here was wonderful and would def come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful...but worst service ever”
Reviews.Author: Boomer1102
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a family members wedding. The rooms were beautiful, the ceremony was perfect. We then went to the reception area and enjoyed an open bar. After the ceremony and open bar, the food service was...ok. The servers started taking full glasses of wine and champagne off the tables as guests were getting food from the buffet or just going to the restroom. They seemed to be in a hurry to get us out of the reception area so they could clean up. The next day we had diner in the Italian restaurant(can't remember the name) on the prpoerty and the service was horrible. We were constantly waiting for the server and I mean we did not see him for 20-30 minutes at a time. A table next to us was not even greeted by a server for 45 minutes and then they had to get the hostest to find a server to take their order. The resort was beautiful, the service and managment need a lot of work. Poor communication between day and night shift made check out a nightmare. Be ready to stand your ground on your bill and rates.

Reviews.Title: “Highley recomended for romantic couples!”
Reviews.Author: amazingvacation
Reviews.Content: WE JUST RETURNED ON MONDAY THE 30TH OF JUNE WE WERE THERE FOR A WEEK,The hotel is magnificent and we have never experienced such incredible service before. The employess were very nice asked if we were ok all the time the food is expensive if u but it form your mimi bar in your room (bottle of water $7.00, coke 12oz $4.00) but we rented a car, its the best thing to do and we headed into San Juan on of the largest city's there and ate,shopped and even went to a club called brava nice please to go and drink and listen to every kind of music, and you have to visit the rainforest it is amazing and eat rice and beans the best out there when you leave the rainforest.this hotel is on its private island so its about 25-30mins from town but there is alot to do and the big pool is so awsome i highley recommend it. don't listen to the reviews listen to your instict i read alot of bad reviews but i wanted to see for my self.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Melia Fantastic 5 Star Resort”
Reviews.Author: maryella61
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I just returned from Gran Melia in Puerto Rico. The trip was a little bit of business and pleasure. I can't understand some of the negative reviews on this resort. The resort is absolutley beautiful and everything is extremely clean. The rooms are incredable and also spotless. We did not meet one singel staff member that didn't have a smile on their face and were always asking if there is anything they can do for you and how are you enjoying your stay. They were terrific! The main pool is great. It as extremley large. You never had to fight for lounge chairs. We booked direct with the hotel and got an upgrade to the Ocean Front Royal Service Suite , which is well worth the additional money. Included with the Royal Service is complementary cocktails from 6 to 9 each evening in their private lounge. It also includes breakfast each day. The Royal Service guests had their own private pool. In the evening the resort has candles lit everywhere. They play very exotic / relaxing music all day and night. They have beautiful couches and comfy lounges through out the resort. The pools are spectacular. Their restaurants are very nice bur are expensive. This is to be expected at a 5 star resort though. The drinks are around $8 a drink.. Beautiful Golf Couses. The whole resort focused on complete relaxation. I just can't say enough about this resort. If you do go to Gran Melia you must have dinner (or lunch) at Richies Cafe. Richie picks you up from the resort and brings you back. The cafe is high up on a cliff with a wonderful view. The food is excellant!. the view and the food were so good we ate there three nights in a row. Richie is a wonderful host. I would reccommend the Gran Melia Resort to anyone who is looking for a relaxing pampered vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Exceedingly poor service and mildewed rooms mars otherwise decent enough resort”
Reviews.Author: SusanfromSoCal
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a trip around Puerto Rico in which we had the misfortune of staying at La Gran Melia Resort in Rio Grande on two occasions over the course of two weeks. The combination of over-the-top ostentatiousness, exceedingly inefficient service (with the exception of that which is offered to Royalty Service patrons), mildewed rooms (we stayed in 3 of them, all of which had the same problem to differing degrees) and being nickel-and-dimed for everything (including hi-speed internet access - they give you the dial up for free) made for an overall unpleasant stay in what would have otherwise been a decent enough place. Check-in (we arrived at 4:00) took several hours - there were no rooms available with 2 beds and we are a family of 3. At 6:30 we were finally given a room that reeked of mildew. The delay in check-in meant that we were unable to make it out to Fajardo to go to the bioluminescent bay as we had planned. I complained to management the next day an we were upgraded to one of the Royalty Service rooms, which was a significant improvement (in fact, I would never stay there again unless I were to have Royalty Service (which is how *all* of the guests should treated - not just those who fork over the extra $$). The grounds are fairly spread out, which was a huge problem fore me as I have limited mobility due to a disability. We were told that carts circled the property regularly or that all we had to do was call and someone in a cart would come to pick me up whenever we needed transportation. The only carts circling the property regularly were security/landscaping/housekeeping. I called to request a cart on THREE separate occasions and no-one came after more than 20 minutes of waiting!! (The night before we were leaving I even arranged in advance to have a cart pick us up in the morning and it never came!! (In addition to the prior arrangement I made the night before I called in the morning to make sure they would send it to no avail). I should point out, however, this was not the case when we stayed in the Royalty Service quarters, as they have "butlers" available for transport, etc. at all times. Again, this is the treatment that should be offered to *all* of the patrons, not just those in Royalty Service. The inefficiency with which the place is run is staggering!! In addition to the outrageously long wait for check-in, each time you leave during your stay you have to get your parking ticket validated (for which there was generally a line). On our check-in for the second visit (a week after the first), we requested that express checkout paperwork be sent to our room to avoid the interminable and unavoidable line. The paperwork was never sent. The tendency to nickel-and-dime the patrons for everything from lying on the canopyed beds by the pool to using the high speed internet was rather annoying. Another *huge* problem for me were the polished marble floors all over the place (very slippery when wet (and it rains a lot in Puerto Rico) - I fell on two occasions). I would not stay there again unless I were in Royalty Service (and even then, I'd have to think twice about it).

Reviews.Title: “The facilities were lovely but...”
Reviews.Author: Upstater31
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with others who said the restaurant choices were limited and over priced. We also had a problem with a fire alarm going off several times in the middle of the night. When we called the front desk to let someone in authority know no one ever answered. It seemed like there were a lot of worker bees at the hotel but no one of any real authority. The beach was disappointing but we did enjoy the pools and the spa. The taxi service was very expensive and everything was so far away. Overall, i think this resort has a lot of potential but they seem content to be mediocre. I would not recommend it to my friends because for the money it was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A great honey moon”
Reviews.Author: csf2024
Reviews.Content: I went here on my honey moon in nov. of 2006. We stayed at the Paradisius. It was all inclusive and wonderful. We got to go to the rain forest, relax on the beach.kayaking, torued the city. Went on a catameran and snorkeled we also saw the ocean change color to like a red when you put your hand or kayak paddle in the water. We had a lot of fun and felt extreamly safe there. I have heard alot of bad reviews on it being dirty here before we went. However, I foulnf that it was only dirty around the city like any city.. Also where the cruise ships come in. I thought the hotel was beautiful and very accomidating. The people who worked at the hotel were great as well. They were filed with information and very friendly. We couldn't have asked for any better.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: vm22
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel and great service, the rooms were very clean. The pools were great as were the restaurants. The environment was very nice. The hotel experience overall was expensive but fabulous, I will love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Gran Melia is a beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: honeydew324
Reviews.Content: Ok the Gran Melia was a beautiful hotel however there are things you should know while staying at the resort. First of all, when you get there if you've booked through Cheapcarribean.com MAKE CERTAIN that the resort applies your RESORT CREDIT if applicable or else they will nickle and dime you for everything while staying at the resort. That's the only issue my husband and I had was them charging you for everything and not disclosing that you may or may not have credit to use while visiting. Also, Hector was great!! He's very professional and has a good attitude and know's the hotel, and area quite well. While in your room DO NOT PICK UP ANYTHING FROM THE FRIDGE OR BAR as they have sensors on each item and once you remove the item, your room is automatically charged!!!! The Royal Service is great as we had the pleasure of being in the VIP suites of the hotel. Overall, I would say we had a great stay the hotel is beautiful and well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds .... terrible service”
Reviews.Author: rolojee
Reviews.Content: Went to the Gran Melia for a birthday celebration with a group of 15 people. The grounds and the layout were superb but the rest of the trip was marred by poor service. The food was expensive and at best poorly prepared - we went off site and had great meals. Our group had similar problems to previous bloggers with regards to room maintenance and check in problems. Everything just seemed disorganized with most of the staff indifferent at best. Additionally they do charge extra for everything. I normally don't post negative reviews but in this case the lack of attention to even the most basic fundamentals of customer service really disappointed me.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money!”
Reviews.Author: Lucy3114
Reviews.Content: My friend and I came back from this resort last week.....The staff for the most part were unfriendly and not very helpful. The first full day we were there....our room was not cleaned until approx. 6:30pm after calling to find out why. When it was cleaned.... when I say cleaned..... I mean we got clean towels and the bed was done...thats it! The mini-bar was not replenished, the floors were not swept, etc. To add to that, there was no price menu for the mini-bar. I called for the prices and they assured me someone would come bring me a list. Three days later.....no list. The bed was VERY comfortable and the room was nice. I lost a sandal out of my bag on the long walk to my room...I could not find it. The next day I called the front desk to see if anyone had found it......I got transferred to six different areas...then they hung up on me without an answer. The restaurants were very expensive. The japanese restaurant was worth it, but I can't say the same for the italian restaurant. The casino is shady people! If you do go to gamble...please gamble with caution. I might suggest to stay away from the free boos....

Reviews.Title: “Gran Mila, hmmmmm”
Reviews.Author: The_busy_traveler
Reviews.Content: As with other reviewers, I think everyone is agreement that this place is extremely over priced. The room rates are priced decently. How so ever they will nickle and dime you to death. There is a fee for everything, and I mean everything. Drinks average 10 a piece. (not all that bad). How ever the food is extremely overpriced for what you get. $15.00 for a McDonalds quality Cheeseburger just seemed a little on the high side. Also, pre warning. You can not bring any type of food or coolers on the grounds. everything has to be purchased from the hotel. If your looking for action, you may want to consider somewhere else, on the other hand if you want a laid back experience this is the place. Also there are no suitable beaches, you can't enter the water, it's nothing but rock, coral and sea weed. If you do come, stay at the pool bar, cheapest food , best service and most action. The place is beautiful and the rooms are nice, but thats where it stops.

Reviews.Title: “Good (not Great) stay at the Gran Melia”
Reviews.Author: mcfields
Reviews.Content: I rely on tripadvisor reviews, so I feel it is only fair to write my own. The Gran Melia is a beautiful property, like others have said, that needs a little tweeking. The first thing - rent a car. Absolutely, without a doubt, the best thing we did. Puerto Rico is really easy to drive around and we used our car to drive into San Juan about every night and drive to local bakeries to get lunch etc. Without a car, i think we would have been really unhappy. The pool is gorgeous. very big, lots of built in beds, very clean, great temperature. It was packed with kids over the weekend (we do not have kids) which was a little "loud" for our taste but they were just kids being kids, so we can't complain. Monday and Tuesday the pool was very quiet. Our room was nice, always cleaned promptly, very comfy bed, great flat screen tv with all the american channels. We found service very friendly and willing to help. We did not like the beach at the property (full of rocks, like the pictures show) but we took our rental car a few miles down the road to Luquillo Beach which was beautiful, easy to find and almost empty on a Monday. Highly recommend that. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to families much more than singles and also I cannot say enough about having a car to leave the property. There is a lot to see in Puerto Rico. The Gran Melia served as a perfect suitable "home base" but the beach on property and lack of diverse restaurant options made our rental car worth 10x what we paid for it.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty rooms”
Reviews.Author: wwanda_2217
Reviews.Content: After a great day at El Yunque National Forest, my family were exhausted to arrive at Gran Melia. The structure is impressive, but when I went to 612 room a lot of mildew in bath linen, no air conditioner and no vacuum my room. My husband was very upset and called several times to front desk and a great, customer service employee came and solved the air conditioning problem. In addition let him know about bath curtain that was with a lot of mildew, he called to correspondent area, but at today, nobody went to my room to change the linen. I suffered with a lot of allergy and my vacation was a disaster. As a matter of fact, the prices are too ridiculous. We pay on dollars instead of euro. A coke cost $3.57, a nuggets with fries for a kid cost $16.00, a buffe without lobster, only creole food cost $37.00 adults, $18.00 kids, that is a ridiculous price due to my kids only eat one or two nuggets. My room never was clean. I will never go to Puerto Rico Gran Melia, is dirty and dusty.

Reviews.Title: “Sol Melia vacation member (Loved our room/condo!)”
Reviews.Author: southernbell7777
Reviews.Content: We just got back yesterday We were there for 10 days We had 2 hot tubs! one in our bathroom and the other on the balcony! our view of the ocean was wonderful. we had the over-advantage b/c we are vacation club members so, check-in was different from regular visitors. check-in was a breeze, staff was friendly and courteous, internet access was available. information was readily available there was many to do San Juan was great great shops! the restaurants in Puerto Rico are great! very impressed it's nice to travel to Puerto Rico b/c u don't have to go through customs, etc...... which can be a headache, sometimes better rent a car while u are there! a taxi is expensive! really expensive! oh, and do the el yunque rainforest :) the downs- it rained off and on every single day we were there, the beach- rocky, not swimmingly.(?*not sure if that's a word- LOL) the resort is not all inclusive anymore i wish it was though The phone in our room had some serious issues. lol Housekeeping came around a wee bit too early some days. I would go back to Puerto Rico but, I don't know if I would stay here again But, the overall experience was A OK :)

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: tpalep
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting Puerto Rico every month for the last 5 years. This might be the nicest overall property on the island. Even rivaling the famous Conquistador. The staff here are very friendly and seem to strive for great service. Somethng I can't say for the rest of the island. The property itself is beautiful. The rates during the summer are pretty reasonable, but they do get you on the food - a little pricey. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: stxvigirl
Reviews.Content: The resort is beautiful. The facilities are well maintained. The lagoon pool was awesome- it has a swim up bar with great mojitos. There are three good restaurants. The bread at breakfast rocked. The boutique casino was also good to us. The rooms were more than we imagined. A great escape to paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed on the Gran Melia”
Reviews.Author: reichspot
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay with Gran Melia's Royal Service, which includes a private check-in and lounge and pool, cabanas and a "butler." When we first arrived we were taken to a room that wasn't ready, so we were moved. It took more than 1 1/2 to get a new key- so we were stuck in the room. The room was beauitful. Large, comfortable bed, flat-screen TV, ocean view and a jacuzzi on the balcony. I'm a big movie fan and we didn't have the movie service the entire stay. Too, our room wasn't cleaned 3 of the four nights we stayed. Because it is a resort between San Juan and Farjado, without a car, you are stuck eating at the hotel. They have 4 restaurants, including the pool grill. In the evening, your only choice is a full dinner. Not always my choice on vacation. I would have loved somewhere to get a burger and a beer. In the restaurants, which are expensive, everytime we chose an entree, they were out of it. The beach is beautiful. Bring beach shoes to protect your feet. It's great for walking and exploring the tide pools. The woman who did my manicure was nice, but it was the worst manicure and pedicure I've ever had. I could tell she was trying to do well, but she was just filing and painting. I doubt she was trained. We listened to the 90 minute sales pitch for the time shares for the free 1 hour massage. Seemed to go ok until the used car sales tactics at the end of the presentation. Casino not as nice as I thought it would be, but the real nickle slots are fun. As I said, its a mixed review- some things were nice, some need improvement. All in all, too expensive for what it was.

Reviews.Title: “So much (wasted) potential”
Reviews.Author: mseeke
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful place, but they really need to tweak a few things if I were to reccomend it to anyone. I was there on a business conference for the week. My girlfriend joined me on Friday night and we stayed until Monday morning. During the week, I was very busy and didnt really notice anything one way or another, other then the sheer beauty of the resort. We checked in late Saturday night and I was floored. The lobby smelled and looked amazing. I almost couldnt contain my excitement that THIS is how I was spending a week at work. Turns out they really need to address a few things. YOU FEEL LIKE A HOSTAGE: RENT A CAR! They charge you rediculous amounts of money to take a cab anywhere off the resort. I was tempted to walk to the nearest grocery, but the driveway is like 4 miles long. I would have felt a little better about the whole thing if I had control over where I could go. Plus, they charge by the person to go anywhere ($80 each way per person to old san juan), which sucks. I actually spent $120 for a 10 min trip to the rainforest (which was cool), but again overpriced. THE FOOD IS MEH: There is not a whole lot to choose from and it is very overpriced. I do not mind spending $30-$50 on an entre, but the food was only so/so. The pool bar is your best bet for the price, but it is only so/so. I have been to Puerto Rico a couple of times and the food is one of the true highlights the island has to offer. I was really dissipointed I did not get to show my girlfriend how good Puerto Rican food really is. Again, if it wasnt so crazy expensive to get a cab out of there, I could have taken her to many better places to eat. I actually played a few hands of blackjack for the free sandwich (hot ham and cheese) which unfortunately was just as good as anything else I had. My girlfriend did get the seabass one night and liked it. KIDS ARE EVERYWHERE: Be prepared... INCONSISTENT SERVICE: Sometimes it was good, sometimes not. We once ordered our food and never saw are waiter ever again. We got our food from the sushi chef and our check from the manager...no lie. Expect to wait a good 15 min for your check wherever you go. The maid service was strange. At times they were overbearing and could not comprehend that I left a DND sign on my door all day. I was working and by myself, I really didnt need any pillow fluffing. But a 2 maids and a large man visited my room in the span of two hours to see if i wanted service. By the time the weekend hit, I came back to my room at 4pm and nothing was done. Very strange indeed. THERE IS NO BEACH: Just know that and accept it. Overall, I did not have a bad time. I spent one full day at the pool and it was lovely. The pool is spectacular. Its big and the has tile lounges that sit half in the pool. My pina colada was delicious and my sunburn was worth it. The senery is to be marveled at, I was really blown away by the beauty of the place. Unfortunately, I felt they were getting me comming and going. I dont mind spending money for good food and good times, buit you know that feeling when you feel as if your being ripped off a little and there is no doubt I felt that way. (You know its bad when you are pocketing food from the breakfast buffett for lunch! lol) If the resort was all-inclusive (i have seen here that it used to be) it would be really nice, but Puerto Rico has too much to offer to be held hostage on a resort with mediocre food. Please Grand Melia, You are so close...fix the problems please. PA

Reviews.Title: “Not the best”
Reviews.Author: newtod
Reviews.Content: I went with a friend as a last getaway before I got married (a more chill 'bachelorette' weekend) and we debated between staying at the Gran Melia and the Ritz...big mistake choosing the Gran Melia. They started off acting like you were very special (we put down the extra $$ to get "royale service" - definitely not worth it) and took you on a tour of the grounds before your "butler" dropped you off at your room. We went to dinner at their italian restaurant because the sushi place was closed for the evening and there were about three other couples there and no outside dining. The next day we kept making reservations for the sushi place but each night we would show up and they would say that it was closed and would be open the next day - with all of the so called royal service we paid for, wouldn't someone contact your room and let you know that your dinner plans were cancelled? Also, we kept getting snubbed by the Royale service - no one was in communication with anyone else. We called three times to get these special pillows they offer for their guests and each time they said they were on their way but we never received them. I felt like i was staying at a poser luxury resort. They also give you the "royale service" that has appetizers and drinks from 6-9. the appetizers didn't come out until 6:30 and it was a plate of crackers with some sort of olive paste... not my idea of appetizers since you get that for free at the italian restaurant. Also, the crowd was less than exciting - one night we were at dinner (the same place we had breakfast - depressing in and of itself) and a clown came over and started doing tricks for us - super awkward. the only good thing about this place was that with the royale service you get access to their "RS" private pool and extra towels (if you don't have RS you have to keep a card and get one very warn towel to use per day and you have to give it back or else they charge you $30) you can try to snag for free one of their palapas - however, they didn't even bring over water which i was surprised at as most luxury places in hot areas (carribbean, phoenix, california) have pitchers of cold water. All in all we'll be staying at the Ritz (same price) next time as I know they know how to treat customers.

Reviews.Title: “great food,great service,beautiful,beautiful atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: priscilla568
Reviews.Content: Puerto Rico,Gran Melia To Whom It May Concern: I cannot express the wonderful experience I shared with my daughter who treated me to this wonderful vacation here in this beautiful hotel. Food was wonderful ,Service excellent,Atomosphere beautiful. I will tell all of my experience to everyone and anyone who will listen. thanks again!!

Reviews.Title: “Thi Hotel Is Beautiful But...”
Reviews.Author: carlos_a_c
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous and Ttheir rooms are big and beautiful,even do they gave us the room late (2 hours late) and then wrong romm(it was already occupied??? ),the spa is really excellent the best thing in the hotel for me.they need more employees and with some sense of humanity, i'm not saying that all of them are like that because some of them gave and excellent service, the service of the carts is perfect but there were some employees will pass by you and would not ask where you where going... The hotel needs employees that entretain the guest whit some good shows.The problem is that like us we like to go to diffrent hotels here in the island and out and we compare them and it's not the same attention.I hope you can work this because is a really nice hotel and we will like to go back if we know its better. THANK YOU.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: leasing1
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a special trip with my mother. The people here are so friendly, helpful and respectful. The Spa is one of the best I have ever been to and the grounds are absolutley beautiful. Room service is great and with in 30 minutes. The Pool and pool bar was our favorite. This hotel is very close to the rain forest and there is a lot to do right at the hotel where you don't have to even leave the resort. If you are looking for an amazing relaxing get away, I would definitley recommend this resort. Just for the staff alone - they make you feel so welcomed and that you are truley on a vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: JTCBMN
Reviews.Content: The resort is gorgeous. We stayed on Memorial Day weekend. We booked 2 Garden View rooms. Room 0810 and 0811. It was my dad, my sister and I. Our maid service was great. Very nice lady. We had no problems in our room, no bed bugs, room was clean. Always a fresh supply of towels. They have balinese beds everywhere inside the hotel and outside by the pool. The nightlife was good. The people working at the resort were courteous and helpful. Our bellman Jose was a definate cutey and sweet. The beach itself is small and natural. it is part of an ecological system and they do not disturb it by raking the sand. They let nature take its course in the cleaning process. It is great for trekking and exploring the nature of it. It is very long to walk and discover the sealife and plants. The room service is quick and is actually cheaper than the restaurants itself. We ordered it twice, the Turkey Club Sandwich and Alfredo pasta was good. The pool water was warm like a bathtub, it was soothing . The spa was beautiful, we were running late for our treatements by ten minutes and they still took us. Our massages were excellent and use of the hydrotherapy was fantastic. They provided us with great service. Our Massueses were Tahiri and Reuben and both were excellent. Very professional. Tahiri was soft gentle and Rueben applied good pressure and worked out those knots. Overall, we had an excellent time. I wouldnt hesitate to come again.......pictures to come.......

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awesome!”
Reviews.Author: EnchantedVacations1
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and stayed at the Gran Melia from May 6-11th, 2008. My husband and I, and my son and his wife were celebrating my 60th birthday. We were very impressed with the astonishing beauty of the resort, the service, the rooms, the gorgeous pool areas, etc. Admittedly, the food and drink prices were very high, but we still found that the quality was very good. We rented a car and would suggest this as a great alternative to find more affordable restaurants for those interested in saving money. Since I was celebrating my birthday, Gran Melia made a genuine attempt to make this a special occasion and indeed it was. I have read several negative reviews on the Gran Melia, but other than the cost, as a travel agent, I would not hesitate to recommend the Gran Melia to my clients. In fact we plan on going back to Gran Melia at the end of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MJRTZ
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia Hotel is absolutely beautiful. We visited El Yunque tropical rainforest and bathed in the waterfall. It was excellent. The hotel in itself is well manicured and the staff very friendly. The rooms were very nice and spacious, although the tub in the bathroom was a bit below standard. There were also some minor details that were not completely cleaned; very good overall. The pool is magnificent. The beach is pretty much unusable. We went to Luquillo beach 10 minutes away and had a great time. The food in the hotel is EXPENSIVE and just average. Rent a car and right on the main road there are many local and american restaurant chains. You will save about $700 during the week with 3 people dining. The casino is small and not really great. It's just there. The beds are comfortable and the area very SAFE. It was very relaxing. I will recommend this as the best hotel in Puerto Rico based on the five that I have stayed in prior trips.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip - better than expected”
Reviews.Author: CaribbeanVacationn
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the hotel. Much better than expected after reading some negative reviews before I booked. Resort was not busy at all and we felt as if we were on our own private island. Accommodation was clean, very comfortable and upscale, and much better quaility than my recent trip to the DR. Sol Melia does a good job with the ambiance and general chic decoration of all public areas and rooms. Hotel is no longer all inclusive, BUT, we had the breakfast buffet and never eat lunch. Food was excellent in the restaurants. There is a walk from some of the further villa units, but there are golf carts that will whizz you around. We booked online and were given a promo code to use that took $200 off the value of the vacation. Some type of sale. They say it has never been cheaper to go to Puerto Rico and this 4 star hotel. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Time, but...T”
Reviews.Author: ATLBeauty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Gran Melia May 2nd - 6th. A friend and I went to enjoy a relaxing few days for his birthday. First, I must say that everyone must view each person's comments as relative. As it is relative to how many other places and experiences you can compare this to. Also, you CANNOT compare some place else to your own home comfort, especially when you are visiting another culture or country. Each culture and country are very diffrent especially when it comes to food. I would only agree with one thing and that is that service should be at high standards no matter where you go. Remember, your ATTUTUDE can predict what type of service you receive. We did not have a problem with service. All if this to say, The Gran Melia was a nice resort, however, it is a little distant from some things you may want to do, (so rent a car - cheaper from the airport). The rooms were a little musty, however I always take scented candles everywhere I travel as you just never know and I have had a smokers room. The people were very nice. As with any place, you can have a "hit or miss" with service, but we did not experience and "bad service". Now, I will agree with one thing, the food was pretty bad. However , we rented a car and was able to get out and about , which we enjoyed a lot. We did enjoy the habachi restaurant, but we knew what to expect there. No it was not sauce on everything, but if you are looking for healthy eating this is not the place. Try this type of restaurant in your home town to see if this is something you like. I cannot say that this place was anymore expensive than any other resort /place I have visited, St. Lucia, Grand Cayman, Bahamas, hell, Miami to name a few. Again, that is relative to what you feel is expensive. To some, $2.50 for a hamburger is expensive; yes it is if you are only are use to eating on the dollar menu. Yes, it was not a beach resort, however some places in Hawaii is the same way. Lastly, we left our I-pod there. I called and they had it and sent it to me. They made an effort to get it to me quickly. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: Merchants08
Reviews.Content: Perhaps the most disappointing vacation our family has ever taken- The inefficiency, incredibly poor service, mold in the room, faulty equipment and failure to respond to these problems made this experience extremely disheartening- Add in the healty cost of the staying at the resort and the anxiety and disappointment becomes almost Biblical in its scope- Would not return to this property if the trip were free-!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jen82898
Reviews.Content: I just got back from the Gran Melia in Puerto Rico and let me tell you it was a horrible experience. Yes the grounds are beautiful but it all ends there. The bungalows are infested with ants that bite. The rooms are dirty, dusty, moldy and stink of mildew. I went 3 days without any housekeeping, thank god there was a maid's closet right outside my room so I was able to take clean towels. I called 18 times and still no housekeeping, for 3 days! The service is despicable. To top it all off they have bedbugs. I am covered in welts on my arms and legs. They offerred me some ointment and to have housekeeping change my sheets. I dont think they understand that bedbugs live in the mattress. They were not at all helpful and truthfully could not care less. I travelled with a large group and there were about 30 people who also had bed bugs. I do not recomend this place to anyone, save your money and stay home.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: DSantana
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family for several days. I was wanting to show my kids what the eastern side of Puerto Rico looks like. So we went sight seeing the El Yunque forest and so many other places around. Also enjoyed the pool at the hotel. Overall, we liked the setting, atmosphere and ambience. People were very cordial but keep in mind you are staying in a hotel. Yes, food and everything else was way pricy, I echo the complians of other reviewers. One thing was very dissapointing to us. The day we left, my daughter forgot her gold bracelet in the security box. We inmediately called (less than 2 hours after) and notified the security office. They promised us promp expedient service and follow up call. I am still waiting for that courtesy call of them. They were helpless and did not make any effort to provide extra help. For that reason, I would NEVER stay there again. If I recommend it, I would make it clear that it is not safe to leave anything of value around. Perhaps your car at the parking lot is better, even though it is dark as a moonlees night. D. Santana

Reviews.Title: “great place, loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: cavanlo
Reviews.Content: I am presently staying at the gran melia, and I have to say that we all were hesitant about coming here with all of the bad reviews that we were reading on the web site, but I can honestly say 110 percent, that this place is BEAUTIFUL, we have had nothing but nice people wanting to help us and get us drinks, and take care of us. We arrived on Thursday April 17 at about 2 am and the pull out couch in our room did not have sheets or blankets for my kids to sleep on, we called the front desk and within 5 minutes there were two ladies at my door with the sheets and blankets, and I told them that I would fix the bed, and they said no that they would do it, then they went and got ice for us, all of this at now about 2:30 am. I can't say enough about Rafil at the wet pool bar, he is the absolute BEST!!!!! We were playing volleyball down the beach a ways, and he came down with a tray of ice water for all of us, we had about 8 kids with us, and nobody told him to do this, he took it upon himself to do this. Manuel is another one that is great in the Royal Service lounge , he will get you whatever you want whenever. The only thing that I could agree with regards to some of what other people wrote was the restaurant service, we went to cafe solei and it took about 1 hour to get our salads, and the whole process took about 2 and half hours, and we had 9 kids with us. But you can eat up to 6 pm at the pool bar and that was great, you just tell Rafil what you want and he brings it right over to you, and your lounge chair. We are traveling with a group of 18 people and we all feel the same exact way. We all give it two thumbs up and like I said earlier we all can't say enough about Rafil at the pool and Manuel at the royal service lounge. Don't believe what other people are writing, it is them not this place, and we are from New York, we know good service.

Reviews.Title: “looks aren't everything”
Reviews.Author: mommy67massachusetts
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the resort the main building was beautiful, the pool was beautiful. When we got to our room, the floors were dusty, and the shower curtain had mold inside. The service just killed the whole beauty of the resort. Housekeeping could show up anywhere from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. and never replaced the towels, face cloths or hand towels consistantly (2 one day 4 another....), same with the toiletries. By the pool all employees would be standing around in the wet bar waiting for us to go order drinks from them rather than them coming to us for our business. As a matter of fact, my daughter did go to order a burger one day from the bar and they told her to come back in 15 minutes to get it! When I questioned the manager about it he was quite embarrassed. I don't know if this resort is all inclusive any more, if it is for some, we were not, and the staff needs to realize that they don't have everyone's money beforehand. There's still lots of money that can be made if they make an effort to treat their guests right.

Reviews.Title: “valet parking service stole property”
Reviews.Author: lucernoPuertoRico
Reviews.Content: left my car during the check in rush 2 days later there was property missing The windows and doors were intact so who ever did this used my own key!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever for families or couples”
Reviews.Author: read_the_reviews_1st
Reviews.Content: wow! This resort was absolutely amazing with no complaints at all. We read all of the reviews before coming and the hotel addressed everything we asked about: Difficult to get to - we asked and the hotel gave us a free shuttle Expensive dinners - hotel arranged free transporation to local restaurants that were a little more family friendly like Richies! Rocky beach - our kids loved the beach to collect rocks and shells and the hotel showed us how easy to get to Loquillo beach or a neighboring hotel beach Activities - while many got cancelled our five little children loved the dancing, yoga and other fun activities all day long This place was amazing in every way and I have stayed all over. I can't comment on the cost as I used points for this. we would like to go back every year for the rest of our lives!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Getaway”
Reviews.Author: cdd64
Reviews.Content: I'm just really shocked of all the bad reviews and pettiness I've read prior to and after our visit to Gran Melia. Granted, there were some issues, but not major enough to complain about. We are people who realize nothing in life is ever perfect. We were not looking for the mistakes or mishaps during our stay as it seemed many who read these reviews and traveled there did. My husband and I travel quite a bit and have stayed in some wonderful places and we consider Gran Melia one of them. The resort is beautiful and very relaxing. We did not have a problem with the food. We ate both at the resort restaurants and outside of the resort. Yes, prices overall at Gran Melia were quite expensive, but I agree with the other reviewer that it's due to the importing of items. You have to pay for convenience. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Particularly Miguel from the concierge desk. He was very consistent in making sure our visit was comfortable. I do recommend that you rent a car because it's a great convenience to be able to explore towns and local restaurants outside of the resort. Miguel had recommended Pasion Por El Fogon in Fajardo (www.pasionporelfogon.net). It was excellent! In fact, we ate there 2 nights in a row. He also recommended Richies's in Rio Grande. Can't see how the one reviewer talked badly about it because it has a great view, menu and Ritchie was nothing but friendly and accommodating. Gina from the Avis desk was also a wonderful person and very helpful. My husband had mentioned it was my birthday and we were going to drive into Old San Juan for dinner. We talked about finding some good paella and she recommended Rosa de Triana, a place that she frequented often in Old San Juan. It's a great casual local restaurant which also has a Flamingo show. When we arrived, Gina was there dining and had arranged for the Flamingo dancers to sing happy birthday to me. Very special and sweet of her to do that for me. Gina was right, the paella was excellent. As far as the pool being too cold. Well, I don't know about you, but while I'm sun bathing in the hot tropical sun, I want a cool refreshing pool to step into, not a warm pool. The activity and towel center staff were also very accommodating. As far as the distance of the rooms and everything else in the resortâ€¦.we didn't mind the walking. There were carts to use but we found the walking a plus after having such wonderful and filling meals. Good advice as far as signing up as a Sol Melia member (which is free). It's gets you a 2 for 1 breakfast, as well as a discount off your restaurant tab. The drive into and out of the resort didn't bother us. Yes, there is construction near the resort itself, but that didn't take away from the beauty. We didn't use the Royal Service package and felt we really didn't need to. Our room had a partial ocean view and sat behind the Royal Service Pool, which was just fine. Very spacious and clean room. We never encountered any bugs, bites or attitudes and had a very pleasant stay. So, rest assure that you will enjoy yourself at this resort, unless, of course, you are one of those people who look for problems.

Reviews.Title: “Work in progress”
Reviews.Author: aek
Reviews.Content: I had visited with my spouse and 19 month old kid. Lobby decor - Wonderful. Commute from the main road to the resort - a little long. The road goes thorugh the golf club area, and ends in to the Gran Melia resort. Nice view and setup, but long distance from main road. Internal commute from the main lobby to the individual resort rooms - they have travel carts that take you back and forth between your rooms and the main parking/ lobby area, but wihout the carts and if you have to carry stuff to your rooms, it can be a pain. Restaurants- Internal 2/3 restaurants - A little expensive, but the food/ decor is ok. There is a inhouse casino, but I never went inside. Room - We did not have the ocean view room, but it was nice and quiet. Much bigger than the regular hotel room at a Days inn or likes. Bed was real comfy, and the room cleaning service was regular for the all 5 days that we stayed in the resort. Room service for food- Ok. No microwave in the room offered or available. There is a small refrigerator to keep maybe 5-6 beer bottles max. I personally thought the room service was a little expensive. 2X2 egg omelettes + tea = $45 Beach - The resort has beach access to the coco beach, but corals and rocks are in abundance, so cannot go in the beach. So the beach access is pretty much only for the view. There is one area with net to play volleball. I think the Marriott next door seems a better option, and that does have a beach access with a beach that you can actually go into. Nice pool area, actually one of the best pools that I have in terms of size, layout etc. No hot water area or heated pool, so the water can feel much colder. Kid area- there is a kiddie pool and a playing area for kids, with slide, swing and toyhouse. There is also a parrot in the main lobby, my 19 month old loved this exotic bird :) They do have an AVIS rental office, so you can pretty much get picked from the airport and then rent your car from the AVIS office in the resort itself. People in the resort - Very friendly and warm. Tourist desk - they have tours to the El Yunque forest and other tours. They do have 2-3 people for tour desk information. The desk opens at 8am. Reception was nice - They did let us checkout late, even though the rooms were getting booked heavily because of the Puerto Rico open going on. Overall - A Nice resort, but like someone mentioned - it is still a work in progress.

Reviews.Title: “great location - horrible restaurants”
Reviews.Author: barslip
Reviews.Content: This property is stunning. I can't say enough about the beach, which is so large that we rarely saw anyone else. There was a lot of seaweed, but the ocean life swimming through it was amazing. The staff was very friendly and helpful. My only problem was the dining. The breakfast and lunch buffets were fine, however the dinners were the worst I have ever experienced. The first night we were there we had to share a single menu among two couples, and waited an hour and a half for any food. There was no bread, and we had not eaten sense breakfast. When they brought our food it was not what we ordered, but we were afraid it would take the rest of the night to get our correct meals. The second night made the first seem like fine dining. I won't go into more details, but I was actually embarrassed for the staff, and we were not the only couple to walk out of the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasy Island”
Reviews.Author: Henri26
Reviews.Content: I can dispel the negative reviews posted on this website. The grounds were like being on Fantasy Island.We couldn't have asked for better service , prompt response to needs, outstanding food, beautiful rooms that were clean, bright and large. We took our family which includes six adults and three children ages 4, 7, & 16. There was something for everyone. The Royal Service Plan is a real deal. The inclusion of breakfast and Tea/Cocktails fom 6pm-9pm more than made up the difference for the higher priced rooms.The pools were awesome, and the beach was great for walking. Lots of coral hampers swimming unless wearing shoes,but quite a few braved it. One note about driving in San Juan.....Don't if you want to be somewhere quickly, and sane !

Reviews.Title: “Staff are rude and incapable.”
Reviews.Author: UKSurfandTravel
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is fantastic! Great location, beautiful scenery, I really could not ask for more, however the staff are rude and incapable of providing the most simple of services. Room service â€“ It seems impossible to have the correct order delivered within the hour. The room & bath room needed to be cleaned, one day we were left without any towels, and had to ask 3 times and wait 2.5 hours before we could have any delivered. This is a real shame as the location and hotel is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing in every way!”
Reviews.Author: ced2108
Reviews.Content: I can not believe what some people will complain about! This place was amazing! I booked my destination wedding there without ever visiting and I was extremely nervous about it once I read the reviews! I had 20 guests in 10 rooms and not one of them had a complaint! They kept telling me how friendly everyone was (grounds crew, service staff...every one) and I agree! The food at the pool bar as good and reasonably priced for a resort...obviously people think they are going to Mexico where everything will be dirt cheap but this is America people and the prices are comparable..except remember it is an island so things have to be imported so they are more expensive. Stick to what is native, RUM, FISH, Plantains...etc and you will be ok. Yes, there were a few minor things that happened, such as my brothers room kept blowing a fuse with the AC but it was quickly fixed. You can't expect perfection but you can hope that any issue is resolved quickly and efficiently, and it was. As for people complaining about musty odors or a lack of shopping should go to the mall for vacation. It is an island, surrounded by water and guess what?...things get humid and damp. Try to remember you're on vacation and have to be a little less stressed and go with the flow. Rent a car and explore the island if you don't want to stay at the resort the whole time...it's not like they advertise being in the shopping district..stay in San Juan if that is what you are looking for...or go 7 minutes down the road and the is an entire outlet center! A few notes on other things: BEACH: natural wild life preserve, excellent for shelling and we did some fun snorkeling too. We found starfish, a living Conch, and sea urchnants. Don't plan on riding the waves...because there are none....if you have water shoes bring them, but enjoy the beach none the less! FOOD: we ate in all 3 restaurants and l liked them all. The Habachi was very fun and delicious, Italian, very good and The dinner buffet (Cafe Solie)- ok for adults but excellent for kids. We had two 10 year olds, a 6 year old and a 4 year old and they all ate well that night! For breakfast I skipped the buffet and just grabbed something from the "Cart" (Kisok)...it was a small wagon with juices, muffins, breads and eggs and coffee. All we needed. Pool BAR/GRILL - any one who complains about this has issues. There are lots of people and they serve you as quickly as they possibly can. You can see the guy cooking behind the bar so it's not like they are being lazy...just busy. And the drinks are about $10 but any one who has been to a resort knows this is the going rate! And they were strong and good. I recommend sticking with the Mojitos!!!!!!!!!! (rum, fresh mint, club soda and sugar) If you can, go with the Royal Service (but if you have kids you will probably stick to the main pool and thus not enjoy all of the benefits) but the special lounge, pool and little extras were really nice. My guests didn't have the Royal Service and they all still LOVED the place and all said they would return. Over all this place was beautiful, the staff extremely friendly, Very helpful (if treated respectfully!) and we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “So-So”
Reviews.Author: RobInCleveland
Reviews.Content: I will basically be echoing most people. The grounds are indeed beautiful. But I will never stay there again. First night we were there, I was chasing a cockroach around in the bathroom (It sleeps with the fishes now). One reviewer said we need to realize that itâ€™s a premium property so we shouldn't have problems paying for the ridiculously expensive food. Problem with that theory is, that most of the food isnâ€™t "premium". The worst Hibachi food I've ever had. $24.00 a person for the breakfast buffet. Old cold Bacon, some kind of weird scrambled eggs that tasted like whole milk, and the omelet guy was in no way interested in making an omelet for anyone. The Asian fusion restaurant had very good food, but way overpriced. What we did: Rented a car on the 2nd day for around 45.00 a day from Avis, which has a desk there. We kept it four days. You DO NOT have to pay anything for parking if you rent the car there. We went to a local grocery store (Many tourists were in there from Gran Melia doing the same thing) and got some dry goods and a little cold food (lunchmeat and cheese). Gran Melia provides only a small cooler (NOT a refrigerator) which is kept cool by a block of ice because they do not want you bringing food on the property (Which is posted at every entrance) because they cant soak you if you donâ€™t eat in the restaurants. It was plenty cold enough for food and drinks. The four days we had the car, we ate local food from the stands on the beach (YUM!) or local restaurants. Stay away from Richies Restaurant. We gave up waiting for our dinner and left after being there for an hour and a half. The place was only 20-25% full, and Richie told me he didn't need tourists business anyway and could have cared less. We also went to public beaches because the beach at the Hotel is useless. The swimming pool was FREEZING. Very rarely were their adults in the pool, just kids cuz they can take the cold. There is no bar outside that you can sit and have a drink with the exception of the swim up bar in the cold water. Makes no sense! The dealers and moneychangers in the Casino were beyond non-caring. You were nothing more than a nuisance to them. On the first night there, we got in late after several delays (NEVER FLY DELTA). We were thirsty and hungry. Nothing is opened after 10 PM, so we had to order from room service. Tried to get a can of coke and water for me and my wife at 11:00 P.M. It took an hour for to get to the room. Some of the employees were nice, others weren't. Get used to waiting, because the staff is in no hurry to help you. Generally, you will not see a waiter after your order until the bill comes. Housekeeping paid no attention to cleaning the small patio. Sometimes the coffee cups werenâ€™t cleaned. If the property owners had any sense of basic economics, they would just lower prices on the food and people would eat there more and they would make more money. People obviously were not eating lunch and breakfast there much because only 1 restaurant and the WAY OVER PRICED food stand/bar by the pool were opened during the day. They also have a stand by the lobby opened until 2:30 that serves microwave breakfast sandwiches at around $5.00. The place isnâ€™t all that bad if you are willing to rent a car. If you werenâ€™t, I would not recommend this place at all!

Reviews.Title: “So much wasted potential...”
Reviews.Author: Thisisstupid01
Reviews.Content: The one and two-star reviews on this site are accurate - BELIEVE THEM! The resort itself is beautiful and the grounds are expansive and well-kept. Unfortunately, the food is extremely disappointing and service is inconsistent at best. The staff was frequently inattentive and service took much longer than necessary in nearly every aspect of our stay (restaurants, bars, room service, housekeeping, checkout, etc.) The beach was a small and uninviting strip of sand covered in stones and jagged pieces of broken coral, so we stuck to the pool area, where we were subjected to a cacophonous racket from two different sources. While the poolside grill blared salsa music over their PA system, the activity hut speakers alternated between Latin-flavored techno and a live singer performing a hackneyed karaoke routine for anyone who happened to be within a 100-foot radius. Imagine listening to one radio station in your left ear and another in your right and you'll get the idea. With the quality of the beach notwistanding, the Hotel Gran Melia could be an amazing resort destination if the management were overhauled and the staff were rigorously trained to focus more on the needs of its guests. Unfortunately, the current lack of customer service makes this place nothing more than a waste of money. We actually received better service and had a more relaxing time when we stayed at the Courtyard by Marriot directly across from the airport last year - for about 25% of the price.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST hotel in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: HateGrandMelia
Reviews.Content: First got in before checkin (3:00) and told the room was not ready (understandable) told our room was next to another couple who also traveled with us (we each have 2 kids) and had an ocean front view (all was on our confirmation). We went back to the desk at around 2:30 told not ready they are still cleaning up the adjoining rooms. Went back at 3:00 told to wait 10 more minutes for the adjoining rooms to be ready. Went back 15 minutes later told the rooms would not be ready for at least 2 more hours. They did not offer us hospitality suites. Also, told the rooms were not adjoining and not ocean front. They did nothing for us and made us feel like an outsider (if you know what I mean). The so-called manager at the desk basically made us feel like you are here and there is nothing else you can do so deal with it. Well we did and went somewhere else and the staff bent over backwards to help us. I would recommend staying at a hotel that actually has a beach and a staff that wants to help people who pay a lot of money to be relaxed not annoyed.

Reviews.Title: “We'd return to the Gran Melia anytime!”
Reviews.Author: martaharii
Reviews.Content: We are members of the Sol Melia vacation club, so this is the 3rd hotel we've stayed at of the chain. The hotel was recently purchased by Melia. If you are looking for an all-inclusive resort where you can just plop yourself down for an entire week and be entertained and have plenty of places to eat, this isn't the place. That said, if you want a beautiful place to stay that is close to many attractions, such as Luquillo beach, El Yunque, San Juan, etc. and have a rental car, you will enjoy your stay here. Restaurants: The website advertises 6 restaurants, but only 3 are currently operating, and they actually only have 2 open at a time, on a rotating basis. The food was great, but as others have said, service was slow (Toto, we're not in DC anymore!). Since we were four adults who enjoyed each others company, this was not a problem. The food was indeed pricey, but this is what we expect at any resort. Room service is actually cheaper than the restaurants. We skipped the expensive but nothing special breakfast buffet and found a few places just off-site on Route 3 that were local, laid-back, and fun (ala the Point at What You Want menu). The hotel staff can point you to these breakfast spots. Beach: Lovely for sunning and walking, but not recommended for those looking for waves and to run and play in the water. Pool: Gorgeous, huge, not heated, almost empty. We loved it. Rooms: We had 4 adults in 2 rooms and had absolutely no complaints about cleanliness, our beds, none at all. Lovely views of the garden from our balconies. Other facilities: There is construction along the road on the way in to the hotel in preparation for the PGA Puerto Rico Tour that starts March 17. The construction was not visable or audible from our rooms, the pool or the hotel. I would imagine that the place will be stunning when they are done since there is less than a month to go. Staff: Concierge and staff were always helpful and friendly, the front desk staff of course all speak English, and the other staff appreciated it when we attempted to speak Spanish. The concierge has menus for the restaurants, but the menu for the Italian restaurant was not up to date. they also had pre-printed directions to all the local sites. Most of these were great, but we got lost following their directions to Ponce! This, however, is pretty much par for the course in Puerto Rico. As for BUGS: we didn't get a single bug bite, but there are no-see-ums and mosquitos pretty much everywhere in the Carribean. We do however, have a SECRET: About a week prior to any Carribean vacation, we start popping garlic pills twice a day. Even if they are swarming around us, they aren't remotely interested in drinking GARLIC blood. Added benefit: We have never had a problem with vampires either! WEATHER: The resort is close to El Yunque, so there are often clouds for about an hour each day (see attached picture) - if there is wind (usually the case) these will blow off for a lovely sunny day. To sum it up: As members, we hope that the Melia ownership will bring this hotel up to a true 5-star level. The facility is beautiful, but it lacks some of the polish of a 5-star.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected”
Reviews.Author: w/thekids
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised when I got to the Gran Melia. I had read some of the reviews and was expecting the worst. Since we got a great deal I figured we would give it a try. The hotel is beautifully decorated and very romantic at night with all of the candles. (though a bit dark) Our room was big, clean. It was cleaned daily. The pool was a bit cold but I found that in other hotels in PR. The only problem with this hotel is the service in the restaurants. They are SLOW!!!! Waiting an hour for lunch is ridiculous when you have hungry kids to feed. The place is pricey but as is expected. The breakfast at Cafe Soleil was bad but dinner there was very good. Their crab cakes are delicious. The people at conceirge were extremely pleasant and really go out of their way to help. We rented a car so getting around was not a problem. Richie's is a nearby restaurant that they suggest which is just as slow as the hotel in their service. Food was o.k. Would I go back? yes if I got a good price. The grounds are big but nothing out of the ordinary. You do not have to wait for a cart. Walk your on vacation and the weather is great.

Reviews.Title: “Both good and bad...”
Reviews.Author: intrepidious
Reviews.Content: The property is very pretty, even though the road to get to it is long and full of construction work. I have seen a number of reviews here complaining about the expensive food - I think everyone should realize that this is a premium property, and that prices are not cheap. $22 for the breakfast buffet, and $38 for the Italian dinner buffet. Lunch is OK with about $20 a head at the poolside cafe. If you don't want to pay so much for food, rent a car at the airport and drive in, so you can go off property to eat. But mind you, it is $20 a day for the valet and $15 for self-park. One huge complaint - the waiter in the Italian buffet altered the bill to give himself a $35 tip when I had clearly marked only $15 - I pointed this out when I was checking out, and the reception desk tried to brush it off. After I insisted, they spent 30 minutes of my time looking for the signed bill from the restaurant. Of course they couldn't find the bill because the cheatin' waiter didn't dare to send it to the reception. He was clearly hoping I wouldn't notice the extra tip in the overall bill. The idea that I would tip $35 at a buffet is ridiculous, and eventually they refunded me the difference. So watch those bills closely. I suggest you write the tip in words on the receipt underneath the numbers, so they can't rip you off. Really left a bad taste as we were leaving, but otherwise the stay was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Melia -- Overrated and Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: ross6585
Reviews.Content: As an avid traveler, I can not recommend this property or see that it has any redeaming qualities. To begin with, the service was slower then (in all areas of the hotel) any hotel at which I have ever stayed. Lunch by the pool, typically took about an hour to complete. In my book, to wait 45 minutes for a hamburger and fries is unacceptable. While we are on the food, the breakfast buffet was horrible, lunches were ok, and the dinners were somewhat above average, but very expensive for a hotel that at best is a two star property. Half of the amenities and dining facilities were closed and I couldnt get a straight answer as to why (my guess is that with few people at the hotel, they were saving on the cost of staffing). The rooms were reasonably well appointed, but the downside were the pillows and linens were terrible and I spent sometime killing spiders in my room. Finally, dont even think of going to the casino -- its a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, and tasty food, a little expensive”
Reviews.Author: A_very_old_student
Reviews.Content: My girl friend & I spent ave. 500 $ per day, then we had a very wonderful holiday there! The food is so tasty and the swiming pool is stunning pretty! The concierge was very helpful! On the last day, we had a trouble on the next hotel, the concierge came to help us without being asked! But I will suggest you call your taxi or rent a car. They sometimes offer very expensive taxi service. Overall, I would like to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: BostonBostonTravel
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to have a vacation, and I would recomend it to anyone. The rooms are beautiful, the staff is very attentive and professional, and the weather is perfect!
