Reviews.Title: “Nice Get Away”
Reviews.Author: mi48301
Reviews.Content: I would say that just about every reviewer has this right. It all depends on why you are going here. You would probably hate this place if you are looking for night life and high energy. You would think it was pretty bad if you just wanted a beach to swim in. But if you are looking for a beautiful or romantic place to relax, you may have found a gem. I took my fiance for a long weekend, and it was a lovely experience. THE GOOD: We had an ocean front suite with the jacuzzi tub. The main area of the hotel is very beautiful, lots of marble, candles lit every night, open air, fountains everywhere. The royal service pool was perfectly quiet, we had an amazing bed looking out at the pool and the ocean just beyond. We enjoyed the fact that the pool workers weren't coming over every 15 minutes asking for another drink order. When we wanted something it was a short walk or an armwave. We ate at the Asian restaurant and watched the cook on the grille in front of us. Fun to watch, fun to meet people, and the food was just fine. Cafe Soliel had a great breakfast buffet that would tide you over until dinner if you ate around 11:00. The grounds are nice, above average but not like a Ritz or Four Seasons. The service was acceptable, nothing special but certainly not to the point of complaining. When we wanted to go off site for a local dinner, our butler, Marcos, recommended TACO RICO, which is just east of the resort road on 3, past the shell station about 2 blocks. You will probably pass it the first time, but it is worth the trip! We were the only non-locals and the owner is the only one who speaks english. They do not serve alcohol, but if you want a beer or wine, the owner will go to the bar down the street and get it for you. The food is awesome...let the owner set you up with appetizers and your meal! You won't regret it! The BAD and UGLY: While the "beach" is very picturesque, everything you have read on previous posts is true. It looks great! But what is pictured is like a hard clay with lots of rocks and coral that they groom in the morning so it looks a little like sand. Gorgeously landscaped, with chairs and hammocks but not very friendly to bare feet. There is a line of rocks that separates this clay beach from the "sand" beach. The sand is very coarse and is more like broken shells than sand. If you have water shoes or plastic flip flops, this is a nice beach to walk, and you can go pretty far. We were with people who saw an octopus, an eel, and a manta ray in the water from walking on the beach. I think you could have some fun and see some fish snorkelling here as long as you don't need the water to be really deep and sandy, but unfortunately the one day we tried, the water was too cloudy. The only other complaint is that the road into the resort is long and with a lot of construction. It detracts from the beauty of the resort to see all the dirt and mud and the lack of landscaping. Overall we had a super relaxing experience. Went to the rain forest and walked to see mina falls and tall tree trail. Saw Luquillo beach where people were surfing on giagantic waves, and spend a lot of time reading books and enjoying the sounds of the surf at the resort. And enjoyed some sunsets over the tree line to the west. Finding the information about the $250.00 food credit on the puerto rico forum pages made the food taste even better, since most of it was free! :)

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Price”
Reviews.Author: pforgebobby
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for five days in November, 2007. We were part of a conference booking, so that may have made our experience above that of the non-conference guest. The room was well below standards for the price. It was clean. The sheets didn't fit the bed and ended a foot above the bottom of the bed. The bath tub drain wouldn't seal -- a wash cloth helped there. The rooms are in separate buildings and are pretty far removed from the front desk. They have golf cart type vehicles that circle the sidewalks. They run on an irregular basis. We rode one to the room and walked the rest of the time. The hotel was probably less than 50% occupancy while we were there. The pool always had sufficient chairs/towels. The beach is very small. The part of it adjoining the pool is not wider than ten feet and has rough shells/rocks. The part of the beach down toward the more expensive rooms is wider and more sandy. There was plenty of room there in November. We had the beach to ourselves (the whole area) for most of one afternoon. BUGS! Thankfully none in the room. But the conference had a cocktail party on the grassy area between the beach and pool one evening and no-see-ums ate exposed skin. Take insect repellant with you! The store on property ran out and it was only available at the front desk at $10 a can. Don't expose too much skin -- that will help, too. The bugs were there during the day but not nearly as bad. The food IS expensive. We rate it 6 out of 10 overall. There was major golf course construction going on during our stay and the earth moving equipment ran all day long in sight of our room. They were trying to get ready for a major golf event. The pool gets an 8 out of 10. It was dirty near the swim-up bar -- an area that seems to attract debri. We would never stay there again. The bug bites were the biggest reason. My wife was sick for a week after our return.

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe this place is still in business”
Reviews.Author: jonnydallas
Reviews.Content: First the positives. This is one of the most beautiful resorts I have ever been too. Now the rest. All food here carries a rediculous high price. Be prepared to spend $1000s a week for a family of four just on food. If you rent a car you could go into town and eat but you can never bring anything back without being stopped by security to check you bag or package. There are signs that state no outside food or drink. If you have been to an all inclusive resort in Mexico be prepared for disappointment unless you have unlimited funds. I remember a beer was $6 and soda $4. If any of the restaurants are open which usually they are not be prepared to spend about $50 per person for dinner without drinks. Lunch and breakfast are the biggest problem though. I have never spend $30 on lunch before just for a sandwich and drink. Scan you bill on check out as we were finding the staff was writing an extra 1 in front of the tip amount we were writing so tips ended up being in the teens for a single beer. Finally since there were so few people staying there in August I assume they are hurting for more business. You would think they would attempt to attract more repeat business but with the prices they charge that is not going to happen.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: mouskateer
Reviews.Content: While the service is still a bit of an issue since they changed from all inclusive, the resort itself if beautiful. The pool is awesome, the royal service rooms are huge and the place in general is very clean. The whole beach thing did not bother us. I actually like the fact that it is a nature preserve. We tried to see the mantees but were not lucky in our search. Once they get the service issue resolved, this place will be fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “A cruel $7000.00 joke!”
Reviews.Author: Traveller99_8
Reviews.Content: I brought my 21 year old daughter for a week of relaxing, good food and sun, so she could recharge her batteries before returning to her final semester in college. We arrived late on Thursday evening. By Sunday, I had hotel management on the phone to negotiate compensation for the lousy meals we were served since our arrival. I did, in the end, receive compensation for all meals except for the ones we ate at Nami (Asian "bistro"), which were average, but NOT NEARLY AS AWFUL as those from Cafe Soleil or Tempo. The word "chef" needs to be used with great care! The resort shouldn't call these people chefs. It is very misleading! If I sound obsessed about the food, it is because we had to endure 21 meals there. The Royal Service plan is a joke. One morning, I came in to the Royal Service lounge to find a young family grazing over the buffet of breakfast foods, eating while food dropped from the dad's mouth into the tray of food which was to be consumed by other guests. The cheeses were slimey and much of the cold food suffered time and temperature abuses galore! We were afraid to eat some of this. Without giving the details of each day, I will say this: Never go to this resort. You will be extremely disappointed with the service, food, and inconsistencies! The final slap in the face was the bill. Our week was consumed with stressing over what we would be able to eat. OH! And don't ask for the wine list. We did, and after many minutes of waiting, the waitress came back and said that they didn't have 75% of the wines listed. She was reluctant to to tell us this, but finally decided that I was not going to give up! The spa was also a joke. NOT CLEAN. The staff provided basic treatments, which were represented as much more than they really were. The skincare products were absolute crap. The special anti aging facial was $190.00 and was the most uncomfortable 80 minutes of my life, with a nervous gentleman administering the treatment, after not washing his very cold hands. Also, the spa hours are from 10 to 8, but try to book a treatment during the early morning or late afternoon and forget it. All the appointment times seemed to be between 11 and 3, which is prime pool time! We knew there would be no beach. The Royal Service Pool was nice. The only beer we had that was served COLD, was here. Leslie was the best pool guy in the bunch. Our butler, Manuel, was awesome too. But you just knew he couldn't right all of the wrongs at that place. So why complain to him? The Royal Service people (Veronica and Tamary) were helpful in negotiating our complaints with management. From the conversations we overheard at the pool and in the restaurants, many guests were flatly disgusted with what they had paid and the quality of what they received, if they received it at all! It was to the point where, each morning, we would say EXPECT NOTHING. Then, when something good happens, we will be happy! We took a taxi to a seafood restaurant on the last night just to have edible food. The taxi was $120.00 and the meal as much. If you are a vegetarian, you will be miserable here. We do eat fish, but that is it as far as animal products. Ask for veggies and rice, and be prepared to take a potent diuretic the next day, as the use of salt was extreme. Most of the staff was friendly, but they seriously lacked communication, just forgot things, and were generally inconsistent with respect to the rules. The Royal Service Pool was to be restricted to children, no matter what. Yet, every day, someone would have a child under 16 there. This is an example of what I mean by inconsistent. I could go on and on about this. Basically, if you don't have enough frustration and stress in your life, come to Gran Melia Puerto Rico. By the end of your stay, your life will be completely full of it. The resort itself was beautiful. I will give credit where it is due. Our room had a funky yeasty, moldy scent, too. If I were given a free week here, I would return. That is the only way I would ever come back.

Reviews.Title: “Huge New Year Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: fbusa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights in a Royal Suite room. We paid a supplement as we liked the concept of a separate 'adult only ' pool, newer room furnishings and separate business/cocktail 'lounge' area. In a large hotel we thought this would make the experience more for couples. We didn't use the pool as the staff did nothing about the children in the so-called adult pool (even though we mentioned it) and there were children in the lounge on the computers a lot of the time when the weather wasnt so good and they were bored. The New Year's Eve buffet was the worst we have had in a hotel - underwhelming and no desserts unless you paid extra - as posted on a sign on the counter only to be discovered when you had finished your entrees!! The atmosphere was like a bad cafeteria and no special decorations to make it feel like New Year's Eve. Actually all the hotel food was very poor overall- the new Asian has the best flavours but the service is terrible - . One night we ate off- site in desperation at a restaurant the concierge recommended called 'Bambu' - but be warned the food here is also poor and they operate a system of menus with different prices - we had one of each so obviously agreed to order from the lower priced-version! On the plus side the Royal Suite room is good with new mattress and is very comfortable - but the hotel need to sort out the other issues before they can justify the higher rate for this 'not-so-royal' experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYlaw54
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just a long weekend and i wish we would have booked it for longer. We went in November and the resort was very uncrowded- very relaxing. Although the beach was just ok, the pool was excellent and the resort grounds were beautiful. The food was excellent and the rooms were very nice. Even thought its about an hour ride, I would recommend taking the trip into Old San Juan- a town with great little shops and restaurants. Definitely a must.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RonDc
Reviews.Content: We had a really good time at the Gran Melia. The Rooms are nice and spacious. We ended up getting rooms beside each other and were able to open the doors in between. Obviously, that might only appeal to some people. Both rooms were large, had fridges and pull out soft-beds. Both rooms also had balconeys. The hotel is really spread out .. and is resort/bunglow style. This isn't a problem as there are golf cart chartering people from their rooms to the pool, reception, whereever. The pool is huge and beautiful. Has a lot of play areas and also a few secluded spots. The wet bar was our favourite spot. The main problem is that this hotel is really far from San Juan and really in the middle of nowhere. The only other problem is that the beach is almost non-existent. Beware of lizards in the grass, etc. But hey, isn't that just a part of being in Puerto Rico. Will return.

Reviews.Title: “lovely resort”
Reviews.Author: Travelinsoutherngirl
Reviews.Content: just got back from this resort, my sister and i went there for a last minute trip. we booked through my parents vacation club, but were not given special 'royal' treatment (and it's not necessary to pay extra for it if you don't have it, really not a big deal at all to have). the resort is lovely. very well kept, very pretty property. there is NO BEACH. but you have a perfect view of the ocean from the pool and can go down on the rocks and collect shells. we rented a car and did day trips and ate out except for one night we ate at the Asian bistro. it was fine. nothing to complain or rave about, but it was expensive. if you do have a car, buy your alcohol elsewhere and bring in. we learned that lesson by spending $6 on a beer the first day...we then went to the supermarket and bought a 6 pack for $4 and change and kept it on ice at the pool. everyone is nice, the rooms are beautiful....

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: SLIMFLAQUITA
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Gran Melia was excellent. It was by far the best experience I have had in my travels to Puerto Rico. This hotel is more like a 10 star resort, although it is rated at a 5 star. The decoration in the hotel were elaborate, yet exquisite. The service from beginning to end was exceptional. The only negative is that if you stay on the hotel side, you have to pay $15 per day for parking. Also, their casino is okay, but a lot smaller than others on the island. However, we enjoyed ourselves so much that we purchased a villa in the vacation club. It won't be ready until 2009, but we definitely plan to visit again well before then.

Reviews.Title: “Read the reviews before you book.”
Reviews.Author: 12TravelGuy
Reviews.Content: The other people here that have complained about the service and the food are right on the money. Bottom line, the service really stinks when it comes to food and drinks. The front desk and maid service staff was fine. The bartenders were rude, very slow and not interested in service of any kind. Absolutely terrible. We ate in all of the restuarants and some of them were really really bad, and the others were just plain bad. $125 for a dinner for two, and I could have gotten a better meal anywhere else in the world. It is a beautiful resort with nice grounds and an awesome pool. (forget trying to get a drink at the swim up bar though) There is no beach. If you do venture out into the ocean, it is completely covered in slimy sea weed. I cannot imagine that the management of this resort does not see what is going on at this property. It would be so easy to fix this place by firing the hospitality staff and the chefs and hiring some people who actually want a job. Save your money - go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “What a Joke... Terrible place”
Reviews.Author: ferret92
Reviews.Content: 1) The rooms: To start, when we had just arrived, we're informed by the front desk that there was no king or queen size bed rooms available for the category that we had chosen and paid for (although I had booked on your own website for a king size bed) and we were assigned to a room with 2 single beds and an very nasty mold smell. After begging for a change, the only option that I was given was to upgrade to a royal service room, spending extra 600 dollars for the room for the week. I had no other choice than take it. 2) The building: We were given a decent room. The inside of the room was clean and without a mold smell but the outside was a mess. The stairs and the corridors where dirty as I've never seen in any hotel in my life (not even two start road side motels). We had to co-live with dirty and smell and as a consequence, lots and lots of mosquitos. Be prepared because there are lots of them there... 3) Food: I chalenge whoever is reading this email to please go eat at one of the restaurants in the hotel. The food was TERRIBLE and fairly expensive for the quality (avg 60-70 bucks for a very bad food). They cold even mess up a simple french fries (cold and mushy). 4) Breakfast: Because we had to pay extra for the room, we had a Continental Breakfast for free at the RS lounge. Should be good thing if it wasnt for the fact that you had to be there very early otherwise you would risk not to have milk or bread. The only good part was the personal. We only found nice people there.

Reviews.Title: “totally hated the experience”
Reviews.Author: ceraware
Reviews.Content: boring, terrible food, bad guest service, dirty WE DO NOT RECOMEND IT AT ALL!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “rained everyday”
Reviews.Author: tershn
Reviews.Content: From the time we got there it rained. NO fault of them. Our luggage got lost. When the plane arrived the next day, they were not there to pick it up like they said they would. The rooms smelt musty and they didnot restock the fridge. The security was rude. The waitress and the waiter were rude and slow also. They somehow lost our reseverations for one of the restarants there. Truly a bad experience and would not reccomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Extreme relaxation”
Reviews.Author: hmgnj1
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I was really scared about going to this hotel after reading many of the reviews. It was my mother's 60th b-day so I wanted a relaxing place for a girls weekend get away. I have to say, that from the time we arrived the place was breathtaking. The girl at the front desk was extremely polite and answered all our questions ( i think her name was Isabel) The place is quite and very relaxing. The grounds are enchanting and during the evening the place looks magical. With that said it is not a place for someone who wants to experience alot of nightlife. I booked a spa day for my mother I and although I thought that the robes could have been nicer, it didn't take away from the great massage that we received. The dinner at Cafe Soleil was exquisite,we had a stuffed snapper with huge fried plaintains and I was still full the next day. The food was a bit on the expensive side but delicious!!!! Luckily I has become a member of the Sol Melia hotel chain( free) you show your membership number to the waiter and 2 people get to eat for the price of one, this only applies to breakfast, but a full buffett costs around 25.00 dollars for 2 people, in my opinion it was worth it. My mother and I loved the place. The staff was attentive and very friendly. If you want a place to relax and unwind this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: kimberlynyc120
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying that my fiancee and I are very laid back people, we don't complain about a lot, and although we enjoy 5 star service we arent picky travellers because we can have fun anywhere. That said, the Gran Melia was not a good experience for us. We just got engaged and this was a weekend away to celebrate that, we just went Saturday to Monday over the Columbus Day weekend. Upon arriving the hotel is so beautiful and the ground look so nice that you couldnt imagine taking any issue with the place but we experienced so many problems with the service that we couldnt ignore it any longer. Upon checking in there was only 1 person at the huge desk and we stood there for about 15 minuted while she took care of the people in front of us (who seemed to have had a problem.) Then we walked to our Bungalow which was touted as an ocean front suite but we couldnt even see what minimal beach there was from our room. The room was not very nice either. It was big, but it was decorated tastelessly, the beds were uncomfortable and the second night there was a pillow on the bed that had no pillow case on it and had dried blood spots. The first night we went to Nami, their on site HIbachi restaurant, it was very good and fun. Order a glass of sake and they fill it up to the top like it's a glass of wine! The next night we went to the Italian place, Tempo, but my fiancee is so picky when it comes to food and all of the "italian" dishes had some sort of a seafood twist to them so we left and ordered room service, this was the worst of it. The room service took 1 1/2 hours to get to our room, and when we called after 45 minutes to see what was taking so long they took our order again as if they didnt have it in the first place, I had already fallen asleep and then when it got to us it was the wrong order and we'd been charged for things we didnt even get! We also tried to make reservations both nights for the restaurants and couldnt get through to the restaurant or reservations either night. On the whole the managers seemed very helpful, the porters and the concierge but the other staff just honestly didnt seem to give much of a thought to the guests. A few times while trying to get towels for the pool we had to wait for the young girl to get off of her personal cell phone. I believe that this hotel used to be an all inclusive or still partially is and the staff still has the all inclusive mentality, that you've already paid for it so they dont have to do much more for you. The last issue I had was the "Royal Service" part of the hotel. It costs a lot more to get the "Royal Service" and you get a butler and there's a separate pool, etc. It just seems as if they flaunt it, you cant go to the pool which is much nicer, calmer and has a private bar (it's HELLISH trying to get anything from the WET pool bar and the foo dis not good.) It just seems like the people who pay for "Royal Service" dont get perks, they get a whole separate experience. It was very elitist to say the least. Anyway, like I said, Im not one to complain, all of my other trip advisor reviews have been positive but I really would stay away from this resort, it has a lot of work to do!

Reviews.Title: “do not read the reviews, go there”
Reviews.Author: MGR52
Reviews.Content: I went to Gran Melia Puerto Rico in my honeymoon. I have to say that I was very scare with the reviews I read before going there. I had a wonderful time, the service was excellent, everyone in the hotel was always ready to help or to give an advise about the places to visit in Puerto Rico. I do not want to write a long review but this is the highlights: 1. Service: Really good and ready to help at all times 2. Distance of the suite to the main area: I recommend to walk all the time as you can find a lot of samll animals like the "coci" especially during the night (very romantic). Also you are on holidays and why to rush!!!! 3. Food: Excellent but a bit pricy Go there and enjoy as it is an amazing place and close to many attractions like the rain forest (10mins by car), Luquillo beaches (5mins by car), snorkling, etc

Reviews.Title: “Not ready for Seasoned travelers”
Reviews.Author: Glowingly
Reviews.Content: The reason I took so long in sending this review is because i have been waiting for the General Manager(Armando Mojica) to call me...He hasn't. The problem with this resort is that they once were an ALL-INCLUSIVE resort, and their staff still has an "All-inclusive" mentality. This was one of the worst experiences i've ever had. I decided to join a few friends at the last minute and booked my ticket through Hotwire. I got to the hotel and they sad my "Ocean View" was not available and that I'd have to stay in a garden view. I told them that was unacceptable and the front-desk clerk actually told me to call Hotwire and get the difference from them. Of course i asked to see the front desk manager. She was nice and helpful and gave me my room number, but told me that my room was going to be 3 hours before it was available and suggested that i have lunch. We went to the only restuarant that was open...a buffet. We walked around the gounds and asked about the cabanas by the pool. We were informed that we couldn't rent the cabanas as they were first come, first serve and we should put books or towels on the cabanas by 6:30am every morning. Well jeesh louise, i don't know about you, but i dont go on vacataion to wake-up at 6:30am every morning to stake my claim on a pool-side cabana. I got back to the front desk to pick-up my key and gave the clerk my room number. She told me that my room was given to another guest and that i could pay to get upgraded. I asked for the front desk manager again and after another hour, she found me an ocean view. Long story short. the pool staff was on their cell phones, the pool towels were very thin, no ice buckets to keep drinks cold by the pool. And my ocean view....If i tipped-toed and stretched my neck real far, i could see the blue ocean in the distance. A few staff members were nice, but they are NOT ready for seasoned travelers.

Reviews.Title: “It was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: 1NCBuckeye
Reviews.Content: Everything at this resort was wonderful. The place is beautiful, one of my friends kept saying I feel like I'm in a dream. The staff was very attentive, especially David. He gave us ideas of places to visit and things to see in the area. The only problem was that the food service was slow. We did mention this to David as well as the people at the front desk. We were told that they are aware of the problem and are working to improve the situation. I recommend this resort as a wonderful place for a honeymoon or for a family vacation. There is so much to do that you don't have to leave the resort at all.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST option!!!!! You can do better, belive me!!”
Reviews.Author: joanhector23
Reviews.Content: I had been in several hotels in the island, (Westin, Hilton, Embassy),... but this is the worst one. The service is terrible, slow, impersonal, like they are doing you a favor...in ocassion you will feel the employess think you work for them...they don't use the proper language to address the guests,...the distance from the rooms to the main pool and common areas is considerable...The variety in food is limited. This hotel is hardly a 3 star, so check you options and keet this one out of them.

Reviews.Title: “Better Now!”
Reviews.Author: CLCB0911
Reviews.Content: Last july i stay at this hotel and i wrote a rewiew..that weekend the hotel was over booked...and the service was poor...no shuttles available to the rooms...so a gave a bad review.. This past labor day weekend i try again.... The front desk personel was very nice..the girl name Nicole gave us a very nice rooms..and was very nice and kind.. the hotel was full but no crowded and the service was much much better....Im so glad I spend this past weekend there..the hotel its very beautiful...im still dont like the beach ..we in PR have much better beaches so i dont really care for the beach. on general the service was better and now i can recomed it..

Reviews.Title: “Bad, very bad”
Reviews.Author: hmarina
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot (I have over 2 millon miles in AA) and this is easily the worst hotel of its class I ever stayed in. Food is good, but place is limited. You have to make reservations to the restaurants, but the reservation desk is always empty! You end up only with the option of room service which takes more than an hour to get to your room at prices you wont believe. The hotel is nice, but has no beach and you have to walk a lot under the sun to get places. I will never go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, but still adjusting”
Reviews.Author: zcooltraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are seasoned travelers to the Caribbean. Many visitors to the Grand Melia donâ€™t understand the economy of tourism, especially in poorer areas and have set too high expectations. In short, if you have a Wal-Mart budget â€“ stay home. Several reviewers were accurate with their assessments and I will echo their advice. The Melia just took over from the Paradisus this year, which was an all-inclusive family style resort. My impression was the employees are still adjusting to different hotel policy. Loungers and towels still had the old name on them. We had a great time because we did our homework, and you will too. Below is my advice for this resort. 1. Transport: Rent a car. For the whole trip. From the airport. We got 5 days with full insurance and prepaid gas for $235. Not hostage to shuttles, or schedules (blah), or the onsite Avi$$. Yes parking fees are charged, but so does every other hotel in PR. There are two lots inside the gate, right is closer, left is the remote lot. Nearby is El Yunque, Luquillo beach, Fajardo. 2. Royal Service: premium â€œclub styleâ€� service. Basically an upgrade in room, attention and treatment, running from $75 â€“100 more per night. You have your own lounge with complimentary horsâ€™ douerves all day, free Internet and a comp bar from 7-9 PM every night. Plus any room or activity issues you go through them, and not other departments. Use of the Royal service pool. Itâ€™s a better class of service. Highly suggest. 3. Meal Plans: The Melia needs to rethink their AP and MAP plans, way overpriced. We prepaid our breakfasts (at $20 pp over 4 days). The buffet style breakfasts were plentiful, with omeletâ€™s, waffles made to order. For dinner, slow service meant long waits at TEMPO. Decent food, I give it 3 stars out of 5. At the Palm, Puerto Rican Paella was excellent. Reservations are not taken, its FCFS. Kids will be everywhere. Not too many fine dining options near the hotel, we ate out one evening at the Rio Mar, about 5 mi down Route 3. 4. Food and Beverage: Pricey. Prices are as other reviewers stated. On Route 3 make a left out of the access road Â¼ mile on left is a strip mall with a BK, a KFC, a Subway and AMIGO â€“ their version of a Shop Rite.. Soda & beer at supermarket prices. A good way to keep the lunch and beverage costs down. 5. Rooms and grounds. Beautiful. Rooms look freshly painted. Gardens are full, lots of color. Main pool is enormous, with plenty of lounge chairs (could use more umbrellas). Beach: a disappointment. Rocky, red sand. Sea grass. Good for sailing, not for snorkeling. Calm. If you want surf â€“ go to Luquillo, about 10 miles away. There is a kids club, and there are games, bikes for the young ones. 6. Main building. Open air. Lots of chaise lounges & sofas. Gardens & fountains everywhere. Clean. Live music at the bar every night. Small casino, but some slots are broken, they donâ€™t take bills, or bar code vouchers. 7. Tipping. I am amazed at how cheap people get on vacation. A little goes a long way. We tipped, and got great attention. Yes the service is slower, but itâ€™s the Caribbean. Overall: a good hotel, that can be superb if they make some adjustments. Be patient, ask lots of questions, and tip a few bucks if someone goes out of their way for you. Youâ€™ll be amazed at how far a smile, and a â€œBuenos diasâ€� will get you.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Robacabra
Reviews.Content: I travel every week and stay in different hotels in the Caribbean, US and Central America. I have never experienced such bad service, and arrogance in my life. Don't purchase the all inclusive package!!! It's a ripoff! They request you make reservations in the restaurants but when you go to make reservations they say that the restaurants are full (Which when you go you find out that it is not true) The only alternative you have is to order room service (very very limited) and as you imagined, not covered by the all inclusive package. They really give you no alternative. On the other hand, the food is extremely expensive. Can you imagine paying for a Chicken sandwich US$20 plus tax, tips, fees? Also, with these prices, be careful with tips, they can rack up to be quite an amount. Also, it is impossible to be there in the summer time, there's no A/C in the lobby or bar area. You have to walk a long way to and from your room and last but not least...It has NO BEACH! In the Caribbean this is a must. Did I mention that it has NO BEACH!. Will not stay there ever even if offered to stay for free!

Reviews.Title: “They didn't advertise the possible bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Jazcutey
Reviews.Content: Well, from the website I was expecting to have a nice relaxing "girls weekend" with a friend of mine, however, this hotel did not live up to our expectations. From the time when we first arrived and until we left there were little experiences that added up to up to us both making the determination we would not come back, nor recommend this place to friends. Arriving from the airport the cab dropped us off at the wrong hotel, we were left at the golf resort, which is on the same grounds, but about a mile away from the Gran Melia. My friend and I knew our adventure had begun! Arriving at the Gran Melia the welcome was nice and the the hotel looked very inviting. Check in was good and our bags were brought to our rooms. We had a handicap accessible room, although neither of us is handicapped. We just assumed this was the only room they had with two double beds. The room was nice, however it was missing little things you would expect out of a four star hotel, a mini-bar, note pads and pens, a "do not disturb" sign, a guide book that discusses the hotel, the amenities, local attractions, etc. Not having these things did not dampen our experience, but I would expect a four star hotel to have these things at a minimum. The beach - well I always heard about the beautiful beaches of Puerto Rico, but the Gran Melia is not on one of those beaches. The path to the beach was filled with rocks, which in bare feet is somewhat of a challenge to walk and water and beach itself were also filled with rocks. You could not lay out on the beach with a beach chair because there was not enough space, not b/c there were tons of people, but because the beach was more like a small patch of grassy area. The water was beautiful once you got past the rocks and the non-beach area, but the Melia cannot take credit for that. Beach experience - Grade C Before laying on upper level of the beach (grassy area near pool) we asked the pool bar/restaurant for food and drinks. The wait staff did not seem eager to assist us. Several staff just stood around talking while we were standing at the bar and the waitress who finally assisted us seemed like she would have preferred to do something else with our time. We eventually got our food and drinks, which were okay, however, that was the only contact we had with the beach staff. One would expect (or at least we did!) that someone would come up and take out plates and cups, no one did, one would also expect that they would ask if we wanted anything else, no one did. We were on our own! If I am staying at a four star beach resort I would like someone to come and see about me, but we came to the conclusion that attention to customers was not their strong point. Another slightly annoying fact is that we couldn't pay for anything in cash, we had to charge eveyrthing to the room. Beach and Beach Service - Grade C Restaurants - well there really weren't any choices b/c only one restaurant was open! The restaurant was "fine dining" and the food was okay, but again for a four star place, why only one eating option??!! I would suspect that on a beach vacation most people would want to grab a burger or something non-fine dining, however, there was no type place to go to. Now we were told that there was room service, which there was, but since we did not have a book in our room with a menu we called to the front desk. What was give to us was a paper print out of the menu, again, not very four star like! The food took 45 - 60 minutes to arrive and when it arrived it was a bit cold, and the order was wrong! I definitely think there were some language barriers to ordering. Breakfast was okay at the buffet. Food and Restaurants - Grade C Transportation - now I mentioned above the cab from the airport dropped us off at the wrong location, which wasn't a huge problem b/c the shuttle from the Gran Melia came and picked us up. However, my friend and I wanted to leave the resort and go into town (15 minutes away from the hotel) and the cab ride cost us an arm and a leg! Considering it takes about 5 - 8 minutes to get off of the resort grounds, $30 for a 10 minute ride seems excessive! However, the ride into town was worth the meal we received at a restaurant called Sandy's. Great food and a great waitress! That meal was the best meal of the whole trip but the only meal eaten outside of the hotel. We had to hire the same cab to take us back that brought us to town, for some reason only certain cabs are allowed on the property - a round trip fare for a twenty minute ride $60. I think that is waaaaaay too much! Transportation - Grade C Guest Services - well, the people who drive around in the golf carts were attentive in asking me if I needed a ride anywhere, but short of that there was little to no customer attention. All of the staff had the same "don't bother me" attitude. When you asked for something they got it (or tried to) but other than that they seemd like they didn't care about your stay. Guest Services Grade - D I could go on and on about the averageness of this place or the lack of things a standard four star hotel should have but I will leave you with this. My first night in the hotel room I kept waking up thinking there was a mosquito in the room. I checked the bed, pulled the sheets off, looked at the mattress, but didn't find anything. But each night I felt the same way, but could never find anything. But each morning I woke up with more and more red marks on my arms and legs. These marks are not mosquito bites, and after some investigation they may be bed bugs. Psychologically I don't feel ilke leaving my house for people staring at the marks on my arms and legs! I should not be stressed out after vacation about whether I am bringing bed bugs into my house!!!! Thankfully my roommate didn't get any bite marks, but I did see a few other people at the hotel with the same bites on their arms and legs. Bed Bugs - Grade F After all I mention above this is not a place I would go back to or recommend to my friends. Overall Stay - D

Reviews.Title: “read reviews!”
Reviews.Author: PerlaElPaso_TX
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Gran Melia during our honeymoon stay in Puerto Rico. I could write forever about how dissatisfied we were, but everyone else has done it for us. We to, were fooled by the nice pictures. It is a beautiful place but the service was pitiful. Check- in was ridiculous, food and prices were also ridiculous. Bottled water for $3.33 is just crazy! Ham and cheese sandwich for $16.20, for a while I thought they had a different currency. All my husband and I have to say is that all the bad reviews are all true. Stay away from the Gran Melia. You will get terrible service and attitudes from people that do not want to work.

Reviews.Title: “Look Before You Book”
Reviews.Author: montymon113
Reviews.Content: The Gran Melia Puerto Rico Resort & Villas Picture yourself surrounded by beautiful palm trees and clean, comfortable rooms. A large pool with built in lounge chairs and tables to place the tropical drink you just got from the swim up bar. Shuttle cars leave regularly from the open-air lobby to transport you to and from your room. Four elegant, high-priced restaurants cater to your dining needs and a buffet breakfast stocks more food than you could possibly sample. Now imagine you want to leave the resort and experience the culture of Puerto Rico. You want to hike the waterfalls of El Yunque, the only rain forest within the U.S. National Forest system. You want to swim at Luquillo beach. Then you discover the customerâ€™s dilemma: the resort is so far off the beaten path and the prices to leave it so high that you canâ€™t afford to leave. However, with the prices incurred on the resort, you canâ€™t afford to stay either. You soon learn that everywhere you turn another guest has a horror story to share. They are commiserating in paradise, over delicious strawberry daiquiris, about slow customer service, long check in lines, false promises, and exorbitant costs. Since the Gran Melia used to be the Paradisus, an all-inclusive resort, the clientele was mixed when we were there. Adding to the tropical flair are the bali-beds, draped in canopies with soft cushions. A romantic dream that can be rented for $30.00 per day. You can frolic in the pool or on the beach on a $15.00 per day raft. Towels are free in exchange for your room number, but donâ€™t loose them or you will be charged, from what we heard the price per towel ranges from $75.00-$100.00. We chose to have breakfast included in our vacation package. A smart move considering it was the only meal of the day that was guaranteed us. The first three days they gave us a check and we had to take the time to explain we had the breakfast package. We ate a few dinners at the resort restaurants. Here are a few examples of the food options taken right from the menu: Romantico (a fine dining experience in elegant surroundings with excellent service) Salmon Alumando appetizer $13.00 Cordero a la Narranja $37.00 Nami (Hibachi-style dining with a Japanese flare) Teppanyaki Dinner Table $39.00 CafÃ© Soleil (considered a steak house) Seabass fillet $27.00 8 oz Rib eye $30.00 Side dish (e.g. baked potato) $7.00 Dessert $7.00 ($8.00 for the Key Lime pie) The other restaurant, an Italian option, wasnâ€™t open while we were there. Lunch at the pool-side bar will set you back $12.00 for a hamburger. Now imagine yourself there with children. Many people I spoke to with families rented a $65.00 mid-sized car from the on-site Avis dealer for $117 per day (thatâ€™s including tax, insurance, and other hidden fees) and headed to the grocery store down the street. We soon rented a car ourselves; a compact car for two days got us off the resort for $138.00. Itâ€™s a good thing my friend was comfortable with city driving, because a cab to San Juan was $80.00 each way, per person. We took the car to El Yunque and after paying $3.00 at the visitorâ€™s center we saw the beauty and spendor of the rain forest, a short, 10-15 minute drive from the resort. The same excursion from the Gran Melia, advertised as a Rainforest Hike to Waterfall Swim (3.5 hours) will run you $97.00 per person. Since getting around was a key frustration for us, I do have to mention that I asked about Sunday services. I noticed a Catholic church on Coco Beach Road, the road the resort is on. I inquired about Mass times and how to get there. Once I found out it was $20.00 each way, per person, I decided that God would understand if I missed mass this week. A side note about renting a car: There is also a $15.00 per day parking fee that you are not informed of. We learned, however, from one of the other hotel guests that the parking ticket can be validated in the Casino with minimal gambling. Short of the canned hotel information, I felt uninformed about how to enjoy my vacation. I felt as if the staff at the Gran Melia did not want me to leave the resort except by the means they provided. By the time I figured out how to have the vacation I wanted, my time was up. I wish the staff was forthcoming and told me to go enjoy a dinner in Old San Juan or to take the car to Fajardo for the experience of a life time. There was very little in the way of entertainment and thus, the nights were boring and rainy day proved long and uneventful. I may have been looking for the experience I had at the Divi in Aruba last year where dancing and shows were provided every night. Music in the lobby and one show with dancers (that we found by chance) did not do it for me. I can overlook the mistakes that happened to us: â€¢The hotel transfer was not communicated properly. Once we found where to go our luggage took one bus and we took another. We were even asked to get off of the first bus because it was a private group. â€¢Our room not being ready (even though we made the reservations well in advance and specifically requested two double beds). A hospitality room was offered to us where we changed and stayed by the pool. My friend asked for a complimentary drink at the lobby bar for our troubles, which was granted by the front desk, but not the bar tender. A manager was summoned. After a few hours we were placed in a room that was first offered us (unacceptable due to the travel party). We did not get in our proper room until 10:00 that night (check-in was at 3:00, our first room was promised to us by 5:00). â€¢Our luggage was sent from the hospitality room to the first incorrect room (the one that was describe during check in that we specified would not work for our party). Some clothes were lost in transit, but then later found and returned. My friend requested a complimentary dinner for our troubles which was granted by the front desk. No one in the restaurants had known about it. We did finally get it. â€¢A party at the resort (not for hotel guests, but sponsored by Budweiser) was not well thought out. We took our rental car into Old San Juan returning about 10:00 p.m. It took us 32 minutes from Old San Juan and 40 minutes waiting in a line of traffic to get into the Gran Melia. No accommodations were made for hotel guests. To add insult to injury when we got to the front of the line the â€œlot closedâ€� sign went up. We explained that we are hotel guests and were redirected to the Avis lot that was already filled with cars from the Budweiser party. We did not have the option of attending the Budweiser party. â€¢They tried to charge us for our breakfast included in the vacation package for the first few days. The Gran Melia traps you in an overpriced paradise on the wrong side of the island (if you are there to experience beautiful beaches. We did not see anyone swimming, nor did the beach water look inviting to us.) The staff will try to make you feel as if you are the most important entity to them, while they never follow through with promises. The right hand doesnâ€™t know what the left hand is doing is an extreme understatement. As far as I can see there are two choices at the Gran Melia; stay on the resort and pay for overpriced meals and excursions (but then you miss the real local flavor of Puerto Rico), or rent an overpriced car and get out and live the culture with the locals. Better yet, find a different resort until they work the bugs out.

Reviews.Title: “worst service of any carribean hotel”
Reviews.Author: hockeynutNY
Reviews.Content: i must say from the check- in to the check-out that this was the worst hotel when it comes to service and efficiency. my family and i have travelled extensively throughout the caribbean and this was by far the worst trip yet. beachfront hotel- it would be nice if there WAS a beach! 2 feet of rock and pebbles, and no actual path down to the beach- you actually have to jump down from boulders and be helped back up, and slimy seaweed- not my def. of a beach. this resort has 5 restaurants- on fri. and sat. there were 3 open-the japanese, steak and buffet resaturants, but on mon.- fri. only 1 -the buffet. we were told that they were renovating and changing the menus. however, when the 2 restaurants "re-opened" the following fri. everything was the same. what ever happened to the other 2 restaurants? we were told by numerous employees that the hotel recently laid off about half of its staff-explains the lack of service. have fun waiting for 45 mins. to get a cheeseburger at the pool grill. to top everything off, we waited over an hour and fifteen for a belllman to help with our luggage upon checking out, and we missed our original flight because of it. save yourself alot aggravation and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Service Ever Experience (Stay Away). Stay at Westin”
Reviews.Author: sagagolfer
Reviews.Content: The grounds of the resort was beautiful, but their so called beach is NOT A BEACH. It's a rocky shore where you can't really swin. The pool was beautiful. Outside of that here I will grade each area of SERVICE WHICH IS THE WORST OUR FAMILIES EVER EXPERIENCED. * Restaurants: Three weeks prior to departing to PR, I spoke to their ServiceXpress (Joanna) and was told that 3 restaurants will be opened during our stay. Well to our surprise, ONLY 1 RESTAURANT WAS OPEN FOR THE ENTIRE WEEK and the japanese (NAMI) is opened only on Fri & Sat. Now that is totally riduculous. You go on a vacation and expect to have a nice dining experience but you are stuck eating the same food. We had to rent a car to go out of the resort to eat after 2 days of the same food. We went to Old San Juan (Highly recommended) & El Conquistador (Highly recommended). DON'T STAY AT GRAN MELIA. * Service: The service experience from the restaurant to the pool side was THE WORST. Gran Melia just doesn't care of taking care of their guest. If we asked for a drink, it seemed that we were bothering them. After complaining about 10 times to various management and front desk, their only excuse was that people were laid off. Even the people working there all agreed that service has gone done after Gran Melia took over from Paradisus. The restaurant personnel are not trained properly on how to serve guests. People don't care to wait on guests. At least in Mexico, the service personnel are eager to help the resort guest. That is not true of this resort. * Quality of Food: We ate at both the Italian and Japanese and it was well below par. The japanese restaurant hibachi grill cook used a ton of soy and all you tasted was soy sauce. The breakbast buffet (almost $30/person) didn't have a variety. On a postive note, the rooms and the resort layout was beautiful but that doesn't help when your overall experience was horrible. I spoke to their management and they seemed not to care. SO PLEASE TAKE THIS RECOMMENDATION AND DON'T STAY AT GRAN MELIA PUERTO RICO. STAY EITHER AT EL CONQUISTADOR OR WESTIN RIO DEL MAR.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but........”
Reviews.Author: JAYAMA
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from a five night stay at the Gran Melia, P.R, this is one of the biggest, most beautiful resort I'v stayed in, it's comfortable, very relaxing, overall nice. But....... there is a lack of communication between the resort and the guests, upon check-in we were given a map of the grounds, told the locations of the five or six restaurants, but we were not told that only one restaraunt would be open for dinner during our stay, nobody was told so what happened was you had all of these people walking around looking for dining options only to find out that you did not have a choice, so now you have a resort full of people trying to get into one place. The rooms did not have a resort brochure in them, so one had to ask the staff or other guest about resort activities and entertainment, the resort channel offered no resort info at all, the resort spa channel reminded you everyday to call and make an appointment, but failed to inform you the day's and hours the spa is open, so needless to say when I woke up monday morning turned on the tv and said to myself, I'm going to the spa today, how disappointed i was to find out that they close on Monday. I'll have to say at this point I won't return to the Gran Melia anytime soon, or even recommend it at this time, not until they work out a few issuses, by the looks of the resort it's five stars all the way, but because of the issuses we had, I would say I would give it a high three or low four. Maybe in a few years it will be up to par.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Underserviced=Gran Melia Gran Flop”
Reviews.Author: MikeC500
Reviews.Content: The photos definitly sold me, the web site led me to believe its charm and being outside the city sold me. However, from the start I was checked into a damp musky room which I later switched. We ate at the resort the first night at their steak house ranging from $28-$45 dollars steak only. It was not that well prepared for the price, sides cost extra and the service was not that great. More over we felt as if we were suppose to tip very high...we didn't. So letting the first night go we decided to go outside the compound to experience the culture. We went to Old San Juan which rocked with service, taste and friendliness. We spent less for better tasting meals and drinks then at the resort. Note that if one rents a car from outside the resort its $10 dollars a day to park where you are staying. So after a great time we had bought some drinks and wanted to hang out at the resort only to be told we cannot bring in outside alchol or food. We later found out that you can bring in food, there is nothing in the pamphelet that states otherwise. As for drinks: the resort charges for 2 ounces of rail liquor 7-8 dollars. Which would be fine if the food was cheaper. Next breakfast, this was the worst part of our trip we said its our last day lets get up and eat the buffet. For 25 dollars a piece we ate food less then par for a Dennys. Further more I and my girlfriend got sick. Though we were told we would be compensated I have no proof yet that I have been. The eggs were not hot, the one cook just made omelettes and the fruit was all but ripe. lastly, after fighting to keep our moral up we checked out, I was not given a reciept, not given a zero balance when I asked for one and was hung up on when I called from the states to check on my bill. Please do your research and call. There are other hotels. Sincerely, Unsatisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: Juandi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. It has a nice ocean view and it has a beautiful decoration. But I must say that the service was Terrible. We made reservations to the restaurants and still had to stand in line for 1:30 minutes to get a table. Also the customer service was not the best. For example, we tried to get a lemonade, and for 3 days, they would bring us anything but a lemonade...one night we said to the waiter "sir, this is not lemonade" and he said "Fine, i'll bring you water then". Last, prices seemed a bit on the high end, and considering the service, it was not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort...terrible service”
Reviews.Author: chezare13
Reviews.Content: Based on the hotel website, we booked our stay, looking very forward to this leg of our vacation. The resort itself is beautiful, but from the time we attempted to check in until we checked out nearly every aspect of customer service was a let down. It started with a long cab ride from the port to the hotel ($90)..which is much cheaper than their shuttle from the airport at $30 per person. When we arrived at 2pm we were strearnly warned that "like I told those people before you, you're early and there's nothing I can do for you until the 3 pm check in time." That was our mistake and understandable, however, not being able to check in until 6pm was unforgivable. It included waiting in the check in line 3 times, each time in excess of 45 minutes. After the second time (and 430pm) I asked if there was a way I could avoid the line a 3rd time when we were told our rooms would be at least another 60-90 minutes, she said yes, just call the front desk...I did....no one answered. When the rooms were ready, two of them were incorrect and wouldn't be changed, single instead of doubles and one of the three rooms was not ocean view as requested. The rooms are exceptional in size and nicely decorated. However, two of the three rooms had ants, the night stands were sticky with spilled "something" from the previous occupants. The bathtub appeared unclean. The two with ocean view rooms, had incredible views. Since we weren't allowed to check in until 6pm and weren't given hotel information it was too late to make reservations at the on site restuarants, so we ended up making the best out of it with a $180 rooom service bill (nachos and $13 hot dogs). The resort is very isolated, so if you don't have a car you are at the resorts mercy. Expensive restuarants, a single small gift shop with $6 bags of pretzels, that they are more likely to be out of than have them in stock (while they are waiting for their deliveries that were suppose to arrive days before). The resort is very spread out which lends to its beauty, but if anyone in your party has difficulty walking long distances they will spend long periods of time waiting for golf carts to drive them to their destinations. One our rooms wasn't made up one day, yet they did remove the old towels, however, it took 3 calls and several hours to get fresh towels. The ice machines are not near the hotel rooms, rather they are in cabanas along the pathways and they didn't have ice. This is not what I would consider a "beach" resort. The "beach" is only a few feet across with little actual sand. A few feet out into the ocean, the ocean floor is covered with some slimy form of sea grass, and the beach is often "frothy". Again the resort itself is beautiful, but there are MANY customer service issues but most concerning is a lack of concern that these issues exist. I would not recommend this resort to friends and would definitely not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Melia needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: Caroline32669
Reviews.Content: The grounds were nice, but staff seems indifferent to providing good service. Our garden view room had a view of a sand lot and the staff refused to change the room. The air conditioning did not work and it took about 4 hours to fix it. we complained because the projected time to fix the AC was at 10PM and we had small children that would be sleeping by that time. The staff was indifferent so we called the manager and got it fixed earlier. We checked in around 5:30PM and could not get any pool towels because the activity center that gave them out closed at 6PM and we were dealing with the AC problem. The staff offered to give us more pool towel cards, but not towels! And last but not least, we expected tram service to help us get our luggage to the main gate, but they were nowhere available and we had to drag our luggage 1/4 mile (with small children) and we missed our plane. The beds were uncomfortable and I am still nursing a stiff neck. For the price, this hotel is a rip off. I can get better service at Motel 6 and the pillows will be softer.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but ....”
Reviews.Author: wilmor
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Great lagoon pool. Very clean and beatiful. 2. Very large room with balcony, small living room. 3. Beatiful landscape and gardens. 4. Beatiful lobby. 5. Some lizards in the area but not a problem. 6. Friendly staff. 7. Near to the El Yunque Rain Forest. Beatiful place, many waterfalls. Cons: 1. No ice. Only 4 ice station for the whole resort. I need to bought ice in a near store. 2. There is a rocky beach, no swimming beach. Near is a Luquillo beach and is exellent. 3. Food too expensive and not the best food. Best bet near the hotel is Pepes Restaurant in road # 3 in Rio Grande. Passion por el Fogon Restaurant in Luquillo, great sea food. Hacienda Carabali Restaurant in Rio Grande. Try a food call Mofongo is great. 4. Check-in: 2 hours in line. Very slow. Bottomline: I live in Puerto Rico and every summer I stay in different PR resorts. Hotel El conquistador is a better bet. They had private island with beatifull beach. Also a great pool. I went to this hotel the last year and it was my best vacations in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Resort 1 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: jbett1234
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the good stuff. The resort is beautiful and we got a good price on the room. Now, the bad.... it took an hour to check in. The service is bad and VERY slow. Everything is a wait. A lot of employees standing around or talking on personal cell phones insted of helping guests. The room service menu is a joke and VERY expensive for what you get. For example, a yogurt with a sprinkle of granola on it is $15. We were over charged a couple of times too. A lemonade in the restaurant is $7!!! w/o booze too! Not including the $30 buffet that was not even on par with Sizzler. The resort is very isolated and you feel limited. There is no beach. There is 3 feet of sand, then you hit seaweed. There is a pool, but you wait almost an hour for a drink and its crowded. Not relaxing. The room was always missing something. The first day, no room serivice menu. The next day, no coffee in the room, etc. Bottom line, we were very dissapointed. The cost of the room was good but the price of food, drinks, spa, etc out weighed the savings. After talking to others at the resort, we found out we were not alone in our experience.

Reviews.Title: “Our nightmare in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: ALazo
Reviews.Content: Here are a few examples of our nightmare in Gran Melia Puerto Rico. If you need more examples, please simply scroll down. Also check this, the approximated score from the reviews are about 3.5; this is a good evaluation for a Four Diamond Hotel? I wasted 1 hour waiting to check-in, is ridiculous and you are very lucky if they have a room ready. My brotherâ€™s room at check-in was not ready at 3pm, and it took 4 hours to check him, also I requested a crib for my baby and after 8 hours they come out with an old Pack â€™n Play. YES, the resort is isolated and there is no place to eat... and YES, It is a 3 or 4 miles from the main road, so you are stuck there to eat the awful food they put at the buffet or â€œRestaurantsâ€� everyday. AND donâ€™t forget to make a reservation at your arrival or you will end ordering from the â€œRoom-disserviceâ€�. Most of the staff was not helpful or friendly at all, in some cases, very rude. The limited selection from the 3 out of the 6 expensive restaurants that were open wasn't very good or good at all, specially the Italianâ€™. Before you leave the front desk at your check-out, CHECK VERY CAREFULLY YOUR STATEMENT; they charged us $134 twice for a lunch. To finishâ€¦ ask for the beach at the Hotel and you will receive a JA JA JA as a response. Sorry guys but you are going to spend so many ours in the pool on a beautiful island in the Caribbean. Is this bizarre or what?

Reviews.Title: “It was awesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Giselle2315
Reviews.Content: Well... what can I say?? Don't listen to the bad reviews!! Yes, this resort needs to work on a few things.... for example. Check-In should not only be at 3:00pm, that causes a line almost to the door and you get a lot of unhappy guests. Security is ridiculous!! Almost everytime I walked towards my room they asked me my room number and if I was carrying anything they would ask me what was in the bag.... for that kind of money I don't want to be bothered with anything. Other than that everything was so enjoyable. I came back today and I really wish I would've booked it for longer. The walks from the rooms to the lobby are long but you're on vacation. Enjoy the scenery!! This hotel is beautiful from its lobby to the pool to the room... I am definetely going back next summer. I would recommend this hotel to anyone! P.S. The food and drinks are really expensive so to rent a car is a must!!! Giselle Boston, MA

Reviews.Title: “The worst in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: prhotels
Reviews.Content: I hated the gran melia, I thought this hotel was going to be the best in Puerto rico first there was internet in my room. there was lizard all over the place, and The pool was dirty. and the beach that was not a beach no one was on the beach that's how bad it was...

Reviews.Title: “Brutal!!!”
Reviews.Author: JSLPuertoRico
Reviews.Content: it's was beautiful!!! in contact with the nature. excelent for families and couples. the trolley serviceis the only that I don't like.they don't pause constantly. the trolleies are the best way to travel between your room and the lobby and other parts of the hotel.very clean.good security. good service.good hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Okay...but not really worth the money”
Reviews.Author: jiaahgirl
Reviews.Content: I went to Gran Melia with my parents and 16 year old niece; we had Full American Plan (included meals) and also the Royal Serviceâ€¦which I would recommend. The resort is beautiful and very relaxing but there were some major ups and downs. First off the place is in the middle of no where, so if you do not have a rental car you are stuck there. There are 4 restaurants but only 2 were open each nightâ€¦I am a vegetarian and they simply did not get it. I asked for vegetarian meals but had to resort to eating potatoes and lots of cheese. For the rest of my family who ate meat the meals became tiresomeâ€¦.not a lot of variety. And they were outrageously expensive. Service ranged from excellent to poor, some staff were extremely attentive others especially in the evening restaurants just stunk. The beachâ€¦there is none. You are really limited to the pool- which is very big but other than that nothing special. Rafts, floats etc are all extra even with the Royal service. As for activities, there are noneâ€¦my poor niece was bored out of her mind. They do have live music in the lounge each nigh but it is a comboâ€¦not for dancing. The disco was dead, they said there was a DJ but I never saw him. During the dayâ€¦no beach or pool activities to get teenagers or kid involved. The place was really beautiful but very remoteâ€¦I would not go back again. Also lots of bugsâ€¦.my mom got bit by an ant which got embedded in herâ€¦.had to have a doctor remove it. All of the people who were leaving on the shuttle with us had real horror storiesâ€¦we did not; I will only say it was a lot of money for a lot of nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay.”
Reviews.Author: treyboy
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Gran Melia a few days ago and I wouldn't return. A high percentage of the reviews were correct and I should have listened. THE CHECK-IN: Everytime I walked thru the lobby there was a line that was 10 people deep. Expect to spend an hour in line awaiting check-in. They move slow down there. ROYAL-SERVICE: We did upgrade to the Royal Service and ROYAL it is not. The breakfast buffet for Royal Service is from 7-9. Who gets up that early while on vacation? Other than the Royal Service pool (no kids allowed) there is really no need to upgrade to Royal Service. Shout out to Leslie at the pool. Oh, the Royal Service lounge has free drinks from 7-9, but the service is awful. The ladies at the reception desk in the lounge don't even look up from their computers to say hello and butlers don't really address you either. My suggestion -- only do ROYAL SERVICE if you get the beach front room. At this resort, it isn't worth the $$. THE ROOM: Nice, but just nice. There is a constant mildew smell, but it is close to the ocean and you're just going to have to get use to it. Other than that, the rooms were cleaned on time; ample towels; mattress is comfortable. I'd give the room a B-. ROOM SERVICE: If you want hot food -- don't order room service. They say 30-40 mins. to receive your food, but it's more like 1 hour. One day we waited 2 hrs. and then had to call the General Manager of the hotel to get someone to respond to taking the charge off of our rooms. They're explanation? "We don't have enough butlers to bring it over to your room". So it sat there until they found someone. In a nutshell -- awful service. FOOD: This place is expensive. $23.50 for breakfast buffet. $26.50 for lunch and for dinner you must make reservations. Since their ideas of service are different than the continental U.S. you just don't feel comfortable spending $50/per person for a lackluster dinner. In a nutshell -- pretty pools, nice grounds, bad service. Don't spend the money to stay out here. Stay closer into San Juan and eat with the locals.

Reviews.Title: “Some changes would make it great...”
Reviews.Author: Pedro727
Reviews.Content: My parents, who live in Puerto Rico, enjoy spending one weekend during the summer at one of the resorts throughout the island every year (and they like to treat their "kids" and their spouses). After 2 years staying at the El Conquistador, we decided to give the Gran Melia Puerto Rico a chance. My parents had stayed here before (when it was the All Inclusive Paradisus). However, my wife and I had not. Structurally, from the outside, the hotel doesn't look like much. However, once you enter the lobby area, it's a beautiful resort and nicely decorated. The pool area is the main focal point and it's also very nice. The rooms are some of the largest and nicest I've come across (with large bathrooms, large balconies, and marble throughout). Instead of one large high rise building, the hotel is spread out with one main building housing the lobby, casino, shops and restaurants, and several bungalows where all the rooms are located. These are spread out throughout the property. We were in bungalow 10, and even though it wasn't the farthest one from the main building, it was still a 1/4 mile walk.(distances are marked along the paths). Golf carts are constantly going by taking guests from building to building, but don't hold your breath for one. During the 3 days and 2 nights we were there, I was only able to ride them once. This hotel became a Melia resort a few months ago, and unfortunately, the transition seems to be hurting them some. I hope that they can iron the problems because it's the only way that it can truly be a 5 star resort. We encountered some problems, which could've ruined our vacation, however, we tried to make the most of it: - CHECK IN: Veeeery slow. We arrived at 6:00pm. Our reservation was nowhere to be found and they tried to convince us that we had only reserved one room and the hotel was full to capacity (I was not planning on spending my vacation sharing a room with my wife along with my parents!). I asked the lady to allow me to look up my email account where I had saved my confirmation which obviously stated two rooms. Magically, the second room appeared. FINALLY, one hour and 10 minutes after arriving at the hotel, we were on our way to our rooms. The golf carts were nowhere to be found, and after waiting some more, we decided to walk the 1/4 mile to our bungalow. Unfortunately the luggage didn't arrive until 9:00pm (3 hours after we first arrived)! We kept calling, and calling and they kept saying that they were very busy (and apparently the front desk team was also understaffed). - THE ROOM: As mentioned before, it was one of the nicest rooms I've ever had at any resort. The only negative was that there were three phones, but the only one that worked was the one in the bathroom by the toilet! - HOUSEKEEPING: We left our room at 7:00am and returned at 4:00pm only to find out that the room had not been cleaned. We called for clean towels which were delivered promptly. The maid knocked on our door around 5:00pm, but by then, we didn't care about having our bed made so we thanked her but told her not to worry. Once again, I believe their housekeeping team was also understaffed. - FOOD: The only place to eat something without getting raped with the prices is the grill by the pool. Even though $13.50 for a burger is insulting, we expected these prices since this was a resort. The breakfast buffet was $23 per person. Dinner at the Tepanyaki restaurant was $39 per person. Even though the food is obviously overpriced, it was very good. We did feel sorry about our waiter at the restaurant for dinner. Usually, at resorts, and in order to maintain the service that is expected, you would expect several people serving you at once. Our poor waiter was doing an excellent job, but he was all by himself, running like crazy between 2 tepanyaki tables with 10 people at each one, cleaning, bussing, taking orders, serving drinks, cleaning again, serving desserts, and still managed to keep a smile. Dinner was a 2 hour affair, mostly waiting and watching our waiter run from one table to another, but the food was very good. Once again, the problem here seemed to be with staffing. -ENTERTAINMENT: We went to the bar area after dinner, where they had live music, featuring traditional and fun music from the island. It was definitely very entertaining. After that, we went to the casino which is terribly small, but we aren't big gamblers so we didn't care much. After that, we returned to our room where we attempted to get a movie on pay per view, only to find out that we couldn't order because the hotel reservation system didn't show anybody checked in to our room (??). They promised to fix it, but after waiting for 20 minutes, we decided to give up on that idea. FACILITIES: Very nice, but some construction going on as part of the transition. It didn't bother us too much, but there was some jack-hammering during the day which didn't mix too well with the "serene" atmosphere of a beach resort. Overall this resort will be great once all of the problems mostly caused by understaffing and renovations are addressed, but the experience we had was somewhat dissapointing. The rate was great, but after staying there, we understood why this resort was mysteriously priced substantially lower than all the other resorts in the island....

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: sus430
Reviews.Content: myself, my husband, and my 2 teenage children spent our 4th of july vacation at the Gran Melia. We arrived approx 6:30pm. Once on the property we had to wait in line for 1 1/2 hours for check in. Apparently, the hotel was booked solid. When we finally arrived in our rooms, they were beautiful but the smell of mold was overpoweing. The smell was never taken care of during our stay. .It was 8:30 by the time we settled in our room. We went to the lobby to find a restaurant to eat in. To our suprise, there were only two restaurants open. One, we were told was closed for good. and another was under renovations. Since the hotel was full and reservations were needed, no reservations were left and our only option was room service. Room service took 2 hours and was $97 for 2 chef salads and 2 chicken cesaer salads. It seemed very over priced to us. Luckily, we were able to rent a car the following day and spend most of our vacation sightseeing. It was a hassle daily with parking as Avis assured us we would not be paying to park. Every day the hotel attempted to collect the $10. Be sure to check the bill at check out as there were many items listed on the bill that we did not authorize. The pool was beautifu, but the filter system was not on 3 days we were there and the water was cloudy with mold growing around the grout of the pool tiles. 2 days my kids room was not cleaned nor fresh towels given. There was not much for my 15 year old to do. not much nightlife. At check out when I asked for a corporate name and number and address, no one could give it to me. think twice before spending your vacation at this resort

Reviews.Title: “ROBBED.... STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE”
Reviews.Author: guy1028
Reviews.Content: i really should of read the reviews on tripadvisor before i booked this place.. number 1 this place is isolated no place to eat for lunch except the jail food they put at the buffet everyday in this resort.. night life you can forget about...on the third day of my stay my safe was open as well as my sliding door to my balcony (the balcony was on the ground floor) when i contacted the front desk they hung up the phone on me 3 times...we actually went to the front desk to tell them they did nothing about it just a im sorry..the next day we came in our room and again the safe was open and money missing..this place is disgusting...the only thing that i loved about this place was the lady that worked for avis rent a car she was so helpful we love her!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I would have read the reviews before booking this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: n_baker8
Reviews.Content: The resort was very beautiful and I had a great time but there were enough annoyances that I would not return. First, we had to wait in line for close to one hour just to check in! We were really upset by the time we actually approached the counter and had to deal with an unfriendly worker who not only failed to apologize but blamed the wait on the fact that it was a holiday weekend. This only made me more upset since it was clear that the long wait was a failure on the part of the resort to adequately staff the reception desk. I asked if we had to stand in this line to check out and was told that we would receive the bill under our door on the last day and there was no need to check out. There was no bill under our door and so again we had to wait in a long line. The other major annoyance was that you had to have your parking validated every time you wanted to leave the hotel which again required you to wait in line. Although, we were really happy that we had a car so that we could leave the resort for our meals and avoid the over priced restaurants that were part of the hotel. Oh the plus side, the pool was really beautiful and we enjoyed the kayaks and other amenities that the resort had to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Not very user friendly”
Reviews.Author: talb
Reviews.Content: I didn't much care for the place but after reading the other reviews it appears that it has improved from its low point in the spring. The room, for example, did not smell musty and was clean, although the shower took a long time to drain. However, it still has a ways to go, and some things can't be fixed.
