For example, unlike every other resort I've ever seen, the pool, nice as it is, isn't in the center of the resort but off to one end, a VERY long distance from the rooms. During our stay the shuttle ran fairly often until a convention came and most of the shuttles were reserved only for attendees. The beach is narrow and the water not very inviting, although one employee said that will be fixed when the hotel convinces the government that they should be allowed to blow up the reef! Renting a car is a must, considering the cost of the hotel shuttle and on site restaurants. I never saw a taxi at the property. Unfortunately, the hotel charges $10 a day to park, even though its in the middle of nowhere. And the system for paying couldn't be more annoying and inefficient. Every time you enter the property you must take a ticket. When you leave you have to have the ticket validated at the parking office at the opposite end of the hotel from the rooms. Apparently they never heard of a parking pass. The 15 unnecessary speed bumps on the way out to the main road manage to make the experience even more annoying. We never ate at the hotel, instead we bought pastries and drinks at the very good but inexpensive bakery on the main road and kept them in the small refrigerator in the room. We had lunch several times at the bakery near the Wyndham Rio Mar, which had great inexpensive sandwiches made to order. There were lots of restaurants within a few miles, probably better than those at the hotel and certainly much cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Gran Melia- A resort with noisy construction and no ocean swimming, small rocky b”
Reviews.Author: drawart
Reviews.Content: We were so disappointed with the Gran Melia and felt isolated and stuck there because it is so expensive to leave the property (I was told $70 to catch a cab to go eat somewhere else). First thing we did after calling service to remove the bloody towels left by prior occupant and clean one of our rooms was take a walk to see the beach and ocean. I was flabergasted to find NO ocean swimming, as I had gone on Sol Melia vacation site to see photos of this hotel- out of the 8 photos they show on the slide show, only 2 were actually taken on site. The others were stock photos. There was just no swimming in the ocean at all. The photos showed a beautiful smiling family on a white beach, and also a man relaxing in the waves of a blue ocean on a lounge chair. I really think Gran Melia should remove these photos as they certainly are misleading. AND in addition, there was non -stop construction at the pool/beach area- and I mean JACKHAMMERING! The first day there was hammering and large areas cordoned off with "caution" tape. Then 2 entire days of jackhammering which did not let up until sundown. The 4th day I was given a complimentary excursion by management for 2 of us (oh well, we were a party of 4 that had purchased TWO rooms!!!). The hammering was so loud 2 of us were delighted to get away from the Gran Melia for the day. We thought the food was very high priced and with no outdoor grill or less expensive food available, we were just stuck. There was no warning about the construction- They did have a great gym and thank goodness for that The pool is huge but no deep area to swim-We were very disappointed to fly 3000 miles only to find jackhammers and caution tape, no ocean swimming, very expensive food. Also, bring lots of games for your kids from home, it's a very long night with only a small game room, and you are totally isolated here.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it.....”
Reviews.Author: bbg720
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Melia Resort in May. I prepared myself for what to expect (as always!) by reading the reviews and complaints of previous guests. I have learned to take otherâ€™s opinions with a grain of salt since some people are just overly picky. Good lesson for everyone!! We had a few hiccups during our stay, but nothing major. The A/C wasnâ€™t working our first day. We called to report it, and within about 20 minutes, someone arrived to fix it. He made one minor adjustment and we didnâ€™t have another problem. The pool was great. The size of it was nice, and it allowed everyone to have their own space without feeling like you were invading someone elseâ€™s. The cabanas around the pool were a perfect touch. We had a place to put our stuff and relax, out of the sun. And the bar was good too :o) The beach wasnâ€™t the best, but I was FAR from disappointed. And yes, there is vegetation in the water. Not all over, but most of the beach area in front of the Gran Melia has some sort of seaweed close to the shore. BUT, I love to snorkel, and with the vegetation so close to the beach, there were LOTS of tropical fish extremely close to the shoreline that were perfect for my 8 year-old to see. She had never snorkeled before so that provided an excellent experience for her! We didnâ€™t have to worry about going out deep; it was convenient to do it in 2-3 feet of water! Someone complained that there werenâ€™t any waves. I saw that as a good thing as well. I got GREAT digital pictures of the tropical fish just by standing over the water and snapping pictures. They turned out better than my underwater camera! One really neat thing was the lizards that run around the resort. Being from Florida, we have lizards everywhere. But these suckers were HUGE. And quick I might add! We also had an iguana that perched itself on a rock in the small pond right outside our bungalow. It always caught our eye as we walked by. Besides the prices the resort charges for the meals (which again we didnâ€™t pay), the only other complaint I would have is the service in the restaurants. On one occasion we had to wait to find out who was responsible for our table (to sign the bill) so we could leave! The hostess got us drinks and we had no service during our entire meal. But again, since we werenâ€™t paying the bill, we werenâ€™t too upset :o) We rented a car for one day from the Avis counter at the resortâ€¦.that was a little frustrating. It took us about an hour and a half to finally get into the car. I returned the keys within the 24 hour period, but was still charged for two days when I got my credit card statement. Avis corrected the charge, but I wasnâ€™t happy about having to call to fix an error that should never have happened. Overall, I think the experience was good. We had been to Puerto Rico before, so we knew what to expect from the island. Many people think that just because itâ€™s a Caribbean island, itâ€™s going to be a tropical paradise. The island itself is quite poor and rundown. So the Gran Melia was a great escape for us. I definitely feel there are opportunities for improvement. But that goes for just about anywhere you go. Do your research, know what to expect, and make sure you plan ahead for what you want to do while away on vacation. I am a planner by occupation, so it kind of comes naturally. But it pays off every time!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous but pricey”
Reviews.Author: SCBride
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Gran Melia this past week for our honeymoon. I must say, when I got to the resort, I thought it was incredible. The pool was gorgeous, the view was breathtaking and the hotel was beautiful. I was a little disappointed that the outdoor grill wasnt open due to the resort making some changes. Unfortunately, I do have to agree with the other people who reviewed this resort. They definitely nickle and dime you to death here. We had the meal plan thank goodness which covered our breakfast and only covered either lunch or dinner so we mostly used it on our dinner. Our first day when we got here, we were about to starve and ate at Caribeno which was a buffet. We about had a heart attack when we got the bill which was $53 without the tip. There wasnt much else to do though bc the resort doesnt offer any type of sandwich shop which wouldve been nice for lunch instead of a huge buffet. After that, we felt like we had to eat all we could bc of the price so we endd up overeating all week!! My husband went and played golf at the Coco Beach golf club and it was very nice. The views were gorgeous with mountains on one side and beach on the other. The golf club is right down the road but the resort charged us $20 to drive us down there (Pretty ridiculous if you ask me) I went to the spa the same day for a massage. It was great but it was very pricey and I think very comparabe to the $80 massages I normally get where I live (ended up paying $135 as gratiuity is included). We decided to order room servie one night to save money and my husband wasnt feeling too good. All we ordered was 2 grilled chicken sandwiches (no drinks) and a slice of choclate cake....oh yes, they charged us $60!! I simply couldnt get over the food prices my whole trip down there. If anyone frm the resort is reading this, you MUST add an affordable lunch option!! I would say that the food options were my only complaint. The staff was very nice (esp Mark and David), the tour desk and concierge service. Our room was nice with a nice view (was a little far away from everything though). Overall, we had a great experience with this resort. If I give a low score, it's only bc of the lack of food options and the expensive food prices.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but has problems.”
Reviews.Author: claudster22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Melia PR from May 29-June 4, 2007 for our honeymoon. First off, the hotel is beautiful. The grounds are gorgeous, the pool is awesome and without a doubt the best thing about this hotel. The beach although not very swimable is very pretty as well. The lounge chairs everywhere are relaxing and the cabanas surrounding the pool area are great to lay down, relax and take a good nap. The room was spacious and beautiful as well. Very high celings with a very large marble bathroom. However................. there were many drawbacks. The food and drinks are extremely overpriced and too expensive to really be able to enjoy. We were on a budget, but even if we weren't still think prices are too high. We ate only at the Avocado once for breakfast. All the restaurants are buffet or a la carte. The breakfast at the Avocado although they had a great variety, was mediocre. We payed $48 just for my husband and I and it was not worth it! All the food was cold, the eggs rubbery, the bagels stale an dry. I even spotted a few flies flying around the cold cuts. Pretty gross! Needless to say at those prices we did not eat at the hotel again. The pool swim up bar closes at 6pm! Not much fun if you are on vacation. We could not enjoy the swim up bar either because they charged us $20 for a Long Island Iced Tea and a substitue for a Mojito (they ran out of mint and mix)! The drinks were practically non-alcoholic too. Very weak. Beers cost $8-9 dollars a piece! From then on we went to a loca supermarket, stocked up on beers and wine, bought a foam cooler and kept it in our room. They don't let you walk around with glass bottles or glasess though, so make sure you get some plastic cups too. The Mirador Grill one of the other restaurants by the pool was closed the whole time we were there. Apparently they will re-open again, but what a shame we could not even try that one out. It's an outdoor restaurant with views of the ocean. You are not allowed to eat outside at any of the other restaurants even though they have chairs and tables set up outside. The biggest issue with this hotel is the parking. What an incovenience and mess! Not only do you have to pay $15 a day to park your car, but they do not even have enough spots to accomodate all the people staying there. During the week not as bad, but on the weekends they have a lot of proms, graduation parties, weddings, etc. On two separate occassions we came back from the beaches outside and could not find parking anywhere. We had to valet park. It was an unorganized mess. The worst part was that later on that night when we tried to go out of the hotel for dinner, they could not find our car. They had lost the keys to our car and it took them an hour to find it! Needless to say we lost our dinner resrvations and by the time we got to the restaurant it was closed. They need a better parking system and more parking spaces. It seems they cater more to their weekend party people than their guests. Another thing, the hotel is located in an area that is far and isolated from the highway (Rt. 3). Just to get out of the hotel we had to drive 5 min. and go over 15 speed bumps (yes, I counted). What a hassle! It makes you not want to go anywhere, which is probably what they want. Aside from those problems, the service was pretty good. People and staff were nice and friendly. Jose at the front desk was very helpful and accomodating when we checked out. After telling him our problems he was kind enough to knock off some of the parking fees and a discount on our whole bill. This is a good place to stay only if you plan on being in the pool all day and spending all your money there and nowhere else. If you are the type of people who like to explore and experience being in another country, this is not for you. We ate at Amadeus in Old San Juan once, it was delicious. There are also 2 restaurants off of Route 3 East, one called El Meson next to a Suzuki dealership and one near entrance to Whyndham Rio Mar called Antojitos. Both were very good and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “The bad and the good”
Reviews.Author: jodaly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Gran Melia from June 1st to June 5th. We had read the many reviews so were a little nervous about what we were getting ourselves into. We went with a big group of family. We knew there had to be some catch because we got a great price for a "5" star resort. The hotel was about 35 minutes from the airport. It was not a bad ride at all. I will start with the bad.. We get to the hotel, pull up and just sit there with our car inthe front(being that we had gone to many other 5 stars inthe past we just assumed a valet person would come and open up the doors for us) which they didnt so we sat there. We then waited to check in for about an hour. Not only were there about 2 people behind the check in desk(with a big line) but they kept dissapearing leaving us to wonder if we would ever check in. When we finally checked in, the girl was not partically friendly. She didnt give us to much information when we asked. We finally got our room. We went to the pool(which I have to say is beautiful) I was hungry but apparently there was only 1 place to have lunch which was a 25 dollar buffet. No place for a burger or just a snack The room was far away from the pool but being that we are active people, we didnt mind walking and seeing the grounds( plus they do have shuttles, which I never saw before). When we got back, I went to take a shower and the shower was filthy. There was hair in it! We complained(which we never usually do) and we ended up getting upgraded to a nice suite. The suite was modern and clean. After that we went to Toscano and had a very so so buffet. We ended up talking to the head guy of the restaurants, who explained to us about the changes going on there and to be patient. He ended up picking up the tab for our troubles and giving us a wonderful dinner the next night for a birthday we were having in the family. So they were very accomodating. Long story short, the next few days ended up much better. This hotel is going through many changes from all inclusive to not all inclusive and the facilites are meant for all inclusive so some restuarants do not have bars, 2 out of 5 were closed due to renovations. A few things to know..Although all the buffets are expensive, You can have continental breakfast for half price at the buffet. We did not know this till the last day. We ended up having fruit, cereal, and all breads for 1/2 price. They dont tell you that though you have to ask. It is the same for lunch.Romanticos was a nice place to eat with good service. Toscano, the buffet was not worth the money. There are restaurants and delis outside the resort on the main road you just have to ask where. I believe in about 6 months this resort will be lovely and much better. The grounds are really beautiful and serene. We went to ElYunque(not a bad 20 Minute drive) and hiked for an hour and to Old San Juan, about an hour drive. Defintely rent a car!! and NOT from Dollar!! Its cheap but u get what you pay for. I would stay there again, but once it is all finished and completed. but I probably wont be able to afford it then!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay here!!! Terrrible Service”
Reviews.Author: RobD1966
Reviews.Content: 1. Just got our bill and they charged us $150 for a late check-out fee, although we were clearly out by 12 noon. We called the front desk for a golf cart at 11:30...No golf cart showed up, we waited for 30 minutes and finally decided to walk our 3 suitcases and 2 backpacks about the 1/2 mile to our car in 90 degree weather! Terrrible!!!!! 2. They $25 charged us for a room service we never ordered! 3. I Just called to give them a chance to fix things and again the service was the worst...Sorry sir the maids said you were still in the room at 2pm....We were half way to Isabella by then. 4. One out of the two Room Keys did not work after the first night...I called for them to send another key and no one every came...We had to leave the door latch open when we were not together....I explained that we left the latch to keep the door open when we left just in case the maids key was not workin,,,,but no unstanding what so ever.... 5. Service at Restraunts was horrible, we ordered a regular dinner and it felt like our server was a buffet server...She didn't care. I asked for bread before our dinner, and she said go ahead and get some at the buffet counter...We did not order a buffet....I ordered wine. It was one of the smallest glasses to put wine in... 6. The limited selection from the 3 out of the 6 expensive restaurants that were open wasn't very good. Either too salty, greasy, or cold when it should have been hot. A couple that had a small child went out of there way to complain to us about how there was no child meal, and they had to pay full price for a meal for there 5 year old... 7. In conclusion, I read some one elses review, and should have listened and not stayed here...They do nickle and dime you to death, the resort is 3 or 4 miles from the main road, so you are stuck there to eat, and when the service and food is bad...thats not good 8. The only upside, was the pool was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, very expensive to eat there”
Reviews.Author: teeWashington_Dc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for five nights during the Memorial Day holiday. The pools were gorgeous as well as the landscaping. It was set back from the main streets which for some I guess that can be a good thing. Very relaxing. What I did not expect was for the food at the hotel restaurants to be so expensive. We were literally in shock when we ate lunch at the buffet at Avocado and received the bill of $100 for three. We then decided to try breakfast thinking that would be alot better......$23 per person for breakfast at Avocado. The next night we went to Bamboo for dinner....I had a very small portion but the price was still steep. The staff was very polite, they made sure our rooms were in tip top shape everyday. The only problem we encountered was the expensive food. We finally decided to go grocery shopping but since our fridge was small, we couln't buy too many things that needed refrigeration. It still saved a great deal of money doing it that way though... So, overall the experience was nice, the hotel and grounds were beautiful, but the food was VERY expensive. If you are there for a week, eating all three meals, you will be paying around $1,000 if not more.

Reviews.Title: “Has potential but has many problems”
Reviews.Author: Countcost
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights for business and pleasure at resort. Here are the good parts. Nice pool, gardens and facility overall. Beach is long but in most places pretty thin. The resort seems to be on a point and it blocks most wave action near the beach which results in very still waters. Rooms were quite large and nice overall. The rooms are cabana style and pretty spread out on the facility. Expect to walk quite a bit. The hotel offers golf cart shuttle service for your bags and self but it can be spotty. Now for the bad. You are isolated. If you do not have a car, you are stuck with the hotel food service which is mediocre at best. It is pricey too boot. Check-in took me about 1/2 hour. Service is spotty and overall slow. (My room was always nicely made and cleaned each day however.) Forget about taking a cab to explore the area because they cannot promise you that you will get a cab to return (especially at night.) The hotel is about an hour away from Old San Juan. There are no nearby resturants. The rainforest is nearby however. There is a golf course (Coco Beach) nearby but expect to pay $10 shuttle service for a van to take you a 1/4 mile. The course is expensive which is typical for outsiders in PR and not well maintained. It has a pretty nice design but needs a lot of maintenance. Some bunkers had nice powdery sand, others had rock-filled dirt. Overall, there are better choices in San Juan area.

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled after one night”
Reviews.Author: Travelsquirrel
Reviews.Content: When we got to the hotel, we had a 0.5 mile trek from the parking lot to our villa. The security guard posted at the entrance ignored us (would have been nice to know that a shuttle service ran!) While the property is rather nice and the rooms were nice, it's so spread out that you have to take a shuttle to the pool, which just isn't very helpful if you need to go back to your room. The hotel does a good job at "extra" costs - 6 phone calls to San Juan (short calls to book another hotel) = $34.00; parking (nightly, in the middle of nowhere Puerto Rico) = 10.00. This place is not a vacation destination - it's good for conventions and that's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but not worth $500 per night”
Reviews.Author: milk41358
Reviews.Content: First of all -- this place was STUPID EXPENSIVE. I didn't have much choice though. I was a cheapo for our honeymoon, and I have been paying for it ever since. I was told by our travel agent that we were getting the Royal Service for no extra charge, which may or may not be true. And, I think if not, then not, our agent was only relaying what she saw on her screen. Anyway, we got a beach-front room even though we were told we were only getting a garden-view room. Maybe it was a mistake. Whatever. I didn't complain about it. It was a great room. Food -- Pretty good! I think almost everything there was good, but I was told by many that the sushi was lousy. We ate at every restaurant, and I had no complaints except that maybe the AC was a little intense at Toscano. I had filet mignon every night, except for the night I had a ribeye. Ahhhh. We were on the all-inclusive plan. (More about that later.) I cannot imagine what it would cost for a meal. I think the bills for our meals would have been around $150 for dinner alone each night (meal, appetizers, deserts, drinks and wine ). Trust me, if we had not been on all-inclusive, we wouldn't have gotten such extravagant meals. We are simple, humble folk. Remember, money really wasn't an issue. I would have spent most anything to provide my wife with a relaxing vacation. Trust me -- she deserved it. The Royal Service was DEFINITELY the way to go. I loved the Royal Service lounge. Anytime I wanted, I could pop in to use the computer or get a drink without having to wait at the bar. The computer was very nice, and I was able to take care of a little business at home while I was away. Snacks were also provided in the lounge. The Royal Service pool was nice, but small. SERVICE -- People like to talk about the "laid back" atmosphere of the Caribbean. Yeah, that's great except for when you're paying $500 per day for your room, and time really is money -- a lot of money. You will spend a lot of time (and money) waiting if you don't raise your voice. Some people call it rudeness. I call it ASSERTIVENESS, and sometimes your level of ASSERTIVENESS must rise to meet the hosts' LEVEL OF APATHY. If someone on the staff is being dismissive or slow to act, SPEAK UP. It's your money. (More about that later.) Remember, YOU DESERVE GOOD SERVICE. if you demand good service, you will get it. If you are o.k. with someone wasting your heard-earned money, then by all means, keep quiet. This is rated as a 5-Start Hotel, and you SHOULD EXPECT BETTER. The SPA: My wife loved it. She had a massage, and some of that other stuff. It was o.k. with me, but I don't really get into spas. I had a massage by a very pretty young lady, and I wasn't sure how to deal with that. I mean, if I'm enjoying it, am I being unfaithful? But, isn't the point of the massage to enjoy it? Every time, I started to relax, I thought "Oh, this feels too good." Then, I would think, hmmm, better not enjoy it too much, right? Oh, too much confusion. Too many questions. And, no booze at the spa. Apparently, drinking prior to getting into a hot tub is dangerous. The ROOM: Very nice -- just like the website photos, but the floor was marble and very slippery. The TV was great. I looked through the pay-per-views movies. There must have been 50 ADULT movies. Geez, how many dirty movies can one person watch in a week? It seemed like overkill. The bed was o.k. The AC was great. Bathroom was nice also. We had a no-so-private hot tub on our porch facing the ocean. It was o.k., but we learned one night that it's REAL easy to lock yourself out. Someone had to come and open the door for us. We also learned that the secondary lock was useless. (It's kinda like a door chain but steel bar instead of chain.) They have been bent open to disable them. The maintenance guy just unlocked the door came right in even though we had the lock on that is supposed to be opened only from the inside. Also, I liked the in-room safe. It opens with a code rather than a key. ROOM SERVICE: LOUSY, LOUSY, LOUSY even though we supposedly had Royal Service. And, when you check in, CARRY YOUR OWN BAGS TO YOUR ROOM. We waited HOURS to get our bags. I had to berate the front deck baggage man just to get our clothing. We wanted to get to the pool, but they were holding out luggage hostage. It was at this point that we started learning about that "laid back" attitude that we could come to loathe. We could have easily carried the luggage the five-minute walk to the room, but they insisted so we relented. We didn't make that same mistake when we checked out. POOL: Fantastic, just like in the website photos. BEACH: Not so great. There's a lot of muck and plants in to water, but another person told me that once you get past that the snorkeling wasn't so bad. EXCURSIONS: We went snorkeling with the on-site company. It was just o.k. The water was choppy and deep. It also took forever just to get there, and I was glad when it was over. We used a rental car to explore Old San Juan and the forts -- definitely worth seeing -- as well as El Yunque Rain Forest. El Yunque was o.k., but it looked pretty much like the mountains of NC, which I can see anytime. The only difference were the Coqui frogs. There's a hike they tell you to take to a waterfall -- not worth it, in my opinion unless you LOVE waterfalls and you plan to swim. And, AVOID THE CEMETERY AREA IN SAN JUAN. Just don't go there or to the tiny ocean-side neighborhood next to it. These are DANGEROUS areas. RENTAL CAR: After waiting in line for two hours, I learned that our RENTAL CAR WAS NOT AVAILABLE when we went to pick it up at the on-site HERTZ desk. Our reservation was apparently not a reservation. Instead, your reservation is merely the right to reserve a reservation. There was no car available for our first day, and nothing would change that. After much of my yelling, which regrettably made the HERTZ lady cry, we got a Pontiac Aztec at a very low rate. But, we only got it for one day. The next day we got a Cadillac. The Hertz lady was very nice, but she was constrained by the lack on a computer on-site. She said she didn't know what she would get each day. If you plan to rent, see the Hertz lady a day ahead to get everything sorted out. They most likely will NOT have what you reserved so be prepared to be disappointed. ALL-INCLUSIVE: Better than paying every time, and with the prices like the were -- $8 for a drink, $100 for dinner -- it worked better for us. I'll gladly pay extra to avoid extra hassles. Some people didn't get the all-inclusive plan. There was some kind of an electrician's convention, and one of the wives was begging for drinks at the bar. She didn't have an all-inclusive wrist band on. She claimed she couldn't get the bartender's attention, and wanted me to order for her. It was annoying. I knew what she was doing so I said, "I will order a drink and swim away. If it's not here when I get back, I'll just assume it got poured out." Luckily, the bartender never came back to me. He was too busy taking care of the people who were tipping. TIPPING: In spite of the all-inclusive talk, TIPPING STILL MATTERS. I found that I got much more attention when I gave the bartender a few dollars. We tipped one guy really well, and he spent the evening coming with new drinks for us and a couple we went snorkeling with. One was on fire. I also taught the bartender a new drink. MUCHO DRINKO. MUCHO HANGOVERO. SUMMARY: Pool - A Beach - C Food - A Service - C- (But F if you consider that this is rated a 5-star hotel.) Accommodations - B+ Rental Car - D Old San Juan / Forts - A It was 70/30, but the poor service brought everything else down. I will not return, and I can recommend it only with a warning to BE ASSERTIVE so that you will get what you paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money; This place has problems”
Reviews.Author: hockey16mark
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from May 16th - May 20th as part of a business trip that was won. This place is all inclusive but we hear that is going away. This place has some major problems. It could be so much better with a little work. Here's our story: We checked in and our room on the 1st floor was terribly musty. I read the previous reviews so I knew this may happen. Before we unpacked we called and they offered to Bomb the room with some spray that I knew would not work. They brought a service AC guy who played the acting part and acted surprise about the smell and said the AC was not working but I knew better. We told them to change our room and asked to move up to a 2nd floor room which was better I figured just like your basement often can have a musty smell. It was still musty but better. Still the keys did not work and they had to go back to get new keys. All of this before we even got started. I notice on the thermostats in the room it has a motion detector that the hotel can use to save energy by turning up or off the AC when no one is in the rooms to save money. That is why I am assuming the rooms are musty are that they don't run the AC enough as I asked our friends and their rooms were must y also. The next issue was the restaurants. Only a few were open. Romantico was under construction; another one by the ocean was closed so it was down to basically 1 or 2 places to eat. The problem is you are far away and stuck at the resort unless you rent a car or take a taxi. We ended up eating at the same place for 8-9 meals as thats all that was open. The service was spotty; you had to keep reminding them to bring you water or something they missed. The food was so so. I never saw any managers which is why I think this place is hurting. The staff is doing its best with what it has to work with. They do not have enough people to serve and no one is there managing them. If they had managers at each restaurant and at key places around the hotel it would be so much better. Avocado's was fair to good and so was Bamboo. The rest were not rated highly. They served steak one night and said they had no steak knives but the next night they would. Go figure ! Our bathtub was clogged and drained very slowly so you had to take showers in a pool of water. We asked our friends and some had the same issue. Our room lamp was broken and they had to tape it up. The porch had red ants that were biting. The checkout line during the rush time in the morning had only 1 person to check you out. I could go on. The drinks were all included but they measured 1 shot max for every drink so you never could get buzzed. I stuck with beer so I knew what I was getting. Good things included the grounds, landscaping, pool and pool bar and the bell hop and casino bar. The best was the pool.The service got better during the weekend when more people came to the hotel because they added service people. Good place if you just hang out by the pool. Other than that avoid avoid avoid. We were lucky that the company paid for everything or I would have been really steaming. The beach was unusable due to vegetation and/or coral. Our friends went golfing for $200+ and it was under construction with backhoes and construction equipment all over. They were able to get half their money back after waiting 20 minutes to meet with the golf pro. My take; if they added managers and tried to tackle the problems this place could be so very very good. It could be a great turnaround story. The layout is great and has alot of potential. This place could easily be a Ritz Carlton if they put service first. Instead they try to cut corners and be cheap in all the wrong places by turning off AC; reducing staff levels; and not putting the guests first since all the problems were reoccuring based on previous reviews and our friends who said the same things. With new owners now they have a chance to make it better. They need to get to work. Stay away for now and check reviews in a few months or a year.

Reviews.Title: “2.5 Stars on a Good Day”
Reviews.Author: 30WINKS
Reviews.Content: The stay was during the first week of May and had been booked when the resort was all inclusive. The staff was moody. The same food was served day after day after day. The rooms had bugs in them. The dirty linen was left outside the rooms all day long. I was charged for services that I did not use. When I tried to resolve the problems via phone, I was given the run around and sent to numerous voice mails. I have turned this merchant in to VISA and am disputing the charges. The grounds were poorly kept and the facility is in need of a lot of maintenance. There is no way that this should be considered a 5 star resort. I have had better experiences at Motel 6. I cannot recommend this resort to anybody, except to tell them to avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “No where close to a 5 star. Not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: DerrickWTampa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there from 4/23 - 4/26 and were pretty disappointed with the service that we received. From the time we got to our room until the time we left, it all went downhill. For being an advertised 4 diamond hotel we were amazed that the service was so sloppy and the rooms were in the condition that they were in. After check in we got to our room and the key didn't work. That was ok, because these things do happen, but when the securities key didn't work we should have known that it was going to be a problem. After waiting almost 30 minutes to get into our room it got worse. We entered our room and the smell of mildew was so over whelming that we could not stay in the room. The wall where the bathroom was located had water stains and the tile did as well. We called the front desk and told them that we will be going to dinner and passing by to have our rooms changed as per David. After dinner we did just that and we were assured that our bags would be brought to our new room. We spent time in the lobby and finally decided to go back to our newly assigned room after about 2 and a half hours to find that our luggage was not yet moved to our room. It was about midnight and we wanted to get ready for bed in hopes that the next day would be better. Not to mention that the new room also had the smell of mildew. We were very surprised that a hotel of that caliber would have rooms under these conditions. After working in the hotel industry myself in the past, it made me feel as though these rooms were maintenance rooms and the only time these rooms are usually used is when the hotel has been over booked. The service at the restaurants were also lacking. The food was great, but the service was very slow at the Avocado Grill. The Bamboo was wonderful, but our reservation was at 9:30 and we were not seated until 10:15. I think Romantico was the only restaurant in the resort that we had a great experience. Room service was horrid. We ordered room service and it took almost 2 hours to be received and the food was cold when received, not to mention the beverages were warm. Like I said, we were very disappointed and when we mentioned the issues we had, all we received in return was a mere "I'm sorry" and nothing was done to make sure that we were satisfied or taken care of for our inconveniences. In my opinion, this hotel is not a 4 diamond/5 stars. I wouldn't even give it 2 stars. Not worth the money. Extremely disappointed as it has such wonderful potential. And we were approached with the opportunity of purchasing a vacation club package, but if our experience was different our decision may have been different.

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend it”
Reviews.Author: cway
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Royal Service oceanfront room. Nice, spacious. Odd smell. Pretty view of natural beach. Pretty resort overall. Nice but small Royal Service pool. Pool butlers were inconsistent. Some remained at the bar and did not provide individual service. Beach unfit for swimming due to large volume of water vegetation. Restaurants: Romantico good food and service. Avocado okay. Asian-CONfusion awful, AVOID. Toscano embarassingly terrible, you honestly will not believe how bad it is; AVOID. Try Don Pepe's just west on Hwy 3. Very good Puerto Rican food. Friendly owner & staff. Royal Service lounge: clerks at desk were mediocre. Not too helpful. Tried to charge us for an extra night. Beware. This is not a 5 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific resort”
Reviews.Author: USAlawyer
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Paradisus - Puerto Rico for a week in mid April 2007, and had a wonderful time. The grounds are lovely - beautifully landscaped and well maintained. The rooms are spacious and nicely furnished. (The bathroom is large with marble floors and countertops, large mirror and terrific water pressure). The AC works well - actually a bit too strong for my taste - so the ceiling fan was fine. There was a musty odor when we first got to the room - which seems to emanate from the AC unit. As soon as we turned it off, and used the fan, the odor was eliminated. Negative comments about the staff should simply be disregarded. From the reservation desk, to the poolside bar to the activities center - all of the staff with whom we interacted were friendly and helpful. Everyone we encountered greeted us warmly and with a smile. As long as you are friendly and courteous, you will receive the same in return. The beach is not what most envision for the Caribbean - it is rocky with seaweed patches. But all you would need are aqua shoes and you are set to go. The water is warm and clear - actually warmer than the pool on some days! There are kayaks and boats to use or just a long stretch of coast to walk and find shells. During our trip, the Paradisus was still an all-inclusive. The choice of restaurants was fine. We had breakfast each day at Caribeno - a wonderful assortment (eggs, fresh omelettes, pancakes, bacon, oatmeal, fresh fruit, blintzes, muffins, bagels, juices, and Puerto Rican specialties etc.). It also has a lunch buffet that was great. We had lunch at Mirador grill since it was closest to the pool. The lunch there is average, but one could always find something to satisfy the appetite. The dinner choices (beyond Mirador Grill) were Romantico (adult only, so since we have a teenager and 8-year-old we did not try it); Bamboo (a Japanese hibatchi-style restaurant - very nice, tasty - John Carlo was our chef and was terrific); Avocado (typical steakhouse - make sure to have the shrimp at the buffet - they are large and delicious); Toscano (rather pedestrian Italian fare). All in all, the selections were numerous, the entrees were well presented, and the staff at each restaurant was attentive and pleasant. Keep in mind, this is not a resort know for gourmet food. However, there is something for everyone, and in general, the food was above average. A few tips - check-out is at noon. Be sure to check out at 8:30 to avoid the rush. You can then leave your bags in a locked room near the front entrance, enjoy the remainder of your stay at the pool and then shower and change in a fully-equipped salon next to where you leave your bags. Don't book trips to El Yunque rainforest or Old San Juan through the hotel. The costs are exhorbitant. Instead, rent a car from the Avis representative at the hotel (Gina was ours - she was great). We rented a car for a day ($70) and went to the rainforest (20 minutes away), Luquillo Beach (another 10 minutes away) and then drove back west to Old San Juan. If we had booked the tour through the hotel, this would have cost more than $500 for the 4 of us. We'd go back to Paradisus tomorrow. It was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Paradisus was Paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: bubbles3266
Reviews.Content: For a 5 star property, we give this one a TEN! Loved the food, drinks, pool, room,hospitality, beach and Casino. We had read that the beach was full of coral, and it was, but we were ready for it with shoes.. We kayaked and the water was so calm and clear. We could walk all the way either direction and see nothing but water, fish and trees. We have stayed at the Sol Melia chain in the past and loved it, but this one left us in awe! The cart service to the rooms is so nice and they are willing to wait if you need something in a hurry from the room. Top shelf drinks and fabulous food really topped the week for us. We are sad that they are changing from an all inclusive on May 1st, 2007. That is the way to go. Puerto Rico was great, safe and very beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: AKfrozen
Reviews.Content: Very nice facility and grounds. Restaraunts were average in quality, little expensive. We were gone most of the day time but did find the resort a pleasant place to stay. Did witness some people having registering problems. We had no troubles here at all.

Reviews.Title: “a relaxing and enjoyable trip - Penfield,NY”
Reviews.Author: 1anna1
Reviews.Content: Paradisus was beautiful. Everything was wonderful from the rooms to the grounds to the ocean. We went with 2 other couples and had terrific time. All-inclusive was perfect for us. We ate and drank all day. I was concerned about the food because of the reviews and how picky I am but I was pleasantly surprised , the food was good. The Avocado was delicious and the Cabrenio(sp) was also terrific. The only thing that was missing was night life. We still had a great time and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Missing it already!”
Reviews.Author: wanita36
Reviews.Content: Sometimes is is easier to complain than to praise. Remember that when you read the negative reviews. I am sorry if those people had a bad time but we didn't at all! This place is beautiful. No problem at check in, great room. the friendliest staff I have ever met!! Snag a sun umbrella in the am early because you will want it. Everyone leaves a towel or something to mark what spot they want, the umbrella areas go fast. The beach is different but it is refreshing to see they kept the charm. I am a vegetarian and was able to eat fine at the restaurants. Just ask and they can make something for you if you need too. The pool is huge and wonderful. Lots of families but didn't mind it. What a great trip. I miss is it already.

Reviews.Title: “Our best vacation yet!”
Reviews.Author: McLucky
Reviews.Content: Having read all the bad reviews about the resort, my husband and I were a bit apprehensive about our stay. So, we started out with very low expectations, which is often the best approach when chartering into the unknown. We chose this resort because it was rated to be one of the most kids-friendly resorts by the Conde Nast Traveler. True to this rating, Paradisus is indeed one of the most kids-friendly places we have ever been to with our son. The staff was extremely courteous and patient with all of the very many young patrons. If you canâ€™t stand sitting next to a very disgruntled toddler during meals, then perhaps this is not a place for you. Our five year-old son absolutely loved the resort and asked if we could stay in Puerto Rico forever. We wish we could. The weather was perfect, the food was much better than what one reads in these reviews, although I personally would not recommend Bamboo for dinner. All of the entrees were simply drowned in soy sauce and our hibachi chef kept dropping his utensils. But other guests at the resort loved this restaurant, which shows that people like different things. Just remember to make your dinner reservations in advance and you will be fine. And yes, it definitely helps to tip. We did not choose Royal Service, which, by the way, guarantees dinner reservations at any time. In spite of that, we were happy we did not because kids are not allowed at many of the Royal Service facilities. The only major draw back of the resort for us was the lack of swimable beach.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful getaway!!!”
Reviews.Author: miltonmom
Reviews.Content: We just arrived back from a 3 night stay at Paradisus Puerto Rico. I was very skeptical after reading many of the reviews on Trip Advisor. I'm thrilled to report that our stay was wonderful!! The only problem we found at the resort were some of the people staying there!!! There were several people who we ran into who were looking for problems! It seemed there was NOTHING anyone could do to make them happy! Unfortunately, these seem to be the same people who love to write reviews! One couple we met stated that their whole trip was "horrible"! And then they followed that comment up with "Well, our standards are VERY high..we just returned from Club Med." I'm sorry, but Club Med is NOT the pinnacle that others should be compared! We have stayed at the Four Seasons, The Ritz Carlton, and several of the top hotels of the world. Although this resort is not in the same league as some of these, it is a wonderful resort. We found the food to be wonderful at Toscana and Avacado. Breakfast was more than adequate, as was lunch. Next time if we're traveling without the kids, we would do the Royal Service. We truly enjoyed the Spa. If you have a treatment, you are then able to use the Spa pool (which is private and very quiet) that same day. The couples massage was wonderful!! We had a very relaxing and enjoyable vacation. We would love to go back, next time with the children, as all of the children seemed to be having a wonderful time. I hope this review is helpful and I feel confident that you too will enjoy your stay at Paradisus Puerto Rico

Reviews.Title: “It's almost humorous”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonTravelers
Reviews.Content: We just got back from staying a week at the resort and if my kids would't have had a good time I would have been furious (ages 3 and 1).Good thing the 3 year old loves to swim because there was NOTHING eles for him to do. Here is a list of things that went wrong: From the time we arrived to the time we got into our room with our luggage it was almost 2 hours and after our long flight and being so tired, I didn't have the energy to switch rooms when they gave me a room with a king bed instead of two queens like we requested. Service was horrible, don't bother asking for anything because you were going to be a bother to the staff or thats what you felt like, even when ordering drinks you had to walk up to the bar youself, so carry cash it comes in handy if you want good sevice. We ate 3 meals without a high chair (can you imagine doing that with a 1 year old)? They claim to have ran out. Shower in our room was broken, we called to have someone fix it but when no one showed up we gave up. You couldn't get into eat at any of the restraunts if you didn't have reservations a week in advance ( no joke) unless you wanted to have dinner at 9:00 and with kids unrealistic. Bring your own crib because they ran out, so you were on your own even if you did request one in advance. Beach was rocky and unswimable. Oh... and the food, disgusting especially the buffett. ALL in ALL...... I think I lost weight from not eating and drinking or it could of been the half a mile walk to the room from the pool. They claim to have golf carts but don't count on it.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, memorable honeymoon!!!”
Reviews.Author: jenmorgan55
Reviews.Content: Wow, what can I say that could possibly de-bunk all of the bad reviews prior to going to this resort? After reading many negative reviews, I was quite nervous about staying here but I decided to give it a chance anyway. We arrived at the resort on Sunday evening and check-in was prompt and courteous. Our luggage arrived at our room within the hour. We were able to make reservations at all of the restaurants with no problems at all. Our last night there we decided to take the kayaking tour to the "bio-bay" and didn't return to the resort until after the time for our reservation at Romantico. My husband called and explained what had happened and they took our order over the phone, then delivered our food along with a bottle of champagne to our room. All of the staff were very friendly and accommodating. The food was great, the drinks were delicious, and the grounds of the resort were breathtaking! The pool was spacious and beautiful. The beach area was a bit rocky, but if you wear water shoes or flip-flops, it's just fine. The coast line was amazing. Everything was so clean and airy. Our room was comfortable and spacious with an amazing view of the mountains. I was very pleased with everything at this resort. It's unfortunate that they have decided to no longer be all-inclusive, as I would definately return. Don't believe everything you read, make your own judgements!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not what its cut out to be...”
Reviews.Author: sts3mike
Reviews.Content: First things first, I love Puerto Rico. I did not like the resort. I understand itâ€™s the first all inclusive resort in PR but come on they need some work on customer service. The shuttle from the airport was supposed to be included and it was $100 a person when we got there, so I rented a car. The hotel does not tell you that parking is included so I had to pay for parking when we were there. Once we got there we had to wait 30-40 minutes to check in. That is ridiculous. After we checked in we were never told that you had to book your dinner reservations in advance. We had to eat at the same restaurant 2 days in a row followed by the fourth day. One of the restaurants was closed the whole time and figures it was the Puerto Rican cuisine restaurant. I flew to PR to have American, Japanese, Italian food. The room service was horrible; the menu seemed like a menu at a bar with nothing really worth getting. The pool was really something it was huge. Once the paradisus works out there customer service issues and other various problems, I would probably return and give it one more chance.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Resort”
Reviews.Author: mo1love
Reviews.Content: Myself and a few girlfriends decided to go on a nice getaway to Puerto Rico and stayed at the Paradisus. The resort was absolutely gorgeous. The buffet was gross so expect to spend some cash at the local eateries. The key is to make friends with the resort staff because their very helpful with giving directions for local restaurants and attractions. Rent a car because it is easy to get around and the price to rent cars are really cheap and are accessible from San Juan Airport. I highly recommend the following restaurants which are 10 minutes away from the resort: EL Dejao and Las Vegas (Yummy!)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort and great food but customer service lacking”
Reviews.Author: cmc2275
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 day trip to the Paradisus. We upgraded to Royal Service. Our review is mixed: we had a wonderful, relaxing time but the customer service is REALLY lacking. First, the Royal Service turned out to be a good thing for checking-in (we were able to bypass the front desk) and for making dinner reservations and also for reserving the "huts with beds" at the Royal Service pool. The Royal Service pool was great---not crowded and quiet. No children are permitted. There is also a separate bar at the Royal Service pool. That is the only upside to Royal Service but highly recommend it since we couldn't imagine what the service would have been like if we didn't have it. The food at the resort was excellent. We tried all the restaurants except the Italian. Order the filet mignon where you can. The Asian Fusion restaurant was ok but the menu was limited and again, the service was lacking. Breakfast and lunch are buffets but don't be scared---the food was great and varied. The lunch buffet had fresh fish, sandwiches, hot foods, gourmet salads, etc. The rooms were clean and spacious. Each room has a balcony with chairs. We had no bedbugs as earlier reviews reported (believe me, we checked). We thought the beach was beautfiul. Very natural setting but it is not a beach where you swim in the water so we did hear that people were disapponted in that. You could take beach chairs down to the water but most people were by the pool (which had a great view of the ocean). There is no snorkeling. The problem we had was the service. We have been to a few all-inclusives and the staff would do anything to make your stay comfortable. We were used to the friendly, enthusiastic and proactive service of the staff at the resorts in Mexico and the Dominican Republic. But here, it always seemed like we were bothering the staff when asking for a drink or even checking in at the hostess station and EVEN at the Royal Servie lounge! We found ourselves standing in front of a hostess or at the bar and we would sense this attitude of "We will get to you when we are ready". There was no acknowledgment of "We will be with you in a second". This attitude was pervasive and it wasn't any better at the Royal Service pool. At points on the trip, it felt like we were on a 'Seinfeld' or 'Curb your Enthusiasm' episode. We would be the only people in line for say, lunch. The restaurant was just opening and there were only 4 people standing there to get in (and NO ONE was in the restaurant). They would not acknowledge that you were standing there until they were ready (we almost thought they were faking busy) and then they would take our names and tell us that it would be a few minutes. This was funny in itself since the restaurant was open and no one was inside. Then seconds later--with still only 4 people standing there--the hostess would seriously yell out our name like she had no idea where we were. We were like, "we're right here, you just took our names 5 seconds ago." If we hadn't spoken up, I was convinced she would have just crossed our name off the list. It became comical. And it didn't matter if you tipped every bartender or server (which we did). Another scenario was when we would request a refill of water or request a utensil or napkin. We would both have empty water glasses and only the person that asked for the water, got a refill. We had to stop the server from walking away so they could refill the other glass. At the buffet, they take away your plate each time you go back up, so usually your fork would be missing when you got back. It was getting so hard to get someone to come to the table that we saw the drawer where they were getting the forks and would just help ourselves. Thank god the food and the resort were excellent or we would have not enjoyed ourselves as much as we did. We did have 2 excellent servers: Harry at the Romantico restaurant and Diana at the Avocado Restaurant. Very friendly and proactive. Glasses were refilled with water and wine and they would check-in with you to make sure you had everything you needed (and if you needed something, they would actually come back to give it to you within a 15 minute period.) So, in summary: despite our frustration with the serivce, if you are booked for the all-inclusive in the next month (the hotel changes hands May 1st--no all inclusive after that point), I would say that you will love the resort and the food. It is a great place to unwind and relax. Just be forewarned that the staff has a laissez-faire attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Way better than expected”
Reviews.Author: missnr
Reviews.Content: After reading the very mixed reviews we were leary of this resort. We were pleasantly surprised and it was way better than we expected. The service was tremendous, the food was good , not great but very worthwhile. We had no problems booking dinners and were able to change them if we wanted as we enjoyed Avacado and Romanitco the best. Great Steaks!!!! The bar service and choices were first class. Premium beers and alcohol. We would definately return to this resort...

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: sam8273
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Paradisus and did not want to leave. I had a great stay! When I checked in they could not find my reservation but they just had it misspelled and it was quickly resolved. My luggage took only 15 minutes to arrive. I did not upgrade to the Royal service but was given one of their new timeshare rooms. The room was immaculate and the bellman said I was like the 3rd person to stay in the room. It was missing a bed skirt and possibly a second nightstand but the room was immaculate and the bed was very, very comfortable. The room had 2 plasma tv's but who watches tv on vacation anyway? The room was always cleaned promtly. I do agree that the Mirador outside restaurant was full of the birds and even a bunch of flies around the buffet so I stopped eating there and went to the indoor restaurant which was a pleasure. I also ate at every restaurant except the japanese and the best one was the romanitco. you can order your app from the menu instead of going to the buffet. Eat here more than once is my reccomendation. The pool was beautiful and I actually saw many people swimming in the ocean even though it was rocky. Just bring water shoes....The grounds were wonderful and it was a very relaxing vacation. I don't think I will go back since they are not doing the all inclusive starting in may. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service? Needs training.”
Reviews.Author: Golfvacationer
Reviews.Content: A group of 12 women went to the Paradisus for a golf vacation. The vacation was booked on Travel.com and rooms with double beds were "requested". When arriving at the hotel, we were informed that our request is "only a request" for a bed. The hotel only guarantees a room not the type of bed. Since our whole group consisted of 12 women, we all wanted and expected the double bed setting but were never accommodated. We were told that we were upgraded to a room with a King bed and a pull out couch. We were told that our rooms are not pre-booked, yet the first twosomes signing in were given the "upgraded" room and the others had the double bed rooms. Furthermore, one of our more seasoned travellers gave a separate front desk clerk $20 and he immediately found them the double bed room. We we told that they would let us know if a room with a double bed became available which never happened. Our group were not the only guests that felt the customer service was lacking. While checking out there were stories of wedding party people being told that they couldn't be driven all the way to the wedding area because they had to go to lunch. Good thing it wasn't the bride. I used the in room safe wisely because I heard that $300 and jewelry were stolen from rooms. Someone's door was broken and the guest did not want to leave it open. When calling for it to be repaired, was rudely treated. Bath tubs not draining properly, toilets breaking. This resort will no longer be all inclusive as of May 1, 2007. Hopefully, the company taking over will train "NEW" staff the meaning of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: HudsonValleyMama
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews, although I do pay attention to them. I read a lot of bad reviews before going to Paradisus this March and was a bit nervous. I'm happy to report that after a week with my husband and 2 grown sons, we all had a wonderful experience. Check-in was a breeze. We took our luggage to our room so delivery of baggage wasn't an issue. We had Royale Service, which I highly recommend. The room (ocean view) was very nice, clean and well appointed. Maid service was excellent . The Royale Service pool was fabulous. We reserved a private "palapa" each day with no problem. The bartenders and attendants were extremely efficient and friendly. (When a gentleman dropped a piece of fruit poolside a nearby bartender quickly picked it up, washed it, and returned it to the man's lounge chair. ) Our "private butler" introduced himself to us the first day. And although we never used his services, he saw my husband 3 days later and spoke to him by name! (very impressive) The grounds are beautiful and extremely well kept up and clean. No surprise....the beach was not great - can't really walk it or swim. But the kayaking was fun. We didn't expect gourmet food and didn't get it. (This is the reason I'm not giving this resort a 5* rating) The breakfast and lunch buffets were terrific (But avoid the Mirador Grill - ugh! opt for the Carribean instead) Romantico is over rated. We enjoyed Avocado and Tuscano better. Bamboo is your typical hibachi place.(Avocado has great beef) Overall we found that the beef was much better than the fish -fine for my sons but my husband and I prefer seafood. The snacks that were always set up in the Royale Service Lounge were great. There was a problem with a restaurant booking one night. When the RS manager called to explain we couldn't get the time we reserved at our chosen restaurant, we didn't make a big deal about it. He quickly got us a table at another restaurant. Fifteen minutes later he, along with a waiter, arrived at our room with a bottle of wine and a plate of hors d'oeuvres to make ammends for the mistake. Now that's great PR!!! I cannot stress the cleanliness enough - everywhere! Especially the bathrooms. EVERYONE (maids, shuttle drivers, bartenders, waitstaff, gardeners, watersports staff, etc. etc) was extremely warm and friendly, and always quick to greet us. Certainly everyone cannot expect to have as good an experience as we had. But I do recommend it highly and hope that some people will take advantage of this great all-inclusive resort before it no longer is all-inclusive as of May 1.

Reviews.Title: “Had one of the best vacations of my life.”
Reviews.Author: sullil01
Reviews.Content: OK. I don't normally write reviews but after all the horriffic things posted about Paradisus on this site I felt that I had to. I do feel awful for the people who had bad experiences here, but my husband and I just got back from 5 days there and were THRILLED with the entire experience. Yes, it took about an hour for our luggage to arrive at our room after we checked in, and that was a bit annoying, but we went and had a drink at the bar and it was fine. We did NOT upgrade to Royal Service, but still managed to have no issue with service or attentiveness by the staff. Example: one night we locked ourselves on our patio. (Actually not that hard to do, so watch out, people!) I flagged down one of the MANY golf carts that drive around offering rides to guests to ask him what we could do about it. (I was in my jammies, as was my husband, and didn't really want to walk back up to the front desk.) The driver stopped the golf cart, even though he had a passenger on it, went to a courtesy phone, had them speak to me to verify I was who I said I was, and then used his master key to get me back in my room. All was taken care of within 5 minutes. We also couldn't have been more happy with the staff - they all had a big smile and a wave for each guest, and went out of their way to help you out. A girl working at the pool taking drink orders even went into the casino to get change for me! I was amazed. And they were all so helpful as far as telling us what everything was - there was a traditional Puerto Rican dance show our first night there, and the VERY busy bartender took time out to explain to us what it was, what its' name was, and why the dance was done. The food was GREAT. Yes, the outside dining (Mirador Grill) has quite a few birds flying around, and you do see them around the salad bar area, so if you get queasy about that, don't go there. The Caribeno (the other casual buffet) is inside and WONDERFUL. The restaurants that require reservations were delicious, and the appetizer buffets are ridiculous. You barely even need your entree! Beware of the 'snack' buffets, though (afternoon and late night) - all greasy stuff. Ick. Chicken wings, pizza, chicken nuggets. I guess that's more for the kids though. All in all, it was Paradise. Truly. We had an amazing time, the weather was perfect, and it was a very special vacation for us. PLEASE give this place a chance and don't let all the negative reviews on this site turn you off. I was TERRIFIED of what we were going to encounter when we arrived, and then had no issues whatsoever. HAD A BLAST!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good service not included”
Reviews.Author: LikesTheSunBoston
Reviews.Content: Reservations Not Honored: A group of 12 women decided to enjoy a classy resort and de-stress. We planned months in advance and booked rooms with two beds. After a fairly long travel day, we arrived to find that our rooms were not going to be two beds after all, but instead a bed and a sofa pull out couch. We tried to get this reverted, but to no avail. "there just are no rooms like that left." Little did we realize that one of our more seasoned travellers simply slipped the guy a $20 and he "found" a room that she wanted. Supposedly if a room opened up they would call. It did and they didn't. Discounts: We had received a group discount for golf. However, we had to produce the letter about this when we arrived at the course. It was like this every step of the way. Simple things: They delivered our luggage, but we were able to walk back to our rooms faster than the luggage arrived -- an hour later. We booked our meals right away. However, one night they closed a restaurant for another party and rebooked us. The restaurant manager was actually a bright spot in the bad service we kept encountering. He rebooked us to a restaurant of our choice. Security: We found it odd that we had to shout out our exact room number, when there were bungalow labels. This was required on a shuttle or the casino. My friend tried just shouting the bungalow, but they didn't go for that. We were not surprised to hear of SEVERAL thefts. (Our group did use the safe provided and were fine.) Hygiene/utilities: The sinks and showers were clogged. How elegant does it feel to go into the shower after your friend and stand in ankle deep dirty water? A staff member was commisserating with a friend who asked how she dealt with all the angry people day in and day out. (We were not the only ones at the desk with problems.) She said "Yeah, can you believe they call themselves 4 star? This is how it is all the time. I've never worked for such a bad place." We really just wanted something comped like perhaps the $60 ride from the airport, but in the end got nothing. Positives: The grounds are quite beautiful, the breakfast nice (though often lukewarm coffee), many of the staff who did shuttle or porter service were actually helpful and friendly. The pool was lovely. The rooms (although QUITE a hike if you get the 800s rooms) are attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay EVER”
Reviews.Author: srp123
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving to the Paradisus hotel after a weary journey, a staff worker took our luggage and promised to deliver it to our room in "no time!" 5 hours later he appeared at our room with our luggage. That event symbolized our stay at the Paradisus. I don't know what was worse the service or the food, but both were entirely unacceptable. I read the reviews of the bad food before I booked the trip, but I thought to myself "I'm not a picky eater. I'll eat just about anything." Well, guess I'm not such a flexible eater after all. One day I had a hamburger for lunch and pulled several hard large chunks out of my mouth. Another time I took a bite of chicken that was completely RAW. I had enough. My husband and I arranged a trip to Old Puetro Rico. Instead of looking at the sights, we looked for a grocery store where we could get crackers and peanut butter to get us through the rest of the trip so we wouldn't have to eat the terrible food at the Paradisus! We stopped at a restaurant in Old Puetro Rico and ate like straving refugees! To be fair, we never got a reservation to one of the 3 restaurants that take them. When we arrived we tried to make a reservation, but we were told they were booked for the length of our stay. How is that possible? They do not take reservations in advance -- you have to be there to book anything. So, onto the service. Room service took approx 2-3 hours once we placed an order. Our television broke and it took them 2 days to come and fix it. The pros? The room was quite nice. The facilities were nice too (as long as you don't mind the lack of beach). I did complain to the manager who gave us 2 free nights to compansate for our experience. But, honestly, you couldn't pay me to go back! I've travelled extensivly and stayed at a wide variety of accomidations, and I have NEVER experienced such poor food and service in my life as I did at the Paradisus.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars My Butt”
Reviews.Author: 07Gemini
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this was our first time traveling and it was for our honeymoon. The reservations were made for us by a family member and it was not for all inclusive. Check in was a snap. We arrived early from the airport and had a room key within 10 minutes with a fancy new green bracelet. Unfortunately, communication at this resort is poor along with the English translation. From the start we were not informed about how food was payed for, what the bracelet meant or that cash was not accepted anywheer except the casion and gift shop. Although all inclusive is nice, when you have to pay for your meals, the $20 breakfast buffett fell short from acceptible. Or how about a $45 plate of spaghetti with a couple small mussles randomly placed on top. The food was well below "Elegant" or worth the cost. We enjoyed a nice dominos pizza the following day for $15 and enjoyed it much more. Staff was less than helpful. They seemed irritated they had to serve you another drink or sign a dinner slip because of the green bracelet. Some of them didnt even know what it meant and questioned me like some sort of criminal for wearing it as if I didn't belong at the resort. To sum it up. Service was poor, food was way over priced and not worth it. Rent a car and see the countryside in Old San Juan at your convienience like we did. All inclusive is not worth it unless you plan on staying at the resort and drinking to no end. Oh, and learn spanish because none of the underpaid staff cares enough to understand english. The rooms and facilities are absolutely beautiful. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “Not for Beach Lovers”
Reviews.Author: M'times
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 night stay at the Paradisus. Overall the resort is good, with exceptional rooms (we were in their Royal Service buildings), great pools and grounds. Staff were friendly and went out of their way to help. Food was varied from a great breakfast buffet to a so so dinner buffet. The theme restaurants were decent although the service was a little slow (Italien) The beach was poor so if you are a beach person who likes to walk the beach and swim in the ocean this is not the place. Traffic in Puerto Rico is bad so plan lots of time to get to places. Every trip was twice the time we were told. Took us over 1 1/2 hours to get from gthe hotel to Old San Juan. Weather was good, had a couple of rain storms that blew through in about 15 minutes. Next to the property is the CoCo Beach golf resort with 36 holes. The Palms (9 holes) is the tighest course I have ever seen. No room for spraying as the jungle takes all! THe Mountain (9 Holes) has some great view and holes but also a couple of quirky ones. The other 9's Lakes and Ocean are a little more forgiving. Not cheap though as a round and rentals cost $200 US THe Paradisus presently is the only All Inclusive in puerto rico but as of May it is dropping the all inclusive option. THey are getting ready to start a new Caribe (another Sol Melia chain) but it will not be ready for a year of more at least. Overall we had a good time but given the beach situation and the cost of the package and now losing the all inclusive I probably would not go back. I have stayed at the Paradisus in the Mayan and would rate it better than this. As a side trip we did one of the Catamaran snorkling days. (Spread Eagle 2 was the catamaran)Water and boat ride were fun, (although first one I have been on the drinks are not all included in the price) but the snorkling was mediocre at best.

Reviews.Title: “Lost in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Bracca
Reviews.Content: The resort is quite beautifull. However the resort is like a hair band rock concert. Lots of beautifull sites but lacking in substance. My room unfortunately had a break in and my wedding ring was stolen. I was quite annoyed at the relaxed and non pro active attitude of the staff. Restaurant reservation system leaves a lot to be desired. Variety of food is non existant. However standing ovation for the Avacado restaurant excellent steaks. Room was clean. However security around the rooms leave a lot to be desired. I often saw several rooms in a row left open while 1 maid cleaned them leaving it quite vulnerable for theft as I experience...... Stay at your risk

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: gomo42
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed @ the Paradisus for 6 days. We had a wonderful time. The staff was very helpful and always smiling. Our rooms were ready upon arrival. The rooms were clean and nicely decorated. I would recommend requesting the second floor, that way you can leave your balcony door open througout the day and night. Room service was great, but keep in mind unless you have Royal Service there is a $3 fee. The beach was beatiful and the pool was amazing. Royal Service was very convenient. They held a cabana for us at the pool and made all of our restaurant reservations. They also were very helpful about giving us directions to the rainforest and San Juan. The resort priovided a golfcart driven by one of the workers for transportation which made our stay easier since the hotel is somewhat spread out. We rented a car which was great. We could go to places whenever we wanted. Driving was not too difficult either. The restaurants were pretty good. Some of them didn't have much of a variety of food. Mirador Grill was one of the best restaraunts. The lobby was huge , they have an open lounge where many families hung out throughtout the day and night. The hotel also provided boardgames for everyone. I would defenitly recomemedd this hotel to anyone, and I hope to one day go back!

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation of my life”
Reviews.Author: islandbarbiegirl
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I am shocked by all of the bad reviews on here! I was at the Paradissus in April of 2005 and it was fabulous - no complaints! The room was gorgeous, very clean and even with a balcony to sit on. The resort was very safe (important for two young women travelling alone together) and the staff was beyond friendly. Every restaurant was excellent and I have been to many top-notch restaurants in the U.S. We would go back in a heartbeat and recommend it to everyone we know. Additionally, the tour desk and concierge service were excellent. This was the best all-inclusive resort I have been to in the Caribbean and Mexico. Ignore the negative comments and see it for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Darned Good”
Reviews.Author: SkiKat
Reviews.Content: Having been to Puerto Rico several times before, we were able to avoid some of the potential hassles and overall had a really nice time. Hopefully, some of these tips can help you. The hotels in PR tend to be pricy - Paradisus included. However, Paradisus serves decent food in the buffets, very good food in the reservations required places and has top shelf drinks included - the value is not bad as compared to other places. Paradisus has nice, large rooms with balconies. The beach is OK, not great. But the pools are wonderful and the place is large - i.e. not crowded. The service staff is primarily younger folks (this is not their career unlike what you find in many other Carribean destinations) - you see many of the things that can come with that - service is not always rapid fire or accurate - but it is generally very good. The hotel is well outside of San Juan. If you want to do excursions with a tour company, you get stuck with the inevitable waits you see anywhere in the world. (I abhor waits and shuttles) Here's some advice - if you are going to leave the resort and tour or partake in excursions, rent a car. Driving in PR is easy, rental cars are cheap, picking them up at the airport is fast and easy, self park is close to the rooms. A lot of cool stuff can be done on your own, you don't need a tour company. Or, hook up with the tour company at the destination rather than waiting on a shuttle. There are a lot of people from the North East. They, generally, have a more brusque approach to things - if that really bothers you, don't go to PR because it is a big destination for New Yorkers.

Reviews.Title: “A week in paradise”
Reviews.Author: p20nch
Reviews.Content: I felt I needed to add a review to this website after using it in preparation for our family's trip. I read through many reviews ranging from "this place is hell on earth", to "greatest destination I have ever been." After the reviews I did not know what to expect, but I trusted my family's decision and could not wait to get away. Our party included 18 people ranging in age from my grandparents to young cousins. I am a 29 year old male. I should note here that our last family trip to an all-inclusive resort was a disaster. Stay away from Playa Naco in the Dominican Republic at all costs. Paradisus was head and shoulders above our last experience. The trip to and from the airport was about 40 minutes by van and not bad at all. Our first order of business was an upgrade to royal service. I recommend this move if your budget allows.
