It provided access to a few extra ammenities including a separate royal service pool (ask for the mojitos), and some upgrades in rooms and dining. The all inclusive food and drink worked out very well for our party. It was great to be able to eat or get a drink at any time, day or night. My uncle was able to force me into a shot of tequila and a beer as I stepped out of breakfast one morning. The quality of the food was very good over all. This included the breakfast (good omelettes) and lunch buffets, and all of the different restaurants on sight. The only negatives here were the slow service at one or two of the restaurants, and some confusion over reservations. Not bad over all. Room service (try the quesadilla) and butlers were also free with royal service. The main pool in the center of the resort was a lot of fun for all including water basketball and other sports. I should note here, if you are a looking for a beach-front resort, paradisus is not for you. The pools were great and there was a beach volleyball court. The sand and beach area were not great. The staff and service was very competent and friendly over all, including one woman with beautiful eyes that my brother is still talking about. Some slow service in the restaurants but we had a party of 18 to serve each night. We were lucky enough to have great weather for most of the week. A little overcast and rain at times. The resort did get buggy at night and my feet and ankles were pretty bitten up all week. On our last night we were fortunate enough to catch the "white party." A dance party where guests and staff (yes she was there) showed up wearing white and we danced and drank until the wee hours of the morning. A great way to end the week. My family's review was very positive over all. We all had a great time and I would recommend the resort. My major complaints were the lack of a great beach area and the bugs. I think I covered the important points and I hope you find the review helpful. Bring your sunblock and bug spray and enjoy the trip. Have a mojito for me.

Reviews.Title: “Paradisus tries but it's not a 5 star.”
Reviews.Author: ILike2Explore
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at Paradisus for 4 nights. After reading many negative reviews I was hesitant but the lure of an all inclusive sealed our stay here. Thanks to the advice of some savvy travelers, the suggestion of upgrading to "royal service" was heeded. I firmly believe if you can afford it, upgrade. The service was notably better as far as gaining dinner reservations easily with other advantages such as a private butler. Our butler provided us with special services such as a cheese plate with wine before dinner and they even set up a romantic jacuzzi evening for us. It seemed to be ask and you shall receive. Fortunately we never found service to be an issue. If you travel a great deal, you know- tip when appropriate-yes it is an all inclusive and no you shouldn't have to give extra but if it makes life easier to part with a few singles here and there, why not? You will be amazed how much better attitudes become. Royal service also provides a separate, adult pool that is only for royal service guests. It is a smaller pool but definitely more quiet and allows personalized attention. A word of advice, try to get poolside before 10:00 to insure your own cabana for the day. As other travelers stated, the beach is nothing to be in awe of and swimming there is not ideal. But it still makes for a nice stroll and to dip your toes in. They do have paddle boats and catamarans to enjoy. The 5 star element here is undoubtedly the grounds. Paradisus is a breathtaking place to behold and the attention to its decor is amazing. If only they placed remotely close attention to their food. There is nothing 5 star about it. I have been told that all inclusives almost never have gourmet food. Everyone was right. The food here is fine if you do not expect stellar chef delicacies. We ate at every restaurant except Toscano. Romantico was more upscale and other travelers said it was the best pick. My boyfriend had a delicious lamb entree but my seafood entree was inedible and I had to return it to the kitchen only to be told it would take another hour AGAIN to bring me something. I left hungry and couldn't believe the mis management with that one. I would have opted for room service when we got back but the room service menu is extremely limited. The casino is definitely larger than a "closet" as another trip advisor member stated. It's actually a decent size and staffed with friendly employees. The spa is also nice although small. We had a couples massage which was delightful although quite expensive even for 80 minutes. I began the trip to Paradisus filled with trepidation due to so many negative reviews but the stay here was lovely, with not a bed bug in sight, thank god! I think perhaps if Paradisus lowers it's star rating, expectations will not be so high. Based on my personal experience as well as that of my boyfriend, I can tell you that if you do stay here, you can expect a wonderfully, relaxing time. It was a little taste of heaven for us. How could it not be when you are lounging poolside and the most energy asked of you is to lift your head up to ask for another drink? Just remember, heaven doesn't come cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Below Average Paradisus”
Reviews.Author: sci
Reviews.Content: What a rip off. I took my daughter here to check it out, because I am a travel agent. The staff knew this upon my arrival, so they immediately upgraded us to Royal Service. I can't imagine what our stay would have been like if we didn't have this service. The greatest benefit is that you get to use the private pool area with the beautiful palapas. That is, if you are lucky enough to get one or grease the pool attendant early enough in the morning. The other benefit is the rooms are larger and most have a view of the water. Ours didn't. Our room had the most disgusting smell - reminiscent of a barn. The beds were hard and uncomfortable. Look out for the bugs. We were on the first floor, and I could hear feet pounding above us in the late evening and early morning. Nothing bothers me more. The food was mediocre, at best. Everything is the same, day in and day out. We made reservations for the a la carte restaurants, which, after the rigamarole of trying to get a reservation, should have been fabulous. In actuality, the food was the same as it was in the regular dining areas - only the linens were different. We walked out of the Japanese restaurant, because no one came over to serve us, after waiting for 25 minutes. We avoided the general pool area, because hearing the noise from a half mile away was enough to tell me I didn't need to partake in the activities. It was full of loud, drunk, obnoxiouos people who have no regard for personal space. If your travel agent steers you in this direction, run, don't walk. There are many, many wonderful places and resorts on this magnificent island. After 72 hours, we left for the comfort of El Conquistador, and all was well.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the poolside drinks”
Reviews.Author: dk190
Reviews.Content: There was food left outside the neighbors door for 3 DAYS! We had to make alot of noise to get rid of the birds etc to get away from eating it so that we could get back into the room. Many,many complaints were necessary to finally have it removed.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT Recommend”
Reviews.Author: jstorms
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Paradisus. It's absolutely beautiful and the staff is for the most part pretty friendly. As many others have stated, this place falls short in many ways and we were quite disappointed. We got there and were told that they were only at a 23% occupancy. We thought great, we will have no problems eating where we want. We are then told that you have to book reservations for you dinners way ahead. We tried to get in somewhere the first night we got there and were told there were no openings! With 23% occupancy, how can the restaurants be full? We were on a company trip so I mentioned this to our Marketing director who proceeded to check on the reservations himself and they gave him 10 spots at 3 different restaurants?? How does that work? The food was pretty good tasting however; it was ALWAYS cold at the buffets and not just a little cold. You would expect better quality of food at such a nice all-inclusive. We were wondering if there is ever any sort of Health Dept. that inspects and checks the foods temps. Also, for an all-inclusive they don't make foods very readily available. There is a very limited room service menu. There is no grill or anything right at the pool. You have to go into one of the restuarants to eat. Also, none of the staff is eager to get you another drink, many times we had to just go to the bar and get our own. This is definetly a beautiful place but for the money you could go to an all-inclusive in Mexico and get much better service and food. We will not go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous grounds, horrible management and service”
Reviews.Author: Traveler1234567
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paradisius for 5 days for a business trip. My delight at the goreous scenery, huge pool and luxe furniture faded and soured as the week wore until I was finally so appalled at the way the hotel was managed I gave up trying to enjoy the place. Although the staff generally seemed like nice people trying to do their jobs, nothing went smoothly. Getting an issue resolved from the staff gave me the same feeling of helpless frustration that I often feel when calling a customer support center in Bangalore to get a computer fixed. Minor inconveniences like water not working, bugs in the room, repeat buffet food, or lost reservations might be fine if you're staying here for pleasure and are enjoying all the cocktails the hotel generously pours, however, as a business traveller trying to make efficient use of my short time there, I found the experience quite antagonist. Here's the details of just one of these inconvenineces: Upon check-in, I found tiny ants (or some other bug - hopefully not bed bugs) in my room, and requested to be moved to another room. I was asked if I had called engineering to resolve the issue, and was told that I had to follow procedure before changing rooms. The "engineering" staff (an employee with a spray can) sprayed the part of the room where I had seen the ants, and left me with a foamy residue. A few hours later I spotted more ants in other parts of the room, and got some more spray. Not suprisingly, I kept seeing ants and finally when I saw that they had moved into the clothing in my open suitcase, I called and requested a room change. They promised a bellman would come immediately to take me to a new room, and 45 minutes later, the bellman had not arrived and I had missed my dinner. I requested an appointment with the manager the next morning to discuss my frustration with this issue (and several others too tedious to discuss here), and scheduled an appointment at 11 am. I arrived at the check-out desk at 10:15, and was still checking out at 11 AM due to several errors in billing (double charges for phone, etc). I waited for the manager until 11:20, but could no longer wait, and left the hotel feeling insulted and a bit bug-paranoid.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation Place”
Reviews.Author: miav
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Paradisus during the Martin Luther King, Jr. weekend. We read the reviews before we booked our vacation and decided to go to Paradisus since our first choice hotel was booked solid that weekend. Thankfully, we were not disappointed. Personnel - 4 out 5 stars 8 out 10 staff members smiled and greeted us. We didn't have any issues checking in or checking out. The operator was always there to pick up the phone and helped us. Everyone was friendly and attentive. Food & Drinks - 3 out of 5 stars overall, but some restaurants are better than others We didn't use room service, so we can't comment on that. We had breakfast at Caribeno and Mirador Grill. We found Caribeno to be better than Mirador Grill for food quality. The outdoor seating at Mirador Grill is nice and convenient if you've been out at the beach or the pool all day, but there were bees by the desserts and pastries - at times I wasn't able to get desserts and pastries because I was afraid of the bees. Mirador Grill is also open for snacks in the late afternoon. We had dinner at Avocado (steak house), Romantico (fine dining) and Bamboo (Japanese steak house). Avocado was below average for your usual steak house - the appetizer and desserts were buffet style, but the main course is ordered from the menu. We liked Romantico and Bamboo much better (both are not buffet style). Make sure to wear pants for Romantico, we saw a guy who was asked to change since he had shorts on. Other restaurants were not as formal, but people did somewhat dress up for dinner. We didn't have any issues with dinner reservations (we made our reservations right after we checked in), but the hotel didn't seem to be booked when we were there. Facility - 4 out of 5 stars The grounds are beautiful and nicely kept. We didn't use the spa service - I called the spa twice but noone picked up the phone, so we just decided not to get spa services. We stayed in a Jr. Suite - it was roomy and clean, it also has a small balcony. We were in building 7 by the villas, which is about 0.3 miles away from the lobby, pool and restaurants. It's a nice walk from the room to the pool because of the beautiful grounds. They have a shuttle that just goes around and around the resort. They always stopped to offer us a ride, but we declined most of the time since we wanted to walk off all that food that we ate! Casino - 3 out 5 stars I'm not a big gambler, but we stopped by one night just to check it out. It is small, but aren't many Caribbean hotel casinos? They have slot machines, blackjack tables, poker tables, roulette and Texas hold'em poker. A great thing about the casino is it's smoke free (maybe not good for some, but this is a great plus for us). Beach - 3 out of 5 stars Definitely not a white sandy beach, but not rocky enough that you need shoes to walk on the beach. Water was calm and warm. We also went out on a kayak and a paddle boat. Easy enough to rent - just sign a waiver and pick one to take out in the ocean. They also have hobie cats and one of the staff members goes out with you. Be careful as you may get stuck when the current is strong and the wind is working against you - my husband had to help these 2 teenage girls who didn't seem to be strong enough to paddle back to the beach. Pool - 5 out of 5 stars Nice, big pool, with a swim up bar. There are jacuzzi areas (not hot tubs) in the pool and also in-water lounge chairs. There were plenty of lounge chairs when we were there. Sunday was more packed, but we always got to the pool early enough (around 9:30 am) to pick our spot. They also have cabanas that you can lounge in, just go early and put your bag or towel there to mark it. Proved to be useful when the intermitten rain came (which usually lasted about 5 minutes and then it was dry and sunny again). Guests I was afraid the resort will be full of drunk college students since it's all inclusive, but thankfully we didn't see any. But we went in January, not during spring break, so I don't know what their clientele is like throughout the year. When we were there, we saw a lot of families (the kids are about elementary school age) and couples (about mid 30's and up). We're in our early 30's and we're happy to have a quiet vacation with no distractions. We didn't see a lot of honeymooners, but it wasn't during a honeymoon season. We did see a wedding party who seemed to have a lovely wedding at the outdoor chapel. Others While we were there, we didn't see one mosquito. We saw birds, small lizards and iguanas in the gardens, but none came close to us. None came in our room either. Thumbs up overall. We'll definitely go back to this resort for a nice, relaxing vacation. This is our second time in Puerto Rico, so we didn't venture out of the resort. We basically sat at the beach/pool and ate all day - the laziest vacation we've ever taken!

Reviews.Title: “forget all the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: Dbuoy1961
Reviews.Content: I was very hesitant after reading all of the bad reviews and really enjoyed our week. The best food of all of the all-inclusive resorts we have been to and we belong to one in Mexico that is very good. Check in was a breeze, make reservations early at the beginning of your stay and you will have no problem. Nov. 22 starts the busy season, which is when we left to go to the Island of Vieques, and it was getting busy the day before we left (1000 people checked in for two conventions). We were happy that the first part of the week was not so busy. It was nice that it was out of the hustle and bustle of San Juan, close to the jungle and some good kiosk's for really good traditional food for a day trip out, but enjoy the pool, beach, sailing, at the resort. Very relaxing, not too much to do other than eat and relax, but the restaurants are very good and so is the wine selection and all premium liquors. Romantico is the best, and the Italian was next best. Loved it all but the Japanese restaurant was not our favorite. Would recommend this resort to any of my foodie friends!

Reviews.Title: “eh... beautiful facility, ok service, too many New Yorkers”
Reviews.Author: tervs
Reviews.Content: We arrived just before the President's Day Holiday -- although the physical location is wonderful, it is a hike from some of the villas to the pools or restaurants. A tram that is supposed to run on a regular basis doesn't...ah yes, island time. The good -- the location/beach rooms were spacious with comfortable beds, luxurious bathrooms Bar service (with tipping) resulted in excellent service with many premium brands available. The good -- childrens programs kept kids occupied with a range of activities The bad -- upscale restaurants were totally booked or taking reservations at 10pm (fine for us, not fine for families) There was even a sign on the concierge desk that stated that restuarants were fully booked until further notice. Interesting concept since you're not supposed to be able to book reservations until you arrive on the property! The bad -- New Yorkers everywhere who wanted things NOW. People claiming poolside cabanas who never appeared to use them. It's a quick direct flight to SJU from all the metro airports -- that's good and bad. The ok -- food generally was ok -- buffets had some variety. Service was adequate, but uninspired. Casino was small but never crowed while I was there All in all, for an all-inclusive we didn't pay for (company trip) it was alright but I would not spend my own $$ there. There are better choices but at the time we were there, it was the only all-inclusive on the island. I've heard that other Sol-Melia resorts (such as Costa Rico) are far, far better.

Reviews.Title: “Total Rip Off - Not as All-Inclusive as You Would think.”
Reviews.Author: petulia
Reviews.Content: Service - The service was actually quite good the staff was always very friendly and helpful and I do think that they were overall quite attentive. Reception - We arrived at 6:00pm and there was one woman at the reception who was not terribly nice. There was only one family ahead of us but it took us 45 minutes to get checked in. Food - Atrocious. at $1240 a night per room, (and i would say that our room was worth at the very very most $300 a night (actually, i am being very generous), which leaves about $940 for the rest of the amenities per day, $470 per person, the food should be beyond amazing. However, most of the restaurants offer buffet-style appetizer dining and in my book, no classy restaurant makes you run around and serve yourself. in addition to which the different cuisines that they offer (french, italian, carribean, etc) offer largely the same array of dishes for the appetizers, which is very disappointing. The presentation and quality of the food also very disappointing. A japanese restaurant with no chopsticks, for example, is just weird. The all-day dining room service menu stinks too. They offer sandwiches, BLT's, hamburgers, for the most part. The fanciest offerings are a shrimp ceviche and beef carpaccio, but they are mediocre at best. And you are restricted to 2 beers per room per night. What the hell is that? Spa - They tell you it is included, and that the massage/facial treatments are not included, but in fact the use of the spa is only included if you have a facial/massage appointment that day. Those treaments cost between $80-$165 and the spa itself (we had a look) is pretty meager. The spa in my gym at home is set up better than what they have there. In order to even use the spa by itself, you have to pay $28, which makes it in fact NOT inclusive at all as part of the package. We were so annoyed by this that we canceled our appointment at the spa since we just had a feeling that it would not be a very good experience in the end. Beach - The nice part of the beach is that it is never overcrowded since it only serves those staying in this hotel. The problem is that it is completely rocky and you cannot really walk on it without shoes on. there really is no sand to speak of, more like gravelly pebbles, which smart quite a bit on the feet. Not surfable for sure, at least not while i have been here. The Hotel Building - Really beautiful, very photogenic, it really is a sprawling complex that is great and not over crowded and well-decorated. Conclusions - I just think that this is the very problem with this hotel which is that it looks good but tastes like crap. The fact that the food is so mediocre is a really big problem because the least that they can do is offer excellent food and it is just too disappointing in the end and there is no excuse for it given how much money people have to spend here. And honestly, if you just want to relax and have a beautiful time and eat good food and not feel ripped off, then don't go here.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: vpn
Reviews.Content: I visited the Paradisus Puerto Rico with my boyfriend from December 6 through December 13. I chose this resort based on my previous stays at the Paradisus Punta Cana and the special pricing I received. As all the reviews have stated, it is a beautiful resort. The room and bathroom were both large and well appointed. I did not expect the groomed sandy beaches because I had read previous reviews but Iâ€™m sure some guests were disappointed. The food was always good, especially Avocado. I am not one to always plan my evening meals and would have liked the option of an informal evening buffet. We had no difficulties getting reservations for dinner however Iâ€™m sure it would be a problem if the resort were fully booked. To our advantage there were few guests staying this week. I have read that getting people to come to this resort has been an issue and may explain the special pricing of my package. I do take exception to the negative comments about the staff in previous reviews. I felt the staff was no less than great. Special thanks to bartenders Efrain, Shirley and Alex, and server Vanessa. I did find the management team was rude to guests as well as staff. The tension between management and staff was obvious. This may explain some of the less than flattering reviews about the staff. The Melia parent company is also promoting its vacation club that has a building under construction at this resort. This, as well as the pressure for â€œRoyal Serviceâ€�, was somewhat distracting. The entertainment and activities staff was not as I was used to from my many stays at other resorts. The entertainment was a singer in the main bar area every evening and the activities seemed less than enthusiastically promoted. The only major complaint during my stay is what will prevent my return and my recommendation of this resort to others. The resort allows day passes for guests, which in itself is no problem. The problem occurred when 70+ young adults (18-25) from Blockbuster Video converged on the pool at 10 in the morning and drank heavily until 5 in the afternoon. They were loud and obnoxious. When I complained to management that there was no oversight for these individuals I was told there was nothing they could (or would??) do. These guests had paid their $135 and basically too bad. I never did find out what happened to one partier who was passed out cold in one of the outside showers.

Reviews.Title: “There are better options . . . .”
Reviews.Author: jaypatent
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, while the property was lovely, enough lapses occurred that I cannot recommend vacationing here. We stayed just before Christmas 2006 in a Royal Service Oceanfront Junior Suite. We found our room musty and poorly ventilated. The beach was for walking only, and not for swimming--we had to hire a driver to take us to a nearby beach for that purpose. The enormous pool is gorgeous, but not heated. Two restaurants were open for breakfast and lunch. One, the Mirador, was infested with a number of black birds. Several of them landed on the bread line of the buffet and picked away while we were seated there. The remaining quickly circled our table. The staff did nothing, so we left promptly. We ate the rest of our breakfasts and lunches at the other restaurant, which typically opened 5-10 minutes late. We found the "Royal Service" not particularly helpful in making reservations. Rather than arrange travel or tennis for us, for example, we were simply directed to queue up at the front desk, concierge, or travel desk. Royal Service did provide a prompt check in and check out, however, and also gave us access to the charming "Royal Service Suite" as a base of operations. The suite was far less musty than our room, and featured a TV, Internet access, drinks, and a small buffet. Although the hotel boasts that tennis lessons are available at certain times, in fact the staff will simply call local tennis pros to see if one will visit on-site. Nobody was available during our stay, so my daughter didn't receive a lesson. The hotel cancelled one of our restaurant reservations (at Bamboo) just a few hours before we had arranged to arrive. Other restaurants were closed for one or more nights during our stay. I found the food on whole rather undistinguished, with the exception of the fine meal served by the Romantica. The decor of each of the restaurants is quite spartan, and all but the Romantica have what is essentially the same buffet as your appetizer. As buffets go, they are probably above average, but the food was at times underheated. Given the Rain Forest nearby, it was not surprising that the weather was overcast for much of the trip. Scattered showers during the day are apparently very common here. Finally, there was no shortage of mosquitos on site. Overall, not bad, but at this price point superior accommodations are available in this part of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the resort”
Reviews.Author: oksana_19438
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Paradisus for a week. I don't know what people complaining about. Everything was great. Room, food, service. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Probably some people asking for too much attention. Enjoy every minute of your vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Almost Paradise”
Reviews.Author: BaltNj
Reviews.Content: Glad that I had received the advice to book all of the dinners as soon as I arrived. The place is beautiful. Dissapointed having to wait in lines for the lunch buffet. Service could use improvement. A little to quiet and too many kids for a young couple.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it . . .”
Reviews.Author: gmat43
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had never been to an "all inclusive" resort before, so we weren't sure what to expect. The resort is beautiful, the room was very nice. We opted for the "Royal Service", so we had an upgraded room (ocean view with jacuzzi on terrace). Nothing better than sitting in the jacuzzi, wind blowing through the palm trees, watching the ocean. The Royal Service also gets you faster check in/check out, immediate dinner reservations for your entire stay, an adult-only pool area (much stronger drinks mixed at the adult-only pool), a special area to check e-mail, have snacks, etc. All staff was very friendly and helpful. Breakfast and lunch are buffet-style, and the inside restaurant (Carmeno) had plenty of choices. We did not try the Mirador, which is the outdoor buffet. Dinner at the Romantico was fabulous -- the filet mignon was excellent, and the service and atmosphere was as good as I have ever seen. The Bamboo (Japanese cooking at the table) was also very good. We took the rain forest tour which included a hike to the waterfall, which I would highly recommend. We spent time at both pools, and you can reserve a cabana (large covered bed area) to relax and put your towels, bags, etc. Besides a short walk, we didn't spend any time at the beach, because the pools are so nice. Overall, a top-notch vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised by others complaints of poor service...”
Reviews.Author: FastEddie_MA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Paradisus with my wife from December 4-11, 2006. I was a bit worried, given some of the bad reviews I had seen from people who said the staff was rude or otherwise inattentive. Thankfully, this was not my experience. The facility is very nice. Suites were spacious and well-appointed. Housekeeping was good overall, but lost points when they forgot to restock our fridge the last 2 days and also for missing hand towels on a couple days. Other than that, the room was clean and well-attended. The pool area and cabanas were good. We never had any issues getting a good spot by the pool, but to be honest, the facility seemed to be lightly booked the week we were there, so we may have been lucky in that regard. The food and drinks we thought were quite good for an all-inclusive. Not five star as they suggest in their marketing, but not bad. We did not like Mirador, the outdoor restaurant -- and not because of the birds and bugs that many other people complained of. While these are "issues", it is an outdoor restaurant so that's part of the deal. We didn't like the staff there, they were standoffish and a little rude -- this was the only place where we found that to be true. Romantico was our favorite of the restaurants, the food was quite good (French/Contemporary) and the atmosphere was as the name suggests (and little kids are not welcomed there, OK by us). Caribeno was a better bet for breakfast and lunch than Mirador, for the reasons noted above. Bamboo was a typical Japanese/Teppanyaki place, but I found it not as good as your standard Benihana, nevermind a more upscale offering. The food was OK, but only OK. We also had good dinners at Avocado and Toscano, although the apps, salads and desserts were buffet. syle, they were fresh and had a decent selection. Check in was quick and easy, a very short line. We did NOT opt for the Royal Service and I did not want for attention from anyone. The bell staff, concierge, transportation desk, etc. were all very attentive. We got dinner reservations for whatever we requested, pretty much for whatever time we wanted (7:30 most nights). We never waited for a table when we arrived at our reservation time. Again, the resort wasn't crowded while we were there, so your results may differ. All in all, it's a nice facility and we were treated well. They market themselves as a five star resort, and I would say that's a stretch. However, I would place them solidly amongst the 4 star resorts I've stayed at before, and I'm no pushover.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to love it.”
Reviews.Author: m.stanley
Reviews.Content: My party was at the Paradisus for the Thanksgiving holiday and although the grounds were kept up well, facilities really nicely layed out, and food pretty OK for an all-inclusive - I am left a bit dissapointed. The staff gives off an attitude - like eveything is your fault if the dinner reservation is screwed up - they almost seemed annoyed that you are there...and this is WITH royal service. We were paying extra for WHAT? The Royal Service pool is amazing - absolutley beautiful and you can reserve these amazing cabanas for the day...but they do not do a good job at patroling the reservations - basically you need to be your own police when you get to the pool to kick the people out of the cabana you have reserved....not exactly what I want or need to be doing on vacation. The Spa was by far the best experience while we were there. It exceeded my expectations for a spa at an all-inclusive. It is first class and the therapies were very very very well done. I guess when I look back - I am just disspointed in the level of customer service...some people were nice, but overall I felt like I was annoying them to ask a question or resolve an issue. It is really too bad because the resort is well done - has a lot of options (no beach though) - and the food was pleasant for all-inclusive (although the wait service stinks...good luck getting a drink without assalting the waiter). Note to management: Get the staff in line - and don't sell royal service just to rip people off with no SERVICE!

Reviews.Title: “Facility 10+/ Food 3/ Service 3 too bad nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chaver
Reviews.Content: First off never stay here with a group of four or more if you expect to eat without waiting for 1-2 hours even with a reservation. We made 8:00 pm reservations and they were not honored once during our stay. On one occasion with an 8:00 pm reservation we waited until 10:00 pm to eat only to find most of the employees went home and we had to find the manager and complain heavily to get food. We ended up just walking in past the maitre de at most meals because there is no communication between employees as far as table availability. Expect to wait an hour and a half past your reservation time and thatâ€™s only if they don't lose your reservation which happens frequently. This is a real shame as the hotel is beautiful as well as all the facilities. The employees are very friendly and helpful but all complain the hotel is badly understaffed and they are 100% right. On our first day I was very impressed until we went to eat lunch and were greeted by a beautiful indoor-outdoor restaurant with garbage on every single table. Not one clean table what a disappointment! We have been to many resorts in the Caribbean and know to expect service moves a little slow but this place is a joke. On our final night we were told we would have no problem with our reservation,guess what they lost it again which brought out the general manager who thought by handing his card to us would satisfy us, another joke. The General manager told our party we never made a reservation even though we had a confirmed written reservation from the hotel in hand. Whenever you complain they write it down and hand you a card like thatâ€™s supposed to make you feel better. When I told the manager about the lost reservations he incredibly told me (after I refused to take his card again) thatâ€™s the way it is here. To me that means if you don't like it tough luck! So much for the food, incidentally one night (with a 9:00 reservation) we waited until 11:00 pm to be seated, my dish came with only a small piece of fish as we were told there were no vegetables left. Do not come here if you like the ocean as you can't swim in it because of all the sea grass. If you want a chaise lounge be prepared to get up very early as they are all taken by 10:00am. The cabanas by the pool are great but never available unless you are there before sunrise. There are some good things, the bartenders are very attentive and the liquor is top shelve. Some in our party opted for the Royal service including a private pool which is great because the main pool has music blasting so loud I could not listen to my Ipod. My kids were exited to go to the talent show unfortunately it was is in Spanish. The Casino is small but ok, they are short on dealers. Friday night with the place packed there was only one Roulette table with a load of people waiting to play, I asked the manager to open another table and he told me he did not have a dealer. Upon checking out we were greeted by an employee who asked how our stay was. I gave her the information in this review and she told me she heard the same thing all week. I don't know maybe they had a bad week when we were there but I would guess we were not the first to experience these problems with the facility. I feel bad to write this review as the Hotel is really beautiful the employees attentive, it could be a real nice place once they get their act together and hire more staff. One last note Royal Service doesnâ€™t mean much, the ones in our party who opted waited 2 hours to check in because there was no room for them. It doesnâ€™t make sense if you have kids as they are banned from using the â€œRoyalâ€� pool, For adults itâ€™s great if you don't want the zoo scene at the main pool. Also you are supposed to have a butler for the extra $150 a day but nobody ever saw his or her butler after the first day! We had 20 people with us and not one person said they would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: DCAttorney
Reviews.Content: The bad reviews could not be farther from the truth. My husband and I just left this hotel this morning and because we were so nervous about the negative reviews, we could not wait to come back and write a review. I am EXTREMELY picky and never stay in a hotel with less than 4 stars. Everything was perfect from start to finish.We also did the Royal Service Oceanfront service. The staff was FABULOUS. After arriving at the hotel, we were whisked off to the special room where Royal Service guests are checked in. We were offered champagne during this process (or any other drink that we desired). All restaurant reservations were made for us at that time. Then we were taken to our room. The room was very nice and the jacuzzi on the balcony was great. I could write for days about how nice our stay was but the fact that we just booked a December vacation at another Paradisus property in Cancun should tell all! Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Resort”
Reviews.Author: DT123SP123
Reviews.Content: Great Resort! This place was amazing! One of the best vacations I've ever had and I've traveled all over the world and have stayed at many nice resorts, plus I live in paradise in Florida so great review is something special! As for Restaurants you have to make all dinner reservations when you arrive. As for Breakfast & Lunch: Mirador is outside and very casual, El Caribeno is in inside and air conditioned both have great food, a little more upscale. For dinner...must try Romantico...super nice candlelite dinner. This is the only restaurant that requires a dress code, ie: kakais pants and a polo shirt are fine for guys...dress shirt and tie is not required. Very Romantic and a must for one of your nights. Bamboo is a great Japanese Restaurants with Teppanyaki (that's where they prepare the food right in front of you at a table, what a great show) or you can do the sushi buffett. In between Romantico and Bamboo is an awesome Martini Bar, go there before your reservation and have a cocktail. They make great martinis...I heard great things about Avocado which is a American Steakhouse that may guests raved about as well, though I didn't have enough days to check out. All the drinks were top shelf...and since you're in Puerto Rico you need to try some Rum Drinks, try the Rum Punch at the pool and Mojitos are delicious. Don Q and Barcardi are the Puerto Rican Rum Favorites. If you get the basic room you will be so pleased, we had a king bed and it was huge...all rooms are suites. This was my 3rd vist to Puerto Rico and I would go back in a heartbeat. I didn't do any Spa Services but heard they were execellent. This is a great place to visit on a honeymoon, anniversary, or just a get away and even with babies/kids. And if anyone is getting married there...wow you'll love it, they have beautiful area for a ceremony. Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed very minute of Paradisus.”
Reviews.Author: 2ndavid
Reviews.Content: I went for a 4 day R&R with my husband at Paradisus. We really enjoyed our stay. The resort was beautiful and the staff were very friendly. The food was great! The room was clean and getting the royal service was an excellent idea. Felt like we were king and queen for that 4 days. Didn't have to wait in line for check-in and there were so many perks by having the royal service. Highly recommend the royal service. We check out the night before so we didn't have to worry about waiting in line for check out and missing our shuttle. The ocean was right there at the resort and it was very quiet and nice. I enjoyed walking on the beach and taking in the scenery. True, the water was not very blue but it was still very nice. Some day the food was better than another but the dessert always make it up. This website was so helpful in gaining information about the resort. I took all the tips from other reviewers ie. get the royal service, make dinner reservation right away, etc. So thank you to everyone that made a review for this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Frankie and Samara 's Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: trustus
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay at this all-inclusive resort for our anniversary and we are happy to say it was a great choice. We decided to upgrade to royal service, which we recommend. As royal service we bypassed the front desk, into the royal service check-in and promptly given cold beverages. In 5minutes we were on our way to enjoying our vacation. The rooms with a private jacuzzi, the staff service, the royal service pool with bartenders and no children, the restaruants with delicious food surpassed our expectations. We would like to thank the staff members that made it very memorable; melissa from royal service desk,Reynaldo & luis from the lobby bar. Special thanks to royal service pool bartenders Pedro & leslie (pedro that agua de coco was great), Angel and Manuelle our butlers thanks for giving us 5 star treatment. To every couple wanting a great romantic escape these two butlers will make it happen.To all you trip advisory readers,you can read all the reviews good and bad. but, the only true way to find out is to try this place for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, will go back again!”
Reviews.Author: gmroigmiller
Reviews.Content: We went to Paradisus for our honeymoon (Sept 13-18) and had a blast. Driving to the hotel wasn't impressive but, once you get to the Coco Beach area, it is really pretty. We waited a while for someone to check us in for a while, there was noone to be found so when the girl finally arrived, we were a bit upset, hot and very uncomfortable due to the humidity. We left out luggage with the bell hop who took care of it. They have trolleys to take guests from the main lobby to their appointed bungalow. We decided to explore and eat something as we had a long flight due to AA. We ended up going to El Mirador (southwestern restaurant), the food was ok, it was somewhat cold; however, we were greeted immediately, seated and offered a beverage. Our room was awesome, we had a partial ocean view across from the Royal Service. The bed was comfortable, the room had a sitting area, nice size bathroom and a good size balcony. We had dinner at every single restaurant and they just got better per night. We do recommend you make dinner reservations for Romantico (best restaurant, food and service). The night entertainment was great and full of fun; the bartenders (specially Reynaldo and Luis ) were great. The facilities were awesome. Great pool with lots of space to have your own private corner; the pool bar was great and the bartenders there were very attentive and ready to suggest some exotic drink. The beach wasn't all that, so we didn't go in. However, the hotel gets busy on friday to sunday when the locals check in for the weekend. We found plenty of kids running around the pool and a bit noisy than we expected. Overall, we would like to go back for our 1 year anniversary.!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at paradisus”
Reviews.Author: earthangellinda
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our week at the paradisus. It was great!! I was pleasantly suprised with the outcome of our vacation. (I was initially hesitant to stay at an all inclusive report. ) The resort is absolutely captivating!! The rooms were very clean. The pool was so so beautiful. Every where you looked was a beautiful view. The bars had everything you could imagine for your favorite drink. The food was pretty good. The buffets were satisfying. You must try the Romantico!!!!... It was my favorite restaurant!! The staff was great!! They were fluent in english and spanish. They were extremely helpful... a nice young lady at the concierge, Melissa, helped us plan a great "local's" day in old san juan. She went out of her way to do so. Our bell hop, Julio, was so kind. He always greeted us when he saw us and inquired about our stay. He even helped us when we were in dire need of a cigar. The restaurant's staff eventually started to recognize and address us by our names too!! Now that's great service!! There are a few things that the resort could improve on though... Check-in wasn't up to par. We didn't have to wait as long as others, but it wasn't a speedy process at all. And of course, they offerred a ice-cold beverage during the wait. They also provided a tram service to your bungalows.. it was nice, but was more readily available during their peak times (weekend). We had to wait for them to come around the rest of the time. There were timesthen we eventually got tired of waiting and waiked to our bungalow. Great for a romantic walk only if you are sober... different story if you have had a few adult beverages. They should list when each restaurants are open/closed, too. We had to ask daily which would be available for dinner. We absolutely loved Romantico and Bamboo. Advocado was ok.... my steak was over-cooked, but the appetizer buffet compensated for it. We were blindsighted as soon as we got to the paradisus shuttle bus at the airport. No one informed us that there was a $60 shuttle fee to and from the hotel. You just walk up to the stand and the girl tells you to sign before she explains about the fee. There was an AVIS car rental on site... but I would suggest renting your car from the airport. That is was we did. The drive is very scenic. Unfortunately, there is a daily charge to park/valet your vehicle. That shouldn't be the case with an all inclusive resort. These were just the little things that we were able to overlook during our vacation.... The stay was great..it was an extremely pleasant place to stay!! Just chill out and remember that you are ON VACTION!!

Reviews.Title: “Not What You Will Expect For The Money”
Reviews.Author: octubre11999
Reviews.Content: I am used to travel around the world for pleasure and for businness. I have stayed in all kind of hotels and resorts around the world. I have been living in Puerto RIco for the past 11 years and stayed in all kind of places around the island. I live close to Paradisuss (3 minutes away) and choose to stay there just for the fun of it. To start , the checking time was ridiculous (almost an hour) not to mention the check out time wich took over 90 minutes and then another hour waiting for my luggage. The food was terrible and i mean terrible. The room had a bad odor and needed to be freshen up. The hotel outdoors and gardens are beautifull and in excellent conditions. The staff was very friendly. This hotels is far away to be considered a 4 or 5 stars. Only the price is 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: crk723
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night at the Paradisus after spending eight nights at the Ritz in Isla Verde. We wanted to see if it was worth planning a future trip. The lobby, landscaping, rooms, and pool were very nice. It truly gives you the feel of a secluded tropical paradise. However it is very true that they are understaffed and they have horroble service. The only restaurant worth eating at was the La Romantica, which was fantastic. The worst part of our experience was the room service. We were three people and EVERYTHING that we orderd was un-edable. It was disgusting. There is also no real beach at this resort. So if you plan on laying on the beach, I recommend you stay in Isla Verde.

Reviews.Title: “butifull but enogh staff”
Reviews.Author: dioner
Reviews.Content: well let me tell you something their are understaff all the time. Why if you have this buitifull place if you no have the correct quantitty of employees to atend the guest in properly maneers? The only positive was the room attendant Yonelly she did a very good job.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful and Had a BLAST!”
Reviews.Author: skyprincess1004
Reviews.Content: After reading all the negative reviews here, I was a bit worried about my vacation at the Paradisus, but I've realized most of these folks just complain about EVERYTHING. I traveled with a group of 10 to the Paradisus on 7/31 for a 5 night stay, and must say that we had an awesome time. Our shuttle bus pickup from the airport was prompt and our driver did not drive like a lunatic. I was actually surprised that the bus was a real shuttle bus operated by Paradisus, vs. a van that most tour operators use. Check in took literally 10 mins for us, as we had FREE upgrades to Royal Service. There is a different area for Royal Service Guests. RS will give you vip concierge service, your private butler, snacks mid day, and access to the RS pool, where there are no children allowed. If you do decide to purchase RS, its actually only 25.00 per person per night. We did have a tiny problem with one of the rooms smelling very moldy/musty with damp bedding. However, that problem was resolved immediately. I must say that the rooms (we had an oceanfront RS room) are well decorated, spacious, and comfy. We also did not have a problem getting reservations to the restaurants. We were able to get reservations to every ala carte restaurant for a group of 10. The beach is really non existent, but the RS pool was so great that we didn't budge. Also folks, keep in mind that Paradisus i located about 45 mins from San Juan, so if you plan your day trips to old san juan/san juan ahead. We ended up renting two sport utes for an entire day at about 110.00/sport ute. I would definitely stay at the Paradisus again.

Reviews.Title: “stay far,far away. belive All the negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: posatcop
Reviews.Content: Stay far, far away For anyone thinking about going to the Paridisius All Inclusive Resort let me tell you about my adventure at the resort. It started on a Monday july 24 where we were met by a hotel representative at the airport and taken to the resort bus. Being the only family only family on the bus was nice, but the driver thought he was driving a Nascar causing my wife and I hold onto the kids for our lives. Once there, the resort looked beautiful, marble floors to ceilings. Little did I know there was a line down the hallway and exposed to the humidity and heat of the day. After approx 2 hours was waiting with no forward movement and kids wanting to run around and starting to complain about being hungry. I saw several people in line drinking and having a great time in line. People began spilling drinks and leaving their empties on the floor and any place that will hold a drink. Well considering the floors were made out of marble with fountains all long the hallway, not to mention the humidity, turned the beautiful marble floors into a ice skating rink. Kids were slipping all over the place and keeping the kids from wanting to play with every left drink was also fun for next two hours. During this time my son had to go to the bathroom, and after locating the nearest bathroom next to the bar my next adventure started. The bathroom has three rooms, the entrance/sitting room, the washroom, and the room you finally use. Well out of the three stalls available, stall number 1 looked like someone did number 1 all over the walls and seat, stall number 2 looked like someone did number 2 in the trash can next to the toilet, and stall number 3 which appeared to reasonably clean had not toilet paper. After kicking the trashcan out of stall number 2 in order for my son to use the stall was an experience wont forget. By the time I got back the line that still did not move I was already calling continental looking for a flight to go to Disney in order to save my vacation. Unfortunately continental only flew to Huston and Newark. By hour four came around we finally got the front of the line and still looked like we will be in the line for at least another hour, we had it. After asking for the manager we were taken out of the line and escorted out of the lobby in order to voice our complaints to the director. Luckily my wife insisted on have the meeting in a air conditioned room because at this point all I wanted was to go home. After telling the director this story he attempted to satisfy the situation by telling us this was a busy day. After asking him if the incompetence was a management or front end staff problem, he advised me it was a little bit of both. He then attempted to give us 50% off the first day thinking it will make up for the now five hours I had to wait for a room. Needless to say we were given the first night for free because by the time we finally checked in and eaten dinner, the kids were ready for bed. Unfortunately the rest of our stay wasnâ€™t any better. The Italian buffet restaurant they made reservations for us horrible. You would think at an Italian buffet there would be some pasta! For breakfast we eat at restaurant surrounded by netting. It would take to long to get into everything that was wrong, but let me say it was dirty, the staff doesnâ€™t know enough to keep the floors clean so no one slips on the beautiful tile floor, and the food was terrible. When youâ€™re not waiting on line, donâ€™t bother going to the beach. You would think after pouring all that money into the dÃ©cor you would work on the beach. Beach was unusable, full of sea grass, broken coral, and surrounded by huge rocks making it a challenge to get to. Luckily the director gave me his business card because trying to get reservations into a restaurant was impossible. How do charge almost $500.00 a day and canâ€™t eat where you want. Needless to say the director got us into the only two restaurants worth eating at. The Japanese restaurant was great, and the steak house was also very nice, but I could not help but notice that while eating in the restaurants I was told were full. The restaurants were half empty the entire time I was eating. Now the night before we left I saw only two people waiting on line at the front desk. I figure why not check out early for tomorrow. Well it still took 1 hour in order to check out and thank god we did because the next day the power and water goes out for some unknown reason. No one told us what was going on or when to expect things to come back on. Instead employees continued to walk around like nothing was wrong while I quickly gathered our luggage and headed to the lobby looking for the next bus to the airport. After eventually finding a bus that will take us to the airport I thanked god that the airport was far better and safer place to wait for our flight. Kids were able to run around without having to worry about slipping on the floors and the food was a lot better. Next time I will stick with disney where the customer serice is first and formost.

Reviews.Title: “It was a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: portiace
Reviews.Content: This was a vacation disaster. Let me say, we are not overly picky people and expect that an all-inclusive will have some issues. Well this place is horrible. After waiting for 3 hours to get in our room, only after I had to speak to a manager and our children were crying in the lobby from hunger, heat, and exhuastion, the resort lost power the next morning. It was not weather related and the rest of Pueto Rico was fine. Besides there being no lights, tv, refridgeration, a/c, etc., there was no running water! The toilets didn't work. It was disgusting and unsanitary. The thing about it was that there was ZERO communication with the guests, no bottled water, ice, flashlights. No explanation, no information. The power was out all day. The pool was disgusting since it was not being filtered. We saw the hundreds of people in the lobby in line for some sort of help and left. We luckliy had a car and the resources to find another place to stay. I feel for all the people trapped there. We then spent 3 blissfully perfect days at the Ritz-Carelton in San Juan. It is quite scary that a big, supposedly good resort has NO capabilty to handle a major problem like losing power. Can anyone say "hurricane"? Don't risk it and go here. They don't know what they are doing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Food, Beautiful rooms and grounds”
Reviews.Author: DallasCB22
Reviews.Content: Date July 24 - 29, 2006 Experience: Overall is was nice Pros: Great Food, Great Rooms and Beautiful grounds, Nice staff - 80% if whom speak English. 25 minute neck and back message given to evreryone who checks in to the hotel. Cons: We arrived at 3pm and did not get a room unitl 6:30 p.m. It took us 3 1/2 hourws to check in, which needless to say ruined an entire day. There is only one restaurant that is not buffet, breakfast and lunch buffet is fine but wouldl ike to have a sit down dinner. Trolleys that run every ten minutes to take you to your room. Power outage happened on Thursday and the staff did not communicate what would happen to guests if the power did not come back on, after seven hours of waiting around and getting dark, I approached the front desk and was told that due to no lights and water the Government would shut them down in a half hour and take guest to a refugee camp until the problem was resolved. The entertainment was great if you spoke Spanish because they did not offer any English shows at all, they are marketing to a strictly Spanish audience. Delivery of luggage to rooms is very slow, sometimes taking up to 45 minutes. Also, not having children myself, I was constantly surrounded by kids with no place to just sit and relax byt he pool to enjoy a nice swim or a good book. The swim up bar has nore kids sitting there and no room for adults. The resort could use one area for adults. With six jacuzzis they could make one an adult only experience.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 Star but they are working on it”
Reviews.Author: BritRN
Reviews.Content: Arrived to check - in which took over 1 hour. Only 2 people at the desk registering new arrivals. Not offered a drink. I went to the bar and relunctantly I was given bottles of water. We were unaware of the "Royal Service" (RS )so we had to book our restaurants for the week at the concierge. We did manage to get to the restaurants we wanted .We prefer to be waited on and not do buffets and did get those type of restaurants.. From there we decided to get towels and go to the pool . At 3pm there were no clean towels and we were told to walk to the RS pool to get some. Well bad no towels , good that we went there. This pool is Adult only,( no -one under 18yrs) peaceful , elegant and has upgraded wooden sun beds. We figured out very fast this is where we wanted to spend our week. An Upgrade cost us only $25 pp, which in our opinion was definately worth it. If we had done this in advance we would have also been able to check in at the designated RS lounge (so no waiting upon arrival). A continental breakfast and pre-dinner appetizers are available in the RS lounge- worth going there as other people said lines for breakfast were horrible in the main restaurants. Restaurant wise the Bamboo, Avocado and Romatico were very good. Service is not. Having stayed at other recommended " Leading Hotels of the World" this is not one and should be removed from their book until a similar standard is achieved. However, a management team from the Cancun Paradisus are here presently and are making changes! We met some great people and had fun with them. The weather was beautiful. The Spead Eagle catamaran day out was outstanding and the snorkelling better that we expected. Overall I would say a 4 star resort with potential . Cannot tell you how the place is from a view without the RS.Other people were complaining about the noise at the main pool, lines for food and standard of food being mediocre in the self service restaurants. Would visit again but like one other reviewer said there are too many other great resortss out there to visit to keep coming back and many more are better than here

Reviews.Title: “One of the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: susandances
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend at the Paradisus (July 21 - 24) and had a spectacular time! Do Not believe the negative reviews! The resort is absolutely beautiful, from the grounds to the rooms. My husband and I paid for the Royal Service and I would highly recommend that you pay the extra for it. We did not wait long at all to check in (there was one person ahead of us). I will say that the line was extremely long for regular check-in and we met a family that waited 2 hours to check in. Therefore, do the Royal Service if you can. Upon arrival, our butler (Manuel) drove us to the Royal Service pool, reserved a Palapas (wonderful "hut" w/mattress and pillows) for us for our entire stay, got us drinks and booked us reservations for dinner for our stay. You definitely need to book dinner reservations when you arrive. We found that they tend to say that the non-buffet restaurants are booked, but if you insist or just "show-up" you most likely will get in. We ate at Romantico twice and really enjoyed it. The food was very good and the service was excellent. The other night we ate at Avacado which was quite good, too, though not as good as Romantico. We ate breakfast and lunch at Mirador and contrary to what others have written, my husband and I enjoyed our meals there. It is not gourmet food and a lot of it is their local cuisine, but the food is perfectly good. It is an open-air restuarant and views of the ocean are wonderful. Every morning we asked them if they would cut us a fresh mango and they never had a problem with it. We has excellent service there, too! The Royal Service pool is quiet and our bartenders (Pedro and Leslie) were excellent! They would check on us quite often and bring us drinks. Both bartenders made great rum drinks! If you are truly a beach person then this may not be for you. The beach is very rocky and there is a lot of seaweed and what not at the shore. We did take a kayak out one day and we were able to get out of it and swim in the water further out. The ocean water is warmer than the pool! We never really ventured over to the main pool. It was very crowded while we were there (there were 2 conventions). There were many activities going on every day (salsa lessons, water aerobics, karaoke, etc). My husband and I were there for relaxation and that is exactly what we got! I did get a massage at the spa and it was wonderful! If you have the time and the money, I would recommend it! All in all, this was one of the best vacations we have been on. We have been to Puerto Rico before and have stayed at what was once the Hyatt Cerromar and this was much better! The Paradisus is a beautiful resort with lovely accomodations, good food and just a really wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Two Families - One Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: ChipL71
Reviews.Content: As another person mentioned, I'm sorry I checked Trip Advisor before this vacation. It only caused unnecessary anxiety. We did wait about 15 - 20 minutes to check in, so I immediately feared the worst had come true. But I'm happy to say that was just about the only wrinkle (if you can really call it that) in our whole stay. We traveled with friends and they agree that this was a perfect getaway. Each family had a 4 and 6 year old child. They enjoyed the experience as much as the adults. To give some perspective on the food, the two families are from Northern New Jersey and we have dined in some of the finest restaurants in the north east. Frankly with the exception of the scrambled eggs EVERYTHING we ate ranged from good to wonderful. Breakfast and lunch were as good as breakfast and lunch could be. Avocado was our favorite dinner spot. Perhaps we had a nice time because it was in the off season, but take it from someone who lives among people with the highest expectations of service and quality, it is a great resort.

Reviews.Title: “Some flaws .... but overall very nice”
Reviews.Author: Beachlover888
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults) just returned from a week at the Paradisus. For months I read the comments on the tripadvisor and had very mixed feelings about the resort. Well, overall I have to say that we enjoyed our stay very much. Service was very good, friendly and helpful. We got all the dinner reservations we desired and the times we wanted. On the first evening, since we arrived around 6 PM, the concierge desk was already closed. But we went to the Toscana restaurant and were welcomed and seated within minutes. The buffet style Italian food was very good and offered a nice variety and the wait staff was excellent. That was a promising beginning!!! The front desk could not honor our request for a king-size bed room (reason was never explained), but offered us a room with two double beds pushed together (which was acceptable) in the Royal section without the royal service. (The rooms are basically the same in the royal and non-royal section). Yes, the beach is nothing, also the water is clear and warm, but the coral and coarse sand and rocks are not nice. I brought my aqua shoes and spent every day a bit of time wading knee deep in the water, seeing quite a few fish. The pool is large and busy the whole day long. We found an umbrella shaded area (bed) every day, since we were at the pool around 7:30AM. I am a bit puzzled about the remarks of another tripadvisor writer in relation to the pool bar. We usually requested our last drink at the pool around 4:30PM and never had a problem with it not being honored or even having to wait. We never ordered drinks while in the water. Like I said, the staff was great everywhere. We were able to eat in all restaurants and the food was excellent. Bamboo: great Japanese tepanyaki....the day we went, two seats on our table were empty. La Romantica: great food, a lovely ambience and an attentive wait staff Avocado: steak and fish dishes were excellent, service very efficient even on a day when there were a lot of large tables (convention) who required so much extra work. Carabena: breakfast and lunch buffets were always presented very well with lots of things to choose from. Fresh fruit every day, great salads and cold cuts (salmon and prociutto crudo) and a friendly wait staff to refill your water or drinks. I tried the scambled eggs and they were very good, not at all rubbery and dry as some reviewers indicated. Mirador: this was a bit disappointing, especially the evening meal there. It is buffet style and there is no Mexican ambience and the wait staff is the slowest. I would not recommend the Mirador for dinner. Unfortunately, the resort creates some of the problems with insisting of stationing a hostess at the door for breakfast and lunch buffets. One has to constantly wait for the hostess, because she is off seating people, and that creates a backup. We were at the Paradisus when there was a convention with 250 people and it tended to be crowded and loud during breakfast and lunch. Not 5star quality!!! One remark from a previous writer about no food available after 3PM until dinner time, is not correct. The Mirador, which is the outdoor restaurant close to the pool, serves snack food between 3:30 and 5:30PM. We went ithere once and were offered chips and dips, pizza, chicken nuggets and a few other things. So, there is always something to eat. We used the resort shuttle bus for transportation to and from the airport and it was efficient and quick. No problems other than upon arrival at San Juan airport the driver neglected to hold up a sign for "Paradisus", but had only a sign for "travelocity". When we could not locate the bus, I had to call the resort and then a staff member located us immediately and escorted us to the waiting bus. So, a bit of confusion.... but no harm done. The bell hop service worked great upon check in, but we called for luggage pick up upon check out and nobody showed at the appointed time. We wheeled our luggage to the lobby by ourselves. We did not use room service and did not frequent any bars other than the pool bar. If you plan to travel there with children, I think the activity desk does a lot to keep the kids entertained. There were always games offered and other activities and we saw a lot of happy kids. In summation..... the resort is beautiful and the grounds very nice. Would we go there again? .. probably, but given all the other places in the Caribbean, we tend not to go to the same place every year. If you have any questions, please feel free to send me an email. I will be happy to give you my view.

Reviews.Title: “I'm here now, July 14, 2006”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel grounds are beautiful. There was a recently a management change. They still have a way to go. I understand there have been several management changes in the last two years. Service in restaurants is very inconsistant. Room service gets our order correct 50% of the time. Best food is in Bamboo and Romantico restaurants. Overall, this hotel has great potential. But, has falls short now. Tour desk only has one person. Generally a wait to get information. However, offers variety of excursions. Recommend 4 wheeler trip. No food service at Royal Service pool. If you want food delivered, you must order room service and have the food delivered to your room and carry it yourself to the pool. Odd!! Recommend Royal Service for couples. Lots of small kids and blaring mexican hip-hop music at main pool. Lots of locals here on weekends, with children. Two additional luxury hotels are scheduled for completion next to Paradisus within the next few years. Hope everything is up to speed by then or they will have a difficult time.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Blast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I picked the Paradisus Puerto Rico, because we had stayed at Sol Melia All Inclusives before (Playa Conchal Costa Rica), and we were curious about seeing Puerto Rico. We also thought we could (and did) get a good deal in the off-season (last week of June). After we made the reservation, we had some difficulty getting answers to some of our emails, but were still excited to go. Then someone suggested checking out Trip Advisor. Wish we had not. The reviews were negative, and just made us anxious about the whole thing. As it turned out, we had a great time. The food, facility, service, area etc. were all wonderful. We play golf, and the Resorts nearby were excellent (Coco Beach and Rio Mar). If you play golf, you must play the Lakes and Mountain Courses at Coco Beach, and the River course at the Rio Mar. The hotel will take you to the Coco Beach course for free, and pick you up. We did not run into a single unhappy person at the hotel, and everyone was wondering what provoked those negative reviews. As for ourselves, we have nothing, but good things to say. As others have said, you should make your dinner reservations for the whole week as soon as possible. Also be advised that if you rent a car and drive there, the self-parking is $10.00 per day. The area and facility are beautiful. If you do go, plan ahead for checking out. We called three times to get our bill, so that we could do Express Check-out. We finally gave up and went to the front desk. Luckily no one was in line and we were immediately taken care of. We hated to leave, because we had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Not very All Inclusive at all...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed a couple of times this year (work-related). Here are my observations: * Rooms are gorgeous, perhaps the best thing the resort has, besides the lobby. * Room service takes almost an hour, with a $3 charge (all inclusive?). Still, we decided to keep using room service for the reason stated in the following bullet. * Restaurants are not open all the time. They open at 6 or 6:30AM and then they close at 11-11:30AM. Then, they open at 12:00 to close at 3PM, and then you have to wait until 6PM for dinner. So, if you just decided to go to bed late because you kept hanging out or watched movies until 3AM, then you have to adjust yourself to their schedule so you get to eat something. Unless, you use cold-food room service. Then, if you are at the pool and suddenly you realize it's 3:30PM, you're [----] because you have to wait until 6PM (that, of course, if you happen to have a reservation for that time!!!!). So, if you're hypoglycemic, don't ever come to this hotel! Or, leave the pool, go back to the room, and ask for cold-food room service... again. * Reservations: They sell you this hotel over the internet and ads as a top class resort with amazing restaurants blah blah blah. But, the restaurants are always full, and you have to make reservations the day you check in, not before. So, you may have to wait until 10PM to get to eat to at the Bamboo (Japanese restaurant), which is amazingly great, by the way, but always full. There's always buffet food at the Mirador and CaribeÃ±o, but believe me, the food is not very good. The restaurants close before midnight, and there's no such thing as midnight munch like in cruises. Either you starve, or go back to your room (even if you're supposed to be out enjoying the resort lobby and facilities) and, guess what, order room service. * Bamboo and Avocado are the best restaurants. However, I have observed that now they are serving much less in restaurants than before, and the quality of the buffet food in general (especially lunch and "dinner") is declining. * The Pool is beautiful, kids will have a great time. * The Beach is probably the ugliest beach in Puerto Rico, by far. It's full of rocks, not much beach sand, and just ugly. * Bars/pubs: This is the must disgusting thing. There are only three bars at the resort, an ALL INCLUSIVE resort, and I will discuss each of them separately to send the message clear of what's wrong with this resort. - Pool bar: Pool bar is great, bartenders are great, drinks are great. Half of the bar is outside the pool and the other is inside (it is not very big, but nice). For some reason, at about 3 or 4PM they close the "outside" section of the bar, so if you are not inside the pool, the bartenders "kindly" tell you that you could keep ordering but by standing by the edge of the pool, screaming at the bartender, and finally bending over to get your drink; this is after having to compete with other people at the pool. I think this is outrageous. How could they just close one side of the bar when at least half the people at the pool are is outside!!! And they do this everytime, it is not that I stayed once, one day, and saw that... - Casino/Pub bar: This bar is OK. People can smoke inside and air circulation is horrible, so it stinks as bad as you could imagine. Furniture absorbs all the smoke smell, so even during the day the room stinks. Bartenders are great, they are not the problem (they are probably the only good thing - as far as service goes- the resort has), the problem is that at 1AM (or before), during the weekends, the bar is closed, as well as the lobby bar (the next in my review), so you, as a tourist in an ALL INCLUSIVE resort, have nowhere to go, but to your room?????? - Lobby bar: Lobby bar is on a nice spot. Bartenders are great, as usual. The only bad thing about this bar is that they close it shorly after midnight! Yes, you're on vacation on a resort that they sold you as an ALL INCLUSIVE resort, and before 1AM you have nowhere to go besides your room. No restaurants, no gazebos with food or drinks, no bars!!! They even shut down the lights and the fans at the LOBBY!!!!!!!!!!! Could you, for just a second, imagine this!!!??? You can't even keep talking to your friends, wife, or whoever you met that day, because they shut down the lobby, the only thing left open in this All Inclusive resort??? These people want to save it all! The funniest thing is, and this is true, if you ask for leaving the bar open, or for at least get a couple of beers out, they "kindly" tell you that you could order beers guess where?, yes!, from your room!!, and they limit the amount of beers you could order. It's so pathetic you have to laugh. With all I have told you, it would be hard to believe that the hotel is paying for a woman to sing every night by the lobby bar, but they do, only that she thinks that she is singing to her mirror because she is just only singing for her pleasure; she does not ever connect with the people around. She has a great voice, and surely has the talent to entertain the people better, but what she is doing now is just a show for herself; she even sang the Titanic song the last time I went... With the stinky casino/pub bar as the other option, I have had to stay at the lobby bar at night and listen to the most annoying singer I've ever watched in my entire life. When she sings salsa or merengue, there's only a few people dancing, and the only could be her. I've been to the Paradisus in Dominican Republic, and the singer(s) over there put a show that has the entire lobby dancing all night long!, and what do they play?, salsa and merengue!, and bachata too! To finish, I know Puerto Rico very well and there are many other places to stay which are far prettier, better, and funnier. There are hotels of all types in all metropolitan areas (San Juan, Ponce, Mayaguez), and "Paradores" (B&Bs) on most towns, where you don't have to be stuck in an all-inclusive resort that does not allow you to eat what you want, when you want, and tells you when to go to sleep. In summary, think well before making your decision to come to this hotel, and consider other options if you want to visit the Island (check tripadvisor.com for reviews of other places).

Reviews.Title: “the wrost service ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just found out that the Paradisus (or hell) resort illegally overcharged my credit card of $1745, besides paying for my room $1204! I never authorized that payment. I also found out that I paid double one night. I'm currently trying to get my money back and I'm struggling in trying t find somebody who just answers the phone! It took me more than an hour to check out, and it was the same treatment for everybody, just because they have one or two people at the front desk and the slowest computer system ever. Other people have been overcharged. Everybody in my group complained. Stay away from that resort if you can!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!! Don't believe everything you read”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
