Reviews.Content: I was not looked forward to my recent trip based on the reviews but after the first day my mind was changed. The food was good. People must have only ate at Mirador Grill for them to say it is bad. I will say that the Caribeno did have better breakfast and lunch than Mirador Grill. Toscano was good. Joel the Maitre D' is great and very friendly. Bamboo was excellent! Romantico very good! Roberto is a great waiter. Manuel at the Royal Service Pool Bar was EXCELLENT!! He was always walking around making sure you were ok and if you needed another drink. Room was very nice and spacious. Lobby was always lively at night. The staff was always friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “the worst service I ever got”
Reviews.Author: SERVICIO
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Paradisus Puerto Rico after I spent over $5000 US, the hotel is beautiful, but the services are so bad that after two days on the property you just want to check out and get your money back. First when asked for a manager to present a formal complaint no one was available, I even asked to speak to the GM, but everytime I asked for him it was not available and please do not go to the front desk and report a complaint, because the aptitud of the people at front desk it is something. My room was never cleaned, one night my wife and I were drinking an a boltle a wine felt on the floor, could you believe that a lot of pieces of glasses were under the bed when we left the hotel. The food is horrible, and do not order room service because it will be forever, it seems that no one care, I talked to one of the employees and he said, that the managment only think about firing employees and managers to see if things gets better, he said that most of the employee including some manager are looking to get out there, beacuse with 2 and half years of the opening and the hotel have not change a bit, that they want employees do work with only 4 waitress for restaurant. Please if I was you I will go some place else they are do false advertising telling costumer about been 5 star and I don think they are even close to two.

Reviews.Title: “Some people can't enjoy themselves!”
Reviews.Author: JSmith48
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to the Paradisus in Puerto Rico during the last month of June. We loved it, however some people are never happy. Suggestions for travelers *Book your dinner reservations for the week when you check into the hotel. We enjoyed all of them except the Mirador. *If you don't mind a walk, take your bags to your room yourself. This gives you some time to familiarize yourself with the grounds of the resort. (They are awesome!) *Get the Royal Service, if you can. You have access to a separate pool for adults only. There are gorgeous cabanas and chairs. You have a separate bar. (Manuel, the bartender, was awesome.). Check the website for all of the other additional items that are available. *The beach is a natural one. It is owned by the government. It is rocky, but swimable. Bring flipflops or water shoes. *If you have any problems or questions, ask a staff member. Please don't sit and complain. *Check the tour desk for the tours in the area. We went to the rainforest and loved it. It was worth the extra money. *Stay as long as possible!

Reviews.Title: “Believe the HORROR STORIES! They OVERBOOK even confirmed guests are sent away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked and confirmed a 7 night stay with my family. I also scheduled and paid for airport pick up for me and my 3 kids. We arrived at the airport - no pick up. Leaving me stranded at the airport with 3 kids late at night. I called the hotel to find out where they were and they told us they had overbooked and we would be put at the Courtyard Marriott for the 1st 3 nights of our stay. They said they would compensate us but then they charged my credit card after my stay! I am still trying to get a refund and they give me the run-around! I have made over 10 phone calls and not been able to resolve the matter. The other guests who booked through a 3rd party (i.e. web based like this site) were told they couldn't get any compensation. I did everything by the book with confirming and scheduling directly with Melia reservations. Confirmation #'s meant nothing. They overbooked by 23%! Over 100 people were put out in random places. When we finally checked in on day 4 I had to wait 1 1/2 hours standing on line in the lobby to check in only to find out it would be another 6-7 hours to get a room. They showed me a closet where I could change me & my entire family if we wanted to . Yes the facility is pretty but you may never actually get to it like many other guests I met. Even honeymooners were shuttled off to other 3rd rate hotels like us. I had read some complaints about dining and stuff but had figured some people are just fussy - I didn't care about that stuff. It was fine not 5 star but fine for a family vacation. What was not ok was asting my vacation time and money . DO NOT TAKE A CHANCE IF YOU VALUE YOUR TIME! I have written the management already and I had to dispute the charge with my credit card company because from what I can tell they have made no effort to resolve the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved It! The Negative Reviews Are Not To Be Trusted”
Reviews.Author: cinnabar75
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved it! At first glance my breath was taken away. The lobby dÃ©cor was extraordinary. I was very skeptical about staying at this resort because I read all of these negative reviews about it and because I was traveling right after the recent fiscal crisis in Puerto Rico. To my surprise there was nothing to worry about. The ambience at the Paradisus put me in a relaxed tropical vacation mood right from the start. Getting stressed out was impossible at this place. Donâ€™t believe all of the negative reviews. I was a nervous wreck during my whole flight worrying about what was waiting for me at this resort. The service was excellent. The staff was extremely attentive whether you tipped or not (I forgot to tip a few times). The only service issue I had was that housekeeping removed the washcloths and towels from the room daily but they would only replace them if they removed them from the towel rack. I know, silly but true. I never put my washcloths and towels on the rack after I use them so everyday I had to request a washcloth and towel. That was annoying. The food was excellent. I enjoyed all of the restaurants with the exception of the Midori Grill. The Midori Grill is the day snack eatery. This is the place to go if you missed one of the other restaurants for breakfast, lunch, or dinner but you are still hungry. The food tasted good but â€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦.The Midori Grill belongs to the birds, literally. I am not at all comfortable dealing with birds of any kind. Because I am a native New Yorker, every bird is a pigeon. Those birds flew all over the place. They walked on the tables, they ate every piece of unattended food (including the buffet) and when they were done they pooped. Yuk! I only had to eat there on day 1 of my vacation because I neglected to read the electronic itinerary in the front of the resort that tells you what time everything opens and closes. Donâ€™t make that same mistake; you do not want to eat with the Puerto Rican pigeons. The food at the other restaurants was excellent and so was the service. I read reviews that stated that the buffets had many unidentified foods and that the eggs were not safe to eat. I eat Caribbean food often so I knew what the few native dishes were. The breakfast buffet had an eggs station. I donâ€™t really care for trendy food presented with chocolate drizzle and parsley on the plate so I was satisfied with what they had to offer. I had no complaints at all. The Beach was very small and full of shells. It was not very appealing but I am not a beach person so that did not bother me. However, before I left the resort I toured the grounds with the Melia Club and I discovered that the Paradisus has a section for Royal Services. This section is cut off from the rest of the resort. It has separate villas, separate staff, a separate pool, and a separate beach which is beautiful. The common traveler doesnâ€™t have access to the Royal Service facilities and for good reason. Those people paid $$$$$$$ to be isolated. So if you want to have access to the fabulous Beach at the Paradisus thatâ€™s the way to go. But the pool will make up for the beach, if you donâ€™t want to spend that kind of money. The pool is phenomenal. Itâ€™s huge! It has a swim up bar, pool beds so you can lie down and be in the water at the same time. There are real beds (not sure what they are called) on the outside of the pool as well. All of the activities take place around the pool. You can have a drink in the pool, step out to have a salsa dance lesson and then get back in the pool. It was great! The spa looked nice from the outside. lol Unfortunately, I did not have time to take advantage of the spa. The live entertainment was very enjoyable. It enhanced the mood of the lobby. The casino was small and quiet. If you are a casino person, then you know that quiet is not good sign at a casino. The nightclub was nice. They tried to play a variety of music to please all of their patrons but they played mostly Latin music. Some nights there was a live DJ and other nights they played recorded music. I have a very nice time there. The movie theater was nice. I missed the movie that I wanted to see because of a misprint on the activities schedule but I got to see the facility and it was nice. The Paradisus was a great value for the money. I recommend booking off season to get a better deal. I would also recommend that you do a few things when you get there: 1) Make dinner reservations for every night of your stay all at once, shortly after you arrive. You can always change them later if you need to. 2) Have patience with the front desk. The atmosphere is very laid back so donâ€™t expect check-in to move quickly. 3) Go to breakfast early if you come late you will miss the egg station. I loved the egg station. Overall I loved the resort and I plan to go back next year and stay a little longer. There were so many things that I did not get to do because I had such a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Checked out and went to another hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went to Paradisus this past Monday June 12, 2006 for a 5 night stay. I tried to book a private Villa but they were all sold out. I booked a Ocean View Suite with Royal Service. We paid $660. per night for two people for this All Inclusive Resort. Billed as a 5 Star I was very disappointed. I understood their would be families at the resort but was not prepared for the multitude of kids all over the place. Children were running rampant in the restaurants with their parents oblivious to the noise the kids were creating. A 2 or 3 year old girl laid on her back in the middle of the restaurant and screamed until she finally tired out and stopped. No one stopped her. When I asked the hostess why they allowed it she looked at me sheepishly and said "when we speak to the parents they get insulted and raise a fuss". After Dinner the Lobby Bar had entertainment. After one song the Singer brought up 3 cute little girls to sing and dance with her. This went on for the rest of the show. A little cute goes a long way. We had dinner in Avocado the first evening. They bring you your steak cooked to order but everything else is Buffet. And Buffet food it was. Dry Vegetables, uninspired cooking. Paper napkins. The waiter asked me to hold my fork as he removed my salad dish as I "would need the fork for the entree". We are 5 Star but please hold on to your only fork. As there was no Break Plate my only option was to hold on to the fork or to place it on the table. At least it gave me time to not pay attention to the Romper Room going on around me. Dinner on Day two was going to be at the Mirador Grill. We got to the grill but it was closed due to rain. When I checked with Royal Service I was told it was moved to Toscano and I "should have been informend". I eventually found out that they had left a message for me but the light on the phone was not working.... 5 Star. The room was acceptable but by no means was it luxurious. The Jacuzzi was in fact a single jacuzzi tub that you would have in your home bathroom. I was very suprised by it as I expected it to be more of a two person Hot Tub. For some reason sitting in a single bathtub was not what i was envisioning when I booked the suite. I brought 5 movies that I had wanted to see for the past year but never could find time for and was told that the hotel could not provide a DVD player as it violated the contract with their in room Movie providor. The in room moview were $20.99 each and they were not the ones I wanted to see. I brought my favorite CD's to listen to but was told the they could not provide a CD player. As most hotels have CD players as part of the radio it never occured to me to bring my own. 5 Star. Royal Sevice Check in was a lengthy process and my room was not ready until 45 minutes after arriving. At 4pm when I did get my room key the housekeeper was still in the room cleaning. I waited on the Balcony for 15 minutes while she finished. I thought the staff was very very friendly and listened sympathically to my requests for a DVD or CD player. I even asked the one Royal Service person if someone could buy a TV and DVD player at a local store and I would pay for it but they never got back to me. The Assistant Front Office Manager Omeira was wonderful and very accomodating. After two days at the Resort I checked out and checked into Las Casitas Village at the El Conquistador Hotel. It was beautiful, Serivce was incredible, Food was delicious, my Casitia overlooked the Sea and the Balcony was huge. If you have children Paradisus is a perfect place for your family. Lots of food, and very kid friendly. If you want a quiet weeks vacation go somewhere else. The royal service pool was the only place that was kid free. I heard that Romatico "restaurant" was kid free but never had the oppurtuninty to try it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family vacation”
Reviews.Author: QueenBee22
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our one year old in April and spent 5 heavenly nights at Paradisus. We opted for a royal service beachfront suite, and we just loved our time there. It was money well spent, in our view. What we liked: the huge pool and cabanas, the groomed beach, the weather (the place is magically protected from bad weather, seriously) the play area for kids, the babysitting services and the super friendly staff. Our balcony jacuzzi was sweet; your butler will run you a bath (I'm not kidding - a GREAT experience!) Room for improvement: the food quality at Toscano's (better to eat at El Mirador, outside) the availability of children's items in the gift shop (swim diapers, especially.) Wish we'd known: 1) Book your dinners as soon as you arrive-don't wait! I highly suggest Bamboo (benihana-like dining) and heard Avocados was good, though we never did eat there ourselves; Romantico is fusion cuisine-small portions of savory foods (no kids allowed) 2) Royal Service pool area is for adults only. Someone complained when my husband took our baby swimming there, so we spent most of our time at the (huge, beautiful) public pool 3) You can reserve Royal Service cabanas; cabanas by the main pool are first come, and usually occupied by 8 a.m. Overall we highly recommend the resort to couples with kids and would not hesitate to endorse the babysitting services. It's a great way for Mom and Dad to get out for a night alone and was worth every penny. We spent two nights in San Juan after leaving the resort and realized just how pampered and spoiled we'd been. Despite some hesitation after reading a few negative reviews I'm SO glad we booked it. We'll definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “has its ups and its downs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose the Paradisus for our honeymoon. We stayed in a oceanfront royal suite. The resort was very beautiful but the food was not the greatest.After 6 days if I never se another buffet I will be very happy. Whatever you do do NOT go on thebeacha ndbring your bug repellent- the sand fleas ate us aive. Make sure you reserve a parador hut around the pool - it is heaven. Royal Service is nice, but the check in took an hour and the response time to pick up our bags at check out was horendous. Rooms are gorgeous though! And staff is very nice. Best restaurants are Romantico and Bamboo by far. I would definitely recommend taking the tour tothe rainforest and San Juan. Tour Guide - Jose - is fantastic. And Manual - at Royal Service Pool was the best bartender in the resort!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Paradisus”
Reviews.Author: happy_traveler10
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend at the Paradisus, Puerto Rico and had a wonderful experience. I had already booked the hotel before I read the reviews on TripAdvisor. There were several bad reviews that had me concerned but my concerns disappeared quickly once I arrived. We were there for 4 nights over the Memorial Day weekend and had excellent service. The pool was fantastic! The drinks were very good and easy to obtain! The food was good (typical for an all-inclusive)! Our rooms were very nice and clean! It was only my boyfriend and I and we had a great time but there were also a lot of families there that seemed to be enjoying themselves as well. We booked our dinner reservations immediately upon arrival and had no problem getting what we wanted. We did get a good rate thru an on-line deal of approx. $300 per night and we more than got our daily allowance out of the deal. Highly recommend this hotel and would definitely return to this exact same facility! Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Paradisus Properties”
Reviews.Author: FoodieGal
Reviews.Content: Hi travelers... I am so glad to hear about the Paradisus Puerto Rico. Since you mentioned you are planning to go to the Paradisus Punta Cana, Dominican Republic, I thought I'd let you know you will be super happy! I've been to Paradisus Punta Cana, and last January to Paradusis Palma Real - both Punta Cana area. My husband and I never want to leave. You can check out my reviews in the Punta Cana forum. Meanwhile, we're headed for Puerto Rico the first of July. We're staying at a condo, visiting family, but I sure wish it was Paradisus I was headed for!

Reviews.Title: “It really wasn't bad!”
Reviews.Author: BrownieSI
Reviews.Content: After reading all the negative reviews, I started to wonder if my husband & I had made the right choice. Thankfully, we did! The Paradisus is a beautiful, relaxing place to vacation. My husband & I took the Royal Service plan & were taken care of the minute we stepped off the shuttle. They made all of our dinner reservations at each restaurant, our butler prepared our jacuzzi every night & we got a 2 for 1 couples massage at the spa (which was wonderful by the way). The Royal Service pool was beautiful. No one under 18 was allowed, so it was quite peaceful (we left our kids at home for this trip, so it was bliss). My only complaint is that the darn pool bar closes at 5pm!! Way too early if the sun hasn't even gone down yet & people are still out relaxing. Manuel & Brad made some mean drinks & were very accomodating. We had an ocean front room which was gorgeous with nice marble floors, stunning views & a huge bathroom. The resort doesn't have mcuh of a beach (very rocky & still being developed); but they make up for it with their large pools. The casino was fun, the food was more than edible (Bamboo, Romantico, Avocado, Toscano, Caribeno); we always found something good to eat. It's an all-inclusive resort, food is always average or above average at all-inclusives. Bottom line is, if you want a beautiful place to visit, relax & get pampered, this is a nice choice. The staff is very friendly & eager to please. I would definitely go back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Vacation EVER.”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoRockstar
Reviews.Content: I was our first time in Puerto Rico and I'm glad we didn't stay in San Juan. The paradisus is in Rio Grande about 30 mins away from san juan. We rented a car at the hotel the last 2or 3 days we were there and went into san juan. It was easy to find and a nice day trip there is a town called Fajardo where you will find Luquillo beach and the 7seas beach, absolutely awsome and only about 15mins from the Paradisus. If you want to hike 5 mins to the El Yunke Rainforst, great hiking trails. The nice thing is that you don't need to leave the hotel. There is entertainment, food, pool, beach, activities, snorkeling, wind surfing all for FREE. It was one of the BEST vacations we've been on. We like to travel, but if you want a relaxing get away, THIS is it. They take care of everything, anything you want. Its a beautiful hotel, newer facilites, it has a fitness center. there is abundance of anything you want any time you want. All you have to do is ask. The staff is SO awsome everyone there rocks especially Santos and Alex the activies guys. They have entertainment at night and an AWSOME pool. If you enjoy snorkeling (like we do) they will take you out away from the shore and drop you off in this BEAUTIFUL sea of fish and coral and starfish and sting rays and squid its so cool. We saw a sea turtle during one of our windsurfing rides. The best part is, you can go over and over again. They don't mind, really. The food is unbelieveable. 5 Star quality. Their one restaurant Bamboo is like Bennihana the Japanese food place Oh man, I could go on and on with how awsome this vacation was. The bathrooms are really nice and the rooms and room service is worth it! If you are willing to pay for it let me tell you this is the place for it! We don't have kids, but I imagine that if you are a family with kids and you need a vacation, this is the place to go. They babysitt and have activities for the kids while you relax and swim up to the pool bar for another drink. This place makes you feel like you are the king of your domain. - The staff, from the cart drivers, to the front desk, to the bartenders and activities people are too much for me to put into words. I would recomend the Paradisus to anyone and everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Even with a few minor issues, we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Like many others, after reading the negative reviews, I thought we were about to waste a whole lot of money and time on this resort, but not the case! I am 7 months pregnant and my husband and I wanted to take a last relaxing trip before I couldn't fly anymore and the Paradisius was a perfect spot for it. First, for anyone who's been pregnant, you can appreciate how important it is to have access to food at any time of day. And the huge pool provided plenty of exercise just swimming from one side to the other. It seems like all of the other reviews during the time we were there were all positive, and I think the main reason was because the resort was empty! The pool chairs and awesome little Bali huts were easy to get at any time during the day, check-in/out was a breeze, restaurants were fairly empty, and there were few enough people that we kept seeing the same people and met some very nice couples. I HIGHLY recommend going in off season and trying to hit a time where there are no conventions there - we were very aware of how different it would have been if there ware large and rowdy groups there. Even when people came in for the weekend, it started to get a bit more crowded and less peaceful (we stayed from Sun-Thurs, which was perfect).There were many families with small children and I was surprised at how well suited it seemed to be to them too. Food: We loved breakfast and lunch at the Carabeno and didn't bother going anywhere else. Great healthy salad bar and fruit options. If you don't like healthy food though, you probably won't be as happy - hot food wasn't all that good. But because it was so damn hot out, we loved all the fresh fruit and vegetable options. As for dinner, they can definitely use some help with the reservation service. The process is just screwy, but we were satisfied with all of our meals. And actually started asking for 9-9:30 reservations as it gave us plenty of time to nap/relax after the pool. We avoided the Mirador buffet as it didn't look all that appetizing. We did have an issue with the Concierge making some reservations for us, but turns out they were un/mis-informed so we weren't able to get to Vieques, which was our goal. They were supposed to send us to the Tour Desk to make any reservations (which we didn't even know existed). So just make sure to double-check plans and reservations and make sure you're working with the right people. All in all, we had a wonderful, relaxing stay, found the grounds and the rooms extremely comfortable and elegant (the lobby area is to die for), and the staff friendly, if occasionally underinformed. Provided you're not going when the place is packed, we would highly recommend the Paradisius.

Reviews.Title: “Nice grounds, high price includes Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was easily the most expensive hotel I've ever stayed at, but I figured I would pamper myself for a few days. My vacation started off great. I thought this place was incredible. Compared to the Caribe Hilton, Paradisus was paradise. The grounds were beautifully maintained, gorgeous landscaping, huge pool, secluded beach (although no swimming or snorkling because of shallow rocky waters), nice rooms, friendly staff, nice bars and entertainment, and great plantation like relaxation areas. The food varied - breakfasts and lunches at Mirador were OK. Decent selection, certainly edible. The birds flying around the food and eating off people's plates when they got up to get drinks was a little gross, but tolerable. I ate dinner two nights at Avocado and one at Toscano. I was impressed. It was much better than I expected based on the reviews I read. I thought I was in heaven. However, I woke up after my second night with three dozen welts covering my arms and legs. I did not recall receiving one bug bite when I was awake. I remembered reading that bed bugs are an increasingly common problem. After a little internet research, I found out that the bites fit the classic pattern of bed bugs. When I complained to management, they sent a maid to the room who spent 30 seconds scanning the bed in the middle of the day and concluded that there were no bed bugs. I have NO DOUBT these were bed bug bites. What had been a great vacation was ruined! I felt extremely self conscious going out to the pool area covered in itchy welts which still, one week later, have not gone away. Try sleeping knowing that there are blood sucking bugs waiting to come out! I know these things can happen in even the poshest hotels. That's fine. What bothered me was management's response. They completely blew me off, did not apologize whatsoever, and refused to even refund a single dollar. When you are spending hundreds of dollars a night to be in paradise, you expect to be treated better! Paradisus was OK, but not worth the $. If you go, bring some potent bug spray and long sleeve sleeping attire.

Reviews.Title: “Just enjoy the resort!!!!”
Reviews.Author: EmarieR
Reviews.Content: When I started reading the reviews in the Site I got very nervous thinking that I was bringing my family to a horrible place. VERY FAR FROM IT!!! My family and I had a wonderful time here at the resort!!! At the beginning of the our stay we where amazed at the beautiful surroundings. This resort is what I call "Luxurious -comfort". Although it looks very upscale it's inviting to relax in the lobby and enjoy cocktail in one of the sofas. During the evening time the ambience changes completely to candle lit paradise!!! It was beautiful... During the day my husband and I took our two children (7 & 11) to the Kids Club which is included in the price (GREAT!!! Tired of paying at other resorts). We went out to relax by the pool while overlooking all the kids in a nearby area playing games. We had a blast!!! Food which was the main concern wasn't the problem. We went to Bamboo and the chef did everything in front of you with a show. Great asian fussion!!! Also in Toscano the pasta selections where good and hot. Romantico I went with my husband and had the surf and turf!!! Excellent service and food!!! Plus room service is included and the kids could eat at any time... Needless to say, I think people should go there and ENJOY the resort. If you go with a misconception or predisposition of having a bad time, and you can't look beyond that, believe me... you will have a bad time. It's fun and family oriented... an experience and having a good time it's a matter of ATTITUDE!!! My family and I are planning to return over the Holidays!!! Lewis Family - New York

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: lexiuncc
Reviews.Content: Everyone is right...the grounds, the rooms, the lobby...the welcome...Nice as can be.... And that is where is where it stops. If you LOVE buffet- eat here. I have never been to an all inclusive that serves it for both breakfast and lunch! AND they are cold!!!! I was going to orginally write that the Mirador was the best place for breakfast because of the omelet station....the only one around. BUT there was HAIR in my omelette! EWWWW Then when I asked the gentleman to kindly remove my plate because it had hair in it (three pieces) he says, OK, and smiles! WHAT!!! Anyway, that along with the gentleman who had a bird defecate on him, and then to top it all off I had to pay 15 for a raft rental...this is no five star. I have been to the best, and this is not it. I will say the dinners at both ROmantico and Bamboo where phenominal. Some other items: Spa manicure- 48.00, the pedicure-98.00 and this is just the standard. (Bring over 250.00 if you and your loved one want to go!) Toscano- Is a buffett even though you have to make reservations. And by the way...their idea of Northern Italian is pizza! YUCK They will not let you slide on the 12 noon checkout. We tried because they were at low occupancy, but they said that they needed OUR room right away. I stayed in a standard room folks. They charge you for room service. 3/per delivery Call ahead on the last day you are there for your bags, as they never picked up ours. BIG ONE!!! No activities at all! If you have been to Sandals and loved it you will hate it here.

Reviews.Title: “Believe everything you read!!!”
Reviews.Author: LadyM600
Reviews.Content: Just came back tonight from a 5 night mother daughter (aged 24) getaway. While we had a nice time, this resort has the potential to be so much more. Unlike some of the other reviews, we had no trouble checking in. After check-in, we attempted to make dinner reservations. Like all the other reviews, we were told all the special restaurants were booked except for 9:45. We were forced to eat in Toscano the first night (chain food Italian at best) and Caribeno the second night...another average buffet. My daughter befreinded some staff and somehow, we were able to get reservations for the other nights. The Bamboo was good if you like Benihana type food. Romantico, the restaurant that is supposed to be the best, was anything but. Service was fair and food to match. We really did enjoy Avocado. We both had different type steaks that were cooked to our order. Also, if you are a dieter there are problems. Breakfast is fine, lunch is sometimes passable, but NOTIHING for dinner that is remotely weight watcher friendly. The hotel was overbooked for the weekend (others were bumped but not us). We did not have any trouble getting drinks at any of the bars. There are pleny of lounges at the pool. My daughter enjoyed the dance lessons every day but I felt there could have been more activities. The beach in absolutely disgusting. If you are going to the resort to lay on a beach this is not the place. Nightlife stinks!! The shows on Thurs.,Fri.,and Sat night were okay. Sunday and Monday night offered nothing other than a singer in the lobby and kareoke in the smoke filled pub. Most people were just walking back and forth looking for something to do. On a positive note, the rooms are spacious and very clean. Also, most of the staff are extremely friendly and try to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but don't recommend”
Reviews.Author: bjm1271
Reviews.Content: The place is beautiful. The pool is great. Most of the workers are friendly. The beach is all rocks & shells. Did take a nice walk saw some fish, crabs, etc....The casino is decent. The food is horrible. Some of the food was unidentifiable / inedible. The restuarant reservation system is puzzling. Restuarants were always half empty but could never get a table. Room service was a joke. It took 90 minutes for a BLT w/ 1 piece of bacon and a cheese quesadilla that had 1 slice of cheese melted in it. Would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Spectular Place!”
Reviews.Author: STEVENSNY
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had a couple of days off and decided to take a quick trip to P.R. and selected Paradisus. I am a travel agent and had not visited this property before, so I will make this review quick and from a professional standpoint to help other travelers. The resort is beautiful, very lush and scenic. The staff very helpful but at times some appear to be understanding English and agreeing, but have no idea what you asked for. So, make sure you are understood before walking away. Take a cab from the airport... only $64 (opposed to resorts $60 bus charge), and cabs are plentiful. We got there about an hour or so before check-in at 3pm and were told it would cost $75 add'l PER person for early check-in which was ridiculous! The resort was very empty and that was uncalled for, so we opted to walk the grounds, which were amongst the most beautiful anywhere in P.R. Being that it was fairly empty, in our two days we ran across only two other couples along the vast beach and there were less than a dozen people in any of the lounges, etc. Now, the place can accommodate tons of people, and I don't know if we would have had such a great time if it was jampacked, but we truly felt it was our own resort. ALL of the staff was very friendly and helpful. FOOD: I love to eat, but also realize that inclusives usually consist of buffets which are mediocre. The food here was no exception. Not a great selection and 1/2 of it non-descript food which I couldnt even guess what it was! So, you're not going to get deluxe dining here. ROOMSERVICE ... Not matter how slow you talk or how you THINK you gave the order, three of 3 times roomservice screwed up the orders. They always made good on it within 15-20 minutes. Long story shortened: If you are looking for a truly beautiful place with attentive service, friendly faces and total relaxation, Paradisus is wonderful. If you are into a culinary trip, this is not your place. I also didn't see too much around the resort except for some BBQ roadside places, so I would venture that compared to those, the food at this resort is better and safer! We did have a fabulous time and I would go back in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Steer Clear!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The grounds are the best thing going for Paradisus... the pool is nice, the lobby gets you psyched when you arrive. Then the service (or lack thereof) begins! Check-in took forever and no one bothers to offer you a drink. You wait 15 minutes after that to get a ride to your room. The room was nice, but the floors were FILTHY! You had to wash the bottom of your feet if you walked barefoot. The food was THE WORST! The buffets had old, overcooked food in sternos... burgers and hotdogs and cold cuts... did I need to travel to PR for that? I could've stayed here and gone to the local diner! The restaurants were AWFUL... 45 minutes to get your first course and the entrees were so overdone we just didn't bother eating them. The staff apologized and said "it's crowded", but half the tables were empty. Room service took 75 minutes the first day, and they forgot half the order. We went to the breakfast buffets after that... stay away from the eggs and raw bacon. On the rare occasion when they actually had some Latin food choices, it was better. Why would you open a resort in PR and make the restaurants French, American and Japanese? If you want that stuff, stay home! The place was unequipped for the rain... the walkways flooded and you could hardly move around. Rather than sweeping the water off the floors and paths, they just put up "Caution" signs. For the money we doled out, this place should be ashamed of themselves... Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Paradisus - Don't even waste your money”
Reviews.Author: danadonnie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our honeymoon were we stayed at the Puerto Rico Paradisus. I wish I went with my first choice and went to Aruba. I cannot believe what a horror this place is. To start with, I booked my honeymoon with a travel agent back in October 2005 and my travel agent received a phone call from the Paradisus the day of our wedding (April 21, 2006) stating that they overbooked the hotel and that we would be put up at the Westin but our stay would be covered by the Paradisus. We were scheduled to arrive at the Paradisus on April 23, 2006 and stay until May 3, 2006. Once we landed we had to find our transportation to the Westin which was a disaster. We were sent to 3 different buses. Finally we arrived at the Westin and had to waste 3 hours trying to get our all inclusive status taken care of. NOthing was in the computer so Westin had to keep calling the Paradisus to get it straigtened out. We were only suppose to stay at the Westin for 1 night. Well the next day I call to confirm our transfer to the Paradisus and they say everything is okay. We go to the pull and go back up to our room only to have a message waiting for us stating that the Paradisus had us booked to arrive the next day. So again I had to waste another 3 hours getting that straigtened out. We finally arrive at the Paradisus only to have more screw ups. We were promised a room upgrade, never got it. We were put in a room that smelled like mildew so again had to be transferred to another room. The reservation manager, Wanda Rivera, how was suppose to assist us on everything, never returned my calls and when we went to the front desk to speak with her directly, never came out of her office. I wasted 4 days of my honeymoon just trying to get everything straightened out. On top of all of this, they had 4 conventions going on so that bar was completely swamped all the time. It took at least 20 minutes to get a drink. Because of the conventions we could get dinner reservations early then 9:45 p.m. The food was disgusting and the service was horrible. You would sit down to eat it would take a waiter at least 20 minutes to take you drink order and then it would take them another 10 minutes to bring it to you. I think the food was horrible because of the conventions. I really wish I knew that the conventions were going on because when asked if I would like to stay at the WEstin for the remainder of my trip I would have said yes. I can go on and on about the negative aspects about the Paradisus but there' s not enough room. Please save your money and go somewhere else. This place is horrible. Spend the extra money and stay at the Westin. They were hospitable, the service was fantastic and even sent us a bottle of champaigne for all of the confusion which is more than I can say for the Paradisus. I am sending a letter to the owner of the Sol-Meil Paradisus and if I do not receive a response, I will be sending a letter to Consumer Affairs. Traveler beware!!!

Reviews.Title: “Objective review from a native”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I live in Puerto Rico, and spent an overnight stay at the Paradisus. I can honestly say that this is NOT a 5-star resort. It closely resembles a 2.5-star at the moment, especially with the prices they are charging. Check-in: 0 stars The easiest way to screw up anyone's vacation is at the beginning. The front desk is highly disorganized. The way they handle guests is more like a Burger King. We waited six hours for our room. There were guests that actually screamed at the front desk people, that's how desperate it was. Rooms: 5 stars The best I have seen in the island. Big, beautiful, well kept. Most of the stars I give in the review come from the rooms. Beach: 2 stars Don't go in the water and you'll be fine. Too many rocks, seaweed. Pool: 3 stars Beautiful shape, too much chlorine. Mats under the huts need serious cleaning, put towels on top before you lay down. Food: 2 stars Buffets for breakfast and lunch are decent, as expected, with breakfast coming up on top. However, the big disappointment was dinner at Avocado. My NY steak looked awful, although it tasted like something from Ponderosa. Presentation was horrible. Waitresses always looked like they didn't care. Entertainment: N/A I can't comment since I didn't participate, but my friends tell me it was OK until 2AM. With enough alcohol, anything is fun. To sum up: I would never pay to go to this hotel again, not until they improve front desk help and dinner/service. Try ANY other Puerto Rico hotel or small inn, and I guarantee you'll come out satisfied. Sad but true ...

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel, very understaffed”
Reviews.Author: benvenutoaNY
Reviews.Content: i stayed at paradisus puerto rico from april 8 to april 14. this is a beautiful hotel, spotless, and grounds are spactacular. the food is okay, if you go to the good restaurants. DO NOT go to the italian restaurant it is def not the best italian food. it tasted like it was microwaved the onyl things good were the desserts. And caribeno, i didnt even eat there, it looked grose. THe food at romantico was excellent and also at Bamboo (Benihana/hibatchi)was good (how bad could it be, they cook in front of you). also the steak at avocado wasnt bad either. For breakfast all the restaurants basically serve the same things (dont eat the eggs they are horrible) all of the breakfasts are buffet. The mirador grill is not the best its really for youger kids(they basically only hav chicken nuggets and french fries, pizza, rice, chips, and salad and other foods, sometimes BBQ chicken). But for dinner one night they servd good food, they had shrimp, steak, chicken, fish, and lots of side dishes. surprisingly this restaurant was good for dinner. The Hotel itself.. The hotel was beautiful, everythign is marble, the lobby, the bars, the lounge, and the bathrooms in your room and in the lobby. The rooms are nice. you can get it with a king bed or 2 double beds and either room you choose, you get a living room with a coffe table, and a pullout couch. also they give u a table with two chairs with a coffee machine, and give you coffee bags and creamer...)the only reason i knwo they hav 2 different rooms is that we were given a room with 1 king bed and we are 5 people. so we called n they kmoved us to the other room. at the time it ws very annoying since we got there at 1am n had to switch rooms. we had also brought 2 laptops and they have an internet port under the desk by the fone. we had forgot ot bring out cord but one of the people who brought our bags (his name is Angelo) gave us a free one he had(usually you have to pay $15dollars to buy 1). When you hook up the interent it says you will be charged $15 dollars a day but, you dont it was free, also they have wireless interent in the lobby) The pool is huge,literrally it is about 4 times the size of an olympic size pool. plus it has a swim up bar, in pool lounge chairs, a kiddy pool, and basketball hoops. they also have kids activites an water aerobics in the pool some days. Also GOOO sailing, you have to make a reservation though) it is really funespecilal y when you feel like your about to flip over(dont worry, you wont) also they kayaking and petalboats to use. But for all this there is a consequence... (its not Cheap we paid $11,000 including airfare this was for 5ppl. ( 2 adults, a 14yo, a 12yo, and a 9yo.) Also it will cost you abotu 250-500 dollars in tips to get what you want. THey say that the restaurants are booked when they arent. we went to the iitalian resaurant at 800, we had reservatiosn for 630 and they said ti was too late, meanwhile there were abotu 13 tables (seriously). but when we slipped him a 20 oo suddenly thers a table!!!! it was redicuouls about the reservations. HELLO its a an ALL-INCLUSIVE. it should be first come first serve basis. Whoever doesnt make it should go to the next restaurant. also at the mirador grill they take about 20 min 2 seat you and when they do they sit oyu all the way on the other side when the food is right there, also there is abotu 20 tables near the food. Dont wait on line just go find a table its a waste of time. Overall this was a fun vacation but there are many things that could hav been done to make our stay better, but it was a great family vacation to Puerto Rico!!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: rebeccag52576
Reviews.Content: Would love to be able to write an informative review, but all I can say is be forewarned.... My two best girlfriends and I had an ALL INCLUSIVE vacation scheduled for the PARADISUS... however we found out that was all about to change....thank god for the Rio Mar. At 5:07pm Thursday April 20th a message was left on my answering machine, from Apple vacations stating the PARADISUS had over booked and we were being moved to the RIO MAR. It stated that if I had any questions, I could call my travel agent... I was irate. Knowing nothing about the RIo Mar, and being that I was on my way to the airport, I hunted my poor travel agent down on his cell phone. He did all he could, but the Paradisus had screwed up so badly that there was nothing he could do. We had paid for an all inclusive vacation and that was what we wanted... not even knowing anything about the Rio Mar. We arrived at the San Juan airport to be greated by someone from the Paradisus... making all sorts of empty promises, that EVERYTHING would be included and not to worry about a thing. The Rio Mar was gorgeous, they had a beaultiful beach, which by the way, the Paradisus does not. The staff was incredible and tried to accomodate us as much as possible.... There were a least 100 people in our situation... all greeted with 4 drink coupons a day and named the 2 restaurants we could eat at per meal... A FAR CRY FROM ALL INCLUSIVE. Regardless, I loved the Rio Mar, would stay there again in a heart beat... my adivise, pay for your meals, drinks and everything else, and stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “not 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If your looking for customer service...go to The Ritz! When we checked in we were told that the room that we had already paid for was not available, that they would down grade us...who does that? We had no choice. The "nicer " restaurants needed reservations, but there were not any available. We had to eat buffet the entire time that we were there. We are fighting to get our credit for the down grade back, there doesn't seem to be anyone to help, or care for that matter. At this point it is about principle rather then the money. If you are going to Puerto Rico, seriously, go to the Ritz or to El Conquisidor.

Reviews.Title: “WORST SERVICE EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have never experienced anything like this. Only one restaurant was open. There were two waiters for the entire restaurant. People were bussing their own tables and getting their own drinks from behind the bar. Check-in was a nightmare and took close to two hours. You could not make dinner reservations at the 2 restaurants open for dinner unless you paid for Royal Service. The management sucked. DO NOT GO HERE! YOU WILL HAVE BETTER FOOD AND SERVICE AT A HOWARD JOHNSON OR HOLIDAY INN.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute of it”
Reviews.Author: LauraPh
Reviews.Content: This was our annual springbreak vacation for me and my teenage daughter. It was everything we wanted. This was our first experience at an all-inclusive resort, so I have nothing to compare it to. I read all the reviews before we went and decided to go anyway. It was unfortunate that many people had bad experiences, but they provided us with the information we needed to make sure we did not have the same problems. One thing I think that helped was the timing of our trip. We arrived the Saturday before Easter Sunday so there were no conventions. It was all families. A couple of conventions came Thursday, but we were not bothered (although I heard that many others had their reservations changed to accomdate the convention and were very upset). Here is the breakdown of our experience: Arrival: The shuttle was waiting for us when we arrived and the driver loaded the bags. It is supposed to leave every hour on the hour, but apparently we were the only two so it left at 20 minutes after the hour. We were offered refreshments. It was a long drive, but we just sat back and enjoyed the scenery. Check-in: our bags were unloaded and we headed to the check-in. (We got to the resort at 12:20 - the official check-in is at 3:00). We waited about 10 minutes in line to check-in. The process was quick and painless and the clerk was friendly and happy to answer questions. We were told our room would not be ready until 3:00, but were shown to the hospitality room where we could change into our swim suits. We were provided with the resort wristband and told to enjoy the facilities. Our luggage was held up front for us. At 3:00 we checked to make sure our room keys were activated, grabbed our lugguage and took the trolley to our room. (we learned from previous reviews that luggage takes awhile to get to the room so we took it ourselves - no problem). Grounds: Beautiful. The palm trees, various flowers and the buildings were all beautiful. Even though our room was in the last building we walked to the pool daily just to take in the sights. Pool: Extraordinary! Even thought the resort was apparently booked full, we did not ever feel crowded in the pool. On the first day we chose two chairs with an umbrella direclty across from the pool bar. We sat there everyday! The poolside chairs and cabanas do get snatched up early. However, we are early risers so everyday we got up, got our stuff together, walked down to the pool, put our stuff on our chairs and went to eat. We were usually done with breakfast by 7:00. We never wanted a cabana (we were there for tans!) but, I think the cabana people get up at 3:00AM to out their stuff out! My daughter and I practically had the the pool to ourselves until 10:00 most mornings. Our one complaint about the pool area is that the pool bathrooms were disgusting most of the day. Yes, there should be more staff to clean, etc., but the other guests caused the mess. It is hard to believe that people pay to stay at a beautiful resort like this and leave the bathrooms the way they do. I will not provide details, but by the end of the day the bathrooms smelled like an outhouse. Poolside activities: there is an activity hut by the pool. They play fun music all day. It is probably loud if you sit near that area, we couldn't hear it where we sat so we were able to relax. We played water volleyball and basketball, participated in the daily dance lessons, water aerobics, bingo, and pingpong. My daugher played beach voleyball. There was a ton more to do. The staff at the activity hut is amazing! Upbeat and energetic ALL the time. The dance lessons were surperb! Bars: all bars were great with excellent service. Liquor was top notch and they were not stingy. They knew how to make all types of drinks. Food: Breakfast and lunch were always buffet. Mirador and Caribeno were usually open at the same time although Caribeno was closed for a couple of days during the week. Caribeno is the place to eat breakfast and lunch if you have the choice. The breakfast is hotter and the fresh fruit selection is outstanding. Lunch always has an amazing salad bar. Service is fantastic. Mirador is so-so, food is not hot, there are birds flying around and service is lacking. The ONLY non-friendly person we found at the whole resort was the hostess at the Mirador. We had no problems at all getting reservations at all thesit-down restaurants. We went to the concierge the day we checked in. All of our meals were amazing at Bamboo, Avocado and Romantico. Reservations are also needed for the buffets at night. Maridor did surprise us with their evening meal and show... it was great. surprisingly, our least favorite was the Italian buffet at Tuscano. Service was good, but food was bland and oily. Rooms: really nice and cool. The maids did a great job everyday. Beach/Watersports: we went kayaking and paddle boating. It was fanatastic - I nice was to truely see how beatiful the water is. The beach is not good for swimming becuase of the seawead growth and it makes the water look brown. However, the water is crystal clear and wonderful. If you take time to paddle down the beach (or walk) you will find quiet little spots with nice areas to take a dip. Even on the busiest of days there were NO people at some of the most beautiful spots on the resort. Bottom line: we loved every minute of it and did not want to leave. We were treated like queens for a week.

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite Up To Par”
Reviews.Author: cmarkell
Reviews.Content: I was at Paradisus Puerto Rico with my wife and two children for six days beginning April 13th. The resort is beautiful, but falls short in many ways. Immediately after check-in, we went to make our reservations at the restaurants. We were told all the full service restaurants were booked for the rest of the week and could only eat in the buffet style restaurants. What a way to start the vacation having to argue with this person and demand to see the manager. We eventually did get the bookings we wanted. What surprised me was that these "fully booked" restaurants were only 75% full when I was there. It became apparent that the hotel staff are instructed to push as many guests to the buffets instead of the full service restaurants. They'd rather you eat at the buffet because it costs them less. You won't find lambchops, sirloin steak or fresh fish at the buffets. You'll only find these at the full service restaurants. Additionally, just about any "hot" dish I had at the buffet was never hot. It sits there in a large metal tray on steaming water. This does not keep the food hot. It barely keeps it warm. The overall service from the waiters is shameful. Some try hard, but there's not enough to attend to the guests. I had to wait 30 minutes to get a cup of tea... 20 minutes to order a second drink. Need a spoon, forget about it... help yourself if you can. Overall, the place is beautiful, has plenty of activities, but the food situation, and overall service is hit or miss. One day my room was not even cleaned by the maid. Even after calling the front desk, nobody was sent. At 10pm after going to the front desk, someone was sent. They compensated us with a free massage. In speaking with other guests, I heard many similar complaints. I did enjoy my stay at the Paradisus, but should not have to have dealt with these problems for what I paid. I will not be returning anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “THERE'S SO MUCH BETTER OUT THERE FOR THE MONEY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel extensively thru the Caribbean and were extremely dissatisfied with the Paradisus. The surroundings were lovely, the best bar I've ever experienced, but everything else about it was below average. We fortunately had an upgrade to their VIP service which is the only thing that made the stay tollerable. If you must go definately go for the VIP treatment. Also, beware of the food. The buffets were reminiscent of highschool cafeteria and there were no reservations for the sit down restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, service not so nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spent the week at Puerto Rico Paradisus Resort. Reserved an ocean front room 6 months in advance and was told at the check in desk that none would be available for the next too weeks. Instead of an apology or upgrade, we were downgraded to a garden villa that had a veiw of the back fence and mud pit. Had to call my travel agent at the front desk to get the correct reimbursement for the difference in price, they wanted to give me 25 dollars a night when I paid 125 extra a night - which I hope get soon. Our rooms were not cleaned on two days because the service did not get there till 5pm and we were showering for dinner. Room service trays were left in the hallway for days. You had to wait to be seated for meals which although is a nice touch - it creates lines and you did not get a fork unless you were seated they did not have them available. Everytime you got up to get more food, they took the fork so we finally started taking our forks up with us. You also could not get orange juice or coffee unless it was served to you which meant waiting a long time at times. The resort is beautiful, the food is good, you can not really swim in the water too much seaweed and baracudas, need water shoes on the beach - lots of rocks and coral. This can be a wonderful resort with more smiles, forks, and cleared water.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful...What are others thinking?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to Paradisus with a group from work and after reading some of these reviews, I must say I was worried. After the long, traffic filled ride from the airport, we finally arrived at this beautiful resort. STAFF: The staff was very friendly and helpful. Although they were understaffed, especially at the bars :( FOOD: I thought the food was very good, many different choices. One restaurant brought our food, then let it sit there for 10 minutes next to us on a tray, only after we asked if this was our food was it served. Rooms: Ours was a little musty smelling. After we told the front desk they immediately gave us a new room which was pleasant. Very clean and nice. POOL: The pool was wonderful. What else can I say. Conclusion: If you are looking for a beautiful resort so stay in Puerto Rico, this is the place. I would absolutely go back and recomend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant five days”
Reviews.Author: rqf
Reviews.Content: REVIEW - PARADISUS PUERTO RICO I recently returned from a trip to this resort. I was at the resort from March 23 to March 27. GETTING TO/FROM THE RESORT - The hotel runs a shuttle bus from the airport to the resort and from the resort to the airport. The charge is $30 per person each way. It leaves every hour on the hour and the trip takes close to an hour. Shuttle is a modern air conditioned vehicle that can take at least 25 people. The hotel has a representative at the baggage retrieval area at the airport. The representative will escort you to the bus. He will give you a receipt and you will be told to save the receipt as it will be needed when you board the bus for the return to the airport. This system is well organized . ChecK IN - It was a relatively slow process but not because of inefficiency. People have questions and this is time consuming RESORT GROUNDS - Truly beautiful. It is, in effect, a botanical garden. On a scale of 1 to 10 this is definitely a 10. RESTAURANTS - There are six restaurants, three serve buffet style and three are sit and be served and these are open for dinner only. For these you must make a reservation and that poses a problem since there is no way the resort can accommodate all guests on a given day. I was told the three restaurants can only serve 400 people a day. For a hotel with a capacity of more than 1000 lots of people can not get reservations and that makes for a lot of unhappy campers. That issue is the source of most of the complaints made and rightfully so. FOOD - The buffets are open for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The buffets were adequate but not as good as the buffets you find on most cruise ships or at other hotels. The ambiance at the sit down restaurants was very good at all three but the quality of the food varied. The best was the Japanese restaurant. The other two canâ€™t be rated much better than Fair. The service at all three was very good. POOL - The pool is large and there appears to be enough lounges for all. There are a number of huts that have thatched roofs and are open on all four sides that are available if you want to get out of the sun. Unless you get to the pool early you wonâ€™t find any vacant huts. There are about 20 of these placed around the pool. Other than the huts there is very little shade in the pool area. BEACH - This beach may be one of the worst in Puerto Rico. The beach is a narrow strip (15 to 20 feet at most) with poor quality sand and plenty of small rocks and pebbles that make walking, barefoot, painful. Further you have to go through sea grass to get out to where you can swim. I never saw more than four or five people swimming in the ocean at any given time. This is not the place to go if you want to swim in the ocean and refuse to go into a pool. They do have kayaks and paddle boats for guests. There is no charge for using this equipment. . ROOMS - The rooms are located in two story bungalows. The rooms are large, clean and well appointed. Each room has either two double beds or a king size bed. There is a sitting area with a sofa. Every room has a coffee maker and a refrigerator stocked with bottled water and cans of soda. You can get beer if requested. Each room has a terrace. A shuttle that operates all day is available to take you from your room to the lobby. There is a safe in the room and an ironing board but no iron ROOM SERVICE - Room service is available 24 hours a day. There is a $3 charge each time you order from room service. I used room service once. It took 35 minutes from the time I ordered to the time it was delivered. I didnâ€™t find that to be an excessive wait since the kitchen is located a fair distance from the rooms. SERVICE - General service was good. All those workers I can in contact with were very pleasant and it was apparent they wanted to be of service if needed. ENTERTAINMENT - There was a show every night that featured dancing. The same performers appeared every night. The shows were entertaining CONCLUSION - On the whole it was a pleasant, restful experience. I am not a finicky eater so someone more discriminating would probably take issue with the food served. I went there because the price was right. I would go back again should I get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jerseygirl1976
Reviews.Content: I had a long weeked away with my husband and friends. It was so nice in November, great weather. I was disappointed that the only reservation I was able to get was at 9pm. They need a better system, when we go there they were already booked for the week. What about the people just coming in? We were stuck with the buffet. Have to say Lobster and Steak at a buffet,was pretty good. Bring bug spray, little nats. All in all I did enjoy it, will go back. Spa was relaxing. I purchase with the Vacation Club, because I loved all the places I could go. Starting to plan my next Melia vacation. Night life at the hotel was OK but after being in the sun all day, I was so tired. Beach needs work, pool was great.

Reviews.Title: “Many factors to consider....overall a great place!”
Reviews.Author: orr333
Reviews.Content: My heading said many factors to consider. Here they are. If you expect 100% perfection...don't stay here. If you want to see Puerto Rico, this is a great bet. Overall, we stayed here and one other place and toured the entire island. Service is an issue in PR, period so either get used to it or go somewhere else (i.e. Mexico). At the Paradisus, I will concede that as we were traveling as a group, we received better treatment and had reservations in every eatery every night. The resort was 100% capacity during our stay. The biggest downside to this place (Paradisus and PR in general) is the location. Travel time from SJU to the resort is at least an hour because of traffic going to the NE part of the island. This appears to be a problem no matter where you stay. Transfers in PR are expensive. To get to and from the Paradisus is $60. To get to Fajardo it is also very expensive so getting transfers with your excursions is a must. Renting a car here or in San Juan is also not easy as parking is almost non-existent and is $15-25 per night at some places including the Paradisus. ROOM: Some of our group (3 of 17) had problems with their first room. Moldy, musty or dirty. Ours had a problem with the A/C leaking and the bathroom had not been cleaned well. They changed us immediately to a perfect room. I cannot complain as they fixed it. One thing I have learned is that in tropical climates, mold happens. It is a problem in MANY places I have visited, not just the Paradisus. GROUNDS: The grounds are immaculate. The lighting, architecture, layout, etc are all perfect. BAR: I NEVER waited for a drink (much to the dismay of my head!). I tipped $1 every 3rd or 4th round (multiple drinks in many cases) which even though it is all-inclusive, I do not see a problem. It became where they made my drinks as I walked up or asked if I wanted the usual. No problems with service at ANY bar in the resort. The locals make an average of $7000 per year per tourism websites. A $1 tip does alot for them. FOOD: Bad service at some places. This is the only reason I gave 4 of 5 stars. Quality in sit down places was just OK for me. Avocado served us cold food but that was the servers fault entirely. Mirador Grill, Toscanos (great server there) and Caribeno were all just fine. As for birds eating from the buffet...never saw it. I did see birds eating from empty tables outside. You cannot stop that and if it bothers you, go inside. OVERALL: We visited the rest of the island and frankly, there is not a ton to see. The Paradisus is just fine and we would go back there but most likely to a different island having seen it all. OTHER NOTES: Some did the rainforest and said it was OK and overpriced. I did central PR in a car in the mountains and had much better views without the tourists. We did a charter on the Salty Dog (saltydreams.com) and they were great. I would highly suggest a snokel trip as we saw many things that we have not seen before like Barracuda, puffer fish, Lion fish, Octopus, Squid and nice coral (for now). PR questions or comments? Drop me an email!

Reviews.Title: “not quite 5 star”
Reviews.Author: janer2008
Reviews.Content: For a 5 star resort, although fairly new, the service in not up to 3 star. The wait staff were sourly and slow. Breakfast is buffet, however the waiters bring you coffee and orange juice, on their own sweet time, even when you ask for service, you don't get it. The golf course is awsome, most of the time we were the only ones on it. Try the mountain course, its beautiful, and then you don't need to go into the rain forest.

Reviews.Title: “Not that Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Spivee
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a 8 day stay at this hotel. Well 8 days is just TOO long. The rooms are nice and the bed is SO confortable but that is all the hotel has. There is no beach! Sure it's on the shoreline, but if you go to this beach... bring shoes, or else you will have lots of cuts... there is no sand only broken shells and a ton of crabs! As for the food... in the buffet there is no choice on food. Everyday it is the same food no change. However if you have the chance to go to the resturant - especially Bamboo and Romentico, the food there is very good. The filet migon is great! The spa is nice, but expensive. The casino is nice, but you get the impression that the machine are "fixed". The staff - well this is hard to judge - I had no problem with them, but the group I was with complaib and thought they were rude. This is up to you. Overall, I found that I paid too much for this hotel. Everything was expensive, even the ride back to the airport! They really do take advantage of the fact that there is no other transportation other than the one the hotel provides you!

Reviews.Title: “Stop complaining and enjoy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 4 days at the paradisus with my girlfriend and it is exactly what we wanted. We arrived to a beautiful hotel with helpful staff. I have read plenty of people complain that it took hours to have their bags delivered to their room, we were able to sidestep that problem by taking our own bags a whopping 5 minute walk to our room. The rooms were huge and fantastic with a great terrace. We heard people complain that there were not enough activities at the resort, but we wanted somehwere where we could sit by the pool and not be bothered. If you want someone to constantly entertain you, then this is not the place for you, but if you are looking to relax then it is perfect. Another complaint I have read is about the food. We had one bad meal over the course of 4 days. The reservation process is not a difficult one. Each day we went to the pool in the morning and stopped by the concierge to make a reservation for that night. If you do that there will be no problems. The only thing I would watch for is the Roulette dealers. They seemed to have a little difficulty counting the correct number of chips.

Reviews.Title: “Disorganized and disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from Puerto Rico. The company I work for flew us to the Paradisus for a corporate escape. The hotel is beautiful but unfortunately several things made the trip somewhat disappointing. 1. A representative from the hotel did not meet us at the airport right away. We had to find our way to the "pickup spot" which was on a lower level of the airport. Unfortunately we had to carry our luggage down a set of stairs to get there. The buses took some time to arrive and when they did, several porters arranged our luggage while we were allowed to board. We were then counted and away we went. 2. We arrived at the hotel around 1:30 PM. The porters unloaded our luggage in the lobby and started labelling them with the name of our company. The hotel representative told us our luggage would be transported to our rooms shortly. 3. The staff greeted us nicely and wrapped an "all inclusive" band around our wrists. They told us our room was not ready but that they had a little snack waiting for us in the main lobby. We also had access to the bar while we waited. The first estimate they gave us was "about an hour". This was bearable as our vacation was paid for by my company. However, when the hour passed their next estimate was 3:00 PM. The front desk manager told us, "we are working with housekeeping to have your rooms ready but we have been running into delays due to some guests that have checked out late." This seemed somewhat reasonable since our group included about 400 people and the hotel only had 500 rooms. We kept drinking and checked back at 3PM. Still a "no go" and the manager was singing the same tune. My wife started to get irritated as she also works in the hotel industry. She argued with the manager that our rooms should have already been prebooked and arranged. The manager recanted her earlier statement like a script in her head. She suggested that we could use their hospitality suite to change so that we could go to the beach. She told us to go check with the concierge to find our luggage. 4. We asked the concierge for our luggage. He pulled out a clipboard, found our names and told us our luggage had been transported to our room. He also told us that our room was ready. 5. We went back to the front desk to get our room key. The front desk agent told us our room was still not ready and was being cleaned by housekeeping. We told her that the concierge had indicated our room was ready and that he had transported our luggage there. She replied, "he has no right to tell you anything like that. I'm sorry, but your room is not ready yet." Luckily the hotel representative that had met us at the airport spotted us at the front desk - my wife was getting very frustrated. Magically, he handed us our room keys. The front desk agent looked dumbfounded. 6. Happily we went to our room. When we go there, a musty smell pervaded the place. My wife used the word "moldy" to describe it. However, since it was 4 PM and we didn't want to wait or complain anymore, we changed and went to the beach. 7. Although the manicured grounds of the hotel were beautiful and the pool well kept, the beach left something to be desired. Patches of seaweed blocked access to the waves and the sand was hard and spotty with pebbles. Also, an anonymous guest told us that they had spotted jelly fish which really turned us off. We went back to the pool to enjoy what remained of the day. 8. Two restaurants offered a buffet breakfast - the Mirador Grill and the Avocado. The Grill offered scrambled eggs, bacon, hash browns, fruits, yogurt and several types of bread. Overall not particularly fantastic but edible. The Avocado added freshly made omelets to the array. 9. Lunch and Dinner were very similar buffets at both places often repeating left overs from the previous day. The selection of sea food was excellent including shrimp, snapper, mussels, etc. 10. The hotel also included plate service once per week by reservation only. The Avocado, the Mirador Grill, Romantico, etc. all had different themes. The food and the service was excellent. However, the bus staff were fairly inexperienced and had to be reminded to get water and coffee. 11. Nightly entertainment was subpar. A lounge singer churned out popular tunes in karaoke style with the assistance of a piano player and track sequencer. My wife commented that the entertainment was for seniors only - not suitable for anyone between 18 and 35. 12. The hotel also featured nightly live performances with different themes. Only two of the ten performers were near professional quality. The rest seemed to be in learning mode, often out of sync with each other. 13. The Casino was small and had few tables open simultaneously. Caribbean stud did not include a progressive or big jackpot. Overall, though, everyone was friendly and we had a decent time. I believe this place has a lot of potential. The staff needs training and the daily activities need development. Also, something has to be done about the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I love to go to all inclusive resorts for our vacations. I picked this one because of the rain forest and beautiful island. Our room was not working, all the resturants were booked in which we had to argue for two days to get to eat at one our whole stay instead of eating buffets three times a day.Several other guests were having the same problem. The setting didnt seem tropical and the beach was horrible. I would NEVER recommend this place ever. Until they get a new Director or GM. We will go back to san juan but NOT here.....

Reviews.Title: “Itchy”
Reviews.Author: donnaterry
Reviews.Content: This is a three star hotel masquerading as a five star. Only one restuarant choice if you fail to make your reservations for the others as soon as you check in. Pool bar closed at 6pm. Cushions on Bali style loungers were full of black mold and unknown to us full of bugs. My husband and I have many many insect bites and are still itching a week later. It took an hour to get our luggage to the room. The employees were offering as good of service that they could considering. Only hot tub on the facility was at the Spa and even though this was a supposed all inclusive it was a $28 per person per day charge to use.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For spring break me and my family went to the Paradisus for 7 days. We had read some of the reviews posted on this sight and were worried on how our stay might be. We have been to many all inclusives in years prior, but have never encountered one with such beautiful surroundings. It was a major plus to be part of the Royal Service, which gave you extra accomadations and an ocean front room. The only problem that we encountered on our trip was with reservations and seating at the buffets. It seemed that there were constantly empty tables that had not been cleaned yet...meanwhile there were long lines of people waiting to be seated. So i recommend that if you are planning a stay here to make reservations well in advance to avoid this problem. The pool is gorgeous and we never had a problem finding a place to sit. Our room was also very nice and was close to the pool/ lobby. So all these people who are hating on the Paradisus dont know what they're talking about. Although i wouldn't call it a 5 star hotel, we had an awesome time and its a beautiful hotel with a friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “not a four star”
Reviews.Author: SitalCherryHill
Reviews.Content: positives: great pools, rooms (on 2nd floor) , nice people, property, good location (near to San Juan and El Yunke rainforest), excellent Bar in main lobby. Negatives: Poor management, Short staffed, Tardy room service(if you order in meals), Beach (scary for kids ), Restaurants, no first aid kit at pools and only one lifeguard. No signs at the pools either (eg: no diving etc). We travelled with two kids (3 and 10) so we enjoyed the pool . The rooms were wonderful on the 2nd floor of two storied bunglows. We opted for royal service where a butler is assigned to you. Ours was great ( a tip does help) . Reservations are needed at the restaurants well in advance so please book them as soon as you arrive . There is one operating buffet where the food is okay but one gets tired of it after two days...there is an italian buffet which only operates on weekends.The other restaurants are reservations only. Nothing spectacular. There are tours availabel to various spots in PR and AVIS has a desk there but were out of cars. We rented one from nearby arranged by our butler and we visited San Juan and ElYunke rain forest ( avoid rushours between 2pm to 8pm) . Room service is a disaster if you order food in..ours took hour and half first time and 45 mins second time. Book your transport from airport and back before you arrive in PR by calling the hotel. Last day I fell into pool and was injured in my back by concrete stools near bar area in the pool. There was no first aid available. The security staff would call a doctor however that will cost you $150.00. In my case I opted for ambulance however they arrived after 20mins. So please carry first aid kit. The locals come in on weekends and there are local business events. Lobby is beautiful and Royal service lounge will spoil you. Overall we had a good time however I would rate this hotel a three and half star.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous place, but not good enough”
Reviews.Author: suzysunshine
