Reviews.Content: Before we went to the Paradisus, I read the reviews and hoped the negative comments were coming from very stuffy people who just couldn't be pleased. Sadly, everything I read here is right on the mark. So I won't repeat everything, just give my validation. This place is so incredibly beautiful, but I just don't think that is enough to justify the very high rates they charge. The total package is just not there, and it's a real shame. My husband and I had our trip paid for because it was a corporate trip. I personally would never pay $700 a night to stay here, or even close to that, because you're not getting what you pay for. We have been to many beautiful resorts for much less than that that offered more satisfaction than the Paradisus offers. It's a shame. My belief is that the resort does a great business because of the large corporate events, so they don't have to try harder. It really is a shame. That said, we had a fabulous time, really enjoyed the beauty of our surroundings, and were able to laugh off the food situation since it wasn't costing us a dime. Otherwise, we would have felt very ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed and enjoyed the Paradisus”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were apprehensive after reading the reviews. Our concerns were put to rest shortly after arriving. The staff who checked us in were friendly and warm. The lobby area is beautiful. Our room was very far away, but we enjoy walking and there were always golf carts available to drive you if you don't wish to walk. Our room was beautiful, an ocean view jr. suite. It was clean and comfortable. There was a bit of a musty smell, but that seems to be unavoidable in the Caribbean. The only challenge we encountered was in securing dinner reservations in the restaurants. The hotel needs to devise a better system. We were not allowed to make reservations before we arrived and when we arrived, the concierge was taking a lunch break. With some negotiation we were able to get reservations for each night we were there. (This was not the experience of most other guests we spoke to.) Oddly, each evening when we ate, approximately half of the tables were empty. This was odd because so many of the guests we spoke to told us they were not able to get reservations. I would rank the quality of the food as average to above-average. The servers and management were friendly and provided good service. Most of the hostesses, especially at the breakfast and lunch buffets were not very friendly or efficient. The pool area is beautiful and clean. There is plenty of room and plently of areas that you can sit if you prefer quiet to people watching and interacting. The bartenders were efficient and friendly. The beach is not ideal for swimming, but is beautiful and great for a walk. We enjoyed sitting on the grassy area overlooking the water and walking along the beach. We swam despite the rocks and seaweed and enjoyed ourselves. The spa was lovely and relaxing and we enjoyed massages. The hot tub and pool areas were very nice and virtually empty when we visited. If you are looking for a five-star resort where your every whim is satisfied, you will be disappointed. However, if you are happy staying in a beautiful and clean resort with stunning views where you may have to negotiate for what you want, you will enjoy this resort. I will return if they offer a great rate again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Rising Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family was quite excited about this all-inclusive vacation but day by day we were faced with increasing disappointments. We checked in late at night and asked for room service, they had only 2 sandwiches available. Room service was consistently unreliable throughout the trip. We loved the room they placed us in but we were on the second floor... it was difficult to bring up and down our baby's stroller. The room they transferred us to was not as well kept as the first one, there was a need for better linen and bathroom amenities. The staff at the Mirador grill (the outdoor restaurant) was in need of some lessons in customer service. The blackbirds were cute at the beginning... until they started diving for our food, even while we were still eating. The biggest disappointment was the ill-mannered hostess at the supposedly best restaurant in the property, Romantico. We were greeted with rudeness. Their only saving factor were the pleasant people at the reception desk, the Avocado and Bamboo restaurants, as well as the managers who most likely have to clean up after their staffs' unprofessionalism. Would we go back? Probably not. Would we recommend this? Well, if you want to gamble the several hundreds of dollars you have to pay for each night's stay for service and food that may or may not be good, then go ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from four days at the Paradisus, and we will not return. There are not many resorts as beautiful as this one, but there are many areas in need of improvement. The climate is wonderful, and the landscaping is well designed. Rooms are spacious and very clean. The pools offer everything one wants, but the beach is one area that does not encourage visitors. Housekeeping needs improvement. Often they do not get to your room until very late in the afternoon or early evening. There were no washcloths or hand towels after the first day. Repeated requests for these items were ignored. Room service was terrible; service was slow, trays were not picked up for days, and the food was poor. The restaurants were not open in the evening, and you were told there were no available reservations when you called. The only meals available were buffets in two restaurants. Food that was to be hot was barely warm, and the buffet tables were not refilled very often. You need to get there early to get any food. Casino is small, and you might want to forget the gift shop. The spa was excellent, and the staff professional. Perhaps Paradisus has a lot of problems because it is only a few years old.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: dmarino96
Reviews.Content: Before we went to Paradisus,I read all the negative reviews, so I booked a backup room in San Juan. The day I arrived, I cancelled the backup reservation. The place is beautiful and relaxing. I never write reviews but I feel I have to refute the negative ones I had read. All the Carribean Islands are a little laid back as far as service and the way they do things. But overall this place is worth it. It is a great place if you just want to lay by the pool,relax, and have a few drinks. Enjoy the Paradisus.

Reviews.Title: “too much money for oh so little”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel to meet with friends for a long weekend. After an easy flight from JFK we had to wait for over 35 minutes for the hotel bus to pick us up and bring us to the hotel. We arrived only to stand in a line for 20 minutes before anyone told us since we were 'Royal Sevice Members' we were to go to another area. We booked an Ocean front room. Well, all we saw of the ocean was the roof top of another building. We were told prior to getting to the hotel that our reservation had been honored, mind you we paid up front. So they move us to another room garden view on the 1st floor, dark and smelling very moldy. NOT ACCEPTABLE. We are then brought to another room garden view with 2 small beds, not acceptable for $100.00 a day. Then brought to yet another room 2nd floor garden view, bearly acceptable.....The room we requested and paid for would not be ready until the next day.?????????? With this special 'ROYAL' service at an additional $100 each we were to get a butler? and have some of our clothes cleaned if necessary. Neither was provided. The food was less than adequate. It appears there is one main kitchen. If you like to each the same food all the time....go for it. The Benihana type restaurant was just a show with everything dumped onto a plate. The bird droppings often found in the Mirador Grill usually found on the plates and tables did not help.....disgusting and certainly not acceptable in the light of the bird epidemic. The royal service pool was pleasant and very cozy, the staff was very wonderful. The casino there is a bit sketchy.....many of the machines were not functioning properly and the atmosphere was not pleasant....small is not even close. Where was Management? Seems they had a major problem...They were ABSENT. Think twice before spending the money.....we will never return even if it were FREE. There is much better out there.

Reviews.Title: “No Room at th Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay through ORBITZ, but we called the hotel to guarantee a late arrival and was given a confirmation number. When we arrived at the Paradisus, we were told they overbooked by 18 rooms and we could stay at the El Conquistador 3 nights FREE. We were upset to say the least after traveling all that while, but what could we do. We got to the El Conquistador around 9:00PM. The next morning I called my credit card company to cancell the payment to ORBITZ. We had a loverly time at the El COnquistador by the way. When we got back home, we called ORBITZ only to be told the El Conquistador billed the Paradisus and they inturn billed ORBITZ which means we have to pay. Needless to say we are in arbitration regarding this bill. I am sure they had 18 other unhappy lodgers on their hands also. How could they totally ruin all these peoples hard earned vacations and just disregard what was told them? What a way to do business. Needless to say we will never return. It much to expensive a place to be run so poorly.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I didn't stay home”
Reviews.Author: HCB26
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a very restful and relaxing vacation. It was a company trip so we were with a large group and had some of our meals planned ahead of time. We had no problems getting reservations the other nights. I am pregnant and a picky eater and did not go hungry. There were plenty of healthy choices and the room service was wonderful during the day. The late night service took two hours. After reading previous reviews I was tempted to pass on the trip and stay home, but I am glad I gave it a chance. The staff was friendly and the spa was wonderful! I didn't get a single bug bite. We brought a candle for the room and that took care of the slight odor. I did get a pretty nasty sunburn, so bring your sunblock and a good book and relax. The weather was perfect the entire time.

Reviews.Title: “Would love to go Back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought the place was as Beautiful as a person could expect. I was in Heaven. The people that have a problem with the resort to me were just ignorant, for the simple fact that when you wake up in heaven would you tell God that it wasn't to your standards, there are people out there that will never see heaven, so just be glad that it was you to take in all the beauty. I would love to take my children there. It was just my husband and I that when't for 4 days and 3 nights, I wish it would of been longer but who knows maybe one day it will be.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Paradisus Hotel, Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Paradisus Puerto Rico with my family. There were 8 of us in total. We had the most relaxing, wonderful time. The service was outstanding, the buffets and bbqs were great, the entire resort is full of activity and yet you never feel crowded at any of the facilities. The people in Royal Services were terrific. We can't say enough. For an All Inclusive Vacation it was really terrific. We will certainly return with our family.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraJ50
Reviews.Content: My friends and I just returned from 1 week in Paradisus Puerto Rico. We were celebrating my friends 50th birthday and were looking for a special place. After reading some of the reviews, I had wondered if we made the right choice. This vacation exceeded my expectations. The place is beyond beautiful...it is truly Paradise. The staff couldn't have been nicer. The shows are great. The shopping in Old San Juan and the local resturants are unbelievable.The photographs of the resort do not do it justice. The pools, bars, resturants, all perfect. If you don't like buffets, this is not the place for you. If you want to relax in the sun, have fun and drink the best coffee you'll ever drink then go to Paradisus. The beach has rocks but so does the North shore of Long Island. If you can afford the few extra dollars, go for the Royal Service. Oh, and if you gon with your best friends thats a real plus! And make sure you try the Flan at the desert table!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Puerto Rico, Hated The Paradisus”
Reviews.Author: capricorn13
Reviews.Content: Puerto Rico is beautiful but really research the hotel where you will stay. The Paradisus is a beautiful property with a great location. There are several problems. They are under staffed which make the customer service rotten. The employees are friendly considering that they are too busy. Never order room service, unless you request the smallest items that would be expected such as salt or butter. The food is terrible, especially the outdoor buffet. The pool and spa are wonderful. So unless you just want to hang at the pool and not eat I would not suggest this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I Don't Get It”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about staying here because of other reviews, but being a fan of All Inclusive vacations, I needed to try this one in Puerto Rico, especially because of the ease of getting there and no passports required. My vacation was MARVELOUS! The employees were just lovely. The property is dreamy. OK, I didn't get my first pick of restaurants two times in a row, but what do you expect? The Hotel was full. We took it easy and agreed to what was available. And it was great. The buffets need to be tended more often so food doesn't dry up, but otherwise, the a-la-carte restaurants were good. I admit I've had better, but also I've had alot worse. Hey look, vacation means RELAX! I saw people creating their own problems. Some peple don't know how to leave the stress home. I would definitely go back. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: UWSGAL
Reviews.Content: This is far from being a 4-5 star resort. Although the grounds are beautiful and the rooms are nice, the food,drinks and service was terrible. They have 3 restaurants ( that had no reservations available) and 2 buffets that were horrific. 1 of the 2 restaurants to choose, do not allow kids under 12... which is a ridiculus rule for a family resort during presidents week. If you want a 5 star meal, you need to take a taxi to San Juan ( $160 round trip) and eat in one of the many amazing places to choose from in town. I will say the activities were great for the kids and the shows at night were well done.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds does not make up for lousy service”
Reviews.Author: gstrauss
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a vacation here during February break week. This place needs a lot of work. While the grounds are beautiful and the rooms spacious and clean, the poor service cannot be overlooked. It's not that the people who work at Paradisus are not nice. They are very friendly. The problem is they are not well trained and there are far too few of them to accomodate the huge facility. We traveled with our three kids. We had reservations confirmed for two connecting rooms. When we checked in, we were put in rooms on different floors. We were not the only ones who ran into this problem. We later found out that there are only 8 connecting rooms in the entire facility. If you have a large family, it makes it difficult to stay at this resort. Dinner reservations are impossible, pool is not heated, beach is visually beautiful but basically unusable. It may sound like nitpicking but for the rates that this place charges - similar to any Ritz Carlton - we expected a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “not nearly as bad as the reviews!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jwjw57
Reviews.Content: Just came back from the resort. We were there February vacation week which could have been a disaster but it wasn't. I was very nervous going in having read the reviews: 1)This is an all inclusive if it is marketed to you in a different way find a new travel agent!!!! An all inclusive is not going to have 5 star food and service. It was fine.I never met any one who worked there who was rude. I thought the bartenders tried very hard to accomodate you as well as the waiters especially the girl walking the pool.A few dollars every once in a while also goes a long way. I maybe spent 25.00 in a week in tips and never had a problem whether I tipped or not. I had to complain at first (which I shouldn't have to do) to get adinner reservation for one of the 1st 2 nights I was there. I spoke to the manager and he tried to be helpful and eventually came up with a reservation at "Bamboo" which was excellent. After that I waited online and took 3 9:00 reservations which were fairly prompt with their seating. (note to resort:when it is a holiday week hire extra staff to clear tables it will make a HUGE differnce in service) 2)My 17 and 13 year old daughter traveled with us. If not for the Lacrosse team from Westchester it would have been very dull for them (Thanks for bringing them down) (note to the resort: Add a Disco or some sort of club for teens vacation week if they are happy so are their parents even if nothing else is good. Its a great resort for the little ones. We even watched the clown a couple of nights he was pretty funny! 3)rooms were gorgous but can't seem to get rid of the mildew smell. All in all my husband and my thoughts were it can be a fantastic resort if they somehow fix the dinner reservations and put in some sort of club. I would go back in a few years. PS THERE WERE NO BUGS AT ALL AT THE RESORT (The general thought was that they must have sprayed it after there were so many complaints in December) All in all the reviews on this site have not been what the resort is really like.

Reviews.Title: “It was beautiful, but needs some help”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Most things were good-service, the place was BEAUTIFUL and the people were nice. It was the cleanest hotel/resort I've ever stayed at!! There were activities to do, a kid show and an adult show every night. Everything was great except the food was not the best and they were short on staff. The best resturant was a Japanise resturant called Bamboo. Avacado, a steakhouse was okay. The buffets were edible, but for the price of the resort it was not what we excpected. The rooms were VERY clean, the place was beautiful, and I saw maybe about 4 bugs while I was there. One thing that really bothered me was that there was only 1 lifeguard in the whole pool(the pool is huge)! One of my family members almost drowned, but another family member jumped in and saved her. This is a great resort, but it needs some help.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay: Why all the negativity here??”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a group retreat and had a great time. The resort is beautiful and relaxing. The food was fair but I do not think you can cook for the masses in an all-inclusive atmosphere and expect 5 star menus! I am a picky eater and found plenty to keep me satisfied. The personnel were all friendly and the rooms were spacious and clean. I noticed a lot of families here as well and there were lots of activites for adults and kids alike. The grounds were beautiful and the coastal landscape was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived to find that you need reservations for the two full service restaurants. Though I got up to make it to the reservation desk to be second in line, they were booked for all of the four nights stay with the exception on one night where we aquired a 9:45 p.m. reservation. They were late seating reservations so we actually were eating at 11:30 p.m.! Additionally, there is only entertainment on certain nights. We missed that because we were eating. Nothing to do but gamble or watch TV at night with buffet eating breakfast, lunch and dinner is not my idea of luxury or service. Though I usally gain 5 pounds on vacation; I lost 2 pounds in four days. The hot buffet foods were cold, the milk was sour. Consequently, my favorite items on the buffet were salad and bread. I sound picky, but seriously, they had crab cakes on the menu at dinner and were substituting chicken nuggets! We talked to several people who said they were going out of the resort to eat a decent meal. Guests at dinner were frequently seen getting up to go the waiter station to get their own drinks! The pool and grounds were beautiful and I was happy that I never had to stake out a beach chair... where was everyone? The linens were changed daily between 11:00 a.m. and 2:00 p.m., but each afternoon we were inturrupted a second time by the staff restocking the water & soda fridge in the room at 4:40 p.m. The liquor was top shelf, but only two of the bartenders were friendly. They seemed overwhelmed which made me uncomfortable. Should I feel badly for ordering a drink? Bottom line is that it wasn't terrible, but for the price it was not the level of service we have received in other travels. Don't bother to complain, they look sympathetic and do nothing to correct the problems. We actually had one of the management tell us that the 'groups' staying at the resort were the priority, even though they paid less than we did! Lower the price and I might refer a friend, but doubtful. Unless we the management of the Paradisus makes some ammends to us and acknowledges their downfalls, we will be telling out travel agent not to send anyone else there.

Reviews.Title: “Service Poor/Food Bad”
Reviews.Author: BethanyHalle
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just returned from this beautiful hotel, unfortunately the beauty of the resort is damaged by the poor service and terrible food. We lived on bread and fruit all the while loving the weather and the grounds which they are constanly working on at all hours including around the spa at 10 am. They also had tend to drive the work carts with trailers dragging behind them around the grounds at the crack of dawn. Would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: virtuoso
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a group program. Overall, we had a great time..Rooms were excellent, service friendly, pools beautiful. Food was average and can be improved for a 5 star resort. The staff was delightful and all of us (60 people) had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms&Pools, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read previous reviews on trip advisor just before our departure, I was nervous. I strongly agree with the people who said it was a very nice resort, but food was average, couldn't get into restaurants that required reservations, and we started the first day we arrived and only made it to one in a week. Apparently they are understaffed in Restaurants. I think they have to cut cost somewhere and it's cheaper for you to go to one of their Buffet restaurants. We had Royal Service, but that didn't really get us any further along. We spoke with managers, they appologized said they would work on it but no one (four different people) every really followed thru. We wanted a good meal and decided to go outside the resort to a restaurant another guest had told us about. The resort provided transportation to and from Restaurant, it was about 20 min. from resort. The restaurant was La Parilla, highly reccommend. Open air (nothing fancy, but not a total dive) locals restaurant, very good food, good presentation, very friendly staff, a little slow but enjoyable. We enjoyed ourselves, if we ever went back to Puerto Rico we would go there. We had our four kids with us (ages 5-17). They were very accomodating to the kids. Paradisus-Very nice resort, but wouldn't return because of Food issues (poor management).

Reviews.Title: “Poor service and location”
Reviews.Author: Buffalo99
Reviews.Content: Went to paridisus to get away from the cold. Poor service, average food, rooms ok. Would recommend staying in the number 1500 bungalows or the number 100's bungalows. Everything else is an extremely long walk to get to pools and dining. I'm not averse to walking; however, you have to plan your evening around a long hike to and from your room. Bamboo dining was decent but the hostess acted as if we were disrupting them by asking for seating for 4 (no reservations). If we weren't so hungry we would have requested management. The Hibachi tables were empty! Bartenders not very helpful and spent most of the evening staring at their shoes. I would not return or recommend this resort to any family members or friends. $100 cab fare to get downtown; when you are on this resort you are stuck. Evening strolls were infested by gnats/blackflies- I am still scratching 1 week post stay

Reviews.Title: “Paradise at Paradisus”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paradisus hotel the week of January 22nd, and found it to be a very rewarding and relaxing experience. The hotel staff was accomdating and friendly, and the service was good throughout. We were thoroughly happy with the hotel. The horizontal layout of the hotel is a bit sprawling, but taxi service is provided to vacationers' bungaloes, and this service is more than adequate as waiting is kept to a minimum. The food is excellent across the board, be it breakfast, lunch or dinner, and the selections are varied. There are several different types of restaurants for discriminating tastes, including oriental, italian, and continental. We preferred the buffets, and the Italian restaurant was particularly good. The pool is vast and winding, and interestingly contoured. The scenery at poolside along the ocean is a thing of beauty, and comfortably laid out. The only problem we had is that we found that we had quite a few mosquitoe bites when we arrived home, so we would recommend protection. As for tours, we enjoyed the rainforest and its myriad types of birds, insects, vegetation and plants. However, our favorite jaunt was to the fortress at El Morro fronting the town of Od San Juan. The fortress was constructed in the mid 1500s to repel invaders, and you can almost feel the battles while walking through this massive, multi-storied structure. And don't forget to take a walk through Old San Juan, which has character and diversity, as well as good buys for interested shoppers. All in all, we had a great time. If you like a relaxed and relatively tranquil vacation, the Paradisus is ideal, as it is tucked away on a remote peninsula, away from the maddening crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Jan. 19 - 22nd Terrible Food, Service & Rain”
Reviews.Author: chestermomNewJersey
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review before but needed to after just returning from the Paradisus. The food is horrible - I have never been on a vacation before and lost weight from not wanting to eat the resort food. The buffets are just plain awful. The lettuce was consistently wilted and brown, everything was always cold, none of the food is marked - you have to guess at what you are about to eat, they didn't even replenish the food once it was gone, and on more than 1 occassion I saw the staff picking at the food (with their fingers) for themselves - gross. The service was pretty bad - no incentive for the staff to fulfill a request from a guest. After asking 3 different people for cream for my coffee my coffee grew colder and colder and I never received the cream. Room service was better than any of the buffets - the downside to that is you have to order it and wait an hour to get it. I wonder who manages the staff because they were always standing about chatting away to one another and were never in any rush to help someone who may need it. They eat and socialize all day long - no wonder they work there. Too bad for the paying guest. We made our dinner reservations when we first arrived and only were able to get into Bamboo and Romantico. Bamboo was the best meal we had in the 4 days - Ironic that we came to PR and enjoyed Japanese food better than anything else they had to offer. Although we couldn't get a reservation for our first night in any of the restaurants we saw many open tables and when we asked they said WE ARE BOOKED SOLID. We had no choice but to go to the buffet and try to pick through the unidentified food and wilted brown salad. I was just wondering why they would build a resort on the base of a rain forest? It rains there a lot. Pretty annoying when you just get relaxed and have to run for cover during the many many downpours that come. I thought the rooms were ok and I didn't see any of the bugs that some of the people wrote about. I was really happy about that because the bugs would have put me over the edge. We had a clean, ocean view room near the Royal Service pool. I was very disappointed in the transfer bus - slow, the check-in - slow (and I was part of the Royal Service plan), the service - slow to none at all, the food - awful and the drinks are NOT top shelf and they do not put very much alcohol in your glass. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and I would never go back. I'm giving this 2 stars only because my husband and I were trying to make the best of it. The Royal Service Plan definitely saved us because the private pool had good chair service and when it wasn't raining and the sun was shining we did get to relax a little. I would gladly pay 10xs the price for good food and service because to me that is what vacation is all about.

Reviews.Title: “Paradisus Jan 15-19th”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Every 2 years my mom who is now 80yrs young and I travel, my husband goes to work. We try to go to an all-inclusive because of the convenience. Two years ago we went to El Conquistador Hotel in San Juan (not an all-inclusive) it was wonderful. Let me start with the bus that picked us up at the airport to take us to the Paradisus. After flying in from Philadelphia we were a bit tired from the travel. They had us walk a distance to the bus pulling along our luggage. It turns out we were the only 2 people on the bus and they couldn't meet us at our airline...The girl who met us at the airport saw my mom was exhausted and finally offered to take her suitcase. They had us waiting on the bus for about 15 minutes as the bus driver socialized outside the bus. After 45 minutes we arrived at the hotel and checked in. Our room was not ready and we decided to eat lunch and make reservations for the restaurants. We knew from past experiences its important to do that immediately or else we'd be stuck eating only at the buffets. We were given a hard time making the reservation since we didn't have the key to the room even though we knew the room number. I wouldn't give in and we got our reservations. I asked for 7 pm and they said it wasn't available but the times we were given were from 6-6:45. The first night we went to the Italian buffet and had to wait 45 minutes for a table. When we were seated we saw alot of empty tables and a number of tables that had to be cleaned off. I was furious that we had to wait so long. We were not the only ones. If a party of 10 walked in the hostess would seat them first all others had to wait. It's amazing that one would have to wait for a buffet when you are getting up and getting the food yourself. It didn't make sense since the tables were available. Right from the start I felt that the hotel didn't care about the people. By the way the food was quite fair. Our first restaurant with a reservation was Avacado the food was just ok, nothing to rave about. The service was awful. I asked for water 3 times before it was finally given. The second night we went to Romantico, we both ordered lamb chops medium, it came to us cold and bleeding. We sent it back and I think they put a match under it. Needless to say we didn't eat our meal. The last night we ate at Bamboo and it was very good. At the first 2 restaurants as we sat there we saw a number of empty seats at 7:00 the time we requested and were told it was booked at 7pm. We didn't appreciate being lied to either. We were told there is entertainment every night which also bought us to this hotel. The first night they had a show but we were to tired to see it. We thought we would catch the other shows. To our surprise there wasn't any as Loreal was having a convention and they were to busy setting that up. Because of that the guests had to suffer. People just sat around drinking or going to the casino, which is where we spent our nights. Our room was nice but we had flying bugs so we had to have the room sprayed. They have service to get you around the resort, the only trouble is it comes every 20 minutes. We were lucky enough that we were near the pool and restaurants. We had waited for the tram at the pool and they told us to go to the front of the resort. When we got to the front they said go to the back. We didn't feel anyone actually knew what was going on. I also asked if they had a computer service and they weren't sure. The last day someone finally told me that it was in the business office. Maybe it was our fault but I was under the impression there was a beach and we could go in the ocean. My mistake. They had some lounge chairs on grass with the ocean as the background. The pool was dirty. They had what looked like a hot tub or whirlpool with jets in the center of the pool. I got into the water which happened to be cold and got to the whirlpool and found out it was just jets and it was not a hot-tub. I thought that was rediculous to sit there and have cold water jets on your back. There wasn't a hot-tub at the pool but for $28.00 a day you could use the one at the spa along with the steam room and sauna. I was wondering what happened to ALL INCLUSIVE! We called for bottled water as our house keeper forgot to to put new bottles in our mini bar. They told us that there would be a $3.00 charge to bring it to our room....my mom told them it could wait until later. That type of thing turns me off to a place to be so petty. We did confront the manager about our gripes. We felt something should have been done to rectify some of the things we told her about. She said she would tell someone the next day and they would get back to us. Of course that never happened. We were very unhappy with this resort and would NOT reccommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Open a FedEx account”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Please FedEx the following items to the Paradisus: 1.a propane grill (you will need to do your own cooking) 2.any food you decide to cook (the food is bad and it takes too long to be served) 3.extra beach towels (you are only allowed 1) 4.a keg of water and normal soft drinks 5.Ear plugs for DJ â€œDisturbing the Peaceâ€� for he will make you want to swim home. 6.A dehumidifier for the rooms are musty and damp (even the tissues were wet) 7.Steel-toed caterpillar work boots for the cockroaches in our bathroom were the size of small birds. 8.Liquid nails to glue on the knob to turn on the showerâ€¦it kept falling off. 9.A bug zapper, a gallon of insect repellent, and a screened in porch. 10.Hiking boots for the beaches are not sand. 11.Your negotiating/debating skills for there were unnecessary charges on my room account. 12.A book on how to learn to pay for room service in an â€œall inclusiveâ€� resort. 13.Coping skills in case you become violently ill from eating an elongated hot dog. 14.Finally, you are gonna need to pack a lot of patience.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go to Paradisus!”
Reviews.Author: hailhim88
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a family vacation at the Paradisus in Puerto Rico from January 12 â€“ 16, 2006. There was 10 of us on an annual family vacation. This year we decided to really splurge and go for a 5 star experience. Our package included air from Newark, NJ to San Juan, PR transfers and all inclusive resort. The total price of our package was $2980 for a couple. I felt it was important for everybody to fully understand what is really happening at this resort. We arrived at Paradisus at 4:05 and waited 17 minutes in the lobby line to be waited on by an extremely unfriendly receptionist who checked us in. Check in time was to be 3:00. Our rooms wouldnâ€™t be ready until 4:30. She said that we go to the bar or the lobby restaurant and enjoy the all inclusive meal or drink. We asked to be compensated for our wait as we just traveled for 5 hours. She suggested that we could have a drink or meal. After we explained it was all inclusive and obviously we can have some food or drink, she stated there was nothing she could do. The resort grounds are very beautiful. When we were ready to go to our rooms, we were driven by a bus boy who was very friendly. Our room was musty and remained that way the whole time we were there. The rooms were clean and very nice. The most important thing for you to know is that the restaurantsâ€™ quality and service was extremely poor. We werenâ€™t able to get any reservations until 9:00 for all nights we were there. The first night we had a reservation at Avacado. Our reservations were supposed to be at 9:00 and they made us sit outside until 9:20, even though there were plenty of available seats inside the restaurant. We ordered at approximately 9:45. We had our apps at 10:00. Our meal finally arrived at 10:40, but it was cold for most of us. We were the last people to leave the restaurant, but it seamed that every waiter had their own agenda and didnâ€™t help the last waiter who was waiting on us. He served us desert which took another 20 minutes and never asked us for coffee, but when we asked him it took another 15 minutes. The food was very poor. Second night we ate at Romantic and the service was worse. We didnâ€™tâ€™ leave this Restaurant until 11:30. We felt we werenâ€™t alone as another party of golfers were extremely upset. The one guy customer actually got up from his table and went back into the Kitchen. He came out and approached our table and asked us if we were upset of the service. He told us that he was sick and tired of waiting and that he had a business party with him that were golfing all day. He told us that the waiters were just in the back â€œhanging outâ€�. I must say the quality of the food was good. The third night we ate at Bamboo. We had reservations for 9:00, however, they wouldnâ€™t seat us until 9:50. The hostess was extremely rude and unfriendly. The food was good and we had a good time. The major drama that night was a scene at the next station. The cook accidently hit one of the customers with one of his shakers and it made a big splash in his soup and thus all over his shirt and pants. The cook didnâ€™t acknowledge what happened and the customer threw a big fit in front of the whole restaurant. The fourth and last night we ate at the Italian restaurant buffet. The place was a pig pen. There were dirty tables all over. Although we only had to wait 10 minutes, the quality of the food was extremely poor. I must say that we travel on business and pleasure and have stayed a many 5 and 4 star hotels and resorts. We feel that we were ripped off and will never return to this place. I was a waitress for six years during college and I believe that the restaurant staff is not trained and not motivated. Our party of 10 people was dissatisfied because of the poor service and mediocre at best food. We tried to communicate our concerns during our stay. A manager was to meet us on 1/13 at 9:00 at Romantica, however he did not show up. I also tried to call a manager several time after that, but they were never available and they would give us their number, but it just rang.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend! (particularly for couples)”
Reviews.Author: Rachael-Dublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Paradissus from 26-30 December 2005. I have never written a hotel review before but feel I have to in this case. We stay in 5 star hotels around the world and usually spend Christmas in one in Mauritius. We are a young couple and joined family there for three nights. The location is nice except it is very far from any town etc. if you wanted to try and escape to a local restaurant. The rooms were fine, large but not luxurious as one would normally expect with a five star. We were paying $1000 a night and for that it was a very average room. The (free) mini bar only contained water and soft drinks. While the water was welcome we would prefer a full bar and the option to decide paying for a bottle of wine. Our first introduction to the hotel was at a slow check in where we were told we would have to wear a wrist band for our stay and given cards which would allow us to get a pool towel each. If the pool towel was not returned at the end of each day one has to pay $30. I have never stayed in a 5 star (or any hotel for that matter) which didn't hand out towels at the pool. We felt like we were in boarding school! The next day we met the rest of our family who had already been there a week who confirmed it was really dreadful. In particular they complained about the food, the wine, the incredible system of having to queue to make restaurant reservations and the lack of a supervised childrens club. The had four children under 8 with them and the 'supervisor' just walked off one day and left them on a beach with other children. We decided to make the best of it and found the adult only pool which is part of a royal service package. For $25 each extra per day we could use it and avail of its relatively civilised atmosphere and its more relaxed towel regime - they gave you two towels! The pool staff here were very friendly and regularly brought around water etc. On the food all I can say is that it wasn't good. Breakfast was the best of the lot as there was plenty of fresh fruit. We avoided lunch after the first day. The salad bar looked as if everything had come out of tins. We ordered a bottle of wine and it came long after we had finished eating. With tips being included in staff's wages they have no incentive to be that attentive. Saying that we did meet some very pleasant staff. We tried three of the restaurants - Bamboo (ok), Avocado (bad) and Tuscana (very average pasta bar). There was loud entertainment in all three and constantly in the main bar area. The hotel is aimed towards large families with plenty of children where costs can be controlled with the all inclusive system and people aren't that interested in good food. It seemed ideal for teenage children and the main pool was full of life. It is not designed for couples at all. We were forunately only staying for three nights on a stopover before we headed on to another Caribbean island. The rest of our family checked out a week early and moved to the Ritz-Carlton in San Juan which they found very good - their main reasons for leaving being the food and the lack of fully supervised child care facilities. I am giving the hotel two stars as the spa was really magnificant. We used it every day. The massages were among some of the best we have ever had worldwide and we travel alot. The staff there were also excellent. The adjacent gym is well equipped but tiny for the number of guests in the hotel and was full at peak times. The casino was also well equipped and seemed to be well run. Finally the bugs - I should mention I got about 40 little bites in the 3 days we were there. Although I should also mention that my husband didn't get any. Safe to say that next year we are all returning to the luxury and fantastic food of Mauritius!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it! All in one and not the cheap watered down ones”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stay in December and we can't say enough about how great it was. It wasn't the all in one type of hotel that gives you watered down drinks or cheap food. We felt like Royality. What lacked in having a relative small beach front it very much was compensated in the pool area. What a beautiful pool and hotel overall. Very friendly personel that show why the Puerto Rican people are some of the tourist friendly in the Caribbean. You can't believe what I saved not having to bring my wallet around or charging everthing to my room. We drank and ate when and what we wanted...Could you imagine what it would of cost us in a regular hotel for everthing we had!!! We loved it and we be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Needs massive improvement!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been to this resort twice in the past 2 years and there is some serious service issues at this relatively new hotel. I stayed from 12/27-1/2 and the staff shortage was very obvious. While I expected a slight drop in service during a peak holiday week, the service level was totally unacceptable. I heard from some of the local staff that much of the service people walked out of the resort in early December because of wage issues. As a result, they are completely understaffed and unable to adaquately service their customers. To charge people $700-$800 per night and be told I cannot make a reservation in one of their better restaurants is unacceptable. If I wanted to eat at buffets all week, I would have went to Punta Cana and spent $300-$400 per night. While some of the positive reviews on this site occured during less peak dates, during the busy season this hotel either needs to close half their rooms so they can adequately service people or drop their rates by 50%! The turn over in management is extremely high and finding competent people to manage this hotel is very difficult. I would never go back to this hotel unless the service improves dramatically.

Reviews.Title: “Just got back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I too just got back from a nice holiday vacation in Puerto Rico at the Paradisus. I am surprised at a lot of the comments as we did not experience a lot of the negatives that others have experienced. Hopefully I won't bore you with the details but I will go into our entire experience there. First of all, due to research on the internet, we booked the Royal Service which was probably worth it in the long run but also the source of the few negatives we experienced. We arrived the day after Christmas around 1:00 PM (at airport) and had originally planned on taking a taxi to the resort which we figured would be faster than waiting for a shuttle at about the same price. when we got off the plane, a Paradisus representative was there waiting for other guests. We were able to take the shuttle which was $120.00 round trip. It did take an hour to get to the resort from the airport - seemed forever - but anything would have seemed forever after a 4hour plus flight from Chicago. When we got to the resort, we were asked our names as soon as we got off the shuttle and when they saw that we were 'Royal Service', we were immediately escorted to a special lounge where we were checked in. So, Royal Service saved us the longer check in at the front desk. While checking in we asked about different aspects of the resort and royal service and it was suggested that before our 'butler' (I use the term very loosely) would give us a tour of the resort and take us to our rooms that we should immediatly book our reservations for our restaurants. The butler took us to the restaurant line (one person was in front of us) and we were told that due to a computer problem and cancellations, we could only book that night and the next. I really didn't feel like coming back and while she stepped away to get a reservation book, I asked our butler about it and told him I would prefer to book our entire week. When she came back he spoke to her in spanish and lo and behold, we booked our entire week, got reasonable times (all around 7PM) and tried out almost all of the restaurants - Bamboo is the absolute best. This resulted in a nice 'extra' tip for our butler (since all tips and gratuities are included). Room - Absolutely gorgeous and no musty smell like some people have mentioned. Huge towels, robes, unbrella, mini rifrigerator stocked each night - just softdrinks water and beer. Balcony - ours looked out toward the mountain/rain forest. The four royal service buildings are very close to beech and to the main resort. And, they have there own private adults only pool around maybe 16 or so cabanas that can be reserved by the day. Do that immediately too ... the first couple days you may be on a wait list - they give them away if you don't claim them by 10AM. Basically we beached in in the AM and Cabana'd it in the PM other than the one day we took a tour of the rain forest which is absolutely phenomenal. The main pool was definitely filled with a lot of kids, but the beach was not nor was the private pool. The beach - Due to research on the internet we brought aqua socks which were a must if you wanted to use the beach as opposed to the pools. From what I understand, the beach is a 'natural' beach and can't be groomed. The beach itself and the views were fantastic. There is really two beach areas .. the first being the natural beach which is from the water to boulders that stretch out along the whole beachfron ... this beach was around 10 to 15 feet wide I would say. Then there are the boulders and behind the bolders, between the beach and the resort is what seems to be a man made beach area where a lot of people sunned and played volleyball, etc. The water is absolutely calm, as there is a sandbar maybe 200 yards out where the waves crash. The beach is rocky but with aqua socks, absolutely no problem. the other problem with the beach is the water where there is muich vegetation. However, with aqua socks and good vision (you can see where the vegetation is) you can find good places to swim and I was in the ocean every day having a ball. If we had our kids (now adults) they would have wanted some motorized fun (jet skis) but for us, it was nice and calm and beautiful. We kayaked some days we paddle boated others and just vegetated the rest. We felt no reason to take a cab to any other beach. BRING AQUA SOCKS! Restaurants and food - Breakfast and lunch were buffet - the 'outdoor restaurant was primarily for people who were at the pool and didn't want to put on shorts and shirt.. the indoor restaurants were for everyone else (including a few who didn't care to listen to the rules and came in barefoot and in swimming suit). Buffet was average. Breakfast, if you are an egg eater, have them make you fresh eggs... the scrambled in the buffet were atrocious. Also, I couldn't wait to hit O'hare airport on the way back to get a cup of coffee as there isn't a good cup in Puerto Rico! All in all, breakfast and lunch were good ... only real complaint was lack of fruit which I found surprising. Some days the fruit was out other days it wasn't. Dinner was for the most part above average. Bamboo great - this is the japanese style restaurant where 12 people sit around a table and they prepare the food in front of you. Nice way to meet people and food was great. Romantica was very good but service was slow and slower. Toscano is Italian but buffet style .. they will make whatever kind of pizza you want, or the pasta dish will be made in front of you with whatever ingrediants you want. Wasn't thrilled about a buffet for dinner but I found the food very good here. Avocado is the 'California' style restaurant and we were warned that the food sucked. We were there two nights and the first night the food was very very good - we had fish of the day and second night it was just ok. We did not try the Mexican nor the Caribbean. Royal Service - Helped us out at check in. Helped us out getting reservations to the restaurants. Didn't know where to get ice (machines are not in your building0 so we called and asked where the machines were .. they told us not to worry , that was part of royal service - they would bring us ice. 45 minutes later - no ice. called again... 45 minutes later we left for dinner, still no ice ... never got it. Next day called again ... no ice... called agian and was promised it in 15 minutes... 30 minutes later got a phone call making sure we got it and told them no. finally two differentpeople came with ice. They have robes in the room and if you want to buy one you call and they will send over a new one. On New Years eve, our last night, I decided that I would get one as a souvenier. Called thenumber and no answer. Went to dinner and stopped at royal service lounge .. they told me they would have one sent to room. Never got it... wasn't billed for it either. (By the way - check the tv account summary every now and then ... they charged me $400 by mistake and corrected it by crediting me $300.00. I didn't like their math and called - no problem getting it corrected. Part of royal service was getting a daily newspaper .. despite calls and a personal visit to royal service lounge, I never got it. New Years eve we called and told them what time we needed them to come get our luggage and take it to the shuttle (5:45 AM for a 6AM shuttle) and no one showedup. Finally after two calls, someone came. Neither did the shuttle. Finally at 6:30 they were able to scrounge one up for us and the other family going to the airport. By the way, return trip to airport on New Years day at 6:30 AM was only 30 minutes - no traffic. So, royal service was for the most part frustrating whenever we had to rely on someone to do something. Casino - Yes it is small - but dealers are very friendly and this was our entertainment. Basically the table games they had were roulette, caribbean stud, three card poker, several blackjack tables, late at night they opened a texas holdem table and then there were slots. We knew ging in it was a small casino and didn't have a problem with it although I would have loved it if they had a craps table. Entertainment - Lounge as nice in early evening - a duet with a piano player and a singer. Later a band that could get quite loud. And each night at 10:00 entertainment in the ballroom. We go on a loto f cruises and love going to the shows. We went the second night and lasted 20 minutes... never went back. If you are going for the entertainment - this is not the place to go. All in all, we had an absolutely fantastic time ending with the champaign and fireworks they provided for New Years. Would we go back - in a second. I would get royal service again but knowing now how they act, would stay on them a lot more about getting what I paid for. I would also book another excursion because I was getting antsy by the end. I am not used to totally vegetating and would haveliked another getaway. I forgot about the spa/gym. I can't tell you about the spa, but tthey had a very nice gym which was very busy. Around 6 treadmills, one eliptical, about three exer4ciswe bikes and a lot of weight machines. I should have used the gym more than I did because it definitely wasn't a break even in terms of working out and relaxing with a rum drink - but what the heck - it was vacation!! I have listed my email address and would be glad to answer any questions regarding my experience. Happy New Year!

Reviews.Title: “bring the bug spray”
Reviews.Author: Harlin
Reviews.Content: It's a beautiful-looking resort, food is passable, Royal Service is the only way to go, but bring the bug spray. So many guests were covered with bites. I was eaten alive.

Reviews.Title: “Shouldn't Be Marketed as a 5 Star Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Paradisus from 12/27-1/1. We agree with most of the comments posted. The reservations process was an embarassment. We waited in line the day we got there for 1/2 hour only to be told the 3 a la carte restaurants (which were the only 3 that came somewhat recommended) were booked solid for our whole stay. We were stunned especially after all of the money we spent on the trip and we refused to take no for an answer. We ended up taking the last reservations of the night(9:30 p.m., which didn't get us out of the there some nights until after 11). We did not travel with children so we were a bit more flexible than some others. I can't imagine this type of reservations procedure can go on like this as we saw MANY people complaining and demanding to "see the hotel manager." Anyway, the food was so-so and the service was less than that. I agree that it is a result of an all-inclusive deal. They have no motivation or incentive to provide 5 star service. The room was clean and the pool was enjoyable. It did seem a bit "spring-break like" at times but we sat as far away from the music/mc as we could have. Overall, the weather was beautiful and anything would have been nice leaving NJ in winter time. If you are looking for 5 star service and amenities don't come here. If you want a quick, warm getaway, give it a try--maybe bring some snacks of your own :o)

Reviews.Title: “Glorious pool. Great service.”
Reviews.Author: newyorkgal
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Xmas week at Paradisus and we had a great stay. The most positive feature was the pool. It's just magnificent - absolutely huge and perfect temperature - with zillions of lounges and shaded areas. The food was very good to excellent. Of course, as an all-inclusive, they had their fair share of weird items, but by and large, it was bountiful, fresh, well-prepared and upscale. As for service, we thought it was excellent. We called housekeeping at 1AM and by 1:15AM, they arrived and took care of our issues. We had a medical situation which was handled perfectly. Service at the pool and restaurants was perfectly fine. There are a few negatives to share. Yes, there is a musty smell in some of the rooms. But on the other hand, they're big (with space for a full king and pullout couch and possibly a rollaway too), and the mattresses are wonderful. There are also issues with restaurant reservations. Very slow and your choice of restaurants is not guaranteed. The beach is very beautiful to look out on, and the water sports are fun, but it's not for swimming. And, it's certainly not the place for you if you worship sugar-spun sand. It's just a rocky strip, but as long as you know this upfront, you won't be disappointed. Bring bug-repellant sunblock. There is a gnat problem at dusk. In general, I agree with the reviewer below that there's no reason why this hotel should have gotten so much negative feedback. Some aspects were better than others but by and large, we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Paradisus PR - Close To Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: RockMom
Reviews.Content: I have no idea why so many people found this resort so unappealing. My stay was wonderful during the week of Dec 6-12th, and very empty. We had our choice everyday of lounge chairs and huts at the main pools. We constantly had people trying to service us with their hospitality, and always got a "trolley" ride to and from the pool/restaurant/lobby area. I guess that's the perks of being a Royal Service guest. Yes, the room was a bit musty smelling upon entering, nothing a little febreeze didn't clear up. Still, the room itself was roomy, and constantly being refreshed/cleaned. The resort itself was amazingly beautiful and clean. The food was OK. If you didn't see these meals as your last suppers, it was passable. Bamboo was fantastic, the food and entertainment. We traveled with children both under 7, and there was a lack of kids club entertainment for them, but the pools more than made up for that, and the beach was steps away, so they could run back and forth and still be supervised. There is pretty much no entertainment to be found, but I knew that going in, and was not too concerned about getting a Broadway performance on a PR Island. Overall, we had a fabulous time, our money ($,$$$) was well spent at this gorgeous resort and we totally enjoyed our stay and would recommend this to all. Oh, take a trip to the rainforest, that too is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of service and nightlife”
Reviews.Author: rick787
Reviews.Content: I had very high expectations from what I had read about the resort in the Internet. I soon discovered things were a bit different. First, the resort is about an hour from the international airport in Isla Verde and transportation is not included to and from the hotel ($120 round trip for 2 adults). The building and the bungalows are very pretty as well as the pool area and the mountain view (it's the rain forest called Yunque that can be seen from the pool area) sadly, the outdoor lobby where the main desk is located is just simply too hot, I was sweating heavy while waiting in line to be checked in (also long line at check out since express check out from room TV was not available) and nobody offered us any refreshment or water, also the desk agents did not look very happy to be working in those conditions. Restaurants are buffet style and a la carte. A la carte restaurants need reservations in advance and if the place is crowded you won't be able to get any reservation during the whole stay. I had a good dinner at Bamboo (japanese) one night but was not able to get in for the rest of my stay. The buffet style restaurants( Caribeno and Toscano) are disappointing to say the least. The main bar was enjoyable and the bartenders gave good service while a lady sang spanish songs, enjoyed that very much and tasted a bit of the national culture talking to locals and watching them dance but this was the only nightlife the hotel offered since they have no live bands or dance club. My biggest complaint was lack of service, employees looked overworked and unhappy, all areas looked understaffed. Concierge was never available during the evening and the front desk was too overwhelmed with guests unable to help us at any time. There is no free shuttle bus to Luquillo Beach which is about 10 minutes from the resort and simply mediocre nightlife inside the resort and not much too do in the municipality or province of Rio Grande where the resort is located (you have no choice but to pay a taxi $140 to enjoy San Juan's exciting nightlife ).

Reviews.Title: “Nice sized rooms, but ............”
Reviews.Author: LMRKW
Reviews.Content: All-inclusives usually are a red flag for me, so our family went to the Paradisus with low expectations. Check-in was painless, and our luggage was delivered to our rooms promptly. We were pleasantly surprised at the nice sized rooms, not royal service but we were an upper floor which I think have larger rooms. It was warm & humid late in November in Puerto Rico, and maybe it's always humid here since the rooms have a slightly moldy smell. All the surfaces & fabrics felt a little sticky & damp from all the moisture in the air. The shower/tub in our room had a slow drain, meaning by the time you got finished with a 10 minute shower you were standing in a foot of water and after you got dressed left the bathroom 5 minutes later the tub still had not drained yet. This problem was made somewhat somewhat better after we complained, instead of 12 inches of water you stood in 2 inches of water. We were a large group so all of our dinner reservations were made months in advance. "Bamboo", the japanese hibachi style restaurant was decent. Very limited menu. "Toscano" - is as horrible as everyone else says it is. Italian buffet without even one decent italian dish. Only edible food item here was the cookies & cream ice cream which - thank goodness came ready to eat from Breyer's. The service was the worst here. "Avocado" buffets for breakfast & lunch were good bets. Did not have dinner here, but I think it's always buffet style regardless of the meal. "Romantico" has an ambitious menu, and the menu descriptions raise your expectations for the food. The food was decent but certainly does not deserve a rating much above "Bamboo". Ask about the policy for young children at "Romantico", this restautant is supposed to be Paradisus' premiere dining place so they discourage very young children from eating there. Most alcoholic beverages are included in the stay rate, but there are premium liquors & wines that can be obtained for an extra cost. I personally did not eat at the "Mirador Grill" buffet by the pool, the children in our group were ok with it since they had burgers, but the adults in our group catergorized the food at the "grill" as slop. Silly one towel per guest policy at the pool, and you had to remember to bring your towel card with you to the pool in order to receive a towel. Many lounge chairs had black mold on them. Invisible biting sand flies or something in great abundance by the pool areas and in the grass by the beach. I have been back from Puerto Rico over a week and am still scratching at 75 -100 bites. Front desk management/service was great. Support staff service, ex. waiters, housekeeping, bartenders, etc...., were not so good, we suppose because of the nature of all-inclusives there isn't any incentive for the staff to put in any more effort than is absolutely necessary. All in all, we had a nice time because of the company we were with. On a scale of 1-10 to rate the resort itself on everything from food, to service, to amenities for the price we paid, I would give Paradisus-Puerto Rico a 5. If the rooms were a little less spacious I would give the resort a 4.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: tattooyou
Reviews.Content: After 15 years of marriage this has only been our 2nd vacation. After saving for some time we were very excited about this trip and hoped that it was paradise. The resort was beautiful.....but the service was not what we had expected. The rooms smelled musty like you were in an old basement. The pool is only open from 8 to 6.....no night swimming. If you have kids there are no night time activities for them. My daughter(15) and I wanted to go to the spa for some a special day of pampering. The spa was not able to accommodate the both of us together for manicures and pedicures. They could only do 2 manicures and one pedicure, each seperately. All meals are buffet with 3 nights of ala carte at restraunts made by reservations. On our 3rd night the restraunt was closed and we were never advised. When it is off season you only have the option of eating at one restraunt which is buffet style. The Manager did make up for it by preparing anything we wanted but for the amount of $ we paid to stay there I don't thingk that they should penalize us for going during off season. The day we left we had made arrangements for the concierge to pick up our luggage and bring to the shuttle bus. They never came so we had to drag our luggage from our room to the bus which was quite a distance. I will end by saying that we read a lot of this before leaving on trip advisor but thought that we would see for ourselves. I will rely on trip advisor more often in the future.....and will not return to this resort unless they drastically improve!

Reviews.Title: “Dont Go There”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have traveled all over the world including England, France, Germany, Austria, Italy, Jamaica, Israel, and many others countries and destinations - both for pleasure and for business. Recently, I traveled to Puerto Rico for a family holiday vacation, and I stayed at Paradisus with my entire family and my in-laws. In my entire life I have never stayed in such a terrible place. If I could I would not even give it one star, but I can't. After one day in "paradise" I had so many bug bites that my youngest son thought I had the chicken pox. He was actually frightened that I would get sick and die. Try explaining that to a six-year-old. The pool was passable, it only scared me a when guests began spilling beer in the pool and nobody on staff seemed to care. The beds were adequate until the bugs living in them came out and ate you alive. The bathtub was outside and I am still perplexed about why someone would design an outdoor bathtub at a family resort that was open to public view. At first I did not care, however, an old woman came up to me while I was bathing (because I had no choice) and asked me how I was doing. I was flabbergasted. Also, there is no beach to speak of; there is an ocean with rocks surrounding it. The food could not have been worse. Mc Donalds was like heaven compared to the horrible food that came out of that kitchen. I went to camp for 11 years and I have never had subjected to worse food - and I had to pay for it. The service was an issue on its own. Don't get me started. It took three hours to order aslice of toast. The only positive thing about the hotel were the movies in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Bewear of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Paradisus was fine untill we had to eat.The food ----! If you are looking to lose weight I suggest you come here. It was also fine untill I was bitten by tons of bug. I looked like I had the chicken pox. The beach has rocks all over so make sure to wear shoes. The pool was nice. I once ordered toast off room service and it took them 2 and a half hours to bring it. The service was terrible. The best part was the outside bath. Somebody was come and put all these salts and bubles in it. But if cource you had to wait 2 hours before the guy came to do it.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel I've Ever Stayed At”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a discerning traveler who has stayed at many fine hotels around the world. Upon arriving at the Paradisus the day before Thanksgiving, I was shown to the grill where lunch is served. The food was in large, unsanitary vats and looked as if it had just been reheated as if it were a school cafeteria. I was so repulsed by the food that I asked for a grilled cheese, which I received ten minutes later. It was two pieces of cold toast with frozen American cheese in the center. Almost instantly, I began to be attacked by swarms of no-see-ums, making my body appear like I had a severe case of the chicken pox. When I went to the room, I ordered food from room service, only to find that the room service menu was limited and takes about two hours to arrive. Although the hotel claims to be all inclusive, they charged me $25 for an order of fresh strawberries. Although there are five restaurants, it is nearly impossible to get reservations at the Romantico and the Bamboo, the only remotely decent restaurants; the food is fit for prisoners. There are three pools at this property. At the main pool, one must present a towel card in order to get a towel which is a major inconvenience, and irritating music is played from a large speaker. The golf course looks like a swamp, and is practically unplayable.

Reviews.Title: “What a let down.”
Reviews.Author: Dallas_TexasTexas
Reviews.Content: We had the wonderful chance to visit Puerto Rico, although the wonderful part was not the Paradisus. The rooms (junior suite) appeared to be clean and was nicely appointed, except for the strong musty smell. The sheets on the bed still felt damp and the closet and phone smelled like someone was performing a science experiment growing mold spores on them. The resort is quite far from anything so there is no sight seeing or other restaurants to go to. Believe me, you will want to find different places to eat, especially if you want to try the local Puerto Rican flavor. (Suggest a cafÃ© called Spangilsh in Old San Juan) Upon our late arrival, (9:45 p.m. after traveling 11 hours from Seattle, WA) we wanted to sit down to a nice steak dinner. We attempted to go to 3 of their restaurants, and were either told we needed reservations (when clearly there were open tables; Avocado) or they were closing and we needed to go to one of the other restaurants. We made the mistake of going to the Itallian restaurant. We would have been better to skip the buffets. We choked down a wilted cesar salad, some soup and a little wine, then went back to the room, where we ordered room service. We rather enjoyed the burger and BLT wrap from room service, mainly because we were so hungry. Anyway, I could go on an on, but if you read the other reviews, you will get an EXACT picture of this resort; Property is lovely, especially the pool area. Food is substandard at best. Service was poor, but for some specific exceptions (Royal Service room personnel) Traditional Beach is non-existent. Very little to at night. Way too far from any other offerings of Puerto Rico. All inclusive does not include quite a bit. (E.g., any spa treatments, or transportation to San Juan, etc.) Tipping is expected if you want any kind of service. So, if you ask would you go back? I would say yes, but would stay somewhere in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing In Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Place is Great !! I have traveled to many resorts and have been on a few cruises but this place is the best , the grounds are perfect the staff is great and a special thanks to the people mentioned Lillybell the Pool attendent was always on time with the drinks , Jorge the Casino Host was the most pleasent Pit Boss i come across in all my gambling days his famous line is " you dont know where your going till you get there " Andres in the Romantico should be a Matrade in a NYC Famous Restaurant He Knows how to make you feel right at home and to the guys at the Front Desk thanks for helping me get my Ring Delivered from San Juan with just a moments notice! If you are planing a trip its a must go place to stay !!! I cant wait to get back !!! Remember take care of the People who Take care of you !!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: Cat89
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 10/22/05-10/26/05. The rooms were modern and spacious. The refridgerator was stocked with bottled water and soda. The pool was fabulous. There weren't too many choices at the buffet for breakfast or lunch, but dinner was excellent, especially the hibaci at the japenese restaurant and the beef at the el romantico. We took a tour of the rainforest (15 minutes away) that was interesting for $45 each. The only problem was I was bit all over by some small bugs by the pool bar that I think came out of the grass. Also, nighttime is a little boring, the casino is small. Overall, the Paradisus is a very nice place to stay,especially if you are just want to relax. I would definitely stay at another Paradisus in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but isolated”
Reviews.Author: Happy_on_the_road
Reviews.Content: Nice property, needs a lot of work to keep it up to top standards and things are slipping already. Confusing airport transportation service with 10 minute delay due to misinformed staff. My in room safe was locked when I arrived. Condensation on marble floors has to be pointed out before staff take action even after I saw them nearly slip as I did. Little things that says to me a year or two from now this place will need help. A bit sad to be so far from the action. I would only return if I am told I have to as was the case with my stay for a work off site. Food only OK, but hamburgers are good. Bars have cheap brands of liquor, some I never heard of. Rooms too far away but with luck I saw the tram go by 25% of the time. I was glad to leave though. This is not paradise. It is a good try that does not make it.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't go off season”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went this Oct. I didn't know but this is off season. This was OK because the resort was pretty much ours. The property is absolutely beautiful, the rooms are clean everything is maintained very nice. The one good thing about the resort not being fully booked was I asked if they could upgrade our room to Royal Service and they did at no additional cost:) But like other reviews I read- during off season they do close restaurants, there is less staff and the rooms are far from the pool and restaurant/bars and that tram car was NEVER seen. While we were there it rained in the morning so they closed the pool bar all day--even though it cleared up somewhat (keeping in mind this is one of 2 bars). I don't think they would have done these things if they were full. And I didn't pay any less because it was"off season"

Reviews.Title: “Not the place to stay during Celebrity Sports Invitational”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Last summer, my husband and I decided to take an 8-day all inclusive trip to Paradisus Resort prior to his deployment to the Middle East for 12 months. We paid over $5,000 for a royal service rooom, and happened to arrive the same day that the Celebrity Sports Invitational (CSI) began. For the 5 days of our trip that overlapped with the CSI, the services available were limited to almost nonexistent to individuals who were not part of the event. The entire 8 days we were there, we were forced to eat at the same restaurant for breakfast, lunch, and dinner, as all other restaurants, excluding the 2 restaurants open for reservations only, were only open for celebrity events. In addition, on Friday evening, the large pool and beach area was closed off completely to guests who were not part of the CSI. My husband and I complained to the royal service staff and to the General Manager, and although they were concerned about our unpleasant stay and frequently checked on us, nothing changed. If it would have not been for the excitement of seeing all the celebrities, my husband and I would not have had a pleasant trip. The tours available through the hotel are limited and short, and other than hanging out at the bar or the extremely small, 1-room casino at night, there was absolutely NOTHING to do there....no events for the non-celebrities at all. In addition, although the restaurants were clean, the menu/buffet was limited and pretty much offered the same food every single day. Furthermore, room service was very limited and took exceptionally long for delivery.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Paradisus”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Paradisus for 4 nights. It felt like paradise to me. My room was well appointed, high ceilings, eating area, good sized bathroom. My initial reaction was "Nice, very nice!". The service could not have been better. Mostly young folks, very helpful, friendly, pleasant and professional. The grounds and the pool are to die for. At night the open air common areas are lighted by candles and strategically placed lamps. It has a surreal effect, again, quite lovely. The food served buffet style was fine. The only buffet food I ever had that was above average was at West Point, The Thayer hotel. Other than there, most buffets to me are for satisfying hunger and not much more. Though I wouldn't describe the a la carte restaurants as gourmet they were, in my opinion, above average. I was pleased. The dining experience was close to being top notched. The beach is less than so so but I knew that so I wasn't surprised. If this resort had a better beach it would be heaven on earth.
