Reviews.Title: “Paradisus needs good Management but grounds are beautiful and help is nice”
Reviews.Author: TVI
Reviews.Content: Here are our issues with Paradisus in Puerto Rico: We arrive on August 1st, 2005 around 1:30 in the afternoon after a Paradisus $70.00 Mini Bus ride from the El San Juan Hotel in Isla Verde where we had stayed during the weekend. We went to the front desk and were told that we were a bit early, as they only take guest in at 3:00 PM, but that we could check in an hour and a half early for a fee of $100.00. I declined and sat down to wait in the lobby. I then tried to wander around the grounds but was stopped by security because I didn't have one of their arm bracelets identifying me as a guest so I returned to the lobby. At at little past three I went to the front desk to inquire on the room and was informed that it was not ready but they were working on it and that it would be available in another 20 minutes. I was then given a guest bracelet and allowed to have a drink in the lobby bar. At around 3:30 I returned to the front desk and again was informed that the room was not ready but that they would be glad to put me up in a Garden View room that was available, I declined having already paid for an Ocean View room and asked what the hold up was. They weren't sure but were sending someone to the room to see if service had cleaned it. Many apologies later they informed me that the room had been ready for some time because it had been vacant for a number of days. We then walked to room 924, about a quarter of a mile, as the golf cart trolley was full and no other cart was available. I arrived at the room but none of my luggage was there. Called the front desk only to be informed that the luggage had been misplaced but that they were looking for it and would have it to our room as soon as they found it. Many apologies later the luggage arrived and we were off to our first day of fun. We found the following during the next few days: Not all of the restaurants were open because this is their low season. So we had a choice of the "Bamboo", Japanese or the "Romatico", their Seafood and Steak and only by reservation. The Avocado buffet was available for Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner. The Caribeno, Mirador and Toscano were closed. The food was sub-standard, except for the Japanese Sushi Bar within "Bamboo" which by the way only has seating for six on a first come first serve basis. There are only two bars for the common guest. One in the Lobby and one in the pool. The other two bars are only available to guest who purchased the "Royal Service". I inquired about that and they wanted an additional $200.00 a night. The mini bar in the room only contains water and Coke and they do not re-stock unless you ask room service to re-stock it. The beach is unusable as it is full of seaweed and non-friendly marine life. It also does not have sand but a course gravel. No one uses it. Activities were Pool aerobics at noon, Yoga in the morning and the piano in the lobby at night. I was not aware of anything else happening so the pool and the pool bar is about it for entertainment. They did have sailboats and kayaks but I saw few guest using them because of the beach area is unappealing. The guest shuttle between the main building and guest rooms seem to travel very infrequently so I only took it about 4 times during my entire stay walking the 1/4 of a mile to and from the pool and lobby. I considered this the Paradisus exercise routine. They do not provide Free Internet Access but charge $14.95 a day for its use. They will also charge you an additional $15.00 if you do not have your own Ethernet cable. Dial up Internet is available at a $2.00 a minute charge and are happy to rent you a WIFI card for $25.00 a days if you wish. Far cry from their add on the Internet.

Reviews.Title: “I have had fun everywhere in the world except.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In order to properly present a clear and unambiguous evaluation of the resort I have broken my review down into a series of sub topics. 1) Bedrooms - I stayed in a exceptionally clean bedroom that contained 2 queen size beds and a suprisingly comfortable pull out couch. However, getting clean towels was extremely difficult and at times i found myself forced to use clean undershirts as towels because the staff and front desk was so unresponsive to my requests for fresh towels. I also made the mistake of trying room service which was fine if your able to eat disgusting deli meat or enjoy a portion of 4 over cooked buffalo wings. 2) Pool - The pool was gorgeou, spacious and suprsingly clean. Although my feet were covered in disgusting corking I didn't mind cleaning them after I got out of the pool because at least the water was clean (to the naked eye). I did enjoy the swim up bar until I was struck in the face by a young adult with a ball who thought it would be funny to hit someone with a drink. By the way if you can't swim dont go in the pool till saturday because the pools aren't protected till then. 3) Nightlife - If you like going to bed early and being surrounded by locals and drug dealers than you are in for a treat. The most exciting part of the nightlife at this resort was seeing that nobody was having fun. 4) Restaurants - They are all equally bad, but some have nicer staff than others. I ate at the Bamboo restaurant 4 times I enjoyed the food but found myself to only have a good time when I was able to finish off my mandatory 3 bottles of wine per meal. Drinking to create sanity is never something that should be a necessity on vacation. By the time you get to the hotel you will realize its too late to go back. Enjoy the beach while you can, seating for 6 on a beach sometimes can get really crowded. However, by the end of the week I found myself laughing hysterically at the situations around me and realized that I did have fun.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for an average resort..more like a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Aristah23
Reviews.Content: This review is kinda longer but worth the read. I am an avid recreational vacationer who usually stays at 4-5 star properties that are AI. I'm not super-picky, all I ask is that I get my $$$ worth. I stayed at the Paradisus during July 2005. We went as a family of 6 and went with the Royal Service. For a vacation that cost us $15K, it definitely wasn't worth it. I saw NO difference between the usual guest and the Royal guest (besides the use of a lounge and a pool that my 8 year old couldn't use anyway). The food was just OK...not gourmet. The restaurants seem to be understaffed. When you ask someone a question, you'll get 6 different answers. I had to make several calls to housekeeping, and Royal Service just to get enough towels. I was on the phone at the least twice a day asking for something (the minbar was never refilled and I never had enough bath towels). The rooms were absolutely beautiful and the grounds are amazing. The staff at the Royal Lounge tried their best to help you out but senior management seemed unresponsive to guest problems. When I checked in, I was told that one of the oceanview royal suites I booked was not available and they insisted that I never booked an oceanview to begin with. After proving my case with documentation from my travel agent, they believed me but couldn't get me the room. I opted for a refund for the difference b/w the rooms and was told that I'd get a letter of refund at the end of my stay to show my travel agent. As if that letter was ready for me upon departure! I had TO WAIT for the letter to be drafted while my airport transfer waited for me! The butler service was OK and it seemed like I'd get problems resolved faster by making the calls myself. What did I pay extra for? As for reservations at the restaurants, I really didn't have much of problem (the resort was fairly empty for the most part of my stay). On the weekends, they allow locals to use the pool area (which is totally inappropriate). If you want to go into town, open your wallet! It cost almost $30pp to get into town via shuttle. And if you want to go to the rainforest (which you can see from the resort...that's how close it is) is $50pp. Speaking of being ripped off, the cherry on the cake of this vacation was when I received my cell bill when I got home I found unauthorized calls to Dominican Republic on my phone while I was there! Apparently someone in housekeeping helped themselves to my hidden cell phone to call their family! HIDE YOUR CELL PHONES IN THE SAFE OR TAKE THEM WITH YOU! This resort has much room for improvement. Perhaps I'll go back when they get their act together. If you get a good deal on this resort, I'd try it. Otherwise, it's not worth the $$$$$$$$$

Reviews.Title: “All around nice, but has some problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were 4 couples who went there from June 30th to July 3rd. The hotel grounds are very nice especially at night all lite up. There really isn't a beach, but you sit on like a step up from the beach that has grass and sand in different areas. Not bad. The water is clear and very warm. The food was very good, but if you make reservations before you go, make sure you double check them when you get there. The girl had them written in her book, but not in the computer and it took some time to find them. I was worried about the staff from reading some of the reviews, and they were right. The staff is a little slow and new. You get different answers from different people which is the most frustrating. For example I called down to the desk and asked if you need long pants for the one restaurant we were going to in the evening and they said no. Well when we got there the host said you need pants, but she let us go. The casino was nice, but I would like to see $2 tables and not all $10 and $25. They did have nickal slots. The kids will like the arcade room. It's just about 9 playstations and xbox set up to computers. The drinks are all top shelf and the pool bar is cool. Instead of a high rise hotel, this one is spread out on the grounds in 2 story units. Some are pretty far, but they have a tram car that runs back and forth that is not always easy to find. What I really wasn't happy with is that on the weekends this place is open to the public and they have local company party's here. So if you can imagine Thurs and Friday this place was empty. Running about 24%. Then Sat and sunday it was packed. The pool was packed with mostly all Peurto Ricon's and there familys including kids. We enjoy meeting people from around the world, and I really didn't see that many here. The Perto Ricon's were very nice and friendly, but they mostly keep to themselves. There are enough lounge chairs also even when it's packed. Also the place is so big that even if it's packed, mostly around the pool, you can walk to a area that's empty. I was worried when we first got there and there was one person checking people in and we were in line for about 20 minutes. Also we were suppose to get all these coupons for things like massages and casino chips and I had to ask for all of them. The girl really didn't know. We rented a car from the hotel for a day and drove to old San Juan which was nice. Another thing that the hotel needs help with is the disco. The disco in located in a auditrium. The dance floor is in front of the stage. At 11:00 the disco lights come on and terrible music that is prerecorded is played. There was never anyone in there except for one night that we were in there with the guy who runs it and he was showing us new dances. They really need a didicated room with a bar and dj. They need atmosphere. We enjoyed dancing till dawn at Jamaica and missed it. All and all it was nice, but I don't think I would come back. There wasn't anything that really grabbed me with this place.

Reviews.Title: “great vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and our two children just got back and had a wonderful time, if you can't have a great time here you probably wouldn't be satisfied anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Concrete Bed!!!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveler43
Reviews.Content: I visited the Paradisius in Puerto Rico for a 1 week convention in Feb of 2004. The resort itself is beautiful and extremely well kept. The week was ruined however by the poor quality beds which where extremely hard. We where staying with over 100 other guests and the lousy beds where the topic of conversation at most meals. When we asked for a different room due to the beds, the staff told us the beds where all the same and we should complain to the manager. They also said the beds are the biggest complaint they have and seemed annoyed to hear it again. They encouraged me to write to the parent company which I did, but recieved no response. I also left a message for the manager the first night but he never contacted me. I would suggest at the price of this resort that you stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading earlier reviews my husband and I were reluctant on keeping our reservations from July 11 to the 15th. But we decided to give it a try and see what happened. Well I must admit that we had one of the best vacations we ever had while staying at the Paradisus in Puerto Rico. The grounds are absolutely beautiful. The food was good (never had a problem getting reservations where they were required). The variety of food was excellent and the presentation was impressive. The staff was very friendly and try to please you. The room was very nice, we had an ocean view with the jacuzzi. The casino was small but fun. In the evening there is live music. They definitely keep the resort spotless. In the evening there are hundreds of candles buring with many pool and fountains throughout the lobby and sitting areas. The pools are magnificent. We did gave the Royal Service and when we go back we would do the same thing again. It was worth the extra cost. We are so glad we kept our reservations and are already looking forward to our return visit next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great potential but falls short”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great potential; but the resort falls short of being even a four-star property. Some very simple adjustments could bring this resort up several notches.....improve the food! And figure out what is wrong with the "reservation" system for dining and fix it! Have some simple, fun evening activities; like bingo with a bottle of rum for the prize. Have it before or after the dinner hour and have it in the bar next to the casino or in the lobby. People would love to have something to do; there is nothing to do around the dinner hour. Have an mc and do an audience-involved type of show. The bar next to the casino is virtually empty, and could be a good place to have some type of activity, or maybe even the lobby area. This hotel could be great; just put in a little effort to raise it to truly be a five star property.

Reviews.Title: “Potential to be a 5* but not yet there... Senior management unresponsive”
Reviews.Author: beachlvr123
Reviews.Content: First a little background, husband and I are 36 & 40. We are professionals who travel 5-6 times per year to locations near and far (Italy, Greece, Croatia, the Caribbean, Mexico, Hawaii etc) and stay at high end resort and hotels. We are avid cruisers, fitting in one or two cruises per year, mostly on premium or luxury level cruise lines (Radisson, Seabourn, Princess, Celebrity). I write this review in order to share my experiences with those that visit this forum for truthful and useful information. These are observations of my experience My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights in June from the 25-30; at the suggestion of many tripadvisor posters we paid the extra $$ and got the "Royal Service". I don't know if it was worth the extra $$ because we did not speak with any others who were not in "RS" (not by choice) it just seemed everyone we ran into was in the "RS" area. I won't go into too much detail about the grounds as others have done a great job of that on this site already, sufice it to say, the grounds are spectacular. The pools (both Royal Sevice and main pool) are beautiful, the beach is kept natural and clean (and many many times we were the only ones there so it is private and peaceful as well). The rooms are quite spacious and for the most part comfortable (more on this later) The staff we encountered were, mostly, helpful; of course you will encounter the employee who won't be helpful in any situation this is not the resorts fault it just is the way some people are. I will add that tipping was definitely expected any and everywhere we went. How much and how often you tipped certainly paid a great part in how good your service was. Overall, I have no major complaints about the resort staff or grounds. My issues: BATH TOWELS- were threadbare and had holes in them on more than one occasion (i would not have made a point to speak with management for one isolated incident) In deference to the staff in Royal Service they attempted to resolve this issue (i was there when they called) but two days later nothing had been done the dirty robes were still in our room and the towels with holes were still being placed in our room. Maybe housekeeping took offense to getting a call from Royal Service?? I don't know but i am sure if the general manager had called this would problem would have been resolved and quickly. SHEETS- had holes BATHROBES-one had a huge coffee stain runing up one whole sleeve, the other had numeorus stains all over. NIGHTLY TURN DOWN SERVICE -only happened once during our stay. RESTAURANTS-Paradisus tout themselves as having 6 restaurants; of these six there were only two open during the day (one really and it is buffet). This would not be a big deal if you had some variety in the food, but both areas (they are not really separate restaurants but two connected areas with different names) had the same things day in and day out and it was usually picked over and poorly presented. I swear if I had to eat fried chicken one more time I was going to cluck! There was no variety even for dessert, Flan, Chocolate cake, ice cream. Evenings were not that much better- Romantico we ate here two times during our stay not so much becasue the food was good but because the other choice Bamboo was so bad (more on this later). Avocado-(which actually had good food), was only open twice during our stay (and we were not able to get in the first day because they were "booked" . All the restaurants were supposedly booked yet we saw 10 tables at Romantico sit empty for over two hours while we had our dinner. This is not counting the tables that were left uncleaned throughout the night. and yes Romantico was "booked" the night we were there . Bamboo-was a bad hibachi experience which might have been saved if the staff at Bamboo had offered some information on the sushi and appetizers available in the other room (even though we and another couple waited 45+ minutes at our table with nothing to eat before our "show" began). I believe I saw desserts on the menu but I could not tell you anything about them because after waiting 1/2 hour after our meal no one came to ask if we wanted any we all left. Poor restaurant management? maybe, sneaky expense management? more likely. My observation was that corners were being cut in the food department and many many people were unhappy about it. Unfortunately, none of the people I asked with said they had or planned to complain. The staff was without a clue, asking 5 of them what restaurant was opened on any given day resulted in 5 different answers (sadly all wrong). Spa-Overpriced for the service which was ho hum, nothing to write home about but certainly nothing to complain about. Again tips were defintely expected Car rental- we reserved a car week before we arrived, we checked once at the resort on Monday she confirmed that she indeed had our reservation for the Thursday returning to the airport. On the Wednesday we went to the Avis counter to check on our car (we had nothing to do) only to find out that they had no cars for us becasue they were short in SJU airport so they took all the vehicles. Now we were stranded! the only suggestion teh woman had was that she could refer us to a local rental agency but they only had one location so we would have to bring it back to them! so what good was this doing us! upon bringing this to the attention of Royal Service staff i was told that for $60 they could have the shuttle bring us to the airport to pick up a car. So now we have to pay $60 on top of the $60 per day the car was costing us just to leave this place! the least the should have done was to comp us the shuttle to the Avis counter at the airport. My biggest complaint? Lack of response from Sr. management These issues mentioned above could have easily been resolved by the manager whom we attempted to speak with on several occasions to no avail. It is so surprising to me that a hotel general manager would ask to hear their guests' comments and even take the time to respond to these Tripadvisor reviews but when presented with the opportunity to resolve a valid issue first hand before it gets to a review point; can be so totally clueless. Had Mr Lapp taken the ten minutes or to speak with us and listen to what we had to say I am sure he would have felt as did his other management personnel (who did attempt to to resolve these issues to no avail) that this was not acceptable anywhere in the world but even less in an alleged 5* resort. We paid good money to stay here, we were asking for nothing more than what we paid for, the quality were were promised and the quantity were were promised; 6 restaurants, clean robes non threadbare towels and sheets with no holes. We were not looking to get more than we paid for, but we were certainly looking to get what we were promised! Beware if you choose to stay here, bring lots of $$ for tip and your own robes/towels.

Reviews.Title: “Had potential, but certainly not there yet.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a four-night stay at the Paradisus. When we first arrived, we were very pleased. The resort is beatifully decorated and the pool is lovely. However, our excitement was short-lived! Our room smelled dank and moldy (so much so that my luggage and all my clothes smelled like it when we got home), and the toilet was not working properly. Our sheets had stains on them and the bed was not very comfortable at all. After spending about 30 minutes at the pool, we had had enough! The hotel overbooked the rooms due to a convention that weekend (we were told by a staff member that there were more than 4 people staying in a lot of rooms). The pool was extremely crowded and got dirty quickly - the guests were leaving plastic cups and straws throughout the pool area and they were floating around the water. The staff did try to clean it up but there was just way too many people for them to keep up. It was also impossible to get a drink at the bar, and when you were finally waited on, they were often out of whatever it was you wanted. The bartenders also seemed put out to take your drink orders. If the beach was beautiful, I would have been just as happy to spend the day there, but as another guest had said, it was non-existent. What little sand they had was covered in broken rocks, making it impossible to walk along and shallow water was covered in patches of sea-weed, making it impossible to swim in. The restaurants were mediocre at best. Romantico was the best food by far, however they classify themselves as fine dining and fancy with their dress code. They will not, under any circumstance, allow a male to dine in their restaurant with shorts on. My husband and I went to dinner, he was dressed in pressed khaki shorts and a button-down shirt and they would not allow him in the dining room until he put long pants on. This would be fine if this was their rule, however, they classified ripped, baggy jeans as long pants. While they would not let us in, they were allowing guests in baggy, ripped jeans, white tank tops and sneakers to eat in their dining room - fancy restaurant, I think not! One of the better nights we had was spent ordering cheeseburgers from room service to avoid the noisy crowds in the lobby and restaurants. This, too, was short lived, as the cable for the second night in a row was not working. After we complained and suggested they allow us to order a free movie they did, which was the right way to handle the situation. However, we got about half way through the film and that shut off, and was out for the rest of the evening. As I said, the resort itself was beautiful, but they need to improve their hospitality skills. There is no way this resort is a five-star, I would like to meet the person that rated it and find out how stained sheets, mediocre service, dirty pools and mildew stained lounge chairs can ever be classified as five star.

Reviews.Title: “Paradisus- Locals only club”
Reviews.Author: jrfalso
Reviews.Content: Five star resort, I think they do not know the meaning of 5 star. They need to have management /staff stay at a real 5 star resort such as The Ritz and take notes. Do not go for more than 3 days, you will be bored out of your mind! At first we were nervous because the Paradisus was off a main highway that thankfully led to the ocean. We relieved when we got out of the $60 per person shuttle (TOTAL RIP, $30 more reasonable) and arrived at the lobby. I will make this report short and sweet. I only stay at 4/5 star resorts when we travel. -The hotel ammenities were very nice. Marble floors and nice decor as far as having a drink in the lobby( antique furniture etc). -The rooms were nice, but mine smelled like a public bathroom. There was a stench that was not very pleasant. The maid service was good, no quams. - Could not get reservations at their "gourmet" eatery's, they said they were booked! Are you kidding me, I payed this much money for an all inclusive and I cannot eat where I want? Ridiculous, happened on more than one night! - The grounds were nice and well kept. - Good place if you like chaos, tons of kids and locals are welcome to pay a minimal fee to use the pool and resort facilities. Was soo crowded with locals on the weekend. This is suppose to be an exclusive resort, not even close. - There was nothing 5 star about the service! The bar tenders would serve their local buddies before they served customers. It was pathetic, you wait at the bar and they walk past you 4 times without serving you. Seemed like the staff was miserable except for a few nice people. Basically, if you are not from Puerto Rico you will not get any attention from the staff. - The food was ok if you can get a reservation, nothing gourmet as they proclaim. Romantico was actually good, the others were buffet style. Bamboo is a hyped up Benni Hanna, but they call it Asian Fusion ( there is no fusion). Paradisus likes to hype up most of their services, they are trying to hard to be something they are not - 5 star! - Cable was out for two days, not the hotels fault but atleast they can apologize. They did offer us a free movie which cut off half way through playing. - If you want a beach area, this is not the place to go. Big mistake by this resort, they should work on their beach area. It is all Rocks and little sand, could make the hotel alot better. - Pool was nice, except on Saturdays when all of the locals and their kids take over. Ridiculous, if you proclaim to be 5 star then act like it and remain exclusive. I paid alot of money to go there, these locals do not! Bartenders at the pool bar serve their buddies first, then eventually get around to paying customers. They were rude and had no etiquette, they need to get a clue! * All in all, Paradisus has along way to go! There is no way Paradisus is a 5 star resort, more like 3.5. They have to realize that it is not just the grounds that make a 5 star resort, but more importantly the service..which is a far cry from other 5 stars. Beware! I may sound like a pick tourist, but when I pay alot of money I expect good service! I will not go back or would I recommend this place to anyone. Hopefully they will get their act together.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, not thrilling, but nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to a Paradisus resort. Our first was in Punta Cana and it was AWESOME! The Paradisus Puerto Rico is just as nice and well taken care of but the beach is a mess, and not much of a beach to speak of. Our room was great, the staff was great the pools and spa were beautiful. Our biggest complaint was the restaurants, during our three night stay there were only three places to choose from. For the high price we paid for the trip I expect alot more. The food at the three was okay at best. I can't say a bad thing about the place or the staff, but the food needs some serious help. My advise, go to the Paradisus in Punta Cana.

Reviews.Title: “Some good points - some not so good”
Reviews.Author: cgras777
Reviews.Content: I spent June 5 - 11 with my wife and 4 year old daughter at Paradisus and this is the second all-inclusive we've been to (the first was Iberostar Tucan in Playa del Carmen, Mexico - a true 4 -5 star resort). What really needs to be done is break down the categories and rate them. Price - 3 out of 5 stars - We were very satisfied with the cost even after upgrading to the Royal Service - which is a must. Service - 4 out of 5 stars We upgraded to the Royal Service. If you are are not a Royal Service guest, the service will be poor. We were mistaken for non-RS guests and had to wait 45 minutes for someone to come to our room and get our luggage. Most employees were very nice - especially those assigned to RS guests. The resort was fairly empty so we were moved to a ocean front suite immediately. Food - 1 out of 5 stars The website states 5 star cuisine - not even close. You must make reservations to avoid the toscana and carribean grill. Avacado was only open 1 night ( we were there 6 nights) - The Bamboo the japanese fusion (which is really just a hibachi steak house) was open, but the staff never told us there was an appetizer menu with sushi and sashimi on it. Pretty lame not to do that. The Italian buffet style Toscana was horrible and the carribean buffet was only a little better. This place is not kid friendly in terms of food. The outdoor grill and eating area was never open when we were there so it was either eat inside after having to change your wet swimsuit, or eat lunch outside in 90 degree heat/100 percent humidity away from the shore with no breeze. Also there are no kids allowed in Romantico the French restaurant - thus eliminating another choice for our family. So for 5 of 6 nights, there were only 2 restaurants available to us. Beverages were plentiful and readily available - house wines were drinkable. There really was no afternoon snacks - all deep fried food. Beach - NONE no stars A dead reef surrounds the swimming area and although quite beautiful in a natural sort of way...the water is not what you would expect from Puerto Rico. Swimmable and clean, but not pleasant. No snorkeling. Catamaran, kayaking and paddle boats were fun though. Ground and Pool - Pool is great - grounds excellent 4 out of 5 stars Kid friendly - 0 out of 5 stars The Kids club is a small playground. There is no staff to organize any activities - except adult aquarobics - There is a baby sitter available if you need it. Activity packages - 0 out of 5 stars Since Paradisus is 50 minutes - 1 hour from San Juan with no traffic (and not the 35 minutes the website boasts) Most excursions outside the resort cost $60 - $100 per person. We rented a car for $60 and went on our own. Driving is no problem. The only kiosk is an AVIS rental (which is funny - because the resort package we purchased included a large discount for HERTZ - so if you took the resorts shuttle - you couldn't rent-a-hertz! ) Definitely do the rain forest and old san juan. If you rent a car an need to park it over night, you get charged $15 to park your car at the resort you're staying at! That was unbelieveable. The Spa is way over priced - even for a resort Room - 4 out of 5 stars - Room was beautiful with a jacuzzi on the balcony - though there are no doors or any separation between the 2 rooms of the "suite". View was lovely from the balcony. Oh by the way, we left an old worthless SLR automatic camera at the restaurant one night...never to be seen again - no one turned it in...good thing I didn't leave our digital camera.

Reviews.Title: “Must visit Paradise, I mean, Paradisus”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just came back from 4 nights at Paradisus Puerto Rico and had an amazing time. We have travelled and stayed at luxury resorts in the past, and we had a great experience here. I was certainly concerned before going after reading some of the earlier reviews, but for the most part was pleased. Pros: The resort setting is gorgeous. The grounds were well kept with plants and flowers. It was clean. The main pool was fantastic. Despite many people in the pool, it was large enough were you could find your own quiet corner. Swim up bar and partially submerged lounge chairs were a plus. The covered cabanas were great and provided some needed shade from the HOT SUN. The food was very good. Breakfast and lunches were mostly buffets, but the quality of the food was great. Dinners were very good. Service was a bit weak (see cons below). The beach was actually great. Not the best for actual swimming, but nice to sit out and use the kayaks and paddleboats (included). Royal Service was a must. Nicer rooms. Made a jacuzzi on your balcony for you each night if you wanted. Access to private pool. Cons: A bit of a drive from the airport. The service in the restaurants was still a bit slow and not as responsive as one would expect at such a resort. They didn't fill water glasses promptly. When asked, they would say ok and not come back. You would have to ask several people (often the manager) to fill the glass. When you went up for seconds (or thirds, fourths, fifths) of food, they didn't take away the dirty plates. It became a bit comical after a while. The reservation system for dinners still doesn't quite work. I had heard that they improved it by allowing you to call before you arrive. When I did (the day before arrival) I was told they would hold the time slot and to call when I arrived with my room number. I did, but was told that the reservation time wasn't available and had to chose different times (not the ideal ones, but oh well, we were on vacation). However, when we did arrive for our 8:30 reservation at Bamboo (had called and asked for 7) they told us that it would be at least 30 minutes more. We ended up not staying and just going to one of the restaurants that didn't need reservations. The only other con would be that in the evening there isn't too much to do. They close the pools at 6pm (seemed kinda early) and at 10pm had a typical resort show. The lounges are open but aside from that there was alot of activity. We ended up sitting on our jacuzzi on our balcony, cetainly not a bad thing.... Overall, we had a great time and would certainly recomend Paradisus. I would hope with time and more training in the restaurants, the service would improve and this would be a perfect place. That being said, it certainly was close to paradise...

Reviews.Title: “The one & only paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the most beautiful resort I've been to & a fabulous experience. We vacationed mid June and the resort was about 20% occupied---it was perfect! The food was excellent--from sushi @ Bamboo, to the lamb chops & filet @ Romantico; and the buffet bkft/lunch was fantastic. The booze was top shelf--vodca, gin, liquors, were a pleasent surprise. The weather was very hot & muggy (but to be expected), the pools were beautiful & very comforable. The royal sevice was a wonderful experience--highly recommended & wasn't difficult to upgrade once you were there (depending on occupency). The staff couldn't be more accommedating/attentive to your every need. The rooms were very spacious & comfortable (the beds were to die for--you didn't want to get up). The property was picturesque and huge. They have a shuttle to get you where you want to go. The beach is rocky, not a place to lie around or swim (but knew that prior to booking) but that was just fine. Had the vaction of a lifetime at the paradisus--great food, great drinks, and met great people. Unfortunately I didn't meet Kevin Costner or the Kennedy's who were these a week prior--Oh well, maybe next time!

Reviews.Title: “Read my review and see my pictures!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent five days at the Paradisus without our children. We're just normal, middle class people~ we don't travel to lots of five-star places internationally. Our entire stay was paid for by my husband's company, so we weren't really concerned about the value. If I were considering paying $700 per night myself to stay there, I would probably look elsewhere. Prior to our stay, I researched the property quite extensively. I learned that the restaurant reservation process was very unorganized. Upon our arrival, we were told that most of the restaurant reservations were already taken. I explained to the hostess that I was aware of the poor reputation of the reservation process. I mentioned the tripadvisor website and suggested that she read some of the reviews. She claimed that she already had! My husband and I just stood in front of her desk while the line behind us became quite long. Within about four minutes, which seemed like an eternity, we had dinner reservations for each night of our stay. The quality of the food was very "cruise-shippy." I wondered if fighting for our reservations had really been worth it. However, after a day in the sun, we were very hungry and we thought the food was quite tasty. Please avoid the lobster bisque . . . it tastes like cold pumpkin soup!!! Our favorite meals, however, were not in the "nicer" restaurants. We enjoyed the relaxing lunches at the outside Mirador Grill. We had a great table with a view of the ocean and enjoyed lots of choices at the buffet. We did have to contend with some hungry birds, but we were able to have lunch everyday in our swimwear, without having to go back to the room to change. The Royal Service was really wonderful. We relaxed each morning at the Royal Service pool. Ed, the bartender, had our drinks and our chairs waiting for us each morning. He also learned that I needed an umbrella because of my very fair skin. Ed had it waiting for me everyday! The larger pool was very beautiful and we spent a great deal of time there, too. The staff was very polite and friendly, except for the dinner reservation lady. We found very quick drink service in the bar just off of the casino. It was much less crowded in the evenings than the main lobby bar. My husband's company had rented almost all of the rooms at the resort, so the staff was very eager to please anyone from our group. Bottom line . . . if you must travel to Puerto Rico, this is a nice place to stay. Especially if it is free. If you have other choices, consider them wisely.

Reviews.Title: “Restaurants Always Booked??”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just stayed in this Resort last week and I must attest that architecturally is the most impressive hotel in Puerto Rico. However, I paid $470 a night and I could not make reservations to eat in the Restaurants. They were â€œalways fullâ€�. Friends knowing that the Hotel was only running at 64% occupancy and actually seeing the restaurants empty while they were turning guests away only makes you wonder if this is just a strategy to maintain food costs low by controlling the amount of â€œcoversâ€� guests that eat in the restaurants. For this amount of money I would have preferred to stay in a non inclusive hotel and pay on their not included restaurants and at least not having to eat every night room service. By the way â€œROOM SERVICEâ€� is GREAT at your hotel. The best I have had in PR!!!! Thanks,

Reviews.Title: “Incredible wedding & honeymoon!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just spent June 6th - June 11th at the Paradisus where we got married. We stayed in an ocean-front Royal Service room. I can't say enough about the grounds, the room, the pool, the food and the service. I agree with some previous reviewers that the time you go is crucial to the type of experience you'll have. Monday - Friday was quiet and tranquil - even in the main pool area. By the time we left on Saturday afternoon there were a lot more young people and kids. We were there from Monday - Saturday - the hotel was only 20% booked - so maybe that's why were treated like 'Royalty'. The Royal Service staff and the staff at the Royal Service pool bar couldn't have been more wonderful. When everyone found out we were getting married they went even more overboard. I must say that I was extremely concerned before we came when reading some of the more uncomplimentary reviews, but I honestly can't imagine that anyone could find a single problem with this resort. I travel extensively for my job and have stayed in 4 and 5 star hotels all over the world and the Paradisus rivaled most of them. If you're planning on going there for vacation - go!!!! don't worry about the negative reviews. I think some people can find fault with anything. If you do go and stay in Royal Service, ask for Hector at RS and Edwin at the RS pool, they're the best.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Property Must Read”
Reviews.Author: JulesRogersAR
Reviews.Content: We returned from the Paradisus last week and traveled with a 11 and 16 year old. We loved the resort, the grounds are beautiful, the rooms are very spacious, the pool is huge, the lobby is gorgous with fountains, status, huge vases of flowers, marble floors, candles everywhere. Reservations at the restaurants were so easy to make. Please remember this property has only been open for a year, they are still learning and trying very hard to please everyone. They are listening to comments and are trying very hard to improve. You can make advance dinner reservations for all the restaurants upon arrival, we were able to make all of our reservations the first day without any difficultly. We were even able to change them later in the week without any difficultly. We found the service to be very good, your in the Caribbean so mellow out and don't except them to be at your every beck and call. Go with the flow and relax if you have this type of attitude and I'm sure you will enjoy every moment. They had a wide varietly of restaurants, menu options, exquiste presentation, we thought the food was very good. If you really want to be pampered pay the extra for the Royal Service, they go above and beyond to accommodate your request! The concierge pool is quiet and relaxing and has private pre reserved cabanas. We weren't in the Royal Service level, but I found the staff to be very friendly and accommodating. The main pool is beautiful and has many private cabanas, , more cabanas than I have seen at other resorts. When the property is full they are somewhat difficult to obtain, early bird gets the worm. The pool activities building has plently to keep you busy if you want to, if you don't like the loud music that some complained about on other messages then you're too old and need to move to the other end of the pool. There were a few times that you would have to wait about 5-10 minutes at the swim up bar or the lobby bar, but again this was at peak time when the property was full. Within a week this happened maybe 3-4 times, big deal we were on vacation and had lots of time and weren't in a hurry to go anywhere. We were at the resort when they were filming the Sports Invitational for Fox TV, there were about 50 celebrities there such as Kevin Costner, Chevy Chase, Kelsey Grammer, Matt Dillion... if it's good enough for them than it should be good enough for you! Beach- ok so you know that the beach isn't white sand, the water isn't a tourquise blue other than this the resort is beautiful. The beach is wide and great for exploring. I have been to many other worldwide resorts that offer better beaches, but I knew about the beach prior to arriving and was perfectly content with the beach. I personally think it is hard to find every single aspect of a resort, property, destination that has 100 % of everything that you might be looking for. Sure I could find a few petty things that could be taken care of, but they are petty and not worth my time getting upset over. I found the Paradisus to be a true paradise and gorgeous resort and can recommend it highly to others.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Romantic”
Reviews.Author: sybershan
Reviews.Content: We went to Paradisus May 3rd-8th - and, having traveled quite a bit (including "5 star" all-inclusives), my expectations are always VERY, VERY high - and, I'm usually disappointed. But, this time I was pleasantly surprised! First off, let me echo what countless others have said in their reviews... the grounds are AMAZINGLY beautiful. You really do feel like you're entering a corner of paradise when you see this place. We had an ocean-front, Royal Service room (the ONLY way to go if you stay here). Our favorite part of the room was the sunken jacuzzi tub (for two!) outside ON the balcony. I've never had that experience before... and, drinking a glass of wine overlooking the ocean in a tub of bubbles is the BEST - especially after a day of baking in the sun. (Oh, by the way, they CHANGED ALL THE BEDS in the early Spring, 2005. So, we went expecting HARD mattresses due to other people's comments and instead had a week of TERRIFIC sleep on the new, perfect mattresses!!) Ahhh... baking in the sun. The main pool was glorious. Since we came on a week that wasn't very booked, we felt like the resort was our own private plantation. There were only about 4-6 other people around this HUGE pool at any given time of the day Tuesday - Friday. The built-in "chairs" made laying in the sun a dream because you could stay cool, covered by an inch of water from the pool on your legs and feet. It was an amazing, relaxing experience on those days... (I'll save all my negative comments for the end of this review!) Another great part of the resort is the top notch spa and workout area. Although we didn't have any spa treatments on this trip, we did take a complete tour of the spa area and everything was very relaxing and pristine - including the indoor and outdoor massage tables. (You can get a massage in the tropical garden area by the spa pool - or even at the edge of the ocean if you choose!) We did use the exercise equipment on three of our vacation days - and it was great! (Air-conditioned and aromas from the attached spa made it smell fantastic!) THE NEGATIVES: 1- The food was just "ok". Typically, we go out to eat quite a bit - to a variety of top restaurants. Going out to eat for me needs to be an experience - not just about the food. (great atmosphere, good wine selection, excellent service!) So, I was really looking forward to both the Japanese steak house on the property as well as the French restaurant that everyone raved about. But, this is where is was disappointed... Our first night at the Japanese steakhouse was pretty good but the second time the food had little flavor. (It all depends on the cook you get that night. The second night our cook was new.) As for the French restaurant (Romantico) - not so romantico... very boring actually. The place was EMPTY!! And, we were seated at a 2-top in the center of the restaurant with no one else really in the room we were in. There was no background noise so we felt like all "ears" were on us and we talked very little. As for the food at Romantico - I think they're favorite ingredient is Nutmeg. The Lobster Bisque that came highly recommended from our waiter was really creme de Nutmeg (I think they may have dipped a Lobster claw in the broth at some point but there wasn't really any Lobster to speak of in the soup.) As for the Filet Mignon main course - dry and tasteless. (I'm spoiled with Midwestern Beef.) 2- Be prepared to age 10 years waiting for a drink. Now, I know what you're thinking... "she's so impatient - she should just get used to the Carribean pace." NO WAY. I have been to Sandals in the Bahamas and other resorts in the Carribean several times and I have never experienced bar "service" like this. Let me break it down... There are about 4-5 bars around the resort (not including the restaurant bars) and NONE of them stock the same inventory. If you find one that knows how to make a drink you like, the next bar will say they don't carry that liquor. It's crazy! I wanted a Vanilla Stoli and Diet Coke and the waiter from Romantico had to walk out to the main lobby bar to borrow their stash of Vanilla Stoli. But, MORE importantly, the service itself is very bad at the bars. There were two guys at the main lobby bar that had drinks in front of them and were deep in conversation with the bartender when we showed up. (Other than those two guys we were the only ones there.) We sat patiently for at least 5 mins - ignored completely. Finally, I got up and walked around the bar right in front of the bartender and asked him, "Is this bar open?" "Oh yes, miss..." and then he took our order. The pool bar is another story... none of the bartenders had any drink suggestions whatsoever. So, if you didn't already know the tropical concoction you wanted top of mind - you were out of luck. And, not surprising, they were just as slow and unattentive as the main lobby bartenders. (To contrast, the bartenders at Sandals were FANTASTIC! Not only was there a HUGE menu hanging around every bar with 10-20 different drink suggestions, but the bartenders had their own specialties that they would reveal to swim-up bar regulars.) Personality is KEY to staffing great bartenders... and, they still have a ways to go there. 3- The beach is filled with broken shells and sharp stones. So what? It didn't really matter that much to me, since I'm a pool person anyway. It was still beautiful to look at out of our balcony every morning and every night from our JACUZZI!! But, if you are a beach person this would probably be a drawback for you. 4- ... and, then there was SATURDAY. Remember how I wrote that Tuesday through Friday at the main pool were fantastic?? Well, on Saturdays, they open up the resort to locals. AAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHH!!! Saturday was a nightmare at the main pool - total chaos. Seemingly thousands of screaming, running children and salsa music so loud it only inspired the kids to scream louder. After 15 mins at the main pool on Saturday, we retreated to the Royal Services pool area for some quiet cocktails and romantic pooltime. That is one of the reasons you should DEFINITELY choose Royal Service if you go to Paradisus.... the option to use that private pool area as well as other niceties. Now, go plan your vacation and stop reading these reviews!! :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a resort where there would be a variety of activities and yet plenty of relaxing. The Paradisus was wonderful for our family get-a-way. The rooms were spacious, clean and beautifully decorated. The staff was warm and friendly. We were very pleased with the restaurants, food was very well prepared, buffets had a delightful variety and the food was always the correct temperature. We especially enjoyed going to the Lobby bar after dinner for drinks and to enjoy the wonderful music every evening. Our sons loved to go kayaking and snorkeling. The beach was a natural beach and we loved to get chaises close to the beach and look out over the ocean. After reading many reviews and seeing numerous complaints, I was afraid we had made a poor decision. It became a family joke trying to imagine what we could complain about! In fact, after a week, we had no complaints! We were very pleased with every aspect of the resort. Since the resort is so new, I am sure it will continue to fine tune it's services....but we enjoyed ourselves and would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Paradisus is OK..”
Reviews.Author: JayneGA
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Paradisus for 9 nights during January, 05. There were 5 of us, my husband myself and our 3 teenager daughters. Months earlier we had stayed at Windjammer in St. Lucia -loved it!! Iit appeared to me that Paradisus doesn't really cater to families, actually I felt as if they catered to the people that had booked "Royal Service" - those of us at the bottom were told there wasn't any setting available in the resturants. Each person staying at Paradisus wears a color coded bracelet-the color determines everything-your reservations to eat and the quality of service. For the amount of money this resort cost-I do not think it is worth. We were there during the "busy" season-many of the other resorts had overbooked and had sent the people they couldn't accommodate to Paradisus. Even with the extra bookings the resort closed several of the resturants. The pool was beautiful, the resort was beautiful, the beach-wasn't.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent honeymoon at Paradisus. A new resort with a few growing pain but overall would definately go back, especially now that I know they have fixed the beds. Grounds are beautiful and staff is very friendly and helpful. Did not have a bad meal the entire eight days. I think some people just complain about anything. GREAT RESORT

Reviews.Title: “I LOVED, LOVED IT. I A'M LOOKING FORWARD GOING BACK!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently at PARADISUS RESORT IN PUERTO RICO as part of my honeymoon (5/1/05 TO 05/04/05) . The resort is beautiful, well maintained . We stayed at bungalow 1406 , very luxurious, marble everywhere, and the bungalow was immaculate clean . The staff was super firendly, they went above and beyond to give us an excellent service , very attentive and very nice and friendly . The food was excellent, we didn't had any problems getting reservations for Romantico and Bamboo . The staff was extremely nice to us . The concierge (CINDY) was a sweetheart, she even arranged for champagne and strawberries to be sent to our room . i am definitively going back to paradisus soon.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: jmf3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent April 21-24 at the Paradisus and really enjoyed it. We came as part of a group from my husband's company so it didn't cost us anything. But after reading some of the reviews, I was a little concerned anyway. We stayed at an all-inclusive before which was beautiful but had no beach at all and the food was mediocre, at best. This trip was free but, being a huge beach lover, I wasn't thrilled about the prospect of coming all that way and not being able to walk on the beach. We ended up coming a little early and staying in San Juan at the Intercontinental for several days just in case. (See separate review). My fears were unjustified. The Paradisus was wonderful! The food was great! I wasn't expecting that and gained a pound or two! The pool was beautiful. There are small, roofed cabanas set all around the property with big mattresses and pillows on them. When we got tired, we just took naps on one of those. It was incredible. The staff were VERY friendly and helpful. My husband forgot his key card one afternoon and he said security was there in a matter of minutes to let him in. It rained off and on the whole time we were there and we were surprised to find an umbrella stored in our closet. It came in very handy. The rooms can be a bit of a walk from the pool and restaurants. But they are very private and they have a tram that drives around offering rides. Our building was one of the farthest away but we never felt the need to catch a ride, even when it rained. And the grounds around the rooms are incredible. The pool staff offered activities throughout the afternoon but they kept it towards one end and we didn't find it bothersome or overdone at all. We didn't have our 5 kids with us (thank goodness!) but, if we had, they would have enjoyed it. They had a Kids Club next to the pool with a swingset and activities. I walked by several times and the staff seemed to be genuinely enthusiastic about what they were doing. And, more importantly, the kids were enjoying it. There were plenty of chairs at the pool and the pool itself has tile lounges built into it so you can tan while sitting in the water. Very nice. The staff was very friendly but we ended up going to the bar for our drinks ourselves, most of the time. We were only asked a time or two if we would like anything brought to us. Now the beach...I was grateful for the warnings about it. I love a big, wide sand beach with waves that you can walk on for hours. And I am glad that we came early to San Juan so that we could experience that. But, this beach was beautiful. I took my chair down there and laid in the water every day. It is very pebbly and I did not bring water shoes. I wish I had because you can walk the beach. It curves around the resort. We could have walked from our room to the pool on the beach. But it's not so great barefoot. I still did it. It's in a natural state and it is very pretty. The water was very blue. It's like a lagoon because a reef breaks up the waves. Almost nobody was down there. I loved it. It was very quiet and secluded and very picturesque. It was different, but not disappointing. But if you want the big sweeping sand beach with waves, you might want to stay somewhere else. Our room was very large and very comfortable. We could see through the trees to the water from our balcony and also had a good view of the mountains. And it wasn't a royal service room or anything like that. And our bed was awesome. The lobby and restaurants were gorgeous. The resort seemed intimate to me. There are a number of rooms but it didn't seem huge. My husband and I wouldn't necessarily pay to stay at an all-inclusive. We loved not having to worry about paying for something every time we turned around. But we don't drink alcohol or eat three and four meals a day so I think we might end up losing money there! And Paradisus was asking $500 for an extra night. But if you're not as cheap as us and would make more use of those things, go for it! This is the place! I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Every Second!!”
Reviews.Author: MystikalPowers
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful place! I read these reviews before we went for a 6 day stay and I loved it! The staff was very friendly and the resort was beautiful! There was lots of foods to try and plenty of places to relax. I would definitely go back! The grounds were impressive and the nights filled with wonderful songs from the co-qui frogs. This was a very romantic place! I was very nervous about going after reading some of the complaints I had seen... after going to see for myself, I would recommend this place to anyone who has enough money to make the trip! The flight was a little nerve-racking but the resort was breath-taking. We did the kayaking and took one of the catamarans out... the water was warm and inviting. It does rain on the island but that's why everything is so green and beautiful! Enjoy your trip if you go! Try it for yourself! I will be back again! I have many pictures of the grounds if anyone would like to see, just email me! :)

Reviews.Title: “Paradisus Skeptic”
Reviews.Author: larchdoc
Reviews.Content: As a true skeptic, I was very tentative concerning my trip to Paradisus, especially after reading the reviews from this site. I considered changing my plans to the Ritz Carlton if the reviews were correct and indeed had booked the Ritz tentatively if I decided to leave the Paradisus. Much to my surprise, the resort was extremely pleasurable. Specifically: 1. The hotel's appearance and cleanliness were terrific. 2. The staff was extremely attentive and polite. 3. The food was quite good. I never experienced any "long lines". (even though the resort was full) Especially notable were the restaurants Romantico and Bamboo. If you are flexible about your dinner times it is quite easy to obtain entrance into them. The Avocado was excellent for my perpetual diet. Indeed, there is an abundance of great fruit which allowed me to only gain one pound during the week. 4. The gym was sufficient and clean. 5. Spa was excellent. 6. Pools were great. Indeed at times I did have concern about the level of music but this was rectified simply by asking the attendant to turn down the volume. 7. THE BEACH Directly in front of the main pool it is certainly almost non existant. If you decide to walk approximately 200 feet to the right there is sufficient beach with an abundance of lounges. 8. The beds. They have all been replaced with very comfortable soft mattresses. 9. The lounge chair problem has been resolved with the purchase of many more. 10. SUMMARY Overall, it appears that many of the problems noted on this board has been addressed by management. Indeed, I did speak to management and they do review these boards in order to improve their facility. It is still a fairly new resort and certain problems will always occur as with any resort. Not every employee responds as desired and unfortunately can cause a problem. I did have to call room service twice on one occasion but management was very attentive to my complaint. That is basically what we all want---somebody who will listen and resolve the issue-- the resort does this. The resort is particularly excellent for family groups, small conventions or small groups who need to spend time together without wondering where they will eat or meet at nite. It keeps people together. It is certainly infinitely better than any other place in Puerto Rico! I do have one compaint though, and that was with the price of a round of golf which I thought was excessive. I did price other courses in the area and they were all about the same. Maybe the resort can have a "golf package" price. In essence, I , the Skeptic, would return.

Reviews.Title: “what a great place”
Reviews.Author: prowlerontariocanada
Reviews.Content: my wife and i were blown away by the beauty of the resort. we also had the royal service option and this is the only way to go. our room was very clean and the service was outstanding. the royal service pool is a nice touch as overcrowding is avoided, although we did go to the main pool and found it very large also finding a quiet space at that pool was quite easy. we read that the beach was just awful, so please read the following carefully, had the other complainers quit whinning and give us some uasable info we really would have enjoyed the beach, so here goes,,,this beach is a natural one, not man made, therefore there is broken shells and vegetation on this beach. i highly recommend that you bring with you a pair of water shoes. had we known we would have packed ours . people should quit whinning and try to enjoy nature as it presents itself. at any rate this resort is fantastic the food is great the beds are comfortable the staff is freindly, we highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Lost in Paradisus”
Reviews.Author: CompressedChi
Reviews.Content: As other have written, this is a beautiful, well maintained property that is all-inclusive and a member of the Leading Hotels of the World. We just returned from a long weekend and found much of what has been said (both good and bad) to be true. We had several choices of hotels in San Juan and decided to try the Paradisus on the strength of its reviews. Based on the suggestions of others who found it difficult to get into certain restaurants, I decided to call the day before to try to make arrangements prior to our arrival. I was told that reservations can only be made if you know your room number, which unfortunately is not revealled until you check in. I also asked for driving directions from the airport and was emailed them promptly. The property, while it may be only 20 miles away from the airport, took about an hour to drive to in bumper to bumper traffic. We decided to rent a car based on the fact that the hotel shuttle charged $30/per person one way, so for the two of us it would have been $120 round trip. The driving directions are somewhat confusing, and we had a few wrong turns that only delayed our arrival. We also found out that they charge guests $10/day to park (not mentioned anywhere), which is crazy since the lot is huge and very underutilized. Since we were there for 3 days, the $30 added onto the cost of the rental car came out a little over $120--no wonder the hotel priced it's shuttle that way! Upon arrival, there were a lot of bellmen, none of which offered us any assistance with our bags. Check if was very efficient, but as was noted by other, we were left on our own to find our room. When we went back to the bellhops to ask about transport to our room, they said that no one was available to bring our bags, so we should take the trolley since the room was "very far away." We went back to the front desk to inquire about closer rooms and the woman at the front desk was very apologetic and reassured us the room was not that far away and even walked us to the trolley (which is located at the back end of the lobby), and we rode to our room from there. I must say that the property is spectacular and well kept. The employees are polite, but do not go out of their way to be helpful. Rather than ask the concierge to make dinner arrangements for us (since there was only one concierge and a line of about 10 people needing assistance), we walked directly to the restaurant and asked about tables. We found Bamboo to be difficult to get into and the surly hostess did not make things easy. The host at Romantico was much more accomodating. Bamboo is a down market version of Benihana, but entertaining and they offer you a lot of food. The atmosphere at Romantico is very nice and the service good. They also offer a surcharge wine list, which has very good wines at New York restaurant prices (about twice retail) -- but it beats what they pour for free. We went to the gym daily, which is virtually always empty, and very clean. The attendant was friendly, and it turns out that he will teach aerobics, but only if enough people show up. He also told us that there were pilates classes at the Activities Center that did not exist. The Activities Center is poolside and there is a list of daily activities posted. Unfortunately, no one seemed to know what activities would occur the next day, so it was difficult to plan things. The pool is great. There are a lot of areas to sit around and plenty of chaise chairs and cabanas on a first come first serve basis. The cabanas are definitely the way to go as the sun can be fierce. Poolside salsa lessons in the afternoon were a lot of fun! Beware that the drinks at the poolside bar are very weak, and one should always ask for an extra shot! The rooms are very spacious and the oceanview rooms offer a wonderful, romantic setting to watch the sunset off your balcony. One thing we found lacking in the amenities were hair conditioner and a sewing kit (you only figure out what you forgot to bring when you need it most!). It turns out that there is something called Royal Service which functions like a Club Level Room in other hotels. They have personal butlers and a private pool and check in service. It is significantly more expensive than the already pricey rooms, and I'm not sure it is worth it. All in all, the place is beautiful. The food was good for an all inclusive, but not great. My overall impression is that this five star hotel would match up with a middling three star place in Asia or Europe and a four star hotel in the US. They really need to improve their service, especially since it isn't cheap. I think that there are numerous other options to consider when choosing a San Juan hotel that (technically) isn't in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away - no beach, no service, not much at all”
Reviews.Author: gsmarko
Reviews.Content: The Positives 1. The hotelâ€™s appearance and the grounds are absolutely beautiful. 2. The beachfront dining at Mirador provided spectacular views of the ocean. A wonderful, tranquil dining experience. 3. The tennis pro was excellent. 4. The spa, though small, was very pleasant. My wife loved it. 5. Dinner at Bamboo was very enjoyable. That said, this restaurant should not be described as â€œAsian fusion with Thai influenceâ€�. It is, quite simply, a Japanese Hibachi style restaurant with a very limited menu of sushi. 6. The swim-up bar in the pool was great. It was one of the few areas in the resort which was properly staffed. The Negatives 1. ABSOLUTELY ZERO BEACH. The beach is about 12 feet wide from the grass to the water. The limited space is filled with rocks and broken shells. There is no sand to sit on and no place for children to play. The resort was full when we were there but no one at all was on the beach. Also, the water sports are extremely limited. 2. The pool is large and nice, but could be cleaner. Since there is no real beach and little available activities, I would think the resort would put more effort into keeping the pool clean and in tip-top shape. The water at times was cloudy and often contained drinking cups and debris. Furthermore, for our entire stay, the hotel was full but there was never more than 1 lifeguard on duty covering a massive pool that often contained > 150 people. I was astonished. 3. Seating by the pool was inadequate. At one point, this lead to a shouting match between guests over seating space. If the pool is the main attraction of the resort, should seating be inadequate? 4. The restaurants were booked from the time of check-in and many guests could only get into the buffet restaurants. This was ridiculous since the restaurants were only about 60% occupied when you went inside. The only explanation I can think of is that the resort was inadequately staffed. This is shameful considering the expensive price of the resort and the large # of guests. If you can not get into 1 of the 3 non-buffet restaurants for dinner, you are stuck at one of the 3 buffets. The quality of food at the buffet restaurants was sub-par. My dinner at Toscano is best described as a bad night at Macaroni Grill (not even a good night at Macaroni Grill). Not a great deal for $750/night. 5. Even at the buffet restaurants there was a long wait to be seated. We waited 30 minutes to be seated at Toscano. Once seated, we found that 60% of the tables were empty. When we asked why we waited 30 minutes to get into a largely vacant restaurant, we were told that they did not haven enough staff to clear the tables. This is shameful. 6. The concierge desk is woefully inadequate. There was never more than 1 person working. You often had to wait 20 minutes to speak to someone. You could not call the concierge desk since they were too busy to answer the phone. 7. Service is extremely slow throughout the resort. Room service is particularly bad, often taking > 1 hour. 8. The beds are as hard as a rock. This is a frequent complaint among customers. It appears that the resort is trying to purchase new mattresses to address this problem. Negatives that really messed up our trip 1. We arrived late at night with a 3 year old. We needed bedding for the couch. We had to call housekeeping 5 times. It took 1 hour and 20 minutes to get a blanket. The good news was that hotel manager wanted to appease us afterwards and suddenly the restaurants with no available dinner reservations had a spot for our family. 2. Room service consistently took too long and brought not only cold food but the wrong food. 3. The porters were not careful with our luggage. They arrived late to pick up our luggage, drove their little truck recklessly, and our luggage went flying out of the truck onto the road. 4. MOST IMPORTANTLY, our son got sick and required a doctor. The concierge desk, which was probably the single worst aspect of the resort, took 4 hours to pick up the medicine from the local pharmacy. This was clearly due to the fact that they were understaffed and they were prioritizing â€œnew businessâ€� over a sick, young child. This was disgraceful. Overall, I would strongly discourage anyone from staying at Paradisus Puerto Rico. The resort may look beautiful, but the terrible service, understaffing, and lack of a beach front are significant problems. This is not a 5 star resort, not a 4 star resort, and maybe not even a 3 star resort. Of note, many people we met on the island (away from the resort) were well aware of the many problems at the resort. This undoubtedly explains why the occupancy has been low and the cost of staying at the resort has dropped precipitously over the past year.

Reviews.Title: “I would return...”
Reviews.Author: Ski-Again
Reviews.Content: Yikes, I don't agree with the last two horrible reviews there are some drawbacks, but there are many good things to report as well. I was there for 4 nights Easter weekend. I am a frequent traveler from the Northeast US with young kids and generally stay at 4 or 5 star hotels, Ritz, Hyatt, Marriott, or upscale boutique hotels. In Puerto Rico I have stayed at the El San Juan, the Hyatt Cerromar and Palmas Del Mar. As my title says I would go back, for a family vacation, as the Pros outweigh the cons and every hotel has drawbacks. As all inclusives go, this is a "nice" one. Pros- the setting is beautiful, the rooms are spacious (I liked the bed and did not find it too hard), the food was excellent, really too good so that you have to be worried about gaining weight!, the selection was great, the staff was VERY helpful with generally GREAT attitudes, the spa was small but lovely, the beach is full of pebbles which is lousy, but it is very long and wide and pretty and nice for running/walking - with sneaks or flip-flops - I have been to many places with short narrow beaches and this is not the case here, the boat rides, esp. sailing on a catamaran (they send you with a "captain" which was great) - but you have to get there before 10am to make a reservation and they go quickly, the pool is very very nice, the shows were good, though a bit late beginning after 10pm, the drinks were good - try the local lite beer with lime!, child care was OK, more on that below, the gym is small but nice and there is a trainer there all day who is very helpful. They had evening child care (5 and up only) from 8 to midnight and this was pretty good with moon bounces, movies and games - the kids enjoyed this more than the day time program. Cons - they are still new and not great with crowds, there were no chairs at the pool Easter weekend, the staff was weary and overworked, the hotel just seemed stressed out!, The kids camp is lacking - NOTE it is only 10:30am-noon and 2:30pm to 5pm NOT ALL DAY, NOT FOR LUNCH, no early morning care if you want to do sports before it gets hot, forget it. Kids camps at other resorts are much better, Hyatt, Ritz and other all inclusives. They play loud, loud music and make announcements at the pool all day, if you want peace you have to go to the pebbly beach, which is ok too, but it could be better. The rooms are far from the main facilities, ours did smell a bit musty and there are very few ocean view rooms, if you are not guaranteed, you won't get one. The restaurants requiring reservations were all "full", we wondered whether it was a scam to have them, but not let anyone in, they didn't seem crowded at all. If you complain loudly they may help you get in at a time they select. This is ridiculous. The hotel is 1 hour from the airport NOT 35 mins, except by helicopter. HINT - The Royal Service is very, very nice (we didn't get it, but wish we did) there is a beautiful adult pool, preference at restaurants, ocean view, special services, if your kids are over 5 or you are just adults visiting, this would be key to a relaxing, pampered vacation. I would not go back with my husband alone unless we had "Royal Service" accomodations. If you go ENJOY - don't be nervous this is a nice place, they care about their guests and you will have a good time! I was reluctant because of some of the bashing I saw here, which is exaggerated. No its not the Four Seasons, Paris, but if you booked here that is not what you are expecting!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Service Needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: KLM1970
Reviews.Content: Though the resort itself is beautiful, we found that it really never exceeded our expectations. The lobby area, pool, furnishings, spa, etc. are gorgeous. The rooms are a decent size. The food is nothing special, which is to be expected in an all-inclusive I guess. For the money, we would recommend staying at The Ritz and be assured of exceptional service. With few exceptoins, we found most staff to be apathetic. Three out of the five days we were there, our room had not been cleaned by the time we returned from the pool around 4pm. This was at a time when the resort was more than half empty so I wouldn't want to be there when it is at capacity. I also heard that they allow people to day-trip at the hotel pool, which I think is unacceptable when guests are paying to stay there. It just created more crowding. Overall we had a great time, but we would likely not return to Paradisus, which is unfortunate because it has much more ambience than other resorts I have been to in Puerto Rico. A management overhaul would likely bring the service up to par with the surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “can't get their act together”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: just returned 3/20/05 from hotel and their are several area to be concerned with:First-Transportation,when you cal there they either give you the conciege or transportation to arrange travel from the airport.These are two different services within the hotel ,so be aware when you call to confirm and they say there is no reservation.Also the hotel does not tell you that a cab (all vans) from the airport is less expensive and not a per person charge as is the hotel. Reservations for eating were impossible.They have 3 restaurants that require reservations and they do not let you make them on the phone.The restaurants are small and it's hard to get a reservation at a reasonable time.They do not open reservations for Fri or Sat until certain times. The hotel books cocktail parties for outside companies as well as dinners on FRi and Sat evening but they set these up around the pool starting at 3:00 pm so you better beware of your location. The mgt there is totally non responsive including head of food service Alfredo and hotel mgr Claus Lapp.Neither person answers calls nor do they return calls.
