The food is passable and the staff is wonderful.The hotel ground are gorgeous but the beaches are rocky (but we knew that before we went).The rooms are spacious and the pool area magnificent.The radio broadcast from the pool area could have been a little less noisy,but we simply moved away from that spot to a less crowded area (in which they starting setting up those cocktail parties at 3:00). It was an aggravating experience(there were other incidents as weel) at my first and probably last all inclusive resort. P.S. Took two rooms with 4 nite total of $4,700

Reviews.Title: “No paradise at the Paradisus”
Reviews.Author: Boeckmann
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the misfortune to stay at the Paradisus in connection with a business trip. We have never been so happy to check out of a hotel. A few "highlights" The resort is a easy 1 hour from the airport (in the middle of nowhere) even though they tell you twenty minutes. THe rooms are a long way from the central areas of the hotel. Be prepared to take a golf cart or take a very unscenic 10 minute walk to the pool. THE BEDS ARE ROCK HARD. I MEAN THE WORST BED EVER. THE FRONT DESK DOES HAVE EGGCRATES YOU CAN PUT ON TOP OF THE MATTRESS BUT THEY WERE ALL CHECKED OUT. The linen is terrible. The rooms are musty. 4 couples in our group were moved from their rooms (by management) because of mold over taking the bathrooms. The food is terrible - poor selection and quality. The outdoor bar area is filthy. There is no nightlife except for a small casino. Most of the employees do not seem happy to be there. The beach - well it looks nice in the brochure but too bad it is made of gravel. I AM STUMPED AS TO HOW THIS PLACE GETS POSITIVE REVIEWS. WE WERE WITH A GROUP OF 300 PLUS INDIVIDUALS AND EVERYONE AGREED THAT THIS PLACE WILL BE LUCKY TO SURVIVE ANOTHER YEAR. I WOULD NEVER EVER RETURN TO THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Much better this year!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Paradisus in Puerto Rico again this year (Mar. 3-7). We returned with our business group. Last year they had only been opened 3 weeks when we arrived. This year there was a vast improvement! Staff was still friendly and eager to help you. (at their pace of course) Food was good. We were able to get reservations at Romantico. Which I had read on this site was a problem in the past. After our group dinner the, 1st night, could not get into room, at midnight. Flagged down a golf cart and was told in a few minutes security would arrive. My husband and I expected to be there until two or three. But, to our surprise security was there in about 7 minutes. A word of advice. Do not put your key in the same pocket as your MAGNETIC name badge. Later found out about 5 or so couples had the same problem. We did have some issues: sand on the floor of our room the day we arrived. They lost the lugage of one couple. Located it an hour or so before our group dinner( inverted numbers on tag.) Handle fell into the tub while showering. We left it in plain view and it was fixed when we returned. (several hours later) We found out quickly why the Mirador was alway empty. It is the restuarant of the Birds. They could remedy this I was told by installing fishing line so the view was not obstructed and would keep the birds out. As I walked away from the salad bar a bird helped himself to the cheese I had just used. Our bed was turned down every night. Our last night there was no different except at 1:30 when we returned we had one wash cloth and not one towel. Called the operator and within 15 minitues we had our towels. We really did enjoy our stay and the issues I mentioned are minor compared to last year. I do hope they keep improving. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from this great place last night and we are all really missing it. My daughter woke up this morning and wanted to go back! We found this hotel purely by coincidence, we were originally scheduled to vaction in the Bahamas on a remote island, but Bahamas Air cancelled our connecting flight a week before we were to leave. My wife and I scrambled to find another destination and found the Paradisus. They had availability for the exact dates and we booked it. We lucked out and loved our trip. Everyone who worked there, and I mean everyone, was extremely helpful and went out of there way to make sure everything was taken care of. As an example, I forgot my cell phone charger and asked the front desk clerk were the nearest Verizon store was and the front desk manager over heard this and offered up his Verizon charger. I borrowed it a few times and he always said no problem. This is just one example and I won't bore you with others, but everyone went out of there way. The food was very good for an all inclusive, but not like in a small gourmte restaurant. We were not expecting 5 star restaurants so we were very pleased, if you are expecting a 5 star restaurant go to one don't go to an all inclusive resort. The pool, grounds, rooms and everthing else is very very nice. The only negative is the beach. It is small and the water is not so great, but pretty to look out to. My wife and I take a vacation every year to the carribean and have been to many great beaches and new this was not going to be a great beach based on the reviews here and thus were not disappointed. We have small children who love the pools so that is where we were going to be anyway. All I can say is if you are a beach person you might want to try another hotel. Also, we noticed that the hotel never seems crowded even though they were at capacity. Price- My wife and I thought this hotel is an absolute steal for what you get!! We were actually wondering how they can employ so many people (always somone around to take care of every need) and deliver such great service for such a low price. One last note, we agree with other reviews about tipping. We tipped a great waiter we had for dinner many nights and our service was second to none. We did not ask what he made, but for a couple of $20s he went way out of his way and we had better service than in many upscale restaurants here in Chicago. We also tipped the bartenders by the pool and never had to wait for a drink. Stay here, it is an undiscovered gem!

Reviews.Title: “Tip the help! A few pointers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, The place is beautiful. The beach is barely so so..no real swimming as it is shallow and murky. The help is excellent and is not paid well so tip them as much as you can. A wonderful waiter there said he was only paid $ 5.50 an hour. Frankly I am not a fan of loud music and it was hard to escape the noise coming from the pool area..it made me nuts. The shows they had were first class from stage presentations to belly dancing. The food is excellent but their system of reservations for the restaurants is completely out of whack. They would say they had no room when they were half empty and people were rightly miffed at the way they handled it. They should have no reservations at all and it would work a lot better. There is a Mexican style restaurant there...skip it..not worth it. The public space, bars etc. is very classy with marble floors, fountains and comfortable and spacious. It is not a barefoot and torn jeans or wet bathingsuit type of atmosphere at all...more like a swank hotel. The aesthetics of the whole place are excellent and the people very nice and that is why I am giving it a four star. Be prepared to gain five pounds!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Paradisus”
Reviews.Author: Nature1611
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a geat vacation at Paradisus Puerto Rico. Beatiful grounds, great pool, good food, friednly service, great Spa, great tenis, we had a wonderful relaxing time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the first time in Puerto Rico, for my husband and I. We had a really great visit. The grounds were clean, very friendly staff, housekeeping staff were very efficient. The food was great. The onsite restrauants were great. Weather could not have been better. The golf course is still under work. The hotel was beautiful, bellboys and staff were so friendly. By the end of the week they new you by name or bungalow number. The beach was nice with all the water activities. The pool was great. Really nice sitting areas around pool and lots of lounge chairs. No problem finding any. Would like visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Paridise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing i just had a problem with dinner reservations and some people were very rude! But, overall it was a place i will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Fine experience overall but you're naive if you're expecting the Four Seasons or Peninsula stay.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned from a five-night stay at this lovely all-inclusive resort in January, and, like any new property (opened 3/04), it has kinks that have to be ironed out. I preface this posting by saying that my wife and I both work in the hotel/ hospitality industry for large hotel companies, and i must say that the Paradisus passes the test. The positives severly outweigh the negatives, and by reading many of these December postings, I have to believe that the Paradisus took the criticism to heart and "fixed" most of these bugs. This is an all-inclusive resort where tips/ charges are taken care of by your daily rate. But I must say, the staff treated us like royalty from the moment we stepped out of our taxi. The door/bell staff are very cheerful and make an effort to please. They socialize with you and offer assistance before you even have to ask. In the hospiatlity industry, we are expected to anticipate our guest's needs, and at the Paradisus, they do that. From the bellmen down to the maids, they make a sincere effort to make you happy. I happen to believe that, despite it being all-inclusive, it's Ok to tip a couple of bucks. There were times I didn't have change and did not leave a tip, and it was fine with their staff. They didn't seeme bothered or slowed their service because of this. Believe me, this happens at many resorts (Cancun and Domomican rep. come to mind). I received terrific service on my first day through to the fifth day. My wife was there for a conference and I just tagged along and had fun. The lobby bars are very good. You get top of the line liquor and you get your drink refreshed before you're even finished with the one y0ou have in your hand. There was a waiter, which I cannot remember his name, who must have swerved around 50 people in this one area. He was efficient and very friendly. I watched as he filled everyone's order (correctly) and quickly. No one tipped him. Not one. But he came back and gave the 100% service time and time again. I live in Chicago and let me tell you, I can go 15 minutes without having my drink refreshed or even have trouble getting the waiters attention. But at Paradisus, you almost never have to wave a waiter/ waitress over to you because they're already there. I disagree with the assertion that the pool bar/ waitresses sucked. The days varied as far as occupancy ( ranged from 40-75%), but I received great service in the pool. I had a waitress ask me at least every 15-20 minutes if i wanted something. Yes, she did her rounds. Best of all, when i was just snoozing, she didn't bother me like some resorts do. Enough has been said about the restaurants. They're all good, even the buffet ones. Romantico, Bamboo and Avaocado were very good to good. You got to make reservations for them. Do so at concierge as soon as you get there. The Carribeno, Toscano and Madoro Grill were good. What can you say about buffet-style joints? The'ye are not going to be first-class al lof the time. If anyone can tell me a 5-star buffet exists, please tell me. All of the outlets had freindly hostesses and waitstaff. Again, we never had to wait for drinks or requests. Food was hot and fresh. The desserts were good as well. Yes, the beach is not much to look at. I love poweder-sugared beaches like everyone else, but it's relaxing. The sea is dark because it's winter time, so that's not the resort's fault. Also, the sea is cold. It's January for Gods sake. That's how it is. You can Kayak, windsail, paddleboat, etc. It's all included and the staff was very cool. The beach is empty--no other guests around. The entertainment was a bit corny but what do you expect, Vegas? The music was loud but not overwhelming, but I guess that'll be up to you to decide. They have nightly shows that are of decent quality and they have the casino, which i believe is adequately proportiioned for the resort. I won some cash, so maybe that's why I liked it. There are at least 50 slots, a roulette table, 4 Black Jack tables, Carribean Stud, 3-card Poker, Keno and Limit Texas Hold'Em. Again, if you're expecting Vegas, then you'll be disappointed. but the casino is big enough and is never crowded or packed. The dealers are very friendly and love to converse -- unlike many casinos where the dealers are robotic and not very personable. The spa and gym are OK. They could be better for a facility this large. I did not try the spa, but I hear it's expensive, but again...what do you expect? The gym has free weights, treadmills, etc. All the things you need to work out. Fresh fruit, water and towels are provided. There is also a spa private pool for use if you wish. They have two business centers on the property. One is for all guests to use while the other is a VIP/ Premeir Member class facility that has all of you bc needs plus comforts such as leather sofas, wide screen TV and a waitress to offer you cigars and drinks while you check your e-mail. nice touch. I have two small children but I did not bring them on this trip. They are 4 and 2 years old and I believe they would have had fun. They have a large kiddie pool and play area, and there were kid activites throughout the day. I guess it depends on whether there are lots of kids around the pool area for the activities to occur. There were board games available to use for the kids, pool toys, all sorts of balls to play with. Ping Pong and Billiards, Chess also available by the pool. And best of all, if you're hanging out by yourself like I was while the wife was attending her conference, the entertainment staff would play with you. Gift shop was adequate -- had everything you needed. You get fresh fruit/ wine in your room on a daily basis. Newspaper to your door. Shuttle guy driving around asking if you want a lift. I had a room close to the facilites so I didn't utilize him. He always offered and was courteous. Rent a car if you can. Taxis are outrageously priced. Aiport shuttle is expensive as well. One way cab is $66-75 and shuttles run $30 one-way. Rip off. All in all, this property should get better with time. I paid a group rate so, for me, it was definitely worth it. I easily consumed $200 worth of food and drink per day. But for $469 a night...I don't know about that. Not yet, anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facility!”
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 10 day trip to the Paradisus in Puerto Rico and had a wonderful time. During our stay the hotel was at a 37% capacity which was great. No problems getting chairs at the pool, service at dinner, etc. Although we had a lovely time we would be afraid to go back. Apparently (from talking to other guests and employees) the hotel was not even booked to capacity the week before we arrived and people were fighting for pool chairs and towels. We were told that there were lines at the buffets and it was hard to even get a reservation at a nicer restaurant. One of the problems is that the beach is awful. Although there are a lot of chairs to lay in, you can't even walk on there are so many bolders, broken shells and small rocks. The beach is protected by the government so they can not make it any better. No one, no one was on the beach at all; everyone was at the pool. The water is not pretty, it was mostly brown while we were there. If you are looking for a kids club, forget it. They say they have one but it is very disorganized (some days they have it, some they don't) no sign in for the kids - 5 year olds can just come and go. One of the attendents "buried" my 6 year old in a bin of old towels. He thought it was funny, my son cried. Not a comfortable place to leave your child. So ... if you don't bring kids, only like the pool and pay to stay in a villa or royal service room, go when it is not near capacity, it is a great vacation. Otherwise, it is not worth the high price. Also, we were told that they are building 300 condos to rent out and they, too will use the pool and dining facilities. That will be way too crowded. To be fair, this is a new resort and there are a lot of kinks still to be worked out. For instance, the spa only has a few employees and it took 5 days to get a pedicure, 3 to get a message ...

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: yahootie
Reviews.Content: Overall I was very pleased with my recent trip to Paradisus. The resort is beautiful! My two major dislikes were that the bed was very hard and that the water in the pool was very cold. It is also true that there is not much of a beach (but I'm a pool person, so this did not bother me). Service ranged from average to good, but all of the staff was very friendly and aimed to please. Anyone traveling to the Carribean must remember that there is a thing called "Carribean time", and not to expect instantaneous service. That is just the way of life there. So, if you go in knowing that, you will not be too disappointed. The two restaurants, Bamboo and Romantico are excellent, though hard to get into. Otherwise, the food at the buffets (especially Avacado)is good (sometimes cold, but that is true at any buffet). The drinks were wonderful, especially the Mojitos prepared at the Lobby Bar. I would recommend this resort and would happily return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Facility, Poor Management”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Not deserving of the â€œLeading Hotels in the Worldâ€� status. The facilities are beautiful, but the poor management creates a 2 star experience. 1) The better restaurants are booked days in advance and you canâ€™t book them prior to arrival. So those restaurants really arenâ€™t available to you during busy seasons. Also the reservation system is horrible with many reservations being lost. Even when the restaurants are booked, there are many empty tables. I suspect the capacity is linked to lack of cooking staff. Also, while there are plenty of choices in the buffet, the food is NOT 5 star.We were served our bread without butter at Romantico. It took a half hour and 5 requests to finally get it. 2) The music around the pool and expansive lobby area is way, way, way to loud. You canâ€™t talk, you canâ€™t think and the music is often annoying. I love loud music and concerts, but a pool side and lobby is for relaxed talking. Itâ€™s simply a matter of turning the volume down. 3) The towel situation around the pool is out of control. People get up at 6am to reserve chairs and by 8am they are all taken. Granted we were there the week after Christmas but there has got to be a better way to manage the chairs and towels. 4) Donâ€™t expect a beach, there isnâ€™t one. The ocean frontage is on a lagoon though, so the free sail boats, pedal boats and kayaks are a wonderful option here not possible on a regular beach. 5) The employees are very friendly but ill informed about everything. Many do not speak English. 6) Take a cab to and from the airport. The cab fair is about $57 for four people. The hotel shuttle charges $120 each way and makes you wait Â½ an hour at the airport. All in all the problem is lack of training of the employees, lack of good cooks, and lack of quality employees. The computerized reservation system also needs replacing to end all the lost reservations. It's a shame to see such a wonderful facility end up so screwed up from lack of better management. The â€œLead or not to leadâ€� and â€œNot Deserving â€œLeading Hotels of the Worldâ€� reviews elsewhere cover many other issues quite well. I would wait on this one until the management sorts out the biggest kinks. It's a new faciltiy with lot's of employees that needed to be hired and it's just going to take time to get it all organized. But better management could get it organized much faster then they have. In the meanwhile they should lower the hotels capacity until they get their act together to avoid bad guest experiences.

Reviews.Title: “A great getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After my husband and I booked our reservation at the Paradisus, I read some online reviews and got a little concerned. I'm glad I decided to form my own opinions because we had a great time. We had no problem making reservations for both Romantico and Bamboo once we checked into our bungalow. We thought the staff was very friendly and attentive. The bed was a little hard, but we were able to sleep fine. There was a nice variety of food. The beach definitely left alot to be desired, but Luquillo beach isn't that far away if you want to swim somewhere beautiful. The casino was a little small, but if you aren't a serious gambler, it was adequate. Overall we would definitely return to Paradisus especially during this time of year. It was not very crowded, and if you're looking for relaxation, this is the place

Reviews.Title: “To lead or not to lead”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveler
Reviews.Content: The Leading Hotels of the World should be ashamed of issuing this resort a membership and a 5-star rating. Here is what we experienced, after staying for 5 nights and this is how we think Paradisus should be rated: Basically, the pool is their main attraction, with a few hitch; loud booming background music (you won't be able to hear yourself thinking, you'll end up having a headache), the surrounding gaming activities, that could be relocated someplace else, not enough beach/pool towels, which according to the rules, one per guest, and sometimes they run out of the towels and lounge chairs that are stained with bird droppings. Tacky. -1 star rating. Although, there is another pool, catered to the Royal Service guests, which in my opinion that's how a 5-star resort ought to be, with well kept grounds, no loud and booming background music, towels waiting for you at your lounge chairs. I also found out later, that RS guests can have unlimited use of internet, newspaper and movie channels, whereas the non-RS guests get none of those, internet is $.40 per minute, no newspaper or newsfaxes, no single movie channel ($9.95 if you want to rent). Tacky. -2 star rating. The resort has no beach whatsoever, even though it is heavily advertised for its "beautiful beaches." Misleading. -2 star rating. It does have beautiful grounds, which in my opinion was not so well kept with few places/areas where you'll see littering, with unattended leftover cups/drinks, plates, utensils, etc, causing all kinds of unwanted bugs and birds. Disgusting. -1 star rating. The staff was friendly (way too friendly, sometimes that is a sign of trying too hard to please). +1 star rating (not possible). There are six restaurants, and two of them are their claim-to-fame restaurants, Bamboo and Romantico (which I don't understand the fuss over them on getting reservations) are basically a la carte (Bamboo is like Benihara and Romantico is "so-called" French and the rest (besides La Mirador, which is also a la carte, Mexican) are buffet style and not so great. I think Las Vegas has a better buffet spread. Nasty. -1 star rating. The bed, well, way too hard (I think the floor was softer than the mattress), and beware of the bed bugs (and not Paradise), aka, fleas. Also, beware of the "marble" floors, they are "SLIPPERY WHEN WET"!!! The rooms are cleaned, superficially, they are not swept or vaccumed, and the terraces are left with cigarette butts from other guests. The bed sheets are not changed daily, but recycled from your stay until you leave, I hope. Creapy. -2 star rating. Since it was our first time at the resort, I'm glad to say it would be our last time. I don't believe the resort deserves the status of the LHW, even though it is a bought membership, or a 5-star resort (if my math is right, this resort should be rated as -8 star). Sorry Paradisus, better luck next time. Maybe you should take all the reviews into consideration and make it as a lesson-learned for future improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Not deserving of "Leading Hotels of the World" rating”
Reviews.Author: Luv2TravelOften
Reviews.Content: POSITIVES: 1. Beautiful grounds, lobby and room 2. Bamboo and Romantico restaurants (two that need reservations) extremely nice 3. With some exceptions, buffet restaurants very good 4. Most of staff was very pleasant. A few (Lashaun -lobby bar waiter; Richard - lobby bar waiter; and Julio - shuttle driver) were outstanding b/c they were so responsive and friendly, and seemed to genuinely care. 5. Beds were great, but we like firm mattresses. 6. Showers in rooms had great water pressure. 7. Drinks were great. You don't get beer on tap in plastic cups everywhere. Medalla (local beer) is great. Also have Corona and Coors Light. Booze isn't well quality (i.e., they had Absolute vodka, Dewers scotch, etc.) 8. The built-in lounge chairs around the edge of the pool in a couple of spots are great. They're hard b/c they're concrete, but they keep you cool because they're a couple of inches beneath the water level. 9. We were with a corporate group, and alll of the activities and services associated with our seminars were great. NEGATIVES: 1. This is our biggest complaint. The open-air lobby is beautiful, with seating areas all over. The problem comes in with volume of the music and the activities. (My husband is 39 and I am 44, so we're not "crabby old people.") A lobby should have background music, not loud speakers that make it impossible to talk. In the evening, a female singer and a piano player perform right next to the lobby bar, and the decibel level is deafening because of the amplification system. Even if you go to the farthest seating area in the lobby, you still have to scream to be heard by the person sitting in the chair next to yours. They say that part of the problem is that the hotel is struggling (40+% occupancy when we were there the first week of December, which is the high season). As a result, they supposedly allow locals to use the hotel facilities. I'm assuming that it was local people who were dancing in the aisles of the lobby to the singer's music, encouraging her. There is another bar next to the casino, 50 steps from the lobby, called the "Fun Bar." It has a stage, couches, disco lights, etc. We think this is where the live entertainment should occur. During one rainy day, a game of bingo was conducted in the lobby. Again, even though the players were all seated within 20 feet of the caller, she used the amplification equipment, so anyone else trying to enjoy the lobby in peace was subjected to her obnoxious screaming. Even going to the farthest point in the lobby didn't help that day. We left. At the pool, there are two stereo systems, one near the bar and one near the activities hut where you pick up towels, etc. They play different music, but you can hear both from almost all parts of the pool area. The girls in the activities hut constantly change the volume, stop and restart songs, etc. It's just obnoxious. 2. After the fact, we learned that each room is supposed to come equipped with two umbrellas. Ours had none. On the morning it rained, we sprinted to the "shuttle stop hut," and waited over 1/2 hour for the shuttle to come. It never did. (It's supposed to make the rounds every 5 minutes.) When the rain subsided a bit, we ran to the lobby. When we told the porter that the shuttle hadn't come, he said he hadn't seen it in over an hour. He told us to complain at the front desk, which we did. 3. Staff at pool bar were lazy. Not very attentive to female patrons, if unescorted. Waitress one day sat on stool at bar, talking to bartenders and lifeguard and didn't even make rounds of pool area to take drink orders. 4. Much of staff seem young and immature. They play around with each other a lot, instead of tending to the guests. Probably has a lot to do with negatives 1. and 3. above. 5. There really is no beach. I thought it would be small, but people weren't even venturing into it. The sand is riddled with large rocks and broken shells. 6. This is slightly minor, but the stools in the swim up bar are too high. 7. There were mites running around the ice cream container in the Avacado restaurant one afternoon at lunch. CONCLUSION: While it was a very nice hotel, I wouldn't rate it a 5-star or give it membership in the Leading Hotels because it's just not elegant enough for the price ($600 per night). It's ambience is slightly forced and amateurish. At $300 a night, I'd stay there again, but, without that reduction, we'd try the El Conquistador next time.

Reviews.Title: “a winner”
Reviews.Author: ohiocoalminer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from 4 nights at Paradisus. Many of the comments I would have made are on the preceding review (nice job â€œA trip advisor from Atlantaâ€�). This person covered the pros and cons quite well. I agree with all that was said. I too was a little concerned about the beds (and some other concerns raised) and while they are strangely hard, I slept really well so maybe they know something I don't. We also rented a car and even if you donâ€™t drive to Old San Juan do the rainforest or drive Route 187â€”itâ€™s the back way to San Juan and it hugs the coast and was very nice. I stopped at a beach on my way back from a fishing trip and it was huge, lots of soft sand and quietâ€”no one there on a Saturday around noon. The main lobby bar is superior to the pool bar in my opinion. We were in Service Royale so we did the private pool once but it was really quietâ€”which can be goodâ€”I guess itâ€™s all relative I suppose. It was also nice to have a private room to have cocktails and snacks in but beyond that (and the pillow menu) I donâ€™t know if itâ€™s really that big a dealâ€”but it was nice. We couldnâ€™t get the concierge to budge on early reservations when we called but I agree itâ€™s worth trying. We had no problems getting into Romantico or Bamboo once we arrived and they were quite good. Breakfast at the Mirador was good because it was so close to the ocean but Avocado seemed to have a better selection of fruits and they made omelets and smoothies and such. The entertainment is a bit hokey but they put their hearts into it and thereâ€™s lots of energy so at least they were trying. I signed up for a scuba/snorkeling trip and that was fun (it leaves from the marina at El Conquistador about 40 minutes away). $65 to snorkel or $105 to dive but it was fun. And taking kayaks and sailboats out (price included) was fun, too. Service is a bit slow but most of the staff seemed sincere in their greetings and wanting to please us. But they also werenâ€™t shy about accepting tips (we limited tipping and didnâ€™t feel â€œcheapâ€� when we didnâ€™t tip). We liked putting our lounge chairs in the grass between the pool and the beach under either the palm trees and/or umbrellasâ€”we then had the best of both worlds. It seemed extremely slow (customer-wise) which made it nice but Iâ€™ll bet when itâ€™s busy slower service could really be a problem. Weâ€™ll go back but weâ€™ll probably go this time of year again (early Dec) when itâ€™s not real crowded (and a little cheaper). Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Know What to Expect and Prepare Accordingly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a quick weekend getaway here with my wife. We were a little worried after some of the reviews, but decided to act on some previous tips left on this board and in some ways, altered our expectations. The property itself is beautiful. The lobby and common areas, restaurants and rooms were very nice. The beds, however, are rock hard. If you have trouble sleeping on a hard bed, don't stay here. The property is also very large, thus, request in advance a bungalow nearer the service areas if you don't want to have long walks to the restaurants and pools. The resort shuttles run regularly, but are not always there when you're ready. The restaurants were good. Before you arrive (5-7 days), call and speak with the concierge and insist on making reservations at the "reservation only" restaurants prior to arrival, otherwise, you will be eating at the buffet restaurants. Breakfast and lunch are buffets, food is okay, but not great. The reservation restaurants were really good. Drinks were non-stop at a variety of bars, but a little slow when seated at a table. At dinner, a variety of wine options were offered and all sampled were good. The pool area is great, very expansive. If you want to avoid music, the activities crowd and kids, you will want to reserve your room with Service Royale, which has a private pool and bar w/ no kids. The beach has water sports (kayaks, sail boats) for use, but it's not a swim/snorkel beach. The resort has a "one towel per person" rule as well that works through a card trade-in system, which for a high-end resort was a little disappointing. Nightime activity is a little slow. A "cruise style" entertainment show is offered each night around 10. There is a small casino. The lobby bar area has live music nightly and many guests mingle in this area. We rented a car since it was the same cost as the shuttle provided by the resort ($60 per person round trip). It's about a 30 minute drive from the airport. Rule of the road in PR seems to be that traffic lanes and lights are merely suggestions...drive carefully. The car was nice as the resort is about a 10 minute drive to the El Yunque rainforest, which makes for a nice day trip and we didn't have to book a package through the resort. The resort charges $10 a day for parking, which I thought was a little odd given there was ample parking available throughout the resort. I think locals use the casino and also the convention meeting area for private events, thus the charge. The spa onsite is very well equipped, but also very expensive. Take what you expect to pay at a normal resort spa and add about 50%. We enjoyed our weekend for what it was...a quick getaway. The staff is friendly, but not always attentive...they definetly run on island time. I did find that a well placed $5 tip at the bar or to a cocktail waiter would keep you in good drink more quickly...otherwise, all gratuities are included. For me, the food variety was wearing thin by night 3, so I could not imagine a week-long stay. For the price we paid ($435 room rate secured through lhw website) we felt it was an excellent value for comparable services and what would have been spent had the resort not been all-inclusive. If you do go, a few tips: - Make Restaurant Reservations for Romantico and Bamboo before you go. Politely insist via phone call to concierge. - If you want to avoid children and noise, book w/ Service Royale. - If you are wanting to enjoy the pool bar portion of the all-inclusive, seek lounge chairs near the bar. You're going to be walking to the bar quite often...the pool bar cocktail waitress is non-existent. - Footwear is a good idea for walking on the beach. The area is ideal for watersports, but not for swimming or snorkeling. If you're looking for those activities, this resort is not for you. - Don't expect Ritz or Four Season service, do expect courteous employees and a very scenic property

Reviews.Title: “pretty place, horrible food, bad service and has nothing to do at night for kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this place looked nice and had a nice pool area, but it had a bad beach that was almost un-swimmable, the food was bad, all of the food was abnormally salty. The beds were very hard, and the service was crappy, 3 out of five nights the hotel ran out of towels and we were left with none, they charge you to use a hot tub/sauna area that comprable hotels give to you for free. the hotels to spread out so going back to the room to get something is a chore. and at night theres little to do if ur not of age to gamble. I suggest that you spend ur money on a hotel thats more experienced and accomadates its clients better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway for the Family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from four days with our two girls (ages 4 and 6) at the Paradisus Resort in Puerto Rico where we had a terrific time. We found the location, atmosphere, amenities and accommodations completely to our satisfaction for a quick getaway in the carribean. The resort is very attractive with beautiful decorative pools, parrots and lovely open air sitting areas in the main building with comfortable, well appointed and modern sitting areas and decor. THe bathrooms are immaculate and quite impressive looking. The staff for the most part was extremely friendly and provided good service. We did the Royal Service level which from what I could tell allowed us to check in within a separate area furnished comfortably, an offer of a fresh towel, television and refreshments. Also our room faced the ocean and included a tub with jets (jacuzzi like) on the open patio which the kids loved after being at the pool all day. The turndown service and chocolates on the pillows were a nice treat. (one minor complaint - when I asked the "butler" about the gratuity situation he responded that it was included but we were welcome to tip whoever we wanted - I would have preferred he said it's all included and that's it.) WE stayed in one room which had a big king size bed (a little hard but comfortable) and pullout couch which was fine since we did not spend much time there. It was very comfortable and clean.. and included a small refrigerator stocked with juice, water and soda at all times. The bathroom had a huge walk in shower and enormous towels and nice bathrobes. The pool layout was our absolutely favorite part... big and inviting with a small baby pool attached and 3 and 4 foot deep areas for swimming. (The beach was okay.. kind of rocky and mucky in the water but the kids loved scavenging for hermit crabs). I loved the big covered canopy beds around the pool area for lounging as well as the lounge seating in the pool itself. We all loved swimming over to the pool side bar and sitting in the water to order drinks. My four year old became a big fan of virgin strawberry daiquiris and highly recommend the mojitos! THere is also poolside drink service but it was kind of sporadic and if you want something to munch in you do have to walk back to one of the restaurants. The "activity hut" was a center of things happening all day long for adults and kids. Music plays constantly and they announce different scheduled events including water aerobics, pool volleyball and basketball.. there's a ping pong table, pool tabel and oversized chess game as well as lots of different fun board games, float boards and noodles to borrow. They will watch children ages five to twelve also and have salsa lessons poolside in the afternoon. There is also a small playground area right by the pool with a table that had occasional craft projects in the afternoon. The only slight downside for small kids was the evening after dinner there was usually a show of some sort but not until 10 pm. I found out after a couple of days that they also had a fun kids "disco" and games at 9:30 each night but this was not well publicized. The staff were great with kids. Also one night we were told there would be crafts and activities before the show and it never materialized. Food-wise we were very pleased with the choice of six restaurants. We ate breakfast and lunch every day in the open air patio restaurant by the beach which is a buffet with lots of good healthy and not so healthy choices! Our favorite restaurant was Bamboo for a delicious beni-hana type meal. Make your reservations because it's worth it and they have a kids menu for an alternative. WE never ate at Romantico because children must be twelve or older but heard from many it was fabulous for french food, atmosphere and service. We were pleased by the other restaurants (all buffets), found pizza and an "Olive Garden" type menu at the Italian place and did okay at the Puerto Rican and California restaurant. WE also utilized the babysitting service which was reasonable ( $12 per hour for two children and a $15 transportation fee) to get away and play nine holes of golf which was also very nice. The woman was very friendly and loved children (Evelyn) and brought a bag of toys and games to play with! All in all a great getaway and change of scenery for people with our without children!

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After waiting for all of the opening kinks to work themselves out I finally visited the Paradisus 11/06-09 with some female friends, all in our early 40's. I am 20 year plus travel agent and searched out a great rate of $350.00 per night on Sol Melia's website for each room. The Positives: Absolutely beautiful property despite the lack of a swimmable or attractive beach. The public areas come close to any Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons, great decor in all of the restaurants and lounges, extremely clean and well kept, stunning bathrooms, obviously money well spent in building this property. The rooms were lovely although mine had a mustly odor and they are a touch dark. The hard beds do grow on you after a night or two. The grounds are very nice and the landscaping is filling in all around. The food was very good except for Toscano, the Italian buffet which the staff tends to push you towards. Avocados has an excellent buffet for all 3 meals. Both Romantico and Bamboo were worth the visit, great food and service. Even though they say they will not take reservations before you arrive for either, insist on it, otherwise you will be dissapointed when you arrive if you're only there for a short stay. We had to jump thru hoops to get reservations at each once we arrived, but it was worth it. What the hotel is lacking in is available snacks with your drinks poolside during the day. The Royal Service Pool was a pleasure and the covered king beds around the pool were heaven, but many times during the day we kept saying some chips and salsa would be nice or some type of snack without having to take the long walk back to one of the restaurants. Service was spotty. The bar staff all around was excellent as were most of the restaurant staff but you found at least a couple of lazy workers in each restaurant. We made a habit of tipping the better bartenders and wait staff and found them to then be even more attentive, it's worth the $5 or $10 here and there. The spa was wonderful. I had two seperate treatments and found the facilities to be very nice and the therapists well trained, although their 50 minute treatments are more like 45 minutes. The Negatives: If you are 3 or more people don't bother with the Paradisus shuttle when you arrive at the airport. It runs $30.00 per person each way. We were 6 and the rep tried to put the 6 of us in a delapidated taxi-van at the Paradisus cost of $180.00 total. The taxi driver didn't speak the best English and was confused by the Paradisus rep's voucher. I asked what the actual cost was and found it was $66.50 plus tip. We sent the rep on his way with a tip for his trouble and paid the taxi driver directly. We did use the shuttle on the return as some of us had different flights and knew it would be difficult to get a taxi from the hotel. The beach is an unfortunate failure and from what I can see is unredeemable. The water is murky as far out as you can see and the sand is quite muddy. They do have lounge chairs spread around the higher level of sand which is still mostly dirt with broken shells spread throughout but there is never anyone in them or in the water unless they are taking a kayak or sunfish sailboat ride. The hotel is best marketed not as a beach resort and I think they are learning to take the focus off the beach. We were upgraded from the standard room to Royal Service rooms and were very grateful. However, checkin was very confusing, first I was told my 3 rooms was actually 1 for 6 people yet 6 could not stay in one room, obviously! After 1 hour of waiting in the lounge we were given our 3 rooms at 4pm but they weren't ready. We were shuffled off to lunch and at 5pm the rooms were ready but it took another 25 minutes to get our luggage. There were 2 large groups in-house and the hotel was sold out that evening, it showed. When I asked about dinner reservations for our 3 evenings I was told Romantico and Bamboo were sold out and we should go to Toscano. I had called the day prior to arrival and refused reservation and told we would have no problem when we arrived. When I informed the girl of this she got us dinner in Romantico for our 3rd night. Toscano is a beautiful restaurant but the food was mediocre at best. In addition, you wait 10-15 minutes to be seated in a half empty restaurant. People are lined out the door with many available tables inside. It's buffet service, no reason to keep you waiting for a table. After dinner I stopped back in the RS Lounge to insist on reservations for Bamboo the next night and after describing out unsatisfactory meal at Toscano I was told they would see what they could do. Later that night I had a message confirming Romantico for the next night also but still no Bamboo. It was not until an incident the next day that they finally obtained a 930pm reservation our last night and Romantico the second night. Watch your valuables. Put everything in the room safe. One of my traveling companions came in off her balcony to find a staff member going through the purse of her roomate who was at the gym. He lied to excuse himself and apologized but he unfortunately tried to cover for himself with management with a different story and in the end was not believed. The incident was reported and the management took the information and assured us it was a very serious issue but in the end the man was just suspended for 4 days, so we heard thru another employee. There was no further contact from management after the incident and it did not leave a very good taste in our mouth's. Fortunately nothing was actually stolen. Conclusion: For the rate we paid, it was a very good value. I did advise management that they have a long way to go before they can command the type of prices they are asking during the high season. There are still a number of issues with the property that need to be worked out. I think though despite the beach, this will eventually be a top resort for those just looking for a relaxing getaway in nice surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort but just a few kinks in 1111”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from a long weekend here. Loved the grounds, beautiful surroundings quite tranquil. The food was good at the buffets (sometimes great) but Romantico was the place to eat (we did 3 times) Jose and Roberto offered outstanding service. Most staff were extremely friendly and genuinely concerned with the quality of our stay. A few kinks need to be worked out though, liquor drinks were light on the pour so you might want to ask for a double and bar service at the pool could definately be improved upon. There seemed to be conflicting information between staff members as well, keep in mind the shuttles from the lobby to the rooms run every ten minutes no matter what anyone tells you. All in all it was a weekend in paradise and we are looking forward to making this our annual getaway.

Reviews.Title: “one good thing...the spa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The spa @ the Paradisus was great, my husband and I shared a special anniversary spa day together. The spa staff was top of the line and professional. However we were not pleased with the room. the bed was extreamly hard, the room and bathroom had poor lighting, they have not yet worked out the electrical kinks...we had trouble gaining entry to our room twice and the response time was unacceptable (a 30-45 minute wait each time).

Reviews.Title: “Paradisus Is As Nice As The Brochure”
Reviews.Author: AlBrent
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday from 5 days at the Paradisus. It is absolutely beautiful. They boast six restaurants, but 3 are together in adjacent rooms. Instead they provide 3 different menus you can choose from as you enter. The wait staff is very nice. Most speak English. All of the staff even helped me with my limited Spanish. The 2 (Bamboo and Romantica) restaurants where you must make reservations are worthwhile. Dress code for men at these 2 are long pants and no tennis shoes. Food is average to good. We selected what looked good, tried a few new things and ate what we liked; didn't eat what we disliked. Breakfast and lunch are pretty much buffets so it is impossible to not find something good to eat. The grill on the beach is wide open with roof to ward off the sun and occasional showers. Very nicely done. Food is good. 2 in our party ordered hamburgers and 3 of 4 burgers were served very bloody. There was no problem getting the burgers recooked tho. We rented a car from Cabrera one day to drive to Old San Juan and the next day to El Yunque (rainforest). There was some overcharging the first day due to the employee at Cabrera not speaking English. Evidently she lied to Cabrera about speaking English. When I returned the 2nd day for the rainforest car, Cabrera reduced the overcharges and satisfied me. What the employee did not tell us is there is a $25 charge if Cabrera must pick up the car at the hotel. They were very fair in that regard after I told the 2nd day employee about the pick up charge. The concierge will arrange your hotel sponsored trips and/or the rental cars. Rooms were beautiful. All are suites. The royal upgrade we did not participate in. I do not think you have to unless you want to have an direct ocean view. A slightly obstructed ocean view is what you get otherwise. Bathrooms are granite (marble?). Towels are huge - maybe 5 feet long. Great for the women wrapping around themselves. Had a great time. I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “A VIP experience”
Reviews.Author: 30andover
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the Paradisus 8/16-8/20/04. We booked a 1 bdrm royal ste, the hotel and room was breathtaking.............The ride from the airport was about 30-35 min, no problem as soon as we checked in we were ushered into the Royal Guest Lounge w/2 mimosa awaiting us. We had a upgrade with package we booked (oceanview) no problem they took care of it while we where at our adults only pool in the private cabana.....This resort are for those seeking a calm relaxing vacation with premium drinks and service. I would like to thank Jose (our butler) & Veronica in (Royal Service)..........we had a great time Tonya & Cliff

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon at Paradisus”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just came back from our honeymoon stay at the Paradisus. We had a wonderful honeymoon here. We had a room in the 1300 building with a great view of the mountains and the landscaped grounds. Service was outstanding. We ordered room service half of the nights we were there and we always got our food within 30 minutes. The room was great. Very clean. The bathrooms are nice with an outstanding shower and nice sized tub. The air conditioning was excellent. The lunch buffet at the Grill was just ok, with a limited menu. The breakfast buffet there, however, was excellent. We had two outstanding dinners at the Italian restaurant. The pool is wonderful. The beach is just ok--not really a swimming beach. Still, the beach area is shallow so one can safely enjoy boating or paddling (this was important to us since my wife cannot swim). We rented a car for a day and went to El Yunque and shopped at the outlet mall. We used Cabrerra rental (50 bucks for day). Highly recommend renting car rather than taking taxis or organized day trips. Everyone was very friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. We will definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned froma week's stay at Paradiscus. The place was fabulous, the grounds were very impressive. We were always made to feel at home. Edwin at the Royal Service Pool was the greatest. Jennifer at the front desk, knew us by sight and always looked for us at events. We did have a few complaints, slow bathtub, light out and it was fixed immediately when we told the front desk. The followup calls to make sure the work was completed was unbelievable. The restaurants were good, Bamboo and Romantico were superb. The other restaruants feature buffets - sometimes good, sometimes okay. Everything was plentiful and the Towel have to be the plushest towels I used at a hotel in a long time. The conceriege level was great. Always someone there to point you in the right direction. The drinks were made to order. Frankie was by far the best service staff member, He drove us around in the golf cart and showed us everything. Emillio, Roberto, Dario just to name a few were excellent. We are still looking for our butler Alex- actually just kidding, last day we found him : )

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This resort is beautiful! The staff is helpful, the food is very good, and the grounds are incredible! Our only complaint is that the beds were so hard it was unpleasant to even sit on them.

Reviews.Title: “No beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds.. great pool.. good food..nice staff..BUT NO BEACH..IF YOUR LOOKING FOR A BEACH RESORT THIS IS NOT THE PLACE...the sand is very rocky,you must wear sandals or you will cut your feet on the rocks,the water is not your typical clear carb.beach water it is murky and always appears dirty,we never saw anyone swimming at the beach. I attempted to go in the water,BUT MY FOOT GOT STUCK IN THE MUD!Also they could have more activities for kids,our three kids started to get bored..On the whole the place needs some help..especially the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort w/a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Paradisus Resort and your first impression of the actual resort is awe. The resort is beautiful. The detail in the architecture and the decorating is great. The Lobby, the pool, and the grounds are beautiful. Upon our arrival, we were offered a tour by Emilio, one of the bellman. He was great. He gave us a tour aboard a golf cart and escorted us to our room. The rooms are truly nice. Very large. Big bathrooms with large soaking tubs, bath robes, a king sized bed (yes, it was very hard), a sitting area and a balcony. We attempted to experience every facet of the resort....each of the restaurants, the casino, the pool, etc. The food in the restaurants was good, however the service was lacking, with the exception of the Romantico and Bamboo, which provided good service. The casino was tiny and not very exciting. The pool was nice. Very large, nice built in loungers and even cabanas with padded mattresses nearby. My few complaints, I'll simply list: -Mattress was entirely too hard. Drink enough so as to just pass out! -Activities at the resort were limited. Basically you could eat, drink, swim, gamble and do it again! I recommend renting a car and experiencing the island. **My Number 1 Complaint!!!!! - Apparently they sell day passes ($100) to residents of the island. This wouldn't be too bad, but we had a number of busses come one day. Nothing against the locals, after all I am PR, but the resort was overtaken by many many kids and teenagers who were very loud and boisterous and naturally weren't very caring for those of us who spent the money to be there to enjoy the tranquility of the resort. My suggestion would be to limit the number of day passes!!!! Peace and quiet one day, and then all hell broke loose at the pool for two days. It wasn't too much fun!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Not Great Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying that I got to go for free... so it's hard to complain. The place is beautiful. You can tell it's still new and they are still working on some of the gardens, etc. to make it even more attractive. The only really disappointing thing was the service. We never could get a hold of anyone (concierge, front desk, travel office, etc.) by phone. Room service took 1-2 hours for everyone we knew staying there. Many of the restaurants clearly didn't have enough staff. Many of our questions about the island and activities were difficult to impossible to get answered. Getting information anywhere on the island is a challenge. We were there on a Puerto Rican holiday and not a single Puerto Rican person knew what the holiday was for or how it would affect services, activities, etc. My last comments are just random things. First, the bed was the hardest I've ever slept on, but I actually loved it after the first night's sleep. Second, and most weirdly, the resort employs a mime (yes, a mime!) to wander around the restaurants (even the really nice ones) to "entertain" the guests. They need to get rid of the mime. Mimes freak everyone out and can only spoil the mood of any meal. Overall, definitely a nice place - just be ready for sloooow service and don't expect a lot of useful information about the island from the employees.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: tatiana_g_k
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a Paradisus resort after a week stay - (07/07/04 - 07/15/04), we had a wonderful time : ) The food was great in every restaurants, the pool was amazing, you don't need to go to the beach at all, but the ocean was very warm. The service was great. The tours provided by hotel to 'Bacardi & Old San Juan' and 'Snorkeling' to the private island were excellent. The only thing was that it was very hard to leave this place. We strongly recommend to stay at this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Gran Melia Golf Resort Puerto Rico
